1.content:
Welcome to the Interactive! Make sure you read through the overviews of each established story and especially the Rules before continuing. Please choose one of the three established storylines or make your own!

The Ahn'Ger Stone: A magical , anger powered gemstone lands on the porch of high school senior Bill Strasserman, one April morning before school. Quickly discovering it's magical properties, Bill ends up on a series of wild, transformative adventures. Can he manage to use the Ahn'Ger Stone to get what he truly desires, or will he constantly be the victim of the nebulous concept of 'fate'?

Mark's Morphin' Machine: Mark, a mid-20s man living with his fiancee Sharon, encounters a strange, out of this world (or more accurately, time) visit by a woman who gives him a device of remarkable power. Told that he has to end his relationship with Sharon to avoid the end of the world, Mark begins experimenting with the device, resulting in a adventure he will never forget.

Magical Transformation (or Characters in Search of Change): Magic exists, unknown to humans. And one day, during a particularly weak moment in the boundaries between our reality and that of Magic, something slips through and empowers the first mortals it comes across with the power to change their lives (although without informing said mortals beforehand, of course).

Featured Side Stories:

The Toolbox: You and your friend Kyle are spending your first summer before college in your own house! But after an earthquake strikes, the two of you find a toolbox to repair the minor damage to your house, unknowingly embarking upon a whirlwind adventure as the tools change your bodies in wildly different ways! Just make sure the toolbox doesn't close before you're prepared, though...

(Click the 'More Story Choices! option to reach this story or check the Interactive's Outline)

The Wackerknobs of Hollison County: It's the last summer before college. You and your friends are enjoying one last summer of freedom before you go your separate ways in life. During one late night dare you and your best friend end up hiking through the woods and getting pulled into a reality warping adventure that may not have a happy ending for everyone.

(Click the More Story Choices! option to reach this story or check the Interactive's Outline)

And even MORE stories and story prompts to choose from in the options!
1.title: Choose a Story!

choices: Tom, finally there to walk to school with him.
Big Jon, ready to make Bill pay once and for all.
Little Sister Kimberly ready to annoy her big brother
Gloria? What is she doing here?
11.content:
It was before school on a late April Friday morning in Shermer Illinois when everything changed. It was a pretty nice morning in the near-Chicago small town, the spring dew catching the rays of the rising sun, a low mist creeping across the shadows of the trees, birds singing as they fluttered among the blossoming leaves. Even the temperature was great, it was on track to get to 78 degrees fahrenheit today. Just a great day to walk to school, as the lone teen sitting on the front porch of his modest home was preparing to do.

Bill Strasserman was your everyday teen. He was nearing the end of high school and outside of having a persistent bully problem his only real concerns were an annoying little sister and lack of a girlfriend, though they were small problems in the grand scheme of things. After all, college loomed on the horizon and Bill was confident that he'd find someone interested in him there. Hopefully.

His more sci-fi and video game hobbies and lack of any real interest in sports did however give him some worry. He didn't hate sports, he enjoyed watching baseball and basketball, and he was friends with several players on each teams, including Tom Ackerton, his best friend since Kindergarten. But he just didn't care for participating in them. It was actually a little embarassing to him that his lowest grade was in P.E. simply because he hated having to participate in sports!

It had been his lack of interest in 'manly' things such as sports and his slightly small physical stature that had attracted the attention of Rob Bolstrum in the first place. Rob had targeted Bill early on in middle school, the hulking giant having already been held back twice. It was only in his sophmore year that things had changed for Bill, but not for the better. Jonathan Ingerman, or 'Big Jon' as he was known by the student body, had moved to Shermer. And it had taken him very, very little time for the intimidating and just as strong as Rob rich kid to take over as king of the bullies. He had tricked Rob into fighting him for dominance and had outplayed Bolstrum, and now Rob was little more than an errand boy, doing all the things that Big Jon commanded of him. At first the students had welcomed the change in leadership only to realize that Ingerman was ten times as worse than Rob had ever been, and about five times as smart. Not to mention the money and influence his father, Ragnar Ingerman wielded over the school administration and the town as a whole that caused a blind eye to be turned to Big Jon's clearly criminal enterprises.

And then one day, Bill had been able to trick Big Jon, during one of the routine shakedowns that the more easily preyed upon student population had grown accustomed to by getting Ingerman to monologue while unknowingly on camera, the bully king boasting about himself, his power, and how he'd keep picking on the weak to get what he wanted. "It's just good business" Big Jon had said with a shark-like grin towards the camera. And the end result had been enough evidence that had forced the school to take action, suspending Big Jon for a week before the local press had gotten involved. And while Bill became a bit of a high school hero for that, Big Jon definitely had it out for him. He was the reason that Bill was still reliant on others to transport him around, his already in poor shape car getting vandalized in the middle of the night and ending up a pile of scrap that would cost far too much money to fix.

With no real job and no way to pin it on Ingerman, Bill was stuck using his bike or having others, like Tom or his parents, take him places. And when it came to school taking his bike wasn't much of an option either, and Bill wasn't about to leave his last mode of rapid transportation at the mercy of being stolen or otherwise destroyed by Ingerman's fury. So he had walked to school most mornings, unless the weather had been terrible. It wasn't too far and honestly, the exercise had done him some good. The last few months Tom had even joined him, though this was not entirely out of a desire to keep Bill company.

Tom had been having significant relationship issues with his long time on and off again girlfriend, Gloria Vanapolous. This last breakup had been particularly rough and seemed pretty final; Gloria was trashing Tom around school to her girlfriends, which had quickly filtered to the rest of the student body. And through the grapevine the stories had been twisted to a point that had left Tom an outsider, even on his basketball team as his teammates girlfriends were busy making their lives painful if they even spoke to Tom outside of practice. To ease his isolation and to sneak into school with a little less of the mean girl bitching that had greeted him in the student parking lot, Tom had decided to walk to school with Bill. Bill had been happy for the company and to give Tom the opportunity for a little comraderie and venting before school started, but his friend's thoughts had become particularly...dark the last week. Almost to the point where Bill was starting to get annoyed. And more than a little worried.

Bill checked his watch, the classic Timex that his grandfather had bought him for his birthday reading 7:32AM. Tom was running late, already he could hear his mother and father and little sister Kimberly finishing up their morning routines and frankly, Bill didn't want to deal with another harping at "Just take your bike" or "You should get a job and get that damned car fixed" or "Honey, just let me take you to school" or a high pitched "NYAH NYAH NYAH LOSER STINKFACE". Just thinking about it, on top of everything else, made his blood start to boil.

Bill was just getting ready to leave his friend behind and make his way to school alone when it happened. One moment the porch's white railing had been clear, just the typical slightly cracked and fading white paint shining with dew and sunlight as Bill bent over to grab his backpack, and when he rose up he saw it.

There, right in front of him, was a stone. And not just any stone, but a gemstone. It was a brilliant emerald green teardrop that caught the light and refracted it against Bill's torso. It was impossible to miss, and Bill knew that it had not been there before. The teen leanded in closer and picked the gem up. It was cool to the touch, and almost completely opaque, though bringing it up to his eye BIll could see another, smaller gem embedded in the core of the emerald; this one also a teardrop though cloudy and gold in color. It glowed, but the light from the sun seemed to curve around it instead of passing through.

"Weird" Bill said to himself, "I know this isn't mom's it's too expensive looking. And where did it come from? Hell, I wonder how much it's worth?"

But any thoughts of selling it were quickly pushed away as his anger over the rather mundane things in his life seemed to flare back to the forefront of his mind. Why couldn't life just be easier? Why did he have to suffer because of some idiot neanderthal, or wait around like a doofus for his sadsack failure of a friend? OR take shit from his familiy? Bill's hand curled into a fist around the gemstone and he grit his teeth.

" I wish..."

But right then Bill's anger was pushed away by a loud "HEY BILL!"

Jerked out of his angry state, Bill looked up and saw...
11.title: The Ahn'Ger Stone: Beginnings

choices: "You were my girlfriend! You're the only person that gets me!"
111.content:
"HEY BILL"

Jerked out of his angry state, Bill looked up and saw his friend Tom rounding the corner across the street, backpack hooked over one shoulder and looking like he had his own personal raincloud above his head.

"Fucking finally..." Bill muttered to himself as he hustled down the front steps and quickly made his way across the street. Tom looked even worse up close, Bill saw; the other teen's face was pale and bags hung heavily under his bloodshot eyes. The disgraced jock's clothes were wrinkled, and Bill was pretty sure those were the pants that Tom had worn yesterday. It was clear that even by the now normal standard, Tom had a particularly rough night.

The two friends exchanged a fistbump and made their way along the concrete, their footfalls and birdsong the only words between them for a few minutes before Bill finally broke the silence.

"Hey, check this out." Bill said, holding the strange green gemstone over to Tom as they walked. Tom took it and spun it around in his hands for a moment.

"Wow. This your mom's or something?" The other boy asked, stopping and holding it up to the sun, his tired eyes squinting as he watched how the light seemed to curve, not refract, through the smaller, central gem. Tom let out a low whistle before the two started walking again, Tom continuing to inspect the artifact.

"Nah, I literally just found it. It was sitting on the porch! I was thinking that maybe we go back to your place after school and then drive out to the mall so I can have the jewelers look at it?"

"Yeah...About that..." Tom muttered, his fist closing around the gemstone and his exhausted face growing dark. Bill knew that look, it was the look Tom got every single time that Gloria was involved in something. He shook his head and placed a hand on Tom's shoulder.

"So, what happened this time?"

Tom sighed and shrugged Bill's arm away, "My parents were out last night so I walked to McFly's to get something to eat. Turns out the G-Squad had the same idea." The G-Squad was Tom's private way of referring to Gloria's groupies, her little clique that hung on every word Tom's ex had to say and then spread it around the school at the speed of gossip. McFly's was a local indoor/outdoor burger joint that stayed open late and sometimes featured local artists. It was decently popular with high school students for it's cheap prices.

"Oh shit" Bill said.

"Yeah. So I didn't actually realize they were there until I had already started eating. They surrounded the table and gave me so much shit, man. Then they fucking followed me halfway home! I bet they would have kept following me if it hadn't been for Ingerman and Bolstrum. So then they gave me shit. But apparently a ten dollar bribe wasn't good enough because they egged the house AND the car! And of course no one actually sees it and mom and dad actually buy into Gloria's bullshit so they think I'm making all this shit up...So I had to clean all of that mess up and dad took my keys. I maybe got like thirty minutes of sleep, all because of her bullshit!"

Neither of the boys noticed the green-gold glow coming from Tom's closed fist.

"Tom. You gotta repo-" Bill tried again, but he was again shot down as Tom flew deeper into a rage fueled by lack of sleep and emotional trauma that was the other boy's life. Bill had seriously been trying to get Tom to report all the abuse he had been taking to the police or get a counselor or just...something. It wasn't healthy.

"It's like no matter what I do, it's wrong! I mind my own business, I'm being cold and distant and a brat. If I try to just talk with her about all this, she gets to play me off as desperate and that I won't leave her alone! I can't even get angry because then who the fuck knows what she'll say! I just don't understand what to do, Bill!"

At this point Bill noticed the glow coming from Tom's fist. Was the gem causing that? He needed to calm Tom down so he'd drop the rock before it exploded or something like the space rock did in the rebooted Spiderman movie. "Tom" He started, but was again cut off as Tom said the fateful words that would change both of their lives forever.

"Damnit! I wish that..."
111.title: Enter Tom Ackerton

choices: Bill is now Willow, in body and mind.
Bill is still Bill, despite everyone thinking otherwise.
1111.content:
"I wish you were my girlfriend! You're the only person who gets me!" Tom yelled at the top of his lungs. With a flash of light and heat reality shimmered away around Bill, who found himself unable to move.

Bill was no longer standing on the street next to Tom. Instead he was back home sitting on the porch. But something was wrong, he couldn't move! Instead he was frozen as a feeling warmth crashed over his body, painful at first but then incredibly relaxing and soothing. But he couldn't feel anything beyond that. If he hadn't been caught up in the feeling of his imminent changes, he would have seen the world around him had frozen as well.

Had Bill been able to look down, he would have seen his male mass strip away, his overall height shortening while his legs seemed to stretch out. His feet shrunk in his black/gray sneakers which immediately became a pair of peppy white shoes with pink highlights. His bulky jeans tightened around his waist, which seemed to shrink inwards but then immediately curve outwards once more. The jeans hugged his now long, slender legs as his body hair ceased to exist along his legs and arms. His arms slimmed down along with his hands, ten soft red pools appearing on the tips of his fingers. The hard wood of the porch softened somewhat as his posterior swelled, the excess mass of his male body pooling there while even more former muscle and fat surged into his chest, sending two large mountains rising into the morning air while his stomach became taut and toned.

Something between his legs caved inward, leaving a warm void. His shoulders and neck slimmed, while his face changed, the once broad and strong bones reconfiguring into a far more feminine shape. His lips plumped and became coated with gloss and lipstick. Strong cheekbones pushed themselves up beneath where once flawless skin now resided. His nose slimmed while his eyes grew slightly larger, changing from brown to blue, eyelashes growing longer as the changes continued upwards, his ears shrinking in size while accessories materialized on his lobes. His short brown hair exploded from his scalp in a slightly curling cascade of silky locks, pooling on his new shoulders and draping down his arced back.

The final change was Bill's shirt, formerly just another t-shirt, now a white and black stripped designer top that had a risky neckline to his newfound cleavage while a strong supportive bra formed beneath his new organs. A light dusting crossed his face as very soft make-up was appled.

And with that, reality seemed to start once more. Birds chirped fro mthe trees, a slight breeze blowing away the last of the morning fog, Tom rounding the corner across the street...And the stone was nowhere to be found.
1111.title: Becoming Willow

choices: Tom decides to explore this reality.
Tom, feeling guilty, tries to change Bill back.
11111.content:
Willow Strasserman blinked her eyes for a moment before realizing who was across the street. It was Tom, her boyfriend! She leapt to her feet, grabbing her backpack and purse, nearly bounding down the much larger steps of his front porch.

"BYE MOM, TOM'S HERE!" She shouted in her singsong voice, not waiting for a reply. She quickly raced across the quiet street and practically tackled Tom, leaping into his arms and planting a large kiss on his handsome, sexy lips. He was looking so great today, a fresh haircut, his skin tanned, his muscles rippling under the letterman jacket he wore. She could just stare into those dreamy brown eyes, even if they did look so cute and confused, forever...

Tom, on the other hand, did not have the luxury of being fully adapted to the situation. One moment he had been with his best friend Bill a block from school, the next minute he was back on Bill's street, and this gorgeous brunette had tossed herself at him! Instinctively Tom knew that this was Willow, his girlfriend. They had been best friends since grade school and it was clear they had were meant to be soulmates to anyone that took even the slightest look at them. She was a cheerleader, he was on the basketball, football AND baseball teams, it was an almost too sappy, too perfect love story.

But then there was the previous reality, where Tom was depressed, almost suicidal, and the only bright spot in his life being the times when he'd hang out with Bill. The one person that had never bought Gloria's bullshit, the one person that knew the truth. Bill was Tom's brother and the primary reason why Tom hadn't killed himself, never wanting to put his best friend through something like that. So strong was the bond that while this beautiful girl snuggling against him felt so right and so good, he couldn't help but feel horrible about what had become of Bill.

Meanwhile, in Tom's hand, the Ahn'Ger Stone's ethereal green-gold light faded away, leaving no trace that it had been involved at all...
11111.title: Tom's New Woman

111111.content:
Tom Ackerton, handsome but depressed basketball hero, was severely conflicted as he walked to school with Willow Strasserman, his gorgeous and charming cheerleader girlfriend, formerly known as Bill. A back and forth tennis match was occurring in Tom's mind, his conscience weighing whether or not he should use the wishing rock he now possessed to change Willow back into his male confidant.

Tom dwelled on this heavily during the trip. He imagined that he was in one of those old cartoons, with an angel on your right shoulder representing your personal ethics, and a devil on your right shoulder representing your selfish desires:

Angel: “Bill's your best friend! You have to change him back!”

Devil: “But Willow is your best friend too, and she's so hot.”

Angel: “You're stealing Bill's identity away from him!”

Devil: “Reality has been rewritten. Willow doesn't remember being Bill, and nobody but you remembers Bill. Who is really suffering here? Did I mention that Willow is really hot?”

This indecisiveness, this impulsive nature of Tom's, was what had spurred him into making that stupid wish in the first place. Tom had always been impulsive, jumping at every opportunity the first chance he could. Bill had compared his temperament once to the Large Hadron Collidor. Bill had tried to explain to him what CERN's purpose was. Tom had tuned him out, joking condescendingly to Bill that he wasn't a nerd and didn't need to know about that stuff, but he had gotten the gist of it. It was particles that move around at super high velocity speeds crashing into each other. Yep, that sure was Tom all right, and now he was paying for it.

New memories had immediately created themselves in the aftermath of Tom's fateful wish. He now realized that he was in another reality altogether from the one he woke up in. One, indeed, where Bill Strasserman never existed. One where Tom had never gone out with Gloria Vanapoulos. One where Gloria never made him crack up with her insecurity and need for drama. One where Gloria's G-squad never soiled his reputation. One where the diva like girl had never even gave Tom much thought apparently. The Vanapoulos offspring didn't dare, as the entire school knew that Tom and Willow were an item. Tom and Willow in this reality were Ken and Barbie, the school's pretty boy and the school's preordained Homecoming Queen, the one her fellow seniors voted “Most Likely To Succeed” out of high school.

Tom almost couldn't believe this. He had a magic wishing rock! The fact that he held in his hand some ancient artifact that could bend reality to his whim...not only was it almost too much power to handle, but it went against everything Tom Ackerton grew up believing in. Tom had prided himself on his skepticism. He was never a brain like Bill was, but his parents had instilled in him a burning desire to constantly challenge himself, to improve himself, to never settle for “good enough”, to be a paragon of both body and mind. Part of this ambition included a desire to dispel himself of any delusions or superstitions. Tom knew that ghost sightings were just figments of the very fallible human imagination and our primitive pattern detection skills. He knew that UFO abduction stories were likely a combination of sleep paralysis and watching too many movies. He knew that 99.9% of all psychics and mediums were scammers, using cold reading and mentalism to fool gullible marks, and that the remaining .01% were likely just delusional. He was disinclined to believe in the paranormal right from the very start, and yet here he was. He had irrefutable proof in the existence of magic. In his hand held a stone which bent light around it, carried an unnatural coldness, and could do just about anything. It was an astounding feeling to know he held something so godly right in the palm of his had.

Prior to this morning, Tom had never been one for fantasy, for whimsy, for flights of fancy. He never had that much interest in speculative fiction. That was more Bill's thing. When Bill tried to get Tom to watch Rick & Morty with him one day, Tom became bored within minutes, and asked to change the channel so he could watch rugby instead. Now his brain was lighting up with possibilities, dreaming of parallel universes and time travel like Bill's favorite show Doctor Who. The Stone was exciting...but also a burden. A heavy responsibility.


Tom looked down. His Stone free hand was wrapped around Willow's smaller, more delicate hand. He looked up at Willow's pretty face, who was staring at him like a lovesick puppy. She started talking. Then she started giggling. She made Tom giggle along with her, and then she kissed him deeply, their lips locked in perfect synchronicity. Life was good for now.

Then the lovely couple reached school.

**
111111.title: Come On Get Happy?

1111111.content:
“See you later at McFly's, babe” said Willow sweetly as she waved Tom off at the front entrance of Shermer High School, Willow joining her group of equally leggy cheerleader friends Krystle, Janet, and Juanita for their first class together. On the way to school, she and Tom had agreed to a dinner date later in the evening, as neither of them could afford the time right after school. Willow had practice and Tom said he had practice. In reality he had been planning to just wander around town and feel sorry for himself. Now though, now he had options.

Tom continued to stare at the utter perfection that was Willow Strasserman as she walked inside the glass doors. Lost in his daydream, the young man didn't mind his surroundings carefully enough as he immediately found himself surrounded by Big Jon Ingerman's gang, all of whom had seemingly dropped from the sky. Tom honestly didn't know how people that bulky and that slow were that talented at sneaking up on people.

“Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou is our fucking money, Romeo?” said the deep, unpleasantly obnoxious and arrogant voice directly behind him.

Tom snapped himself out of it remarkably quickly. If the voice didn't give it away, the looming shadow that cast itself over the front entrance to the school sure did.

“Hey Big Jon” answered the basketball star, not turning to face the bully. “Good to see you too.”

Big Jon snapped his fingers nonchalantly, and two of his intimidating looking underlings pinned Tom's arms and forced him to turn around and look Jon in the face.

“That's better” said the lead bully, appraising his quarry up and down with a predator's eyes.

Jon walked up to Tom and threateningly laid a hand on his shoulder. His blonde, rough hewn Nordic face was close enough for Tom to take a whiff of his breath. Jon smelled of lutefisk, a disgusting Norwegian dish, Tom remembered Bill telling him once.

“So punk, how much you got this week?” the bully asked him.

“I'm broke, Jon. Please. I'll have more money on Monday. I swear.”

Tom suddenly felt one of Jon's flunkies patting down his jeans and searching through his pockets.

“He's clean, boss” said the gorilla like teen Randall Jones.

Tom mentally breathed a sigh of relief, glad that the all powerful gemstone he had been carrying was still tucked inside his fist. None of the Junior Achievement Club seemed to notice it.

“You better have something by Monday, or you'll be leaving for summer vacation on a stretcher” warned Jon, his voice serious and deep. “Or worse. Maybe I'll cut your little slut's face, give her a little Joker smile for you two lovebirds to remember me by.”

“When you're busy sitting in jail?” Tom snarked. He instantly realized he shouldn't have said it.

“What'd you say, Ackerton?” said Jon, his face turning just the slightest shade redder.

Tom's heart stopped. He loved Bill. He loved Willow. He couldn't let anything happen to her.

“I don't like guys who hurt girls” Tom said, defiantly once more.

“What would do about it if I did do something, pussy?” asked Jon.

The question hung in the air for a long period of time before Jon spoke again. Tom just gulped. Magic rock or not, Big Jon was a scary dude.

“That's what I thought. Just a pretty face without any balls. Get out of my sight, you fucking dork”, lightly smacking Tom on the cheek in a show of dominance.

Jon's gang all pulled away from Tom, allowing him safe passage inside the building. Tom took two long strides towards the glass door when his impulsive nature came rearing its head once more.

He was furious at being shown up. Aggravated being humiliated by a sadistic freak like Big Jon. That's when he saw the stone in his hand glowing between the cracks of his fingers. Even if Bill had turned into a girl and he had never gone out with Gloria, he'd be damned if he still had to deal with harassment from this future death row inmate. Big Jon made him sick! This was his one chance to finally do something about him.

“I wish you'd punch yourself in the face for ten minutes straight” said the basketball star. He said it softly, but the tenor of his voice was anything but ambiguous. Tom Ackerton meant it definitively. The Stone flashed brightly and then extinguished itself. Smiling to himself, Tom walked inside. He didn't need to witness what happened next.

“What'd that asshole mutter to himself?” asked Rob Bolstrum as he saw Tom walk inside.

“He's probably just crazy” ironically added another bully, Leon 'Loco' Scarfo, who himself had a severe personality disorder.

Rob looked toward his reluctant boss as Jon immediately gave himself a self inflicted black eye with his own fist.

“What the fuck? Why'd you hit yourself?” asked Rob.

“I-I don't know!” yelled Jon, his other fist now punching himself in the mouth, damaging his teeth.

Jon's left hand grabbed his right wrist, attempting to restrain the almost sentient fist from punching himself again. He watched his fist tremble mightily in his grip. It was the most bizarre thing he ever saw. If he had been a movie fan, Jon may have been reminded of a famous sequence from Evil Dead II.

Out of sheer curiosity wondering what would happen if he let go, Jon did, and he was greeted by another painful black shiner.

Option 1: Tom spends the rest of the day using the Ahn'Ger Stone to settle other petty grievances like what he just did to Big Jon. Feeling guilty, he eventually talks to Mr. Ellis, the school guidance counselor, about whether to transform Willow back into Bill, using coded language and metaphor.

Option 2: At the end of an otherwise uneventful day at school with no other opportunities to use the Stone, Tom goes to meet up with Bill, now Willow, only to find one of Big Jon's thugs waiting for him instead!
1111111.title: Come On Get Happy? Part II

11111112.content:
Tom grinned to himself as he left the baseball field, duffel bag of equipment under his arm and ball-cap pulled tight around his head, blocking out the low afternoon sun. He couldn't believe how great his day had been, the run-in with Ingerman this morning notwithstanding. His life was totally different now that Willow was his girlfriend and Gloria hadn't mucked up everything! Instead of just basketball he was now still on the football and baseball teams! His teammates were laughing and talking to him, Mr. Lonnigan wasn't glaring at him (well, more than usual, at least), and he didn't feel so...exhausted like he did before he'd made that fateful wish this morning outside of Bill's...Willow's house.

Tom tried not to think about the fact that he'd just erased his best friend and replaced him with a beautiful woman that was head over heels in love with him. On the one hand everything was better now, his life was back on track the way it was before Gloria had gotten her claws into him.

And speaking of Gloria...

Gloria herself had been reduced in status, now that Willow was around the raven haired girl was no longer the queen of Shermer High. Instead she was just another girl, the 'bitch' of Shermer High's cheerleaders with far less influence than she ever had before. In this new reality Gloria's attitude had left her without a boyfriend, though the now mean-spirited rumors were that Gloria was either a lesbian, or was seeing a boy from another school...Or was too much of a 'mommy's girl' to be allowed to have a boyfriend.

Tom shuddered as he remembered the few times he'd had to interact with Gloria's mom. He had thought Gloria had been a controlling bitch, Ariadne was a meg-bitch. Or maybe even THE mega-bitch. She had been the most intimidating, hateful woman Tom had ever met, and Gloria was almost a entirely different person around her. Polite, quiet, hooking up with Tom had been her one act of defiance...And he had been tolerated by the Vanapolous matriarch in that previous reality only because he had been Shermer High's all-star athlete. And even then the few times he'd eaten dinner over there she'd glared at him like a hawk watching a mouse.

Meanwhile Willow was captain of the cheerleading squad (and so good at what she did that Shermer High now apparently had a cheer team, all thanks to her). She was super popular and loved by most of the student body, and even though most of what had actually made Bill, well, Bill seemed to have been replaced by a love of makeup, cheerleading, romance and other almost stereotypical girly things, his/her life seemed much better as well. Her parents were still the Greg and Martha Strasserman that Tom had known all his life, though they seemed much more proud of Willow's accomplishments than they ever had been of Bill's more academically focused ones. Tom felt a little bad that the new memories in his mind knew that there was now a trophy case standing in the main entryway of the Strasserman's house, filled with trophies from Willow's various gymnastics events when she was younger and now her numerous accolades as a cheerleader. That seemed to be Willow's only real shortcoming, she struggled in subjects that Bill had once excelled in like math, science and history...And while Bill had owned a entire bookcase filled with science fiction and fantasy novels, Willow only owned a handful of young adult novels, like Twilight or Hunger Games, or the first few Harry Potter books before she'd grown out of them.

"They just got so sad and boring! And who wants to read when you can just watch the movies?" Willow had told Tom one night when they were curled up on Tom's couch watching one of the funnier Marvel films, the one with the talking raccoon and...Groot? Tom never really payed attention before, and especially not with his dream girl cuddled against him.

Even her relationship with her little sister was better! Before, when Bill had still been Bill, his relationship with Kimberley Strasserman had been..strained at best. The girl was a bit of a obnoxious brat that loved nothing more than to make Bill's life miserable whenever she could. But now Kimberly looked up to big sister and was already planning on being a cheerleader herself once she got into high school. And she acted more mature as well, mimicking Willow's grace and poise and breezingly pleasant personality. All in all, becoming Willow had seemed to be the best thing to have ever happened to BOTH Bill and Tom.There was no more looking over her shoulder for Ingerman, or at least hadn't been before Tom had run his mouth to Big Jon this morning.

choices: Gloria rushes toward Bill and tries to kiss him. The two are already dating!
Gloria shyly says hi to Bill. She has a crush on him, but the two aren’t dating.
Tom and Gloria say hi and...walk past Bill? Wait, what?
1113112.content:
In the split second before Gloria came into view, Bill’s thoughts anxiously raced through the horrors the Stone could have inflicted upon Gloria. Could she be naturally deformed? A victim of a terrible accident? Maimed, brutalized, or abused? Any one of those could make even Gloria humble enough to care about Tom, but surely the Stone knew that wasn’t what Tom meant? Unless it was actively malicious, in which case there were much bigger problems to address than Glora’s physical appearance.

Bill clenched his fist in an attempt to brace himself. He didn’t want to shut his eyes, in fear of offending a possibly deformed Gloria. She pushed the branch away from her face, showing off a perfectly smooth, pale arm.

No deformities yet. Hopefully the Stone knew to keep it that way, Bill thought. Though he hadn’t been the one to make the wish, guilt wracked at him. It gnawed at him enough that he didn’t notice Gloria’s olive skin had become a milky white, the same color as Tom’s.

As she stepped into view, Bill couldn’t contain his gasp. Not because Gloria’s facial features were malformed, not because she was covered in scars, and not because she was bruised. The reality was far, far worse. Seeing her next to Tom, the two of them laughing, it was obvious Tom’s wish had been granted. It was also obvious that Gloria had become his sister.

The Gloria that Bill knew was an average 5’5, but that was the only average thing about her. She had perfectly styled black hair that reached her waist. Her face was angular, almost predatory, with brown eyes and a straight, wolfish nose accentuated by striking makeup. This Gloria was nearly a full foot shorter than the 6’ Tom, and had taken most of his features. Messy blonde hair, a heart-shaped face, an upturned nose, and full, pink lips. Worst of all were her eyes, the same bright blue as Tom’s. But unlike his, Gloria’s were focused solely on Bill, with a sparkle and intensity that Bill only knew from romance movies he’d seen his mom watching.

Gloria Ackerton, Tom’s goddamn sister, was in love with Bill. All he could do was gulp, step off his porch, and hope someone would make him angry enough to make a wish soon.
1113112.title: Gloria looks like a different person. Is she To...

choices: Tom got angry that he just lost his girlfriend and made  another wish.
11131121.content:
Bill was so caught off guard by Gloria rushing towards him that she kisses him before he can even react.

“Hey handsome.” She said, grabbing his hand.

“H-hey.” Bill said back, before looking at Tom, who had a confused look on his face. He must remember Gloria being his girlfriend, and Bill not having a girlfriend.

What happened next?
11131121.title: Gloria rushes toward Bill and tries to kiss him...

choices: “I wish that I didn’t care about Gloria!”
“I wish Gloria would tell me how she really felt!”
111313.content: As the words left Tom’s lips, the glow coming from the stone reached its peak. Bill could feel that something terrible was about to happen. One arm covered his eyes, and the other reached out for Tom’s hand. He took a blind swing, hoping he’d knock the stone away, and felt nothing but air. As he cursed himself for the mistake, he heard Tom finish saying his wish.
111313.title: Tom makes a different wish (Options)

choices: Tom is now a goth, caring little about Gloria, or anyone else
Tom is completely emotionless, unable to express interest in anything
1113131.content:
“I wish that I didn’t care about Gloria!”

At first, nothing happened, and Bill wondered if he and Tom had just made fools of themselves. Of course the stone wouldn’t grant a wish, no matter how much it glowed. Then a flash of black overtook Bill’s vision, so fast it could be mistaken for blinking. If he hadn’t somehow been teleported to his front porch steps, he just might have.

Bill scrambled back of the steps, understandably freaking out, until his back hit his front door. He glanced back and forth, taking in his familiar surroundings. The stone must really have been magic, Bill thought. He was amazed by the power for all of a second, before his thoughts turned to Tom. Bill was familiar with stories of genies and wishes gone wrong, and if they had any basis in reality, Tom was in for a shock. Or not, Bill thought as he realized how Tom’s wish may have been interpreted. He wanted to stop caring about Gloria, but what if the stone twisted the wish to make him stop caring altogether?

A droll, “Hey, Bill,” coming from around the bend seemed to confirm his fears. Bill rushed to the sidewalk, anxious to see what the wish had done to his best friend.
1113131.title: “I wish that I didn’t care about Gloria!”

11132.content: Who interrupts Tom before he can make his wish? Is it a teacher, or did a extremely poor twist of fate lead Tom and Bill directly into the last people that Tom wants to see? Namely Jonathan Ingerman and his squad of local bullies, or perhaps even worse...Gloria and her own mean girl squad?
11132.title: Bill and Tom are interrupted by someone. (Options)

choices: The stone causes Bill and Big Jon to swap bodies
The stone transforms Big Jon into a wimpy, dweebish version of himself
112.content:
“Oh shit” muttered Bill to himself, his voice trembling with genuine fear. It was Big Jon Ingerman, the kingpin of Shermer High himself. And behind him was his usual entourage of bullies, including the sullen, red-headed giant Rob Bolstrum.

“HEY BILL!” shouted Jon again from the sidewalk in his Incredible Hulk-like vocal range. “ARE YOU GONNA WAIT FOR YOUR BOYFRIEND TOM TO SHOW UP AND WALK YOU TO SCHOOL?!”

Bill stopped himself from telling Jon to shut up. Lobbing insults the brute was a waste of time. As Mark Twain said “Never argue with a fool, onlookers may not be able to tell the difference”. So he just stood there, momentarily forgetting about the fortuitous gemstone he had just found.

“WELL COME ON!” shouted Jon. “GET UP OFF YOUR PORCH, STOOP KID! AFRAID OF LITTLE OLD ME?”

Bill didn't want to admit that he was. Sometimes he wished that Jon knew what it was like to be scared of bullies. This was like a bad, school play version of Back To The Future, but Bill didn't have the effortless charm of Marty McFly, nor did he know how to skateboard.

Five minutes went by with neither man moving, staring at each other like two outlaws.

“Damnit Tom, where are you?”

Bill figured that his buddy must have seen or heard Big Jon and ran in the other direction. Tom was athletic and the former star of Shermer High's football team before the recent falling out with his on and off again ex, Gloria, but he was still no match for the local Frankenstein's monster. Especially not with Big Jon's lackeys there. Tom was heroic but Bill knew that Tom would put his own self-preservation ahead of some heroic sacrifice.

It was 7:39 A.M now. If Bill didn't muster some courage real fast, he was going to be late for school and get a strike against him. His school had a policy of three strikes, and you get automatically suspended for a week, and he couldn't bear his parents berating him for that on top of all the other garbage he was facing. Something inside Bill suddenly erupted.

“WILL YOU FUCKING LEAVE ME ALONE ALREADY?!” screamed Bill so loud that his parents and Kimberly could hear him from inside the house. Behind him he could hear the alarmed sounds of his parents calling out to him and the scraping of chairs against the kitchen floor followed by the thumping footfalls as the adult Strassermans hurried to see what was causing such an outburst from their son.

But Bill ignored them and dug deep into the well of hate and anger he had towards Big Jon as he roared out;

"I WISH-"
112.title: Bill the Stoop Kid

choices: Joanna waves for him to join her.
Snatching the stone up, Bill raced after her.
Bill glared at the stone, deeply suspicious, and curiously hypnotised.
1123.content:
Knowing it wasn't brave, he was tired of slinking away, cowering, always alert for Big Jon's voice or approach. His fist curled around the gelid green stone. An impotent fist against a bully who could easily over-power him, that was trying to provoke a physical fight. It was then that Bill made his wish. It wasn't a very well thought out wish, but it was the only thing that Bill's brain could construct in the heat of the moment as the front door of the Strasserman household opened behind Bill.

"I WISH YOU WERE A NICE PERSON, JON! SOMEONE PEOPLE ACTUALLY CARED ABOUT!"

It felt like the gem was suddenly colder, colder than it could possibly be. And then there was an eruption of verdant light that caused Bill to wince in pain before it faded away. And then Bill's jaw went limp as the world around him began to change. The assembled bullies vanished into thin air and the heavy hand of Bill's father vanishing from his shoulder. And then the largest change began.

He watched transfixed, as Jon Ingerman's outline became vague. His proud Nordic ancestry, rippled and shifted. He had to blink his eyes clear, to be sure what he saw.

As in that instant Jon was replaced by Joanna Ingerman. The stunningly beautiful blonde, a Valkyrie from many a fantasy, busty and ... and standing near his home. He knew so many people would be jealous that she was here, that she was looking at him, talking to him. He took in her uniform, filling it in a way like no other.

Raising an awkward fist he waved to her. Only unknuckling his fingers as he waved. Out from the unclenched hand a pale emerald stone dropped, it's flickering centre dying back to pale lifelessness.

As it landed, softly rolling, Bill's memory flooded back. He recalled Big Jon, ripping his eyes from the stone he looked back up. In his place was Joanna, waving back at him, with every sincerity. A coy smile on her face, a faint flush to her cheeks that wasn't due to the Sun.

Narrowing his eyes, he couldn't deny that she was every bit as real, as Jon had felt. The chill tightness in his stomach too real to be forgotten, ignored or dismissed.
1123.title: Bill's anger found voice.

choices: Bill enjoys his new life and forgets about the Ahn'Ger Stone for now.
Joanna gets a hold of the Stone later that day.
11232.content:
Bill casually grabbed the gemstone and put it in his pocket, but truth be told, he was honestly too distracted by Joanna Ingerman to care about what had just happened.

DID something just happen? Bill wasn't completely sure it had. The Ahn'Ger stone had tampered with his memories a little bit. Deep down in his subconscious, he still remembered Big Jon and how that neanderthal had destroyed his car and had been trying to provoke him into a fight just a moment ago, but those memories gave way to a new reality. One where Big Jon had never existed, and Joanna Ingerman, the hottest girl in school...was his girlfriend.

“Hey there handsome” smiled Joanna as Bill approached her. Joanna was several inches taller than Bill and had to bend down to kiss him, though Bill didn't mind. She grabbed his hand and enveloped it into her own, warmly embracing her former enemy in another reality. Bill smiled back, and the two began their journey to school together.

“You know, I actually kind of like walking to school instead of driving there” said Joanna as she walked hand in hand with Bill. “It's such a gorgeous day out.”

“It sure is” said Bill, lost in a daydream that felt too good to be true.

**

Bill's new memories continued to inform him of the current reality. Somehow, by some complete stroke of blind luck, he and Joanna had hit it off back in the eighth grade and had been going steady ever since. He recalled double dates with himself, Joanna, Tom, and Gloria. He remembered the first time he had invited Joanna for dinner to his parents house, with Joanna extending the invitation to dine with her own parents at her house. He remembered going to the prom with her last year, and how much his parents complained about the cost of his tuxedo. He remembered the first time they had sex with each other, though neither had told anyone yet. Bill recalled vivid memories of himself inside her sex, and Joanna knowing how to pleasure Bill beyond his wildest imagination.

His entire teenage life up until this juncture had been obsessed with finding a girlfriend. Bill was definitely not one of those red pill/incel idiots that you find on the internet. He didn't feel entitled towards having a girlfriend, and it didn't dominate his entire life, but he had been getting very lonely as of late, watching Tom and Gloria date, break up, get back together, and then break up again all in a circuitous loop all while Bill was forced to resign himself as Tom's wingman. But now he had one, and it was his former enemy, transformed into a gorgeous maiden! Somewhere deep down inside him, Bill simply couldn't believe this.

The two had reached school, both laughing over some silly story that Joanna was telling him that happened to her over cheerleading practice the other day. When they both reached their lockers to grab their books for the day, Bill was approached by another bully, Rob Bolstrum.

In the old reality, Rob had been one of Big Jon's minions. Rob was even dumber and more brutish than Jon had been, though since Big Jon was older and had a stronger physique, he had reluctantly acquiesced to Big Jon after the latter had beaten Rob to a pulp in a vicious schoolyard fight to prove his dominance. But that was then...

Rob slammed Bill about against his locker.

“Hey pipsqueak. I've got bills to pay, so you're going to help me out. You're going to be giving me your lunch money every day from now on until...”

Rob couldn't finish his threat, as he was suddenly thrown against the adjacent locker by none other than Joanna Ingerman herself.

“If you touch my man again, you'll have to face me.”

Joanna, gorgeous as she was, looked every bit as intimidating as her formerly male self had. Her eyes carried a steely determination, and try as he might, Rob could not free himself from the tall girl's amazonian grip.

“Swear an oath to me that you will leave Bill alone and never bother him again” she demanded.

Rob gulped.

“S-sure thing, honey” he said. “I swear. Bill's dead to me. I'll never look in his direction ever again.”

Joanna wanted to grab his balls and squeeze them until they liquefied, but when she recognized the look of subjugation in Rob's eyes, she let him go. Rob, embarrassed, walked down the hallway and around the corner with his tail between his legs. The entire student body started clapping and hollering their support for Joanna.

“I wish my girlfriend could do that for me” said Tom Ackerman to another student within earshot of Gloria Vanapoulos, who fumed at being shown up.

Bill grinned. He momentarily felt that he should be embarrassed that his girlfriend was apparently the dominant one in the relationship and he was the damsel in distress that needed to be rescued, but he put macho bullshit for aside for now and came to realize realized that finally, after seventeen years, he was living his best life.
11232.title: Bill Is Living His Best Life

choices: "Everyone had to do what I say!"
Kimberly is interrupted before she can finish.
112321.content:
Weeks passed in this glorious new reality that Bill had found himself in. No more bully problems (one of said bullies now being his extremely attractive girlfriend), three days left until graduation and the freedoms of being out of high school...Even Tom's life was better due to Joanna using her own girl squad to counter Gloria's bullshit and eventually redeeming the teenager in the eyes of the entire school! Things had simply gone so right, so fast that the strange stone had simply slipped Bill's mind and laid dormant at the bottom of his backback, which was currently sitting precariously on a chair in the Strasserman living room.

And now, on a lazy, rainy, mid-May Sunday afternoon, Bill lay on his bed listening to the rain hit his bedroom window. Well, listening was the wrong term. Joanna was draped across him, her bare incredible breasts pressing up against him, a long, toned, mostly naked leg slowly stroking his own as a slender hand caressed his chest as soft lips repeatedly met his. Luckily his parents were out at a movie and while he did have to watch Kimberly, Bill had made the most of the free time. This woman, and Joanna certainly was a woman, truly completed him. She giggled as he teased at her panties, slowly stripping them down her legs as one of her powerful yet gentle hands slipped into his boxers and grasped the hard shaft that was waiting in the darkness. They had more than enough time, and Kimberly was more than taken care of at the moment.

And Kimberly? While she was a bit of a brat and she and Bill often fought over...everything for little reason at all, they shared one thing in common: Video games. It was Kimberly's 'dark' secret that she liked something that was popular with 'stupid boys'. And she wasn't very good at them, but it seemed to be the one thing that brother and sister could do that didn't erupt into a sibling fight. They'd played various video games together in co-op, but with Joanna now in his life, Bill had been letting Kimberly play some of his more mature single player games. Much like she was this afternoon.

"Woah!" Kimberly gasped as she wandered down the streets of Karnaca, city in the video game Dishonored 2. The pre-teen marveled at the colorful buildings and the fantastic art design the game had, her young mind immersed in a world that had been so meticulously crafted that it felt alive. "This is so cool!"

Kimberly had had her doubts with the opening level, the dull, colorless streets of Dunwall and the oppressive atmosphere of the polluted, troubled city. She'd blazed through the level, dying several times and killing most of the guards due to not fully grasping the concept of stealth or the binary nature of the game's morality system. But then the comic-like cutscene and the weird space level where the skinny guy had given her magic powers? That had kept her interested enough to make it to the next level where Karnaca's tropical beauty had simply pulled her in and never let go.

"I love this place so much!"

But at the apex of her joy the skies above the Strasserman house simply to split apart as the flash of lightning filled the entire house, the breakers popping and the power going dead as the loudest thunder Kimberly had ever heard shook the house and everything in it. Kimberly screamed, but it was all gone in a second, the rolling thunder fading away to the sound of heavy rain once more. Shaking her head, Kimberly picked up the console controller and tried to power everything back up, eager to resume her adventure in that amazing world...But nothing happened.

"You okay Kim?" Bill's shout came from upstairs. So long as she wasn't dead or something, Bill had more important things to worry about. The power would come back on in a few minutes anyway.

"Yeah but the power is out and the Xbox won't turn back on!" Kimberly screamed back as she furiously pressed all the buttons on the controller and the console itself.

"The power will come back on, just go color a picture or something!" Bill yelled before turning back to Joanna, who had a very impatient look on her face. "Sorry, brotherly duties" He grinned sheepishly, and was rewarded with a eye roll and a deep kiss as Joanna slowly slid guided Bill's cock towards her slit.

Meanwhile, downstairs Kimberly was mad. She paced the living room and said every bad word she knew while she waited for the power to come back on.

"It's not freaking fair!" She grumbled, "I bet the characters in the game don't have to worry about this!" She was so consumed with her childish, petty desire to continue playing the game that she hadn't noticed that Bill's backpack and been knocked off of it's precarious perch by the thunder, it's content spilling all over the carpeted floor of the living room. It had largely just been papers and stuff Bill had cleaned out of his locker, most just piling halfway out of the backpack as it lay in a pile on the floor.

But one item of note had managed to fully escape from the pack: A deep green stone. It, despite it's shape and the carpet, had somehow managed to shoot halfway across the room, right in Kimberly's path. It caught the faint light just right, shining weakly and drawing the girl's attention.

"What's this?" Kimberly asked no one as she reached down and picked up the pretty gemstone. She marveled at it's design and how the light seemed to curve around the gold teardrop in the center. "Where did this come from?" She wondered before her mind instantly starting making connections back to the game that she had been denied. The pre-teen clenched her hand shut, grasping the gemstone tight as she went back to her private tantrum.

"Why isn't the power on!? I want to play my game!" She whined somewhat loudly, hoping Bill would hear her, but she had no idea that Bill wasn't hearing much of anything outside of the heavy breathing that was currently filling his room.

"This sucks so much! I bet in the game they didn't have to deal with this! That place looked perfect and so pretty! Not like this stupid place with it's stupid weather!" Kimberly continued to rant on, unaware of the green-gold glow escaping from the cracks between her fingers.

"I bet if I lived there I'd be a princess and I could just make them fix the power right now! I wish that..."
112321.title: Kimberly's Rainy Day Activity

112323.content:
Bill and Joanna, now a happy couple due to the mysterious magical Stone that had appeared on Bill's porch hardly an hour ago, walked hand in hand down the hallway of the high school. All of Bill's problems, at least those that were actually problems, seemed dealt with in the best way possible and the stresses the teen had felt melted away as the stupid grin on his face grew wider. And Joanna had no recollection of who she used to be, only that she was beautiful and strong, smart, rich, popular and wonderfully in love with Bill.

It was a happy ending, or so it seemed.

But the Ahn'Ger Stone, or perhaps whatever power that had guided it into the Human reality, was not content with happiness. As it could only be activated with anger, with hate, it needed those emotions, perhaps to survive, perhaps simply out of 'hunger' or a need to sow chaos and now the weave of reality was being manipulated by it, ever so slightly, in order to find or cause a reason for the Stone to be used once more.

Bill's backpack jostled as he spent his day at school, going to classes, walking down the hall, making out with Joanna, all these motions causing the Stone to shake loose from it's spot in the backpack and slide towards a worn out corner that BIll had never noticed was forming in the wall worn fibers. A nudge here, a rub there, the Stone's edges slowly, and passively tore a hole through the backpack's surface and without a sound, slipped out onto the cold tile of Shermer High as Bill and his new love continued on their way, drunk in love and utterly oblivious to what had just occurred.

And there the Stone laid unnoticed until a chance beam of light made the gemstone shine brightly, drawing the attention of it's new owner, who had just had a very bad day.
112323.title: Happily Ever After?

1123233.content:
The Ahn'Ger Stone, perhaps just by chance, or perhaps due to the strange reality warping powers that it possessed, shined brightly in the beam of light and caught the attention of...

Matt Harris: Matt is a Sophmore in Shermer High, two years younger than Bill and a geek that is unlucky in love and suffers under the casual cruelty of the school social hierarchy. Picked on by the jocks, ignored by the cheerleaders, mocked by the punks and bullied by Rob Bolstrum, Matt can't help but feel that his life should be different, that he deserves for it to be better, that his life has not turned out the way it should have, as a forgotten third rate player in his own story. He wants a life like Bill Strasserman, a geek that is respected by his peers and loved by a beautiful woman that is too good for him.

Walking alone through the halls as usual, Matt spots the Ahn'Ger Stone and soon makes a wish.


Paige Walters: Paige is a Sophmore at Shermer High, your typical nerdy teenage girl that was just unlucky enough to have poor genes. A little too fat, one too many freckles, Paige is picked on by the Mean Girls of Shermer High, including Gloria Vanapolous and the newly created Joanna Ingerman (though BIll has no idea). The only boys she seems to attract are desperate and disgusting, and those that she desires don't even realize she exists. Lonely, frustrated, and looking for a way to make friends and find a boyfriend worth having, Paige has little in her life to look forward to aside from her Internet friends.

Exiting the Girl's bathroom and wiping tears from her eyes, Paige spots the Ahn'Ger Stone and soon makes a wish.
1123233.title: Happily Ever After? (Additional Options)

11232331.content:
"So Matt, what do you want to talk about today?"

Matt Harris slumped to the bottom of his therapist's comfy green couch with a frustrated, almost defeated look on his face. He stroked back his mop of curly brown hair with his hands and rested them on top of his forehead, the constant background anxiety in his mind coming to the fore.

He sat there, staring at the stoic but empatheic face of Dr. Gold, ashamed that at sixteen years old, he already needed to see a shrink to help cope with his problems.

"Same song, different tune, doc. I get ignored by the people I want to be around, and because life is so wonderful, I receive plenty of attention from the people I DON'T want paying attention to me."

"So you're still having problems with making friends at school?"

"Yeah" sighed Matt.

"Do you want to talk about that?" asked Dr. Gold, no hint of emotion in his voice.

"Well sure. I think I'm doing a little better than last week. There's one girl I've been starting to open up to. Her name is Paige. She's a year up from me, but I take some of the same AP classes as her, so it's not weird. We have a lot of the same interests, and I like her."

"Good" nodded the therapist, writing something down Matt couldn't see. "What kind of interests?"

"Oh, you know, geek stuff. Dumb jokes and shitposts we've seen on Reddit. The latest Adventure Zone podcast. Sometimes we even get around to discussing our schoolwork! Nothing earth shattering, honestly, but I didn't have anyone else to talk about that stuff, in real life anyway, and neither did she, so it was a mutually beneficial kind of thing. She's sweet. I wouldn't say that anything romantic is going to come out of it. I'm not attracted to her, and I don't think she's into me that way either, but I'm glad that I don't have to hide who I am anymore. I can let my freak flag fly, so to speak."

"Do you have any romantic interests?"

"I don't want to talk about it" Matt replied curtly. Vanessa Chandler laughing at him after he asked her out was too painful to discuss.

Dr. Gold nodded, understanding Matt's pain. In the six months Matt has been a patient, his frustrations with his inability to attract women was a frequent topic of conversation.

"How is your bullying problem?"

"Ah, the six hundred pound elephant in the room" joked the teenager. He sat up straight, revealing his black eye.

"This" pointed Matt, "was just the latest thing that's happened to me. On Monday, one of the players on the basketball team gave me a swirlie in the boy's bathroom after I mouthed off to him. I still got the faint taste of Lysol in my mouth. On Tuesday, one of the punks somehow put a smelly fish in my locker the day after I tried to talk to him in chemistry class. On Wednesday, one of the cheerleaders started shit talking about me after school ended and tried to get her gang to go after me. That girl is a known bitch though, so I didn't take it that seriously."

"And why would this girl have her gang go after you?"

"Because I had the audacity to talk to her ex-boyfriend in front of her, who she is mad at for dubious reasons and wants to ostracize from everyone. What I did was like the equivalent of me walking into North Korea or some country American's aren't supposed to be in and opening a pizza shop. It just looks bad."

"I see" answered the forty year old professional, somewhat shocked by the social realities of Shermer High. He wrote down something else onto his notepad.

"Her boyfriend is a nice guy though. I'm a little surprised since he's a football player and all the other football players at school treat me like shit, but he's not bad at all. I could see the isolation was really upsetting him, so I thought he deserved to be treated like a human being. That's why I'm not upset about what I did" continued Matt.

"Who assaulted you?"

"A bully named Rob Bolstrum. Big kid. Bad seed. Head full of rocks. Trailer trash. His family is probably inbred for six or seven generations. He's so big that I wouldn't be shocked if he was actually 35 and he's been held back for twenty years in a row."

Matt laughed bitterly through his pain.

Dr. Gold asked what happened to provoke such an assault.

"It's a long story" replied Matt. "It all started at school today. I wasn't there to see it, but apparently before first bell Rob tried to shake down this Senior kid named Bill Strasserman, but Bill's girlfriend Joanna kicked his ass in front like thirty people and got Rob completely humiliated. At least that's what I heard happened. My theory is that instead of licking his wounds, Rob went down his list of victims to the next easiest target and picked me to take his frustrations out on."

Matt recalled the verbal abuse from Rob this morning with goosebumps immediately rippling on his skin. Rob's nasty, meanspirited voice alone was enough to trigger traumatic flashbacks. Snapshots appeared in his memory bank of how the sadistic bully manhandled the skinny, gawky Sophomore, shoving him roughly against the locker just before his 11:00 A.M class, and how the bully roughly confiscated Matt's weekly allowance from his pocket. Matt remembered the fear he felt this morning, the utter powerlessness of his situation. He recalled the rage. The anger. He felt pure hate he had against Rob, hatred so intense it made him take a swing at the Cro-Magnon looking thug, the end result just pissing Rob off and ending with Matt's ugly black shiner.

"But..." Matt continued, "Bullying I'm used to. This isn't the first black eye I've ever had. Just ask my father when he did the same thing to me two years ago. What's really, truly disturbing me this week, doc, is Bill Strasserman."

"And who is he to you?" asked Dr. Gold.

"That's the thing, I DON'T know him. He's a Senior, a couple of years ahead of me. He's a geek like me, but we've never talked or had any personal interactions with one another. Yet, I feel like we should know each other."

Matt paused.

"I can't explain it, but something about this life of mine has always felt just a little bit off. For as long as I can remember, this deep seated feeling in my gut that this life here in Shermer wasn't...there's a dark underbelly to it. And then I worried that I shouldn't have known about this. That there was a glitch in the matrix. A mistake. Something I was never meant to discover but somehow did. I know that this reality we're living in isn't the real reality."

"I know what you must be thinking, that I've seen too many Keanu Reeves movies. Believe me, I tried to convince myself that the paranoia was just my overactive imagination, but I can feel it every day. I feel it when I wake up in the morning, and I can feel it when I go to bed at night. When I watch TV. When I do my homework. It's like...this has all happened before."

"Like deja vu?"

"Yeah. But weirder. I feel like I don't belong here. Like this isn't MY story."

"Many thoughtful individuals such as yourself often undergo existential crises. It's normal to feel out of place, especially in a small town like Shermer" replied Dr. Gold.

"Yeah, but it's more than that. It's something bigger. Stranger. Something cosmic, something supernatural. I know that I've lived similar lives like this one before, that I've had many past lives, and they are all tied together by a common thread."

"So you believe in reincarnation?"

"Maybe. For years, I've always had these weird dreams. These dreams always had two common elements. The first one was a magic green gemstone that grants wishes. The catch, because there's always a catch, is that the stone can only grant wishes when you're angry. It just appeared one day out of the blue. Like it came from nowhere. All this crazy stuff happened in the dreams. I made wishes I didn't mean to because I was angry. I either wasn't thinking straight, or someone else wasn't. In my dreams, I got transformed into all matters of different things. Women. Dogs. Inanimate objects. The world got taken over by aliens. I ended up as a cartoon character. I woke up on this big spaceship far in the future living with my future wife. There was a weird chicken lady. Just bizarre stuff. And always, ALWAYS, Bill Strasserman was involved in these dreams. Always."

Dr Gold briefly wondered to himself where his patient was going with this.

"Then today, eureka! I figured it out. By complete, doodah coincidence, I stumbled upon it, just laying there innocently in the hallway at school. The answer to all of my questions. I always wondered how someone like Bill, a pasty faced geek if there ever was one, landed a girlfriend like Joanna Ingerman. The gemstone! The green gemstone from my dreams. It had to have been that. Bill had to have rediscovered the gemstone and wished this reality into existence. One where he's popular and respected and loved. Otherwise, I figure, a hottie like Joanna would never give him the time of day, let alone be as head over heels in love with him the way she is. Which means that my dreams must have been real. Maybe sometime way back when, Bill and I really were friends. We were always best friends in my dreams."

"So" asked Dr. Gold cautiously, worried about Matt going off the reservation. He didn't want to confront Matt directly about his delusions, but he had to get the teenager back on track.

"Matt...how did you realize the dream were real?"

"Because of this" answered Matt proudly as he pulled out the Ahn'Ger stone from underneath the sleeve of his blue hoodie. A sly grin spread across his teenage face.

Dr. Gold examined the stone. It was emerald green. Teardrop shaped. Almost completely opaque except for a smaller gold gem that could be seen in the center.

"And you want to know the great thing about this, doc? I know how to operate it without screwing up what I want. I'm always angry."
11232331.title: A Glitch In The Matrix

11232333.content:
The Ahn'Ger Stone, perhaps just by chance, or perhaps due to the strange reality warping powers that it possessed, shined brightly in the beam of light and caught the attention of...

Eugene Kazinski: Eugene is one of Shermer High's janitorial workers, an over-50 man that barely graduated high school, never attended college, never had a meaningful relationship and spent the majority of his adult life floating from job to job just to make rent. Finally landing a stable job at the high school, Eugene tries to enjoy his work but his disheveled appearance, lack of education and the rumors surrounding him make it difficult and he finds himself regretting the choices of his life, especially after another creul prank by Rob Bolstrum and his gang.. He'd love to go back and do things all over again, to get a decent education, a job, a wife and family.

Cleaning up the mess left by Rob's prank, Eugene spots the Ahn'Ger Stone and soon makes a wish.


Gabriella Vasquez: Gabriella is the Spanish teacher at Shermer High. Still young and attractive, Gabriella just so happens to be on the last legs of her employment visa, and with the political climate of the United States and the almost purposeful slow processing of her citizenship application may soon be deported back to Mexico. It doesn't help that she's constantly fending off sexual harassment from some of the other faculty and some daring members of the student body. All she wants to to teach her native language and live the American dream but everything seems stacked against her, simply because of her ethnicity.

Leaving school for the day to an uncertain future, Gabriella spots the Ahn'Ger Stone and soon makes a wish.
11232333.title: Happily Ever After? (Additional Options)

choices: Eugene is transported to his new life
112323331.content:
Witness if you will, a prison, made out of endless hallways of polished linoleum, rows of metal lockers, and the fictional promise of a bright future. It is colloquially known as Shermer High, and there are many ones just like it dotting our landscape. The prison is occupied between the hours of 8:00 A.M and 5:00 P.M by its population of Shermer's progeny and their wardens known as teachers, but currently, just as those very prisoners and their wardens go home to lick their wounds from a day filled with heartbreak and woe, the prison is being haunted by a single, lonely resident, a sad disheveled little creature known as Eugene Kazinski, finishing the rounds of his toil. Eugene is a desperate man, a profoundly unhappy man, one who's soul has been burdened for too long by the unfortunate hand of poor choices and bad luck. A man who would do anything to escape this prison he has found himself trapped in. Now witness, if you will, as a man full of life dying of neglect finds his only salvation...in the Ahn'Ger Stone.

**

Eugene had discovered and pocketed the otherworldly gemstone just as school was ending for the day at 3:20 P.M. The various extracurricular activities such as the debating team, the drama club, and something called the Warhammer 40K Society, who only had a roster of three members(Headed by the equally lonely Paige Walters and occasionally attended by Bill Strasserman before he had found a girlfriend) were still in session and loudly making their presence heard, but otherwise the school and it's halls were barren of life save Eugene, and no one paid him much attention.

Eugene. The background noise of other people's hectic lives. A...what was that term he had heard on the news lately? A Non-Playable Character? Yeah. An NPC. He was an NPC. Someone with no life of their own. Someone whose entire purpose of existence was in the service of some greater hero. Someone who nobody thought much about as they went home to their cheating wives and bratty siblings. "Unimportant side character" was the leitmotif of Eugene Kazinski's entire life. When he was lucky.

When he wasn't so fortunate to be wallpaper, Eugene was known better around Shermer High by his nickname, Gene The Creeper. Rumors had been spread earlier in the year. Horrible, disgusting rumors, courtesy of one Gloria Vanapoulous that Eugene was a pedophile who spent his spare time leering at other people's children on the playground and had once tried to abduct Kimmy Strasserman on the way home from Horace Mann Middle School. These rumors had gained traction, as all of Gloria's sycophantic girlfriends on the cheerleading team couldn't take one look at the middle-aged janitor's sunken in, blue grey eyes or his stubbly salt and pepper beard without gagging on their fat free yogurt. Thus, a legendary creature was born. One that was black of heart and cruel of temperament. A boogeyman. The incestuous nature of small town gossip had not helped these accusations, and now even grown adults had begun suspecting poor Eugene of the most terrible things. According to these rumors, Eugene Kazinski, who went out of his way to avoid stepping on ants, gave a friendly hello to everyone who crossed his path, and still sent his elderly mother nearly half his paycheck every week, was secretly a cunning predator waiting to lure children to their own defilement. Residents of Shermer began avoiding the glorified transient. They gave him the cold shoulder when he politely tried to make conversation on the bus ride to work. They gave him dirty looks, and if he didn't take the hint, they would dismiss him with a tone of voice that would chill the most oblivious narcissist to their bones. Parents of Shermer High told their children to never be alone around the mean old janitor, who probably kept photos of them with the eyes cut out in his creepy sex dungeon/utility closet. The only reason the high school didn't outright fire Eugene Kazinski is because, of course, there was not a single shred of evidence that any of these claims were actually true. Gossip alone could not hang a man, and the victim, used to a lifetime of "Dumb Pollack" jokes, just let the accusations slide off his back.

At least he tried to.

What he actually wanted to do was cry his eyes out and find someone understanding to hug tightly, but he found those comforts lacking. He had no one close to him in this nightmare of a life to confide who he could feel safe around, and he couldn't cry, because a lifetime of verbal abuse had already calloused his mind against the cruelty of others.

Walking inside his dank, dark utility closet, Eugene switched the light to his personal bathroom on. The gemstone glowed green like kryptonite, except in the center where it glowed gold. He stared at himself in the mirror as he held it.

For the first time in his tenure at Shermer High, he was finally beginning to feel angry at his plight. Today, he had finally had enough. Tomorrow there would be hell to pay. He would no longer be anyone's punching bag. Not after today's humiliation from that punk Rob Bolstrum.

Earlier last month, Eugene had begun receiving text messages out of the blue from the Spanish teacher, Gabriella Vasquez. Gabriella was at least thirty years younger than Eugene, and indescribably gorgeous, but like Eugene she claimed she was being eaten away by loneliness as she too found herself a pariah in Shermer. Racism and simple culture clash was preventing her from getting a foothold in the American dream. She described, in heartfelt(And heartbreaking) eloquence, how she understood what Eugene was going through, how searingly painful it was, and that if he ever wanted to go out for coffee, Gabriella would gladly treat him to it.

This initial text had set Eugene's heart ablaze. He must have re-read it a hundred and fifty times throughout the next day, as even when he was growing up, he never had any friends, let alone someone who understood his inner turmoil, the stormy disquiet perpetual throughout his life. Eugene had been thrown out of the house by his verbally abusive drunken father in Chicago the moment he turned eighteen years old, and since the old bastard had worn down his self esteem, Eugene had never truly believed that he COULD find someone who understood his doubts, his fears, his ambitions, and the simple joys he took in life. The simple things nobody else thought of like a smile of a strangers face as they passed him by. So he shuffled from one menial job to the next, aimless in his quest to avoid being hurt.

Since Eugene hated the taste of coffee, he suggested something else. Something more intimate. Instead of coffee, Gabriella and he began a correspondence, texting penpals. Within a week, both of them became fast, close friends. Eugene never pushed anything into romantic territory, although he was desperately tempered to, for fear that Gabriella would become creeped out by him, just as everyone else had. But he enjoyed the talks, the ability to get things off of his chest, and the opportunity to laugh. He had the most charming laugh.

Gabriella had requested to keep this friendship a secret. She him to not acknowledge one other in public. Keep it between themselves. Eugene agreed. He didn't look in her direction or even smirk during school days.

Yesterday, to Eugene's delight, Gabriella had finally popped the question herself!

"Eugene, let's go out on a date tonight. Wait by my class at Noon to discuss plans."

What Eugene discovered in Room 219B was not Ms. Vasquez. It was that troublemaker with rocks for brains Rob Bolstrum, and the no good punks who followed him around. Rob held up a cell phone, with Gabriella's text superimposed on the screen, a cruel smirk plain on his face. The gang of bullies began laughing at the older man as they saw his hopes, feeble as they were, crushed into the dirt like so much rubble. They mocked him for his insecurities, and called him a pedophile. He ran away like so many bullied children, past football star Tom Ackerton, wondering with grim pessimism what those assholes were laughing about now.

Rob had been angry today that he no longer had Bill Strasserman to pick on because the geek's cunt of a girlfriend Joanna Ingerman ball busted him, so the red haired thug decided today was the day to reap the rewards of his little catfishing enterprise.
