11232333112311223121131.content:
Eugene stepped off the bus down onto the cold sidewalk, the final step almost causing him to trip as he, in his new form misjudged the now larger drop. He let out a womanly grunt as he landed harder than he should have on his two feet and was suddenly glad that this female version of himself wasn't wearing heels. The last thing he needed right now was to accidentally break his ankles. But still, the harder landing sent a flare of pain shooting through his body and he grimaced in the dark as the bus doors closed behind him as Reggie the bus driver continued his journey through the chilly autumn night.

Even though it was October instead of May, even though he was a woman instead of a man, at least his apartment building was exactly the same as he had left it. It loomed above him in the dark, an older brick building that was older than Eugene, and was constantly shifting owners despite a steady stream of occupants like himself. The building was four stories tall and fairly narrow, but still dominated the skyline of the old main street of Shermer. It dated back to around 1940-ish and had been renovated several times over it's life span by multiple owners but somehow managing to keep the 'old timey' charm of the 40s. But the fact that 'old main street' Shermer was largely nothing more than a handful of old businesses that were too stubborn to let go meant that rent was cheap, which also meant the building continuously changed hands every five or so years.

But so long as the revolving door of new owners didn't evict him, Eugene really couldn't have cared less about the fact that the last time the building had seen any extensive renovation had been 1989, and then in the early 2000s to bring it up to fire and asbestos code. It didn't leak, everything more or less worked and it kept him out of the bitter northern Midwest winters, one of which was getting ready to once again arrive.

The once-again janitor inhaled the crisp, cold night air and walked up the short flight of steps into the four-story apartment building's lobby, which was furnished with yellowing tile, bank of small wall-mounted mailboxes and the main office where Ralph, the current superintendent, sat under a pair of florescent lights watching something on the small TV while, despite a 'no smoking ordinance' he smoked a large cigar with his legs popped up on a filing cabinet. The harsh light shined painfully off the overweight man's bald head as he noticed Eugene, spinning around in his squeaky chair.

"Good, heh, Eve-nin' Ms. Kazinski! How are you tonight?" Ralph said cheerfully as he leaned heavily on his side of the counter, pressing his face close to the glass pane that divided him from the tenants. The man was just a couple of years older than Eugene and had run the building since sometime before Eugene had found himself in Shermer. While he didn't own the property and was technically only the building super, he also collected the rent money from Eugene and the other tenants. Eugene watched as Ralph sucked in his gut as he swiveled around to face him.

"Oh, uh, I guess I can't complain?" Actually Eugene could, given his situation, but he was pretty sure his landlord wouldn't like having a tenant that thought she was supposed to be a man or in possession of a magical, reality altering gemstone and had spent the last few hours being A: Transported back in time from April of 2019, B: Having been regressed to being eighteen years old again, and C: Was the star of the school play before being unceremoniously tossed into the role of head cheerleader for the high school's cheer team.

"That's good! Hey, listen, I hate to do this but the new owner is really coming down on me about rent, and he's not too happy about you being a payment behind. I was thinking though, maybe if you and I went out to dinner tomorrow night, maybe I could...smooth things over?" Ralph's voice was full of false sincerity and Eugene caught the man's eyes flickering down at his flabby breasts before wandering back up to his face.

Eugene tried not to puke as it dawned on him why his super, who usually only communicated in grunts or short, gruff, profanity laced sentences was being so nice and communicative. He wanted a freaking date! Eugene felt himself gripping the Ahn'Ger Stone tightly as the urge to escape another uncomfortable situation. Was there just no END to the terrible situations that he was going to find himself in today!?

"I wis-" Eugene started under his breath, but caught himself before he made the situation worse. The last thing he needed was to end up married to the fat man in front of him or something! At least right now he was as close to breaking even as he'd gotten all day, and Eugene just wanted to get upstairs and be alone, even if it meant being in this flabby female body.

"What?" Ralph said, leaning closer to the gap in the office window, his flabby face scrunched in confusion.

"Oh I, uh, I said I would, uh, love to but I thought I would, uh, use the kids being at a game tomorrow to, um, clean the gym floor!" The janitor fumbled up the best excuse he could find, which was, ironically, something he actually did do when the gym would otherwise not be in use. Whether or not he actually had done it the first time he'd lived through October 2018 was another story all together.

"Oh." Ralph's face fell as he looked downward at the counter, relaxing in disappointment as his stomach ballooned out to it's original size. Silence and the muted sound of some old TV show filled the otherwise quiet lobby,and just for a moment Eugene didn't see the abrasive and crude landlord. Instead he saw a sad, tired and lonely old man that had just gotten his heartbroken.

'Shit' Eugene thought to himself as a wave of guilt washed over him. As weird as being a woman was, Eugene WAS behind on his rent, and if he couldn't figure out how to make the stupid gemstone in his hand work the way he wanted it to, at least going out to dinner wasn't the worst way he could solve the problem. Plus there didn't seem to be any way out of this particular situation without just walking away and potentially risking his apartment.

"Um, maybe some other time?" Eugene croaked meekly, suddenly leaning forward on his side of the glass, giving Ralph an up close look at his flabby cleavage, "I don't think I'm doing anything this weekend? Maybe then?"

Ralph's eyes lit up in delight and Eugene hated the fact that he had been a woman for all of about four hours and was already forced to use 'feminine wiles' to get his way.

"That sounds like a plan my dear!" Ralph beamed as he leaned back in his chair, which creaked dangerously under the man's weight. "I think I can tell the powers that be they don't have to worry about any late payments" The super gave Eugene a wink and the tortured janitor tried not to shudder (he was pretty sure that even the slightest shiver would make his fat new body start jiggling). Instead Eugene just gave Ralph the best smile he could, wished him goodnight, and retreated up the stairs as fast as he could.

Which proved to be a mistake. Eugene's apartment was on the top floor, as far away from everyone else as he could manage. In his old body he was still regretting the decision as he got older and his body got weaker, but as this new, almost obese woman he found himself as, the climb was torture. He was out of breath by the time he got halfway up the second flight of stairs and had to pause to catch his breath, gasping as quietly as he could unless Ralph suddenly appear and take it as an excuse to 'flirt'. So Eugene had carried his Eve bulk upwards each flight of steps, trying his best to ignore his throbbing feet and the layer of sweat that was unpleasantly catching in the folds of his skin (and beneath his breasts). By the time he had reached his floor he was so exhausted and frustrated that the gemstone had begun to glow once more and the risk seemed dangerously worth it to the suffering man-turned-woman.

So Eugene had shoved the cursed little gem into his purse and waddled down the hall, the floor creaking under him until he finally, finally reached Apartment 4E. Home.

Praying that everything inside was more or less how he left it, now that it seemed the only thing different about his life was that he was fat and female, Eugene fished a keyring out of his purse, slid the appropriate key into the lock, and held his breath as he opened the door to find...

...Exactly what he wanted, what he NEEDED to see. His furniture, faded and old, right where he left it. His TV, the same. The wallpaper still in need of replacement, and his kitchen, while still in need of a deep clean, was still acceptably clean. It was, in fact, even more full than Eugene usually kept it, which he had to attribute to 'Eve's' currently, well, size. As Eugene completed his inspection of his apartment, the only things that seemed 'off' was largely just his curtains, bedsheets, the feminine products in his bathroom, and of course, his wardrobe. The handful of pictures he on display had not changed outside of him appearing as a her, and the one, perhaps the most important one that Eugene had owned that was kept next to his bed, showed much younger, thinner and happier looking Eve (one that looked like a 26 year old version of the body he previously had) held tightly against the body of a strange dark headed man he didn't recognize.

Eugene picked the picture up off of the nightstand with two flabby hands and stared at it. He remembered this, only he had been the guy and the girl...The girl's name had been Karen, but she definitely hadn't looked as good as Young Eve did. It was the only keepsake he had from the only positive relationship he'd ever had, but it had been impossible, now that he was a she.

More than any of the other crazy things that had happened to him today, strangely hurt. Eugene put the picture back on the nightstand and collapsed, exhausted into bed.

"What a fucking day" He muttered.
11232333112311223121131.title: Eve's Old/New Life Alone

112323331123112231212.content:
Poor Emily McLeod was completely in the dark at everything Eve was saying to her.

Evelyn Kazinski was her very best friend, for intents and purposes her sister from another mother, and now not only had had her closest pal in the word turned on a dime into a raving lunatic the second she decided to indulge that weird Willow Strasserman girl, now she...now Eve was this fat old hag standing in front of her!

She watched with horror as the now middle aged Eve, actually looking far older than that, having accrued some city miles on her, pointed her fat finger into the middle of her palm, which was holding a pretty little green teardrop shaped gemstone between the excessive skin folds.

"I wish you'd help me for once!" the former popularity queen croaked out in her husky voice, which sounded addled from years of alcohol and tobacco abuse. Then her hand seemed to begin radiating an unearthly green glow.

Emily's eyes widened in shock

"What the fuck?"

...and then realization.

Wait a minute, is that gemstone magic or something? Like out of Supernatural? That would explain why Eve is old now! the eighteen year old thought silently to herself.

One of Emily's guilty pleasures, which she didn't like admitting in front of people, was that she was a huge fangirl of horror movies, and her favorite TV show was Supernatural. Her mind was already primed to accept the existence of paranormal relics like the Ahn'Ger Stone since she had seen so many variations of the scenario before, like in Wishmaster.

Maybe if I can break that thing, I can reverse the curse, and bring Eve back to normal!

She watched as the otherworldly green glow slowly began to create wisps of green smoke that slowly filled the room.

"NO!!" screamed the pretty brunette cheerleader, her body leaping on top of Eve to try and wrestle the accursed thing away from her friend, knocking them both to the floor. She began to pry open Eve's thick, sausage like fingers...

"LET GO!" bellowed Eugene in his new voice, sounding surprisingly mean and bitter, as if the new Eve had gone through an even harder life than her formerly male self had. She slapped Emily in the face with her free hand, assaulting her for the third time that day. Given that Eve now weighed at least as twice as much as the rather slender Emily, this slap hurt, knocking the beautiful girl a significant distance across the bathroom from Eve, underneath the sinks.

Emily cried to herself about how insane and impossible this all was, her seemingly picture book existence, with almost everything going for her, having been torn away in an instant by a magic stone.

She looked on with fearful eyes as the stone's glow intensified in Eve's hand, and then let off a blinding flash of light...

**

The next thing Emily and Eugene both heard was the shrill cry of two dozen middle aged voices.

"OH MY GOD!"

"OH! MY! GOD!"

"HOLY SHIT! SHIT! SHIT!"

Then they heard a stampede of feet rush towards the ladies room.

"Oh crap, what now?" Emily asked herself in a voice that sounded slightly off from the one she had a moment ago, slowly pushing herself out of the cavity underneath the sink and up on her feet again. She turned around and looked at herself in the mirror.

"HOLY SHI..." muttered the Scottish-American girl, unable to finish her blasphemy as the stampede of feet rushed inside the medium sized lavatory. She was immediately pushed aside by a now very matronly Vanessa Chandler gazing with terror at her thickened body and her short, butch looking haircut, appearing ridiculous in her now much too small cheerleader uniform.

"I'm so old looking!" loudly moaned Lindsey Moon in the mirror next to Vanessa as she appraised the wrinkles on her now weather beaten face, the crows feet dominating everything. She picked at strands of her fading dark hair as she saw streaks of grey running through it.

"I've turned into my mother!' stuttered Gloria Vanapoulous quietly from behind Lindsey, in clear shock.

Well, not exactly her mother, but close enough for the resemblance to be uncanny. The usually arrogant beauty began breathing rapid and shallow, worried that she was about to have a panic attack over this unexpected transformation, not appreciating that while she was indeed older, she was actually still rather attractive in a MILF sort of way, and she was one of the girls who had been affected the least by Eugene's wish.

Certainly not as bad as Alicia Adams, who had the great misfortune of developing arthritis and degenerative scoliosis in her old age She took one look at her mature, fiftyish looking face, her brown hair half gray now, and hobbled out of the bathroom, looking for a place to sit down so she wasn't in agonizing pain.

Meanwhile, yet another cheerleader, Kaitlyn Irby, was crying as she poked at the imperfections on her now withered chocolate covered skin.

"I had a date tonight!" she cried in her throaty, mature sounding voice. "Brad will never want to go out with me now!" as her friend April Huang gave her a supportive hug.

For what seemed like an eternity, the squad all primped and sobbed and worried what the hell was going on, if anyone would even recognize them anymore, if anyone would even love them anymore now that they were old and fat and disgusting, and how to return to normal.

No one stopped to look at Eve, or had put two and two together that her outburst may be connected to this very strange turn of events.

Gradually, the girls of Shermer High's cheerleading team left the bathroom and filled out into the hallway, all of them quite a sight in their ill fitting outfits, all looking like middle aged women on the way to a Bon Jovi concert. Several of them grabbed their phones out of their purses and called their parents. Each call was unique, but all sounded something in the ballpark of;

"Daddy, you are NOT going to believe this!".

**

As the last girl, Victoria Mattingly, left the room in tears, Emily McLeod took an opportunity to finally get a look at her new self.

"God, Eve, what did you do?" as she saw her friend hiding in one of the stalls out of the corner of her eye.

Emily gulped at her new body.

Unfortunately, the middle aged woman staring at Emily through the mirror was now visibly overweight, though not as bad as Eve, Vanessa, or a couple of the other cheerleaders were. Her face was much rounder than it had been twenty minutes ago, with a thick double chin and jowls. Her body had become wider, with her tummy and her upper arms jiggling with excess fat. Her posterior was now soft, lush, and did the rumba when she walked. Overall, she looked like she had been well fed, the only positive being her now much larger breasts. But that wasn't all.

Her formerly well kept long brunette hair was now a short bob cut, and was dyed blonde. Her roots were just beginning to show, which made Emily a tad self conscious, though she didn't know why.

She now seemed to possess poorer eyesight. She was wearing a pair of admittedly cute black cat eye glasses on her face, but when she took them off, everything near and far seemed to blur, so Emily put them back on.

She could still make out traces of her original self. Her blue grey eyes continued to twinkle mischievously, and the cheerleader could recognize her telltale smile from anywhere, but overall, she was virtually unrecognizable. She could pass for any random stay at home mom on her block.

"...Eve?" she asked with a distinct dread in her voice, turning around to face her sulking friend.

Her friend, sitting on a closed toilet, very slowly raised her face to look at Emily with her deep set, piggish looking eyes.

"Eve, where did you get that piece of jewelry from?"

Meanwhile, Willow Strasserman, who had been unaffected by the wish, had quietly snuck away from the scene through a side exit, both upset and deeply, deeply confused by what happened tonight. The geeky blonde could barely believe her own eyes. Had all of the girls really aged forty years right in front of her? She couldn't wait to tell Paige the news.

Standing silently, her arms crossed underneath her cleavage, was a now middle aged Joanna Ingerman.

All things considered, Joanna had gotten off the easiest. She was clearly a middle aged woman, just like the rest of her team, but she was still incredibly beautiful and fit for her age, and more importantly, she had seen Eve run off with that weird looking gemstone. She knew that bitch had something to do with this, and she was going to make her pay for it.

Option 1: Parents of some of the cheerleaders begin arriving at school after receiving distress calls from their daughters.

Option 2: Joanna, along with the other cheerleaders, confront Eugene about the Stone.

112323331123112232.content:
"Where is it!?" Eugene hissed as he dug through the bag and purse before unending their contents over the bleachers. Out tumbled a phone that cracked and broke as it hit the floor. Out came a load of cosmetics. Out came the rest of the clothing and the loose change that Eve had been keeping in her purse.

But there was no gemstone.

"No...NO! It was supposed to be right here!" Eugene spun around, tumbling backwards as he over-estimated his control over his new centers of gravity and was saved only by grabbing onto one of the nearby handrails. His green eyes were wide and his chest heaved as panic overtook the anger he had been feeling, and suddenly he realized that every single pair of eyes in the gym was locked on him, and plenty of phones were pointed in his direction, including Gloria's. And Joanna simply stood there, towering over all the other girls with a cold look on her face.

'Oh no. Oh no oh no oh no' Was all Eugene could think as he realized what had happened. The Stone was gone, it clearly hadn't come with him from the previous reality, if it still existed at all. It had abandoned him here as a cheerleader and now he'd ruined it with his tantrum. He inhaled sharply as Joanna took a step forward and pointed a finger towards the row of doors at the far end of the gym, Eugene following it and catching a blur of something curly ducking under one of the windows.

"Eve, I think you need to go. Clean up this mess and leave or I'll have someone go get Mr. Irons and he can walk you out" Joanna said in a very stern and icy cold voice that sent a chill running through Eugene's body. Suddenly the girl who had hugged him, had felt so soft and warm just minutes ago looked like a unyielding mountain of stone and steel as he blue eyes drilled into Eugene's soul.

"But-I...I just, I didn't mean to" He stammered, trying to find the words, some way to make it right, but it was too late.

"I don't want to hear it, Evelyn. You attacked a student, and now you have to leave. Pick up your shit and get the hell out of our gym. You're no longer welcome here" Joanna said, a murmur of approval running through the collected crowd of cheerleaders. "I'll be speaking to Mrs. Beck and Mr. Lonnigan about this. Don't plan on going to the game tomorrow"

Eugene could do nothing but stare in shock before Joanna snapped her fingers, the snap echoing across the otherwise silent gym, and Eugene quickly scrambled to life as he stuffed the mess of items back into the duffel bag and ran towards the door.
__________________________

Like all the days had been in the month following the incident in the gym, Eugene had had a rough day. He'd scrambled out of the gym into a blast of cold air, which had taken his breath away before he discovered that it was no longer April 2018. Instead the gemstone had changed more than just his gender and made him a cheerleader, it had shifted time itself! Instead of it being spring it had become mid-October 2018, and Eugene had nearly froze in the chilly night air as he wandered the parking lot, trying to find out which car belonged to Eve. Finding the cute little pink and white convertible Eugene had piled in and taken off, ending up at the home of Eve Kazinski through some weird form of autopilot. He'd pulled up in the driveway of a extremely expensive looking house in the white collar neighborhood of Shermer on the opposite side of town from the apartment he rented when he he had been a man and bolted inside.

Eve's parents, two strangers that Eugene didn't know, wanted to know why their daughter was home so early, why it looked like she had been crying, but Eugene had simply bolted up the stairs and into what he now knew as his bedroom, slamming the door and falling onto the large, soft pink bed and passing out.

The next day had been hell. He hadn't wanted to go to school, but Eve's parents, Karen and Howard, had forced him to. His lack of knowledge of makeup, how to do his hair and his eyes locked shut experience in the bathroom had left the apparently pristine looking Eve looking like a mess. And when he'd gotten to school, well, things just got worse. Everyone was pointing and whispering at him, crowds parting as he wandered down the main hallway before the school's PA system summoned him to the office. There Eugene was the unfortunate star of the first tongue-lashing that Eve had ever received, video evidence being presented to his horrified new mother, mumbling excuses through a mane of limp red hair before Eugene had been escorted out of the building by Mr. Irons, the school security officer. Eugene, or rather Eve as he resigned himself to be now, had received a week suspension for bullying, physical violence against another student, and erratic behavior. And he'd...she'd been removed from the cheerleading team, the academic decathalon team, the BETA Club and pretty much every extra-curricular that Eve had ever been involved in. At home she was stripped of all her privileges. Her keys were taken away, her computer, no TV. Her new parents were clearly so hurt and angry that they would barely look or even speak to her.

And Eve's reputation among the student populace? All the goodwill, the praise and admiration, it had all vanished like dust in the wind. What had taken the girl that Eugene now was a lifetime to build, he'd destroyed it literally overnight. And Eugene, Eve, found herself the target of the same bullying she had tried to save Willow from. Her locker, smack dab in the middle of the of the 'popular' hallway was vandalized, and she was ostracized by all the girls she shared classes with, including Emily, who wouldn't even look at Eve. Eventually Eve was re-assigned a locker away from everyone that she was 'causing conflicts' with, and eventually had her entire schedule re-arranged so that she would stop 'causing disruptions' in the classes with the cheerleaders.

And they stripped her name from her, in a way. Instead of being called Eve, everyone now, if they spoke to her without insulting her, simply called her Evelyn.

She was friendless, adrift, a shell of a person. Ironically it was almost second nature, given Eugene's former life and the social pariah he had been because of the same cruel rumors, caused by almost the exact same people. It was why Eve had rolled with it better than anyone had expected, and the target on her back had faded as it looked like the 'fallen angel' of Shermer High wasn't going to give anyone the satisfaction of being provoked into another tantrum. She was just a sad, quiet little loser now, and it was no fun for Gloria and her newly enlarged pack of sycophants if she wasn't going to play ball. Eventually Gloria had gone back to torturing her boyfriend and the constant abuse finally stopped. All that was seemingly left to play with was just a shell of a person, and that was boring.

But that was when a ray of light finally appeared in the most unlikely place. Three weeks after the shockwave had passed and Eve, Evelyn now found herself at the lowest rung of the Shermer High social ladder, two girls appeared at lunch, at the empty table near the back of the high school cafeteria where she'd found herself exiled to. She had quickly and quietly finished her meal and tried to focus on catching up on her homework, which was near impossible for her, given her previous life as a man who had originally barely graduated decades ago.

"How is this shit even math!?" She muttered to herself as she stared at the incomprehensible calculus in front of her. But then a shadow fell across her book and she closed her eyes, preparing for the assault.

"Hey...Eve?" Came a slightly nasally female voice. Eve's head shot up, sending her limp, faded red hair flying. There, standing in front of her table with lunch trays in hand, were Willow Strasserman, Paige Walters and some greasy haired boy that was staring a little too intently towards Eve's cleavage.

"Can, um, can we sit with you?" Willow asked shly, and Eve could see more than a few eyes glancing their way from the other tables. More gossip for the rumor mill.

Eve chuckled to hereself. "I don't know. Might damage your reps sitting with me"

"Well, we don't have any 'reps' so I think we'll be okay" The tubby Paige Walters said, "With how crazy everything has been, now that we share a locker block and classes..."

"I just wanted to thank you!" Willow blurted out, slamming her tray down on the table as emotion overtook her, "I know the story, you stood up for me! You kept me from making a fool out of myself! I..I can't believe would do something like that for me! I knew you were a good person! I just knew it!"

Eve just closed her eyes and shook her head. 'You have got to be kidding me' She thought to herself as the three other losers of Shermer High settled down at the table around her.
112323331123112232.title: The Lonesome Life of Evelyn Kazinski

1123233311231122321.content:
Another month passed by in the lonesome life of Evelyn Kazinski, the damp gloominess of November giving way to the biting cold of December. Snow fell in droves from an omnipresent wall of endless gray clouds dominating the Shermer skyline, transforming the town below into a living Norman Rockwell painting, a winter wonderland which the kids loved and the adults lamented.

Before Eve knew it, the ten day Christmas break had finally arrived, marking the end of 2018. Despite everything, being turned into a teenage girl and gaining this entirely new, unwanted life, the weirdest thing to the transformed ex-janitor had always been the inexplicable six month jump in time. What was that all about?

But she had no time to ponder the mysteries of the gemstone that had brought her here. Right now, she had more matters to pay attention to. Like her grades.

Eve had once been a straight A student with a sterling GPA. She had aced all of the honors classes Shermer High had, and until recently, had been on the road to attending her pick of whatever Ivy League school she wanted.

Now, thanks to Eugene, all of that had been unceremoniously taken away from her. After it was made clear during a particularly embarrassing Biology lab that she no longer understood the material, the former top student had been bumped back to taking remedial classes earlier in the morning. At home, Eve had even heard her new parents whispering to one another about her seeing a private tutor.

Karen and Howard Kazinski didn't know what to make of their daughter's changes in well... everything. Prior to that one night last October, which Karen refused to even acknowledge, Eve had been their perfect little angel. Now she was starting fights, she perpetually looked like a mess, and she had become a social pariah, consistently coming home straight after school and locking herself in her bedroom. It was like she had become a different person!

Instead of Eve's usually chipper, bubbly personality, she was now consistently sullen and depressed.

Instead of her witty banter and garrulous way of speaking, she now only gave monotone one or two word responses, saying only as much as she needed to before abruptly ending the conversation.

Instead of the warm, caring extrovert that Eve was known for being, she now turned inward, seemingly wanting to be closed off from the world.

She had even put on a couple of pounds, although this only had a negligible effect on Eve's fitness, merely taking her from being "absolutely perfect" to "perfectly healthy for a girl her age".

The married couple of twenty years asked themselves in hushed, guilty tones if they had ever truly known their daughter at all. It's not like they had seen Eve very often in the last few years between all of her extracurriculars and her vibrant social life. Karen and Howard were both busy professionals themselves, and the only times the three of them were ever together as a family anymore was at best...maybe having dinner together three times a week? The odd weekend where Howard wasn't out golfing or Karen wasn't busy with her work friends? As they gazed around their immaculate household, both adults realized to their sadness how un-lived in it looked.

Their fears gave way to a paranoid brainstorming session. Was Eve doing drugs? Had she fallen in with a bad crowd? Did she join a cult? Did her boyfriend dump her? Did she even have a boyfriend? Was she eating Tide Pods? Had...had Eve been sexually assaulted or even raped?

Whatever it was that was bothering her, Eve refused to tell them, even after a particularly unnerving integration from her father. She had also declined Karen's persistent pleas for her to see a therapist.

The red haired girl, whose knotty unkempt mane was increasingly being referred to as a rat's nest behind her back, had made it clear that whatever was causing her changes, it was something that she didn't want to talk about. Reluctantly, Karen and Howard had decided to let their worries go. For now.

**

By contrast, Willow Strasserman and Paige Walters had increasingly inserted themselves into Eve's life, becoming the adoring groupies and unwanted companions of their new hero.

While their initial luncheon with Eve had gone poorly, as Eve was rather dismissive and distant towards the two teenage best friends, Willow and Paige didn't seem to take the hint, as they sat with her in the back of the lunch hall the following day. And the day after that. And the day after that. And the day after that.

"I made you this friendship bracelet!" beamed Willow one day, tying a multicolored band of woven thread across Eve's wrist.

"Gee... thanks" said Eve unenthusiastically, not wanting to hurt Willow's feelings by rejecting her gift, but not really desiring her attention either. She had started to tolerate how they followed her around like lost puppies during school hours, but that didn't mean that she would start having pow wows with them either.

"You're welcome!" answered Willow, grinning through a row of braced teeth, holding up her own wrist to show that she had made herself the same bracelet. "Sorry, I know it's kind of corny and all, but I just wanted to make you something. I'm just really glad how you stuck up for me when nobody else would."

"Don't mention it" said Eve as she struggling to finish her homework.

"What's your favorite Grass Starter, Eve?" asked Paige innocently, somehow expecting the former most popular girl in school to know what that was.

"My favorite what now?"

Paige was interrupted from going on a Pokemon related geek out when a fourth person joined the table.

"Oh, hey Matt" said Willow quietly, her body language noticeably tensing up around the greasy haired boy. He sat between her and Eve, dropping his lunch tray right next to Eve's textbook.

"So what are my three girlfriends up to today? Something obscene, I hope!"

"Gross, Matt" moaned Paige.

"Hey, did any of you hear how Gloria Vanapoulous and Tom Ackerton broke up again?"

"Matt!" yelled Willow, pointing towards Eve.

"What?"

"We don't mention Gloria's name around Eve. It upsets her."

"Really?" asked Matt. He turned towards Eve, who had been ignoring the conversation.

"Eve, does it bother you if I bring up Gloria Vanapoulous?"

"Not really" she answered blankly.

"See!" exclaimed Matt. Willow's face became flushed.

"I was just being considerate is all" answered the tall, dorky art lover defensively. "After all the abuse that...that..." Willow stuttered for a moment as her face took on a slight red tinge as anger welled up inside of her. She was silent for a moment as her eyes darted back and forth and her mouth seemed to fuse itself shut for a moment before she inhaled sharply. "That bitch! After what she put Eve through, I just assumed Eve would be upset, alright? I know that I would be."

Matt and Paige shared a look of surprise while Eve continued to just stare blankly at the trio that had attached themselves to her, watching Willow's face turn red with embarassment from her outburst of uncharacteristic profanity and stared down at the assorted Pokemon cards and her half-eaten sandwich.

It was Paige who broke the moment of awkward silence with a forced giggle, "Oh please! We all know that this is really about Tom. You've had a crush on him since Freshman year."

Next to Eve, Matt's gangly body tensed and his face scrunched up in disapproval as he opened his mouth to say something that he probably shouldn't, only to be cut off by Willow perking back up.

"I can't help it Paige! He's so dreamy. I can't stand the way that he puts up with Gloria. I'd be so much better for him!".

"Ugh" moaned Eve as she buried herself in her work.

**
1123233311231122321.title: (Just Like) Starting Over

11232333112311223211.content:
The day before Christmas break, Secret Santa gifts were exchanged among the student populace. In the original Eve's life, she had requested for her gift to be a donation to the local food bank or to a charity designed for Syrian refugees, which meant that the former Eugene was the only student at Shermer High to go home empty handed. He didn't really mind this, however, as he had never had very much to begin with, and had grown past the desire to acquire more and more stuff.

However, he was still someone's Secret Santa, and he felt an obligation to have a present ready for his charge. Just his luck, it ended up being Willow Strasserman.

Since Eugene had never had anyone in his life to buy presents for, he was crap at it.

"What do I get for a lonely, nerdy sixteen year old girl?" he asked himself the Sunday before vacation started as he wandered throughout the local mall. He wondered if Willow would enjoy receiving a new book, or maybe some clothes, or one of those Funko Pop things, or possibly even a new sled?

As Eve pondered what to do, she inadvertently found her answer.

She walked inside the local Game Stop, and tapped on his shoulder.

Tom Ackerton turned around from the shelf of games he was browsing through and saw Evelyn Kazinski wrapped up in her signature ruffled winter coat and pink hat. He had been one of the few popular kids at Shermer High to not shin her, knowing intimately well how humiliating it was to be shunned and suspecting that there was more to the story than Gloria or Joanna Ingerman had let on.

"Oh, hey Eve. How are you?"

"I'm fine, thanks for asking. Listen, um...I know this is going to sound really weird, but I'm Willow Strasserman's Secret Santa, and I have a BIG favor to ask you."

Tom's baby blue eyes widened, slightly surprised.

"I'm listening."

**

During lunchtime, Eve and the three biggest losers of the school once again spent the hour together in the back of the cafeteria, Paige and Willow playing Magic: The Gathering together while gossiping about the latest season of Daredevil, which Willow had just gotten done catching up with. Matt sat on the opposite side of Eve, doing little more than staring at the noticable lumps that pushed up through her sweater, periodically shifting his creepy gaze towards Willow in between bites of his lunch.

As Willow and Paige chatted amongst themselves, someone entered from the rarely used double doors near the back of the cafeteria and began to approach their table. A shadow loomed over the quartet of losers, whose heads snapped towards the source of the occlusion.

"It's Willow, isn't it?" asked the shadow in a cheerful voice.

The stick thin, curly haired geek girl's face lit up as she saw her crush Tom staring down at her, her heart beginning to pound in excitement. She let loose a quiet squeak of surprise and felt her face start to turn red as she tried her best not to have a total high speed come apart in front of the high school sports star.

"Is this seat taken?".asked the golden haired athlete with a boyish grin on his face as he sat down next to her.

"Um...sure" Willow stuttered as her eyes bored into the hunky teenager, not knowing what to say. On the other side of the table, Matt's look of surprise turned into a angry glare as Tom pulled a empty chair from a nearby empty table and plopped it in the space between Willow and Paige, taking care not to disrupt the small mess of Magic cards splayed out between them.

"Eve here tells me that you wanted to get to know me a little bit better, so here I am! She was your Secret Santa, and I'm your present. I'm going to spend the whole day hanging out with you, doing whatever it is you want to do! That is, if you're comfortable with this." Tom said, giving Willow a huge grin of perfect white teeth that backed up eyes that looked convincingly sincere.

Willow stared slackjawed at Tom, then at Paige, whose face was scrunched in confused surprise, then at Matt who was glaring daggers at Tom, and then at Eve, who was smiling for the first time in months.
11232333112311223211.title: (Just Like) Starting Over, Pt 2

112323331123112232112.content:
"I...I'd really, really like that!" Willow tried not to scream out in excitement. She was, internally, about to explode from being this close to Tom Ackerton, the star athlete of Shermer High. And he was talking to her! And smiling! OMG!

And Eve was smiling as well! Willow almost couldn't remember the last time she'd seen the grumpy-gus that Eve had become smile, and it had most certainly been before she'd taken the fall and kept Willow from making a fool out of herself back in October. It was is all the celestial forces in the unvierse were converging on the two of them and to be honest, Willow was finding it a little hard to breathe from all the excitement. But the skinny sophmore forced herself to take a deep breath and focus on the amazing thing happening in front of her as Eve spoke.

"Merry Christmas, Willow" Eve's voice was different to Willow, like it had sounded the school day before the fateful cheer practice. It was full of energy and genuine happiness, the sheer wonderous magic cracking the shell around her heart open and making her feel again. Or at least, that's how Willow chose to take it.

In reality, or what amounted to it when an artifact that could bend existence to it's will was floating around out there somewhere, Eugene, Eve, WAS happy. Maybe not on the scale that Willow believed she was, but the janitor turned cheerleader turned loser definitely felt better in this moment than she had for months. In fact, she instantly compared it to when Gabriella had first texted him, how sweet it had all sounded...But then that turned out to be fake. It had been wiped from existence along with his old life, but the pain still felt real to Eugene.

The smile on her face drooped a bit, her unpainted lips sliding closed to hide her perfect teeth once more.

"So, what do you want to do first? Als, you gonna eat that, bro?" Tom said good naturedly, pointing to the red apple sitting on Matt's tray. The greasy haired boy just continued to glare at Tom, his face growing more and more red as his hands began to ball up into fists.

'THIS ISN'T FAIR' Matt's mind howled and screamed in jealously and hate, 'WILLOW IS MINE! I SAW HER FIRST! YOU'RE JUST SOME SECOND FUCKING STRINGER FROM NOWHERE!' The fire in Matt's mind was making him so angry he couldn't think. If he'd only had that...that THING that he dreamed about, the thing that made him the star and made Willow realize she was made for him, destined to be with him, he could make this fucking jock pay...

Matt began to rise from his seat but an unexpected hand tugged at his pant leg. His head snapped towards the source and saw a flabby arm gripping one of his cargo pockets. He followed the had to an equally chubby arm, which was connected to the equally chubby body of Paige, whose face had turned from confusion to concern as she stared right at Matt.

'Woah. She's never done that before...Man, her eyes are pretty even if she looks like a pig' Matt's brain was distracted enough for the mental fire suppressants to kick on, and Matt found imself lowering himself back to the seat of the chair before he grabbed the apple and tossed it towards Tom with as much attitude as he could manage.

"No...'bro'. Take it. I'm not very hungry anymore anyway" Matt did nothing to hide the hate in his voice as Tom effortless caught the fruit with his fast reflexes.

"Thanks dude!" Was all Tom said in reply as he turned his attention back towards Willow. "So, you wanna finish lunch? You want seconds? I'll buy!" Tom's voice was eager, almost...urgent. Paige didn't like it.

It made no sense to the girl that often served as the 'Anchor of Reason' in her circle of friends. Or, well, with Willow. Matt was just sort of there, the flotsam of the school body clinging to the two of them simply because he had nowhere else to drift off to. She was relieved, at least, that Matt took her quiet suggestion to not have one of his freakouts, though. Even if Tom selling himself as a man-whore for the rest of the day seemed earnest enough...Why would he stick his neck out for a loser like Willow? Sure, the rumors that his on again off again girlfriend Gloria Vanapolous were awful but so many of them were just not true...Or were they? Paige had long since given up on trying to glean some kernal of truth from Gloria's bullshit.

'But still...' Was all her mind said as she watched the two interact, 'This doesn't feel right'

"Um, well, We've all got study hall next period. You can, um, help me study?" Willow said, blushing at the other kind of studying she wanted to do with Tom.

"That, my dear, sounds like a plan!" Tom smiled again before glancing at his phone, "Hey, lunch is about over, you want to beat the rush and get what you need from your locker first?"

Willow's knees can within millimeters from knocking together. This was it! They go to her locker and open it and they'd hide behind it while they shared their first kiss! It was just all so perfect!

"YES!" Was all Willow could say as she shot out of her chair like a lightning bolt, grabbing Tom's hand before pulling him away towards the double doors the group had been using. But Willow felt a tug on her hand and she wheeled around directly into Tom's muscled chest. She gave Tom a puzzled look that melted away under the toothy smile he was giving her.

"Let's go out this way! It's quicker. If we go the other way we have to walk all the way around the cafeteria to get to your lockers!" Was all Tom needed to say. Willow smiled, giglled, and nodded, allowing the hunky popular boy to lead her towards her wildest dreams. He even stopped near the double doors, released her tiny hand and gave a little bow as he said "Ladies first!"

'OMG, HE'SO PERFECT!!!!' Willow's mind simply screamed as she gave him a braced filled smile and walked through the slightly askew door...

..Which was was when Paige realized that Gloria and the other popular kids were no where to be seen in the cafeteria.

"WILLOW! STOP!" Paige screamed bolting up from the table, but it was too late as Willow pushed open the door and was suddenly doused, head to toe, in stinking garbage as the bucket that had been set on the lip of the door tumbled over as the door was opened.

Filthy water, trash, leftovers and other refuse poured down in a torrent upon the skinny girl that was almost too innocent and naieve for high school. All she heard was Paige saying something and then the WOOSH of water as it cascaded down upon her, soaking her from head to toe as she screamed in surprise and alarm. And then, as the water spread out around her and dripped furiously off of her previously frizzy hair, Willow heard it: The cruel laughter of several dozen voices from the hallway she had been coerced into using. Willow wiped wiped her eyes clean as the stench of the garbage began to overwhelm her as she saw the group of horrible, horrible kids led by Gloria Vanapolous pointing at her and laughing as they recorded the entire thing on their cellphones. And even to the right of her, she heard laughing. Confused she turned to look and saw the final straw that broke her back.

It was Tom, pointing and laughing at her as well.

"HEY EVE! THIS WAS GREAT! MAYBE YOU'RE STILL COOL AFTER ALL!" Gloria's shrill cry rang past Willow as the skinny girl burst into tears. She cast a large, wet look at the stunned face of Eve Kazinski before she took off running, slipping and falling twice as the stinking wetness from the prank made it impossible for her lanky form to gain traction on the floor tile as she tried to escape the horrible situation. The young Strasserman was full on bawling by the time she disappeared around the corner, heading deeper into the school to find refuge somewhere, anywhere, away from everyone. She wiped her face, but only caused more stinking garbage water to drip out of the friendship bracelet she had made for herself and Eve.

The betrayal hit her just as much as the prank ever did. She had been so wrong! Eve wasn't her friend!

Willow tore the bracelet from her damp wrist and let it fall to the floor as she ran for the only place she could think of: The janitor's closet.

Meanwhile in the cafeteria, the popular kids had eventually tired of their prank and had dispersed as the bell had begun ringing. Tom had vanished as well, but not before clapping a hand on Eve's shoulder and wiping the mirthful tears from his eyes. Paige and Matt simply stared at Eve in shock and horror (though Matt was also just relieved that it wasn't him for once).

"That...That was the most horrible thing I've ever seen anyone do, Eve" Was all Paige said before she stood from the table and rushed out the door to find her best friend. Matt simply faded away, getting up and heading towards his next class with a backwards glance at Eve.

And Eve simply sat there, staring at the horrible, horrible cruelness she had indirectly visited upon the only person that hadn't made her feel like shit for the past two months. Eventually the cafeteria staff had called Principal Stevens once the troubled redhead had failed to leave for class, and he and Mr. Irons, the school security officer, had arrived to collect her.

Once again, Eve found herself in the office of the man that had, once, paid her to clean the building, receiving another lashing for 'bullying' and 'harassment'. Her new parents had been called and there was hell to pay, especially because they couldn't find poor Willow anywhere.

But Eve? Eve felt the last part of her that seemed to care about the world around her shrivel and die. The world fell into a distant, muted, slow motion state as her mind just...shut down. It was all her fault. She should have never have picked up that goddamn Stone. She just should have stayed away instead of trying to be a 'good friend'.

Eve hated herself entirely.

Option 1: Eve is suspended indefinitely pending the result of a full investigation.

Option 2: Willow, crying alone in the janitor's closet, finds a peculiar looking gemstone...
112323331123112232112.title: Ashes, Lies, and the Decimation of Willow

1123233311232.content:
"I JUST WISH....I...."

Eugene's flustered, humiliated state of mind couldn't find the words to properly convey what he was feeling right now, so he gave up even trying. His anger gave way to despondency, which in turn gave way to despair. The gemstone's glow faded into nonexistence. Eugene sunk his pretty little head into his hands and sobbed.

He had never asked for this! Why, oh why couldn't things just go his way for once!? Why had he been cursed with such bad luck?! Whether he was a grown man or a teenage girl, nothing ever seemed to go right for him. No matter what iteration his life turned out to be, he seemed perpetually destined to live out his days as a complete failure. A fuck up. He was a born loser, and right now, he just wanted to go crawl under a big rock and die.

Emily watched ruefully as her best friend broke down and ugly cried into into her hands. For the first time in her life, Emily felt pity for her.

Her jealousy of Eve came from the latter's seemingly immaculate perfection. She was the superstar of Shermer High, the one who every girl wanted to be and every boy wanted to be with. She was so effortlessly good at everything, so beautiful, so graceful, so composed, and level headed, and kind, and beloved by everyone that she almost didn't seem real sometimes. She was a literal Mary Sue.

Emily genuinely didn't know what Eve was going through right now. If she was having some kind of nervous breakdown, Eve had never told her about it previously or even hinted at it in their many times alone with each other doing homework or watching bad horror movies. It was incredibly disconcerting and yet, in a horrible way, refreshing, knowing that there was a chink in her armor that Emily hadn't known about.

The brunette sidekick didn't approach Eve to hug her, as her instincts told her to do. Instead she stood guard, waiting for Eve to come to on her own terms.

As Eugene continued to sob, fresh tears falling freely to the ground, Eve's makeup a complete mess, her stage outfit soaked, Ms. Barry finally found her way backstage, storming onto the heart-rending scene.

"OK, WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON HERE!?" demanded the diminutive drama teacher. Emily looked up and frowned.

"Nothing's going on, Ms. Barry. We're just having a little personal issue here. We'll be ready to leave in just a few minutes" answered the eighteen year old, knowing that it was a crappy little lie that would never work.

"Uh, whatever is going on between you two, the entire damn theater heard it!" snapped the adult teacher. "Shit, the entire school probably would have heard it if it were still in session!"

Jeannette turned to Eve sitting quietly in her stool, the red haired girl's crying spell down to a case of the sniffles, and she gave her a dirty look.

"Eve, what's wrong?" she demanded with a hard voice. "What's going on with you? Why were you such a mess out there today?"

Eugene didn't answer her. Even if he had wanted to, his throat was sore and raw from all of the screaming with Emily.

"Answer me! What the hell was that thing you called acting back there!? Just yesterday, you were pitch perfect, you were a star, and today, you're acting like some drunken off key klutz who got rejected during the American Idol auditions."

"Ms. Barry, stop."

"Emily, don't interject. You're in hot water too!"

Eugene looked up at the furious teacher and glared. He knew Jeanette. This was her third year teaching English and Drama at Shermer High. She didn't have tenure yet, and the possibility of getting fired was always hanging over her like the Sword of Damocles. As a man, Eugene mostly avoided Ms. Barry, because he knew how self absorbed and high strung she could be. Most struggling actors were.

"Ms. Barry, please, I think Eve is just..."

"IS IT THIS? IS THIS WHAT YOU TWO ARE FIGHTING OVER?!" Ms. Barry asked as she snatched the green gemstone right out of Eve's hand.

Jeanette briefly became transfixed by the Ahn'Ger Stone as she watched the energies inside of it swirl around in beautiful patterns, like snowflakes on a winter's day. A deep part of her brain was reminded of the primordial soup which had given birth to life on this planet, and in some weirder, metaphysical way, she felt as if the stone itself represented change, evolution, ambition, and unceasing progress.

"It's beautiful" she whispered to herself, before turning back to Eve.

"Huh? Is this what you were fighting over?"

"...No" answered Eugene, as quiet as a church mouse. Her voice indeed, sounded rather hoarse at the moment.

"Why were you telling at Emily? Why were you so bad during rehearsal today?"

Emily huffed behind both of them.

"Let me explain!"

"I want to hear it from Eve. You're not her lawyer."

"Eve is...I don't know! I think she's having a nervous breakdown or something. She wasn't like this earlier today!"

"Again, Emily, you're not her lawyer. Speak up, Eve! If you're in a bad mental place, you're going to have to tell me now, because the play goes live in two days, and your understudy needs to be informed."

Eve remained silent. Inside, Eugene was totally spent. He was being held hostage in this auditorium by these two people, one of whom he only barely knew from his day job, and one he didn't knew at all. If he had the stone, he would have made another wish, but Ms. Barry was holding it at the moment.

"Answer me, Eve!" screeched Ms. Barry. "Why are you acting so weird? Why didn't you perform well today?"

Eve looked at the woman with pleading eyes to just leave her be, but the teacher either didn't take the hint, or didn't want to.

"The silent treatment? Seriously?"

The emerald gemstone began to glow once more in Jeanette's hand. She had completely lost her patience with the little drama queen.

With a raised voice, she made a wish...

Option 1: "I WISH YOU'D GIVE ME AN HONEST ANSWER!"

The gemstone grants Jeanette's wish. Eugene is now forced to tell the truth and to never lie. He admits to who he really is, a lonely middle aged janitor who was changed against his will into a teenage girl, causing Ms. Barry and Emily to believe that Eve has lost her mind.

Option 2: "I JUST WISH YOU'D BECOME A BETTER SINGER AND DANCER SO I DON'T GET FIRED!"

The gemstone grants Jeanette's wish. Eugene now knows all of the choreography and sings like an angel. Unfortunately, he can't stop singing and dancing. In his day to day life, Eve now behaves like she's in a musical.

Option 3: Ms. Barry wishes for something else.

Tara Ingerman couldn't believe what she was hearing, as she sat in the WAY too uncomfortable chair the school had provided for her. The twenty-eight year old wife and stepmother felt her flawless skin crawl beneath her white designer dress and blazer as she dug her nails into the far too expensive designer purse as the school's administrative staff spoke. And the fact that she had to cancel her day trip into Chicago and make time to come here to this dingy school and listen to people nearly twice her age lecture her on how to be a parent? It was completely unacceptable!

"It's come to our attention that your son may be involved in a bully situation, Mrs. Ingerman"

"We believe he might be threatening students Mrs. Ingerman"

"Would you know anything about this Mrs. Ingerman?"

A pile of questions and false accusations were piled onto Tara faster than she could keep up, and all the while she could just feel the judgement from the school staff, all of which were clearly just jealous of her looks, her wealth, and that her stepson, Alexander, was so physically gifted that he was allowed a free pass so long as he stayed on the basketball team, which he hated. They wouldn't let him play football though, because of the Incident. But she had heard the rumors before and until now, had chosen to ignore them. Of course, that had been in the original reality. Now that Jonathan was an attractive girl and had been altered both inside and out to being one of the nicest, most popular girls in school and Bill Strasserman's girlfriend, things had shifted just enough. Instead of Jonathan, now the school board was concerned about the complaints coming in about Tara's OTHER stepchild, the younger child of Ragnar Ingerman from his previous marriage, Alexander.

Or as the student body of Shermer High knew him as, 'Alex the Terrible'. He was only a sophmore, and, until around nine hours ago, hadn't existed, but in the twisting of reality the Ahn'Ger Stone had willed the boy to life, now little more than a product of a loveless marriage and a powerful businessman wanting a proper male heir. The boy, Alex, wasn't so much an organized bully as he was simply a entitled, spoiled terror who, from time to time, paid Rob Bolstrum and his pack of thugs to terrorize some unfortunate student or faculty member until he got his way.

Perhaps he was created as a contingency plan by the Ahn'Ger Stone, or perhaps it was always just the vague concept of 'fate' that would lead to the creation of a hate-filled bully with the last name of 'Ingerman', but whatever the reason, he existed now, and unlike his previous incarnation as Jonathan, Alexander exhibited far less caution, which is what resulted in Shermer High finally being forced to take action against the boy and his connections to Bolstrum and his bullies. Which was why Tara was currently spending her afternoon listening to the accusations leveled against her stepson (even if she secretly despised the boy for the same attitude, she had worked too hard to get to where she was and she wasn't about to let some underpaid school marms tarnish her achievement).

And it was because of this insecurity, the thought that if she didn't defend her new family's name, that she might end up back where she began. Proving the rumors about her right. The rumors that the disapproving school board in front of her clearly thought were true. Tara knew what they were thinking. It was what everyone that was jealous of her thought.

'Look at the dumb bimbo trophy wife'

'She'd be sliding on a pole if her sugar daddy wasn't so rich'

'She probably sleeps with her stepson, they're basically the same age'

'I bet she slept her way to her high school graduation, she's never been to college'

'No wonder the boy is disturbed if he has to put up with THAT every day'

'I really feel sorry for the sister. Such a pretty girl and so nice!'

Even as the gathered school staff in front of her droned on about the number of offenses that Alexander had supposedly committed while on school property, Tara felt the rage boiling up inside her, over the accusations, over everything, and especially because she was here, in the dingy school her husband had graduated from decades ago, instead of living it up in downtown Chicago, personal car full of merchandise and just sitting down to eat a expensive meal at one of the city's best restaurants. The place where she deserved to be! Enough was enough!

"YOU'RE LUCKY MY HUSBAND ISN'T HERE OR HE'D SUE YOU ALL FOR LIBEL AND SLANDER!" Tara screamed at the top of her voice, rising from her chair and pointing a long, manicured finger at the assembled members of Shermer High's school board and several teachers.

"Mrs. Ingerman, please-" The balding, bespectacled and slightly overweight figure of school superintendent Andrew Chandler began, but was silenced by a hateful glare from the much younger woman's icy blue eyes and a feminine snarl as she shouldered her ludicrously expensive purse.

"I'll MAKE SURE HE HEARS ABOUT THIS! YOU'LL ALL BE FIRED AND THIS SHITTY SCHOOL WILL BE CLOSED DOWN!" Tara snarled as she turned and marched towards the door, her styled mane of long, blonde hair bouncing with every step as her designer heels clicked against the hard tile of the conference room as she made her way towards the door, gripping the cold handle in a fist of slightly too long red fingernails as she pulled it open and stomped with as much fury as her body could muster out into the school's interior. She had only made it a short distance away when she heard the door open behind her, and the voice of Superintendent Chandler call out to her.

"Mrs. Ingerman, PLEASE! We don't want to offend one of our largest donors but there's a record AND a substantial number of students who have come forward about your son's actions! That's why we called you here so we could discuss it privately! If it gets out to the media, we'll be forced to take action! Please, just calm down and I'm sure we can-"

"You're such a spineless old turd!" Tara sneered down the hallway at him as several other members of the staff poked their heads out the door behind the superintendent, "YOU ALL ARE! YOU'RE JUST AFTER OUR MONEY! I BET-" Tara paused in the middle of her tirade as the overhead lights caused a dull glare from something on the floor to catch her eye. It looked like glass, maybe part of a broken bottle. Tara grinned sinisterly (or as best as she could, with her flawless face) and bent over to pick up the item, giving the staff in front of her more than a clear view of her expansive cleavage as she picked the object up within her red taloned fingers.

"Why, look at this!" Tara said, not really looking at the object herself, knowing only it was cold and hard against her flesh as she glared back at the gathered faculty, "A piece of broken glass? Why, that seems like a serious safety hazard to me! What if a child had gotten a hold of this? Or fell on it? Maybe I should do my part as a concerned parent and report the absolutely FILTHY conditions this school is in to the news! Maybe then you'd see that there are much larger concerns than a bunch of jealous little snowflakes wanting to get my stepson in trouble!"

In her hand, the Stone began to glow as Tara lowered it with a evil smirk, watching the blood drain out of the face of Superintendent Chandler and several other members of the staff that actually understood the threat, while the others stared at her with open contempt. No one out of the small crowd noticed the glow of the Stone, and with a harsh, cruel laugh, Tara Ingerman unknowingly unleashed the artifact's power.

"I wish..."

Superintendent Chandler and the collected Shermer High school board went rigid for a moment as their eyes became greenish gold and cloudy. Tara, herself, was unaffected as the bright explosion of light from her left hand caused her to look towards it before the brightness of the flash forced her eyes shut on instinct.

'Maybe they all had a stroke at the same time?' Tara thought for a moment, but as soon as she finished, the clouds left the eyes of the administrative staff and they returned to a more relaxed, natural looking pose. Whereas before most of them had been staring at her with reproachful looks, judgemental stares, or outright disgust, now each staff member seemed more more open and friendly looking. Superintendent Chandler straightened his tie and took a step forward.

"Mrs. Ingerman, you're absolutely right" The balding man said, the small double chin waggling a bit as he spoke, "These accusations against your stepson are completely out of line, and I can see now that we were taking the wrong approach to dealing with this. Alexander is a fine young man with plenty that the other students would be jealous of, and we, as a whole, will be dealing with punishing the students that brought these complaints to our attention. Rest assured we won't rest until we've made sure that each student receives a punishment equal to the complaint against your son"

She took a breath and lowered herself out of her aggressive heeled stance, lowering her arms. She cast a glance at her left hand, opening the fist she had made to look at what she had originally assumed had been a shard of glass, but was actually a gorgeous emerald teardrop, with a smaller golden teardrop in it's center. It was gorgeous! Tara couldn't believe she had mistaken it for a shard of glass before! The moment she reached the luxury porsche she ripped open the door and crawled into the driver's seat, slamming the door behind her and locking it as to not be rudely interrupted if...whatever had just happened to the school board wore off and they came looking for her. Satisfied with her security precautions, Tara opened her hand once more and began to examine the mysterious rock that had apparently just changed the minds of EVERY member of Shermer High's staff.

It truly was gorgeous, and Tara was a girl that knew her gemstones, given she had tons of them at home, gifted to her by her dear husband Ragnar 'Reggie' Ingerman. This particular gemstone was the most brilliant green Tara had ever seen, and however they had managed to get the inner golden stone in, well, the jeweler must have been an absolute master at his craft as the trophy wife couldn't feel any seams in the material whatsoever.

"Some poor girl is going to be very sad when she realizes she just left this for a random stranger to find" Tara said with a cruel laugh, "If this really mad those old fuckers listen to me, then imagine what I can do now!"

Clutching the Ahn'Ger Stone tightly, Tara closed her eyes and said "I wish I was queen of the world!" and braced for the light...But nothing came. Confused, Tara looked at the stone once again and made another wish. "I wish I had bigger boobs!" She shouted, though she was actually quite happy with her breasts it was the only thing she could think of. Again, nothing. No flash or anything. The frustration boiled within Tara's abdomen and for a brief moment she could have sworn the golden stone within the emerald had glowed.

"What are you and how do you work?" Tara muttered, studying the Stone further.

112323333322.title: Seeing what it's like. (Options)

1123233333221.content:
When Andrew Chandler transferred from Chicago to Shermer nearly twenty years ago, he had assumed that his job as would become easier. Less hassle. Less paperwork. Less angry parents and less bureaucracy to deal with. More time to go hunting and fishing and catching up on his bowling score.

He thought he had it made here. Shermer was a nice picturesque small town, like something you'd find on a postcard. Most of the families here with school age children were well off, well educated, and for the most part were pleasant enough. The economy in Shermer was good, especially for a Rust Belt state like Illinois. Some poverty existed, but it wasn't anywhere near as bad as the big city. Violence for the most part wasn't an issue. Andy didn't have to worry about any drive bys here as he sat in his office or getting mugged on the way to the parking lot. Kids here had problems, but not the life and death kind, which made his job easier.

Still, things weren't all Norman Rockwell.

Take this Alexander Ingerman kid, and he used the term "kid" very literally, as Alexander was somewhat on the small size for his age.

Alexander was a sadistic bully and a thug through and through. In Andy's opinion, it wasn't long before "Alex the Terrible" saw the inside of a jail cell. Ever since Alexander's father had moved back to his childhood home from Chicago seven years ago, reports of bullying had gone up dramatically. So had reports of sexual harassment and misconduct, and what do you know? They were all tied to Ingerman. There were also rumors that all the bullies and delinquents in the Shermer School District were now acting almost like an organized crime racket, systematically robbing their fellow students of their money and belongings, all of them acting under the auspices of a blonde haired kingpin.

Alexander's father Ragnar had used his considerable money and influence to sweep these little transgressions underneath the rug, but now as Jonathan was getting older, these incidents were increasing in frequency and becoming impossible to ignore. Andrew had half a mind to expel Big Jon, but there was never enough support from the district or the school itself. He suspected that Karl Stahl, the school principal, was himself scared of the influence Alexander had over the bullies and his father.

Now, as Alexander's insufferable stepmother was crying about an errant piece of glass, he heard her make a foolish wish, something along the lines of "I wish YOU had to deal with this!", and then everything went green.

**

Andrew felt a bizarre, stomach churning sense of whiplash as he quickly realized that his perspective had suddenly shifted.

A moment ago, before that flash of mysterious green light, he had been facing the furious scowl of Tara Ingerman as she stormed out towards the parking lot.

Now he was facing towards the principal's office at a handsome looking blonde man in a suit, a look of desperation on his face.

"Mrs Ingerman" said the blonde man with some concern, "I wish that you would reconsider your current course of action. Your son may be about to face some serious legal consequences if we don't deal with this now."

Andrew was confused. Who was this man? Where did he come from? Why was he speaking with Tara Ingerman?

He was about to ask the man "Who are you?", but he could only get the words "Who" and "Are" out of his mouth before he realized something was extremely wrong. That wasn't his voice. A look of panic crossed his face.

"MRS INGERMAN, PLEASE!" pleaded the blonde haired man. "PLEASE COME BACK TO THE OFFICE AND LETS DISCUSS THIS LIKE ADULTS."

Andrew instinctively took a couple of steps forward when he heard the telltale click clacking of heels. He glared down...and his eyes went wide.

He was...he was wearing black high heels. And a white dress. The very same expensive designer dress Tara Ingerman had been wearing just a second ago. His head snapped back up, causing a curtain of shiny brown hair to follow in its wake. And his hands! They were soft, small, and dainty.

"What the hell is..."

That voice again. His voice. Soft, bubbly, almost ditzy sounding. He was starting to get dizzy.

Andrew fainted.

Option 1: Tara's wish caused the Ahn'Ger Stone to alter reality yet again, this time swapping Tara's and Andrew's lives around. Andrew is now Mrs. Andrea Ingerman, the trophy wife of Ragnar and beleaguered stepmother to Alexander and Joanna. Tara is now Terrence Sheppard, the superintendent of the Shermer School District trying to convince Andrea to consider moving Jonathan to another district.

Option 2: Andrew wakes up in one of the school offices and sees...Tara Ingerman sitting next to him!?

Option 3: Something Else
1123233333221.title: Superintendent Andrew Chandler

11232333332212.content:
The pain in his head as he opened his eyes was the first thing Andrew felt, slamming his eyelids shut once more to blot out the glare of the overhead flourescents lights. But then after a few moments he felt the cold leather of the couch that was in the school's staff administration office. And then he felt several something elses. Like the pressure on his chest, the slight tug on the back of his head, the way the couch felt different around his rear. And then as he groaned, felt something waxy on his mouth as he realized the groan was light and definitely feminine. Andrew pulled himself upwards and felt what seemed to be like the entire world shifting as the pressure on his chest shifted forward and a mane of long brown hiar covered his vision as he looked downward into a canyon of cleavage that was held in place by a white dress.

"Oh no!" The former superintendent said as panic crept back into his brain. But any further thoughts were whisked away as he heard someone move next to him, and he snapped towards the sound causing his newly acquired hair to flash in front of his vision as something metallic tapped softly against both sides of his neck.

"OMG sis! I thought you were never going to wake up! Like I can't believe you fainted!" Said Tara Ingerman, or at least a woman that looked mostly like her. She was still blonde, but her breasts were at least twice the size Andrew remembered them being before he was given his own pair, and her clothing was definitely less expensive looking and clearly designed for a more sexualized look.. Tara's hair was much lighter that it had been and much, much longer and her skin was almost bronze as numerous golden bangles hung off her wrist and forearms. "It's a good thing I was waiting in the car!"

"Uh" Was all Andrew could say as he struggled to process what had happened. What HAD happened? One minute he was trying to handle the deranged woman in front of him, and the next minute he WAS the deranged woman! Or at least, he thought he had become her until he had passed out. He looked around the small office and was glad the strange blonde man that had apparently taken his job wasn't there, or any of the other school staff. He wasn't sure if he was ready for them to see him as he was now. He looked back to the strangely different Tara who began straightening his hair with a few swipes of her hands.

"You should totally sue this dumb school for every penny. That would make them regret stressing you out so much! I'll call Reggie and let him know what happened!" Tara continued on, pulling out her phone and tapping on the screen with hot pink nails that were so long that they seemed painful.

Andrew cast a look at his own nails on his now very female hands and were thankful they seemed much less extravagant, even though they still looked like glossy light pink claws to him. And then he saw the diamond encrusted wedding band on his ring finger and his stomach dropped out from under him.

"R-reggie?" He asked, the sound of his own voice still so alien to him.

Tara fixed Andrew with a strange look. "Uh, you know, your husband? Reggie? As in Mr and Mrs. Ragnar Ingerman? OMG Andrea did you hit your head so hard that it gave you amnesia!?"

"MY HUSBAND!?"

"Yeah, you know, you met him when the two of us went to that REALLY nice bar with the rest of the sorority after we graduated? You and him hooked up and then like a month later you were getting married? Dad and mom were pissed and didn't come to the wedding?"

"W-wedding?" Andrew whimpered. The only wedding the previously bald, middle-age school administrator recalled being part of was his own, to his beloved Charlotte. 'Oh god, how am I gonna explain this to Charlotte?' Andrew said to himself as he stared numbly at the ring on his finger that seemed like it was more diamond than gold. Baside him, Tara's face was clearly twisted in concern.

"Yeah, don't you remember? Like, Reggie paid for everything! You got married in that huge cathedral, you had a dress that was just to die for, you guys disappeared for like a month on your honeymoon? You sent me all kinds of pictures from Europe!" Tara tapped frantically at her phone and shoved it in Andrew's face. He squinted automatically, not feeling or seeing his glasses on his nose, but suddenly realized the pictures were as clear as day. Not that he was pleased to see them. Tara scrolled through hundreds of images, picking out ones that showed Andrew with the tall, Nordic Adonis that was Ragnar Ingerman. And all the pictures were selfies of his current body (which Andrew had to admit, was stunning and had more than a passing resemblance to Tara, at least in her previous form. Was he now her twin?) nestled against Ragnar in some romantic pose or another in front of famous European landmarks. Andrew noticed that quite a few of them seemed to be in the famous Red Square in Moscow, his body hanging off Ragnar's business suit like it was little more than an overdressed accessory.

"Oh god" Was all Andrew could say. Was that what he was now? Just a pretty little piece of arm candy to a much older man?

Tara exhaled dramatically, her clearly no longer fully natural chest heaving in relief against the tight confines of the dress. "Oh thank god you remember!" She said, mistaking Andrew's words. "You know I'm still super jealous, I would have gone after him first if you hadn't called dibs. But I wouldn't have met Harry then!" Tara began swiping excitedly through her phone, away from pictures of Andrew and Ragnar and onto pictures of herself and a slightly portly man that Andrew could have sworn owned several car dealerships in the upper Illinois region, if he was remembering the commercials right. Was she married to him now? Or dating? Either way, right now it wasn't that pressing of a question.

'Whatever changed me clearly changed her as well. If I'm...married...to Ragnar Ingerman, that must make me Andrea Ingerman!' Andrew said to himself, leaning back against the familiar leather couch that he had used many times, but now felt as strange and alien as his new body did. BECAUSE of his new body.

"So...now that you seem better, what do you want to do, sis?" Tara asked, grabbing her purse and tossing her phone into it. From the darkness inside the massive storage container, the Ahn'Ger Stone softly glowed beneath a pile of makeup.

Option 1: Andrew, or rather Andrea, insists on asking more questions about his new life, much to Tara's worry. After losing the sibling argument, Andrea finds herself being carted off to the hospital for a head injury when Ragnar, Alexander and Joanna arrive.

Option 2: Andrew, or rather Andrea, plays along for now and eventually goes to his new home, the sprawling Ingerman estate outside of town. There, Andrew discovers that this isn't just a small change, but something that has changed the whole of reality itself.

Option 3: The newly changed Tara re-discovers the Ahn'Ger Stone, wondering what it is, why it was in her purse, and why it looks a little familiar. Seeing it as the possible cause of all this mess, Andrew snatches it away from Tara and tries to make a wish.

After asking several questions about his new life, Andrew is taken to the hospital. Tara believed her sister got a head injury when she fainted, causing partial amnesia. While there, Andrew meets his new husband, Ragnar, or Reggie, as he and his new sister Tara apparently called him, along with his new stepdaughter, Joanna and stepson, Alexander.
