Joanna, being the kind soul she is, seemed very worried about her stepmother. Just as worried as her aunt was. Ragnar, was concerned, but his anger at the school board for supposedly causing this overshadowed that concern. And Alexander didn’t really seem to care. Andrew also got to meet two new people who didn’t exist a few hours ago as Tara's new family rushed to the hospital after a panicked phone call. Apparently, thanks to her wish indirectly giving her a new husband, Tara now has new children, a two year old son and three year old daughter, named Blake and Jasmine respectively. He didn’t know about the stone, or its ability to grant wishes.

On the surface, at least, it seemed like Joanna was a decent stepdaughter while Alexander just threw himself into one of the few chairs in the room and pulled out his phone without even saying hello.

“Thanks Andrea.” Joanna smiled at her. “I’m gonna step out for a moment and call Bill. We had a date planned tonight, but I’m gonna cancel it so we can spend the night together. Be right back!.” Joanna patted her stepmother on the hand and walked outside. It was only then Andrew realized how motherly he acted, placing his hand on Joanna’s.

‘God, how the hell did this happen?’ Andrew wondered.

What happened next?

"Uh, like ow?" Came an annoyed voice, and as Tara blinked the afterimages of the school hallway out of hervision, she could see that she was no longer even AT Shermer High. Instead all she could see was the annoyed looking face of her BFF Andrea Chapman as her hand was pressed against the other woman's not insignificant breasts that seemed held in place (however impossibly) by a small bright blue dress.

"Oh. Uh, sorry...'Drea?" Tara said in confusion. The trophy wife removed her hand from Andrea's boob and looked at it, before turning her gaze towards what else had changed. Instead of the school she was at...a winery? And around her were almost a dozen other women that all looked to be somewhat well off, all seated around a massive table that overlooked the nearby lake. Most of the other women were engaged in their own conversations, some looked angry, some joyful, some sufficiently intoxicated, given that Tara and every single other woman at the table had wine glasses in varying amount of fullness.

Something seemed off about this to Tara. She could have sworn she had just been in the dingy high school that her husband supported, listening to a bunch of blithering school staff chew her out about her stepson's supposed bad behavior...But hadn't she always been right here, with Andrea, Teresa, Lisa, Hannah, Veronica, the whole squad of girls that she'd either been friends with in the sorority or had met at parties with her husband, Ragnar and formed a bond with. Most of them were young like her, but a couple were older, but at the moment she couldn't really remember their names, for some reason. She felt like this wasn't right. She knew EVERYONE in their social group, and this was their weekly Girl's Night, where they rented the entire winery out for their own private party.

"You okay, Tara?" Andrea said as her annoyance turned to concern at the confused, almost scared look on her BFF's face as Tara scanned the table.

"I...Um, maybe? 'Drea...how long have we been here?" Tara asked as she finally turned back to her dark haired sister in arms. She KNEW Andrea, they had grown up together, attended the same college together and had almost competed in men together, though Andrea had gone after a more younger man than Ragnar, in the end. She could feel her voice trembling as conflicting memories of some...other girl than she couldn't picture or name floated around in the part of her brain that was convinced she had just been at the high school. But any hope of answers was brushed off as Andrea's look of concern twisted into a chuckle and an eyeroll.

"Like geez Tara, you have had WAY too much to drink! We've been here for like two hours and you're already shitfaced? What, you on some sort of new pills or something that turn you into a lightweight?" Andrea chuckled, "C'mon, let's call your driver and get you home before you have to go hurl like last time. We're all done bitching about the high school anyway, Monica's already left." Andrea rose up from her chair and gave a little stumble as it was clear she was more than a little drunk herself, to which she just giggled. She held out a hand to Tara, who cautiously took it.

'New...pills? What new pills?' Tara thought to herself as she was pulled upwards by her best friend. She stood for a moment and felt wobbly on her feet as suddenly the world took on a blurry edge. Was she really just drunk? She hadn't felt drunk a couple of seconds ago...Tara blinked it off and reached for her purse, sliding it onto her right shoulder as she allowed Andrea to guide her away from the table with a polite wave that barely any of the other women noticed. She was so lost in her own thoughts that she never heard Andrea call someone on her phone, or realize that the car waiting for her when they reached the entrance of the winery was her own.

"Well, here you go, Tara. Text me when you get home? I know Emile will get you there but I'll feel better knowing my BFF isn't hurling on the side of the road somewhere" Andrea said as she loaded Tara into the backseat of a car that the trophy wife could have sworn she hadn't been driving before.

Tara looked up at her best friend with bleery blue eyes, "You're not coming with me? But..." Tara said, suddenly scared to see what else had changed.

"Girl I have BARELY had anything to drink! Lisa and I were gonna meet up with Monica and Tiffany later anyway, and we're too old for sleepovers!" Andrea said with a grin, "Text me!"

And with that Andrea slammed the door and minced off, her feminine rear rocking the blue dress as she went to rejoin the collected group of women that Tara was uncertain hadn't been there moments before. The sound of a small electric motor made Tara jump however, as the small privacy mirror that separated the back of the car from the front began to roll down, revealing a slightly portly, bearded man.

"Ma'am, shall I take you home now?" Tara's driver, Emile McLeod said, staring at his employer's wife through the rearview mirror with deep green eyes that seemed like they knew more than they should. Tara didn't like it, and turned away from his gaze, her eyes landing on her purse.

Her purse.

Tara suddenly felt an overwhelming urge to dig through it. Maybe if she just got on her phone, the answers would be there...She clicked the white designer leather open and reached in with perfectly manicured nails, digging through the assorted cosmetic items, loose change, and other items in search of her phone.

"Ma'am? Shall we return to the house?" Emile asked again, and something about the way the driver had said it finally tripped Tara's patience from confusion to annoyance, and she snapped her eyes up out of her search right as her fingers brushed against a certain green gemstone which caused it to glow softly.

Option 1: "Yes Emile, take me home!" Tara commands, and finally pulls out her phone, the Ahn'Ger Stone flopping out of the purse unnoticed and falling to the floor of the car. Later, at the Ingerman estate, the Stone is discovered.

Option 2: Tara tells Emile to just drive around town while she pulls out her phone. Scrolling through her photos and social media, she finds out more about this reality that she's not quite sure is right.

Option 3:"I wish you'd just shut up and drive, Emile!" Tara says, her frustration and confusion being enough for the Ahn'Ger Stone. In a flash, the entire car is different, sleeker and more futuristic, along with the landscape outside.

Had Jules been aware that the emerald gemstone he had stolen from the janitor was actually a magical artifact, one that had been slowly charging itself up for a wish while the bully had been silently fuming about his life, he might have chosen his next words differently. He might not have said anything at all, instead dropping the stone on the tile floor of the bathroom and letting the pent up angry energy dissipate before picking it up and inspecting it.

But the bully had been completely unaware, too caught up in his anger at his so called 'friend' Rob Bolstrum and desiring the kind of friendship the kids in the library seemed to share with one another. And so Jules, staring up at the plain ceiling of the school bathroom and completely unaware of the green-gold light streaming out of the cracks in hist closed fist that held the stone, changed his life forever.

"I wish Rob would just be nicer to me!"

The magical power that had been charging within the gemstone was released in a flash of light that, had it not re-written reality in an instant, would have caught the attention of the students in the school library. Instead, they simply continued on with their after-school activities as Jules Harper vanished from the halls of Shermer High, having now never been there at all. And as for Jules, the last thing he remembered before his reality was blasted away, was the feeling of falling, and darkness taking over the brilliant emerald light that was blinding him. And then there was the feeling of soft warmth covering him before consciousness left him entirely as his new reality settled in place around him.

*BZZ BZZ BZZ BZZ*

The electronic racket caused Jules's eyes to snap open, darkness giving way to a softly lit room that, at the moment, more closely resembled a blurry oil painting. The only thing that stood out were the glowing read numbers that read 7:00am, their brightness like knives stabbing at Jules's eyes. He squinted his eyes shut and shot out a hand, his fingers colliding painfully with hard molded plastic as his brain registered the familiar shape of his alarm clock sitting on the cheap bedside table he'd bought from a garage sale a few years ago, right next to his wallet, pocket knife and the ash tray he'd stolen from said garage sale. He grunted as pain suddenly shot through his skull, a dull pounding that coincided with a queasy feeling in his stomach.

'Fuck, did I pass out?' Jules wondered, slowly registering that he was,in fact, in bed. How did he get there? Wasn't he just in the bathroom by the school library? Jules scrunched his eyes as the world swam more into focus, the bathroom seeming more like a fading dream now, but the alarm didn't wait for the bully to get his bearings as it continued it's synthesized shriek. He guided his hands across the surface and pushed the Snooze button, the alarm clock's wailing ending with a low beep as Jules let his hand go slack in relief as relative silence filled the bedroom. Outside were the familiar sounds of the Shermer Fields trailer court coming to life for the day, but everything else was quiet, normal.

'Maybe I just came home and got shitfaced. Probably explains the headache' The teenager said, pulling his arm back in under the warmth of the covers, willing himself to go back to sleep as the limb settled against two mounds of flesh that tingled as he brushed against the shirt that hung over them.

Wait.

Jules's eyes snapped open once more, his head launching from his pillow as his arm rose upwards sending the small comforter flying off his body and exposing it to the world. Cold air rushed across small bare feet and two slender legs and sent a involuntary shiver through Jules's body as he stared in horror at himself.

There, dressed in nothing more than a pair of plain panties and an oversized t-shirt, was a very feminine body that Jules was apparently attached to. He sucked in air as his eyes widened even more, his generous chest heaving upwards towards him as he simply stared in shock at the smooth, tan skin that covered his legs, the small hand that moved in front of his face, the strange tickle as brown hair fell in front of his vision and was now gently pulling at the back of his head. The weight of his large breasts and somewhat tubby stomach that was revealed as the t-shirt settled upon it's bulging form.

"Oh. Oh god. OH GOD" The boy turned woman screamed, his new higher voice causing him to flail even more as a hand clasped his now slender throat. Another hand shot up to his face, Jules winced inpain as he poked himself in the eye with a nail that was certainly longer than he remembered it being, his tiny palm tracing around a much smaller nose and a set of lips that had no business being that puffy.

"HOLY SHIT! HOLY SHIT!" Jules screamed once more as he launched himself out bed and falling immediately on his face as his personal center of gravity failed to assert itself. But the flare of pain did nothing to stop him as Jules flailed about on the floor, a hand shooting inside the panties that hugged his feminine hips that simply confirmed what he already knew: His penis had been replaced by a womanly slit.

"AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!" Jules rolled across the floor as bile built up in his stomach, and he clambered to his new, tiny feet as stumbled his way out his bedroom door, hitting the hallway wall and guiding himself to the equally small bathroom on his end of the house, flicking on the light and collapsing in front of the toilet, breasts swinging wildly from the erratic movements as he gripped both sides of the porcelain throne and heaved, salty, burning tears filling his eyes as stomach acid made it's way out of his transformed body and into the water below. His new brown hair hung shook violently around him as his body arched and shuddered until it was finally spent, Jules collapsing in an exhausted heap against the bathtub rim and wiping a thick ribbon of spittle away, his face coated in sweat has he gasped for air, which only further reminded him of the massive orbs on his chest.

Of course, that was when he was given another surprise; the sound of feet padding down the hallway towards his bathroom, which he was starting to notice was filled with feminine products instead of it's usual spartan appearance.

'Oh shit, dad!' Jules thought in alarm, staring at the doorway in dread as he struggled to come up with some kind, any kind of reason to explain to his dad why Isaac Harper's only child, his son, was now a woman.

But instead of the haggard, bloated form of Jules's father, instead the hulking mass of someone else slid into view. Someone with a mess of short red hair and a face that looked as if the entire ugly tree had just decided to fall on it. Someone that was wearing nothing more than a pair of underwear that did little to hide the bulge of a cock.

"...Rob?" Jules squeaked in surprise as his 'friend' or more accurately, his 'boss' in the previous reality leaned against the door frame and and rubbed his eyes with a hammer-like fist. "What...What are you doing here?"

"Is it that bad this morning?" Rob said with a yawn as he blinked away the last of the sleep in his eyes. The giant's nose wrinkled in disgust before he reached over and flushed the toilet, sending the contents of Jules's stomach into the sewer system. "Bleh, must have been. Good thing your hair didn't get in it". Rob rubbed his face with a massive palm before stretching it down towards Jules, or rather, Julie's bewildered form.

"C'mon, get off that floor and I'll take you back to bed"

Meanwhile, Jules's mind was racing a million miles a minute. How was he a girl!? Why was Rob here!? Where was his dad!? What was Rob talking about!? WHY WAS HE A GIRL!? But despite all of this, the teenage boy turned girl felt himself reach out and take Rob's hand, bracing for the vice grip the larger bully often used but finding it to be surprisingly gentle, if a little firm. With barely any effort Jules felt himself being pulled upwards, his center of gravity wheeling once more as he fell against Rob's muscled, hairy chest. He looked up at Rob and realized that his new body was short. Not crazy short, but definitely shorter than he had been before, his head didn't even clear Rob's pecs! But the former bully saw something flash in his periphreal vision, and turned his head towards it.

He heard Rob's voice rumble something, but Jules never heard what. he was enraptured by the face staring back at him.

"Holy shit" Jules whispered as he stared at his reflection. Was this what he would have looked like if he was a girl? Large, bright blue eyes started out at him, a narrow, cute nose with nostrils that flared with every breath he took, agape, kissable lips that looked as if they already had an application of lipstick, and small, white teeth hiding behind them. There was a little bit of puffiness to his new face, seemingly because he was a little tubby now, but overall he wasn't too far from being a total knockout. Almost as if someone had mushed his face up with that Jane chick from Breaking Bad!

Jules watched one of Rob's large hands slid into the reflection and cupped his tiny chin, turning his head away from the mirror to look upwards at Rob's face, locking onto his brown eyes that, for the first time that Jules could remember, weren't glaring or filled with hate and rage.

"Hey, earth to Julie! you in there? Babe" Rob said, his voice full of concern.

Jules simply stared upwards for a moment before he realized he needed to respond. "Oh, uh, yes? I mean yeah? It, uh, yeah I must have had too many beers last night!" Jules thought it was a perfect enough answer, but Rob's face scrunched in confusion.

"What? Julie, you haven't had a beer since you got pregnant!"

"PREGNANT!?" Jules screamed in alarm. He looked down in horrified realization at his bulging stomach, and then went limp in Rob's arms as he promptly passed out from the morning's final shock.

Jules closed his eyes and took a deep breath, trying to muster up the feeble dregs of good that hadn’t been stomped out of him. Slowly, he put his hands on Rob’s shoulders and moved the redhead to a safe, non-boner-encouraging distance.

Well, uh freak him out more “There’s also, uh…”

You’ve always -hic- been a piece of ungrateful shit, and, and…” He swiped a thin wrist underneath his nose, leaving a thin trail of slime underneath it. ”I hope you DIE!”

112323333332331121211.content:
Rob lowered his stunningly good looking new head down out of the building's window now that he'd confirmed someone was actually there.

"At least I didn't have fucking far to walk in these god forsaken heels!" Rob muttered quietly to himself. Jules's trailer was near the front of the trailer court, so the building had only been about a hundred or so feet away. Still hadn't stopped him from almost face planting in the mud, though.

It wasn't actually just a random building, but a slightly crumbling brick house that had been there long before the rest of the trailer court had. It was the 'front office' of Shermer Fields, the first (and sometimes last) thing most people that lived in the sizable collection of dilapidated mobile homes would see. But the owner of the trailer court didn't live there, instead it was the Superintendent's house. Whoever actually owned the park was something Rob didn't actually know, but he'd been to the one story house plenty of times before. Typically it was about yet another endless problem that plagued the run-down Bolstrum family trailer, or to deliver a (typically late) check on behalf of his lazy bitch of a mom. Rob and the Super, Lou Reed, didn't get along very well, but his wife Peggy was always nice to him, and one of the few adults in Rob's life that he didn't feel some form of hatred towards.

Rob had a plan of sorts. Jules's dad seemed to recognize the...girl side of him, but who knew how any of this was actually supposed to work? Maybe it was just Jules's house that made the new switch in his brain flip over and make Rob become 'Bobbi'? Or now that he 'was' Bobbi...Maybe he lived somewhere else?

There were just so many questions that Rob had and that little lying shitfuck hadn't given him any answers. He'd just have to find some himself.

He grimaced as his new additions bounced with each small step he took up onto the house's front porch.

'You got this, Bolstrum' He said to himself as he carefully walked across the positively ancient wood planks that made up the porch, the fading twilight casting long shadows that the single pale yellow bulb did little to get rid of. 'You just walk in, ask the Super's wife where this...bimbo lives, and then you walk out. J ain't here so you're not NOT gonna turn into that brain dead cunt, you're NOT gonna start crying! Just walk in, get directions and walk out. You got this!'

The former man took a deep breath and tried his best to ignore the rising twin peaks that currently hung off his torso. Their weight was so alien and uneven, how they shifted and bounced inside of the strained fabric of his new t-shirt. He reached out with a hand that felt comically small and gripped the screen door's handle and with a final burst of adrenaline and false confidence, he pulled the screen door open and marched into the office.

Of course, the moment the door had swung open, and the moment Peggy's eyes had spotted Rob as he crossed the threshold, all that confidence vanished as Bobbi returned.

"Who...Oh, Bobbi honey, you scared the me!" Peggy said, giving the girl a soft smile. But the smile was short lived as the young woman froze mid-stride, her eyes wide in surprise.

"Oh! Oh Mrs. Reed, I'm...I'm so sorry I just wasn't paying attention and...and" Bobbi stuttered as her large green eyes filled with tears. She sniffled and turned away, a hand reaching for the door handle as she swiped a rogue tear away with a mud-stained finger. She felt another one run down her opposite cheek, and a final sniffle was all it took as the waterworks began. Bobbi let loose a sob and her body shuddered as the emotional toll of what had just happened overtook her.

"Honey, what's wrong?" Peggy said, rising up from the desk where she had spent...And rather significant amount of her life behind. She rounded the counter and moved towards Bobbi, who she'd seen grow up from a little bean pole into one of the prettiest girls she'd ever seen around Shermer. Now that the counter wasn't blocking her view, the shorter woman could see that...something had happened to the poor girl; her shapely legs were splattered with mud, her hair was matted in places and she was crying!

"O-oh Mrs. R-reed!" Bobbi sobbed, turning and burying her head into the shoulder of the older woman, "I-I just can't seem t-to make my b-boyfriend happy! I l-love him so much but h-he won't let me get close to h-him!"

"Oh honey..." Peggy cooed sympathetically, pulling the girl into a tight hug. At least she hadn't been assaulted or raped, Peggy had always been afraid that one of those would happen to Bobbi, especially given where they lived and ESPECIALLY given where the girl worked.

"It's c-cause I'm u-gly isn't it!?" Bobbi bawled again, and Peggy just let the girl cry as she held her tight, stroking her pudgy, wrinkled hand through her hair and along her back.

"Bobbi, you're not ugly baby, you're one of the prettiest girls I've ever seen! You've always been good looking, why when you were younger you were so cute I always thought it was criminal you had to live here!" Peggy said a few minutes later, after Bobbi's unbridled sobbing had slowed. She pulled the girl off her shoulder and grabbed a handful of tissues from the box on the office counter and went to work dabbing up the Picasso painting that was now smeared across Bobbi's face from the waterfall of tears.

"B-but why won't he love m-me?" Bobbi said with a slight hiccup as she let Peggy clean her up.

"Bobbi if there's one thing I've figured out from all my years on God's earth is that men don't have a lick of sense when it comes to women" Peggy said as she finished up, the tissues practically dripping with wasted makeup, "I've known men who'd rather sit alone with a video tape and a sock than touch a woman out of fear of makin' a fool outta themselves. That Julian boy doesn't know how lucky he is that you even look at him!"

"I guess..." Bobbi said with another sniffle as the last of her tears, for now, dried up. "Thanks, Mrs. Reed, you always know how to make me feel better!"

Peggy smiled up at the girl and gave her a soft pat on the cheek, "Oh honey, it's the least I could do. Now c'mon, lets..."

Peggy is reluctant to leave Bobbi alone, but the young woman assures her that her mom will be home 'soon'. The moment Bobbi closes the door, Rob returns...But is he alone?

1123233333323311212112.content:
“C'mon, let’s get you out of those muddy clothes! No adoptive daughter of mine is going to be filthy if I can help it!” harumphed Peggy, driving Bobbi further into the house by her thin waist. A frown clouded her face as she bustled her kinda-daughter through the kitchen, and she gave the taut tummy of her ward an approximative squeeze.

“We need to get some more food in you too, darlin’.” she tutted. “I swear, you could eat five buckets ‘a wings and not gain ‘n ounce!”

“You know that’s not true, Mrs. Reed!” whined Bobbi. “I get all hippy and my jeans barely fit!” She put a demonstrative wiggle in her step, answering the loud snort this elicited from Peggy with a cheeky grin.

“You kids these days,” sighed the interim-super with mock disapproval. “You grow like weeds, but yer minds don’t catch up fer years.”

Foster mother and daughter shared a giggle as they pushed their way past the small, but well-stocked kitchen and into Bobbi’s room. It was surprisingly austere in its decorations, a peeling punk-band poster salvaged from her old trailer the only notable piece of furnishing, and maybe the pink-sheeted bed would catch someone’s eye.

Everything else though, looked like it got hit by a category 5 pubescent hurricane. The dresser was strewn with magazines for your garden variety teen, every Valentine’s Special Edition cover creased from heavy use. The vanity had a plethora of products on it; lipsticks from purples to reds to blacks; fifteen eyeliner pencil-nubs; and enough moisturizers and lotions to keep Nosferatu’s skin soft and supple.

A slightly ajar white door led to a compact attached bathroom with so many jars of perfume that it smelled like a candle store, and makeup wipes used and unused litter the sink.

Bobbi practically skipped into her room, parking herself firmly in front of the magazine-replete dresser. The third drawer down — underneath a compacted layer of boyfriend-shirts and hoodies stolen from Jules — contained a variety of sheer fabrics and lace that, heretofore and probably for a good bit longer (Valentine’s and Jules’ birthday were a ways off) were unused, but the mere sight of it might give Ms. Reed a heart attack.

But before she could lovingly but firmly dismiss her foster mom from the room, the rotund woman started setting about Bobbi’s clothes with maternal vigor.

“Agh, stoooopit!” squealed the redhead, bapping at the liver-spotted hands pawing at her clothes with both of her hands. “I can get undressed mysmrgh—”

Whether it was due to the fact that she didn’t want to hurt one of the few positive female role models in her life, or that the fact that Bobbi’s exercises were primarily for aesthetic — and Jules’ — benefit, it didn’t matter.

What mattered that Peggy Reed was able to divest Roberta Bolstrum of her tank top and then proceeded to stare with disapproval at the unveiled and unsupported peaks revealed.

“Bobbi...” she hemmed, with the disapproving lilt that all mother-figures had mastered.

The eponymous girl put her hands on her hips, twisting her face into a sullen pout. “What?!” she huffed.

Ms. Reed arched an eyebrow.

“I-it’s to celebrate our six-months-and-twenty-day anniversary!”

The other eyebrow went up.

Bobbi sighed and tucked a strand of silky red hair behind an ear, looking away. “It’s not like anything happened.”

Ms. Reed sighed and folded the tanktop into a little white-stained-brown square, wistfully smiling. “I just want ya to be happy, darlin’.”

The impudent expression melted from Bobbi’s face, and her lip started to wobble. Overwhelmed by familial sentiment, the teen once again collapsed into Ms. Reed’s arms, who, once again lightly stroked the girl’s hair as she gently guided her to the bathroom.

Peggy helped the girl out of the pair of particularly tight — and wet from mud, she hoped — jean shorts while trying to avoid the drip of mucus. She refrained from commenting at the scanty pair of panties, choosing instead to thank the Lord that at least the girl had worn something down there.

She cranked the hot-and-cold knobs of the shower as Bobbi sat on the toilet seat, blubbering happy and sad tears in equal measure. Peggy could remember comforting the Bolstrum girl in a similar state when she was younger; whether it was the pet grasshopper that she had accidentally squashed or the sad Disney movie she had watched a few minutes ago, a couple’a gentle coos and maternal affection fixed her right up.

Or she could cry herself out, an option that her deadbeat biological mom had tended towards.

But Ms. Reed had expected Bobbi to, well, change as she got older. Instead, the girl stayed at a fairly high level of emotional volatility as she grew up and, um, out. Sure, the Verner youngun could’ve probably handled the situation better — and if she heard word that he didn’t treat her lil’ Bobbi right, the boy’s ass was grass — but the constant games of emotional Minesweeper with the Bolstrum girl didn’t always pan out for her, so it was a bit of a tossup.

She shoved the girl into the shower as delicately as she could, nodding at the indecipherable words sniveled into her ear. A brief frown was leveled at the trail of snot left on her blouse, but she shrugged it off. It’d go in the laundry with everything else.

“You good with biscuits n’ gravy, darlin’?”

Onomatopoeic sobbing echoed from the shower.

“Bobbi dear, I can’t quite understand you.”

A shaky red-capped thumbs up extended above the shower curtain.

Peggy smiled again. “It’ll be done when you’re out.”

Inside the shower, Bobbi let a wobbly sad smile stretch across her face. She was so truly blessed, having someone like Miss Reed take care of her.

Ingerbitch running her hands over him, driving her tongue into his mouth: Nada. A quiver of disgust, if anything.

Fuckit. He went to his old standby; that nice jock-and-cheerleader ‘film’ he had on his favorites bar. Even the foreplay-makeout was enough to make him hard. The guy was just like him, tall, musclebound, and redheaded, and the girl was one’a those blonde bimbos.

All of his cognitive energy was focused on visualizing their embrace. To Rob’s delight, heat prickled in his core, and a smile spread across his face.

Still, something could be different. Maybe make the guy a lil’ shorter… less muscles. Make it more realistic n’ shit. The heat rose to his stomach, and Rob’s hand unconsciously made its way to his breast, a small keening moan escaping his lips. He didn’t really know what girl-horny-buildup was like, specifically, but he was pretty sure that this was it. And he felt pretty fuckin’ close to, uh, what happened before.

What if the guy had, like, black hair? And, unf, the cheerleader bitch should have some tattoo sleeves, all done up in some badass roses. Give her some red hair, and Rob could practically feel the guy’s hands roaming… wait.

No.

GOD no.

An aghast Rob released his boob the moment he realized specifically what he had imagined someone doing to him, and his seemingly unconscious preferences for what the person looked like.

Ashamed and helplessly furious at the second time that J had made him horny that night, Rob stormed into his, Bobbi’s, whom-the-fuck-EVER’s room and tried to distract himself with clothes.

Option One: In the midst of changing and figuring out how girls' clothes work, a rat-a-tat-tat and face appearing on his window scares the everloving shit out of Rob. It’s Jules, of course.

Option Two: Desperate to escape the fucked state of mind that he’s in, Rob goes out to the kitchen and surrenders to the expected brain-tsunami of Bobbi. But is something different?

The drive only took a few minutes to get to the school campus, though Bill was momentarily confused when his mother's sedan pulled to a stop in front of the Elementary School, near the Sixth Grade wing where Kimberly's classroom was. He stared at the horde of Tweens before realizing that he WAS a Tween now.

"What's the matter Kimmy? Cold feet? Afraid of the big bad sixth grade?" Bill heard his voice say mockingly from behind, and he shot Kimberly a glare before unbuckling himself and reaching for the obnoxiously colorful backpack that was, for now, his. Bill opened the door and slid out, not even bothering to return his mom's 'I love you' as he slammed the door behind him and made his way into the crowd of pre-adolescent students. Once he reached what he thought might have been a safe enough distance in case Kimberly tried anything, he turned and gave a half-hearted wave and tried not to shudder as he felt the bracelets on his forearm bounce and jangle and his sister's hair tickle his ears, watching as the car pulled away in the direction of Shermer High.

"That little shithead has no idea what's about to happen" Bill said to himself with a giggle, not realizing how girly it sounded as he stared at the retreating tail lights. There was another reason why he and Tom always walked together, strength in numbers. The moment Kimberly was alone, Big Jon Ingerman, Rob Bolstrum and the rest of Shermer High's bully brigade would descend upon her. "But not my problem!" Bill said as he turned and followed the last of the sixth grade students into the school building, "Anything that happens, I can just un-wish"

Bill gave the Stone in his pocket a pat just to make sure it was still there, and with his concern momentarily addressed, made his way to Kimberly's classroom. He'd have to play along for now, there was simply no time to experiment before her class started. The former high school senior found his way into Mrs. Beckham's classroom and, thankfully, the desks were still labeled so it was easy enough to get to Kimberly's desk right as the final bell rang.

"Well, this should be fairly painless" Bill said to himself as the middle aged Mrs. Beckham rose from her desk, cleared her throat, and greeted the class.
11333222.title: Bill and Kimberly are late for school and don&...

113332223.content:
(Continuity edits made by Mr. Domino)

As the class continued, Bill just stared out the window, not paying attention since he already knew everything that was being taught in the class. He still had all of his knowledge after all. This worried him a little since that meant Kimberly probably still had her own knowledge as well, so she could end up screwing up his grades today. However, what Bill didn’t realize was that both he and Kimberly, while retaining their own knowledge, also gained all the 'surface' knowledge they needed to convincingly act like each other, so Kimberly was able to do just as well in class as he would. Unfortunately, knowledge wasn’t the only thing they gained. As Bill tuned out the teacher, his gaze drifted across the classroom, taking in his surroundings. As his gaze landed on a boy on the other side of the room, he started to stare at the boy. He didn’t realize it, but he started to get excited, thinking about holding hands with the boy. As he pictured it, he even thought about saying ‘Danny, I love you.’ to the boy. Suddenly, he came back to his senses and realized he was just daydreaming about being lovey-dovey with a twelve year old boy. He got really embarrassed and shook his head, even lightly slapping himself on both cheeks to snap himself out of it. This strengthened his resolve to return to his own body, not wanting to deal with his sister’s first crush.

'This is crazy! I didn't even know that boy existed before today! When did he and Kimmy even meet!?' Bill thought angrily as he tried to hide the embarrassed blush on his new cheeks. In reality, Dan had moved to Shermer two years ago, joining Kimberly's fourth grade class and despite his sister's obnoxious behavior, the boy had become one of the younger Strasserman's best friends over the past couple of years. Now that they were in sixth grade and their bodies were entering puberty though, Kimberly had been dealing with some really...strange emotions. Emotions that were now messing with Bill's mind, and that he was totally unprepared to deal with.

When the bell finally range at the end of the day, Bill grabbed Kimberly's obnoxiously pink backpack out of the tiny locker and rushed out the door before he could get sucked into any sort of crazy situation or be forced to talk to one of Kimberly's equally annoying and giggly friends, waiting on his mom to pick him up. He pulled out the stone for the first time since the switch had happened that morning, holding it tightly and thinking about things that make him angry, such as how Kimberly stole his body, and how his mind was being affected by the switch. Just as the stone started glowing, ready to grant a wish...

Option 1: He managed to make a wish, saying “I wish Kimberly would forget about the stone and it’s powers”, hoping to keep its powers to himself and switch back when they got home, and tricking her into thinking something else caused their switch, but since he’s Kimberly now, the stone made him forget about the stone’s powers, and he ended up losing the stone, not realizing it’s importance to his desire to switch back.

Option 2: Bill felt a tap on his shoulder, and turned around only to be surprised by Dan, making his heart melt due to having Kimberly’s feelings for him. He then finds out that Kimberly and Dan had plans to spend the afternoon hanging out, with both their moms chaperoning the pre-teens.
113332223.title: Bill's Day As Kimberly

1133322232.content:
(Continuity and additional edits made by Mr.Domino)

Just as he was about to make a wish that may or may not have fixed the situation he had been stuck in all day, Bill felt a tap on his shoulder. He let loose a very girlish groan of annoyance and spun in his sister's pink and white sneakers, ready to tell one of Kimberly's stupid girl friends to get lost, only to have butterflies explode in his stomach as he saw who it was.

"Hey Kimbo! Man I didn't think today was ever going to end! Mrs. Beckham was SOOOO boring! I'm freaking starving! Are you starving? You look kinda pale..." Dan's voice was high pitched and still childish, puberty had yet to hit full force and make his voice start cracking, but it was enough to make Bill's new knees quiver as Kimberly's emotions once again got the better of him.

'Yeah I'm starving for you!' Bill thought before he realized what had just gone through his brain. 'NO NO NO NO NO GROSS NO NO EW NO!' Bill said and tried his best to purge the disgusting thoughts from his mind. Kimberly was only TWELVE! Why was she already acting like this!? But Bill's inner conflict seemed to show as Dan's boyish, smiling face scrunched up in worried confusion.

"You okay Kimmy?" The boy said, laying a hand on Bill's tiny shoulder, "Should I get a teacher?"

Bill’s heart melted at this. He felt more butterflies come to life in his stomach as he stared at Dan, and ended up smiling before bringing Dan in for a hug. He was so...warm! And caring! Bill didn’t know what he was doing. He couldn’t help but act this way.

"Oh, I'm just really hungry too!" Bill said, trying very hard not to gush or burst into a giggling fit. He suddenly felt as though he was in control again and pushed away from Dan and turned away, hiding his blushing face in his hands.

"Uh, cool I guess!" Was all Dan said before he started rambling on about some kiddy show called 'Raspberry Squad Go!' that Bill's implanted 'Kimories' told him was one of the things that Dan and Kimberly had first connected over. Bill had seen a poster or two for the show in Kimberly's room the few times he'd walked past with the door open, Despite his lack of Kimberly's deeper knowledge on the subject, he knew enough to at least engage in a excited conversation about it. It was some dumb anime show about fighting robot monsters with what amounted to digital Pokemon cards, but the longer the two pre-teens talked about it, the more Bill found himself getting into it, apparently there was even a brand new movie about it!

“She’s here.” Dan said, interrupting Bill as he was talking about what little he could glean from the surface memories he had of the show, turnind to see Dan’s mom pull up in what Bill had to assume was the family car. It was maroon and the same model as his mom's, if maybe a year or two newer as it slowed to a stop in front of the two twelve year olds. The older woman was a little younger than Bill's own mother, Martha, but only by a few years, and had shiny and smooth brown hair that was hung down past her shoulders and dangerously low neckline. Dan gave his mother a wave and began walking around the front of the car, but Bill hesitated. The surface memories swimming around in his Kimberly'd mind seemed to suggest that she...HE was supposed to wait for his mom, Martha. He didn't know this woman, and the surface memories only knew her as 'Mrs. Davidson' or 'Dan's mom'.

'Figures Kimmy doesn't pay enough attention to know this woman's name' Bill groaned inwardly as he stared at the car and then cast a look down the afternoon street, seeing if his mother's car was close.

Picking up on Bill's hesitation, Dan's mom rolled down the driver side window and looked directly at Bill, who could see his sister's, or rather his, reflection in the enormous pair of sunglasses the older woman was wearing as she began to speak.

“Hey guys! So are we all set? Kimmy, your mom had to run home for something so I offered to pick you up! She said she'd meet us at..."
1133322232.title: A Unexpectedly Welcome Interruption

choices: Bill's mom grabs the Stone before Bill can make a wish.
11333223.content:
"What? NO! Kimmy, there's no way I'm gonna spend the rest of my life as you!" Bill squeaked in his sister's voice, staring up at his old body, who glared back.

"Dude, don't call me that! I'm Bill now! Not Kimberly! That's your name, you stupid girl!" Kimberly snarled back before wandering off to the other side of the porch marveling at herself. Bill glared daggers at his former body and clenched his hand tighter, feeling the Stone dig into the flesh of his newly tiny palms as the anger pooled up within his tiny frame. Gold light began to shine in the gaps between Bill's fingers as he opened his mouth to make another wish...

"I wish that-" Bill began, only to be surprised as his mother charged out the front door of the Strasserman household, Kimberly's backpack in one hand as she grabbed Bill's stick-like arm and began dragging him off the porch.

"LET'S GO, KIMMY!" Martha Strasserman groaned, "You can't be late for school AGAIN and I certainly don't need to be late for work! I can't believe how inconsiderate you are to others sometimes! Maybe I should start making you ride the bus so you can appreciate how much effort it is to get you ready for school!"

Bill allowed himself to be pulled off the porch, not expecting his mother to be that strong. His tiny body almost bounced along the sidewalk before his brain finally kicked into gear and he dug his tiny sneakers into the concrete path that led to the garage and the two females jerked to a stop.

"KIMBERLY STRASSERMAN, YOU GET IN THAT CAR SO I CAN TAKE YOU TO SCHOOL THIS INSTANT!" Martha screamed, wheeling about on Bill, her face contorted in anger and frustration.

"Yeah Kimmy, go to school you little airhead!" The real Kimberly said with a chuckle from the porch.

"BILL! START WALKING!" Martha roared as she turned away from Bill, pointing a manicured topped finger in the direction of Bill's stolen body. After a moment of shocked silence, Martha turned back towards the garage and with a painful tug, jerked Bill forward again, and this time he could do little to stop it, still shocked by his mother's outburst. Before he knew it, Bill's body was practically shoved into the passenger seat of his mom's sedan.

"There. Now I'm sorry Kimmy but you have got to go to school!" Bill's mother fussed as she leaned over him and clicked the seatbelt into place. Like he was some tiny child. He WAS a tiny child. Bill looked up to see his own body standing there with a huge grin on it's face as the true Kimberly, however much of her actually remained beneath the 'dudedification' of Bill's last wish, was highly amused at the situation.

"Hey mom, can I get a ride to school? I'll never make it there in time now!" Kimberly said, making Bill's voice just whiny enough. Martha sighed and pointed at the car with a shake of her head.

"Fine, but you both better hope I'm not late for work!" The Starsserman matriarch said with a glare towards Bill as Kimberly slid into the backseat of the sedan, the huge shit-eating grin still on her face.

Bill looked down and opened his tiny hand, showing the Ahn'Ger Stone sitting there, the greens and golds looking more vibrant and alive but yet not glowing as it had been. Bill's timing was unfortunate as the exact moment he chose to look at the Stone was the moment his mother turned to glare at him, revealing the Stone's existence to her.

"KIMMY!" His mother's voiced peaked once more, "I can't believe you! Stealing from my jewelry box! I thought I raised you better than that! We're going to have a talk later today little missy! Maybe a month's grounding will get make you start listening!"

Bill's eyes went wide as he saw his mother's hand dart towards the Ahn'Ger Stone, the only means for him to get back to normal. He closed his hand protectively around the Stone, pulled it close to his chest and dug deep into the anger of the situation as he felt his mother's hands wrap around his own and begin prying his fingers apart.

"Give me it Kimmy so we can go to school! BILL HELP ME!" Martha hissed, and Bill felt much larger arms and hands begin pulling at him from the backseat He hugged his tiny hands closer to his chest and turned away as his mothers larger fingers wormed through his tiny ones. As Bill made his wish he heard his mother say something beneath her breath.

"I wish we didn't have to go to school!"
11333223.title: Sibling Switchery: Enter The Mom

He was an infant, and so was Kimberly!
113332231.content:
Green-gold light pushed through the inside of Bill's eyelids even though they were squeezed shut, and suddenly the sensations of arms all around him were different, their touch softer. He could tell that something had changed, and his body felt different. And there was a heavy ringing in Bill's ears that made it hard to hear what was being said.

As Bill finally opened his eyes to see the changes his wish had wrought, he was surprised to see...
113332231.title: Bill's wish is granted.

choices: Bill manages to make a wish.
The Stone is taken from Bill.
1133322311.content:
The first thing Bill noticed was the fact that his hands were now solidly stuck between two large fleshy cushions that hung off the front of his body. The second thing that Bill noticed was his swollen stomach from which a horrible flaring pain seemed to be coming from. And instead of being decked out in Kimberly's typical tweenager girl clothes, he was now wearing little more than a oversized night gown that hung limply off his form. Long brown hair filled his vision as he stared down into the canyon of cleavage before he screamed as a wave of sharp, stabbing pain radiated forth from his abdomen.

"OH GOD!" He screamed as the ringing in his ears faded away. Then he heard another voice in his ear and the teenager jerked his feminine head up as his surroundings fell into place.

"Hang on honey we're almost at the hospital!" Said a gruff voice, and Bill turned his head towards the source to see a heavily bearded man who he most certainly did not recognize behind the steering wheel of his mother's car, which now looked considerably older than it had moments ago.

"Sweetie just do the breathing okay? Mom's right here, we got you!" Martha's voice came from the back seat as Bill turned to look. His mom was definitely older, her hair was going gray and there were more than a few wrinkles on her face. Next to her sat a much older version of himself, currently pinned beneath a small mountain of bags.

"Oh god!" Was all Bill could say as another wave of pain rolled across his body. His wish had been granted, he and Kimberly didn't have to go to school, but the Stone had, for some reason, made them all older! And for some reason, made him clearly pregnant! It didn't make sense! Bill tried to take some deep breaths as he turned back to face the front, now realizing they were cruising down the streets of a city much larger than Shermer Illinois. He chanced a look down at the Ahn'Ger Stone in his hands. He could now see the golden band that wrapped around his ring finger.

'Oh god' Was all he could say.

"Oh honey, I wish you could have left your good luck rock at home!" Martha said from the back seat as she rubbed Bill's left arm.

"Yeah, SIS, you should have left it at home so I don't have to keep track of it like everything else!" Came Bill's old voice from the back seat.

"We're here!" The gruff voiced stranger next to Bill said and he looked up as the large structure of 'St. Harrison General' loomed above them, a pair of nurses rushing out the door with a wheelchair already in hand. "Good thing we called ahead, right babe?" The stranger said with a panicked smile as he slowed the car to a stop and put it in park before jumping out and rushing around to Bill's door and flinging it open.

""C'mon, let's get you inside!" The stranger said and Bill felt very powerful arms almost effortlessly lift him up out of the sedan and place him into the waiting wheelchair, and then suddenly he was being whisked away as the two nurses, his mother and his apparent husband were all chattering between themselves about what were clearly pregnancy terms. Bill turned in the wheelchair and looked back, seeing his old body standing outside of the car, giving him a wave that seemed half sincere, half sarcastic as Kimberly made her way to the driver's seat.

"Kimmy" Bill heard someone say, and after a moment he realized someone was talking to him. He watched as the car pulled away and turned back towards the group of people around him, including a woman who was very clearly a doctor. Her tiny, overcoated body was topped by a serious face and fiery, if short, red hair.

"Y-yes?" He said, and for the first time noticed how mature his voice sounded.

"My name is Dr. Melanie Jackson. I'm the OB-GYN on call today, Mr. Goins has a bad stomach virus and can't come in so I'll be delivering your child for you. Given how quickly you're progressing, we should head straight into the delivery, but first you have to surrender the item you're carrying, for your safety and that of my staff's" The woman, Dr. Jackson, said, her voice as cold and serious as her dark green eyes.

"W-what?" Bill whimpered, and through the pain clenched the Stone, his only way out of this nightmare, closer to his newly enlarged chest.

"You need to give Dr. Jackson your good luck rock, sweetie" His mother said softly, and Bill watched as a slightly wrinkled hand reached towards his own. He felt anger beneath the intense pain that was his current existence, the feeling of how unfair all of this was, his hate towards Kimberly, the coldness of this doctor, the insanity of the entire situation.

"B-but I..." Bill stammered as he clutched the Ahn'Ger Stone tighter as the smallest hint of a glow began as...
1133322311.title: He was an adult woman! And Kimberly was an adul...

11333223111.content:
Bill had to make a wish quickly. If he didn’t, the stone would be taken from him, and he may never get it back if someone else takes it. Especially if Kimberly gets her hands on it. She’ll make sure he remains stuck as her, with a newborn child. He quickly thought about how suddenly becoming Kimberly, then suddenly becoming a pregnant, adult Kimberly, and how angry it made him. However, the pain from going into labor kept him from thinking of what he wanted to wish for. He simply couldn’t concentrate due to all the pain, so he said the one thing he wanted more than anything right now. “I wish I could keep the stone!” This was his greatest desire at the moment because of the earlier fear that he may lose it and be stuck as he is, so it was the first thing he thought of when trying to think of a wish. Unfortunately, wishing to return to normal hadn’t crossed his mind because of the pregnancy hormones running through him, along with the pain from going into labor. It was all just so overwhelming, especially since it’s all so new to him and bombarded him very suddenly.

“Okay, let’s get her in the delivery room.” The doctor said as hey wheeled him away from his mother. The man who is apparently Bill’s new husband was allowed to follow them. After a few minutes, he was brought into the delivery room and placed on a bed. His new husband stood by his side, holding Bill’s free hand.

Some time later, after squeezing the life out of his husband’s hand and the stone, while pushing the muscles in his groin as hard as he could, it finally ended. Throughout it all, he hadn’t even considered trying another wish, too distracted by the pain. When it ended, he was so relieved, he had forgotten where he even was or what he was doing. After a few moments, he remembered where he was, and what he just did. His anger at the stone slowly started to rise, along with his embarrassment at doing something no man should ever be able to do, but before he can open his mouth to make a wish, he’s interrupted by the doctor saying...
11333223111.title: Bill manages to make a wish.

choices: Bill went home with his new family
Bill finally came to his senses, making a wish, but does he want to lose Willow?
113332231112.content:
At those words, Bill instinctually looked over to his husband, who he just now noticed was no longer holding his hand, and saw a baby in the man’s arms. This caused foreign emotions to well up inside Bill. He couldn’t help but stare at the baby he had just given birth to.

“Want to hold her?” Bill was snapped out of his daze by the words spoken by the man holding his baby girl. The man he was apparently married to. He looked at the man, then back at the baby, conflicted by the desire to see his new daughter, and to wish himself back to normal.

After a moment, he simply nodded his head, and said “Yes.” The man carefully placed the baby in Bill’s arms. Bill, still holding the magical stone in one hand, held the baby in his arms. He stared at the baby as if it was the most beautiful thing in the world, and to Bill, it was.

“Have you decided on a name?” Asked the doctor.

“Willow.” Bill replied immediately. For some reason, he felt like he picked that name out a while ago, but in reality, he had never considered what he might name his child if or when he ever had one. Bill spent the night in the hospital holding his new daughter, Willow, as he slept, while his husband slept on a chair right beside his bed.

In the morning...
113332231112.title: “It’s a girl!”

1133322311121.content:
In the morning, Bill was placed in a wheelchair again, and wheeled back out to the car. Kimberly, in the adult version of Bill’s original body, was waiting by the car with Bill’s, or rather Kimberly’s, husband, who he learned was named James O’Neill. Which means Bill is now Kimberly O’Neill, and their new daughter is Willow O’Neill.

“How’s it feel to be a mother Kimmy?” Kimberly asked with a smug look on her new face.

“...I’m...not sure yet.” Bill replied, before looking down at the baby girl sleeping in his arms, and smiling. “But I think I might like it.”

Kimberly is caught off guard by Bill’s answer. “Oh....well good.”

They all got in the car and after a short drive, they arrive at a rather decent looking house, that Bill didn’t recognize.

After they’re inside, and Willow is placed in a crib, Bill looked at the stone that caused all this, and contemplated what he should do.

Option 1: Place the stone inside a safe, locking it away so no one will take it. Years go by, Bill finds his new life as Kimberly O’Neill to be a good one, and even falls in love with his new husband, having a son a few years after Willow, and naming him Tom, after his best friend from when he was Bill. One day, when cleaning out the family safe, Bill, now Kimberly, gets in an argument with a now teenage Willow, and absent-mindedly makes a wish with the stone.

Option 2: Bill makes a wish with the stone, too overwhelmed by suddenly being thrust into motherhood. He wishes to be a teenage boy again, but for Willow to be his new baby sister so she still exists. Years go by, and he protects his dear baby sister as if she were his own daughter(because she was).
1133322311121.title: Bill went home with his new family

choices: Tom stops by and sees Gloria. They have a fight, and Gloria makes an angry wish
Bill says something careless, pisses off Gloria, and she makes an angry wish
114.content:
...Gloria Vanapolous, standing a fair distance away from Bill's house on the sidewalk. She made a beckoning motion with her left hand, as she was a southpaw, that indicated that she really needed to talk to him. “Great”, Bill thought bitterly to himself “Just what I need”. He grabbed his backpack , slung it over his shoulder, and practically schlepped his body down the front steps towards the next bit of drama in his life. He just hoped that whatever it is she wanted, she left before Tom showed up, otherwise he'd have to listen to their bickering for the next hour.

“What do you want?” Bill asked with a neutral voice, hiding his dislike for Gloria, although the look of raw annoyance in his eyes gave it away.

“Listen” said Gloria somewhat insistently, as if she had big news to tell Bill. “I can't be seen talking to you, you understand that, right?”

“Yeah” sighed Bill impatiently. “I'm not popular, you don't need to rub it in.”

“You know I like you, Bill. You're a sweet guy.”

“Yeah, whatever.”

Bill's mind briefly imagined Gloria's little clique. Despite being an only child with a really strict mom, Gloria was pretty enough and cunning enough(Bill used to refer to her as Littlefinger behind her back in middle school) to have earned a spot among the popular crowd of jocks and cheerleaders. It was almost a cliché, the popular kids all being beautiful and athletic and largely well off, but that was the truth. The popular kids ran the school, and everyone else were their footstools. The only caveat that allowed kids like Bill some degree of room to breathe is that despite all of their privileges, the cool kids seemed like they were a surprisingly miserable bunch. Gloria's friends maintained a very regimented caste system with very little wiggle room for social mobility or the ability to resist peer pressure. There were weird and capricious rules which dictated acceptable social behavior, and there was constant paranoia among them that if you did something out of turn or were the victim of malicious gossip, you could be ostracized at any moment like Tom had been. Despite being by some definitions a loser, Bill felt that he had more personal freedom than Gloria did.

“You've ignored all of my texts and private messages, I even tried to call you, so you had to know that this was coming. I really need to tell you something, and I could only tell you. I...”

Gloria stopped for a moment before composing herself again.

“...I think that I'm ready to forgive him.”

Bill briefly closed his eyes to prevent his eyes for bulging out of their sockets.

“You're...ready to forgive Tom?” said Bill, enunciating his words slowly, every last one dripping with sarcasm and disdain.

“Yes” announced Gloria proudly. “We've had our differences in the past, and we've always bounced back from them. No matter what was said, who threatened who, who called who what, I think that Tom and I can make it work again. The problem is, I can't tell Tom directly that I'm ready to start fresh. I want to ease him into it. You know how he gets. How he flies off the handle when he thinks he's being lied to. How oversensitive he gets. I swear he's bipolar.”

“I wouldn't be surprised” said Bill quietly, ready to fly off the handle himself. While she prattled on, giving herself a pat on the back for having the compassion to forgive Tom's previous transgressions, Bill was thinking angrily to himself “How DARE Gloria try and paint herself as the victim here?”. You see, Tom and Gloria had possessed a toxic relationship for the entire length of time that Bill had known the both of them, ever since Kindergarten, and Gloria gave as good as she took. She was just as much of a drama queen as Tom was, just as capable as creating absolutely vicious insults that would embarrass the rudest sailor, and Bill was getting really sick of being caught in the middle of their inane soap opera. If Bill wasn't so distracted, he'd give Gloria a piece of...

“Hey, what's that?” pointed Gloria towards Bill's hand.

“What's what?” he asked.

“There's something glowing in your hand.”

Bill opened his hand, revealing the mysterious Ahn'Ger Stone.

“This? I don't know, just something I found laying on my porch. I forgot I had it.”

“Why is it glowing?”

“I don't know. Maybe it's kryptonite?”.

Bill laughed. Gloria didn't. She was transfixed, almost in a trance, somehow preternaturally aware that it was something special. Something forbidden and all powerful.

“Can I see it?” she asked with a touch of awe in her voice. “It's beautiful”.

“OK, just give it back. I found it first, and I'm planning to find somebody to appraise it. It looks expensive".

Gloria turned over the Ahn'Ger stone in her hand three times over, examining its teardrop shape and the smaller gold gemstone embedded inside.

"This looks priceless."

"I'm hoping so. Then I can move out of here and do something exciting with my life" said Bill wistfully.

“So” she said, changing the subject back to Tom, gradually losing interest in the artifact “can you let Tom know that I'm open to seeing him again? If he behaves, that is?”.
114.title: The Young And The Furious

choices: "I wish I had dated Bill instead!"
"I wish you and Bill would just become the old married couple you guys act like!
"I wish you and Bill could just feel the pain I feel!"
1141.content:
"What the hell are you doing here?" a familiar voice rang out. It was Tom.

"Oh great." Bill said. Just the perfect time for Tom to finally show up.

"See, this is just what I'm trying to avoid." Gloria said, as if this were all Bill's fault.

"What are you talking to her for, man? You know how this makes me feel." Tom said.

"She's talking to me. I'm not talking to her." Bill countered.

"Shut up, Bill. You're not helping this."

"Sorry. I'll shut up." Bill said.

"At least Bill has a little bit of sense here to SHUT UP. Tom, we can fix this! I have forgiven you, if you can forgive me, we can work this out!"

Bill could see the anger building in Gloria's face. But more than that, he could see a green glow erupting from her hand. From the stone!

But before Bill could point anything out, Gloria erupted with a statement that would have grave consequences
1141.title: Lover's Knot

choices: Bill changes into Gloria’s perfect man
Gloria changes into Bill’s perfect woman
Bill suddenly finds himself back in Kindergarten...With Gloria and Tom!
11411.content:
Bill had known the stone was special from the moment he saw it. He’d expected it to be a broken off piece of jewelry, or some undiscovered mineral that would make him famous. The last thing he expected was for it to start glowing in Gloria’s hand. Gloria herself didn’t seem to notice; instead, her attention was stuck on Tom.

“You’re such a self-absorbed asshole! I came here to forgive you, no apology necessary, and you try and turn it around on me! You’ve even got Bill on your side! Honestly, I thought he was smarter than that!”

“What the hell are you talking about!?” Tom shouted loud enough for the whole block to hear.

Bill shut his eyes and hoped he’d go deaf as the two teenagers competed in their shouting match. Their words jumbled together in his ears until they just became noise, noise that made Bill cringe and wince and shake his head.

“Hey,” he said softly, knowing he wouldn’t pierce their screams. Neither Tom nor Gloria turned away from the other. “Hey!” he repeated, louder this time.

The former couple their heads to look at Bill. “What!?” they shouted in unison.

“Could you please, maybe, possibly stop shouting just a little bit?”

The moment he stopped talking, Bill knew he’d made a mistake. Tom looked as though he’d insulted his mother, killed his cat, and punched him in the face all at once. Gloria, on the other hand, was wearing a manic grin.

“Are you taking her side?” Tom asked in disbelief.

“What? No, Tom, of course not! Where’d you even get that-”

Gloria stepped in front of Bill before he could finish his sentence. “Of course he’s taking my side! I’m right!”

Without missing a beat, Gloria spun around, grabbed Bill’s shoulder, and planted a spiteful kiss on his lips. She pulled her head away, but continued to hold him; it wouldn’t be that easy to escape.

“You’re such a good kisser, Bill,” Gloria lied. She looked behind her, directly into Tom’s moist eyes. “Really, I wish I’d dated you from the start!”

Then the stone in Gloria’s hand grew bright enough to blind the trio, and green light enveloped the world.
11411.title: "I wish I had dated Bill instead!"

choices: It was Gloria’s mother, come to pick her up for school
It was Tom and his girlfriend, the new leader of Gloria’s clique
114112.content:
Bill only had a few precious seconds to process what Gloria- No, what he and Gloria had done. It had been a joint effort. Had he controlled his outburst and not offended Tom, the explosion of light never would have happened. Bill was afraid to see what the consequences would be. He could feel in his gut that it would be nothing good.


After a few seconds, the green light naturally faded, but Bill still had to blink a few times to drive away the spots in his vision. Once they were gone, Bill took in his surroundings. He was back on his porch, where he’d been before Gloria and Tom and the argument. His hand curled at the memory, only to ease up at a sharp pinprick. The stone was still in his palm, which had been pierced by a jagged edge. Bill grumbled to himself as he slid the stone over to his other hand. Suddenly, a familiar voice cried out to him.

“HEY BILL!” Gloria shouted from the sidewalk, where she’d been the first time this had happened. Only this wasn’t Gloria Vanapolous. Gloria had always had her silky hair draped over her shoulders, framing a carefully made up face. Designer tops and torn up skinny jeans always covered her curvy figure, except for the few times she wrapped herself in thousand dollar dresses. The young woman running excitedly up the sidewalk had none of these features.

No, this Gloria had an impossibly frizzy ponytail that bounced with every clumsy step she took. It flopped over a too-big sweatshirt that covered any figure she might have. Instead of her body, a logo for a video game tournament was on display. Paint-stained pants and muddy converse made up her lower half. This Gloria even had a small pair of reading glasses jutting out of her back pocket, next to her phone and a spare paintbrush. Bill had always suspected that Gloria wore contacts, but he wasn’t sure that an alternate dimension confirmed it.

Bill stood up and, not knowing what else to do, spread his arms open wide for Gloria to fall into. She laughed, not some small, cutesy thing but a hearty, deep-throated guffaw, and pressed her head deep into Bill’s chest.

“I forgot how cozy you are,” Gloria mumbled. Bill did what he supposed was the gentlemanly thing to do, and hugged Gloria back. He had to admit, she was right. This was cozy. “Sorry I didn’t call you. I was stuck with my mom all week.”

When Tom and Gloria were dating, Bill had had a couple run-ins with her mother, Ariadne. To say that they were miserable would be an insult to misery. She was strict, overbearing, clingy, and even louder than her daughter. Bill had never thought that he would feel bad for Gloria, but these few encounters had softened him to the girl.

“Sounds awful,” Bill said as Gloria reluctantly pulled herself away from him. She was careful to keep her hands in his. “What were you doing?”

Confusion crossed Gloria’s now-pale face? “You don’t remember? I was at that gaming competition, the one in California? I got this rocking sweatshirt out of it!” All signs of disappointment left Gloria as she admired her hoodie, but they suddenly returned when Bill coughed to grabbed her attention. “It was really important to me. How’d you forget?”

Bill had never played poker, or gambled all that much, mostly because of his truly terrible poker face. Right now, Gloria was staring at a mess of sweat, nervous smiling, and bulging eyes. “It’s, uh, it’s really early. Babe,” Bill added with no tact or romance. “It just... slipped my mind?”

“Uh-huh, sure it did.” Gloria rolled her eyes. It seemed that even with the changes to her appearance, she’d kept her perception and ruthless sarcasm. “Look, if you forgot, you can just tell me. I’d be upset, but I won’t break up with you over your memory.”

Had Bill known this version of Gloria for any decent amount of time, he would know that she was telling the truth. Unfortunately, he was used to the popular, mean girl Gloria, who had used and abused his friend for nearly his entire life. So when every bone in Bill’s body told him that this level of care and understanding was a trap, he believed it over the love he was receiving.

“I, uh, look,” Bill sputtered, desperately looking for a way to escape his apparent girlfriend. “I don’t know if, uh, if I...”

“If what?”

Before Bill could do any serious damage to his relationship, his eyes caught sight of a car driving towards his house. It was close enough that he could vaguely make out the person driving. “Who’s that?” he asked, completely oblivious to his changing the subject.

Gloria pouted, but turned around anyways. “It doesn’t matter, Bill. Can you just- Wait. I recognize that car!”
114112.title: Gloria changes into Bill’s perfect woman

11412.content:
Gloria shook her head. Bill and Tom were so ridiculous sometimes. It's like they were joined at the hip! Tom never ONCE stood up for her the way he always went to bat for Bill.

“God, you two should get a room! It's like you love Bill other more than you love me, Tom!”

“Hey, at least Bill was there for me when you turned everyone against me, Gloria!”

“I only told them the truth, you idiot!”

“You're full of shit. I never did half the things you accused me of!”

“Hey Gloria, don't call Tom an idiot. He's going through a hard time right now” said Bill with his hands out in front of him. He was trying to signal to Gloria to calm down a little. Somehow, he instinctively knew that the gemstone Gloria was holding was about to do something bad if she got anymore angry. Gemstones aren't mood rings, at least ordinary ones. They don't erupt into colors the second somebody gets angry.

“I thought I told you to shut up!” spat Gloria, not even looking over at Bill.

“Bill can say whatever he feels like saying, Gloria! He's not one of your sycophantic cheerleader friends!”

Gloria's face was turning red. She was losing control.

“You fucking idiot, Tom! You're so out of touch. You don't have a clue what's going on! You don't want to get back together, fine! Get out of my life! I wish that you and Bill would just become the old married couple you guys act like!”

The moment Gloria said that, the gemstone burst open an onslaught of emerald magic. Turning deathly cold, Gloria dropped the gemstone as it covered the street corner in its gelid glow. It fired on for a moment, and just as quickly vanished into nonexistence, as if nothing had happened at all.

Where Bill had just been standing now stood a middle-aged man, himself at fifty years old. He was a few inches taller now, and unlike a moment before, he was actually in pretty good athletic shape despite possessing a small paunch. He had a well defined musculature, and he was more handsome than he had been as a teenager, somewhere along the way having developed rugged good looks. But the world did seem somewhat different, sharper, and Bill was suddenly aware of a pair of glasses resting on his nose. He felt a tickle beneath his nose and a quick check later revealed a bushy moustache spanning across his upper lip. He felt a coolness on top of his head that hadn't been there before and another cursory check revealed a receding line of short course hair. His clothing seemed like he was about to go to work. He was wearing a short-sleeved polo shirt with a collar and a pair of nice looking pair of khakis and a pair of brown tennis shoes. Definitely business casual, almost as if he was preparing to go to work!

Where Tom had stood now stood a middle-aged woman of about the same age as Bill. She was blonde haired like Tom was, although she wore it in a long bob that framed her pretty, well made up face. Despite years as a sedentary housewife, her figure had somehow only barely diminished, and she was overweight, with a large rear that bulged from her 'mom jeans'. Most of the weight was concentrated in her posterior and hips, her stomach not swollen but certainly not fit as a small muffin top poked against her white undershirt and sky-blue cardigan. Her breasts were still firm and full and a pair of small framed glasses sat on her nose. All in all, especially for a woman who was nearly two feet shorter than Tom had been, she looked good.

"Really good" Bill thought as he stared over his own changed hands at the woman, who was examining her own petite hands with a smile on her face. Bill felt something stir in his dockers before a flash of dark hair drew his attention as Gloria quickly picked up the Ahn'Ger stone from where she had dropped it on the ground, and she looked up at the two strange adults with a mixture of fear, curiosity, and laughter.

Option 1: It is still the present day. Bill and Tom have transformed into Bill and Tammy Strasserman, a married couple who live across the street from Gloria's house. Bill is now Gloria's mother's boss at work.

Option 2: It is now forty years in the future. Bill and Tom(Tammy) are still old and married to each other, but Gloria has aged as well.

Option 3: Bill, Tom(Tammy) and Gloria are in the past! But when?
11412.title: I Hope I Die Before I Get Old

114121.content:
New memories started to fill into Bill's mind. He was still Bill Strasserman, but now he was the brother to his former father, as opposed to being their son. He was now born in 1968 instead of 2000, graduating high school in 1986 and college in 1990. He had met Tammy Ackerton in college, during a meeting at the school's television station, his sophomore year, 1988. Their first date was seeing Who Framed Roger Rabbit at the local movie theater, and they were madly in love ever since.

Over the years, Bill had made his way up through business school, and now was chief officer of sales in the northern midwest region for Veracity Banking, at which Gloria's Mother worked. He was now the boss of Gloria's Mother. How crazy was that?

As more memories flooded in, things got even crazier for Bill. Tammy's dreams of being a news anchor were put on hold after she got pregnant shortly after college, and their only child, a daughter named Willow, was born in 1993. Willow, now 25, was persuing her dream of a career in animation over in Los Angeles.

Bill was a father now. He couldn't fathom what had just happened. His thoughts were interrupted by a laugh. Gloria's laugh.

"I can't believe it! You two are a married couple now! You got what you deserved!" Gloria said.


Option 1: Bill realizes Tammy doesn't remember her life as Tom as she scolds Gloria for laughing. Bill plays along with a "Respect your elders, young lady" speech in hopes of getting the stone back.

Option 2: Bill realizes that the stone did this and argues with Gloria about it. However, Tammy snatches up the stone, and reveals that she sort of likes being Tammy as opposes to Tom.
114121.title: Bill and Tammy Strasserman

1141212.content:
Bill was feeling overwhelmed. Suddenly having an entire lifetime's worth of memories poured into his brain was making him dizzy, and he struggled to not pass out from the sheer abundance of it. Memories of growing up in the 70s and 80s with his own father Greg as his brother. Memories of Generation X touchstones that he hadn't even been alive to witness flashed before his eyes: Watching the end of the Vietnam War on an old fashioned CRT TV with his parents, seeing the Challenger explosion happen on live TV in the high school auditorium, witnessing the fall of the Berlin Wall one night at the college bar, his anger at the OJ trial verdict, his sadness at Princess Diana's death, preparing for Y2K and Tammy making fun of him for it, watching 9/11 happen at work and suddenly having the impetus to take Willow out of school that day. All of it would be too much to take all on its own, but in addition, Bill also had his original memories of him still being just seventeen. He still remembered walking off his family's porch ten minutes ago fuming about not having a girlfriend and having to deal with Tom and Gloria's relationship drama. He still remembered that his calculus homework was due today. These competing memories clashed and negated each other, and yet, Bill felt that somehow they were both still true. Bill was reminded of when he read 1984. The concept of doublethink in Orwell's novel meant to hold two contradictory pieces of information in your mind and accept both as equally true. That's what these new memories felt like. He had to ignore the madness of realzing the contradictions of that paradox for now and shook his head.

Meanwhile, Gloria was still cackling, gloating in her having gotten one over on her knucklehead sadsack of a boyfriend.

“You two look so adorable together!” she squealed. “Can I see the wedding photos? Where'd you go on your honeymoon?” she asked sarcastically. It was at that point when Gloria stopped and realized that the gemstone that Bill had...she still had it, and she could use it to do anything she wanted.

Gloria made several attempts wishing for things- money, eternal youth, fame, glory- all of the greatest hits, but she grew increasingly frustrated that none of her wishes seemed to be working. The gemstone she was holding in her hand lacked even the briefest flicker of the glorious light that it had produced a moment ago.

“The fuck? Does this thing only work once!?” screamed Gloria, shaking the gemstone in a futile gesture, perhaps trying to wake up the genie that she thought might be inside.

Bill started to argue with Gloria, demanding Gloria to give the stone back because he found it first and he needed it to return reality back to normal. His deeper voice and overall demeanor made Bill very authoritative now, but the defiant Gloria wasn't having it.

“Nuh uh” she said childishly, shaking her head. “If you think I'm ever giving this to ANYONE ever again, you've got another thing coming, Bill! This rock is magic. Like, actual magic. I just changed existence itself with it. I'm never giving this up!”
