“Gloria, this isn't funny” said Bill intently. He couldn't believe how much his voice sounded like his own father's. “Do you have any idea how insane this is? I can't allow you to just waltz away with that stone and rob me of forty years of my life. Give it to me.”

“Or else what?” said Gloria.

“Or else I'll overpower you and take it from you. I'm a lot stronger now in case you haven't recognized. I'm freaking Wolverine now.”

“Exactly Bill, you look just like somebodies dad. If some pedestrian drives by and sees a grown ass man like you trying to wrestle something away from a little girl like me, who are they going to sympathize with?”

“Uh...I'm your mother's boss now! I can get her fired and have the both of you put on the street!”

Gloria smirked. “You haven't met my mom. If you ever tried to fire her, it'd be weeks until they found your body.”

“Yeah right, Gloria. Just because you...”

Meanwhile, while Bill and Gloria continued to bicker over the gemstone, Tom was growing confused at how happy, how blissful these new memories as Tammy Strasserman were making him feel. Call him crazy, but he could actually get used to being an older woman. Was he actually transgender this entire time? Tom had never felt uncomfortable being a man before. No, it wasn't his new gender. It was something else. In this new reality, he felt loved. Tammy's memories were filled with almost nothing but wedded bliss. Memories of Bill and Tammy on their many vacations all over the world. Memories of romantic candlelit dinners. Memories of seeing Bill's ripped abs riding on top of her as they made love. Memories of Bill chasing down a man six blocks who had stolen her purse. Memories of their daughter Willow, and how they had both had nurtured her into the wonderful young woman that she was now. Sure, Bill and Tammy had arguments like every couple did, but the fights never lasted very long, and they almost always gave way to the joys of kissing and making up. Not like his toxic relationship with Gloria, who made everything about herself and never accepted that she was wrong.

In the original reality, Tom was miserable. Gloria and her gang had turned him into a social pariah. He was constantly made to feel like shit for things he never did. Tom had never told anyone this, not even Bill, but he had considered suicide at one point. Maybe that's why this new reality seemed so attractive to him. Here, as Tammy, she was respected. She had a loving husband and a loving daughter, and she and Bill lived in a wonderful house without a care in the world. It was so saccharine that most people would puke, but Tom was clinging to any kind of acceptance he could. He loved recalling new life. He wanted to be Tammy Strasserman forever.

Option 1: Tom/Tammy somehow convinces Gloria to give up the stone, and she begs Bill to play at being a married couple for a week. If he doesn't like it, she promises that they can turn back.

Option 2: Tammy decides to fix things then and now by making a wish.

Option 3: Gloria, angry at Bill's threats, makes another wish.
1141212.title: This Is Us

11412121.content:
Tom, who was now so into the idea of remaining Tammy that he started to truly think of himself as Tammy, was broken out of her peaceful bliss by the continued yelling of her sweet Bill and that dreadful Gloria, who even in this reality still seemed to be a spoiled brat, a girl who wanted to always get her way. Tammy watched as the stone glowed. Her eyes widened in a bit of fear. Obviously the stone is what caused all this in the first place, and it's glow most likely meant that it was about to do its magic at the next wish. Tammy didn't want to lose this opportunity as quickly as she had gained it. She didn't want to be Tom again, at least not until she gave this a try. She had to speak up.

"Bill. Gloria. Give me that stone. Now!" Tammy said, her voice taking on a very motherly tone.

Bill and Gloria looked at the former Tom in a bit of shock. Both Gloria and Bill realized that this large woman had been quiet for most of the previous precedings. And now that she spoke, it completely drew her attention.

"Look, obviously that stone is very powerful, and however it works, we need to make sure we don't send ourselves hurdling into another reality. And if you two can't handle it, let a third party try and take control for a second." Tammy said.

As it was, Tammy was lying through her teeth. In fact, she was already thinking of ways to possibly use this stone to make her new life permanent. But for the moment, she had to get the stone away from the emotions of Bill and Gloria.

"You know I'm right." Tammy said, looking to Gloria and Bill.

Gloria, who was currently holding the stone, looked to Bill, and considered for a moment that something like that could happen to her if she wasn't careful. She really wanted the rich and famous life she was trying to get... but she couldn't bring herself to argue with her former boyfriend's logic. Reluctantly, she handed the stone to Tammy.

"Good. Now, Bill... I have a proposition for you." Tammy said. Bill looked on in curiosity.

"Tom..." Bill said.

"Bill, please, call me Tammy." Tammy said. Bill looked a bit concerned, but nodded.

"Listen... what if we played in this reality for a week? What if we lived the life of a married couple? We have the memories, we have the connection, let's just give it a try?"

"Tammy, you really... want to be my wife for a week?" Bill said.

"We can spend some time reasearching this stone, seeing if there are any legends or anything... plus we'll get a chance to be something new. Look, if this doesn't work out in a week, and if we don't find anything, I promise I'll try to wish us back. Please, honey? Can we be husband and wife?" Tammy exclaimed, that last "honey" accidently slipping from his mouth.

Bill looked on in a bit of shock, but it was that honey that Tammy slipped out that really did the trick. He now had many memories how how much he loved his wife, and he couldn't say no to her.

"OK, Tammy, fine. But only if we actually get to do some research on this thing." Bill said.

"Oh, thank you Bill! Thank you honey!" Tammy said, giving Bill a big kiss on the lips. Bill couldn't help to think this was weird... but also... he was sort of into it?


Option 1: Gloria changes her mind, angry about how happy Tom is as Tammy, and demands the stone back. Angry at Gloria's selfishness, Tammy wishes Gloria was the Stasserman family dog. Bill is both horrified and aroused by this development.

Option 2: Gloria leaves to explore her Tom and Bill-less life, leaving Tammy and Bill to be a loving couple.
11412121.title: Tom is Tammy

114121211.content:
Bill and Tammy's romantic epiphany lasted for a brief moment before being cut off by a sound of utter disgust and revulsion.

“You have got to be kidding me!”

Bill and Tammy looked around Gloria, who was now fuming.

“What?” asked Bill, blankly. He was still recovering from that knockout of a kiss.

“Not you, Bill. Tom. I can't believe it! I was joking when I said that you two should be a married couple, but apparently he really DOES love you more than he loves me!”

Tammy looked at Gloria with a look of annoyance.

“The adults are kissing, Gloria. Go away now. There's some cheers that need leading. Go hang out with Jon Ingerman or something. Let him be your boyfriend for a while.”

“Eww!” exclaimed Gloria. “No, I'm not going out with that nine month mistake. I want you! That's why I came over here to begin with!”

“Gloria, please” said Tammy in a firm but gentle voice, letting go of Bill. “I've made my decision. Maybe we can patch things over later, but I'm not in the mood to talk to you right now.”

“Goddammit, give me the stone back!”

“No” said Tammy defiantly.

“Urgh!” growled Gloria in a whiny voice of frustration. “I try to do the right thing and make the rebound even though it's YOU who should have been trying to make things up to ME, and this is what I get! Well it's obvious that you're happy being a kept woman, so you don't even need it anymore!”

“No” insisted Tammy. “This stone is staying with us until we figure out what to do with it. You're proven that you're not responsible with it. You've got to earn your trust back.”

“FUCK YOU!” screamed Gloria as she ran at Tammy, trying to grab the Ahn'Ger stone. Bill himself was so shocked that he hadn't had time to try and stop her, although Tammy was. Although she was now a middle aged woman with a sedentary lifestyle, four years of being a basketball player as Tom had honed her reflexes, and she easily evaded Gloria's telegraphed attempts to wrestle the magic artifact from her grasp.

“Damn it, give it back!” said Gloria as she wrestled on the ground with Tammy. If she had seen the stone's emerald glow, she may have rethought her decision and backed off. Then again, maybe she wouldn't have. The Vanapoulos family were known for their stubbornness.

“Bad girl!” laughed Tammy playfully, still evading Gloria's every attempt at reneging on her promise. That was, until Gloria slapped her in the face, stinging her skin a little. That part actually shocked Tammy.

“You want to be a brat? Fine. I wish you were our dog!” she yelled angrily, knowing what she was doing.

Gloria's body was suddenly covered in the gemstone's green flare. Her body shimmered and shrunk, retracting into a smaller, more compressed shape. Just a few brief moments later, in the dark haired girl's place now stood a friendly looking Labrador Retriever!

“Ha!” laughed Tammy. “That's what you get, Gloria!”

“Woof!” barked Gloria, trying and failing to enunciate human speech. “Woof! Woof!”

Once Gloria realized that she couldn't speak English anymore, her new body now took on a cowering, more frightened picture. Gloria realized that she couldn't even see in color anymore.

Option 1: Gloria acquiesces to being Bill and Gloria's dog in the hopes that eventually they will turn her back to normal.

Option 2: Gloria still desperately tries to knock the gemstone out of Tammy's hand in the hopes that she can wish herself back to normal.
114121211.title: Gloria the Family Dog

1141212111.content:
Gloria the Black Furred Labrador looked up at her apparent new owner, Tammy, who was chuckling to herself at the sight of her former girlfriend in a dog's body. In that moment, Gloria considered her options. She could either go on the attack, try to get the stone, wish herself back. But truly, was it worth the risk? She couldn't even speak English! Would she be able to even wish herself back with just barks and growls? And if she did fail... well... was it possible that Tammy could come up with something worse to change her into?

The other option... Gloria didn't really like... but she really had no choice. She was gonna be the best dog possible, in hopes that Tammy and Bill eventually would be nice enough to change her back.

Gloria rushed up on all fours to Tammy, bounded up to place her new paws on Tammy's shoulders, and began to lick Tammy's face like there was no tomorrow. She had to convince Tammy that she was... well, a good dog.

"Down, girl! Down!" Tammy laughed, and Gloria found herself obeying, going back to all fours and panting. She was loyal, and a good girl for her master... wait, did she think that? Was playing into the dog role giving her a dog's emotions?

"Let's see how smart you are, girl. Sit!" Tammy said. And indeed, Gloria obeyed, sitting on her haunches, tail wagging behind her.

"Good girl! Speak!" Tammy said.

"Woof!" Gloria barked. She liked being called a good girl. It felt.. right! It felt... natural.

"Good girl! Such a good girl!" Tammy said, as she leaned down to scratch Gloria's floppy ears. Gloria's tail wagged even faster, her tongue panting more and more. Tammy was right! She was a good girl! And this ear scratching felt so good. There was a part of Gloria that tried to hold onto her human past, remembering her mission to become human again... but a larger part of her was satisfied with the ear scratching. A larger part of her hoped her male master would take her for a walk later. A larger part of her just wanted to be a good girl.

As Gloria descended further into a doggy lifestyle, Tammy couldn't help but to laugh.

"Well, that worked out rather well... and now... back to us..." Tammy said, returning to Bill's gaze.


Option 1: Bill is horrified that Tammy just took away Gloria's human will like that. He secretly plots to get the stone away from Tammy before she goes mad with power.

Option 2: Bill is surprisingly turned on by Tammy's actions. The two become the Bonnie and Clyde of magical stones, and plan ways to use the stone to imrpove their lives as they grow more and more aroused.

Option 3: Gloria manages to hold onto her humanity, and plots to return to normal.
1141212111.title: Good Girl!

1141212112.content:
Gloria couldn't believe it. She was a dog! Tammy... Tom had turned into into a black labrador retriever! Gloria let out a low growl as she looked at Tammy laughing at her. This had gone far enough. Tom wouldn't control her life, literally and figuratively. No way Tom would be taking her for walks or making her a statue or something. She was gonna get back to being human. No matter what.

On intinct, Gloria jumped at Tammy, biting her arm in the process. Tammy was so stunned by the turn of events that the Stone dropped out of her hand and to the ground. As if in slow motion, both Tammy and Gloria watched as the stone hit the floor.

Gloria wasted no time, and lunged towards the stone, placing her paw on top of it. She growled and barked, hoping that would be enough to activate the stone and fix this nonsense once and for all.


Option 1: It works! The stone can just read pure emotion. However, Gloria has still not learned her lesson. She wishes to be human, but creates a reality where humans are pets and dogs are the dominant species.

Option 2: It doesn't work! The stone needs words for wishes to be made. Tammy retakes control of the stone, and uses it to make Gloria forget about her human past.
1141212112.title: Bad Dog!

114121212.content:
“O...K?” asked Gloria as she saw Bill and her former boyfriend locking lips like they were actually married. “So what should I do now?”

“What any good sixteen year old girl does...go to school” answered Bill as he groped Tammy's buttocks in a rather frisky manner that he remember his wife loving. He didn't even look at Gloria when he had said that, as he was too focused on being in the throws of loves with Tammy...his wife of almost thirty years.

“Am I going to get the stone back, at least? Do I at least get a parting gift? A simple thank you? I'm the one that made you a married couple in the first place!”

“In a week, Gloria” answered Tammy, not really paying attention to her either as she stared lovingly into Bill's soulful blue eyes and sensually traced her fingers down her husband's rock hard chest.

“Ugh...get a room. Nobody wants to see you two old folks making out in public.”

Bill and Tammy both suddenly recalled how much they enjoyed making public displays of love when they were younger, and they weren't going to stop now. Bill had even already forgotten about this blonde woman formerly being his male best friend less than an hour ago. They continued to ignore Gloria.

“Fuck you guys” whispered Gloria as she stomped away. “First Tom won't accept me forgiving him, and then Bill steals him away!” she quietly muttered to herself.

**

On the frustrating walk to school, Gloria noticed her mother's 2009 Saturn Aura passing by her. Ariadne waved in a friendly manner out the window at her daughter. Gloria waved back, almost out of duty. Ariadne would have asked if Gloria wanted a ride, but she already knew the answer. Gloria wanted to spend as much time away from her mother as possible, so the car passed by her on Ariadne's way to work.

As she trudged along, lost in thought over what a mistake it had been to come over to Bill's house today, that she should have listened to her gut feeling and just continue keeping Tom removed from her life, Gloria noticed with trepidation a cool breeze in the air and a sudden drop in brightness. The sunny, cheerful morning was now rapidly giving way to cloud cover. Dark clouds. Within a minute of walking, she heard thunder in the distance, and before Gloria knew it, it began to rain.

“Oh great” said the younger Vanapoulos, not having possessed the foresight to carry an umbrella. She took off her backpack and carried it over her head.

**

Meanwhile, Bill and Tammy were still holding each other, exploring the other's body for the first time in a way only a loving married couple can. They both kept it above the waist, but the intent was clear. They may as well have been making love.

When it began to pour rain, Tammy started to laugh and hugged Bill tightly across the chest.

“This is just like The Notebook!” she said, which Bill's new memories recalled was Tammy's favorite romantic movie, a movie that she forced her husband to watch too many times for his liking. Despite that, Bill laughed at the reference and just the sheer weirdness of this morning. They kissed one more time, reminding each other of Ryan Gosling and Rachel McAdams.

“C'mon, lets go inside before we catch our death of cold” said Bill with a smile, grabbing Tammy's hand. Understanding the intent, and without any desire to return to her life as Tom, Tammy smiled back.

Giggling like the kids they were, in mind if not in body, Bill and Tammy ran inside the house, quickly locked their front door, and they began voraciously discarding each other's wet clothes all over the spacious home as well as the stairwell as they made a carnal journey to the master bedroom.

**

As Gloria reached school, the rain had intensified, and afraid that the constant downpour would wreck her school work, Gloria removed it as head cover and carried the pack around her chest the rest of the way, simply bearing the rain. To make matters worse, the onslaught of water wasn't the warm, breezy summer rain that she enjoyed playing in as a little kid. It was the cold, oppressive rain that felt like bullets as they landed on your skin hundreds at a time, just making you miserable. Gloria felt every drop of that cold hell. She ran up the front stairs as fast as she could and opened the door to enter. Shivering, Gloria decided to take a quick trip to the restroom to readjust herself.

She looked in the mirror.

“I look like a drowned rat” she muttered with horror. Her hair was soaking wet, as were her clothes. Looking downward, she realized that her feet and sandals were now covered in mud.

“Ugh!” was the sound she uttered. Gloria took them off and washed her feet in the sink, feeling like she was a total pig. She then wiped downher sandals of telltale mud stains using paper towels. Finally, Gloria took a couple of deep breaths and stared at herself in the mirror.

“You're Gloria Vanapoulos. You've handled worse than this. You're brave. You're fierce. You're not a failure” she said in a soft yet firm tone to her reflection like it was therapy and marched out of the lavatory to her first class.

Actually, Gloria Vanapoulos was terrified. Her former boyfriend and his spaz of a best friend had stumbled upon a magic gemstone that could change reality. They were essentially gods with it, and she gave it away like a total idiot!

As she walked to class, she wondered why she did.

“How!? How the hell did Tom mind trick me?” she muttered under her breath.

Maybe it was Tom's new motherly demeanor, and Gloria didn't need to be reminded that she had issues with mother figures. In retrospect, Tammy actually came across like she was probably as sweet as she seemed and was a far cry from the emotionally abusive domineering witch that Ariadne was, but nonetheless, the trauma and the button triggered it were both still there.

Gloria would have to analyze her anxiety and self loathing at a later date, as she had to go to Calculus. She walked through Mr. Thompson's door discreetly and looked for her usual seat.

“Ms. Vanapoulos, you're late” said the stern teacher.

“Damn it” muttered Gloria, hoping that he would have noticed her, as the lights were dimmed to show Mr. Thompson's lecture on the overhead projector.

“I'm sorry, Gloria. I don't want to do this, but since this is your second tardy this week, I'm going to have to count that as a strike on your record, Gloria”.

“Yes, Mr. Thompson. It won't happen again. Family emergency” she lied.

Mr. Thompson nodded his head stoically, and then went back to discussing L'Hopital's rule for derivatives.

Three strikes meant that you were suspended from school for a week, which is something that Ariadne would never let her hear the end of, so gulping, Gloria pulled out her notebook and began putting pen to paper.

Option 1: In this new reality, Gloria has a new boyfriend, one who treats her like dirt and is controlling over her life the same way her mom is. To make matters worse: With a more sullen, depressed personality, Gloria no longer has the sway over her girl clique that she once did, and now even has several rivals. Gloria suffers through a day of school waiting to get back to Bill and Tammy so she can wish this horrible reality away. Too bad blissful Tammy has designs on making this reality permanent.

Option 2: Meanwhile, at Bill and Tammy's house...

Option 3: Something else.
114121212.title: Gloria and the Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day

114122.content:
Bill couldn't believe what was happening. He had somehow aged 40 years, and his best friend Tom was now a woman, and apparently his wife. His sudden thoughts on the matter were interuptted by the laughter of Gloria.

"My... Wish! It came true! You two are really a married couple! Aww you look so cute together in your old age." Gloria laughed. It didn't seem like she was even considering the ramifications of her actions, or the fact that her wish even came true. She was just having too much fun.

Bill looked across to Gloria, and couldn't help but laugh himself. It seemed Gloria was missing a minor detail.

"I wouldn't talk so quickly, Gloria." Bill said, unnerved by the deepness of his voice.

"What do you mean?" Gloria said, her smile fading.

"You might want to look in a mirror, sweety." Said Tammy, finally speaking up. Her voice was tender but firm.

Gloria rushed to the mirror in the house's hallway and let off a tiny scream. She had aged as well! Her dark hair had bits of grey around it, wrinkles covered her face, and she now wore a very mature looking black jacket with a blue dress. She looked like a slightly off version of her mother.

"Oh my god, what is happening?" Gloria asked. "How could this have happened!"

"Well... judging by the calender over there, this isn't 2018 any more. We're in 2058." Bill said.

The three of them looked around the house, which now had a sleek, retro-future look.

"But.... How?" was all Gloria could muster.


Option 1: Before the three of them could discuss further, Bill and Tammy's now 26 year old daughter Willow makes a surprise visit home.

Option 2: Bill, Tammy, and Gloria explore the future, both what's happened in history/ technology and their personal lives between 2018 and 2058.
114122.title: The Future Comes Faster Than You Think.

1141221.content:
“This is a nightmare” bemoaned Gloria as she took inventory of her aged face in the mirror again, pulling on some of her gray hairs for inspection. “I'm hideous. What the hell is this thing, Bill?” she asked holding out the magic wishing rock theatrically for Bill to see.

“Uh...apparently it's a magic wishing rock?” said Bill, lost for words in his deeper voice. He looked at himself at the mirror himself. 'Not too shabby' he thought to himself.

“It's a cursed piece of shit is what it is” fumed Gloria.

“Oh, why couldn't you have turned into a puppy, or some ducks?” Bill joked.

Tammy's eyes darted around the house. The first thing she saw were a pair of photos: One when she and Bill had first gotten married. Tammy was wearing a gorgeous wedding gown based on a design from the 1800s, and Bill's thousand watt smile could melt anyone's heart. The date at the bottom said 5/8/2025. The second photo was of the two them, now older, perhaps in their late thirties or early forties, standing next to a teenage girl at Disneyland, all three in front of the famous copper statue of Walt and Mickey Mouse holding hands. It took only a moment for Tammy to realize that the teenage girl was their daughter. Tammy recalled her name: Willow. Willow had both of her parents physical characteristics, and she seemed particularly happy being at Disneyland. Tammy further recalled that Willow was interested in animation beyond just entertainment and fandom. She wanted to pursue it as a career, and Tammy remembers both she and Bill being very supportive of it. Early memories of Willow's artistic abilities flashed through her mind. Either way, all three of them in the picture were wearing Mickey Mouse hats and seemed like they were living the American dream. They seemed so happy...so blissful. Tom had always wanted to visit Disneyland, but he never had the chance to. This reality, despite the forty years of aging, seemed so much nicer than the one Tom had ten minutes ago. He...she could get used to this.

Bill and Gloria continued to bicker for a little bit, with Bill needling Gloria for how old she looked(She didn't actually look THAT bad, but Gloria couldn't stand it, both out of vanity as well as the psychic pain of not wanting to look like her mother). Gloria on the other hand reminded Bill who still had the stone, and how she was going to turn Bill into a ferret if he didn't shut up. Their fighting and Tammy's reverie were interrupted however by a loud honking noise coming from outside.

A cold robotic voice that sounded like the Siri app then erupted throughout the house like Reveille.

“Incoming call from: Willow”

“That's our daughter, Bill!” yelled Tammy with excitement from the living room.

“Our daughter?” asked Bill, confused. He was too busy quarreling with Gloria to recall his new memories, but neither he, nor Gloria, nor Tammy could ignore the knock on the door. He pulled his vibrating cell phone out his pocket, and saw an image of a pretty young woman who looked like maybe an older version of his sister Kimberly staring right at him.

Tammy then unlocked and opened the front door, revealing said young woman.

“Hey Mom!” squealed Willow, giving Tammy a large bear hug, who reciprocated said hug and squeal in turn.

“Who's that?” asked Gloria, still primping in the mirror.

“Beats me” said Bill, not wanting to admit the possibility running through his head. They both walked into the living room, where Bill was ambushed by another big bear hug.

“Hey Dad! I'm home! Hey Mrs. Vanapoulos, that's a cute jacket you're wearing” added Willow after she gave her father a loving peck on the cheek, looking over her father's shoulder at her childhood neighbor.

“Thanks?” added Gloria, who didn't really like the jacket.

Willow let go of Bill and composed herself.

“Mom, Dad...I've got great news, and I just HAD to tell both of you in person!” she said excitedly.

Bill's mind melted. The very first attractive woman to ever kiss him was his own daughter. He felt simultaneously disgusted, confused, and embarrassed. He wasn't anywhere near emotionally ready to be a parent, and yet, here she was, bursting with energy and gusto. He heard her speak, saw her mouth moving a mile a second, but the entire time Bill was lost in thought at this strange new reality. Suddenly he saw Willow childishly snapping her fingers in his face.

“Dad! Didn't you hear a word I said!?” giggled Willow. “I...”

Option 1: After two years of working on other people's shows, Willow is finally getting to create her own animated TV series. The plot of the cartoon, about a magic rock that warps reality and grants wishes, but only when the user is angry, is disturbingly close to the events of this morning.

Option 2: Mutants with superhuman powers exist in the future of 2058. Willow has just discovered that she is a mutant. A quite powerful one.
1141221.title: Make Way For Willow!

choices: Gloria wants to tell Willow the Truth.
11412211.content:
"I finally got my own show!" Willow exclaimed. "It's going to be airing on Disney Channel in the fall!"

The same memories that had entered Tammy's head not too long ago had now entered Bill's mind. The trips to Disney World. Watching Little Mermaid and Zootopia and Sleeping Beauty and Ducktales over and over again. Buying tours of Cartoon Network and the Disney Studio for Willow. Sending Willow off to LA for school. Her being very excited to get her first gig. And now, this moment, this moment where this girl claiming to be his daughter now had found true success.

"Oh sweetheart! We're so proud of you! We're so happy all your dreams are coming true!" Tammy exclaimed, trying to save face for Bill's lack of engagement. Bill took the message. It was almost as if he knew his wife better than anyone, even though his wife was supposed to be his best friend.

"Yeah. Willow... that's amazing. I'm just trying to... take in this amazing news! What's the show about?" Bill asked, trying his damndest to be a good dad.

"I thought you'd never ask! Well, it's about these three friends. Brad, Tim, and Gina, and they find a magical rock that grants them wishes, but only when they are angry enough! Now, that gets them into all sorts of hijinks every week. Like, one week, Brad's accidently turned into Gina's poodle. And then the next week Gina finds herself in 1920s New York... and there's a whole mythology..."

As Willow went on and on about all her plans for the show, Bill, Tammy, and Gloria all looked at each other. This was sounding familiar. Much too familiar...

"And there's a whole bunch of other stones we can introduce in season 2, and beyond! It'll be like that old show Gravity Falls! We can have an endgame!"

"That's... amazing sweetheart." Bill said, a little shocked.


Option 1: Bill and Tammy try to get Willow to share more about the backstory of the stone, and even get her to talk about the other "stones" she has planned for season 2.

Option 2: As Gloria goes to put away her things, Gloria tries to convince Bill and Tammy to just show Willow the real stone and tell her what actually happened. Tammy is reluctant, wanting to keep this reality, and Bill is reluctant, felling like he doesn't want to somehow destroy Willow's dreams.
11412211.title: Willow's New Show!

114122111.content:
Once Willow calmed down a little bit from her big news, Tammy invited her into the living room to sit on the comfy couch.

As Tammy looked at some of Willow's concept artwork for the show that she brought with her, trying to play the role of supportive mother, Bill glanced over at Gloria, who was wearing an over the top expression of stunned disbelief. Gloria's jaw was dropped, her eyes were practically escaping from her sockets, and then she whispered: “Should we tell her?”.

Bill shook his head and whispered back softly: “Not yet”.

They both walked into the living room, where Bill saw some of Willow's drawings sitting on the coffee table as she was explaining them to Tammy.

“And this is Brad. He's more or less the main character.”

Bill glanced at the sketch and noticed that “Brad” looked very much like he himself normally looked. Not 100% identical, but close enough to be disturbing to Bill. The drawing Willow was showing had Brad first discovering what Willow called the “Grellstone”, picking up the mysterious artifact that somehow appeared on his front porch. Below Brad was some black text- the narration that was going to be added to the show once it started being produced.

“WHY COULDN'T LIFE JUST BE EASIER? WHY DO I HAVE TO SUFFER BECAUSE OF SOME IDIOT NEANDERTHAL, OR WAIT AROUND LIKE A DOOFUS FOR MY SADSACK FAILURE OF A FRIEND? OR TAKE CRAP FROM MY FAMILY?”

Bill realized that his internal thoughts- the monologue that goes on his head- more or less said the exact same thing earlier this morning. He was starting to wonder what else Willow knew.

“Honey?” asked Bill as he sat down next to Willow.

“Yeah, Dad?” she asked with a bright smile on her face.

“What's the plot of your first episode?”

Willow laughed.

“Well, that depends on how the Disney Channel decides to schedule everything. They don't always put the episodes in chronological order, but the first episode we're planning on has Brad, Tim, and Gina getting into a fight, and the Grellstone turns them all into adults in their mid-fifties. Towards the beginning, Tim and Gina are boyfriend and girlfriend, but they hate each other, and Gina gets a hold of the stone and wishes that Brad and Tim were an old married couple. Tim transforms into Brad's wife Tabitha. Tabitha wants to stay as an adult woman because she thinks her life is better that way because Gina turned everyone against him in the real world, but Gina hates it because she hates being old, which is understandable. However, her appearance also reminds her too much of her mother Artemis, who Gina sees as a real mean, controlling bitch, but really just wants what's best for her. Meanwhile, Brad wants the stone back for himself because he found it first, and he thinks that it's therefore rightfully his. So for the rest of the episode, they're all scheming to get it back from each other.”

As Willow was enthusiastically explaining the plot, the grin on her face bespeaking her own pride at inventing such a far out and clever plot, Tammy began to become more concerned. The pleasant look on her maternal face began to turn into one of rapt attention at what her daughter was going to say next.

“By the end of the episode, Gina finally gets a hold of the stone, and...”

“And?” added Gloria, who realized that Willow was talking about her.

“And she makes another angry wish that screws everything up even further, but we haven't decided what that'll be yet.”

Willow shrugged her shoulders.

“Sorry! We're still really early in development for this. You three are literally the first people to know who aren't directly involved. Disney would probably sue the pants off of me if they found out I was telling you guys” she said, laughing a little.

“Well that...” Tammy hesitated. “That sounds really creative, honey.”

Gloria looked a little mad, not liking the implication that she screwed things up for everyone in the first place.

“Yeah” said Bill. “I'd watch the hell out of that, Willow. You know how much I love animation.”

Willow laughed.

“That's why I wanted to tell you first, Dad! You're the one that turned me on to all this!”

“So what about those other gemstone you mentioned earlier? The ones you were thinking about putting in Season 2?”

“Oh that! I...”

Option 1: Willow explains that she's planning on there being other gemstones that are powered by different emotions, sort of like Green Lantern, but they are hidden all across the universe.

Option 2: Something else
114122111.title: A Sneak Peek Into The Future

1141221111.content:
"Oh That! I don't have all the specifics about these other gemstones... but I do have some ideas about the future lore and whatnot." Willow said.

"Well, I'd love to hear what you got... this is all so fascinating to me. I'd love to learn so much more. I promise to post no spoilers once the show gets on the air, I promise!" Bill said.

"Yeah, sweetie. We love hearing all this stuff you are so passionate about. The more you have to tell us, the better!" Tammy said, getting into what Bill was trying to do. The more information they had on the stones, the more they could understand what was happening... and the more likely Tammy would find a way to remain Tammy.

"And you don't mind, Mrs. V?" Willow asked.

"No, not at all." Gloria said. To be honest, she had been tuning out much of this, other than the fact that this stone she had was seemingly powered by anger.

"Well, OK! If you insist! Well, there's obviously the Grellstone, which grants wishes through anger, as we've established. There's also the Brellstone, which creates a blissful reality for whoever holds it, but of course, there's always a sort of catch to that thing. Then, there's the Frellstone, based on fear. It essentially reads a person's fear and creates a change or object to protect them from that fear. There's the Drellstone, powered by sadness, and a little similar to the Frellstone, works to make the sadness disappear. And Finally there is the Vrellstone, which is the most powerful of the stones, and is powered by love. But why it's so powerful... well, that's for another time." Willow smirked.

Bill took this all in. These were basically infinity stones, now existing in his reality! All powerful things, objects, with the ability to change and alter the course of space and time. And he was in possession of one of them.


Option 1: Willow goes into one last part of the Grellstone lore, the Two Gods in control of it all.

Option 2: Willow leaves to put her stuff away. Tammy wants to get the Brellstone to create a perfect Tammy life, Gloria wants the Frellstone to take advantage of her fears, and Bill thinks the Anger Stone is enough, even though he is curious about the power of the Vrellstone.
1141221111.title: The Not-Infinity Stones

11412211111.content:
“How are you planning to introduce these other stones?” asked Tammy, trying to keep her daughter on track.

Willow suddenly slowed down a little to think about it.

“Well, like I said, these are all just ideas and they could change at any time, but for one of the stones at least, there has to be some spooky government conspiracy poking their nose where it doesn't belong. I just really dig that as a concept, and it's an easy way to bring in crazy stuff.”

“Like with The Avengers when S.H.I.E.L.D got a hold of the Tesseract” suggested Bill.

“Yep!” smiled Willow. “Or Men In Black, or The X Files, or The Grave of Gunner McNamara.”

“What's that?” asked Bill.

Willow's eyes narrowed.

“Seriously, Dad? My favorite movie? The first time Pixar and Studio Ghibli ever teamed up together?”

Bill caught himself and gave a fake laugh of contrition.

“Ah, silly me” said Bill, poking himself in the head. “I must be getting old.”

“Perish the thought” said Willow. “But yeah, I was thinking that at some point, Brad, Gina, and Tim become embroiled in government shenanigans. Maybe they cause some trouble that's too big to ignore, and they the Feds find out about the Grellstone. Maybe it gets confiscated by some other super secret XYZ agency in the process, and maybe they all end up in some scary black site where people disappear and are never found again. Maybe some goons are working on how to weaponize the power behind the stones and they accidentally release the creators. Maybe...”

“Wait...back that up” said Bill. “What do you mean the creators?”

“Oh...I don't know. I'm just spitballing here. But hey...gemstones...there's probably genies inside it, right? Like the genie in Aladdin? Me and some of the other animators are really keen on adding godlike characters into the story so we can go all meta with it when we feel like it. Every stone could be powered by a different god. Maybe more than one!“

Gloria, looked down at the gemstone she was holding in the palm of her hand. She stared deeply into it, wondering if the reason she had been so transfixed by it this morning was because someone was calling to her. She shook her hand, creeped out by the idea that somebody potentially was watching her.

Option 1: Bill presses Willow to describe the personalities of the “gods” she believed were powering the Anger Stone.

Option 2: Something else
11412211111.title: The Two Gods

114122112.content:
Gloria was having a mini panic attack from this avalanche of weirdness. She had to get out of here! Still holding onto the gemstone, she began to walk hurriedly towards the door to her own home, if she even lived there now, when suddenly a very solid, gut feeling was telling her that she didn't in fact live there anymore. A strange vision, a newfound memory from her recent past was telling Gloria that she lived with Bill and Tammy...Bill and Tom...Bill and Tammy now. This memory was telling her that she was temporarily living in their guest bedroom because she had just gotten divorced from her husband...a Senator! He had cheated on her multiple times, dumped her, and screwed her over in the divorce proceedings. He had done a good job at covering this up, and even though Gloria had raised hell about it in the media, not enough people believed her to make it a political issue.

As Gloria stood there, paralyzed by this new information, indecisive on what to do now, Willow spoke up.

“Oh, I'm so sorry to hear about the divorce, Mrs. V” said Willow, sounding genuinely hurt for Gloria. “Is your mom still OK?”

“She's...”

Gloria's new memories started filling in. Apparently Ariadne was still alive and active.

“She's fine.”

Bill noticed the shocked look in Gloria's eyes. He got up from Willow's little demonstration of her new characters.

“I think I need to help Gloria calm down. Could you just give me a couple of minutes, Willow?”

Willow looked concerned, but she shook her head. “Sure”.

Bill and Gloria began to walk upstairs to the guest room, when Tammy told her daughter that she wanted to make sure that everything was OK and ran upstairs herself.

Inside Gloria's room, Gloria was explaining to Bill the memory she just had.

“THAT SON OF A BITCH!” screamed Gloria. “HOW DARE HE CHEAT ON ME!?”

“Gloria, you literally just found out who this guy was. You have no actual attachment to him. This reality isn't our reality” observed Bill.

“It's the principle of the thing! Nobody cheats on me and gets away with it! It's a rule!”

“Oh brother” said Bill quietly as he rolled his eyes at Gloria.

Tammy then entered the room.

“What are you screaming about now, Gloria?” she asked with a touch of hostility.

“Apparently I have a husband now. An ex-husband. It's so weird. I remember being married to him and everything, and the asshole cheated on me!”

The Ahn'Ger Stone began glowing in her hand a little.

“I can't” said Gloria, starting to hyperventilate. “I can't live in this reality. As funny as it is seeing what you've both turned into, I just can't. It's too painful.”

Bill and Tammy stared at one another.

“What about Willow?” asked Bill.

“What about her!?” asked Gloria, as if that were a stupid question.

“Guys, didn't you see how happy she looked?” Bill continued. “I mean...I know that she's not real-real, but she looked so happy telling us about her show.”

“I'm not happy!” loudly whispered Gloria. “I just got robbed of forty years of my life! And to add insult to injury, I've been humiliated by some ratfaced asshole!”

“I don't want to break Willow's heart. This is like her dream” said Bill, recalling new memories. “Ever since she was a little girl, she's had apparently been obsessed with this.”

“Earth to Bill: She's not really your daughter!” said Gloria, looking at Bill like he was crazy. “This isn't reality. We're still just teenagers!”

“But maybe this reality IS real, just an alternate version of our reality” ruminated Bill, now lost in his own concerns.

“Yeah! That! Listen to Bill” said Tammy.

“Oh stop it, Tom! Stop acting like you're so happy being here!”

“I am!”

“You're actually happy being a middle aged woman?!”

“Yes! I've got a family. Bill and Willow love me and I love them back. I never realized it, but that's all I've ever really wanted, a family to call my own.”

Gloria rolled her eyes and moved her fingers around in a derogatory motion.

“This is the world's smallest violin playing for you”

“Shut up Gloria!”

“No, YOU shut up Tom! I wish...” said Gloria absentmindedly, in a state of anger and panic.

Option 1: Gloria wishes that they were all teenagers again. The wish is granted, and the gemstone transports them all back to 2018...including Willow, who is now also eighteen again.

Option 2: Before Gloria can make a wish, Willow knocks on the door and wants to know if everything is OK. Bill, Gloria, and Tammy stumble over each other trying to come up with a convincing lie.
114122112.title: Gloria wants to tell Willow the Truth.

1141221121.content:
What was it that Gloria truly wished for?

Option 1: She does indeed wish for them to become teenagers again, sending them back to 2018 with one extra passenger.

Option 2: Gloira just wishes that they were younger again. The group becomes toddler age, Bill, Tammy and Gloria are now Willow's kids! Willow is a stay at home mom trying to work at home and take care of three kids!
1141221121.title: Some Younger Options

11412211211.content:
After Gloria's wish, a brilliant green light blinded the room. Bill stood for what seemed for an eternity before the light faded away.

When Bill's eyesight returned, he instantly recognized the place where he stood: His house! As in his house from 2018, not his weird but still really cool future house. Looking down at himself, he found that he was back in the same teenage body he started this day with, Same teenage clothes, same teenage build. Looking up again, he saw Gloria, same as she ever was, except a few moments ago when she was older. But as Bill looked around, he started to see that not everything was back to normal.

First of all, there was Tammy, who had not returned to his Tom form, but was now simply a teenage version of Tammy. She was slightly chubby, not as heavily built as the older version. Her blonde hair flowed downward, and she was wearing a Black Widow Shirt and Jeans. Bill couldn't help but to find himself incredibly attracted to Tammy. He wasn't sure if this was a residual effect of the magic or if Tammy truly just was his ideal woman. But he couldn't stop thinking about how much he wanted to kiss Tammy again.

But then Bill's eyes turned to the other elephant in the room: Willow! She was still rather stylish, wearing nice red dress, and black heels. Bill couldn't help but to wonder what was going through Willow's mind right now. Bill, Gloria, and Tammy obviously knew about this weird stone. But Willow had been a construct of an alternate reality. Does she remember her past? Or has the stone adjusted reality once again?


Option 1: Willow freaks out about her parents being teenagers and being stuck in 2018. Bill and Tammy try to explain, but Willow grabs the stone in a panic.

Option 2: Willow believes she is Bill's sister, at which point Bill realizes that the stone has made more strange changes to reality that he didn't suspect.
11412211211.title: Back to 2018

114122112111.content:
The quartet of teenagers all briefly took stock of their surroundings and their “new” selves. Bill, Gloria, and Tom/Tammy had already suffered the experience of shifting through realities once today, and the second time wasn't any less abnormal or extraordinary.

“Guys, I think we're back home” announced Bill, relieved to hear his normal voice.

“Oh my g...I did it!? I actually fixed things!?” shouted Gloria with a hint of ebullient surprise in her voice as she observed Bill, Gloria still holding the stone in her right hand. She immediately examined her body, her hair, and touched her face. She seemed to be back to normal, and breathed a sigh of relief.

“Yeah. “It looks like were in my folk's guest room still, judging by the cobwebs in the corner since nobody ever actually visits us.”

“Not everything is back to normal, not that I'm complaining” announced Tammy as she examined her own self, a younger facsimile of the woman she had been just a moment ago. She noticed that she was still slightly overweight, with a bit of a soft patch of flesh over her stomach and an overall thicker body, but it was nothing major. Her wavy blonde hair felt oddly comforting as it rested against her shoulders. When she noticed teenage Bill, she immediately felt butterflies. They traded knowing smiles to one another.

The shock of this mystical adventure had momentarily set aside all of the drama that Bill, Gloria, and Tammy were going through this morning. Simultaneously, all three walked up to hug each other.

“Lets never tell anyone about this” said Bill, his voice almost a whisper. “This stone is dangerous”.

“I still want to try and experiment with it. There's got to be a way to use it safely” said Gloria, had hand still gripping the artifact tightly. “Come on, if we crack this, we can have anything we want!”

“Maybe. We've got to get to school first though or my parents will kill me. We can play around with it later” said Tammy. She wondered what her reputation was like now that she was no longer Tom. It couldn't be any worse than what Gloria and her crew had done to slander it.

While the three fire forged friends were trying to wonder what to do next with their lives after discovering an omnipotent rock, none of them had paid much attention to Willow. Gloria had half-expected her to just vanish or evaporate, as she couldn't actually be “real”, could she? Willow was just a construct from the old reality, right?

Gloria was wrong. Despite being from the future(Or perhaps another reality altogether), Willow was just as real as any of our three heroes were. After staring down at herself in the mirror, at the bedroom she now found herself in...after seeing her mom and dad and Mrs. Vanapoulos as teenagers...after having her entire sense of reality torn asunder, Willow began to panic.

“Mom! Dad! Where are we!? What happened!?”

The three suddenly turned around.

“Oh god” whispered Gloria.

“Willow” said Bill carefully. “We've got a lot to tell you. Believe me, we're still figuring things out ourselves. You see, we've got this magic rock we found...”

“What!?” shouted Willow. “What magic rock? Where are we!? One minute I see all of you run upstairs like you're hiding something, and then I hear you all fighting, and then I run upstairs and saw a huge green light coming from underneath the door...”

“Gloria? Please?” asked Bill, pointing towards the stone. Reluctantly, Gloria handed it over.

“This gemstone, Willow. You see...I hate telling you this, but I'm not really your dad. Scratch that. I mean that I am your dad, but just not yet. I found this just sitting on my doorstep this morning. When I was 18, in the year 2018. Me and Gloria and To...and your mother got into a little argument, and somebody made a very stupid wish...and somehow we ended up in 2058 as grown adults.”

Willow's jaw dropped.

“So none of my memories are real? Growing up with you and mom, wearing pajamas, drinking milkshakes, birthdays and holidays, going to college...none of that ever happened?”

“Maybe. Maybe not. I don't know” answered Bill impotently.

“All of that could have happened. Maybe it just hasn't yet” added Tammy. “If we were all as old as we were just a few minutes ago, I'm probably not going to give birth to you for a few more years, at least.”

Willow looked sad at her mother's logic. It all made sense. All that fighting she heard was probably Mom and Dad and Gloria fighting over the stone for a second time.

“So I'm stuck in the past? In 2018? Isn't Donald Trump president now?”

“Unfortunately. I didn't vote for him” laughed Bill uncomfortably through gritted teeth.

Gloria's eyes were darting around. She was becoming worried that something bad was about to happen. She wanted to run the hell out of here, but something inside her told her that she shouldn't.

“Oh god” said Willow, looking sick. “This is like being stuck in the stone ages! No self driving cars. No synthetic meat. First contact with the Martians hasn't even happened yet. I've got to get out of here.”

Surprising even Bill, Willow casually walked up to Bill and suddenly snatched the stone out of her future father's hand, shocking the boy into silence.

“Honey, please give that back. You don't know how to use it” said Tammy in her teenage voice, trying her best to sound like a mom.

“All I have to do is make a wish, right?” asked Willow.

Willow was thinking now about The Wizard of Oz. About Dorothy Gale being whisked away into a magical land of enchantment. That's exactly how she was feeling right now, except for the fact that realizing your life was a lie didn't feel so enchanting.

“I wish I were back home!” she shouted to the sky.

To Bill and Tammy's disappointment, and Gloria's sudden terror about not listening to her gut and leaving, the stone began to glow once more...


Option 1: The stone misinterprets Willow's thoughts of Oz by actually sending the four of them to the wonderful land created by L Frank Baum, and they'll only be able to return home by playing out the story of the classic movie. Willow finds herself in the role of Dorothy, Tammy finds herself as Glinda the Good Witch, Gloria as the Wicked Witch of the West, and Bill as the titular wizard.

Option 2: For the first time, the stone does nothing. The world of 2018 is her home now. One where she has no identity, no paper trail, and no one but Bill, Gloria, and Tammy knows who she is.
114122112111.title: There's No Place Like Home

1141221121111.content:
"Willow, no!" screamed Bill and Tammy in unison, both future parents leaping to save their time displaced daughter from making a horrible, reality altering mistake.

Despite having returned to their original timeline of 2018, the couple still possessed the memories of their future selves on top of their current memories(And on top of a third, original set of memories where Tammy was Tom and they were merely a pair of best buddies instead of lovers). Because of this, both of them felt oddly protective of the girl who hadn't existed an hour ago. Even though Willow was now a couple of years older than both of them, in their eyes she was still their little girl. More importantly, they both knew how sensitive she could be, how easily she let her imagination run away from her into the darkest recesses of horror and despair. Both being caring guardians, Bill and Tammy had wanted to ease her gently into this weird new world she was stuck in.

Alas, they were too late. Willow's existential dread was enough to activate the power of the Ahn'Ger Stone. It flared to life in Willow's trembling hand, and an eerie green haze rapidly filled the Strasserman's guest room...

**

For a brief period, Willow was lost between worlds in an empty void where nothing existed. In this eerie, phantom realm where shadow and substance were indistinguishable from one another, she gripped hard onto the magical emerald which had arguably given birth to her, retreating deep into her mental safe space.

"Somewhere over the rainbow.." she slowly sang to herself to maintain her sanity. The Wizard of Oz was her mother's favorite movie, and whenever Willow got stressed out, one coping strategy that seemed to work for her was focusing on a particular memory of her and her mother watching the film one rainy Thanksgiving evening together as they snuggled up together on the couch. It was a happy memory, one where she had felt perhaps the most content and safe than she had ever been, the combination of childhood nostalgia and maternal affection creating a powerful elixir.

"...where trouble melts like lemon drops. High above the chimney tops. That's were you'll find me..."

Thank God, it seemed to be working. Her trembling was finally easing up. She kept her eyes closed tightly, ignoring questions of what she was standing on or how she was even breathing if she was really in some dark corner betwixt realities. She half wondered if she was dead.

"No, no Willow. Stop it. That way lay madness."

The curly haired young woman tried extremely hard not to crumble into a hyperventilating little ball(As her instincts told her to do) after her parents had implied that the reality she had grown up in all of her life was artificial. She caught her breath just in time and took in slow, measured gulps of air, feeling her chest rise and fall through her top. Gradually, the tightness she had felt melted away.

Still, she couldn't get her mind off of the multitude of thorny questions her vivid imagination was generating. Her parents and Mrs. Vanapoulous just told her that they had made a wish with this magic emerald when they were teenagers and then wished themselves back to normal. This implied that their adult lives weren't their normal, natural selves.

That would help explain why they were acting so weird and secretive earlier, why something had felt off in Willow's brain the moment she had arrived at her family home, but did that mean she wasn't real?! Was she just the byproduct of this crazy emerald shuttling mom and dad through time and making them older!? Was she just a fill in the blank answer to Bill and Tammy's future dream life together? That possibility made her extremely upset, to know that all of her memories were false and that she was essentially a non playable character in someone else's life.

And even if she were real and her imagination was just running away from her, if the timeline could be messed around with so casually, does that mean that she could just as casually be erased?

The worst implication was the one that she had just realized. What if nothing was real? What if she was a fictional character in someone else's strange story? After all, she was a creator herself, and she took joy in playing with the lives and emotions of her fictional characters.

It was just way too eerie of a coincidence that the new animated show Willow had gotten the green light for was about a magic gemstone powered by anger. She had thought that she was so clever, so creative and audacious for coming up with an idea like that. She had impressed all the right people, and her team had already finished up six episodes for the fall season. But now she was wondering if maybe the idea she had in her head wasn't really hers. Maybe it had been implanted in her brain by some higher force, and the implications of that terrified her.

"Stop it!" she mentally admonished herself.

**

After what felt like a small eternity. Willow finally felt herself land on solid ground. The clacking sound of her shoes slamming against what sounded like bricks was the biggest relief in the world to her. She felt like someone lost at sea crawling back onto land at long last. A pleasant warm breeze brushed against her face, tickling her skin.

Slowly, she opened her eyes...

.. and gasped much louder than she had intended to.

Goosebumps instantly rippled all over Willow's skin as she realized where she was.

"It can't be" she whispered.

Oz.

It was unmistakable. In every direction, she saw Munchkin Country. Radiant skies colored an unearthly shade of azure. Enormous fields of grain, wheat, and vegetables that went on for miles, surrounded by neat blue fences. The eccentric looking, squat buildings that dotted the landscape. The freaking yellow brick road she was standing on!

Not to mention the chitter of laughing little people, many of whom were kneeling behind enormous pumpkins and other large obstacles, trying and failing to hide from Willow. A smile crossed her face.

She would would recognize this place anywhere.

But somehow, it was more than that. She just knew this place was Oz. She felt it in her gut. This world felt brighter, more alive, more vibrant than the real world ever had in her two and a half decades of life. Willow's hypersensitivity to stimuli was overwhelming her with the feeling that wonder, real wonder was possible here. Here, there was no more worrying about bosses and deadlines. Or smog or taxes. Or paying the rent or dealing with assholes. All of the riff raff of the modern world didn't exist here. Here, there was nothing but pure, unadulterated fairy tale fantasy, and nothing in her life experience came close to describing the sense of bewitching ecstasy coursing through her soul right now. The only thing that had come close was the first time her parents had taken her to Disney World as a kid, and even that was a distant second to this.

Hell, even the day that an ancient race of aliens were discovered on Mars somehow felt less monumental than the fact that Oz was real.

She noted the irony of having lived in Los Angeles for the better part of her adulthood, and how it was it was sometimes referred to as la la land. No, fuck that. This was the true la la land. This. Was. Amazing. Intoxicating, even. It was like Heaven.

And that was when Willow looked down at herself.

She was wearing Dorothy's outfit. Her casual clothing had seemingly evaporated. Now, she was wearing the signature blue and white pinafore dress that Judy Garland had worn in that iconic film so many years ago. Her curly, dirty blonde hair was even tied into two long pigtails, capped by two blue bows.

Could that mean...

Willow lifted up her feet and to her disappointment, found that she wasn't wearing the telltale ruby red shoes that could transport her...

"Gosh, I'm being silly!" laughed Willow. "I don't need magic shoes when I have this magic emerald right here in my hand."

Indeed, the Ahn'Ger Stone was still in her possession.

Willow giggled as she watched the population of Munchkins trying in vain to hide from her. She was about to call for them to come out when the last voice she had ever expected to hear erupted behind her.

"Willow, is that you!?"

Option 1: It was her mother, Tammy! And she was dressed up as Glinda, the Good Witch of the South!

Option 2: It was Mrs. Vanapoulous! And she was dressed up as The Wicked Witch Of The West, her skin even having turned an olive green!

Option 3: Someone else
1141221121111.title: Somewhere Over The Rainbow

1141221121113.content:
Realizing that she was trapped in what was, to her, the past, Willow was trying very hard not to have one of her almost trademark panic attacks. The thought that she didn't exist (and possibly never existed if this Stone was powerful enough to alter reality like it had with her parents. Who was to say she wasn't some artificial being create to fill a role in a reality that had never existed? And what as time itself? If the flow of time was something that could be changed and altered, who was to say that any actions taken by her or her parents who were now several years younger than her wouldn't change the future, her home into something that didn't exist?

What if mom and dad didn't have sex, or if any number of factors contributed to her being conceived never happened? Or happened differently? Would she simply cease to exist by way of a paradox or would she change to become someone different?

Despite the fact that she was trying very, very hard not to think about these thoughts (which was hard, given that she was a creative girl that had grown up watching and reading plenty of science fiction and fantasy and had been around for true first contact), Willow couldn't help but feel her chest start to tighten, her vision start to tunnel and her breathing start to become rapid and shallow. Somehow the look of recognition of what was about to happen to Willow on her mother's much younger face did little to calm her. Instead, the woman out of time began humming tunes from the Wizard of Oz, one of her mother's favorite films (and hateful dislike of the weird expanded universe the authors of the past had forcied it to become).

The technicolor images that surfaced in Willow's mind helped to stave off the darker thoughts about time and her non-existence. About Dorothy Gale being whisked away into a magical land of enchantment. About wanting an adventure. That's exactly how Willow was feeling right now, except for the fact that realizing your life was a lie didn't feel so enchanting. And when she looked at Gloria standing there with a alarmed look on her face, she pictured the Wicked Witch of the West and her anger spiked anew.

“I wish I were back home!” she shouted to the sky.

To Bill and Tammy's disappointment, and Gloria's sudden terror about not listening to her gut and leaving, the stone began to glow once more...

Option 2: The Stone makes Willow a part of the current time by using one of the three teens around her as a basis for a new family. The question is, who, and what affects does this have on them?

11412211211132.content:

In many ways, Willow's own panicked existential thoughts about the concept of time and how it related to her entire life when put into context that there was a magical wishing stone that could alter reality as it and the user saw fit, well...

And in the time it took for the green-gold light to flash the magic within the Stone had determined that it couldn't send Willow back to the time period in which she called home. It didn't exist anymore as the existence of the Stone and now the full knowledge of it's powers and abilities by the three original teenagers plus one twenty-five year old woman out of time had changed it irrevocably. There was no way that the world ever would have remained in the same state that led to the development of the world Willow had called home. There were infinite numbers of ways that could have changed a key moment in future history, a chronological butterfly effect that changed everything in the future.

Instead whatever intelligence or logic that controlled the magic of the gemstone had decided the best way to grant Willow's wish was to add Willow to one of the families of the teenagers standing around Willow. The frizzy haired reluctant time-traveler felt her body shift in several areas as the Stone's magic changed her appearance to match that of her new family. As the light subsided and Bill, Tammy, Gloria and Willow opened their eyes to see what changes had happened, they saw...

1141221121113232.content:
As Willow made her wish to return home to a timeline that, due to the existence of the Ahn'Ger Stone, no longer existed, something else was happening in the Strasserman household.

Below them, in the basement, was Rob Bolstrum. Formerly the head bully of Shermer High until he had lost a fight of dominance against Jonathan Ingerman, Rob was reduced to being Big Jon's lackey, following the rich boy's orders under threat of further humiliation and most certainly pain. Rob had slid in through the basement's single poorly secured window, and was there under orders to 'burn Shitterman's house down' after the Strasserman family and Bill's little geek fucktoy Tammy Ackerton had left for the day.

And Rob had complied, at least to Big Jon's face. Knowing that it was just a trap to get rid of Rob permanently as well as get revenge on Bill Strasserman for managing to out-think him, Rob had a plan of his own. Instead of burning Bill's house down, Rob was going to recruit the clever teen to help him come up with a way to get rid of Big Jon once and for all. And so he had waited in the Strasserman family basement, lounging on a couch that sat in front of a older big screen television that appeared to be from the mid-2000s, before decently sized flatscreens had become relatively affordable. The geekery he had been surrounded by almost made him sick to his stomach. Marvel memorabilia was everywhere and the full collection of every single movie sat on a huge shell next to the TV. And a collection of numerous weird not-bobbleheads superheroes that Rob accidentally destroyed trying to make, well, bob in his boredom.

But then the commotion happened. There was some kind of argument between Strasserman, Ackerton and the Vanapolous chick, then silence before the argument started once more only with a new girl's voice, one that he didn't recognize, in the mix. Curious and annoyed that his own plan was clearly going awry, Rob had crept up the basement stairs and slid out of the door into the kitchen and had been peeking around the corner of the door frame as he watched everything unfold. The two lovebirds were making eyes at each other, Titsapolous looked to be in shock, and a hot chick in a red dress with curly dirty blonde hair was in the process of having a freak out. Rob had to admit though, this new chick that the nerds were calling 'Willow' was rather hot. She looked about three years older than Rob and her body was curved in all the right places. Nice tits, nice ass, the frizzy, curly hair was a bit much and Rob had no idea why she was in a dress that looked like she was going to some kind of award show or a conference or something, but he appreciated how she filled it out.

'What the fuck are these nerds talking about?' Rob wondered as he listened to Bill and Tammy explain to the new chick, who was clearly freaking out about in 'the past'. Rob watched as Gloria handed Bill some kind of green gemstone and explain to the Willow chick who was supposedly his 'daughter' that it was magic. Rob's eyes narrowed in suspicion as he listened to how the trio had somehow traveled to the future, become old, and then traveled back to 2018 with their accidental hitchhiker.

'These guys are clearly all having a bad trip. Fucking nerds, can't even handle some pot' Rob chuckled as quietly as he could. But then the Willow chick, whom Rob assumed was the one hooking the teens up with marijuana, grabbed the gemstone and it began glowing! 'No way! Holy shit, are they telling the truth!?' Rob's mind shot off in surprise.

If it was, he didn't need Strasserman's help to get rid of Big Jon. All he needed to do was walk over and take the Stone from the group. He was so big and strong that they'd never pose any sort of a threat to him. Rob began to creep out from the kitchen when Willow made her wish, and his viision was filled with a blinding green light. When it finally receded, Rob blinked the remaining floaters out of his eyes and stared, in awe much like everyone else, at what he saw.

Option 2: Willow became...Rob's daughter!?
