1141221121122233312.content:
Bill blinked the last remnants of the magical flash away, his vision slowly returning, and when it did he was filled with patty glee as he saw the tiny form of Gloria Vanapolous staring up at the world around her. Her face was too small to be seen from this distance but Bill was certain from the low shrill sound that she was screaming in sheer terror.

"Heh" Bill chuckled to himself as he took a step towards Gloria's form, careful not to step on the horrible teenage diva, but close enough and with enough force that his footfall caused the shrunken Vanapolous to tumble backwards from the impact. Bill's face broke into a toothy smile as he crouched down to stare at Gloria, who simply froze under his gaze. From this close vantage point Bill could see Gloria's face clear as day, the slight red spot where he had slapped her, now nothing more than a deep pink dot, and the expertly applied makeup, and the trails left in it as tears flowed out of Gloria's eyes. Bill felt the sudden urge to pick her up and extended a hand, which must have appeared the be the size of a building to the shrunken girl, who simply screamed again in her tiny little voice.

"Hey Tammy!" Bill said, and Gloria's miniscule hands shot up over her ears as her tiny face scrunched tight in pain, "Come here, you've got to see this!" The teenager was thrilled to see what his best friend turned wife turned...whatever Tammy was to him would say about the three inch tall Gloria; after all, this tiny, cowering little person in front of him had tortured Tom for years now. But when the expected response never came, Bill looked up, confused.

There, in the spot where Tammy had been standing in the hallway, was a tiny woman frantically waving her arms in the air at Bill.

"Oh god, Tammy?" Bill said, his excitement vanishing entirely to a suddenly rising wave of fear and concern. He gave the tiny Gloria, who was currently flipping him the bird, one last look before leaning back on his knees and taking a few half-crawls towards Tammy's frantic form, the kinetic force of his legs moving sending both girls toppling over once more.

"Sorry!" Bill said as he crouched towards Tammy, and the small girl covered her ears much like Gloria had and giving him a pained, annoyed look. Bill gave his tiny friend an apologetic shrug and slowly stretched out his right hand toward Tammy, who eyed it cautiously as Bill lowered it to the carpeted floor in front of her. Bill watched in amazement as Tammy, like a skittish cat, slowly reached out and touched his skin; she was so tiny her touch barely registered. With another look up at his clearly gargantuan face, Tammy put both of her tiny hands on Bill's own and pulled herself into his open palm, moving to the direct center and sitting cross legged, staring up at him with big blue eyes as he brought his girlfriend closer to his face, trying not to move his hand too fast lest she be swept off to a swift end by the momentum. Now that they seemed to be close enough for communication and BIll had ceased moving, Tammy stood and looked Bill directly in his eyes.

"Bill, what did you do!?" Tammy said, her voice tiny even though it was clear to BIll she was yelling as loud as she could, "Why did I change!?"

"I, I don't know!" Bill said careful to keep his voice soft and low, and suddenly he felt compelled to look at the Ahn'Ger Stone. He brought his left had up even with his right and opened it, revealing the lifeless green stone in his palm. That was when he heard a barely audible gasp.

"Bill!" Tammy said, he tiny eyes wide, "It's broken!" Tammy made her way as fast as she could across Bill's palm, heading towards his left hand, which he brought in closer, setting it next to his right hand so that Tammy could cross over and join the Stone. Even next to the small gemstone, Tammy looked incredibly small, and Bill watched as she moved her hands across the surface of the magical artifact, tracing the length of the massive crack that had spread from nearly one end of the stone to the other.

"That must be why the wish changed me also!" Tammy said, looked up at Bill as the color drained out of his face.

"But if the stone is broken, if breaking it made the wish go bad...How do we fix it? How do we change you back?" Bill said, and Tammy simply stared at him, at a loss for words.

Suddenly BIll's phone began ringing, causing the teenager to jump in surprise and almost send Tammy toppling off his hand and to the floor below before Bill raised his other hand to keep the tiny teenager from plummeting to her death.

"Bill! Be careful with me!" Tammy screamed in anger, her voice straining to be heard above the shrill sound of Bill's ringtone.

"Sorry!" Bill said, and after a moment of being at a loss, he simply sat Tammy and the stone on the carpet before sliding his hand into his pocket and pulling out his cellphone, where the name 'Willow" and a picture of his future daughter turned big sister was plastered on the screen. Suddenly filled with dread, Bill tapped the phone and held it up to his ear.

"Hello?"

"Bill! Oh my god! Something happened! I'm in the car but I'm tiny!" Came Willows voice, clear as day and on the verge of hysterics.

'Oh no' Bill thought to himself, looking down at Tammy and the Stone, and blinking as Gloria's tiny form staggered into his field of vision, the shrunken Vanapolous bent over and wheezing from exertion; clearly not wanting to be left out of the loop Gloria had run the short yet massive distance to join Tammy next to the stone.

"Bill, help me! Call mom and dad! Or 911! Come get me!" Willow cried out over the phone.

"Uh, right. Yes I will, I'll come get you! Be right there, bye!" Bill said, and despite Willow's frantic cries to not hang up, Bill ended the call out of habit and slid the the phone back into his pocket before looking down at the little women in front of him.

"So, uh, Willow got shrunk as well" He said, and he watched as Tammy's jaw went slack as Gloria simply laid on the floor, still panting and clearly beyond caring. "She's trapped in the car, I'm gonna go get her and bring her back inside. But I can't leave you guys here so..." Bill trailed off, ignoring the almost furious ringing of his phone as he extended another hand out towards the girls while his left hand plucked the Stone up once more.

Tammy nodded, and then rolled her eyes as Gloria simply flinched and curled up into the fetal position as Bills giant hand descended towards her. Bill could see Tammy's mouth moving but he couldn't hear what she was saying, and found himself staring in surprise as Gloria's former boyfriend marched over, pulled the tiny Vanapolous up to her feet, and marched her towards Bill's palm before forcing her onto the fleshy elevator. Tammy looked at Bill as Gloria attempted to make herself into a even smaller ball in the center of Bill's hand, and pointed upwards with her index finger before quickly sitting down.

Bill, despite the insanity of the morning, couldn't help but chuckle, and with the two women in his hand, he slowly stood up and made his way carefully down the stairs, each step causing Tammy and Gloria's hair to rise and fall. Despite his concern Bill couldn't help but marvel at how physics now worked for the two girls, even the slightest movements affected them wildly. When he reached the bottom of the stairs, his cellphone still blaring loudly through the empty house, Bill made a short detour into the kitchen and to the table where he deposited Tammy and Gloria onto the soft cotton of the decorative doily in the middle of the table.

"I'll be right back!" Bill said, and quickly dashed towards the garage door, going through it to see Willow's car, still running but no one sitting in the driver's seat. He made his way to the driver side door and, praying that it wasn't locked, pulled the handle, the door popping open with a soft clunk. There, at the back of the seat, tiny cellphone plastered to her ear and tears making her tiny face soaked, was Willow..

"Oh god Willow, I'm sorry!" Bill said, keeping his voice quiet as he reached in and turned the ignition off. Willow screamed...something, but Bill couldn't make it out. Instead, he crouched down once more and got close to Willow, who simply recoiled from her father turned big brother in fear.

"Listen, Willow...I, uh, think I know what happened. IT happened to Tammy and Gloria too. I've got them in the kitchen, so I'm gonna pick you up and take you to them, ok?" Bill said softly, holding out his empty hand to the small woman, who nodded warily and after a few moments of hesitation, climbed up into Bill's palm. Sheltering his sister as best as he could, Bill rose, shut the car door, and made his way back to the kitchen where Tammy and Gloria were waiting.

Opening the kitchen door, he saw...

11412211211222333121.content:
Bill felt horrible as he tried to not to get overwhelmed by the tiny woman in his hands. In just the span of twenty minutes, he'd gone through several different versions of reality, and now the one thing that had changed everything was now broken and potentially even more dangerous to even use!

"God, Willow, I'm sorry" Bill said, glancing down at his future daughter turned older sibling, who was too busy freaking out to really notice.

Bill opened the door from the garage into the kitchen and made a bee line for the table, setting Willow down as carefully as he could before looking around for Tammy and Gloria, seeing nothing but a empty table.

"Tammy? Gloria?" Bill said in a sudden panic as he looked down at the floor, the reality that the two had fallen to a messy death a terrifying possibility, only to hear a deep chuckle that was more like a grunt. Bill spun on his heel at the sound and a electric current of shock and alarm traveled down his spine at the source of the noise.

There, standing by the basement door and holding Tammy and Gloria in one hand, was the walking mass of muscle that called itself Rob Bolstrum. The former head bully of Shermer High, now a disgraced lackey under the thumb of the new head bully, Jon Ingerman, was roughly stroking the heads of the two girls with his free index finger, the girls clearly screaming in fear and pain from being held in his vice-like grip.

"Just the little shit I was looking for. Hello, Strasserman" Rob growled, taking a step forward and causing Bill to take a step back, stepping in front of the tiny form of Willow, who was currently screaming from the top of the table. "Love the dolls, always knew you were a weird faggot"

"Wh-what the hell do you want, Bolstrum!?" Bill said as the shock wore off and the hateful adrenaline kicked in, "What the fuck are you doing in my house!?"

Rob smiled, his thick piggish lips parting to reveal a full set of yellowed teeth and a cloud of foul breath that made Tammy and Gloria visibly gag. the bully eyed the two shrunken girls one last time before he leaned against the counter top of the kitchen's island, dropping Tammy and Gloria into the empty sink with almost an afterthought.

"I've been waiting for you, Strasserman. Big Jon sent me, he says it's fucking judgement day for you" Rob's voice was the typical growl that Bill was more than familiar with. But before Bill could raise his fists, Rob broke out into a rumbling laugh that BIll felt just as much as he heard. On the table and in the sink, Willow, Tammy and Gloria all clutched at their ears in pain as the giant above them guffawed, ignorant of their pain.

"Easy, Shitterman!" Rob said as he reined his laughter in, a handful of final chuckles fading away like thunder in the distance, "I'm not going to do anything! I'm here to help us solve a...mutual problem"

Bill refused to drop his guard as he kept his eyes locked on Bolstrum. He had learned, from experience, that you never took your eyes off your attacker. "So, what do you want then?" Bill sneered, feeling his fists tighten further. He had to get Tammy, WIllow and Gloria away from Rob. He'd kill them on accident, or worse.

"I'll tell you, but you have to tell me how you got these" bolstrum said, pointing a finger down into the sink, "I knew you and Ackerton were geeks, but this is impossible! How'd you get Titsapolous and Ackerton together and how'd you make then small? Tell me, and I'll tell you why I'm here.

Bill simply glared at Rob before the bully rolled his eyes and stuck a finger down into the sink that contained Tammy and Gloria and gave it a flick, a small thud echoing off the far side of the basin as one of the girls, Bill couldn't tell which, was flung by Rob's cruel action.

"Or I can sit here and play with my new toys. Either way, I'm not going anywhere" Rob sounded bored but the look in his eyes was anything but. He made to attack the girls again, spurring Bill into action.

114122112112223331213.content:
"Or I can sit here and play with my new toys. Either way, I'm not going anywhere" Rob sounded bored but the look in his eyes was anything but. He made to attack the girls again, spurring Bill into action. It was his fault that the girls were tiny, that the magical wish granting Stone was broken, but he couldn't just stand there and let his nemesis torture them in their new defenseless size.

There was no way he could beat Rob in an actual fight, Rob was one of the strongest, toughest people Bill had ever known. And with no time or way to get to a knife or some form of weapon, Bill had only one choice; he had to use the Stone, regardless of the damage to it. He looked down to see if glowing weakly with gold-green light.

Bill closed his eyes, focused on his anger towards Rob and his desire to protect the three shrunken girls and said;

"I wish you'd pick on somebody your own size!"

Option 2: Rob shrinks down to three inches tall and becomes trapped in the sink. Upon inspection, Bill discovers that Rob has become a girl as well! But that doesn't make her any less mean or violent...

11412211211222333122.content:
Bill opened the door leading from the now quiet garage and into the kitchen, his eyes locking on the table where two small figures were waiting for him, both of them facing towards the small television that sat on the far kitchen counter. The TV was on, but silent, apparently whoever Bill's new parents were, they still preferred to watch the morning news in silence with the closed captioning on, and, much like his original mom and ad, still forgot to turn it off when they left for the day. Bill paid it no mind as he gently lowered his hand to the table and let Willow slide off onto the soft cotton that had served as soft landing for Tammy and Gloria, watching as his daughter from the future turned big sister in the present stumbled over to Tammy and Gloria.

"Well, that's all three of you. I'm really sorry, guys!" Bill said apologetically, but then raised an eyebrow in confusion as Tammy and Gloria didn't bother to respond as Willow began trying to get their attention herself. "Guys?" Bill asked again, and after Willow touched her shoulder Tammy turned to face her, pointing a slender, small arm towards the television, her face white as a ghost. Bill turned his head to follow Tammy's arm and his eyes locked with the TV.

There, the words 'BREAKING NEWS' was plastered at the top of the TV screen, while a large block of rapid fire captioning took up most of the screen. Bill blinked for a moment, trying to read it all, but after a moment he simply reached for the remote on the kitchen counter and turned the closed captioning off and un-muting the TV.

"-gain for those of you just joining us, there has been a worldwide event of unknown origin as women across the United States of America and other countries have suddenly been reduced to three inches in size" The older anchor's voice was steady, but there was a hint of panic in it, "Here is live footage from our own station just moments ago as my co-anchor, Tessa McKnight was affected"

The video feed suddenly cut to a shot of the two anchors sitting at the desk chatting, clearly during a commercial break when suddenly green light from an unknown source tinted the camera feed as Tessa quickly began to shrink, losing foot upon foot of her height within seconds until she vanished below the lip of the desk, the male anchor jumping up from his seat as shouts the sounds of men yelling from off camera are heard.

"This is, unfortunately, not localized to our station. Here is more footage of this strange and unknown event happening at several of our affiliate stations"

Video from different television stations begin to play, many of them news broadcasts, but several of them early morning talk shows as all females visible begin shrinking to three inches tall within moments of the Ahn'Ger Stone's light appearing.

"We also have footage being sent in from elsewhere in the world as this phenomenon has sent the entire human race into a moment of chaos"

More footage, this time from cellphones in New York, London, Germany, Canada, Mexico, even South Africa and China as women immediately shrink in size as cars and buses suddenly veer across roadways and streets.

"And unfortunately we do have to announce that we do have confirmed reports of multiple fatalities as out of control vehicles claim lives as their occupants were affected by the same mysterious light. There are more than a few cases of accidental crushing happening, and several reports of missing persons already happening. If you are a woman and you are viewing this broadcast, officials are asking that if your immediate area is safe and free of harm, please do not move or attempt to find help. For all of our male viewing audience, please be aware of where you are stepping and sitting. Provide support for any shrunken women by calling your emergency services immediately and keeping the immediate area free from threats. God help us all"

Bill stood there as more clips of women shrinking played over the air, of the chaos created in the world by his wish and the broken Ahn'Ger Stone. Suddenly sick to his stomach, Bill stumbled backwards, a hand reaching out for a chair when he...
11412211211222333122.title: We Interrupt This Broadcast

114122112112223331221.content:
The trio of Tammy, Gloria, and Willow watched from the middle of the Strasserman family dinner table as Bill's face grew increasingly more horrified. Staring at the magical gemstone in his hand,and then back at the TV, hearing the talking heads on the news describe the hundreds of deaths(And counting) his wish had caused, he grew sick to his stomach. He began breathing heavily. He started to tremble, guilt ridden by the cataclysmic butterfly effect his wish had created.

“Bill, are you OK honey?” he thought he heard one of the miniature voices scream, but he didn't respond.

His trio of friends and family watched as he clumsily stumbled backward, a hand reaching out for a chair as he grew lightheaded, just before fainting.

“Oh my God!” screamed Willow and Tammy, covering their ears, the collapse of Bill's body to the floor creating a thunderingly loud sound effect to the three inch high women.

Willow and Tammy immediately sprinted to the edge of the table, Willow throwing off her now useless heels, both girls frustrated by the inconvenience of their new size. Gloria stayed behind and retreated back into her fetal position before forcefully shutting her eyes. She told herself that this was only a bad dream and that she was going to wake up from it very soon, rocking herself into her mental happy place. She prayed that a fly didn't pick her up and transport her away somewhere.

The former mother and daughter team meanwhile were peering over the table at Bill's unconscious face, a face betraying a young man overwhelmed by the power of the artifact he still gripped tightly in his right hand.

“He's bleeding from the forehead” announced Tammy rather obviously to Willow, pointing towards the big gash near the top of Bill's forehead, an injury he sustained when his head hit one of the dinner table's four sharp corners.

“My God, is he dead?”

“I don't think so. He's still breathing. I think he just knocked himself out cold” Tammy continued before lamenting. “Oh my God, my poor Bill. We have to try and wake...”

“What's going on?!” screeched Willow, interrupting the geeky blonde in a cracked up hysterical tone, her teary-eyed, snot filled, terrified voice quivering with confusion. “Why are you so calm, Tammy?!”.

“Somebody has to be!” yelled Tammy.

“But what happened? Why are you acting like this isn't the most insane thing ever? Half of the human race just shrunk down like Ant-Man or seomthing, and you seem perfectly OK with it! Didn't you see that green light?”

“I did see it. There's...”

Tammy saw that Willow was starting to breath heavily herself like Bill had, so she immediately stopped talking and instead tried to comfort Willow by hugging her tightly, stroking Willow's hair and waiting for her to calm down. Tammy's residual memories of being Willow's mother in the previous reality suddenly came into focus. She recalled Willow as a little girl and as a teenager. Willow Strasserman had largely a happy child, but the few times she hadn't been, she had cried in her parents warm embrace, and those sad moments were burned into Tammy's recollection. Tammy had known exactly what to do and what to say to make Willow feel loved and safe.

“It's going to be OK, Wills. I can explain what's going on. But it's going to sound absolutely bug fuck crazy.”

The two let each other go, Willow feeling much better, having the impression that Tammy was levelheaded and a good person to have with you in a crisis like this.

“It can't be any crazier than being three inches tall. We're insect bait.”

Tammy laughed a little at the joke.

“Don't be so dark. Now listen very carefully. This morning, Bill found a gemstone sitting on your family's front porch...”

Tammy gave Willow an edited version of events as she understood it, leaving out the parts where she was originally a depressed young man by the name of Tom and that she had briefly been her mother, instead giving a fictitious but equally outrageous story about how the Ahn'Ger Stone had made Bill, Tammy, and Gloria swap bodies with one another before Bill had figured out the right turn of phrase to swap them back. Willow's surprised looking face implied that she had bought into the half-truth.

“Seriously? That thing in Bill's hand caused all this?” the twenty year old asked, pointing downward at Bill's body. His right hand was clenched, but the glittering green artifact was clearly visible.

Tammy shook her head.

“Yeah.”

"How?"

"How?"

"How did the thing on our porch to begin with?"

"We don't know. It just did."

"I don't like the sound of that. So...so all we have to do is get down there and fix this. We need to just be touching the stone and wish everything back to normal, like the magic lamp in Aladdin.”

“Easier said than done” said Tammy. “This might just be a regular old dinner table, but at our size, we may as well be standing on top of Mount Everest.”


Option 1: Tammy and Willow discuss ways of getting down to Bill and reach the Ahn'Ger Stone. Meanwhile, an opportunistic looter notices that the Strasserman's front door is open and lets himself inside.

Option 2: Gloria's fear is realized as the trio are set upon by a member of the animal kingdom.

11412211211222333122122.title: Don't Mess with the Pest (Options)

1141221121122233312213.content:
Tammy and Willow stared down at Bill's colossal (and unconscious) form on the floor of the Strasserman kitchen. Tammy still couldn't believe how small she was now and how big the world was, especially with the memories of being the 6'3 Tom still lingering in her mind. That had been one of the first sensations when the Stone had...changed? Fixed? Whatever it could be catagorized as being almost half Tom's original size had been disorienting. And now? Now she was smaller than ever! And she was going to stay small forever if they didn't get to that magical rock. She tossed a quick look at Willow and felt a ping of sadness at how different the girl that had once been her daughter looked but the miniature Ackerton still felt a motherly bond to the curly haired girl. She had to take charge and figure out a way to get to that rock!

"Well" Tammy said as she carefully peered over the edge of the table, "We can't stick around here and wait. Bill needs help and we need to get big before something happens to us."

"But what, Tammy?" Willow's voice was wavering on the edge of hysterics. The now elder Strasserman was holding it together, but just barely.

Tammy gave her former daughter a re-assuring squeeze on the shoulder. "Don't worry. We'll figure out...something. There's got to be a way down somehow..." Tammy gave Willow a small smile and carefully made her way to the very edge of the table, being careful as the thick tablecloth beneath her feet made walking a little difficult. And then Tammy gazed out upon the sheer drop to the kitchen tiles and her stomach filled with butterflies. The Everest comparison she'd made moments ago seemed less fitting now. Instead the image of an oceanic drop-off came to mind, a memory from a future honeymoon where she and Bill had gone scuba diving in Australia and the strange terror seeing the ocean floor drop away to...nothing. And abyss. Even though she could clearly see the floor below in this situation, the thalassophobia still crept into the back of her mind and made her shudder.

"You're...We can't jump, Tammy!" Willow said from behind her.

"I know, honey. I just need to get a good look at what we're dealing with, okay?" The short blonde replied.

"And what's with that? All that 'honey' stuff? You've never called me that before today, Tammy. It's really weird for someone five years younger than me to be calling me that!"

For a brief moment Tammy was afraid of a unpleasant conversation. If Willow somehow pieced it together, now that she knew about the magic gemstone and all this insanity happening...She had to act more like the teenager Willow knew instead of like a mom.

"What? Oh, sorry, Willow. I'm just, I mean we're three inches tall? I'm allowed to be a little weird, okay?" Tammy said, deflecting the question as she pointed to the nearby skyscraper that was one of the table's chairs. "And that means we're too small to climb down those. You got anything?"

"Well, what about grabbing the end of the tablecloth and letting it drop us down?" Willow said, giving the dry, thick cushion of fabric a soft stomp, "That might work..."

Tammy shook her head. "No, there's nothing up here except for the plastic fruit bowl. With all three of us it'd fly right off and we'd break our necks" Tammy said with a sigh, turning to face Willow again and pointing to the building sized bowl of fruit that Gloria was currently huddled against, tiny head buried in her knees. Tammy felt her eyes narrow as darker thoughts entered her mind. 'Serves you right, Gloria. Now you get to feel what it's like to be vulnerable to the world and like you're nothing'

More evil thoughts entered Tammy's mind. About leaving Gloria that size, if they somehow managed to get back to normal. And maybe make everyone forget about her...Tammy wasn't sure if it was her thinking or the residual memories of being Tom, but either way, she was enjoying the mental image of an inch tall Gloria having to survive like that old film 'The Borrowers'.

"Tammy?"

Willow's reedy voice cut through the dark cloud in Tammy's brain and forced her back into reality. The tiny short blonde looked at the tiny tall girl blankly for a moment before the haze dissipated. No, she couldn't do that to Gloria, not even after all the shit the drama queen had put Tom through...That was a different life, and she was a better person now. And that meant finding a way down and being the hero.

"Oh, sorry I was just...thinking on how to get down" Tammy said with a smile that felt about as fake as it probably looked.

"Yeah, because you totally weren't shooting daggers at her" Willow said, tossing a thumb towards Gloria, who was now peering over her knees at them with big watery red eyes. "Listen, Bill loves you Tammy, you don't have to worry about him cheating on you. Especially with Gloria. I don't know why she was here this morning but I can promise you, she's not having an affair with Bill!"

But Tammy wasn't listening. Instead a lightbulb had turned on in her mind as she started walking towards Gloria and the fruit bowl. Maybe...

"Hey, are you listening to me?" Willow said, jogging over to the girl that had previously made oup half of her genetic code.

"Willow, I think I might have just found a way down!" Tammy said, pointing up at the plastic fruit.

Option 1: Tammy has found a plastic fruit that has a hole large enough for them to fit into. Using the piece of fruit as transport, Tammy thinks that they could survive the trip down to the kitchen floor!

Option 2: Tammy wants to somehow toss the fruit off the table and try to wake Bill up!

choices: Grabbed Gloria's hands and Gloria pulled her up!
Gloria missed her, sending Tammy back to the table.
11412211211222333122131.content:
Willow followed Tammy's stare for a moment before failure to reach the same conclusion. "Uh, what?"

Tammy tried not to roll her eyes. "Look, Willow! Look at the peach! Look at what's under the leaf! If we can get in there, we can use it to get us down!"

And there, almost invisible had it not been for the last remnants of sun poking through dark rainclouds, was a hole that looked big enough for the girls to enter.

"Oh! I see it! But how are we gonna get it out of the bowl? We're not..." Willow took a moment to look at herself and swallow the sudden panic entering her mind again, "We not big enough to get in the bowl, Tammy!"

Tammy looked up at the rim of the brown wooden bowl, suddenly thankful for the fact that whoever Bill's new parents were, they had the taste (or maybe lack of taste) to put the cliche decorative piece on the table. The rim hung over her, and she, now being the shortest of the group, had no chance of reaching it but maybe...

"Willow, do you think you can put me on your shoulders? I might be able to reach it!" Tammy couldn't help but give a sad chuckle at the absurd irony of it, memories of carrying a baby Willow around on her own shoulders fresh in her mind.

"I..guess? I've never done that before though. Would you be ta-" Willow saw the frown forming on Tammy's face and silenced herself before she insulted her friend. In her mind, she'd always found it really funny how Bill found one of the shortest women she knew to hook up with. But now it seemed like her brother's fun-sized blonde wasn't going to be much help other than giving ideas. And she knew that sometimes Tammy could be...sensitive about her height, which was part of the reason it was so strange that Tammy was taking the current situation so well. "Uh, I mean, what do we do once we get in?"

"If we get it out of the bowl and get in, I think we might be able to force it to roll! We use the chair on the way down to keep us slow and the peach to protect us! Then we just climb out, go get the Stone and make ourselves big again! Then we can help Bill!" Tammy's face brightened again, but Willow could see some red on her cheeks. But the smile faded as soon as a sniffling cruel voice cut into the planning session.

"You're fucking insane, Tom" Gloria chuckled bitterly as she slowly rose to her feet. Now that the hysteria had passed, the teen diva was starting to think a little more clearly. She shrugged off the glare Tammy gave her.

"Tom? Who is Tom?" Willow asked, confused and somewhat alarmed at the look on Gloria's face. It was the look Tammy had just a few minutes ago only made worse through a mask of smeared makeup. Gloria shot her a look but quickly turned back to Tammy, whose face was turning red and tiny hands balling into fists.

"I mean look at you! You're short! You're the shortest person I've ever seen outside of TV! How's the weather down there, short fry?" Gloria hissed as she closed in on Tammy, standing almost a full head higher over the blonde. "If you were still my man, if you'd just listened to me, we wouldn't even be here! WE could be at school and-"

"SHUT UP!" Tammy screamed, a tiny fist rocketing into Gloria's gut, knocking the taller girl over and causing her to wheeze.

"YOU DON'T GET TO SPEAK! NOT NOW, NOT EVER! YOU'RE THE REASON ALL OF THIS HAS HAPPENED! NOW EITHER HELP US OR SHUT UP!" Tammy's screamed, her voice cracking as it reached the highest octaves it could manage. LArge, hot sweaty tears boiled along the rim of her eyes and she ran a arm across her face, wiping them away with a choked sniffle.

"Ahh ahh heh he ahh heh" Gloria wheezed as air flowed back into her lungs. "S-still a big cry-crybaby! Ma-maybe you-ahh-deserve to be like th-this! H-ah!" The raven haired beauty did an un-ladylike spit of mico phlegm onto the tablecloth as she pushed herself up.

"Don't..Don't make me hit you again Gloria. Just because I can now doesn't mean I want to" Tammy lied through gritted teeth. Some part of her burned with a fury that overrode her patience, her reason. There was a part of her that very much wanted to throw Gloria over the side of the table and just finish it. Suddenly those thoughts of leaving her small for eternity didn't seem all that bad.

"Oh that's just what you want to be, h-huh? A woman beater? You can go join Ingerman and the rest of the no life fucks! I'm sure they'd be glad to have you around! Get yourself a real man, not like half-a-fag laying on the floor there"

"FUCK YOU GLORIA!" Tammy screamed as the last of her reason crumpled before the tidal wave of rage. She launched her small body at the cheerleader before suddenly she felt herself being pushed back. Tammy turned her hate-filled blue eyes upwards and saw the terrified face of her former daughter staring back.

"TAMMY! STOP!"

Immediately the rage receded back to it's place at the back of her mind. She had almost, she had, all in front of...

"Oh god" Tammy whispered to herself as the blood drained from her face. The memories of her past life, of teaching Willow to be a good person, always do the right thing and be kind, to turn the other cheek and be the better person, they all came rolling back. "I-I'm sorry honey! I just, she you, your father-" Tammy's hands shot to her mouth as she realized what she was saying.

"I don't now what any of this is about, but as of right now I'm telling you both to end it, okay? I have plenty of questions but can we just focus on being big again, please?" Willow tried her best to sound authoritative, to hide the anxiety attack that was just waiting to be acknolwedged. Tons of thoughts were floating around in her head, none of them good, but even as her breath became shallower she focused on the plan. They were small, they were trapped, and this was their only option. But her show of force seemed to work as the two girls back away from each other, Gloria with a hateful little smirk on her face and Tammy, tears freely flowing, hands still over her mouth as she stared at Willow as if she'd shot a dog.

'Well, whatever works' Willow thought to herself as she closed her eyes and took as a deep a breath as she could manage before looking over to Gloria. "Gloria, you're about as tall as me. Will you help us get into the bowl? Onece you're up you can pull Tammy up, okay?"

But it might have been a trick of the light, as Bill began to notice that the air around him was shimmering and rippling as if he was underwater. The sun-like object flickered again, this time violently, and Bill looked away as it pulsed and strobed against his eyes as pain rippled through his skull.

Moments later a enormous pressure wave hit Bill and tossed the teenager backward, slamming him hard against the rear of the outcropping. As the new world around him spun back into view, Bill saw the ground shift nearby as the emerald green rock seemed to melt away into a path that curved out of his line of sight around the far side of the cliff, while the area within the outcropping seemed to shrink as the walls shrank towards the cliff edge.

"This...What is this place?" Bill said as he scrambled to his feet, the encroachment of the walls stopping the moment the boy was once again upright. He cast another look out at the world beyond the outcropping.

"Am I in the stone?" He wondered, but his introspection did not last long as the outcropping began shrinking once more, this time the hard green stone pushing Bill towards the small pathway that had appeared moments before.

"Okay, okay! I get the hint!" Bill stammered as the rock face not-so-gently pushed against him, and Bill walked forward, placing a foot onto the pathway, testing it's weight. "Seems sturdy enough...What do you think?" Bill said, turning his head and seeing his muddled reflection in the walls around him, "Should I stay or should I-" Bill's reference was interrupted as the stone surged forward and pushed him out onto the path.

"Geez!" Bill cried, stumbling to catch his balance on the very exposed and narrow walkway, "For a rock, you really are impatient!"

The mountain seemingly responded as several inches from the pathway melted away before his eyes.

"Okay, I get it. You don't like jokes" Bill said, and began to slowly make his way forward.
___

Some time and a lot of walking later, the pathway before Bill hit a dead end, terminating seamlessly into the emerald rock. Bill knew better than to look behind him or stop however; the mountain was clearly sentient, and very impatient for Bill to get to wherever it wanted him to go as it was removing the pathway behind him, giving him just enough room to catch himself if he somehow tripped and fell but not much more than that. It was impossible to tell time, but Bill was certain that he'd been walking for at least three hours, following the path as it curved itself downward towards the plain below. And he was also certain that he was now actually INSIDE the gemstone itself, and whatever power or being that granted the wishes was communicating through the environment, pushing him to go...somewhere and vaguely threatening his life if he stopped for more than a moment. So instead Bill kept up his pace and right before he ran face-first into the mountain, the wall of rock melted away and Bill stepped into another wide outcropping. But instead of an vast, otherworldly view lit by a sun, there was a small chamber filled with shadow that overlooked a field of absolute destruction that stretched to the horizon on this side of the mountain. It was almost if someone had taken a hammer to a jade statue, or the obliterated terrain left behind by a tank's treads. A crippled peak grew out of the rubble and reflected the pale light of the sun towards the outcropping, and Bill blinked twice as his eyes adjusted to the weak light.

there, at the center of the outcropping, lay a small, still, human form.

"Oh my god!" Bill yelled as he raced forward, dropping to his knees next the person in front of him. His brain immediately shifted to Tammy, that his best friend turned wife turned...whatever the relationship was between them now and any harm that could have befallen her, but it immediately shifted to mild alarm as he pushed aside the green tinted hair to reveal Gloria's unconscious face.

"Oh. It's you." Bill grumbled bitterly, leaning back on his legs and staring at his...friend? Rival? Annoy mutual acquaintance? Whatever Gloria was to Bill at this point, he was still convinced that she was the cause of all the problems that had happened this morning, of what she had done to Tom, and then Bill's parents. Causing Kimberly to vanish out of existence. Bill felt his blood go hot as he stood up, towering over the completely helpless form of Gloria as a fist balled into existence. Around him, beyond his tunnel vision, golden shafts of light coalesced into existence, swimming through the emerald mountainside as they reached out from the cloudy walls of the mountain in wispy, snake like tendrils. Emerald stone pooled and gre from where the light broke through the surface of the mountain, stretching outwards in wobbling crystalline tendrils around the golden light, trying to contain it as the light-reflecting mountain in the distance began to crack and fracture. As the light within the outcropping dimmed, golden strand whisked across the back of Bill's neck as he gritted his teeth, coiling back as if to strike as Bill's mouth opened and his distorted voice warbled to life...

"I wi-OW!" Bill yelped in pain as a large chunk of emerald stone detached itself from the ceiling and dropped unceremoniously down on top of Bill's head. Pain replaced the simmering anger in Bill's gut as he covered his head with his arms to protect himself from any other falling objects, not noticing as the predatory tendrils of light vanishing into nothing or the grasping emerald formations sinking back into the rock surrounding the two teens. The reflective mountain in the distance regained some luster and the light level within the small cave grew again, though not to the level it was before.

"Huh?" Gloria muttered, her eyes fluttering open as Bill rolled his. Bill stepped back while Gloria pulled herslef to her feet, her eyes going wide at the alien landscape around her before landing on Bill, his arms folded as he started at her.

"Bill, whats...whats going on? Where are we, what did you do!?" Gloria said as panic crept into her off-synched voice.

'It's going to be a long day' Bill thought to himself as he began to explain what had happened, and where he thought they were.

114122112112223332311.content:
"There's no way this is actually happening. We must be, like, having some kind of drug trip or something" Gloria said as she and Bill made their way further down the mountain and towards the ruined emerald landscape below. Gloria wasn't into fantasy or science fiction, the closest that she had ever gotten to anything related to geeky things were the Disney movies that her mom owned and rarely let her watch.

No, Gloria Vanapoulos's world was dominated by her mother's obsessive control over her, a timid ghost of a father that was always gone on business trips, and the fleeting moments of freedom where she could put some of her mother's lessons on being a 'lady' to use at school and getting people to do what she wanted. And Tom. But Tom was currently a chick and much like everything else, Gloria wasn't really ready or capable or processing that yet, not even after the alternate realities she had experienced. And there was a growing part of her mind that was trying to convince the rest of her that Gloria was simply having a /very/ elaborate dream, that she was still at home in her bed and sound asleep.

All in all, as Gloria glanced behind her at the path she and Bill were both walking along disappear into nothing but a sheer, deadly drop into oblivion, her mind never had much capacity for flights of fantasy, and now that she was apparently living in one, she was running our of ways to sanely cope.

"Gloria, I don't do drugs, you don't do drugs, Tom-Tammy doesn't do drugs. And even then, there's no possible way both of us could be having the /exact/ same trip. We're here, we're walking, just deal with it." Bill spat back, not bothering to turn around to look at the girl that had somehow, someway, managed to ruin both his best friend's life and his own. How did she do it?

"But-" Gloria began to shout back, but just a glance out at the ruined, alien landscape around her made her fall into silence. There was no point in arguing with Strasserman, he was already against her in the beginning, and now with all this magic, this...wherever they were,

'Okay, so if we ARE inside the gem, how do I get out? I can't be stuck here, I'm not going to be trapped like some genie in a lamp!' Gloria fumed in silence, and she let a single manicured hand slide across the surface of the mountain next to her. It was cold and unnatural feeling but for lack of anything else to do but walking forward, she let her fingers glide across the cloudy crystalline surface, unaware of the faint golden trails behind her that moved in time with her fingertips. They struggled to keep up with the teens as the mountain seemed to shift, becoming cloudier and opaque until the gold trails were smothered out of existence.

After a long period of silence and walking, and walking and silence, Bill and Gloria finally made it around the much larger base of the mountain, once more coming into view of the stunning vista within this strange alien world. Bill's hand flew up to protect his eyes from the burning white of the overhead rift, grinning as he heard Gloria let out a wordless squeak of pain as her eyes were subjected to the full force of the rift. Part of Bill felt like a dick for not warning her, but a larger part of him felt justified in doing...something to her. It was her fault they were here after all. Little miss perfect could do with a little pain here and there. Up ahead Bill could see the pathway curving into another wall and his mood brightened.

'Yes, maybe Tammy is in there!' he said to himself as he quickened his pace. Maybe Tammy was in there, and maybe, with someone that actually understood what was happening and not just whining about it, they could figure out just what to do next. Other than walk, of course. It was pretty clear that the forces within the gemstone, if that was where they truly were, wanted them to get to the bottom of the mountain, but after then, who knew? The only other points of interest were the cradled sun and the enormous debris field stretching as far as his eyes could see. But first things first, reunite with his...whatever Tammy was to him now.

"Bill, look out!" Gloria said from behind him, and Bill simply grinned to himself.

"You just gotta say the magic words" Bill threw his arms up in the air dramatically as he continued to walk towards the wall of green rock, "Open sesame!" He cried as he stepped forward and...

...went face first into the mountainside.

"Ow! Shit!" Bill yelled as he bounced backwards, his nose flaring in pain as he ran a finger over it. It wasn't bleeding or broken, thankfully, but it hurt like hell. He cast a look behind him to see Gloria trying her best not to laugh, and further back the disappearing pathway had ceased to disappear, instead the wall of reclamation mountainside holding steady as Bill couldn't help but feel as if someone, somewhere was standing with their hands on their hips giving him a 'I told you so' look.

"Yeah, some master of the mystic mountain you are" Gloria snickered behind a raised hand, her eyes twinkling in cruel delight.

"Yeah yeah" Bill muttered, turning back to look at the wall he had just bounced off of, "That, uh, didn't happen before. It's supposed to melt away just like the..." Bill's explanation trailed off as the mountain seemed ready to grant his request, opening slowly like an iris, revealing the cave beyond. He gave the rock in front of him a glare, "And for a pile of rocks, it has a /very/ odd sense of humor"

The mountain may have rumbled in reply as Bill ducked through the still opening iris and planted his feet firmly in the cave, staring with excited hope at the prospect of being reunited with someone who he enjoyed being with...only to be disappointed by nothing more than an empty outcropping.

"Shit!" Bill muttered and kicked at the ground, wincing in pain at impact of a tennis shoe impacted against unyielding stone. "Where is she?"

"She's not in here? I thought you said you woke up in one of these?" Gloria asked as she waited for the iris to open fully.

"I did. I thought it was here when I found you! But no no, I had to find Gloria 'Useless' Vanapolous, queen bitch of the school, ruiner of lives and all around awful person!"

Gloria bristled at the insults, "You think I'M the awful person here!? YOU'RE the one who hit me and then made the wish that got us stuck in...wherever this is!"

"You made the first wishes after stealing the stone from me! You wished us into the future, you made Tom into Tammy, you created Willow and then ERASED my parents and sister! I had every right to hit you before you made it even worse!"

"I still don't see how you think you and Tom are the victims here! He wanted to break up with me, ME! And then what, I'm just supposed to LET him!? You don't get it, caveman, I'm SUPPOSED to be with Tom! Not the sulking little pathetic loser he is when he's around you, but the real Tom! The basketball star, the handsome chiseled jaw, son of upper middle class workers! I'm Gloria Vanapolous, and if you knew ANYTHING about me, anything at all, you wouldn't keep denying me from my fucking destiny, Bill!"

Neither of them noticed that the entire cave was now glowing with golden light, tendrils of magic stretching out towards both of them as their anger and hate for each other rose. Just as the argument was about to hit a crescendo, both teens opening their mouths to utter an echoed wish, the distant sun began to pulse and strobe once more, and the massive shockwave that followed it knocked both Bill and Gloria to the hard stone floor of the cave, which immediately gave out. The floor beneath them vanished, melting away. Then the next floor, and the floor after that. Each time Bill and Gloria fell precisely three feet, their bodies smacking painfully against cold, hard stone as what appeared to be a impromptu elevator ride lowered them deeper and deeper into the mountain before they finally reached the bottom, bruised and battered by the trip.

"Shit...Well, I was tired of walking anyway..." Bill cursed as he pulled himself into a sitting position while Gloria merely let out a long, girlish whine of pain. After a few moment,s Bill stood and craned his neck upwards, staring back up the shaft they had just descended. Far above the two of them was the curved ceiling of the cave but it vanished as the mountain quickly began filling the void, slabs of crystalline rock sliding back into place at an alarming speed. Near Bill a large archway appeared, leading out onto the shattered plains within the Ahn'Ger Stone.

"Shit!" Bill yelled, "Gloria, come on!"

"What?" Gloria said groggily, but a look upwards made her gasp in fear and surprise as the slabs raced lower and lower. Then she felt herself being jerked upwards and rushing towards the entrance, her hand wrapped in Bill's as he hustled thw two of them through the opening right as the final slab slammed into place behind them.

"Well, that was close" Bill said, panting. After catching his breath, he looked up to see...
114122112112223332311.title: Bill and Gloria continue onward together.

1141221121122233323111.content:
"Well, that was close" Bill said, pulling himself and Gloria to their feet as glittering green dust began to settle around the two teens. Aside from the sound of their hearts pounding in their chests by the near death experience, the only other sound was that of the impact's echo, fading in the unnatural atmosphere of the strange world they were stranded in.. They shared a look, Bill staring at Gloria's green-tinted face as her once fine hair was frazzled, her eyes wide with fear as she patted herself down and releasing a small cough from the cloud of dust that flew off her designer clothing. The way even her cough seemed to sound indignant and outraged made Bill chuckle as he patted himself off, sending another small cloud of dust.

"Oh, good to know you find almost dying to be funny" Gloria said, her voice shaky and whiny, "That's just what I need".

Bill rolled his eyes as he turned away from Gloria and taking in their surroundings. They were no longer on the mountain, that much was obvious, now they were standing on the plains below, which was far less uniform than it had looked from higher elevation. Bill had assumed that it would be a glassy, unbroken plain, an endless slab of green crystal, but that was not the case. Instead, it looked far more like a desert, small dunes of green dust standing motionless, flat lowlands that were riddled with millions, probably billions of tiny fractures running deep into the gem. Even where they stood, piles of loose rubble were everywhere, clusters of crystalline boulders creating an alien badland that stretched towards the distant ring of mountains where the sun was nestled.

"Well" Bill said after a moment, "I guess we just keep heading towards the middle? Maybe we'll find a way out there".

"Or we die of starvation, dehydration or by another stupid trap!" Gloria whined, but she dutifully fell in line behind Bill as he took off walking across the emerald desert, but then she gasped as suddenly a path of green bricks formed out of the ground and quickly sped into the distance towards the sun.

"I'm never going to get used to that" She said, and her eyes narrowed into a glare aimed at the back of Bill's head as he chuckled once more, "Oh, shut up!" She muttered, falling into line as Bill began walking once more.

'At least I'm stuck with a nerd' Gloria thought to herself, trying to ignore the aching pain in her feet, 'If I was stuck here with one of the girls, we'd never get out'

114122112112223332312.content:
Meanwhile, in a more familiar alternate reality...

"Where are those kids?" Willow wondered, giving her car's horn a few honks, followed by one loud honk. This wasn't like them, usually Bill and Tammy were always ready to go, Tammy not wanting to break her long-standing streak of being tardy-less and Bill following her into the car with clock like precision. Of course, Gloria being there was something Willow wasn't used to, maybe they were talking about something?

Or maybe...

Willow's eyes went wide at the thought that crept into her head. "Oh Bill, you didn't..." Willow said, her voice low and quiet. Being the big sister, Willow was always looking out for her little brother and had, over the years, casually guided Bill and Tammy together. They had always seemed so perfect for each other and as far back as Willow could remember she had played matchmaker for the two, though despite all the time they spent together (and the blushing, giggly stories that Tammy had told her in private) they had yet to actually confirm to anyone that they were in fact a couple. But Gloria Vanapolous...Willow also knew that Bill sometimes had a 'type', at least for physical appearance, and Gloria matched it. Her little brother had been acting strange the past couple of months, and Gloria had been showing up more and more...

"No, I can't let it end like that!" Willow cried out, shutting her car down and fleeing back into the house that she had lived in all her life, trying her best not to fall over in her heels and red dress. Why did she have to pick today of all days to dress fancy!?

Willow hurried up the short walkway, scaled the porch stairs and dashed through the front door of her house, determined to break up whatever teenage relationship drama that she felt was happening right at that exact moment, her blue eyes tunnel-visioned on the stairs and the landing above where she had last seen the trio. She kicked off her heels as ascended the stairs three at a time, eyes full of panic as she arrived at the top of the stairs to find...no one.

"Bill?" The elder Strasserman sibling called out, hurrying over to her brother's bedroom door, opening it, expecting to see her brother and at least ONE sobbing teenage girl, only to be greeted by his usual untidy room of video game and other geeky sci-fi junk that she knew Tammy was into. "Maybe downstairs?" Willow said to herself, turning back to the stairs that led to the first floor of the Strasserman home. The house had a full basement and Bill and Tammy had sort of taken over the area as their own little hideaway where the two often spent most their time together in, binging movies or making out on the old couch down there. Willow quickly made her way downstiars and through the remainder of the house, flinging open the basement door with wild abandon only to be greeted by an unexpected face that seemed just as surprised as her.

"AHH!" Willow screamed, stumbling backwards and almost bouncing off the kitchen island counter, her hand flailing for something, anything to defend herself with while the towering, hulk-like form of Rob Bolstrum stood paralyzed in the doorway to the basement, one hand still outstretched for the doorknob that Willow had jerked unceremoniously out of his hand. After a moment silence, Rob staring blankly at Willow while she fumbled cartoonishly against the tile of the counter, her hand eventually finding a handful of freshly washed spoons, which she seized and waved menacingly at him. The sight of a potential weapon, however small seemed to stir Rob into motion, and he chuckled as he stepped calmly through the doorway and into the kitchen proper.

"GET OUT!" Willow screamed, aware of the futility of her weapons against the wall of muscle in front of her. This was no random burglar, this was Rob Bolstrum, one of the assholes at Bill's school that had made his life hell. Bolstrum had been the 'head bully', all the other creeps taking orders from him until a new student, Jonathan Ingerman, had kicked Rob's ass and taken away all his clout and power, turning the former top dog into nothing more than his errand boy enforcer. "I SAID GET OUT!" Willow screamed again, raising the fistful of spoons high over her head, "DON'T MAKE ME USE THESE!"

"Or what, you'll spoon me to death?" Rob's voice was a playful growl as he stopped in mid-stride, :I mean, I'm done for a little spooning with you, babe"

"I MEAN IT!" Willow screamed back, hoping that someone, somewhere was listening and would either do something heroically stupid or smart and reasonable like call the police.

"Oh please don't I'm at your mercy!" Rob said, mocking Willow as he raised his hands up as though he was surrendering before busting out into a laugh. "Relax, chica, I ain't gonna rape you. I'm just here for Bill."

"What the fuck do you want with Bill, creep!?" Willow didn't relax, though she was able to slide around the edge of the counter and put more space between her and the intruder. If he made a move, she could probably make it to the door before he could grab her...And then she saw the troubled look come over Rob's face.

Rob looked around for a moment before shutting the basement door behind him. He slowly crossed the kitchen floor, raising his hands once again though this time there seemed to be /some/ sincerity behind the action, before turning on the sink and runing his calloused hands through the clear liquid that poured forward. He stood there for a moment before cupping his hands and splashing water on his bulldog-like face, taking an obnoxious slurp before shutting the water off and facing Willow once more.

"Because I need his help. I know, sounds like a bunch of bullshit, but I'm not here to hurt him. Take me to him and I promise he'll never have to worry about anything from me ever again" Rob's face looked sincere enough, his cheeks flush with embarassment as Willow stared at him in distrust.

"You're right, it does sound like bullshit!" The elder Strasserman said after a moment of disbelief. She knew this asshole, she knew what he had done to Bill, to some of her friends, to all the other kids at the high school. She had gotten away unscathed out of pure luck, and because back then, Rob didn't go after girls. It was only after Ingerman had shown up, and after Willow had graduated, that Rob's fury had truly been unleashed. In front of her, Rob's look of embarassment crumpled into his usual scowl of hate and rage.

"Oh yeah? Well does this sound like bullshit? Fucking Ingerman sent me here to burn your goddamn house to the ground, bitch! I've been in your fucking basement for almost an hour, waiting for your fucking dipshit parents to leave so maybe, just maybe, I could get to Bill without worrying about the fucking cops getting called on my ass!" Rob's stuck a large, blunt finger in Willow's face before she could realize how quick he'd moved. For someone of that size, Rob was frighteningly fast. Willow's heart was in her chest as the fight or flight instinct kicked in, but then Rob reared backwards, moving to lean back against the counter in a move that obviously took some effort.

"Yeah...yeah. Listen, I'm...sorry I scared you. I know what I am, but I'm not going to prison for Ingercunt's wounded fucking ego. Bill might be a little shit but he's fucking smart, I'm not. If he helps me take Ingercunt down, I'll be in charge again and I'll stop being an asshole. To him. Bill." Rob's voice was as close to pleading as Willow thought it could get, and although her better judgement told her otherwise, some part of her believed the big palooka in front of her. But then another thought crossed her mind as the adrenaline began to fade.

"Wait, you've been down there for an hour?" Willow pointed to the basement door, "Then no one is down there?"

"Obviously" Rob said, rolling his eyes.

"Then...where did they go?" Willow gave Rob one last wary look before setting her fistful of spoons down on the counter with a noisy clatter before sliding around the brute, heading back towards the Strasserman home's main entrance and the stairs. Without a word Willow grabbed hold of the banister and ascended to the second floor once more.

"What do you mean?" Rob asked, clomping behind her in his heavy boots.

"Bill was here with his girlfriend, I was taking them to school...I went out and got in my car, waited for five minutes...and nothing. So if I didn't see them leave...Did you hear them leave out the back door in the kitchen?" Willow asked, going door to door of the upper story and checking each of the rooms to no avail.

"No, that's why I was coming up, all I heard was some yelling, then you. Figured it was a good time."

"It was never a good time. You couldn't have just called him?" Willow said as she closed the bathroom door and looked out the hallway window, scanning the backyard for any sign of the teens.

"Lady, I've been held back three times, I live in a skid row trailer park, I have a reputation and any more I get out of pummeling twerps I have to give to a Thor wannabe. I'm too broke for a phone" Rob said as he climbed the stairs, leaning against the wall and taking the opportunity to scope out Willow's ass as she gazed out the window. That's when he saw it, a small, dark object laying at the wall near Willow's bare feet.

"Hey, what's that?"
114122112112223332312.title: Meanwhile, back with Willow and the human world...

choices: Willow puts the gemstone into her purse for safekeeping.
1141221121122233323121.content:
"Hey, what's that?" Rob said, and Willow turned to look at the hulking young adult, whose slab like finger was pointed towards her. She followed his gaze and, for a moment, thought the disgraced bully was pointing at her chest, but then saw what he was truly looking at.

There, at the edge of the small table beneath the window, was a dull green stone.

"What?" Willow said, furrowing her brow as she reached down to pick the unknown object up. Her fingers wrapped around it and she shivered at how strangely cold it's hard surface felt. She brought it up to hold in the sunlight, what remained as a early morning thunderstorm rolled in, and stared at it in confusion. It was a large teardrop of emerald, cloudy with something large and dark at the core of the gem, and a massive crack that ran down one side of it. The light seemed to dull as it passed through the gemstone, and while Willow was no geologist she knew that whatever had damaged the gemstone had clearly ruined it's luster forever.

"Well? What is it?" Rob asked as he stepped closer, his huge face suddenly far too close for Willow's comfort.

"Uh" She began, trying her best to wiggle away from the much larger man, "It might be my mom's? I didn't know she owned anything this large, though" She held the mysterious stone out at arm's length to Rob, who simply engulfed her dainty hand with a massive, calloused paw, pulling it from her fingers as he turned it once more to the fading sunlight.

"Huh" Bolstrum muttered, and for a moment he could have sworn there was a golden flash from within the gem as her rolled it around in his palm, the weak, graying light outside bending for the briefest moments before Rob shook his head. No, that was just faggoty make-believe. He'd pawned more than his fair share of jewels and none of them did that, it was just his eyes playing tricks on him. With a grunt and a shrug, Rob turned towards Willow once more and tossed it towards his unexpected partner. "Well, whatever it is, it's trash now. No one wants a gem with a huge ass crack in it"

Willow's eyes went wide and she snapped out an arm to catch the gemstone, fumbling it clumsily out of the air before it smashed against the hallway wall..

"We're not pawning it! It could be a family keepsake!" Willow hissed, glaring at Rob as she cradled the stone protectively in her hands, and if either of the two had been paying attention, they would have seen another weak glimmer of golden light emanate from the stone.

In that brief moment, as anger between the two unlikely allies rose and the magic within the Ahn'Ger Stone seemed to respond, what happened?
1141221121122233323121.title: Rediscovering the Stone

114122112112223333.content:
No one noticed that despite being an impossibly powerful artifact, the Ahn'Ger Stone was not invulnerable. It was still simply a gemstone, just one with otherworldly powers that could bend and shape reality on command. And when Bill's attack on Gloria caused her to fling the Ahn'Ger Stone down the hallway, it had cracked. In the heat of the moment Bill had no idea that the artifact in his hand was damaged.

With his wish, the power coursing through the stone was not released safely or in a way that obeyed the rules that bound the stone to it's purpose. Not even it, if the stone did or did not possess such an ability, could guess at what would happen when Bill's wish was granted.

Whatever Bill wished for next was going to go utterly, horribly wrong no matter how he said it.

"I wish..."

Option 1: “You and Tom would never go out again!” Gloria becomes a lesbian, and is ostracized by her former clique for it. Tom is dating the new leader of the clique, Vanessa, who has a much tighter hold on him. He’s become as cruel as the rest of them due to her influence, and makes fun of Gloria on a regular basis. Her only comforts are her best friend Bill, and his big sister Willow, who she harbors a silent crush on.

Option 2: “That we had never met!” Because of the damage, the stone separates Bill and Tom instead of the two of them and Gloria. In this new reality, Tom is friends with Big Jon and Rob, and is just as mean as they are. Without Tom, Gloria’s rebellious streak never starts, and she is as ladylike as her mother expects her to be. She and Bill used to be friends before she became more reserved around boys in middle school. In this reality, Bill was his parent’s first child, and they were hesitant to have another when Bill had trouble making friends. As a result, Willow is only thirteen.
114122112112223333.title: Bill makes additional wishes.

1141221121122233331.content:
The entity that inhabited the damaged gemstone was patient. Older than eons, it often waited dozens or hundreds of years before another mortal stumbled across its vessel, blissfully unaware of the chaos that laid within it. Now that the gem's latest owner, the one known as Bill Stasserman, was in the throws of unleashing his fury at the one known at Gloria Vanapoulos, the entity watched with what passed for baited breath, excited once again at the opportunity to feed on Strasserman's righteous indignation.

“I wish...” said Bill with more command in his voice than he had ever featured before as he towered over Gloria's body as she shrank against the wall, desperate for an escape route.

“I wish...” he said again with an almost imperceptible drop in venom as he held his gemstone clad fist in the air, trying to clear his head to think of an appropriately demeaning punishment for the bitch that magically erased his family from existence.

“I wish...”

Before he could come up with something, he felt someone grab his wrist.

“Bill. Stop” demanded another voice, the one known as Tammy Ackerton, formerly Tom. Despite being a teenager, her voice carried a motherly demeanor to it(Perhaps leftover from the previous reality), speaking to Bill in a firm yet sympathetic tenor. Bill craned his neck to look at his former best friend turned wife turned girlfriend.

“Bill. It's not worth it” continued Tammy in a calm, measured voice. “I know what Gloria did, but this stone is dangerous. Making another wish will just screw things up even more. Lets calm down and talk about what to do.”

For a few seconds, Bill noticed that his heart was beating rapidly. He was sweating. His face felt flush to the touch. He was hyper. Tammy was right. He nodded at her in agreement. “OK.”

He then turned to Gloria, who had grown quiet as a church mouse.

“But first, I think we can both agree that she needs to leave. Get out!” Bill yelled at the young woman like a drill sergeant, pointing firmly towards the front door downstairs. “Get out of my house and don't come back!”

If Gloria had been a little wiser, she would have rushed down the stairs as rapidly as her legs would carry her. If she had simply read the room better, she would have known not to provoke the vengeance obsessed lunatic with the nigh omnipotent magic wishing rock. If she had only been less juvenile, she would have known that this was Bill's one and only warning. She would have known that he was emotionally wounded by her reckless wishing and needed time to heal.

Then again, if Gloria couldn't have the last word, if she couldn't dig in her heels even in the face of Armageddon, she wouldn't have been a Vanapoulos.

“Fuck you, Bill!” she yelled defiantly, not allowing her pride to buckle for one second.

A painful migraine suddenly erupted in Bill's cranium. He couldn't believe it. His head swished between Tammy on one side and Gloria on the other. He couldn't BELIEVE that someone as kind as Tom/Tammy was had landed someone as irredeemably awful as Gloria. He gritted his teeth as he glared fiercely at her.

“You stupid bitch! I give you a chance to escape, and you still do this shit!” Bill screeched so loudly that he was losing his voice. “I wish that you and Tom had never gone out with each other!”

The entity within the gemstone smiled. This was the angriest wish the trio had made yet. The upstairs hallway rapidly filled with a thick green-gold mist. Bill heard the screams of Tammy and Gloria before both voices fell into oblivion.
1141221121122233331.title: Defiant To The End

choices: Continue with Bill, Gloria and Willow in this new reality.
Let's meet this reality's Tom Ackerton, sitting in jail.
11412211211222333311.content:
Our hero felt the pangs of disorientation for a few moments before he came to once again, now in his third alternate reality of the day.

Bill now felt like an old pro at the reality hopping business, and so he was not surprised as he found himself not on top the stairs, but standing idly on his front porch. He looked around as he breathed heavily, waiting for the migraine in his head to disappear, quietly listening to the birdsong in the distance. Realizing that he was in a dark place right now with his anger and despair, Bill laid down on the porch hammock and tried to calm down. For about twenty straight minutes he did nothing but concentrate on getting better, and with those precious minutes, get better he did. When he felt ready, he sighed heavily and grinned, his heart beat slowing down to his usual resting rate.

“I'm going to get through this” he told himself as a mantra. “I'm going to find Kimmy and Mom and Dad, no matter how many wishes it takes.”

He then threw his legs over the hammock and took a minute to enjoy the glorious pleasant suburban morning.

Bill sniffed, smelling the pleasant scent of dew and freshly cut grass. His skin exploded in exaltation as he felt the strong gust of wind blowing off of Lake Hopkins not far from home. Gazing downwards, he saw that he was holding the damaged Ahn'Ger Stone tightly in his right hand. He almost wanted to throw it away, but he couldn't, because he needed it. Fleeting thoughts of using the stone's power for more productive purposes crossed his mind, but he quickly put them away for later use. This wasn't a Green Lantern Ring. This wasn't an Infinity Gem. The Ahn'Ger Stone was a curse as long as he didn't know how to properly use it.

Gazing around the neighborhood, he blinked out all the madness of the last hour. Feeling his face, he felt normal. Oh God, where was he now? No, really? Did humans in this reality all have forked lizard tongues like on that Halloween episode of The Simpsons? Was Tom still a woman? Did Willow still exist?

The neighborhood was eerily quiet. He saw no one around except for a passing blue pick up truck, which he recalled belonged to Jay Rasmussen, a neighbor of the Strasserman's as he was on his way to work. Bill waved at the man in a calming gesture, and as Jay waved back at the young man and turned around the corner, Bill sighed. At least things were a little bit normal here.

On the other hands, where did his friends go? Did Bill just wish Tom and Gloria away? God, he hoped not.

“Only one way to find out” he told told himself.

After resting for nearly a half hour, our hero felt refreshed and peeled his butt off the hammock. He walked inside the front door of what he assumed was his family abode. To his relief, the foyer and the living room appeared to be exactly as he remembered it.

“Anyone home?!” he shouted out.

“We're in here, Bill!” came a reedy voice that he immediately recognized as belonging to Willow.

“Great” he sighed, realizing that this wasn't his old world, strolling apprehensively into the kitchen.

In the kitchen he indeed saw Willow. She was still in her pajamas eating a bowl of Cinnamon Toast Crunch and drinking hot chocolate from a coffee mug with a picture of David Lynch saying “That's a damn fine cup of coffee” printed on it.

On the other end of the breakfast table, with her back to Bill, sat Gloria.

“Hey sleepyhead” said Willow with a mouth full of cereal, an impish grin on her face.

So she's still my sister.

“Hey Willow” he answered her with caution as he sat down at the table with the two girls.

“I was just talking to Gloria here over what you did. You're really brave, dude. Really brave. All those superhero stories you like really paid off.”

“What?” Bill asked, genuinely confused. He looked over at Gloria, whose face looked unnaturally shy and mousy.

“For, um, for sticking up for me in front of the entire school” Gloria answered, practically blushing. Her eyes didn't carry a hint of the pride or vanity that Gloria's eyes usually revealed about her. Right now, they only carried hurt(And possible gratitude?).

“I don't remember doing that. What happened?” asked the teenage boy, feigning(Though not completely feigning) ignorance.

At this point in time, he couldn't imagine ever sticking up for Gloria. Sticking her in a fire maybe, but not helping her.

Willow began explaining, waving her spoon around in the air as she talked with her hands.

“Well, yesterday that bitchy cheerleader whose in your grade, Vanessa Chandler, outed Gloria in front of the entire school right before the football game. She grabbed a huge speaker phone and told everyone sitting in the bleachers. I wasn't there, but I can only imagine how horrible it was. Gloria said that she started crying, totally humiliated, and ran off the field. People laughed at her. It's...”

“Wait” said Bill. “Outed?”

Gloria stared at Bill with a weird look.

“I know that Tom Ackerton hit you pretty hard, Bill, but still, I didn't expect you to forget that I'm gay”.

“I...” stammered Bill, not knowing how to respond to that.

“Maybe we should just let Bill rest a little more until that concussion goes away” said Willow.

Gloria looked at Bill again and grabbed his hand.

“Sorry for snapping at you. I'm still glad for what you did. It's nice to have one friend in this town. It's just...God, why are people such trash?” asked Gloria, her defeated face hiding a toxic cocktail of anger, trauma, and exhaustion.

“It's hard to believe, but even in 2018, small towns like Shermer are still virulently homophobic” replied Willow casually. “I should know. Just wait until the people in this town find out about drag queens and genderqueer people”.

“I...somebody hit me?” said Bill, confused.

“Yeah, Tom Ackerton” answered Gloria this time. “After Vanessa.,,after she did what she did... people said you ran down the bleachers and grabbed the speaker phone away from her. I guess you really let that bigoted bitch have it, calling her out and telling her and everyone present how ashamed they should be of themselves for their prejudices and their petty bullying bullshit. Then her boyfriend Tom ran up behind and sucker punched you.”

“Our parents said you put up a good fight. I'm so proud of you, little brother” grinned Willow.

Willow, Gloria, and the kitchen began to blur out of focus as Bill took in all of this new information, shaking despite himself.

What kind of world did he fall into now?

Option 1: Continue with Bill, Gloria, and Willow in this new reality
Option 2: Lets meet this reality's Tom Ackerton, sitting in jail.
Option 3: Something else

No one noticed that despite being an impossibly powerful artifact, the Ahn'Ger Stone was not invulnerable. It was still simply a gemstone, just one with otherworldly powers that could bend and shape reality on command. And when Bill's attack on Gloria caused her to fling the Ahn'Ger Stone down the hallway, it had cracked. In the heat of the moment Bill had no idea that the artifact in his hand was damaged.

With his wish, the power coursing through the stone was not released safely or in a way that obeyed the rules that bound the stone to it's purpose. Not even it, if the stone did or did not possess such an ability, could guess at what would happen when Bill's wish was granted.

Whatever Bill wished for next was going to go utterly, horribly wrong no matter how he said it.

"I wish..."

But this time, Bill becomes mom, Tammy becomes dad and Gloria become their daughter!
