11412211211222333331.title: Gloria's New Upbringing (Options)

114122112112223333311.content:
As soon as Bill made his wish, he instantly became enveloped within a thick green-gold fog, vanishing from his family home, said fog obscuring his vision in all directions. He couldn't see more than two inches in front of him, but the teenage boy felt that he was no longer in any place that made any kind of earthly sense. For some ominous reason, he could sense that he far, far away from home, as if the magic rock his was holding had transported him into the Twilight Zone. The bizarre, uncanny mist probably helped, but it was something else too, as if Bill were somehow communing with the Stone itself, sensing its overwhelming life energy like some kind of New Age Retro Hippie gobbledygook.

An invisible presence made itself known to Bill. A strange, androgynous voice that felt omnipresent yet far away began to speak to him:

“The vessel. You broke it.”

“Who's there?!” yelled Bill, cautiously looking in every direction for the voice.

“It will take time to fix. You must find a way to repair what you have broken. Someone who can channel my energy into something more stable. It is no longer safe for you to go home. Chaos reigns there. I only have enough reserve power to transport you to the reality of your previous wish.”

The voice seemed like it was unfamiliar with the concept language, intelligently but clumsily translate its thoughts into words. Bill guessed that the mysterious voice must be involved with the stone somehow. What did it mean by the reality of...

“Wait!” the boy yelled. “You mean the reality where I'm older?”

The voice didn't respond.

“I don't want to be a middle aged man. I just want to be me!”

“That is not currently possible” announced the voice in its booming authoritative tenor, cutting the teenager off. With that, Bill once again felt his body being yanked into yet another alternate reality...

“Gah!” Bill screamed, looking at what strange place he was stuck in now.

Bill shook his head, feeling almost jet lagged by the experience. Our hero looked around, and saw that he was no longer was standing in an endless fog. Now he was sitting in somebodies living room. Not his own Strassermen family living room, but one that was unfamiliar to him. It looked pretty. Heavy curtains draped against long bay windows, the sun casting shadows over two solidly built camelback sofas(One of which Bill was sitting on), a grandfather clock, a large flatscreen TV, and an old fashioned writing desk tucked into the corner of the room. A large Persian rug covered most of the room.

In front of Bill laid an antique Ottoman coffee table with an open laptop sitting on top. Before Bill could see what was on it, the front door opened and closed.

“Hey Mom. Working on your new book?” asked a happy, inquisitive voice as its owner locked herself inside and skipped over to Bill.

It took Bill a moment to realize it, but the girl was Gloria. Despite having no reason to believe so, something in his mind just clicked. He just intuitively knew.

Her face was structured differently now, her Mediterranean good looks replaced by the WASPy countenance of Bill and Tom's family lines. Her distinctive green eyes were now a bluish-gray, the same color as Tom's. Her hair was now a dark brunette like Bill instead of a glossy black. In some ways she looked like a slightly older version of Kimberly, just mixed with some of Tom's characteristics. Still...everything else about her was Gloria. Her voice. Her mannerisms. The way she carried herself. This was Gloria, in spirit if not appearance.

But why did she call Bill Mom?

“Mom, why are you staring at me like that? Mom, are you OK? Mom?”

Looking down into a pair of breasts, Bill received his answer.

“Oh no, not again!” he screamed in a husky, sensual voice which clearly wasn't his.

Bill ran upstairs to find a mirror...

Breathing heavily, as if this body wasn't used to any form of exercise, Bill huffed and puffed as he reached the upstairs bathroom and locking himself into it. Gazing into the mirror just above the sink, he realized that he was indeed now a middle aged mother. Roughly twenty minutes ago, the Stone transformed him into a middle aged man. Now he was a middle aged woman, and if that weird voice was telling the truth, the stone was now broken. He might be stuck this way for a long time. Damn you, Gloria!

As our hero took a deep breath and calmed down, splashing some water on his face from the bathroom sink, he gradually took greater stock of his new face. He looked strikingly like his own mother Martha, just slightly off thanks to his father's genes playing a role in the cocktail that was Bill. Nevertheless, he was obviously his mother's offspring. His now diminished height, his long brunette hair, his bone structure, the curvy body shape. If he had been born female and been allowed to grow into middle age, this is probably what Bill would end up looking like.

He was pretty, thought Bill, for an older woman at least. He noticed that his new body was dressed slightly bohemian, sporting a floral tunic dress and some black leggings. He had a pair of black framed cats eye glasses tucked into the collar of his tunic and a gold necklace adored with some sort of occult symbol. As he continued to breath, his not insignificant breasts rose up and down, up and down, up and down...

A loud knock erupted from the bathroom door.

Option 1: “Mom, are you OK?” asked the altered Gloria, worrying why her mother had flipped out all of a sudden.

Option 2: “Willow? Honey?” asked the grown up Tom Ackerton, Bill's new husband, who has a few secrets of his own.

Option 3: Bill hyperventilates and passes out.

1141221121122233333131.content:
Bill coughed and wheezed as the strange magic clouds filled his nostrils and throat, irritating the delicate membranes within. As he waved his arms in a vain attempt to clear the air, the teenage boy wasn't sure why the magic had been released in a cloudy smog like fashion as opposed to just pure light, but Bill knew something was different as the air cleared and visibility returned to his house.

Immediately, Bill knew that something had changed. He was now in the living room, on first floor of his house, sitting on the couch alone with the Ahn'Ger Stone with Tammy and Gloria nowhere to be seen. While he wasn't overly concerned with Gloria's disappearance, the lack of a Tammy in his home was cause enough for alarm. As he was about to call out for his erstwhile best friend turned wife turned...whatever Tammy was to him now, a loud pounding on the Strasserman home's front door forced him to put that particular worry aside for the moment.

Pulling himself up from the familiar comfort of the couch, Bill cautiously crossed the threshold between the living room and the foyer and stared at the large wooden door and the figures beyond it's cloudy crystal glass pane. It was always hard for Bill to tell who was out there if it wasn't someone whose silhouette looked familiar to him, like Tom's did...had.

Bill paused for a moment to look down at his left hand which held the strange wishing artifact that had forever changed his life for the weirder. Just like it had Tom's. But the larger figure beyond the glass lifted a fist and began pounding on the door once more, shaking Bill out of his thoughts.

"I'm coming!" He called out, moving towards the door and opening it to a shock which caused his jaw to go limp.

There, in the doorway, stood a very tired looking Tammy and a much younger, blonder version of Gloria, clutching Tammy's hand and staring at Bill with wide, brown eyes. A version of Gloria that looked to be only three years old.

Then Tammy said...

"Let's go, Bill. I need to drop Gloria off at daycare before we get to school" Tammy said, pointing a thumb back at the stuttering car, "You know how bad the traffic is at the school, and with the car acting up and the rain moving in I want to try to get a good parking spot"

"Uh" Was all Bill could say as Tammy rolled her eyes in annoyance. As Bill's mind processed the information, he managed to get a good look at Tammy, and it was clear she was still the same girl she had been moments earlier, before his wish had twisted things even further from the reality that they'd all originally started in what felt like a lifetime ago. Although the dark circles under her eyes and the lack of any sort of make-up, the barely combed hair and least amount of effort outfit clearly did not show the same adorably sexy geek girl that Bill was familiar with.

"Look, I'm sorry I'm running late, okay? Between finals at school and taking care of Gloria I just overslept" Tammy said with a sigh while Gloria huddled closer to Tammy's leg, still staring at Bill with wide, brown eyes that clearly only he remembered being a different color just minutes ago.

The former Vanapolos was wearing a pink My Little Pony shirt, a pair of black tights and tiny Frozen shoes that lit up as Gloria shifted back and forth on her feet. A small, pink MLP backpack hung from her tiny shoulders, previously concealed by the matching pink shirt and Gloria's lengthy golden hair. Now that he could get a good look at it, Bill could see that there was only enough of Gloria's previous identity left in her face to make him recognize who she used to be, instead, Gloria's face was a mix of Tammy and Bill's own features, brown eyes, blond hair, flatter cheekbones and a slightly upturned nose that had replaced the sharp, elegant one that Gloria's previous genetic make-up had given her.

There was absolutely no doubt about it, this version of Gloria was Bill and Tammy's daughter. But if they were still teenagers and Gloria looked to be at least three years old...The consequences of his wish made Bill's mind do some additional somersaults while Tammy's face began to turn hard.

"Are you coming? We really need to get going, I can't have another tardy notice"
114122112112223333313111.title: Daddy's Girl: High School Days

1141221121122233333131111.content:
Bill's eyebrows raised at Tammy's comment about not being tardy again. He couldn't exactly remember why, but that seemed so unlike her, Bill somehow recalling his girlfriend being a very serious student concerned with getting into a good college. In the original reality, Tom Ackerton was never exactly Mr. Punctuality, and Bill never remembered him having concrete plans for his future after high school. So why did he remember Tammy as...

Oh shit, Bill thought to himself.

Three sets of memories, one brain. All of the trips through the different dimensions caused by the stone was messing with his ability to keep them all straight! Memories from one reality where he and Tammy began going together suddenly came to mind.

Middle school. Eighth grade. They were study buddies. Tammy had helped him out in biology once, and he helped her in algebra. They started geeking out over different mutual interests, and that was when Tammy first pecked him on the cheek. Then one thing led to another.

In the other, other reality, where Bill and Tammy grew into middle age and married, he now recalled how they sat together in a college class on human sexuality. She was much more studious than he had been, and indeed, had never been late for class.

With a depressed realization, he guessed that in the reality he currently found himself in, Tammy being a teen mother had taken up all of her time, preventing her from focusing on anything else, whether that included school, her appearance, or Bill himself. Aye yai yai yai yai.

“Honey?” he heard Tammy ask, who along with Gloria was already hallway down the sidewalk to the car.

“Oh. Right. Sorry. Zoned out for a minute” said Bill as he locked his front door and followed the mother and daughter.

“Good thing I listened to the weather app and brought an umbrella” Tammy casually mentioned as everyone settled inside the Cavalier, Bill in the passenger seat and Gloria in the back, still using a car seat. The clouds were now considerably darker than they had been ten minutes ago, the light drizzle had intensified into a full on thunderstorm. Windshield wipers up, the young family drove down the avenue and around the corner.

Neither Bill nor Tammy said a word during the trip, the two damaged lovebirds just focusing on the drive. Tammy's phone was playing “Seasons of Love” from the Rent soundtrack as it sat on the dashboard, Bill recalling that his girlfriend was into musicals.

Gloria meanwhile was enraptured in a Little Golden Book adaptation of the last Star Wars movie.

Within exactly seven minutes, the two young parents arrived at the daycare facility where Gloria would stay for the day until 3:30 P.M when Tammy picked her up, her own parents not arriving home from work until later in the day.

“You want to come in?” asked Tammy through the passenger side window as she held little Gloria in her arms.

Bill stared at Gloria as her brown eyes bored right through to his soul. He couldn't...he didn't WANT to believe that the girl that he hated was now this sweet little cherubic angel.

“I'm fine. I'll sit here” he practically whispered through the window, the raindrops sounding like Iwo Jima as they pelted Tammy's loyal vehicle.

“Suit yourself. They make pretty good hot chocolate here” said the sweet blonde as she walked inside.

Bill waited, staring intensely at the Ahn'Ger Stone as he took it out of his pocket. He just wanted to just get back home to normal life. He didn't even necessarily mind if Big Jon and Rob Bolstrum were there. He just needed some normalcy. Maybe when he could control the powerful artifact would he ever consider using it again. He thought of different ways he could trigger himself safely into anger so he could make a wish, not noticing the crack which ran through the gem.

Five minutes later, Tammy walked back outside, an umbrella shielding herself from the onslaught of cold rain as she held a white Styrofoam cup of hot chocolate in her other hand. She closed the umbrella, got inside, put the drink in her cup holder, and shut the door harder than Bill expected a girl of her size to. She then stared at Bill with the saddest eyes.

“Bill, honey, we really need to talk. Before we go, we really, really need to talk.”

“What about?” he gulped, feeling vaguely uncomfortable by the environment he found himself in.

“About us” she said forebodingly.

“I...” she said, hesitating.

“I've done everything I can to comfort you through this, Bill” she continued, grabbing his right arm tenderly. “I know how much you didn't want to be a father this young. I know I sure as hell didn't expect to be a mother this young, but I think we're finally going to have to start sharing responsibility for Gloria.”

Bill stared at Tammy as her face went through a torrent of emotions- Frustration, anger, empathy, despair- before going on with her plea.

“You know how much my life has taken a hit since it happened. Stuff you'll never have to worry about like stretch marks, losing the baby weight, being called a slut by Big Jon and his gang of pricks and a whore who should have kept her legs shut by bitchy neighbors like Mrs. Casey. My life's been hell” she said, laughing bitterly, rolling her eyes at the memory of the old bat attempting to shame her one morning. “Meanwhile, your stock went up. You get called a player. A pimp. You have guys on the football team congratulating you, saying “I didn't know you had it in you!”. You can understand my frustration in the double standards we both had, right?”

Bill nodded his head. He hadn't expected this at all.

“I'm sorry, Tammy. If I only knew...”

She sighed hard.

“It's fine. You're a good guy deep down. The sweet little dork I fell in love with isn't dead yet. I know that. Anyway, my parents have been really cool about Gloria for the most part, but hey, I have ears, OK? I hear them talk at night when my door is shut. I heard Dad whisper to Mom one night that he was disappointed in me, and I cried myself to sleep. Bill...”

A memory emerged in Bill's mind.

“I...know how close you and your dad are. That must have hurt.”

“It did” said Tammy. “But like I said, they're mostly cool about it. They like being grandparents. Still...I need a break. I...I just wish that you would do your part and take care of her every once in a while. To stop shirking responsibility. To stop making excuses. Be a Dad. I have a life too! And we both owe it to her that she sees both of her parents.”

Bill's eyes betrayed a total and complete blindside. In this new, colder reality, he was apparently a deadbeat father. It floored him. He stared dead eyed at Tammy for what seemed like an eternity before she snapped him out of it. He had thought that a world without Kimmy or his parents was the worst reality he could imagine, but somehow...somehow this might have been even worse.

“Just think about it” said Tammy, starting the engine and pulling away from the parking lot on the way to school.

Option 1: At school, Bill discovers a big surprise: Willow is there! She is still Bill's sister in this reality, and is his only real friend there.

Option 2: Lets follow the life of childless Ariadne Vanapoulos

Option 3: Meanwhile at daycare...

"Thanks for taking her today, Bill. I've got classes and a double shift at work and mom and dad are out of town for the week. I know it's your day off work but this is a big help" Without the motherly tone, Tammy's voice sounded just as exhausted as she clearly looked, and that was when Bill realized that she was older than she had been moments ago. In the brief moment he had before Tammy handed him a small duffel bag that had been, until now, sitting unseen off to the side of the door, Bill realized she must have been at least five years older, making her twenty-three, at least. And her outfit was entirely different, gone were the geek-chic clothes that teenage Tammy had worn, instead replaced with a simple pair of jeans and a featureless sweatshirt that was at least one size too big.

That was when Bill realized he felt slightly...off. Had he been changed by his own wish? And if this was his 'day of from work' and not a single mention of high school at all, did that mean the he too was older? But he had no time to check his body for any changes as the duffel bag was thrust into his arms and Tammy was leaning down to Gloria's tiny form, enveloping the former Vanapolous in a massive embrace ending with a tender kiss on the cheek.

"Mommy loves you, Gloria, have fun with daddy and I'll pick you up after work okay" Tammy said, ending the embrace with another kiss on the cheek before placing a hand on the back of Gloria's My Little Pony shirt and pushing her gently towards Bill. The small child took a few steps forward and reached a tiny hand our for Bill's much larger one, sliding tiny, soft fingers onto Bill's hand, the one that contained the Ahn'Ger Stone, still clenched behind the flesh and bone.

"Okay mommy, I love you!" Gloria said, her voice youthful, full of energy and a hint of sadness as Tammy stood and faced Bill once more.

"When we have time later, we really need to talk, okay Bill? It's important" Bill's mind was currently doing a somersault as it tried to process the information, but he could see that Tammy was fighting back tears. The look on her face was something Bill had only seen when Tom and Gloria had, several realities ago, had their big 'relationship talk' that would always end with them getting back together. Was...was that what is was for Bill and Tammy now? But the sad look on Tammy's face hardened as Bill remained silent, eyes that were almost pleading with him narrowing at his silence.

Bill didn't need another hint. "Uh, yeah! Yes. We should talk later"

Tammy's face softened again and the hint of smile flashed across her face. "Good! Maybe tonight?" Tammy's face brightened as Bill agreed, a hand reaching out and giving his right arm a soft squeeze. And with that, Tammy turned and walked off Bill's porch and back to her car. With one last kiss blown and a wave, clearly intended towards Gloria who simply waved and screamed out "BYE MOMMY I LOVE YOU!" at the top of her little voice. And then Tammy was gone, pulling down the street and off into her apparently very busy day.

After a moment of watching the brake lights fade into the darkening morning as the storm rolled over the town, Bill felt a tugging at his hand and he looked down at an eager little face that only held slight traces of Gloria's previous parentage, and was largely a younger version of Tammy's face with a smidgen of Bill's own features thrown in. She was clearly Bill's daughter. Gloria Strasserman. Or would it be Gloria Ackerton? Or instead of finding out, maybe he should just try to wish everything back to normal...

"Daddy can I watch your TV?" Gloria asked, her eyes shimmering with excitement.

"I wish you'd been raised by someone that taught you how to be nice to others!" Bill roared, and the upper hallway of the Strasserman residence was immediately filled with a heavy green bank of fog that poured forth from BIll's clenched fist. His vision fell away to nothing but a wall of pale green as the clouds engulfed everything before suddenly receding back within the gemstone. Blinking the last vestiges of smoke from his eyes, he saw that the only two people in the hallway were now himself and Tammy, who was rubbing and blinking her own eyes, clearing the remnants of the magic from her vision.

And Gloria was nowhere to be seen.

Bill couldn't help but crack a hateful grin at the empty spot on the carpet that Gloria had inhabited just moments ago before relaxing his fist and sliding the Ahn'Ger Stone out to rest between his thumb and index finger, a thin tendril of green smoke trailing of of the large crack in it's surface that Bill had yet to notice. Had Bill had noticed the damage to the Ahn'Ger Stone, Bill might have realized that his wish to create a nice version of Gloria had gone horribly, utterly wrong. Instead of making it so that Gloria had been born to a family that would raise her not to be so controlling, manipulative, selfish and uncaring of others, instead the damaged Stone had done the complete opposite. In it's damaged state it had reached out and detected the two meanest individuals in the area, changing them to be suitable as parents of the former Gloria Vanapolous. But Bill knew none of this, and he began to revel in his victory.

"Finally, you do something right for a change!" Bill said triumphantly, giving Tammy a huge grin as though he'd just done something amazingly heroic. For so long Tom had suffered, and by extension, Bill had suffered under Gloria's tyrannical yoke, and with the final straw of changing Bill's entire family around, wiping his little sister from existence and putting his and Tammy's daughter in the role as his older sister was just too much to bear anymore. He had done it, Bill had finally removed the problem from their lives! Now he could (maybe) wish Tom back to normal and they could go on enjoying their lives as it should have been, not what Gloria had turned it into.

But as his eyes focused on Tammy, he saw that the disgraced basketball star turned adorable geek girl next door had undergone changes herself, and not for the better. His grin faded immediately.

Gone was the slight layer of fat that had given Tammy her adorable softness, now the teenage boy turned girl was clearly overweight as her waistline had ballooned outward, her face now chunky and splotched by acne marks, rounded off by a double chin while a pair of tired eyes stared out from behind a pair of glasses. Her hair was now a mess, a mousy, dull nest of blonde hair that looked like it hadn't been properly cared for in a long time, and even Tammy's imported fashion sense, geek-chic had been replaced by a pair of oversized jeans topped by a featureless gray sweatshirt, both of which did little to hide Tammy's newly oversized body.

"Bill, what did you do?" Tammy asked weakly as she stared down at herself in horror.

---

Meanwhile, elsewhere...

Things had happened so fast for Gloria. One moment she had been confused as to why Bill had seemed so upset, and then the next moment he had hit her and taken the gemstone! Then Strasserman had screamed his wish and then everything had gone...green? She felt herself moving, her body changing and shifting before suddenly the world popped back into focus, and Gloria found herself laying on a bed that smelled strongly of cheap beer and cigarettes, stinging her sensitive noise as her body suddenly felt weighed down, her stomach churning as her head began to throb painfully.

"Oh, oh god..." Gloria moaned, and pulled herself upright, untangling herself from the sheets of the bed and stumbling across thin carpet, alien glass bottles clattering as the teenager struggled to maintain her balance while the contents of her stomach began a quick and violent climb upwards towards her mouth. She reached for the dim outline of a door and jerked it open without stopping, Gloria stumbled out of the very small room and crashed into the opposite wall of a very narrow hallway. Somehow, she instinctively knew where to go, barefoot thundering a few steps down the short hallway and into the darkened opening she somehow knew was a particularly filthy bathroom. Her hands flew out into the shadows and bounced painfully off the hard plastic of a light switch, her fingers stinging as she reached out again and flipped the switch upwards, filling the bathroom with weak, yellow light. Had Gloria had the time to take in her surrounding and not make an immediate beeline for the toilet, she would have seen that it was filthy, stains on the walls and tile, an overflowing garbage basket and a tub that more than a few beer cans in it. But Gloria simply dashed for the porcelain throne, knelt in front of it, and vomited up the contents of her stomach.

Acid and bile surged through Gloria's body while salty tears stung her eyes, her hair dangling dangerously close to the foul water of the toilet bowel. Gloria's body heaved and retched for several minutes as it purged itself of the excess booze and stomach acids before finally she pulled back as the last of the bile spilled from her mouth in a long tendril of drool. She spit the last of the terrible contents out of her mouth and collapsed backwards against a wall that seemed far too thin as the world swirled around her. Gloria closed her eyes and shifted into a slightly more comfortable position for a few moments before finding the energy in her drained body to pull herself upwards, a hand that lacked her manicured nails grasping the small counter that held the bathroom's small sink, and above it, the lone medicine cabinet. The only one in the house.

'How do I know all this? 'Why do I feel so weird?' Gloria thought to herself as she slowly pulled herself up, her free hand pushing the toilet's handle downward and sending the stinking mess from her insides down into the septic tank, her entire body feeling strange beyond the massive hangover that she was clearly suffering from. Her questions were answered as she finally stood and looked at herself in the mirror, her changed eyes going wide in terror.

On top of being almost a foot taller, Gloria's entire body had been changed.

Gone were her Mediterranean looks, the large nose, the silky black hair that once hung down her back replaced with short strawberry blonde curls that barely went past her ears, her eyes now a strange blue-green crowned by thick eyebrows that had more than a few piercings. A light smattering of freckles across her plain cheeks and thin, pursed lips that replaced her previously full ones completed a face that could have, with enough work and make-up, been attractive. Now she was rather plain, with vague Nordic features that seemed to be cancelled out by the other half of her new genetic code. Even below her neck, Gloria's good looks had been re-arranged, her breasts were different and larger than they had been before, hanging freely beneath a ratty gray t-shirt that had more than a few stains on it. Gloria's arms were larger than she remembered them being, toned and muscled, and covered in tattoos that led to two large hands that seemed to be almost twice the size of their original form. Her hips were more or less gone, simply small curves on the road to her legs which, despite feeling like they were made of concrete at the moment, were clearly just as toned and muscled as her arms were.

"Oh god!" Gloria screamed, throwing herself away from the counter and slamming once more into a wall that felt perilously thin. "What did Bill do to me!?" She screamed, as she stared at her new body in horror. Even her voice was different! Gone was her cute soprano, her voice now deeper, huskier.

But further inspection was impossible as a great rumbling came from the next room over. A bed creaked loudly and the sound of two feet thundering closer through the clattering of bottles and cans before the door next to the bathroom tore open and an ominous, very angry shape appeared in the doorway.

"What the fuck did I tell you about making noise!?" The very female voice hissed in anger, and it took a moment for the identity of the older, topless woman in front of her to register. Knowledge, unbidden, began to pour into her mind, reinforcing the familiarity of her surroundings as suddenly she became aware that beyond her physical appearance, she wasn't Gloria Vanapolous anymore. There was something else in her, something that was born of the small, falling apart trailer she now knew was her home, had been her home her entire life. Anger, resentment, hate, survival instincts against not just the woman in front of her, someone she knew she was stronger than but still felt an intense fear towards, but the rest of the world for how she had been raised.

"F-fuck!" Gloria barked, the expletive feeling...familiar yet alien to her, "I-I'm sorry...mom?"

"You damn well better be!" Hissed...

11412211211222333331321.content:
"Now get me a beer! Better be fucking cold!" Bobbi Ingerman hissed at Gloria as she scuttled down the narrow hallway, new memories emerging from some hidden recess in her mind.

She wasn't Gloria Vanapolous anymore. She was Carol Ingerman, daughter of Jonathan Ingerman and Bobbi Bolstrum, which she now knew as her parents, but the clinging memories of her previous life told her that this was wrong, that Rob and Big Jon were the bullies of the high school that Gloria...Carol barely attended. And was always on the edge of expulsion from.

But her parents were older, not teenagers, and Bobbi, mom, definitely wasn't a guy!

The handful of photos that hung on the stained walls of the small single wide trailer confirmed the new memories: A couple of photos of mom and dad when they were in high school some thirty years ago. Short stack mom's perpetual scowl and mane of wild red hair sitting above two large pendulums barely contained by a crop top, arm wrapped around dad in his varsity jacket. A picture of them getting married, mom in a cheap thrift store veil and low cut dress, dad in a dress jacket that was obviously loaned, a court magistrate behind them. A picture of herself as a infant, then another one that had clearly been taken just a few years ago as Glo...Carol scowled at the camera outside a bar.

'I...Why is this happening!?' The part of her that was still Gloria said as she stopped to stare at the photos before taking in the rest of the small domicile she now/always had lived in. The 'living room' was little more than a pile of trash, pizza boxes, beer bottles, cans, fast food wrappers and more ashtrays and cigarette butts. The brown curtains that at some point in their lives had been white were pulled tightly shut, while a long, threadbare couch and a decrepit looking recliner dominated the rest of the room. An old box TV, one that still had a VHS deck and a DVD player sat lifelessly in the far corner. Carol's memories knew that it didn't work most of the time, not that anyone in the Ingerman 'home' ever bothered to watch it.

"Don't make me come get it myself, you stupid cunt!" Came the harpyish cry of Carol's mother, and Gloria's fragile train of thought stopped dead in it's tracks as the 'new' part of her took over, a spike of fear forcing the girll's new body on a familiar path through the garbage and into the attached kitchen, which was in no better shape. Carol reached the buzzing fridge, opened the door to the unwelcome smell of food gone bad, and pulled out a bottle of Brier's, mom's favorite brand.

"Coming, mom!" Carol called out, her voice croaky as her heart tried to leave her throat. Her mother was not to be crossed, Bobbi Ingerman, back when she was a Bolstrum, had always been trouble. Her body blooming at an early age, using it to her advantage and royally destroying anyone that got in her way. High school drop out, frequent patron and employee of bars in the local area, chain smoker. She only barely cleaned up her act when she met Jon Ingerman, a football star that had more than a bit of a bad boy streak. They'd hooked up, and then mom got sent to women's prison for two years for assaulting another girl that had flirted with Jon, and during a conjugal Carol had been conceived.

Nearly all of Bobbi's pregnancy had been in prison, under watchful lock and key. In the back of her mind Carol knew she had the same prison system that she herself was narrowly avoiding to thank for not being born some booze baby retard. Not that it had saved her from other things, given Bobbi hadn't been much of a mother, doing just enough to stay on foot ahead of having her 'welfare ticket' taken away.

As she made her way back through the living room and down the hallway, where her mother waited in the doorway of the trailer's 'master bedroom', she subconsciously rubbed the cold beer bottle on the scar where, during one drunken night when Carol had been little, the little girl had accidentally knocked over a lamp while playing, and Bobbi had beaten the shit out of her, snapping her arm to the bone and forever instilling within the girl a deep fear of her mother. There had been plenty of other beatings, some deserved, some undeserved, but Carol knew that her mother was a woman to be feared above all others, even if what she was now was a short, overweight hag.

"Here, mom" Carol said, reaching her mother at the end of the hallway, who simply grabbed the bottle and turned back into her darkened bedroom.

"Slow as hell. Should have had your dumb ass aborted when I had the chance" Bobbi said, turning and sneering at her daughter. Carol shrugged off the insult, adding it to the mountain that had accumulated in the eighteen years of her life.

"Sorry, mom" Was all she could say, looking down at her feet like she was supposed to. 'I guess she's too tired or hungover. No slap' she thought to herself as she waited for her dismissal.

Bobbi stared at her for a moment before grabbing hold of the door with a fat, meaty hand, "Just get the fuck out of here and go to school. Or better yet, follow in my footsteps and get a fucking job and start helping pay the bills. Should just throw your skank ass out for freeloading"

"Okay, mom" Carol said, and for a long moment she expected another tirade of insults, or physical abuse to come flying her way, but with a disgusted sigh, Bobbi Ingerman simply slammed the door in Carol's face. From beyond the door the teen could hear her mother crack open the beer and mutter "Just like her fucking father..." before Carol turned and made her way back to the tiny closet that was her room in the tiny trailer.

Gloria resurfaced as the teen entered the small bedroom, which was littered with a handful of beer bottles and stank of cigarette smoke, dozens of butts filling up an ashtray on the smallest bedside table Gloria had ever seen sitting beneath the window. The Carol part of her mind told her she should get out of there, and Gloria found herself drifting over to the closet, pulling out a pair of jeans that had seen better days and the most conservative top she could find; which was a black t-shit, one of the few that looked like it wasn't for sleeping in. Quickly changing clothes (and discovering that she was right at a D cup bra size), Gloria/Carol pulled on her sneakers and left the trailer, exiting out into another world that was both alien and familiar.

The Shermer Fields trailer court. Little more than a tornado bait collection of run-down trailers, the Fields were skid row. It was quiet this morning, but that wasn't anything unusual. Most of the inhabitants of the Fields were much like the Ingermans; poor, and perpetually drunk or high, living in squalor because they simply could not hold down any sort of real job for longer than it took to get a paycheck or two.

With a sigh that saw the Gloria part of her personality slip back beneath the mental waves, Carol made her way towards the trailer park's entrance.

'Maybe the bitches will be there' She thought, her small group of equally...financially disabled lackeys that grouped together not out of any particular like of each other, but because it was easier to get what they wanted when they stuck together. Carol at least hoped that Marcy Collins was there, she was the one with the car after all. As she walked, the last words of Bobbi floated back into Carol's mind.

"Just like her fucking father..."

Carol barely knew the man who had given her the height, the athletic build and slight Nordic features that poked through her mother's genetics. At best, her earliest memories were of a phantom that drank heavily and largely ignored her, and then as a name of a child support check. He and mom were not divorced, but it was clear whatever marriage they had was long over. Carol hadn't even seen the man in four years, the last time he had shown up had been for a day, long enough to sleep off a hangover before he was gone again. Carol knew he was still in the local area, that she had half-sisters somewhere out in the world. That her mother had ruined whatever career her father had hoped to have in football by turning him into an alchoholic and trapping him for good after the fateful conjugal.

Luck seemed to be with Carol as she rounded the last trailer and saw Marcy sitting there in her rusting green car. Giving the bulldog faced girl a short wave, Carol marched across the gravel and, with a painfully loud creak of the ancient car's doors, settled into her 'friend's' vehicle, which smelled exactly like Carol's bedroom. The two exchanged a quick hello, and then they were off to school. Carol stared out the window at the world passing her by as her thoughts lingered on her father.

The thought of being like him made Carol bristle, the old familiar anger surfacing quickly and easily. Not just at her father, but her mother, her life. Herself. Much as Carol tried, she couldn't escape her mother's words. Violence came easily to her, the pent up emotions from a non-childhood of neglect and abuse, falling into the same spiral that had trapped her mother and father. Carol wanted to be better, to be more than she was, but all she had been able to do thus far was stay one head above the rising water of life; grades that were just high enough to pass and keeping her business at school away from school. And mostly away from the cops.

That is, until that fucking Tammy Ackerton had squealed about Carol vandalizing Mr. Kirkpatrick's car after the old fool had given Ingerman detention for being late to class. Again. The little pig had been Carol's favorite target in life, the mousy little thing and her pushover personality. Carol's constant verbal and sometimes physical abuse had led to girl into stress eating, making her get fat and miserable. And that faggoty little nerd she went out with...what was his name?

"Bill!" Gloria said as she drifted further and further away.

"Ackerton's fucktoy? Why you talking about him?" Marcy's gravel voice asked.

“Bill, what did you do?” squeaked the newly plump and pockmarked Tammy Ackerton, the handsome athlete turned geek girl shocked by her unflattering new appearance. She squeamishly poked at the flab on her belly.

“Tammy, I...I didn't mean to...I...” Bill stuttered, in equal disbelief as he stared at his girlfriend with eyes that shifted between distress, guilt, and subconscious disgust. What the hell had just happened? The lanky teenager couldn't understand what part of his wish had caused Tammy to transform into a four-eyed pizza faced blimp!

A foreign part of Bill felt guilty about thinking of Tammy that way as he rubbed his eyes to remember something that had just slipped his mind. He knew how much the female bullies of the school like Carol Ingerman liked to torment her, just like how the male bullies such as Jules Harper enjoyed tormenting him. Bill knew that overeating and other eating disorders were a common if unhealthy way many people dealt with stress...

Wait. Who the hell was Carol?

“Honey, who is Carol Ingerman?” he asked Tammy.

“Someone who I’d never not talk about right now” Tammy answered sarcastically, sighing at the expansive rear end she now owned.

“Fine, I’ll figure it out myself” muttered Bill impertinently.

One part of Bill already who Carol was, a tall and tattooed troublemaker who came from a broken home in the bad part of town, and more or less Jules Harper’s gun moll, someone who Tammy was utterly terrified of, but something about that just felt wrong.

Another part of Bill, the part that felt less real and yet somehow more right, had never heard of such a person. This part of him felt a mental cavity, a gap in his memory of someone else who constantly caused drama for him and Tammy, someone who never failed to make him really, really angry. He knew that it wasn't Carol Ingerman. It was somebody similar to Carol, but not her.

He knew her name, it was just on the tip of his tongue. Greta? No, but it definitely started with a G. Gretchen? Gwen? Georgina? Grace?

Try as he might, he just couldn’t place her. It was such a frustrating, almost alien sensation, like a page torn in the middle of a novel you're reading.

And Jules? Jules Harper was a known bully, yet another member of the infamous Shermer Fields peanut gallery and nobody that Bill wanted to cross, but wasn't it somebody else who always gave him a hard time? Or was it? It was so hard to tell with his brain bearing the weight of two separate versions of reality. One version was telling him that Jules was the kingpin of Shermer High with Carol at his side, and the other one said that Jules was just a flunkie of someone else, someone bigger and meaner than him. Jesus Christ, what else had changed in Bill’s life?

He raged at the inanimate object he held in his hand, resisting the urge to throw it against the wall. Tammy’s head swiveled up from appraising her newly fattened physique, her rat’s nest of blonde curls limply falling to the back of her neck. She saw that her boyfriend was still not in a good place.

“The stone fucked us again, Tammy! First it erases my family, and now it's playing with my memories!”

Furious and frustrated beyond belief, his face flushed with red and his lungs breathing hard. He was about to give in to his urges childishly throw the stone against the farthest wall of the hallway, hopefully smashing the fucking thing into itty bitty pieces, when...

“Bill, stop! You're better than this” Tammy demanded. Impulsively, she clasped his hands. “This isn’t you. The man that I love isn’t a raging lunatic. He’s kind and compassionate and thinks things through!”

Instantly, Bill felt a surge of electricity course through his veins. Even though Tammy was chubby and to his shame admittedly less physically attractive to her now, her voice still sounded like honey, and her embrace still felt angelic. She was also, as she always was, the far more levelheaded of the two. Like a passing summer breeze, his anger went away.

“You’re right. I’m sorry. Tammy, I think that I’m going crazy! I’ve got two different sets of memories in my head. I mean, apart from the memories where we’re married, which I’m still having trouble accepting, and...”

“Honey, I know. I'm going through the same thing. Listen, I think I know what happened. When you lost your temper and slapped Carol in the face, I saw it fly out of her hand and launch towards the window. See?.”

Tammy pointed towards the window overlooking the backyard, where a spiderweb full of cracks in the glass could be clearly seen.

“Oh no!” Bill moaned again. “My new parents are going to kill me!”

“You're missing the point. I think the gem is broken.”

“Broken?”

Tammy nodded.

“Tammy, it’s not an X-Box controller. I mean gemstones are formed under extreme heat and pressure, right? They don’t just get damaged.”

“Yes, yes, they do honey. Trust me. I’m a woman who knows her jewelry. Remember all the pretty things you used to buy me for our anniversaries? I mean, emeralds aren’t as fragile as eggshells or anything, but they get scratched all the time, and if you throw them hard enough, they’re going to get chipped.”

“It’s not like Carol’s a professional baseball player or something!”

“Bill! Whether or not that awful bitch deserved it or not is not the point! She was scared.”

“OK, OK” stammered Bill impatiently. “So you’re saying that when I slapped Carol, she accidentally threw the stone against the window, and then it got chipped or something.”

“Or something. It’s probably worse than chipped to be perfectly honest.”

“And then what?”

“I don’t know! Maybe the magic inside spilled out. Like, um, like...remember that episode of Buffy The Vampire Slayer? The Wish?”

“I never watched Buffy. That was your show, not mine.”

“Oh for God’s sake. I’m saying that the emerald is like a vessel, OK? It’s filled with magical energy, and once it got broken, the magic spilled out or something. You made some kind of wish about her being nicer. Good luck with that by the way, but maybe once the emerald got damaged, it….misunderstood what you were saying? Goddamn it, Bill, just open your hand and let me see.”

Bill reluctantly opened the his clenched palm, and Tammy gasped.

Right in the center of the gorgeous gemstone was a deep fault line. Faint wisps of green and gold smoke could be seen billowing out from it like a burning ember from a campfire.

**

Gloria darted out of the bathroom and began to scuttle down the narrow hallway when she felt a had grab her shoulder. She spun around on the spot and suddenly the realization clicked as new memories flooded into her mind. This was her mother, Joanna Bolstrum, and the hulking mass of muscle beyond her in the darkened 'master bedroom' of the single wide trailer was her father, Rob Bolstrum. But that couldn't be right, Rob Bolstrum was a bully at Shermer high, and Joanna was supposed to be Big Jon Ingerman, the ringleader of all the bullies.

'What is happening here!?' Gloria thought to herself.

"Wait. Carol, honey, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that. I'm just tired, Your father just went to sleep, and the last thing either of us needs is for him to wake up" Joanna Bolstrum's voice was softer, quieter than it had been moments before. In a flash of emotions Gloria felt herself giving way to the flood of memories as she realized her name, along with everything else about her, was different. She wasn't Gloria Vanapolous anymore, she was Carol Bolstrum!

Carol turned to face her mother once more, and felt a enormous need to hug her. Large breasts pushed against large breasts as Gloria...Carol pulled her mother in close. The two women were of equal size, though Joanna was so much more curvier, even if years of hard living had dulled her once staggering beauty somewhat. She was where Carol got most of her physical attributes from, the large breasts, the strong Nordic features that poked through her father's genetics, the blonde of her strawberry blonde hair that would very easily cascade down her back if she ever let it.

"I'm sorry, mom" Carol whispered as she felt the comforting embrace of her long suffering mother, "This was just a pretty bad one. I feel terrible"

"I know, dear. But you've got to take others into account. After all, it's not you who has to fight with your father to keep him from doing stupid things until six in the morning" Joanna whispered back, releasing Carol from the embrace. "Come on, I'll fix you some breakfast before you head to school" Carol reached for something on her side of the door and pulled out a faded robe, sliding it over her bare shoulders and tying the not like it was second nature before gently sliding past Carol and moving down the hallway.

As Carol followed her mother down the narrow hallway and into the rest of the single wide trailer the Bolstrum family lived in, Gloria resurfaced, having been momentarily shoved 'below water' as the intense emotions of Carol had overwhelmed her personality. The trailer was, despite the bathroom's appearance, was remarkably clean. It wasn't filth free, but it was clear that the public part of the house was kept in a state of presentability. The floors were clean, and only the small coffee table that sat in front of the faded couch had six beer bottles on it.

"Can you get those for me, dear?" Her mom said as they passed the small mess, and suddenly Gloria flickered away for a moment as Carol stopped and dutifully collected the bottles, before following her mother into the kitchen.

"What would you like?" Joanna asked, as she opened the refridgerator door, revealing a somewhat small but non-expired selection of food. "I'm feeling like...eggs, okay"

"Okay, mom" Carol replied as she gently set the beer bottles on the tile counter and began to quietly slide them into the trash can. It was getting pretty full, she'd need to take care of it today. Finished with her task, Carol sat down at the small table that sat on the far wall of the kitchen as Gloria sparked back into being, her mind immediately slammed by an influx of new memories as she took in her new 'home'.

On the walls were dozens of pictures. Plenty of Joanna, in the prime of her life as a knockout beauty, as head cheerleader for Shermer high. Of her and her girlfriends cheering in uniform, graduation. Then the towering form of her father sliding into the frames as mom's high school cheerleader outfit became a college one before suddenly disappearing. Pictures of Joanna and Rob in clubs, of new friends, a wedding in which Joanna desperately tried to appear elegant in a thrift store dress and make up while Rob simply wore a suit that looked one size too small for him. Pictures of a priest, but no one else. Then of Joanna pregnant, a small blonde bundle wrapped in a blanket and too many pictures of Joanna and Carol doing things, with only a few featuring the entire small Bolstrum family.

Gloria, or rather Carol, knew that her mom had fallen for Rob Bolstrum as a freshman in college, one fateful night at a bar with her old cheerleading squad. He had been such a bad boy, so strong and muscular, unafraid of anything and those intense eyes. Joanna had made the mistake of hooking up with him, despite learning that he had barely made it out of high school and was known for being violent to those that crossed him. It had turned her own, and after a whirlwind romance in which Joanna suddenly found herself ostracized from both her old friends and new, and even worse, her family, she discovered she was pregnant. Unable to keep up with classes and finding herself on the bad side of her sorority, Joanna had dropped out of college, and shortly after had moved in here with Rob and his own mother, and the two of them despised each other.

Luckily, the problem had resolved itself as Joanna had talked Rob into getting his mother to move out into another trailer, even if it meant both of them had to take on jobs in order to pay two rent bills. But a few months later Rob's mother drank herself to death, ending the main problem in Joanna's life. After nine months, Carol had come into the world, and Joanna had wasted no time in being a mom, quitting her job despite Rob's loud, angry protests that always ended with the both of them at some level of intoxication, much like what had happened last night.

The sizzle of eggs brought Carol's attention back to the present as her mother slid a plate onto the table in front of her. The mass of edible yellow was followed by a slice of toast, a glass of water, and a quietly placed fork. Carol smiled up at her mom and began eating, easily hiding her disappointment at plain toast and water. And as always, her mother was able to read Carol like an open book.

"I know you like butter and milk but we can only stretch the money so far..." Joanna muttered sadly as she sat down across from Carol, "I'd get a job as well, but unfortunately your father's reputation, and the fact that I haven't worked since you were born, it's just so hard to find someone willing to hire an old cow like me"

Carol put her fork down and reached across the table, taking her mother's small hand into her own larger one. "Mom, you're beautiful! And smart! You just have to try!"

"Oh baby, but then who would take care of your father? I have to be here to wake him up, otherwise he'll miss his shift and then we'll all really be in trouble!" Joanna breathed a heavy sigh as she curled her fingers over Carol's. "No, we'll just have to make due. I was even thinking about cutting out TV service. It's all just fake news anyway. Be a few more dollars we can save, right?"

Carol felt her heart drop. She knew her mom loved TV. It was her one real outlet outside of homemaking. A new resolve filled her and maybe it was just the eggs, but Carol was filled with determination and resolve now. This woman had given birth to her, had given up EVERYTHING in her life, for Carol to exist. And putting up with her volatile dad...mom was right, they deserved to have some of the finer things in life other than the cramped shoebox they lived in.

"Mom" she began, "I'll find a job! I can help!" Carol exclaimed as her teal eyes glittered, "Let me help pay the rent! It'll be hard with cheerleading but I know I can do it!"

Joanna's face brightened for a moment, but then fell again, "Oh baby, you know you can't do both. You'd be making such a sacrifice..."

"I don't care! I don't really enjoy it anyway, being the captain is more planning than I thought it was going to be anyway. Let me do this mom. For you, okay?" Carol pleaded, her eyes on the verge of tears. After a few long moments, Joanna gave her daughter a weak smile and nodded.

"If you think that's for the best, honey" Joanna Bolstrum said, her voice sweet as honey to Carol's ears, "But first you need to eat so you can get to school!"

Beaming back at her mother, Carol quickly wolfed down the remainder of her breakfast and hurried to get around for the rest of the day. Gloria flickered back into being long enough to pick out a cute pink top and a pair of tight jeans before Carol engulfed her once more. Carol hated to lose cheerleading,after fighting so hard to get on it, and especially captain, but she owed her mother everything. It was the least she could do, and after all, it wasn't like she was going to be completely giving it up. She controlled the rumor mill at school, through force and manipulation, she would be able to stay socially relevant so long as she took down the right people.

She had to help her mom.

After getting ready for school, Carol bid her mother a teary farewell as she slid into the cab of the only vehicle the Bolstrum's owned: An old Chevy Cavalier, and took off for school.

'Yeah' she thought as she passed street after street, getting away from the skid row that was Shermer Fields trailer park, she could get anything she needed from her network. And if anyone crossed her or tried to make some power play while she was at work? Carol would simply crush them like she had crushed Tammy Ackterton. Now there was a target that Carol enjoyed harrasing in true Mean Girls style. She'd made the mousy little thing turn into a plump balloon in just under a year, she could-

Suddenly Carol's mind gave way to Gloria as she suddenly blurted out 'OMG TAMMY! AND BILL! THE STONE! I can fix this and be me again!"

All because Gloria was a dumb bitch who put her ego and mouth before the two brain cells in her head, always speaking when she shouldn't be, always too fucking slow to see the damage the smallest of her errant, cruel little comments could do to anyone and everyone!

Bill roared, and then the world vanished in a maelstrom of light and smoke that wormed it's way into Bill's nostrils and through his bared teeth. He coughed once, a husky, hacking sound and felt something heavy press down upon him as the light began to clear...

...And Brianna yelped in pain as she let go of the shiny green rock she'd found, the lifeless gem falling to the carpeted floor of her house as she wrung her hand in the air, her flabby arms shaking in the arm and the motion transferring through the resistance free fat and into the rest of her overweight, obese body.

"Oooowww!" She whined dully, looking at the red imprint in her hand before looking up at her friends, Gloria and Tammy, "Did you girls see what happened? I think I got stung by something!" The obese, brace-faced teenager held her sausage fingered hand out towards her friends while she used her free hand to push her limp, greasy brown bangs out of her beady eyes.

Gloria leaned forward as far as she could, her titanic, saggy breasts hanging heavily off her chest and pressing against the thick fabric of her light sweater. She was even fatter than Brianna was, and with a free flabby hand of her own wiped a sheen of sweat off her perpetually sweaty brown. "Um, I don't know Bri...Maybe you just got a sunburn or something?" Gloria's voice held none of it's usual high pitched bitchiness as her triple chin began to jiggle, her previously emaculately glossed and lipsticked lips now more like thin pink rubber bands that spent most of their time hanging slack...Or by the amount of pimples on her new chubby face, shoving down sweets and greasy fast foods.

"What do you think Tammy?" Brianna offered, swinging her arm slowly towards her other friend, Tammy Ackerton, who was staring at them both with wide, blue eyes that sparkled out of her chubby but cute face as her puffy, done up lips opened wide in surprise. Brianna always thought that she and Gloria were so lucky that such a pretty, older girl would hang out with the two of them. Tammy was big like them, but she wore it well of her curvy frame. Her blond hair was styled and curly, pouring down around her cute round face and laying on her boobs. And Tammy was always so confident, unlike herself and Gloria, the two Sophmores were really...um...they knew they were fat but Tammy always helped them feel better about it because she always wore really revealing clothes that made her boobs and booty stand out more than her belly. She even had a boyfriend!

https://i.imgur.com/izWExyL.png

"Yeah Tammy, is it, um, a spider bite?" Gloria chimed in as she leaned against the hallway wall for support. She felt like she knew what had happened...But at the same time she was just sort of hungry. Maybe Brianna just wanted some more breakfast.

Meanwhile Tammy's mind was racing as she stared at her best friend turned husband turned boyfriend and her former evil ex. The two of them had changed in an instant, and she had as well, turning the three of them into...Into heavy girls! And what was worse, Brianna-

'No, that is Bill!' Tammy scolded herself as she stared into the cloudy brown eyes of her former love, fighting the rush of memories that were sweeping over her just like it had when they'd become old people. And then there was some kind of odd fogginess in her brain, she felt like she knew less now than she just had, but whatever had happened, it seemed like it had changed both Gloria and Bill on the INSIDE as well as on the outside! In fact, Tammy was pretty sure that Bill probably didn't remember being Bill at all! Instead the rush of memories told her that she was the older best friend of Brianna Strasserman and Gloria Vanapolous, two obese teenagers who spent most of the school day in their own remedial classes and had very few friends. She'd felt sorry for the girls, who were mocked and bullied both behind their backs and to their faces (most of the time not getting the cruel jokes the other student threw at them). Tammy had decided she'd be their friend, to help them as best as she could through high school.

And because Brianna's big sister Willow had been her own upper classmen friend when Tammy had been a Sophmore. Every girl needed someone to look out for them, after all.

'But...Willow is supposed to be...' Tammy pushed back against the fogginess. She knew Willow wasn't real...She WAS real but clearly not like, real real...But what had she been the first time they had all changed? Didn't she go to the future with them? Or did she come back from the future with them? She was important to her, but that was because Willow was her friend, right?Tammy suddenly felt very scared that she couldn't remember such an important detail.

'Oh, remember you dumb bimbo!' She yelled at herself silently as she stared at the rapidly fading red spot in Brianna's hand, who herself was looking at Tammy with those dull brown eyes expecting an answer. "Um, Like, I think you just bumped it on something!" She said in a throaty, but still sing-songy voice.

"Um, okay..."Brianna said with a heavy nod. Really it didn't even hurt anymore, so it must not have been that important. What was important was that her big sister Willow (who she was slightly jealous of because she was so thin and smart and allowed to drive) was waiting downstairs, and that the three girls were running late. "Uh, Willow said she needed to be somewhere today so we should get going"

The tubby teenager rubbed her greasy palm on her pants which seemed to be barely containing the thick trunks of her massive legs, which trembled as she waddled forward towards the stairs. She didn't like stairs, they were so hard for her to use. She wished mom and dad had put her room on the bottom floor or lived in a one story house. Every time she and Gloria used stairs they always got sweaty. Well, sweatier. It was so dumb. She gripped the banister and took one uneasy, slow step after another as she descended, the reinforced wood shaking slightly with each impact until she finally stepped down onto the hardwood floor of the first floor. That was when Gloria made her own slow descent down.

'OMG they're like turtles!" Tammy thought as she watched Gloria's entire body jiggle violently with each heavy step. They really had to start eating better like she'd been trying to show them but-

'No Tammy, focus! This isn't right! You're supposed to be smart and Gloria and Brianna are not supposed to look like that! What were we using?' Tammy spun around on her own heavier but well carried body and looked around the upstairs hallway. They had been using something...IT was a little like that movie with the old car but a lot smaller...You had to hold it and you had to be really upset to use it...

That's when the memory clicked into place as her eyes fell upon the dull, lifeless gemstone that had bounced under one of the end tables in the hallway by Brianna's door. With a squeal of excitement she bent over and snatched it up in a hand that was only a little chubby.

'This is it!' She thought to herself, casting a sideways look down the stairs as Gloria finally finished her descent, 'Now all I have to do is make a wish to fix this!' Tammy furrowed her brow in concentration, she knew she had to be really focused...Or was it upset?

"Oh, why is it so hard to remember!?" She hissed as she clenched her eyes shut, not noticing the weak flare from the gemstone as it detected a hint of anger in the thick chick's body.

"Um Tammy, we really need to go..." Brianna called from downstairs and Tammy snapped her eyes open. That was right, they were running late for school and Tammy couldn't afford any more tardy slips.

She looked at the gemstone before slipping it into the front pocket of her plus size (but still really cute) jean shorts. 'I'll just have to figure it out at school!' She thought with a roll of her eyes before she hustled down the stairs towards her two obese friends.

Tammy trundled down the stairs of the Strasserman home, feeling her curves jiggling with each step and being confused by the conflicting feelings in her head, which was itself feeling rather strange and foggy after Brianna had made her wish. On the one hand the jiggling felt normal, the soft sloshing of her bulging breasts and tummy as they jiggled with motion, but on the other hand part of Tammy's brain was telling her that it was wrong. Sure, she'd been overweight when they'd ended up in the future, but not this much...

'And what did we wish for anyway? Did we, um, want to see how we'd look as old people?' The former jock turned middle aged wife turned cute geek turned thick chick thought, scratching her curly blond head as she stepped down off the stairs and followed the twin immense bulks of Brianna and Gloria into the kitchen. The kitchen itself was drastically different than Tammy remembered it being; before it had been very clean and orderly, almost the perfect model of a suburban home but now it was almost the exact opposite. Jars of sweets lined the counter while a stack of dirty dishes sat in the sink. Unopened bottles of soda were stored next to the fridge and bags of chips and other junk food lay within easy reach.

"I'm hungry" Gloria whined as she followed her friend Brianna into the kitchen. She'd thought that maybe the other large girl had just been hungry upstairs and it had just reminded her that it had been a whole twenty minutes since she'd last eaten breakfast at the Strasserman residence, the plate full of eggs and bacon and pancakes that Brianna's mom and sister always had ready for when her dad would drop her off on his way to work.

"Me too" Brianna replied, the notion of being hungry had derailed her own train of thought and she paused along with Gloria to start grazing from the readily available junk foods, but a loud honk from the garage proved enough of a distraction. "But...Willow is supposed to be somewhere to do...something. She'll get in a lot of trouble if she doesn't do it"

"But I'm starving! Gloria said, stamping massive cankle on the ground and shaking the room, "I wanna eat something!"

"Umm...Oh!" Brianna turned in a slow circle as her piggy eyes scanned her favorite room in the house. There had to be something they could eat quickly...And that was when she saw the brightly colored packaging from a carton of chocolate chip cookies partly buried under a potato chip bag. "Let's take these" She said, batting the bag of chips away with a puffy hand and picking the carton up to show Gloria. The boy turned old man turned dumb fat girl felt proud of herself for coming up with such a solution, but the small grin on her face died as she saw Gloria stare at the package of cookies in disappointment.

"Just that one?" Gloria said, her already squished face scrunching up into as fierce a pout as she could manage. It was so small! And if there was only one she'd have to share!

"We might have more..." Brianna started as she stared off into the expanse of the kitchen once more. In truth she didn't even want to go to school anymore, she just wanted to stay home and snack now. Maybe take a nap after. She started to drift further into the kitchen, ignoring the second honk of Willow's car horn from the other side of the nearby garage door, but through her layers of shoulder fat she felt a hand give her a squeeze.

"Like, we really need to get to school girls. C'mon!" Tammy clasped another hand on the even larger hump of Gloria's flabby shoulder and tried her best to move the two human boulders along with little success.

'OMG' Was all she could think as the two girls stood there staring at her with dull eyes before a third honk decided the vote. With slow, ponderous movements Brianna and Gloria turned once more towards the garage door and waddled towards it, opening the door and sliding partially sideways through it and into the garage. Tammy just let loose a sigh of relief as she closed the door behind them. They just needed to get to school and then Tammy could focus on seeing her boyfrien-

'No, focus! You have to figure out how to use the wishing rock!' She kicked herself again, giving the tiny bulge in her shorts pocket a pat as she turned towards the waiting vehicle, her eyes widening once more as one memory betrayed another in her mind. But this time, at least, she knew which one was the real memory.

There, sitting in the middle of the garage and looking very much worse for wear, was Willow's large faded purple van. Tammy knew this was wrong because before the wish (whatever it had been) had done whatever it did, Willow had had a almost brand new red sedan. And Tammy's eyes went even wider as she saw Willow glaring at the three of them from the driver's seat. Instead of the skinny, healthy and kind looking Willow that Tammy clearly remembered there was now another overweight (though not as much as Brianna, Gloria or even Tammy herself) girl that clearly looked like she didn't care for her appearance and was getting very little sleep. Another fake but real memory floated to the surface of Tammy's mind; Willow was very much her sister's keeper. Her parents relied on the older girl to babysit Brianna and by extension, Gloria. She had to help her mother fix them breakfast, had to get them to school, help with what little homework they had on top of her own schoolwork. The stress of being a caretaker and essentially a second mom had clearly taken a toll.

"C'mon! Tammy, you were supposed to have them out here twenty minutes ago! What fucking gives? I CAN'T miss my test and it takes thirty minutes to get to the college!" Willow barked at the tubby trio, her voice hard and angry and utterly different from what Tammy knew it should be. "Quick, get your butts in here and..." Willow trailed off as she spotted the package of cookies in her little sister's bloated hand, "Christ, again Bri? How can you be hungry again after everything you had for breakfast!?"

After a few moments Brianna just shrugged and moved to open the sliding door of the van, revealing an interior that was even worse than the exterior. Instead of a mid-sized middle seat and a long rear passenger area, instead there were two large, clearly not factory standard, chairs bolted into the floor of the van. The vehicles shook and shuddered and began to noticeably sag as Brianna and Gloria pulled themselves up into the van with no small shortage of feminine grunts from the obese dullards until finally both girls had settled into their cradles.

"Give me a cookie" Gloria snapped, pawing at her friend who quickly unsealed the package as Tammy simply stood there and watched as sausage like fingers began plucking the small discs of cooked dough and chocolate chips out with frightening speeds. In a matter of moments the carton was empty as Brianna let it fall to the floor of the van as she and Gloria messily devoured their snack.

And Tammy suddenly felt a little upset the two girls hadn't at least offered her one. With all the confusion she was feeling a cookie might have helped ease her befuddled mind (and soothe the small hunger pang she suddenly felt).

"Rear in gear, Tammy! Don't make me leave you!" Willow barked once more, shaking the curvy blonde out of her thoughts again and Tammy wasted no time in getting into the front passenger seat. "Jesus" Willow said as she put the clearly long suffering van into drive and rolled out of the Stasserman garage and into the spring rainstorm that had developed over Shermer.

The drive to the school was rather short. In truth Tammy, Brianna and Gloria could have walked it and Tammy sometimes did, but her other friends clearly wouldn't have made it more than a hundred feet down the sidewalk without needing to stop every few steps. As Gloria and Brianna let out several burps from the back seats, Tammy looked out the window while a hand went to rest on the bulge in her pocket.

"I'm going to fix this. I'll figure out what went wrong and fix it. I promise Bri...I mean Bill!' Tammy thought as the van rolled down the street. She'd always forgotten that Brianna wasn't supposed to be Brianna and was instead a guy named Bill. And Bill was very important to Tammy, maybe even the most important, but for why, much like WIllow, Tammy was having a hell of a time figuring out.

She turned away from the window and looked over at the frustrated face of Willow, who was clearly annoyed with her. Tammy knew that asking a question was a bad idea but maybe Willow knew something, anything, that could help her figure out what went wrong with their wish.

"So, um, Willow..."

"Ugh, WHAT, Tammy!?"

"Did....did I ever used to be so ditzy like this? Or have I always been like this?"

Willow simply gave her friend an annoyed look before turning back to the road. Before long the van full of girls arrived at Shermer High, though not at the front doors. No, Brianna and Gloria spent most of the day in remedial class, and their presence in the halls of the school were someplace that the girls simply wouldn't survive as kid upon kid would crack their usual jokes. Instead Willow pulled around to the back of the school, near the doors to the girl's gym. It was what was best for the girls, after all. As the trio piled out of the van Tammy could feel as well as see the reinforced automobile raise dramatically back up to it's factory standard ground clearance. The moment the passenger door slammed shut the van whirled to life again with a blast of carbon out of the poorly attached tail pipe as Willow took off angrily from the school and headed to her own.

"Can we go home now??" Gloria asked as they watched the purple van speed down the road.

"Now Gloria, you know we all have to, like, go to school. It's the, um, law and stuff" Tammy felt herself saying as she turned to head into the gym doors. But she gasped in surprise as she broke into a huge grin as she saw someone waiting for them.

It was her boyfriend, Rob Bolstrum!

"ROBBIE!" Tammy squealed in delight and shot across the pavement as fast as she could and practically jumped into the muscled arms of her towering boyfriend, wrapping her arms around him and latching her lips onto his in a deep, passionate kiss.

The tubby, short blonde and the redheaded giant held each other in the embrace until a deafening crack of thunder startled the two of them aprart, Tammy's eyes snapping open as she shrieked in surprise before collapsing into a fit of giggles as pressed herself against Rob once more.
