1141221121122233333333331.content:
Bill gripped the Ahn'Ger Stone, the mysterious artifact that had he had found only a half hour before, and could almost feel the anger and rage he felt towards Gloria flowing into the gemstone. He couldn't believe Gloria. Even now, when his little sister had been erased from existence, when even his parents had been changed, she still blamed Tom for everything that had happened. And yet to so many others Gloria Vanapolous was queen of Shermer High, little miss perfect. So pretty on the outside, yet only Bill and Tom really knew of the cold, toxic heart that beat underneath that naturally tanned skin and dark hair. Well, now it was time for everyone to know. For Tom, for Kimmy, for his parents, and even for Willow, his daughter turned older sister.

"I wish everyone could see you for the monster you truly are!" Bill roared, and with crack of thunder, sickly green light that looked decidedly different from the other wish-granting flashes that morning poured out from Bill's hand. The teenager grinned at Gloria's terrified face, a slender hand pressed against her cheek where Bill had struck her moments before, not realizing it had led to the magical gemstone to become damaged, it's emerald shell cracked when it had collided with the wall before the enraged boy had retrieved it. But in the brief moment, before the flash blinded his vision and the world fell away under his feet, Bill realized that the light looked decidedly different from the earlier flashes.

But then the world re-materialized around him, and Bill found himself falling through the sky above a mass of blue-brown water, a large city straddling the coast as the sound of rushing wind filled his ears.

"OH SHIT OH SHIT!" Bill screamed at the top of his lungs as he began to spin in panic, his hands flying open on instinct and the Ahn'Ger Stone was ripped away into the sky, a glimmer of green as it caught the sunlight. Not that Bill noticed as he tumbled quickly towards the rippling surface below him. But he then felt strange, a burning sensation, piercing pain rushing through his body, almost like he was having...growing pains? But a million times more intense. He felt himself slow slightly as he seemed to get larger, his clothes shredding away from his enlarged form. But then he smacked painfully into the surface of the water and everything went black.

He had never seen the falling forms of many other individuals around him.

It was strange, this dream. Bill was wandering through what seemed like a hall of mirrors lit by green flourescent lights. In each one there was a different version of him. Fat, tall, short, skinny, girl, boy, stud, nerd, human, animal, alien, chair. Mirrors that showed family and strangers alike, all on their own adventures. He finally reached the end, where a small crystalline entity gave him a incredulous look, but it felt like it wasn't really looking at Bill, but rather someone behind him. Bill turned to look, seeing nothing but a damp concrete wall, and when he turned back to the crystalline creature it just sighed and snapped it's fingers as a brilliant white light engulfed him.

Bill felt wrong. Strong, powerful, but wrong. The groggy teenager opened his eyes and was surprised at how bright everything seemed, and how barren the world around him was. Above him was a large glimmering patch of light, shifting strangely and causing him to wonder what it was before the teenager realized where he was. He was underwater, laying in sand? He should have been panicking but there was only the throbbing pain across his body that was rapidly receding as he started to feel stronger and stronger. With a groan, Bill pushed himself out of the muck with arms that felt exceedingly more muscled than they had just a few moments ago, rising upwards as he picked himself up out of the muck. Water began rushing past his ears and he felt strange weights on his back. It was almost as if there was something back there helping him get balanced? Like a third leg or arm.

'What the hell happened?' Was all Bill thought as the world around him brightened further still as he rocketed towards the surface of the water.

Meanwhile, from the shoreline of Lake Michigan, even in the early hours of the day hundreds, possibly thousands of individuals had been gathering on the sandy shores as large cargo ships pulled in and out of port. But everything and everyone paused when the weird rumbling sound had come from the water, and the beach-goers began to scream in alarm as the ground shook as something VERY large and VERY powerful moved underneath them. And then the WHOOSH as a massive pillar of water erupted far off-shore, and something even larger appeared within it. Something that had scales, claws, massive plates that rose off it's back and a gargantuan tail that lazily whipped back and forth as if it had a mind of it's own. Something that had a threatening, predatory mouth lined with teeth and piercing eyes that showed only a hint of the intelligent mind behind them.

It let loose a growl as it's clawed, building sized hand rubbed it's blunted wedge shaped head. The sound caused the entire city of Chicago to grind to a halt as it rolled across the skyscrapers, down the streets and over the millions of people that had just started their day. Everyone froze and turned their gaze towards the lake as something else responded. As the stunned silence began to wear off and more and more of the populace caught glimpses of the towering being in the water, chaos erupted on the streets of the American metropolis.

"Ugh, Tammy, where are you!?" Bill cried out, not realizing that he was no longer 'speaking' in English. In fact, he was no longer saying any sort of discernible words at all and instead sounded like the massive beast he now was. He blinked for a moment as he stared into the city of Chicago, recognizing the skyline from the Sears Tower and several other landmark skyscrapers. But why did it look so small? Were those ants on the beach? Why were they all running away from the water?

"BILL! BILL HELP ME!" Cried Tammy's voice from somewhere off to his right. Bill's eyes opened wide as he turned towards the sound, unaware of the huge waves his body caused as his titanic reptillian mass displaced the water with ease.

"TAMMY!" Bill called out as he made his way through the water towards the beach. Windows shattered in smaller buildings and cars closest to him but they were so small that they escaped notice. "TAMMY WHERE ARE YOU!?"

"I'M HERE!" Came her reply.

Bill's vision finally locked on a something large and gray with a streak of brilliant gold running along it laying along the beach nearly where the cargo ships were docked. Whatever it was it was huddled defensively around Navy Pier, the wharf that had been converted into a shopping and entertainment center, which itself was covered in some weird looking mass of..seaweed? A massive rose was rapidly growing at the center of the ball-like mass as tiny figures fled the building that it was covering, but it seemed inert. Instead Bill turned his gaze to the lumpy mass on the beach below. It looked almost like a caterpiller? As Bill crossed the distance with surprising speed he could see the massive ball of flesh undulating in the sand as...whatever it was turned to face him, mandibles dripping with some kind of sticky webbing as two blue eyes stared upwards at him in terror.

"Bill, oh god, what happened to us!?" Tammy's voice said from the mouth of the thing. It wiggled to look at itself and recoiled in disgust.

"Tammy? You look like some kind of worm! Let me..." Bill said as he opened his arms wide. He almost felt like he should pick Tammy up and he bent over to do so before her wriggling body recoiled once more. Streamers of some kind of silk flew from her disgustingly insect-like mouth. On the pier above the mass of seaweeds seemed to tremble.

"NO! YOU'LL HURT ME!" Tammy cried out, "BILL, YOU'RE A GIANT LIZARD! I'M A WORM! WE'RE MONSTERS!"

Bill blinked in confusion before looking down at himself for the first time. Instead of pink, slightly hairy and only a little flabby skin and plain bony fingers, instead there was only an expanse of green scales and muscles. Massive clawed hands were stretched out before him, alien and strange. Bill turned to look at the nearby skyscrapers and could see, in their millions of panes of reflective glass, that he did indeed look like some form of colossal dinosaur. He even had a tail and plates on his back!

"Oh. Oh shit. OH FUCK!" Bill cried out in surprise, and the sides of the buildings he was facing erupted as his voice shattered them all into countless shards of glass that fell onto the swarm of ants...of people below.

And to those people below, in their sheer and utter panic to get away from the titanic creatures only heard a series of roars and chittering, not understanding or comprehending. The only thoughts in their minds were to escape, to get away from the monsters that dwarfed everything else around them. There was a massive exodus but there was no escape as three new monsters rose out of the cityscape.

One was insect-like, two glittering wings rising above a chitinous body that ended in two scythe-like claws. Another one stretching it's wings, a dark red as fires roared to life as it's body oozed a magma-like substance from a cruel, long beak. And another one, larger than all the others that rose in front of the approaching storm clouds from the west. It had three heads on three serpentine necks, two huge wings and a body covered in golden scales.

The world erupted in noise as the new monsters began to scream. A familiar female scream coming from the insect while masculine roars of anger came from the red winged reptile and the golden dragon.

And to make matters even worse for the Chicagoans, something massive and green descended from the sky. It was a teardrop within a teardrop, radiating with strange light as it settled over the center of the city.
1141221121122233333333331.title: City of Monsters

11412211211222333333333311.content:
The roar of the other monsters, at least to Bill, sounded human. To the mass of people running through the streets of Chicago however, all they heard was the deafening screeches of terrifying monsters, ones that had appeared out of nowhere and were already destroying the city as they flailed about, as if they didn't know how to work their bodies. And to Bill, the bellowing screams of rage and anguish sent a shiver through his body all the way to his tail.

'My tail. Holy fucking shit what is even happening!?' The teenage kaiju thought to himself, looking down at his claws once more. But before Bill could get further introspective, the growing layer of clouds over the metropolis parted and the immense version of the Ahn'Ger Stone descended from the sky and hung over the city. And Bill noticed, for the first time, the massive crack that ran length-wise down one side of the gem. It began to pulse rhythmically, flashes of green gold light rippling across the city as Bill suddenly felt drawn towards it.

"Tammy, look!" Bill said to his wiggling girlfriend, who was busy squirming her bulk between the large support beams that held up the pier. "Its broken! That must be why the wish went wrong!"

"I don't care!" Tammy grunted back in frustration, more streamers of webbing flying from her mandibles as her strange new body crushed the wooden and concrete supports, causing the structure above her to groan dangerously as it struggled to hold the weight of the shopping center plus the mass of flowering seaweed, "I have to hide! I...I can't be seen like this! Just go grab it and wish us back! Please!"

Bill watched as his girlfriend covered herself and the underside of Navy Pier in the disgusting webbing and felt the need to say...something, but the urge to get closer to the giant Stone was starting to overpower his higher senses. He gave Tammy a shrug and began to march forward out of the water, his titanic bulk shaking the ground as he moved. As he towered over the buildings he could see the other 'monsters' doing the same, tripping and flopping over themselves and crushing buildings in their path as they were drawn inexorably towards each other. Bill was suddenly grateful for his far more normal body and the tail that hung out behind him, allowing him to maintain an almost normal walk as he carefully tried to make his way through the city streets, wincing every time he felt his leathery body brush against a building and leave it nearly demolished in his wake.

Bill was so caught up in careful stride that, as he moved inland, he never saw a tendril of seaweed weakly rise from the formless mass that sat on Navy Pier, stretching out towards him as if to hold him back.

"At least I'm doing better than that bug thing" Bill said, looking to the south and the cloud of dust and shrieks. The enormous wasp-like creature was the monster closest to Bill was dominated by two massive scythes for forearms, both of them digging at the ground while two clawed legs that were almost hilariously undersized for it's body struggled to lift it's body upwards. The two large wings on it's back beat out of sync with each other in frenetic bursts while a long dragon-fly tail flopped back and forth. The head of the monster was angular and sharp, two huge red eyes with glowing white pupils frantically darting around in it's head while a decidedly feminine cry came from it's fang filled mouth. As the creature collapsed back on it's stomach it let loose a shrill swear of frustration that caused Bill to pause from sudden recognition.

It was Gloria!

Bill's first thought was to move towards her and help her up because at his heart, Bill was a decent human being.

'Not that it really applies at this moment' Bill thought to himself as he looked back at his massive reptile body. 'Besides, she's the entire reason we're in this mess. Let her figure her own damn self out' Bill let out a cruel sounding chuckle as he turned away from the struggling insect and instead continued his march towards the enormous Stone as the other two creatures finally seemed to understand how their bodies worked.

The red...pterodactyl thing began moving in an awkward, bird-like hop as it drug it's burning body across the urban landscape, smoke and ash billowing up behind it from the gusts produced by it's enormous wingspan as it tried, several times, to take flight before letting out a roar. Bill recognized that voice as well. He'd know it anywhere.

It was Rob Bolstrum. But what was he doing there!? The logic in Bill's mind try to think of a reason why the bully would have been there in monster form. So far the wishes had only affected Bill, Tammy, Gloria and the victim of Gloria's previous wish, Willow, so it was clear there was some form of localization going on...But why was Rob there? Unless...Unless Rob had been lurking nearby earlier that morning? Bill was suddenly glad that he'd waited a few minutes later for Tom, even if it had ended up resulting in this chaos.

As the group of monsters converged in the center of the city, buildings toppling from their careless, struggling movements, Bill looked up at the towering three headed gold dragon that seemed to be having a very intense conversation with itself. And Bill's blood, if he wasn't already cold blooded enough, turned to ice.

Big Jon's voice was coming out of the center head as it snarled commands at the two other heads. The right head seemed just as angry, another masculine voice coming out of it, one that Bill recognized as Jules, one of Big Jon's lackeys...But the other head, the left one that seemed utterly terrified and was jerking itself in every direction, had a female voice that Bill didn't recognize spilling out of a toothy mouth.

"Shut up Tara!" Big Jon's head said as he snapped at her, "I don't know what the fuck is happening either!"

"JONATHAN! I'M SCARED!" The left head squealed as it wildly curled around, throwing the massive conjoined body off balance, "THIS ISN'T REAL! I'M AT HOME IN BED! WE GOT IN A CAR CRASH AND WE'RE IN AN AMBULANCE! OH GOD WHAT IF WE'RE, LIKE, DEAD! I JUST WANNA WAKE UP! I NEVER SHOULD HAVE AGREED TO TAKE OYU AND YOUR FRIEND TO SCHOOL!"

"I SAID SHUT THE FUCK UP!" Big Jon's head snarled and his neck began to curl around the left head, constricting it. The left head screeched in pain but ultimately went silent, slinking away as best as it could and cowering close to the golden scaled torso it was attached to as Big Jon's head released a snort of dominance. Whoever 'Tara' was, she was clearly in a horrible position and Bill couldn't help but feel a pang of pity of pity for the former woman, and a surge of anger laced guilt for having made the wish that put all of them in this position.

The damaged city and the hundreds of thousands of people that were suffering and had even been crushed as the four titans converged beneath the Stone didn't even factor into Bill's mind, however. Bill allowed himself a growling chuckle as the bird-boy stumbled in his hopping motion, collapsing on his beak (and through several buildings) as he tried to stand upright on his stubby claws.

"Holy shit, is that you Rob!?" Jules's voice came from the golden...Jon-monster's right head as it curled down towards the clumsy red avian.

"YES IT'S ME, you'd think with three damn heads you'd have half a fuckin' brain!" Rob snapped back.

"WILL YOU ALL JUST SHUT UP!?" Gloria screeched as she managed to perform some kind of hovering hop as the wings on her chitinous torso seemed to finally sync together. Bill could almost see a relieved expression on her frighteningly toothy face as she perched herself on the side of the Sears Tower, the skyscraper taking the brunt of her weight as metal groaned dangerously. "I can...I can fix this if you just help me get to that thing!" She raised a vicious looking scythe towards the crystalline surface of the Ahn'Ger Stone.

Bill's eyes went wide in alarm. The last thing anyone needed was for two of the worst people in the world to get a hold of the Stone! "GLORIA! DON'T-" Bill yelled, but it was too late.

"Titsapolous is right!" Rob said, flapping his wings and sending dust, ash and cars flying about in a small tornado of debris, "I was hiding in Shitterman's basement just like you said, Big Jon! I heard them yelling and snuck up right as Shitterman wished for something about Bug breath over here being a monster! It's his fault!" Rob raised his beak and pointed towards Bill as ten eyes turned to him.

"Strasserman..." Big Jon hissed as realization hit him. All three heads, even the cowering one named Tara seemed to take on Big Jon's hateful demeanor, coiling towards Bill, who suddenly felt as if he was inches from a very dangerous snake. "Maybe this is all just...providence. Maybe the universe wants me to kick your queer little ass..." the heads were silent for a moment as Bill struggled to keep track of them as them slithered in the air around him.

"Or maybe I'll just take Birdbrain's advice and use that thing for myself!" Big Jon's heads snapped away from Bill as the golden colossus charged forward towards the Stone, hate in it's eyes.

"NO!" Bill roared. He couldn't let Big Jon make a wish. He'd be dead! Or worse! Bill paid no attention to the buildings crumbling to dust around him as he waded through the center of the city on a collision course with his enemy, tackling the golden behemoth to the ground. Behind him, Bill never saw Gloria leap off the building she had landed on, scythes out-stretched for the gem as a plume of ash and fire lurched upwards to intercept her with a deafening squawk.

And none of the monsters noticed a flash of green lighting from the sky as the Ahn'Ger Stone began to pulse faster and faster as the city disappeared in a cloud of fire, smoke and claws, a shimmering ring of green light appearing in a miles long circle around the city of Chicago.

114122112112223333333333333.title: Inspect Before Use: Continued Wishes +1

1141221121122233333333333331.content:
Bill shook with rage as her glared at Gloria. Everything, EVERYTHING had gone so horribly wrong this morning all because she had the absolute gall to show up and try to use Bill in her pathetic, evil little game of control over Tom. He now had the Stone, he had the power to fix it and deal with Gloria! All he had to do was make a wish...

Meanwhile, no one had noticed that when Bill had slapped Gloria, causing her to fling the Ahn'Ger Stone down the hallway before she could make another wish for the devil knew what, was now damaged with a large crack running down one side of the fragile gem casing. As Bill lost his temper and the sheer power of his anger and rage flowed through the magical artifact, the Stone glowed with a green-gold light that looked sick and diseased, utterly different from the two times Gloria had used the gemstone before. From her vantage point a few feet away from Bill and Gloria's confrontation, Tammy saw it first.

'That...That doesn't look right!' Her mind raced as tendrils of light seeped out from between Bill's clenched fist. Before, when Gloria had made her wishes, the light from the gemstone had merely lit up the dark haired girl's hand, like she'd been holding a flashlight against her palm but this...This looked wrong. But her observation came a moment too late as Bill's anger boiled forth.

"I wish everyone could see you for the devil you really are, Gloria!" Bill roared, shoving a finger at Gloria's face as her dark eyes went wide with fear.

"BILL NO-" Was all Tammy could cry out before her vision was filled diseased looking magical light, the tendrils of magical energy intensifying in size and strength as they spun out of control, washing over Gloria, Bill and Tammy like an explosion of ribbons.

Bill had been filled with the rush of actually using the Stone, so much so that even through the magical blindness and the wave of nausea (which he didn't register as wrong, given this was the first time he'd used the Ahn'Ger Stone) he was filled with the petty thrill of victory. When this was all over Gloria would no longer be queen of Shermer High! She'd be hated by everyone because they'd all see what kind of horrible person she was!

Of course, that feeling of victory vanished immediately as his vision returned and he saw what he had unleashed upon the world.

Standing in front of him was indeed Gloria...But not the Gloria he had envisioned when he'd made his wish. Instead of shunned and miserable looking, instead Gloria was now at least two feet taller and her body a deep shade of red as two red, leathery wings stretched out from her back as a thick, pointed tail slithered and twisted in the air behind her. Gloria's feet had been replaced with a pair of black hooves as her legs were decidedly ungulated. She was naked as well, save for blue and black fire that sat against her red skin like she was wearing a burning bikini, covering her crotch and cradling her now much large bust in flames that radiated heat but didn't seem to burn her. As Gloria stretched her newly elongated limbs, Bill could see the other changes to her body. She wasn't entirely just naked save for the hellish flames she now wore; There were flecks of black here and there as well, spurs of obsidian looking bone that poked through her red skin on the back of her arms, her elbows, her shoulders. A pair of wicked looking spikes sticking outwards from the back of her horse-like legs and twin barbs that topped her new tail.

Long black nails tipped her unnaturally long fingers, and more black spikes poked through her red skin in detailed patterns as they ran up her powerful, yet slender arms. Gloria's face had changed a little as well, becoming more angular, sharper. She wasn't entirely unpleasant to look at, but it filled Bill with a sense of dread as the changed girl began to look over herself with a pair of black eyes.Above her, pushing out from her much longer black hair that seemed to move on it's own were two large, curved horns and a small ball of purple fire hung between them.

Gloria looked just like a demon.

Averting his gaze, Bill suddenly could see the landscape around him had changed dramatically as well. Instead of a pleasant April morning in otherwise normal Shermer Illinois...The landscape was now twisted as well. The entire neighborhood looked as if a bomb...Or several thousand bombs had gone off, all the houses now nothing more than burning shells and charred frameworks. Thick black clouds covered the sky, and eerie red lightning illuminated far larger...things hidden behind them. It looked as though Hell had come to Earth.

"Oh god" Bill croaked, his throat and mouth completely dry from the heat. In alarm he looked down at himself, expecting to find his own body transformed into some demonic hellbeast...But only saw the tattered remnants of his clothing hanging off his emaciated frame. He looked almost skeletal! Like that one weird Christian Bale movie! Bill turned to look towards Tammy, half expecting her to have undergone the same transformation as Gloria...Only to see that she herself was still human, although little more than a skeleton like himself. She was mostly naked save for an over-size shirt that looked more like a torn burlap sake, and most of her blonde hair was gone save for a few dirty, limp strand. The rest of her scalp was scabbed and bruised, almost as if the rest of her hair had been forcibly removed, and deep black circles hung beneath exhausted, terrified eyes.

"Oooh" Came a sexual moan that drew Bill's attention back to the demon version of Gloria in front of him. She was sliding her clawed hands up and down her new body, slicing her flesh from the sharpness of her nails, oily black blood leaking out of her body before bursts of infernal flame sealed the wounds. A forked tongue slithered out from behind her fangs and across her plump black lips.

"Guh-Gloria?" Bill rasped, "Is that...Is that you?" Bill regretted drawing attention to himself. Gloria's new eyes snapped away from her body and onto him, the black sclera broken only by the burning red irises that seemed to bore right into his very soul and made his skin feel as though he was being pricked by a thousand needles. It was a predatory gaze, one that matched the unsettling fanged smile that took form on Gloria's black lips.

It HURT to look at her! Bill's body shook involuntarily and he tried to turn away, only to be stopped by a single long claw that cut into his dry skin as Gloria forced the doomed teenager to look back at her.

"Oh Billy Billy Billy..." Gloria purred in a voice that sounded like her old voice but tinted with a demonic reverb, "Oh, how do I thank you for this? I feel so much more like...me!" Gloria cackled, her wings flapping with delight as Bill fought the urge to void piss himself.

'Wait, the Stone! I can fix all this if I-" Bill thought suddenly, but found himself a moment too late.

"But before you do anything...rash, let's just take that pretty little problem away, shall we?" Gloria purred before her voice took on a much more commanding tone, "Now. Give me the Stone, Bill".

Bill felt the urge to do what Gloria said take over every fiber of his being, unable to even fight himself as his withered arm simply rose upwards and presented the Stone to Gloria, the infernal light glittering off it's dull surface. That was when he saw it, the massive crack that ran down the side of the Stone.

'A crack? That...That must be why the wish fucked up!' Bill thought as he tried in vain to make a wish. But then the Stone was gone, plucked from his fingers by two long black nails as Gloria brought it up to her face.

"Thank you, Bill! Such a pretty thing, isn't it? I can feel the energy in it..." Gloria closed her eyes and Bill felt a pressure lift from his body, regaining control of his limbs. "Oh, if only we'd known what this really was...I can see it all so clearly now! The power of the cosmos was in the palms of our hands! To think I wasted it on such petty, childish wishes...But then again, we WERE only children. C'est le vie, I suppose"

And then, right as Bill was about to leap for the Stone, Gloria simply squeezed her fingers together and the magical artifact, the ONLY thing that could have saved them, erupted in a small explosion of green and gold light.

"NO!" Bill and Tammy screamed in unison, and Gloria simply cackled in delight as the energy flowed into her, the flames on her body changing from black and blue to gold and green.

"Oh, don't be sad you two! We couldn't let anything else get a hold of that. It would ruin all of our fun" The demoness said with a sigh of pleasure. She stretched out an unnaturally long arm towards Tammy and with a simple flick of her finger, Tammy's frail form lifted from the blasted rock and flew towards Gloria and Bill, the equally doomed teenager slowing to a stop next to him.

"But if we're gonna keep hanging out, you both have to work on your fashion senses. Here, let me help you!" Gloria said with a fanged smile as she slid her claws across what remained of Bill and Tammy's clothing. The sharpness of her talons caused the ruined fabric to simply part and slide to the barren ground, leaving the two humans naked, and very much afraid.

"There! Now you both look great!" Gloria grinned evilly as she flapped her wings, lifting her off the dead ground as she moved behind Bill and Tammy, landing once more and placing two clawed hands on both of their shoulders. Gloria's barbed tail then flicked out from behind her, arcing up like a scorpion about to strike before ripping downwards, a rift of green fire splitting open the air and leading to...

Bill gulped as he saw what was awaiting them. As bad as Earth looked, what lay beyond the rift looked worse. So much worse.

Bill felt her pushing him forward towards the gaping maw hanging before him and Tammy. There was no way to fight it.

"I can't wait to show you this, you guys! You're...Well, I'M going to love it!"
1141221121122233333333333331.title: Chapter 666

1141221121122233333333333332.content:
Bill glared at Gloria and squeezed the Ahn'Ger Stone tight in his fist, unaware that the magical artifact had been damaged from it's recent airborne journey down the hall. It hadn't been enough to simply make them all old, and turn Tom into Bill's wife, and now his girlfriend, no no, Gloria had altered his family entirely, making him no longer born to Martha and Greg Strasserman and had erased his little sister from existence entirely! And had warped the daughter that he and Tammy had been given in the future into his older sister! And despite the three teens not realizing it, BIll himself had gone a subtle shift in appearance, his genetics changing to fit that of his new parents. Bill looked over at Tom...Tammy, the cute, geeky blonde currently caught in a loop of examining her newer, younger body and looking at Bill in worry and concern. Only a few minutes ago the curvy, short girl had been the best male athlete in Shermer, but thanks to Gloria was now twisted far and away, not just physically but mentally, from his original form. All because Gloria couldn't stop meddling with people's lives.

"This is all your fault!" Bill hissed, pointing a finger in Gloria's face as he raised his hand holding the strange wishing Stone high in the air.

"I-I'm Sorry!" The dark haired cheerleader cried out, large, watery eyes flicked between the enraged teen's face and the sickly off-green light in his hand, the tell-tale sign that the Stone was ready to grant a wish.

"It's too late for apologies! All you do is hurt people Gloria! You're just as bad as Rob Bolstrum or Big Jon! I WISH YOU COULD NEVER HURT ANYONE AGAIN!" Bill roared, lowering his glowing fist and shoving it in Gloria's face right as the light pulsed.

"NO!" Gloria screamed at the top of her voice, and then everything went green.

Unbeknownst to all the teens gathered in the upstairs hallway of the new Strasserman household, a red-headed giant was watching them from down below, hateful eyes glaring upwards at them as the trespasser, Rob Bolstrum, wondered just what the hell was going on. The disgraced bully was there to try to convince Bill to help him take down Big Jon, but he hadn't expected Bill's mousy little girlfriend or the queen bitch of Shermer High to be there! Or Bill's hot sister Willow. He'd thought about bailing, but then the fight between Gloria and Bill, the strange other-worldly light had captured his attention.

But unknown to everyone in Bill's house, from the three time-traveling teens to the bully and the daughter out of time in the garage, Bill's wish was not going to be granted as he wanted, and the damage done to the Stone lashed out at all of them as their bodies began to change. And then as quickly as it had begun, the changes were over.

As the world returned, there was only darkness and heat, and the rhythmic thumping of something behind him told Bill that his wish had gone very, very wrong.
__

Willow busied herself at the kitchen counter, mature hands gliding over four pieces of bread as a knife spread a creamy application of golden-brown peanut butter upon the exposed sides of two of the slices before placing their companions on top of them, and then using the sharp blade to cut both of the new sandwiches in half, creating four small rectangles. The curvy, curly haired woman dropped the knife into the sink as she minced across the kitchen and retrieved the plastic wrap from one of the higher shelves and returned to the counter, quickly tearing off several pieces and expertly wrapping the small sandwiches up securely. With that chore done she took the small delectibles and placed them within the nearby brown paper bag, along with a small bag of grapes and a Capri Sun juice pouch.

"There we are..." Willow said quietly to herself, glancing up at the kitchen clock that now read "7:00AM". She smiled as she rolled the top of the bag down until it was reduced to half of it's original size.

"Still plenty of time. Way to go Wills! You're on it this morning!" The big-bottomed woman allowed herself a little victory dance in the kitchen before swooping the brown paper bag off the counter. She moved out of the kitchen and into the foyer of the large house, placing the brown lunch bag next to a pink backpack that had a cartoon pony emblazoned upon it, and in one fluid movement moved to and up the stairs. She passed by the wall of family photos that where hung there, the numerous pictures of her and her parents, of her husband Rob (who was already at work for the day), the two of them on vacation, the look of happiness on both their faces, and of course, the swarm of photos as a small child appeared in their arms.

She slowed her pace however as she came to the upper floor of her home, creeping out onto the second story landing and making her way quietly down the hall to a door that was covered in a mess of multi-colored streamers. Willow's hand softly grasped the door knob and gave it a slow, quiet turn, the latch releasing and the door sliding open just as quietly as the adult woman prepared for one of her favorite parts of the day.

The door swung upon and there, nestled in a mountain of covers, was her precious daughter, Tammy, the five year old's eyes still softly shut as she lay snuggled in her bed.

'Oh, my baby!' Willow thought, her heart almost exploding with motherly love as she padded across the toy-covered carpet. She lowered her substantial rear to the bed and brushed at the thick, burgundy locks that covered her daughter's face, and the small child shifted in her sleep, digging deeper under the covers.

"Tammy..." Willow whispered softly, giving her daughter's face another soft stroke, "It's time to go to school!"

The child grunted and slid almost entirely under the covers, and Willow fought back the urge to laugh at how cute it looked. Instead she simply stood and slowly peeled back the covers as if she was peeling an orange. As the covers slipped away Willow watched as her daughter curled into a small ball of Paw Patrol pajamas and two tiny bare feet.

"C'mon baby, time to get up!" Willow said in a singsong voice as she sat back down on the bed, placing a hand on Tammy's back. After a moment her daughter began to truly stir, the small body unfolding from the tight ball as tiny limbs stretched out, a squeak of a yaw escaping from a between tiny, chubby cheeks. From out of the center of the ball two small toys tumbled out of her embrace and onto the bed; a traditional plushy rag doll that was looking a little worn from years of use, and Tammy's newest toy, a posable plastic doll.

"There you are, booger!" Willow said with a laugh, plucking the toys off the mattress and setting them on the small beside table, where they slumped against each other, their warm surfaces cooling as Tammy's body heat faded away into the morning air. But Willow didn't pay any mind to her daughter's favorite, (and oldest) toys as she scooped the small wiggling child up from the bed and blew a big raspberry on her belly, resulting in a loud squeal of delight from the five year old in her arms.

"Let's go get you ready" Willow said, and without a second look to the bear and doll, carried her daughter out of the bedroom and towards the upstairs bathroom to get her ready for the day.

'Oh god. OH GOD!' Gloria screamed in silence as she found herself unable to move, her eyes locked straight ahead as her new body failed to respond to her commands. Her cotton filled head had flopped at just the right angle for her to see her new body in the closet mirror; she was small, so very small, and her hair, if it could still be called that, was a mop head of black yarn that was stitched into her over-sized, flesh colored felt head that hung down past where her ears should have and ending at the nape of her new neck. Her eyes were two bright green buttons and her mouth was a thin line of pink colored stitching curing upwards in a smile that Gloria definitely was NOT feeling, and her plushy neck disappeared down into a oblong tube shaped body that was clothed in a large black and white polka dotted dress. Curved, digit-less limbs poked out of the obnoxious fabric, two arms she couldn't move and two legs that didn't support her new, almost weightless, body.

She COULDN'T be a doll! She was Gloria Vanapolous! The queen of Shermer High! SHE WAS A PERSON NOT A TOY!

'MOMMY!' She wailed in absolute terror.

'What...What happened!?' Bill wondered as he underwent the same realization that he couldn't move. His eyes looked straight ahead in the closet mirror as he took in his new form. He looked like Gloria! Or rather, a Barbie doll version of her! He was wearing the exact same clothes as she'd been wearing before he made the wish, and his face was painted up to look like a much more friendly and happy version of the dark haired bitch that had ruined everyone lives this morning!

'You have GOT to be fucking kidding me!" Bill swore in the lonely expanse of his own mind as he struggled to figure out what had gone wrong.

And unseen by both newly produced toys, the Ahn'Ger Stone slid deeper beneath the pillows of Tammy's bed.

Option 1: Bill and Gloria are now toys belonging to Tammy Bolstrum, the new daughter of Willow Bolstrum and Rob Bolstrum, who had been transformed by the damaged Stone as well. Unable to move, unable to speak, little more than a few pieces of fabric and plastic, they are vulnerable to the world and completely incapable of changing back on their own. Tammy and Willow return after a few minutes, and a glimmer of hope emerges as the little girl begins searching for the Stone.

Option 2: Bill and Gloria live the life of toys as no one else seems to remember the previous reality. then one day, perhaps because of the broken magic of the Stone or perhaps just Tammy's childlike belief that her toys are 'real', Bill and Gloria find that if they focus enough, they can move and even speak to each other!
