Drops the Stone into the toilet on accident!
1141221121123.content:
Tammy could see what was about to happen, her beloved BIll's face contorting with rage as Gloria prattled on entirely self-centered. With two sets of memories in her blonde-topped head, Tammy knew just how much Bill hated her former girlfriend. And Tammy couldn't blame him, Gloria had done absolutely nothing but make things worse!

And like, seriously, how could she have ever been attracted to Gloria in the first place? Tammy chalked it up to her thankfully no longer existant raging male hormones. Maybe it was just her own pair of tits talking, but Tammy was so glad to no longer be thinking with a dick and making horrible choices in potential life partners.

But yes, from the memories of being older and married to Bill, she knew her former husband turned boyfriend could, when finally pushed to the edge, have quite a temper and make extremely poor decisions. He'd only directed that anger towards Tammy once during an argument about Willow's finances and how draining it was putting their daughter through college on the other side of the country in one of the most expensive states. He never laid a hand on Tammy, but he'd ended up in jail after getting into a bar fight soon after charging out of the house.

Now was her chance to prevent her dearest from doing something incredibly stupid, and to get the Stone away from Gloria before she made her own poorly thought out wished that made things even worse. With a unexpected lunge, the small blonde girl leapt on top of Gloria Vanapolous and took the dark haired beauty to the floor of the Strasserman household. Tammy straddled Gloria across the chest while Bill stared on, her un-decorated nails clawing at Gloria's hand, prying the strange emerald loose from her former girlfriend's fingers and rolling off of Gloria with a muffled "oof!".

"YOU BITCH! GIVE THAT BACK!" Gloria screamed and she scrambled off the floor as Tammy did the same. Before her alternate reality ex could do anything though Tammy bolted into the upstairs bathroom and slammed the door shut on Gloria's face, trying not to smile as she felt the other girl bounce off the hard surface with a shriek. Locking the door behind her, Tammy staggered over to the toilet and sat down, some distant part of her mind groaning that Bill had left the lid open. AGAIN. Miss Ackerton ignored the furious pounding on the door and the yells coming from the other side as she settled down onto the porcelain throne.

And there, on the toilet, Tammy stared into the Stone as it began glowing in her palm, feeling...angry. Not as angry as she remembered being as Tom, not enough to cause an outburst, but it was a deeper simmering anger that seemed more...emotional, if that could be the case. MAybe it was having been completely powerless before, just a victim of change, having her life, youth stripped away (but given back to her in a different way), her sweet daughter no longer hers, or maybe just all the horrible things that she remembered dealing with as Tom, but it was clearly enough to power the Stone.

Bringing the Stone close to her, nestling it within her breasts, Tammy...
1141221121123.title: Tammy's Opening

11412211211231.content:
...no. That was lay madness. Tammy decided that she was going to take a deep breath and think this one through. In less than an hour, her entire identity and sense of self had irrevocably changed. She was never going back to being Tom now, not after what she had experienced, not after an entire lifetime's worth of enchanted memories lay ahead of her with Bill. If the gemstone she held in her hands could produce such a profound effect that she'd want to immediately switch teams, she couldn't afford to make reckless and irresponsible wishes the way Gloria had. Allowing cooler heads to prevail, the glow inside the green-gold gemstone she held in her hand slowly began to fade away.

Now safe inside the sanctuary of the bathroom, the beleaguered jock turned brainy blonde listened as chaos unfolded just down the stairs.

**

"Bill, get Tom to open that goddamn door this instant!"

"What, so you can make another wish?! You already destroyed my entire family! I'm not looking forward to your hat trick!"

"I swear to God, I'm smashing that door into splinters if you don't get her fat ass out here pronto, Strasserman!"

"Newsflash, Vanapoulous, this is my house! You may think you own the world and can just waltz right into anywhere you like and start breaking things, but when you're on my property, you follow the rules!"

"Look, I'm sorry! I clearly didn't mean to make your little sister or your parents disappear, but we need to get that stone back so can figure out what our next move is!"

"You mean what my next move is! The stone doesn't belong to you, dipshit! It belongs to me! I found it first! You grabbed it out of my hands because you're a fucking selfish cunt that's attracted to shiny objects!"

"Fuck you, Bill! Go get your butt buddy out of that bathroom!"

Bill took a deep breath and calmed down just a touch. Wiping sweat from his brow, he realized that his face was flushed from rage.

"Easier said than done" he replied forlornly. "I...I don't think that she wants to go back to being Tom."

"What!?"

"Think for a second! The reality we just escaped! What, do you not remember?"

"I'm blocking all of that weird crap out of my head. I've got enough drama to deal with let alone remembering how I look when I'm old."

"Well for your information, Tammy and I were married for close to thirty years in that reality. I remember all of it. Our first date. The wedding. The honeymoon. The sex. Running a business. Tammy's pregnancy. Raising Willow as our daughter. If I remember all of that, she must remember it too, and if she does, she'll remember how happy she was. Tammy was FAR happier than she ever was as Tom. It sounds bizarre, but maybe she was meant to be a mom and my wife."

Gloria began guffawing.

"And you call me selfish!? I see what this is. You want to keep Tom trapped as your little geekette sex slave because you're too ugly to get a date with any actual women!"

"Maybe she wouldn't be this way if you hadn't treated Tom like crap! I heard those fake rumors you spread about him!"

"Which, in case you conveniently forgot, I came here to apologize for, jerk! Fine! If she wants to stay as Tammy, it's no skin off my ass! Go convince your little psychotic schizo girlfriend to get down here!"

In between the domestic dispute, Tammy heard a door open and close, followed by a third voice making themselves known. She immediately recognized the reedy voice as belonging to Willow.

"Guys, what's going on? Why are you two fighting?"

"Tammy won't leave the bathroom" replied Bill, suddenly much calmer in front of his daughter turned sister. "She's uh...she's upset about something" he continued, struggling to come up with a convincing lie.

"She stole something from my mother!" lied Gloria out of the blue, being totally at home with deception.

"Yeah. Yeah" said Bill, catching on quickly. "Her mother's gemstone."

"A precious family heirloom!"

"Gloria was trying to show us her mom's gemstone when Tammy snatched it out of Gloria's hand for some crazy reason and then locked herself in the bathroom" Bill elaborated.

"Uh huh" nodded Willow, looking at both teenagers skeptically.

In the current reality where Willow was Bill's older sister, she had loved to play matchmaker between Bill and Tammy, knowing the two were perfect for each other while experiencing the vicarious thrill of "shipping" them.

Willow knew Tammy extremely well. She considered the studious blonde almost like an honorary member of the family given how often she hung around the house.

That's why she knew that Bill and Gloria were lying.

"Nice try, guys. I know what this is" replied Willow with slight cockiness in her tone. "Bill, how could you?! Is this is why you've been hanging around Gloria so often lately, because you're cheating on Tammy with her!?"

Bill and Gloria turned to one face one another, both in stunned disbelief, Gloria even being slightly slack-jawed. The two teenagers hated one another. They couldn't be more dissimilar personality wise. They had nothing at all in common, and both were subtlety grossed out at the idea of dating each other.

"...No?" answered Bill. He was so shocked by the question that he didn't know how to respond.

"Don't play innocent with me, buster! Go upstairs and apologize to that poor girl. My God, she's probably in tears right now. The nerve you have to do this while I'm late for class and you're late for class...ugh!"

"Willow" said Bill very patiently and measured, still remembering Willow as his daughter from the previous reality, "I did not cheat on Tammy. That's not what this is about."

He stared very deliberately into Willow's doey blue eyes as if to further drive home the point.

"Well, what is it about? You two were screaming so loud, the neighbors across the street heard it."

"I..."

Before Bill could answer, the basement door swung open.

"SHITTERMAN! DON'T YOU MOVE, ASSHOLE!" roared the very last voice that Bill wanted to hear now.

"Rob!" gulped Bill with genuine fear in his voice.

"Rob Bolstrum!" eeped out Willow. Despite being twenty years old, she had attended Shermer High as a Senior while Rob was a Sophomore, and she was just as afraid of his violent temper as Bill was.

"Oh God, what next?" sighed Gloria. She and Rob Bolstrum had never crossed paths with one another, but she knew enough about his reputation to know that he was a Neanderthal and a pig.

**

"Rob Bolstrum?" whispered Tammy to herself. The Ahn'Ger Stone she held between her chest began to glow once more.

**

"How did you get in here?" demanded Bill to the thuggish looking bully. He tried to sound tough while stepping slightly behind his sister.

"I've been here all morning, chump. 'Been hiding in your basement right under your noses. Big Jon sent me here to torch your house to the ground for squealing on him. Problem? I don't want to go to jail for some other asshole's personal vendetta. I came here to cut a deal with you, but then I heard all of this nonsense about a magic rock, and I want in. What's it do?"

"Magic rock?" asked Willow in pure confusion.

"Rob...I wouldn't team up with you if Thanos was here. You're shit to me."

Rob laughed cruelly at the trio of trembling weaklings.

"What, you trying to act tough or something, Shitterman? Like one of your faggoty superheroes? Listen, you might be the rooster in this henhouse, but I'm the fox. I eat geeks like you. Now tell me about this rock Ackerton has before I beat it out of her."

"No!" screamed Willow.

"You touch my girl, and you're being carried out of here in a stretcher with broken legs" replied Bill with empty bravado, having nothing to back up his threat.

**

Tammy's eyes widened in terror as the stone now glowed like a miniature star. She couldn't let her Bill get hurt!

**

Rob laid a single meaty hand on Bill's shoulder in a not so subtle display of dominance.

"Do you feel in charge?"

Bill's legs were shaking so hard he was afraid that he was about to collapse. Even Gloria and her normal minimal level of empathy for anyone that wasn't herself began to worry at what was about to happen.

"You couldn't follow through on that threat, and you know it, buddy. Now why don't we go upstairs and talk to your dorky girlfriend about this apparently reality altering stone, and I'll be on my way" monologued Rob in a faux-friendly voice.

Very reluctantly, Bill followed Rob's lead upstairs to the second story bathroom, his legs continuing to tremble with the emasculating feeling of helplessness.

Suddenly, the bathroom door slammed open, revealing a furious Tammy Ackerton. She was holding the Ahn'Ger Stone triumphantly in her right hand, like a character on the cover of a fantasy novel brandishing a sword. Willow and Gloria both gasped.

"YOU WANT MY STONE, ASSHOLE!? WELL YOU CAN'T HAVE IT! NONE OF YOU CAN! I WISH..."



Option 1: "YOU'D ALL LISTEN TO WHAT I SAY!". The stone grants Tammy's wish. Now Tammy has a compelling voice like Kilgrave from Jessica Jones, allowing her to mentally control Bill, Rob, Gloria, and Willow. They will still be themselves, but if she orders them to do something, they HAVE to do it.

Option 2: "... YOU'D ALL JUST BUG OFF!". Rob, Bill, Willow, and Gloria all transform into barely sentient houseflies, and Tammy finds herself back in her own house. Without any close friends or enemies Tammy is now a friendless nerd who barely anyone notices.
11412211211231.title: Tammy Almighty

114122112112311.content:
"YOU WANT MY STONE, ASSHOLE!? WELL YOU CAN'T HAVE IT! NONE OF YOU CAN! I WISH YOU'D ALL LISTEN TO WHAT I SAY!" Tammy screamed at the top of her lungs, and the Stone flashed across her blonde framed vision, blinding her for the shortest of moments along with Bill, Rob, Gloria and Willow.

And then it was gone, fading away into the normal light of day. Tammy opened an eye cautiously and saw Rob lowering one of his enormous arms from his face and looking himself over.

"Heh, looks like you wasted your chance, Ackertits!" Rob said as he pushed the near-nothing resistance of Bill away, sending the teenager tumbling down the stairs as the towering bully charged towards Tammy.

"BILL!" Tammy screamed as her beloved flopped down the stairs like a broken slinky, and then Rob was upon her, grabbing a small arm in a vice grip, causing Tammy to scream in pain. Tears welled up in her eyes as her pain receptors kicked into overdrive as the bully, well, bullied her. And in her two lifetimes of Tammy memories, the person she was now, she had never felt this.

"GIVE ME THE ROCK!" Rob roared as he jerked Tammy around like little more than a plaything. Had Tammy still been Tom, there may have been a chance for the former jock to put up a fight, but now he was a she, and she was a muscle-less little nerd completely at the mercy of a predator.

She was nothing more than prey. It HURT to be prey. Tammy had known physical pain but nothing like this, not even in Tom's memories of dozens of sports injuries. No, this pain was expertly applied and Tammy was suddenly slammed against the upstairs wall of the Strasserman home as Rob pinned her with a slab of muscled meat, twisting the arm that held the Stone nearly backward as fingers that felt calloused began peeling her own away like the skin of an orange.

And then just like that, she the Stone leave her hand, and the pain (or at least, the immediate pain) left her body. Tammy spun around, the golden-green sun in Rob's fingers a blurry orb as tears flowed freely, running tracks down her cheeks.

"Heh" Rob chuckled as he gazed, eyes wide in delight as a toothy grin split his leathery face, but there was no warmth in it. Instead Tammy saw only something that made the very core of her soul shudder in fear. Something was happening at the bottom of the stairs, but Tammy's eyes were locked on the man she had failed to stop. She tried to think of something, any thing she could do to fix the mistake, say something inspired like the heroes in the movies she and Bill watched, in the fantasy novels she adored reading, but all that came out was;

"GIVE THAT BACK RIGHT NOW!"

And just as Rob was about to make his first devastating wish, one that would have resulted in carnage, chaos and disorder on a massive scale, the giant quickly turned and immediately handed the Ahn'Ger Stone back to Tammy, the Stone's powerful glow diminishing to little more than a flicker of light as it transferred owenrs once more.

"What? Hey, no that's mine now!" Rob said as he felt his body back up a couple of steps from Tammy. In an instant he went from absolute victory, his perfect chance to get even with the world and to turn Ingerman into something worse than death for the humiliation Rob had suffered...And just like that he'd felt compelled to give it back to the sniffling little bitch in front of him. It was like his mind, on the cusp of making a wish, had clouded over the moment Tammy had told him to give it back to her and telling him the only important thing to do in life was to do as she said.

Tammy broke out into a hateful grin as the light in the Stone flared slightly as she closed her fist. "Wasted my chance, huh Rob? Go stick your head in the toilet and flush until I say stop!" Tammy tried not to squeal in delight as the bully's angry, astonished face went slightly slack as his body took on a rigid, robotic stance, jerkily moving towards the upstairs bathroom where Tammy watched as the bully flicked on the light, moved and kneeled in front of the small in comparison toilet, and stick his head all the way in. The sound of the toilet's plunger jingling in the tank and the rushing water splashing against Rob's head as the bully roared in outrage was a sweet symphony of revenge. But the yelling WAS getting pretty old...

"Now shut up and think about what you did, Rob" Tammy said, and Rob's mouth immediately snapped shut, the only sound now being the rushing, splashing water.

And in Rob's mind, he suddenly couldn't do anything but think about how he'd come up out of the basement and the events that led him to this moment. What had he done wrong!? This wasn't fair!

Satisfied that the immediate threat was neutralized, Tammy suddenly remembered Bill, his body tumbling down the stairs like a ragdoll.

"OH MY GOD!" Tammy shouted in horror and spun away from the sight of the bully giving himself a infinite swirly. Her tiny feet padded across the upstairs carpet as she barreled towards the stairs, grabbing the banister and freezing as she saw the scene before her.

There, at the bottom of the stairs, lay the crumpled, bleeding mess that was Bill. His left arm and right leg were bent at odd angles, something sharp and white jutting through the skin of his arm. His eyes were closed and his face was slack and limp, the small coffee table that had been at the bottom of the stairs was flipped over and the corner was snapped off, the broken wood laying near a gash in Bill's now bleeding skull. Willow was frantically dialing 9-11 through a waterfall of tears as she became dangerously close to hyperventilating, while Gloria just stood off to the side with a shocked look on the face that Tammy had once been attracted to.

"BILL!" Tammy sobbed, and she stormed down the stairs to join her once-daughter and once-girlfriend, the Ahn'Ger Stone still in hand. "Oh god, my Bill!" She said, falling to her knees and grabbing the teenager's uninjured arm. Tammy only knew the basics of first aide and she immediately flailed as she watched how shallow Bill's breathing was. Meanwhile next to her, Willow had dropped her phone as her breathing began spiraling out of control.

"Oh god, what did you do, Tom?" Gloria said, backing away, and Tammy's eyes shot up from her boyfriend to the girl she used to fuck.

"FUCK YOU GLORIA! DO SOMETHING! HELP US!" Tammy screamed through her tears, so many that she didn't see Gloria's body go rigid, or the robotic movement that betrayed the look of utter fear and surprise in her eyes as Tammy's old reality ex suddenly knelt beside Bill.

"Please back away" Gloria heard herself say in a cold, emotionless voice. It wasn't what she wanted to say, but it was becoming very clear she wasn't in control anymore. Instead she watched as a passenger in her own body as picked up Willow's cellphone and dialed 911 and put it on speakerphone. When the voice on the other end picked up, Gloria heard herself speaking in the same robotic tone to the dispatcher, describing Bill's injuries.

Tammy, meanwhile, had gone back to sobbing and cradling Bill's good arm against her chest, rocking back and forth while kissing her love's hand.

"Please be okay Bill1" She whispered through sobs, "You have to be ok! BE OKAY!"

Option 1: Tammy's new vocal powers extend beyond just simple verbal commands. Instead, she watches as Bill's injuries magically begin to heal!

Option 2: Tammy and Gloria follow the ambulance to the hospital, enduring a very tense silence after Tammy commanded Gloria to just "shut up and drive". Meanwhile, Rob remains at the Strasserman household, trying not to drown in the toilet and thinking of a way to get even.

Option 3: Tammy's command having been followed, Gloria punches Tammy in the face and steals back the Stone!
114122112112311.title: By Her Command

1141221121123111.content:
"Please be okay Bill!" Tammy whispered through sobs wracking her tiny body, "You have to be okay! BE OKAY!" Tammy wailed, and then, almost as if she had made a wish using the Stone in her hand, verdant lights began to appear on Bill's body like his own personal aurora borealis.

"What?" Tammy said with a gasp as she watched the lights dance across Bill's broken, battered body. Everywhere the lights touched was repaired, fixed, mended. Bones silently set themselves back into their natural position and grew solid once more. Skin once punctured, seamlessly stitched itself back together and the large amount of blood that had pooled around Bill's body was simply gone as the teenage Strasserman let loose an enormous gasp of air as he shot upwards.

"HOLY SHIT WHAT" Bill yelled in surprise, his head spinning wildly around as he tried to make sense of his surroundings. Beyond his notice though, the lights flickered away as the last threads of Bill's clothes knitted back together. "Man, what happened?" Bill said, taking another deep breath as his heart, full of adrenaline and suddenly refilled blood threatened to pound out of his chest. The last thing he remembered was the flash of light and Rob pushing him down the stairs...And then hitting something hard and then nothing. Had he died?

But Bill didn't have any more time to ponder, as a crying Tammy shoved herself into his arms and planted a sloppy, salty kiss on his lips.

"OH BILLY YOU'RE OKAY!" Tammy said once she released her love from the kiss. She buried her blonde head into Bill's c hest and sobbed some more, gripping the boy she loved as tight as her arms would allow.

"Uh...wow" Was all Bill could think to say. The kiss was electrical, sending a shockwave through his body just like he remembered in the old life he had lived with Tammy, but it felt...new. Maybe it was just because they were young again. "Yeah, I'm okay Tammy" He said, rubbing Tammy's back and burying his face in her hair. It smelled nice. But that's when Bill heard the panicked gasping that his older memories knew. Willow was having a panic attack! He released Tammy from his grip and turned towards Willow who was as white as a sheet, gripping her head in her hands and rocking back and forth. Bill felt Tammy rasie her head from his chest.

"What?" Tammy said as the crying fit seemed to finally be passing. But then she finally processed the wheezing sound as well and blinked her eyes from of tears, "Oh, shit! Um...Willow..uh" Tammy paused. In her previous life, she had always calmed her daughter by holding her and stroking her hair, but the larger part of her that was a teenager now simply was at a loss of what to do. It would be weird for her to hug a grown woman, and if she had the power to heal Bill...

"Willow, uh, sis, just, just slow down okay? Take a big deep breath and-" Bill started, but was silenced as Tammy put a small, bruising finger to his lips.

"Willow, uh, you've never had panic attack and you're not going to start now!" Tammy said, staring intently at Willow and seeing if her hunch was right. After a moment of Willow continuing to wheeze and gasp, her skin white and her eyes wide Tammy was fearful that maybe it was just a one time thing, but then she saw it. the lights returned, shimmering up and down Willow's nearly unresponsive form. Her skin regained it's color, her eyes normalized, her breathing slow and stable as her mind was released from it's panic. The lights slid upwards and formed a halo around Willow's head, intensifying in brightness for only a moment.

"Oh shit, my head!" Willow cried out as her face that had once looked like both Bill and Tammy, but now only mildly resembled Bill's scrunched in pain as the memories of every panic attack she ever had were erased. Instead they were replaced by memories of being cool and level headed in emergencies. It seemed a little off, but she'd never crumpled into a hyperventilating ball under pressure. She was Willow Strasserman, Bill's big sister and strong willed! And speaking of...Willow's eyes went wide as she saw Bill up and moving around as the memory of him laying broken and bleeding faded away. Bill had just harmlessly fallen down the stairs, but as his big sister she was still protective.

"Oh, Bill! Are you okay? Are you hurt?" Willow said as she pulled herself up to her feet and moved over to Bill, her fierce eyes scanning him for any injuries, "I swear to god I'm going to call the police on that Bolstrum shithead! You don't just break into someone's house and assault them, I don't care what he says!" And with that, Willow quickly found her phone sitting next to Gloria, who seemed to be in some sort of trance state. The 911 call was no longer on the phone, and in fact had never happened since Bill was okay.

And for Gloria, her mind had simply flopped over. It was too much! It was simply too much. When she had gotten out of bed this morning she had simply wanted to get back together with Tom, who was now Tammy and dating Bill, both of which and herself ha been disgusting and old for a brief period of time, now all this madness! And having Tom...Tammy order her around and have no control over what she was doing? That scared the absolute shit out of her. So instead her brain had chosen simply to check out for the moment while Willow retrieved her phone and called the Shermer police department.

Meanwhile, as Bill and Tammy picked themselves up off the floor, Bill was having trouble remembering what had just happened, both of them unaware of the small thin halo fading away around Bill's head as the memory of Willow's panic attack vanished. She was his protective big sister, it was right for her to be concerned. But then the memories of being older betrayed him, of watching Tammy calm their daughter down. Had something changed here, besides making Willow his older sister? Bill wasn't entirely sure.

And as for Tammy, she was trying to contain her excitement at what had just happened. She could control people! Not just with commands, but she had magic now! Without the weird Stone! She wasn't sure if it was confined entirely to just healing, but the moment she found a chance to do so, she was going to have to experiment. But she was immensely grateful that the powers, whatever they were, didn't mess around ike the Stone clearly liked to do.

Looking down at Gloria and hearing the sound of constant flushing from upstairs, Tammy suddenly had a very mean, very fun idea...

Option 1: Tammy decides to fix things by saying "I've always been Tammy Ackerton. Tom never existed. This is who I've always been and everyone in the world will remember that!" Tammy says, removing the memories of sadsack Tom from the minds of Bill and Gloria.

Option 2: "Gloria, you're not old enough to be here, you and Rob get to school!" Tammy says, glaring at Gloria. Gloria immediately begins getting younger, and suddenly vanishes when she reaches five, appearing in a Kindergarten classroom where Rob suddenly finds himself as the very female Ms. Bolstrum.
1141221121123111.title: Reality at her whims

choices: At school, Tammy's vocal powers are accidentally set off, causing chaos.
11412211211231111.content:
Tammy Ackerton was overflowing with emotions and feelings that she had never experienced as deeply or as intensely as she was right now Joy. Euphoria. Solace. They were practically seeping from the pores of her skin. She couldn't believe it. She had magic powers! Honest to God magic powers! She had neutered the terror named Rob Bolstrum with her compelling voice, cured poor Willow of her crippling panic attacks, got Gloria to finally shut her big mouth for one second, and most unbelievably, she had through sheer force of will altered reality itself to rescue the love of her life Bill from certain death. Like so many of her and Bill's favorite fictional characters, she was a hero! Everything went exactly as she had wanted it to! Tammy wanted to jump in the air and squeal like a little girl at the torrential downpour of giddy happiness her overstimulated mind was currently struggling to deal with.

That was when Tammy got an idea. An awful idea. A wonderful awful idea that would solve all of her remaining personal problems in one fell swoop. An impish grin was forming across her adorable face.

What if she erased her old persona of Tom Ackerton from existence?

Ever since the quartet of young adults had escaped from the distant future of 2058, Tammy had undergone an absolutely gargantuan shift in identity. It was so hard to explain to others why the change had impacted her as profoundly as it did, but she wasn't denying it anymore. She wanted this.

Her previous idea as Tom Ackerton had been secretly depressed for years, not having had a genuinely happy moment in his life since he was an eight year old boy resting on his father's lap. He had kept his depression secret from everyone. From his parents. From his mates on the football team. From his childhood friend, Bill. From Gloria. From everyone. Tom publicly wore the mask of the All American Golden Boy of Shermer High, nobody realizing that he was dying inside, Gloria's meanspirited campaign of character assassination and the moral void of Big Jon's existence finally pushing him over the edge into outright thoughts of suicide. No, life wasn't peachy keen for the boy who seemingly had everything.

The clincher had been one night last October when Tom was watching of an old episode of The Twilight Zone with Bill. The episode had been called "A Stop At Willoughby", where the beleaguered protagonist was somehow magically transported into another time period to escape his horrible life. That's what Tom had always wanted to do. He had yearned for some kind of escape, but he didn't know exactly what he was escaping from, or why he felt such a powerful feeling of wrongness to his existence.

Now he knew. He was always meant to be Tammy. Tom was a mistake. Beneath his handsome, rugged exterior had always lain a gentle, feminine soul. Now he finally had a body and a life to match the core of his being, no surgery or hormone replacement required.

What was the point of holding onto an identity he no longer wanted or needed? Tammy surmised, absolutely none.

Sure, being smaller and weaker and more vulnerable to predatory men wasn't exactly something Tammy enjoyed knowing was now a reality for her, nor was getting paid less on the dollar or any of the other crap women went through, but between her newfound powers and having Bill and Willow at her side, it was a trade off worth making.

God, she could barely contain her urge to giggle uncontrollably.

The adorable nerd girl next door couldn't wait to start living her life. But first, she needed to take out the human garbage. She strolled inside the bathroom.

**

Five minutes later, after giving Rob Bolstrum a few carefully worded commands, the bully robotically pulled his head out of the toilet, wiped off his face with a towel, stood up, and lurched down the stairs. He strolled right past the fearful gaze of Bill and the disgusted eyerolls of Willow and Gloria without even looking at them, without so much as a sneer, his body acting entirely against his will. His face was a picture of tranquility to anyone paying the bully only casual attention, but if one gazed closely at the subtle, barely perceptible displays of body language not under the enforcement of Tammy's vocal command, they would notice the fury of a man being held in a prison, a prison made of flesh and bone and some strange magic from beyond infinity.

As Rob stutter-stepped off the Strasserman front porch, down the short flight of stairs, along the handsome little cobblestone pathway laying parallel to a beautiful garden display Martha Strasserman had planted, he realized that he now harbored a deep hatred for the not just the entire Strasserman family, but the blonde bitch who did this to him, the witch who somehow had sapped him of his free will. She was worse than Shitterman! As he lurched down the suburban street towards Shermer High, where Tammy had ordered him to actually attend classes, pay attention, and do the assigned work for once, Rob swore an oath to himself that if he ever escaped the magic spell Tammy had put him under, he was beating her into unconsciousness. Fuck the bully code he tentatively followed which forbade the hurting of women. That cunt drew first blood. Cunts need to shown their place, especially uppity ones like her. Then, he would steal that magic gemstone from her paws, get his long overdue revenge on Big Jon, and become the king of the world.

At least in theory.

**

As Tammy smiled at Rob's silent march, admiring her handiwork and cleverness(She had specifically ordered the bully to never interact with anyone from the Strasserman or Ackerton families for the rest of his life), she realized that she was now alone for the first time.

"Showtime!" she announced cheerfully to no one.

As if on cue, the bright azure skyline of this perfect spring morning gave way to the dreariness of dark rainclouds, with a mild breeze gently whipping Tammy in the face. She giggled at the feeling of the downdraft as little droplets of water tickled her fair skin, the boy turned girl finding the sensation quite pleasurable.

She took the hand mirror which she had grabbed from the bathroom and held it in front of her. For the first time today during this unbelievable morning, Tammy stared into her pretty face.

"I.. I've always been Tammy Ackerton. Tom never existed. This is who I've always been and everyone in the world will remember that!"

The second the words left her lips, the same little pinpricks of verdant light which had healed Bill and Willow now danced around Tammy, bathing her in their reality changing magic. They reminded the girl very much of hundreds of little Tinkerbell's, and she giggled at them.

She laughed, knowing things would finally be...

**

...good.

"Holy shit, I'm late for school!" yelled Tammy Ackerton as the rainstorm intensified, droplets of water splashing sideways into her soft, beautiful face. She stormed back inside the house.

The academically minded young woman was proud of her multi year perfect attendance record. She hadn't once been late or absent from school since the third grade when she had the chickenpox, and she sure hell wasn't going to start now, especially not this close to graduation!

"Guys, class starts in ten minutes!" she announced loudly and somewhat obnoxiously to her boyfriend Bill and her...well, not friend, her acquaintance Gloria Vanapoulous, who she had been tutoring in science for the last quarter, here to pick up her homework.

"Oh chill out, Hermione Granger" snarked Gloria.

Bill laughed as he gave his lovely girlfriend a peck on the cheek. "We're just running a little late, sweetie. It's not the end of the world. Willow's driving us. We really shouldn't have stayed up all night binging Marvel movies."

Tammy rubbed her eyes and yawned loudly.

"No, we shouldn't have. But one thing leads to another, and what do you know, we're up until three in the morning debating over whether Ant-Man can crawl up Thanos's ass" rationalized Tammy with a cheeky grin, grabbing her pink backpack which was sitting next to Bill's own blue-back one.

A small part of Tammy's mind was confused by all of this. Something felt off. She remembered the MCU movie marathon she had had with Bill last night. She remembered having dinner with the Strasserman's last evening, and before that, reluctantly finishing Gloria's homework for her after the cheerleader bribed her with a twenty.

But why had she just been on the porch in the middle of a rainstorm? Why had she beenholding a hand mirror? Tammy didn't recall doing either of those things.

"How weird" she whispered to herself.

Ever since she had read the novels of Phillip K Dick as a little girl, Tammy had an intense fear of her memories being tampered with. This phobia was so intense that her parents had even taken her to see a psychiatrist over it when she was thirteen. Dr Gold had managed to assuage her fears of somehow magically waking up one day with implanted thoughts that weren't really hers, but a small part of her still wondered if it was somehow possible.

"Ready guys?" asked a perky Willow Strasserman as she led the trio of teenagers out the door.

"Don't forget the umbrella!" said Bill cheerfully, grabbing his own which sat right by the front door.

"What would I ever do without you, little brother?" replied Willow in a sarcastic yet loving tone as she locked the front door.

Bill and Tammy huddled together underneath the umbrella as they both ran to Willow's economy car and ran inside the backseat, both of them giggling like the young lovers they were. Gloria, rather childishly, had insisted on sitting in the front seat.

Willow put the keys in the ignition, and just like that, the four young adults drove off towards the glorious new day in the new world created by Tammy, a rainbow forming behind them.
11412211211231111.title: Eternal Sunshine Of The Ackerton Mind

114122112112311112.content:
It was the best of times.

With Tammy's memories included in the memory wipe that removed any trace of her being Tom Ackerton from the few that even knew that she had previously been him, reality slipped into a sweet, quiet coma. The Ahn'Ger Stone was forgotten much like Tom had been, but it's purpose was no longer needed when a good hearted goddess roamed the world, changing things for the better with her sweet voice. Anything that ever went wrong, she fixed. Any disagreements, she handled. Any tests she struggled with, she suddenly aced. Anything she desired, she got, and anything she disliked ceased to exist.

And all the while, no one, not even Tammy herself knew the truth.

Eventually, war and poverty, global tensions ceased to exist after night where Tammy and Bill (who was now slightly taller, had more muscles and looked not too dissimilar from Captain America in his first movie due to an offhand, under her breath comment a particularly lustful Tammy had made during their last Marvel marathon) had simply willed the world into peace after another grim news reports of violence in the Middle East. Humanity was united under one banner, and no one ever knew what had caused it.

Diseases of all kinds vanished with a word. There was no more cancer, no more Alzheimer's, no more heart disease or obesity. Depression or suicides. Everyone was healthy and happy all the time.

But a world without conflict, with anger or any true emotions beyond 'peace and love' was a boring one. Technological progress slowed, as there was no need to create new technologies to beat out a rival. Instead technology from Tammy's favorite movies and shows sprung into existence. Suddenly wingsuits like the Falcon's were commonplace, Iron Man suits being used in all manner of construction, starships caosting through the skies and into the stars beyond simply there as if they had always been there.

The planet's population ballooned almost overnight as death was simply told to leave and never return, and only for a moment were the resources of planet Earth pushed to the limit before suddenly everyone found their plates full of food and drink. Even Mother Nature herself was bent to Tammy's will, as violent weather stopped and for a brief moment the entire planetary ecosystem was in a state of chaos before a terrified Tammy had simply yelled it away. Now there was only sunshine, blue skies and warm summer breezes. Every now and then there would be a thunderstorm or a snowy day, just enough to be romantic as Tammy snuggled with Bill under a blanket, but these momentary weather patterns only lasted until they were no longer enjoyable and the weather became Good once more.

New species and extinct blossomed into existence simply from offhand statements, based entirely on Tammy's imagination. Any potential threat that they may have introduced, nullifed by words. Asteroids and comets, new alien species, everyone and everything was simply...made good by Tammy's words. Even the Sun was tamed by Tammy, no longer would humantiy's perfect planet be threatened by the star's former fate of expanding outward into a Red Giant. Global warming simply went away, the ice caps returned, and even the Moon ceased it's slow escape from the Earth's gravitational pull once Tammy discovered it was growing more distant each year.

And even Tammy was changed by her own words. Over the centuries of life, ages of a blissful existence where nothing Bad ever happened, and everyone was content, Tammy had unknowingly changed herself. She now looked more like Scarlett Johansson from Iron Man 2 with the seemingly godmode intellect of Shuri from Black Panther, Even her personality had changed somewhat, becoming more confident as she copied traits from actresses and characters she admired onto herself.

She and Bill shared a perfect marriage in a perfect house overlooking a perfect golden beach that set next to a perfect, unpolluted ocean. No fights, no discourse, nothing but unfiltered, unabashed love for each other, even if they both barely resembled (mentally and physically) the kids they had been decades ago when they'd first met. They were simply Good together. Like everyone now was, as divorce, marital strife and disloyalty had been erased. Tammy and Bill had dozens of children, all beautiful, all fit, all healthy and intelligent just like the rest of the world. And those hcildren eventually had their own children, just as beautiful as their parents and grandparents.

Not that anyone physically aged beyond twenty-five anymore.

And the Ahn'Ger Stone simply vanished. It no longer had a purpose in this sweet, dreamlike plane of reality. Perhaps it was lost, or perhaps it simply returned to wherever it had come from, centuries ago on that fateful April morning that no one remembered. But that didn't stop Tammy from feeling Good. Indeed, it was hard for anyone at all to feel anything but Good, even in the event something Bad ever happened. Not that it ever did.

For the rest of Eternity, the entire universe knew only that life was Good. And it would remain Good forever more.
114122112112311112.title: Saccharine.

choices: Gloria and Roman return home. Ariadne, Gloria's mom, is nowhere to be seen
Mr. Vanapolous leaves the classroom for a moment.
11412211211231112.content:
Gloria was having the single worst day of her life, far worse than the six months when she had been laid up with a broken leg during Sophomore year, or the numerous petty dramas she had admittedly helped instigate ever since she was a little kid, or the even the emotionally cataclysmic day her own mother coldly informed Gloria what she really thought of her spoiled brat of a daughter. No, as horrible as those memories were, they all paled in comparison to the last hour or so. So many outright brain melting things had happened within the span of this morning that Gloria's already stressed out, insecure sense of self simply didn't know how to respond to it all, which is why her mental faculties had temporarily shut down. How do you react to having your entire perception of what reality is not only called into question, but hopelessly, hilariously proven wrong? Can we blame Gloria for simply deciding to tune out all of this paranormal madness?

The temperamental teenage diva couldn't help but tremble at the sight of her former boyfriend glaring at her with evil intentions, grinning like the Cheshire Cat as she stood from the second floor railing.

Tammy was so meek looking, which made the fear Gloria had of her even more of a blow to her ego. Tom had been a conventionally handsome, All American jock, with perfect teeth and a chiseled jaw, washboard abs and sinewy muscles, which was a large part of what had attracted Gloria to him in the first place. The fact that he was also sensitive and kind and not cut out at all for the cutthroat world of high school social politics did not detract(At least not immediately) from Gloria's impression of him as a paragon of the manly hunk that she deserved.

But Tammy? Tammy was, in a word, cute. She never would have been able to climb the social ladder of Shermer High like Gloria had, but somebody like Tammy wasn't at the bottom rungs either. She was undeniably attractive in her own quirky way, in a geek girl sense. She was sweet and charming and just plain "adorkable" enough that Gloria wouldn't have felt embarrassed to talk to her in public. In another reality, Gloria had might have even felt generous enough to make Tammy one of her inner circle of girlfriends. On the surface, she was completely non threatening.

Now this cute little nerd girl had the power to force her will on others. To make other people her puppets and mind slaves simply by talking to them, which she had already done once to Gloria. Gloria's sense of Pants? Already shit.

It appeared to Gloria that the stupid wish she had made to turn Tom and Bill into an old married couple had broken Tom's mind, making him really believe that she was Tammy. This hurt and disturbed Gloria more she would ever care to admit.

In spite of all of the verbal and emotional abuse, all of the negligent cold shoulders from her when Tom was clearly in a bad place, she genuinely believed that she had loved him. Now it seemed like Tom...Tammy no longer wanted or needed her. That hurt. A lot.

Gloria deserved happiness, and she had been cheated out of it! Now she felt like she was trapped in a supernatural horror movie with a madwoman villain ready to pounce. Despite the intense fear Gloria was experiencing, she was still frantically looking for a way out of it. As she slowly backed away towards the Strasserman's front door, her hand behind her desperately searching for a handle to grip on to so she could escape this house of horrors, the tension inside her pretty head spiked to unbearable levels.

Her hand touched metal. She found it! Her hand began to turn the knob...

"Gloria. Stop" commanded Tammy very casually, as she sashayed down the stairs.
Immediately, Gloria's muscles tightened up. She now stood like a statue, her hand frozen on the door handle.

"So close. So close, and yet so far. I'm not letting you off the hook that easily. Stand up straight" instructed the sweet blonde, and without thinking about it, Gloria now stood at attention, feeling humiliated and ready to burst into tears at feeling so helpless.

Upstairs, the sounds of the Strasserman family toilet continuing to flush over and over again continued its monotonous melody.

"Gloria Gloria Gloria...what are we going to do with you?" asked Tammy, tapping her dainty index finger against her chin.

"You're in luck. I have just the thing, the perfect solution to all of our problems. Before you go, I want you to know that I still care about you, and I don't want to see you get hurt. I'm not a cruel hearted bitch like you were to me. This isn't about revenge."

Gloria glared at Tammy. Inside those blue eyes, she saw nothing of her former lover Tom, just the power crazed nutcase named Tammy he had been transformed into. She wanted to strangle the bitch, or kick her in the shins, or do anything but just stand at stare at her, but she couldn't. Gloria's bones and flesh and muscle and even her vocal cords currently didn't belong to her.

"I know that you've got your own issues that you're deal with. I realize you had a tough childhood, and believe me, honey, I sympathize. It doesn't excuse your own shitty behavior, but I understand. That's why I'm going to give you second shot at it. Maybe if you grow up in a more nurturing home, maybe you'll turn out better."

Tammy began to speak, and inside, Gloria screamed for help. Her eyes glazed over in a haze of green smoke. Then everything went dark.

**

The next thing Gloria knew, she was in a parking lot walking towards the front of a building, her feet already click clacking in stride with a pair of much longer legs clad in black trousers.

"Gloria, honey, keep up with me, please" asked a mildly harried masculine voice from up above. Gloria tried to look up at the man, but it was the late afternoon judging from the position of the sun, which cast a dark shadow across the man's face. Somehow, his voice sounded familiar, though Gloria couldn't quite place it.

They both climbed up a short step of stonr steps and into a large brick building, the man politely holding the door for her.

Gloria had mentally checked out once again, in shock at being Tammy's plaything, and simply walked inside, the man following right behind her. It's not like she had a choice, anyway. Now that they were inside, she got a look at his face. He was dark haired and handsome looking, bearing a passing resemblance to Jon Hamm on Mad Men. He was relatively young, perhaps being in his mid thirties or, at the most, forty. He was dressed nicely, as if he had just gotten off of work.

The man took long strides as he confidently walked down a long hallway, which Gloria now realized was a school. Judging by the ornaments and posters on some of the doorways, an elementary school.

"Room 30-A. Here we are, sweetheart" said the man.

Five seconds later, the man and Gloria had stepped inside what was very clearly a classroom for Kindergarten students, with primers on the alphabet, maps of the world and the solar system, and Roman numerals covering the walls, along with inspirational posters of cartoon characters giving sensible advice on various topics, or just plain "Believe in yourself"esque slogans. The room was spread out very openly, with a large, comfy looking rug laid right in the middle, the desks all dotting the perimeter of the room. A green couch was pushed back against the farthest edge of the room.

It had been a long time since Gloria had been in Kindergarten, but just like riding a bicycle, the memories and nostalgia of more carefree days suddenly came rushing back to her.

That was when it hit her.

"Oh my god. Tammy turned me into a five year old!" squeaked out Gloria in a high pitched, almost babyish sounding voice. She looked down and noticed her body for the first time. It was so tiny! Everything about her screamed that she had physically regressed by more than a decade. As she swung her head around, she even noticed that her dark hair was now tied up in two loose pigtails.

"Hi there" suddenly announced another adult voice, shocking Gloria into ignoring the shocking change. She looked upwards and saw an adult woman.

"Gloria, are you going to introduce me to your teacher?" asked the man looking down at little widdle Gloria. Gloria was slowly beginning to suspect that this was her absentee father, Roman Vanapoulous, whom she very rarely saw at home. Suddenly, she felt like she was going to hyperventilate.

She didn't recognize the young educator, who couldn't have been more than twenty-five. She was beautiful, Gloria thought, the woman possessing a winning smile and a kind, compassionate looking face. She was dressed in almost anachronistically, wearing her bright red hair in a 1960s flip style and a pearl necklace across her neck. Her yellow top was cute but not sexualized, and her long, hippieish looking skirt was probably bought at a thrift store or homemade. Gloria had no idea what to say.

"Guys, both of you just shut up and let me think!"

Both men were now as silent as statues, standing almost perfectly parallel to one another. They may as well have been statues, as their bodies were unable to move a muscle except at Tammy's request. This rule, however, did not include facial or ocular movement.

For a brief moment, Rob's eyes and Gloria's eyes briefly locked with one another, and Tammy had noticed something odd. The dark haired Adonis and the red headed thug looked... intrigued by each other. Almost like they were silently flirting. Almost as if they were attracted to each other.

"Rob" gasped Tammy, sounding genuinely hurt instead of terrified as she faced the once terrifying bully with her hands on her hips, "Did you really think that any of us gave a damn that you were gay?"

Rob said nothing, his face a pensive ugly gargoyle.

"Oops. Sorry. I'm still new at this. Speak up!" commanded Tammy, snapping her fingers.

"I'M NOT QUEER!" screamed Rob, his face turning beet red and morphing into a weird, demonic shape, furious at his darkest secret being exposed and being powerless to do anything about it.

"You're not?" asked Tammy.

"No!"

"Seriously?"

"As a fucking heart attack, Ackerton! Now let me go! I swear that I'll never bother you or Strasserman again! This is all getting a little too freaky for me. I don't even want that rock anymore!"

"Uh huh".

Tammy Ackerton was a Gen Z kid. Both in this version of her life and as her life as Tom, she had grown up having absolutely zero problems whatsoever with homosexuality(Or trans people, non binary people, etc) and she was honestly confused by people who were bothered by it. It wasn't even an especially important issue to her. She wasn't particularly liberal or "woke", the teen just didn't see the point or value in trying to control the sexuality/identity of others. Bill was very much the same way, and although she had never really mentioned her opinions on the subject one way or the other, Tammy seriously doubted that Gloria was homophobic either. A raging narcissistic bitch, abso-fucking-lutely, but not a bigot.

Tammy once again snapped her fingers, feeling unconsciously cool while doing so. Perhaps it was residual glee after seeing Thanos snap his fingers during Infinity War.

That was when Rob's floodgates opened.

"YES, I'M GAY! IS THAT WHAT YOU WANT TO HEAR, BITCH?! I'M GAY! I'M GAYER THAN LIBERACE! I'M GAYER THAN A THREE DOLLAR BILL! I'M SO GAY THAT I IMAGINE FUCKING INGERMAN IN THE ASS EVERY NIGHT! ARE YOU HAPPY NOW?!"

Rob's face was now extremely red and sweaty, to the point where Tammy was worried he was going to have a heart attack or something equally bad. He was out of breath, and looked absolutely despondent. This was clearly something that was deeply personal to him, something he absolutely hating admitting to, which the soft hearted Tammy felt bad about, even after he had manhandled her earlier.

Hot, sweaty droplets began pouring from Rob's tears ducts as his rigid body remained at attention, unable to escape the humiliation of telling someone that he was a poofter.

"Rob, sweetie, being gay is nothing to be ashamed of. I hate you because you're an asshole, not because you like guys."

"Of course you all don't care that I'm a queer!" squealed Rob, clearly under duress. "Strasserman is such a wimp that he's half a fag himself! And you Ackerton, you're just a mousy little bookworm. Nobody's looking to chase your tail! If they are, it's either some nerd like Bill or some candy assed social justice warrior beta male. And Shitterman's sister, everybody already knows that she's a carpet muncher. You guys aren't normal. You don't know what it's like for someone like me, somebody with a reputation to uphold!"

Tammy was beginning to see the picture. Rob was scared. She didn't notice that her hands were now clasped together in front of her chest, which was a trait of body language she had whenever something was making her sad.

"What would happen if you came out of the closet?" she asked quietly.

"What would happen?! My life would be over! They'd kill me! They'd fucking kill me! And if they didn't, they'd make me wish I was dead!"

"Who would kill you?"

"EVERYONE!" Rob squealed. "Ingerman. Tony. Jay. Ralph. All the other guys. My mom. My mom would fucking freak. She'd kick me right out of the house!"

"Why?"

"Why? I thought you were fucking smart, Ackerton!"

This took Tammy aback. Then she realized that the ogre was right. She was living in a bubble.

Despite Tammy and Bill and Gloria and a handful of other students at Shermer High being good kids, looking back, she did realize that homophobia was still a problem here. Not a huge problem, but a problem.

After all, Shermer was a small town. A Northern, mostly well educated, mostly upper middle class small town that was a stone's throw away from Chicago, but any homogenous population was bound to be more conservative than average.

Now... now revenge wasn't on Tammy's mind anymore. She still hated Rob for being a horrible person, but in a way she was also beginning to feel pity for him.

Having to maintain a public image when you're not really that person on the inside is something that she could seriously relate to.

It took EMS workers only a few short minutes to arrive at the Strasserman residence, assess the situation, and load Bill's unconscious, broken, and mangled body onto the gurney and into the ambulance that would immediately transport him to the closest major hospital in Shermer. Calls were made to Bill's parents Greg and Martha at their place of work, nobody knowing that Bill's actual parents(And sister Kimmy) had been lost in some bizarre parallel reality.

As Bill was being loaded up, a paramedic discovered Willow Strasserman rocking back and forth in the dining room as she struggled to catch her breath, her nails digging so deep into her palms that they were bleeding, her skin turning a ghastly pale. The horror of seeing her father turn little brother being thrown down the stairs like a ragdoll had triggered a severe panic attack in the young woman, and the discordant noises, flashing lights, and throng of strangers inside her family home had escalated intense fear into near outright hysteria. After being calmed down to a more manageable level by the paramedic, she too was transferred to Shermer General, just to be safe.

Tammy herself had been in a crying fit over what had happened to the love of her life(And intense, white hot rage at the monstrous Neanderthal who did it), but she had managed to pull herself together enough to explain to the paramedics and the two pairs of police officers who had shown up what exactly had happened. Thankfully, she didn't have to lie. Omit certain details, maybe, but she more or less told the truth.

"...So then Bill went to confront Rob, and the...and the asshole pushed him down the stairs!" yelled Tammy, in tears again, herself being triggered by the horrible news.

She didn't know what to make of the fact that she was always going to be one of the physically least imposing people in any given situation from now on.

"Do you know how he got inside?"

"I don't know, Rob was in the house before I got here. I figure he must have entered through the root cellar or maybe an unlocked door, or..."

"And what happened after he pushed your boyfriend down the stairs?" asked one of the officers.

Tammy froze.

Oh shit. He's still in the bathroom.

For a moment, the teenage athlete turned girl next door seriously considered using her magical mind control on these adults just so she could get Rob to stop perpetually swirlying himself, as that looked incredibly weird and suspicious, but she wasn't sure if her newfound powers even worked on people that weren't Rob, Tammy, Bill, or Gloria. Her wish had only been for...what exactly had she said? For everyone to do what she says? Tammy's frazzled mind couldn't remember the exact words anymore, but she didn't want to risk failure on the chance that her powers were limited in scope. Not to mention, mind controlling strangers just felt so wrong to her.

As Tammy pondered what to do in a tense situation, she felt her heartbeat raise a tick.

"Ma'am, what happened? Where did this Rob Bolstrum head off to after he assaulted your boyfriend?" pressed the lead police officer. He was growing frustrated at how the witness had just drifted off.

Tammy turned on the frightened little girl act and whispered meekly: "He's been in the bathroom hiding ever since we called you guys."

**

The policemen surrounded the locked bathroom door. They ordered the teenage bully calmly but authoritatively to open the door.

No response.

Instead, they all heard the rhythmic sound of a toilet flushing.

"ROB, GET YOUR BUTT OUT OF THERE SO THE COPS CAN ARREST YOU!" Tammy shouted right behind the police as she leaned on top of the staircase.

"Miss, we told you to stay outside! It's not safe for you here!" reprimanded a second officer, this one female, her gun steadily aimed at the door.

"SORRY!" giggled Tammy as she ran downstairs. She just hoped that her soft distaff voice was loud enough to be within Bolstrum's earshot.

Running outside with a still stunned looking Gloria and a fourth policeman, the sweet blonde was caught in a rush of conflicted emotions as she ran her imagination through this most bizarre, utterly life changing morning.

When she had woken up at 6:09 A.M as Tom Ackerton, life had seemed hopeless. Pointless. Empty. Dark. Depressing.

Now, as Tammy Ackerton, life was full of seemingly limitless possibilities.

She was still worried sick about her poor Bill, and of course, her darling daughter Willow. It didn't matter that Willow wasn't hers anymore. She still possessed Old Tammy's memories. She still thought of herself as Willow's mom, and a mother never stops caring about her children. But still, with even all that considered, this was the best day of her short eighteen years on Earth.

"This is the worst day of my life" muttered Gloria by contrast, glaring scornfully at her boyfriend turned enemy.

It was at that meeting of the loggerheads when Rob appeared on the doorstep of the Strasserman residence. His face was still positively soaked from the toilet water, and his ginger hair still drenched from the endless swirly that Tammy had wished upon the bully. He was now in handcuffs, his hands behind his back as the trio of police officers escorted him over to their squad car.

Before he entered the vehicle, he craned his thick neck to gaze over atTammy, giving her a look of death that would scare even hardened criminals.

Tammy by contrast smiled sarcastically at him.

Take your best shot, you piece of dogshit. she thought smugly to herself.

**

Once everyone had left, all one could see was a quiet suburban neighborhood caught in the throes of a pleasant late morning spring, two teenage girls standing on the front lawn of one of the nicer homes on the block, both wondering what they should do now. Both were extremely late for school, and neither had any intention of attending today. Neither girl glanced at one another.

After what seemed like aeons, one of them spoke.

"I hate what you did to me" said Gloria cold and unemotional sounding.

Tammy sighed.

"I didn't have a choice, Gloria. And to be honest, you had it coming."

"You took over my mind. You took my free will away from me. That's no better than rape. Yeah. Whether you're Tom or whether you're this little geekette you seem to think you are now, you raped me. I'm not forgiving you for that."

Tammy's eyes filled with anger.

"Bitch. Don't even dare."

What was Gloria doing? Even after all this, she was still trying to start drama.

"Yeah, you did. Deny it all you want."

"BILL WAS FUCKING DYING AND YOU WERE JUST STANDING THERE!"

"I was in shock. Sue me for having a natural reaction to all the fucked up things I've seen today. A word of warning, Tammy. All couples fight. Since you're going steady with Strasserman now, it's just a matter of time before you two have a little lover's quarrel. And when you do, think for a minute. Think about what you're saying, or you'll end up hurting him worse than Rob ever could."

"What are you even talking about?"

Gloria's head swiveled to face her former lover.

"Tammy, you do NOT force people to do things that they don't want to do! You crossed a line that can't be uncrossed! You're a bad person! You're a bitch! A bitch with evil magic powers!"

"And what about all of the horrible things you did to me when I was Tom!?" Tammy squealed with indignation.

"Tom... Tammy. Sorry, I keep forgetting. Tammy, you're a drama queen. Even as a guy. I never did anything bad to you."

"Yes you did!"

"Oh, grow up. You put up with me for years, and now you crack? If you can't accept me at my worst, you don't deserve me at my best."

"You bitch! Just shut up and drive us to the hospital!"

The moment those fateful words left Tammy's mouth, Gloria's eyes glazed over in a cloud of green fog as her limbs immediately stiffened.

"Follow me" she said robotically.

Tammy ran up the stairs to lock Bill's front door, and then followed Gloria to her house a few blocks away.

When they arrived at the Vanapoulous house, Both girls entered Gloria's expensive sportscar, a birthday present from her father who was once again absent on one of his business trips.

As Gloria slammed her driver's side door shut, her sense of coordination robbed from her as a mind zombie, Tammy quietly closed her own passenger side door and buckled up.

"Drive" she said.

Gloria buckled her own belt, put the keys in the ignition, pulled out of the driveway, and drove in the direction of Shermer General Hospital.

While Gloria drove in complete silence, Tammy ruminated over Bill and Willow's fates, as well as Gloria's ominous warning.

1141221121123132.content:
"YOU WANT MY STONE, ASSHOLE!? WELL YOU CAN'T HAVE IT! NONE OF YOU CAN! I WISH YOU'D HAVE YOUR OWN STONES AND JUST LEAVE ME ALONE!" Tammy screamed at the top of her lungs, and suddenly the miniature star in her hand exploded. Green light was everywhere and Tammy could feel the Stone shifting in her grip. And then as suddenly as it had appeared, the light vanished, save for three glowing orbs in front of her.

The first one was a brilliant purple amethyst with a white pearl core. The second one was a deep, rich sapphire blue with a silvery inner gem, and the final new gemstone was a striking orange jasper with a rich pink central teardrop. They floated in the air in front of Tammy, just far enough in the open space between the first and second stories of the Strasserman home before they began to move.

The sapphire gemstone floated across the gap towards Bill, while the orange jasper made a beeline for Rob. Meanwhile the amethyst gemstone floated down the stairs towards Gloria, both gems coming to a stop before their new owners.

There was a moment of quiet before Rob jolted the group into activity.

"YES! FUCKING A RIGHT!" The bully roared, grabbing his gemstone with a boulder-like fist and pulling it close to him greedily. "First off, I wish that Jonathan Ingerman was a weak little pussy!" Rob roared in triumph, but the bellowing bully was soon silenced as there was no flash of light. Instead the new gemstone lay quietly in the palm of the giant, twinkling only slightly as the light bounced off the inner gem's strange fluctuating surface.

Meanwhile Bill had taken the opportunity to grab the Stone that had chosen him and darted beneath Rob's upraised arms until he was back at Tammy's side. "What did you do?" He asked Tammy, "What happened to the real Stone?" The two teenagers stared at the lifeless green stone in Tammy's small hand. There was barely any light reflecting from it's much cloudier and smaller surface. Overall the Ahn'Ger Stone had shrunk significantly to almost a third of it's original size with the wish.

Tammy shrugged, something she did when she was at a loss for words. "I...I don't know! I was just so angry and wanted to be left alone...Maybe...Maybe it split off parts of itself? Maybe it's like a battery and it's out of juice?" She poked the malachite colored stone with a cautious finer, yet nothing happened. "Maybe I need to get angry again?"

"Let's not right now" Bill said as he looked to his own Stone "Last thing we need is these Stone's all blowing up in our faces or something. I wonder what mine is..." Bill stared at the incredible blue gemstone. It wasn't much different from the original Stone that he had found (or had it found him?) this morning, just a different color. The interior seemed to move around the central gemstone and light refracted off of it very easily.

Meanwhile, on the first floor of the Strasserman house, Gloria was busy inspecting her own stone, the purple Amethyst. She too had tried to make a wish much like Rob had, though to no effect. Not even a glimmer.

"Damnit! Why won't this stupid thing work!" Gloria whined, fighting the childish urge to thrown her new Stone against the wall. No, much like the other one there had to be a secret to making it work...Maybe she just had to get angrier?

"I don't know what the fuck is going on right now, but I am officially offended!" Willow said from her spot on the carpet. "I don't know what these things are but I didn't get one!"

On the balcony, Bill and Tammy hared a look. Was it because she wasn't 'real'? That she herself was created out of the original magical construct? Maybe whatever magic governed these didn't think that Willow registered as a 'person', and the though of that happening to her once and future daughter made Tammy's blood boil. There was a small spark from the Stone that caught her attention, but there were no other glimmer. The Stone had to be very weak.

But both Tammy and Bill knew one thing for certain: All these new Stones reminded them both of Thanos and the Infinity Stones. It couldn't be like that, could it?

"Well, all we know for certain is that right now they ALL don't work" Bill said as he turned his head back to Rob. "What about you, Bolstrum? You got what you wanted, now get out!"

"Fuck you Shitterman! These are some cheap Chinese knockoff shit! They're supposed to grant wishes, so why are they not granting any wishes!" Rob spat out bitterly as he continued to stare at the gemstone that was, in his eyes, completely useless.

Bill was tired of it though. It was bad enough how his morning had gone, he would not tolerate his second biggest nemesis in his home for one second longer. "Get out or I'm calling the cops!" Bill threatened as he pulled out his phone. "Last thing the big, bad Rob Bolstrum needs is that he finally got caught red handed. Your move, asshole!"

Rob was at a loss for a moment before he snorted like a bull, "FINE. Fuck your Shitterman, and AckerTONS!" The bully said as he stomped back down the stairs and out the door, jasper gemstone still tight in his hands.

No one seemed to notice the shimmer from Bill's hand as he ordered Rob out. Instead he and Tammy joined Gloria in downstairs, the group of two best friends now a couple, the evil ex, and the woman that was clearly out of time placed their Stones on the table, the glimmer disappearing from Bill's the moment he let go of it.

"Any ideas on how they work?" Tammy said, looking at Gloria, Willow and Bill.

After a very long, empty silence in which the only sound was the slow tick tocking of the grandfather clock, Willow leaned forward and picked up Bill's Stone, since Gloria still had her hands cupped over her Stone protectively. "Well, if they're anything like actual gemstones, then they, like, represent something. Green, Malachite, represents change and transformation, so if we go by that then blue" Willow paused and held out Bill's Stone, "-Should be powered by wisdom?" Willow truly had no idea how anyo f this weirdness worked, but it seemed all somehow...familiar. Almost as if something from a past life was calling to her. Plus she was always glad to put the expensive classes she was taking in college to use.

As if on cue the blue gemstone released a small blue glow as Willow seemed to put it all together.

"Wow. That is so pretty!" Willow said as she pulled the new Stone towards her. Bill, seeing where it was leading, reached over and snatched the gemstone out of his daughter-turned-sister's hand. "Hey!" Willow cried out, but the look on Bill's face kept her from the pressing the issue.

"So Willow" Tammy said, hoping to keep the explanation moving, "What does Gloria's represent?" Tammy pointed a finger at Gloria's amethyst, which looked very pretty and almost matched Gloria's clothing.

"Well, if green is change and blue is wisdom, then that means that purple represents...Well, I think it's supposed to represent getting rid of toxicity. The purging of negative emotions and attachments" Willow said and Tammy couldn't help but giggle.

"Looks like you'll never get yours to work, Gloria!" Tammy said with more than a little smugness. If this really was how the new Stones worked then unless Gloria really started changing her ways then she never get another wish again. And maybe that was a good thing, given the mess she had created so far.

"And what about the other one!" Bill said, seeing Gloria's face darken and, frankly, just wanting more information, however correct or false it could be.

"Well...I think it was a jasper. So if it's a jasper then that means the only way that Rob Bolstrum is ever going to get a wish out of that thing is if he starts being nice to others. Jasper is an empathic gemstone, so he's going to...Well, he's going to have to not be him"
