Bullets of freezing rainfall fell across the bully's pockmarked face stinging him a little bit, but he was too damn angry to care.

"I waited for a fucking hour to talk to those fucking nerds, and then that David Copperfield shit happens" he muttered, staring with a contemptuous glare at the orange jasper he held in his grip. His skeptical mind was already beginning to rationalize away the supernatural event he had just witnessed as his imagination, or some weird shit he didn't care to know the details about. "Why do I even bother trying to be nice when this is all I get? Guess I'll pawn it later."

Rob slipped the gemstone inside his left pocket. He had stolen enough jewelry before to know that it would probably fetch him about thirty dollars at the most. Not enough to mean anything substantial, but he figured it'll keep him in beer and pizza for a couple of days. That is unless Strasserman whines to the principal to give it back later today. Pft. Whatever. Let the little punk try.

Rob was honestly going to give Strasserman a chance too. He knew that egghead could think of a plan to get rid of Ingercunt. He was going to tell Bill everything he knew about Big Jon's schedule, where he hangs out, ways to provoke him, and so on, but then the Ackerton broad had to have her little meltdown and ruined it all. Pft. Probably on her period.

Women. Can't live with them...

...

Well, the same held true for men too, if Rob was being honest with himself. He just wasn't a fan of humanity in general. To Rob, most people's only contribution to this life was turning perfectly good food into shit.

There were a few exceptions.

Strasserman's sister was alright. He didn't know why, but he kind of liked her. He tried to convince himself it was because she had a sweet ass and legs for days, but somehow that didn't feel right. Maybe it's because she just seemed nice. Someone who didn't judge him for being poor white trash. She was an artist too. Rob respected someone who had a passion and followed it.

Another person he respected was a girl named Amber Reid. She was one of the few people Rob knew who could appreciate old school punk music, and she knew where to score good drugs. The two of them would sometimes hang out down at the creek behind the trailer court and get fucked up while listening to The Clash or Soundgarden together, but it never went much further than that. Big Jon and the other bullies egged Rob on for this, calling him names, besmirching his manhood. None of them would have dared to have said the things they had until Big Jon showed up.

"Fuck. Fuck. Fuck. What am I going to tell Big Jon?"

Big Jon had ordered Rob to torch Strasserman's house. The fucking lunatic and his wounded ego wanted to teach Bill a lesson for something that had happened over two years ago.

And it was all a setup to further humiliate Rob.

If he didn't burn down Bill's house, he'd become a social pariah. His fellow bullies would say that he had no heart. They'd treat him like shit. Ingerman would say that he had no loyalty, and no balls. He'd give Bolstrum a beating. One that would leave bruises and would hurt for days.

If Rob had actually done as he was told, the cops would find out right away who did it, and Rob would go to prison for ten years. He'd be branded as an arsonist for life. Not that he cared, but he'd be a felon once he got out. He wouldn't be able to vote. He wouldn't be able to hold down most jobs. He'd be relegated to a life at the Shermer Fields Trailer Park.

If Rob snitched on Big Jon and said that it was all his idea, Ingerman's fucking rich daddy would throw money at everyone until the problem went away. They'd make it look like it was the scary looking 6'4 poor kid.

That's why Rob had no respect for Big Jon. Big Jon was loaded. There were no consequences for anything he did. Any problems could be solved with money. Meanwhile, people like Rob had to carefully consider every decision they made, tactfully deciding who to steal from and whatnot.

Even more offensive to Rob was how Jon didn't have to be this way. He didn't have to be a bully. He easily could have been another rich pretty boy, busy peeling off bikinis by the poolside. He was a handsome guy. He could get any girl he wanted. But no. He'd rather sexually assault developing underclass girls just because he enjoys seeing them shudder in revulsion. He'd rather terrify kids weaker than him versus playing football or rugby with guys his own size because he enjoys seeing the fear he instills in little weak nerds like Bill.

Rob shook his head, partly to fan away the torrents of rainwater continuing to soak the hair on top of his red topped noggin, partly out of disgust with his "boss".

The thing is, Rob knew he was an asshole. He couldnt deny that he took pleasure in being one, but he had a code. He was mostly an asshole because he had to be. Rob had to intimidate and steal and do petty crime because he was poor. He sure as hell didn't live in a mansion like Big Jon.

He was like the guy Jean Valjean in that faggoty play. What was it? Les Miserables?

Or better yet, Scarface. Yeah. Rob liked to think that he was like Tony Montana, building an empire from the ground up.

Plus he needed to take care of his deadbeat alcoholic of a mom. He hated her, but someone had to do it.

Rob wondered sometimes if he was even cut out for this thug life at all. Maybe he'd be happier doing something else.

Rounding a corner, he saw an adult Doberman Pinscher aimlessly wandering around the street, seemingly without an owner.

"Hey Pooch!" yelled Bolstrum through the cold rain. His rough, gravelly voice may have sounded terrifying to most people, but while Rob hated people, he absolutely loved animals, and animals seemed to love him. The dog's ears perked up, and he padded over to Rob, wading through the torrent of rainwater. The dog's face looked friendly and affable, so Rob bent over and began to rub his wet fur.

"You lost, big guy?"

The dog, naturally, didn't answer. Yet, he seemed to appreciate the question and began wagging his tongue.

"No collar. No leash. You just another discarded piece of trash like me, huh? Aren't you, boy?" chuckled Rob a little bit as he tickled behind the friendly canine's ears.

Rob didn't notice the orange glow erupting from his jean pocket.

"I wish you were my dog. I'd take such good care of you and love you and..."

There was a flash of orange light as...

Option 1: Rob finds himself back in his trailer home, his mother passed out on the couch watching TV. The Doberman is standing right next to him, wagging his tail as he waits to be fed.

Option 2: Rob blinks as he notices a collar and tag that clearly had "If lost return to 444 Shermer Fields Trailer Court, Shermer Illinois" printed on it form around the Doberman's neck. That was Rob's address!! He was the dog's owner now!

Rob was busy shaking the inactive, jasper wishing rock, trying not to be weirded out by the strange and foreign jiggling his new body way doing. And as much as it felt alien, it almost felt...good? But Rob pushed that feeling asdie and started shaking the rock in his tiny hands even harder as if it would solve his problem. So focused we he on getting the stone to somehow cave to physical intimidation he never heard the heavy front door behind him swing open or the sound of two large feet stepping out onto the front porch. In fact, it was the dog, the stupid dog he had felt sorry for and had gotten him into this mess, giving a uncertain whine that made Rob look up. If he'd looked into a mirror, he'd see a pretty, round face making an almost comically furious face with squinted green eyes and bared teeth.

However, when Rob followed the dog's gaze towards the door, his angry expression turned to surprise as he let loose a small gasp. There, staring at him with dark brown eyes that made him feel small and insignificant, was the bearded face of Ragnar Ingerman, Jonathan Ingerman's father and the richest man in Shermer, if not most of northern Illinois. There was a look of confused disapproval on the man's face as he stood there in little more than a pair of underwear and a t-shirt. Much like his son, Ragnar was tall and bulky, most of that bulk being powerful muscles.

Even in his old body, Rob had felt physically intimidated the few times he had met Big Jon's old man. And now? Now a shiver of fear shot through Rob's much smaller body.

"Ahmbur? What is wrong? Why are you out here? Get inside, now!" Ragnar's accent was heavy and his voice was like the thundering report of an artillery cannon. The businessman flung the heavy oak door open and pointed a finger towards the dark but clearly well furnished house.

Rob, however, was simply paralyzed by fear. 'OhgoditsIngercunt'sdadohgodhe'ssotallwhyishealmostnakedshitwhattheF UCKISGOINGON!?' Rob's mind turned to slush in the face of his nemesis's father, whose own face turned frighteningly dark and ominous as Rob failed to move.

"INSIDE, NOW!" Ragnar's voiced rumbled again and he took a threatening step forward and Rob could swear he felt the boards on the porch shake. The Doberman whimpered as it lowered to the floor in submission by the sheer willpower the titanic businessman exuded.

'Just do it. He'll get mad if you don't!' Came a voice inside of Rob's blonde head, a voice that was certainly not his own. 'Do or he'll-'

Whatever the voice was going to say next, it was cut off as Ragnar moved with incredible swiftness, grabbed Rob by his skinny arm to which the dog let loose a scared yelp to match Rob's womanly squeal, and effortlessly lifted Rob up as if he weighed nothing at all. The former bully tried not to cry out as he hung from Ragnar's iron grip an inch off of the porch's surface, or the painful pressure that was slowly crushing his forearm. In his free hand, Rob held the magical gemstone tight and silently tried to make a wish.

'I wish I was back home!' He yelled into his head, but there was nothing that could save him.

"Vhen I tell you to do something, you WILL DO IT!" Ragnar growled into Rob's face, and Rob could smell the breath of a man who smoked far too much and hadn't brushed his teeth yet. Rob clenched his eyes closed as turned his face away as he said the only thing he could think of. something he'd never started saying to ANYONE except his mother until the Ingermans had moved to town.

"I'm sorry!" Rob cried out in his new voice, and suddenly he felt the pressure leave his arm as he dropped back onto his tiny feet.

"Just geet inside" Ragnar growled, pointing his finger once again towards the dark interior of the house, and Rob quickly obeyed, shuffling his feet forward over the threshold of the doorway, his barefeet plodding silently across the hardwood floor as he rubbed his wrist where Ragnar had been holding it. It hurt. A LOT.

Behind him, Ragnar simply whistled, and the Doberman came scampering in behind, claws clacking against the wood floor of the house as it darted up the stairs as Ragnar cast a suspicious look up and down the drenched street before slamming the heavy door shut. Rob watched the clearly terrified dog scamper up the stairs and stop at the landing, locking eyes that looked almost as if they were pleading with Rob to follow as Rob took a few more uncertain steps into the dark and clearly massive house. He felt compelled to follow the dog and reached out to grab the banister when he heard the elder Ingerman's voice behind him.

"Ahmbur, wait."

Rob froze again. Ahmbur? Who was...Did he mean Amber?

'Yes...' The strange voice that was not his own said in his head.

'But the only Amber I know is...Oh shit! Am I Amber Reid!?' Rob's mental voice cried out in shock, 'But-' He didn't have time to finish his train of thought as he felt an enormous hand spin him around to face Ragnar's barreled chest.

"Ahmbur, I am...sorry. But I pay guut money for this. For you. I buy this house, car, I buy your clothes, I buy your dog. I even give you money for drugs! All you heff to do is look preety and keep to yourself. What would heppen if a neighbor saw you? What if they saw me? Then Tara would find out. Then all this, POOF! Gone. And you be back in Shermer Field. Back in the dump. Is that what you want?"

Rob struggled to make sense of everything Ragnar was saying. Tara clearly referred to Jonathan's stepmom, some trophy wife, but everything else? Amber had always shyed away from the subject the few times Rob had asked if she'd been in a relationship with anymore, or where she got the money for the drugs and he car when she never appeared to actually have a job.

"Oh, just from here and there" Amber would say and then quickly change the subject. Being a petty criminal himself, Rob knew about discretion and had never pressed the issue. But..Was Amber really Ragnar's mistress? Was HE now Ragnar's mistress? Rob clenched his hand tighter around the gemstone and made another wish to escape, though predictably nothing happened.

"Well? Do you want to lose all this or not Ahmbur?" Ragnar's voice took on another threatening growl.

'He can make people disappear. You know he can' The little voice said, and Rob had to agree with it, whatever it was. If Ragnar could buy off the Shermer police every time Jonathan got caught in something, there was no telling what he could do to someone that threatened his privacy.

"N-no. I'm s-sorry. I just, I just got mad because the dog wasn't going to the bathroom! I didn't want him to...to piss all over this wonderful house!" Rob did his best to imitate Amber's voice, and it seemed to work as Ragnar's face lightened and his tone turned from threatening to almost friendly. A enormous hand cupped Rob's small womanly chin and lifted it up to brown eyes that twinkled with false warmth.

"Neext time, use the backdoor. That is why I had the ence built okay?" Ragnar then bent down and planted a heavy, disgusting kiss onto Rob's new lips, and the former bully tried his best to play along and return the kiss as convincingly as he could before finally the giant released him, a mostly gentle pat on the chick that still managed to sting ever so slightly. The mostly undressed business man wandered past Rob, down the hallway and flicking on a light to what was revealed as a bathroom. The door swung closed as Rob heard Ragnar mutter something in...whatever was his native language, followed soon by the steady sound of piss streaming into a toilet bowel.

With his freedom, at least for the moment, secured, Rob tried not to let his bare legs shake as he rushed upstairs and darted into the first open door he saw, a free hand smacking blindly into the barely lit room until he felt a lightswitch. Flicking it on and rushing across the massive room that was filled with a huge sized bed, a dresser, a doorway to ANOTHER bathroom and a giant TV mounted on the wall, Rob got his first look at his new (and hopefully borrowed) face.

He was Amber Reid, alright. Her pretty face, the curly hair that was currently cut in a more womanly 'punk rock' look. Big green eyes that were shimmering with tears. clothes hanging off supple breasts and bare legs clothed only by a pair of black panties he was just now noticing. Rob looked at himself in the mirror and then down at his closed fist, opening the fingers to show the jasper gemstone laying lifelessly in his hands.

"What did you do to me?" Rob said softly, "Why am I here? Why Amber? Why...him?" Rob felt something...raw in his chest as he thought about what the only person in his life he could actually call friend was going through. It was anger, but a different kind of anger. Indignation? Whatever it was, it burned in his chest as he thought about all the times he'd seen Amber suddenly look sad or go running off into the woods whenever she'd hear Big Jon nearby.

"Damnit, I just wish I knew what was going on!" Rob cried out, his fingers curling around the gemstone again and blotting out the small glimmer of orange light that shone from it. He slammed his fist against the top of the long dresser and a hot, salty tear rolled down his soft cheek as...

Option 1: The Stone itself speaks to Rob, revealing it's purpose and why Rob is where he is.

Option 2: Rob Bolstrum doesn't exist anymore. He wanted to BE the dog's owner, so he became her, body and soul!
1141221121123132231131.title: The Gilded Cage

11412211211231322311311.content:
The world froze around Rob as orange light burst from his fist, causing him to shriek in surprise as he stumbled backwards, the stone falling free from his hand as he tripped backwards and landed on the edge of the enormous king sized bed. He cast a green-eyed look at the Doberman in the corner of the room, frozen in mid-startled leap as it's black and red fur was simply one giant coat of orange. It took the reduced former bully a moment to realize what was happening and when he did, his face lit up and he spread his arms wide, ready for a change, to get out of Amber's body and back into his own familiar one.

But that never happened.

Instead, the orange glow enveloped the entire room and the magical jasper never fell to the surface of the dresser, instead floating in mid air where Rob has released his grip on it as it glowed like a miniature sun. After a moment of disappointed waiting Rob frowned and stood from the bed, carefully making his way back over to the Stone and reaching out a single, slender finger to poke it, but that was when a translucent orange hand appeared out of nowhere and pulled his borrowed forearm down, causing Rob the jerk backwards in surprise as his new eyes focused on a strange humanoid form coalescing from the light that had swallowed the world. A form that looked exceedingly familiar.

"A-amber?" Rob croaked as he watched the ghostly form of his friend looked around the room, sighed, and lifted itself up onto the dresser where it sat with the same killer legs that Rob was currently using.

"Hello, Rob" The specter said in the same voice that had been in Rob's head a few minutes ago, trying to warn him away from angering Ragnar, "So I guess this is the part where I give you an explanation for, well, everything that's happening right now. It's a good thing you wished for that, because it was going to be, like, really hard to keep helping you out otherwise"

"Helping me?" said Rob as he cautiously edged towards the ghost of his friend, currently standing apart from the rest of the unending wave of light that filled the room by a shimmering outline of bright pink, "Wait, is this light everywhere? Shit, Ingercunt Senior is gonna see it! Quick, hide!" Rob waved his, or rather, Amber's hands towards the floating stone as his eyes locked on the open bedroom door where the light had penetrated the rest of the massive house. But the ghost calling itself Amber simply let loose a tired giggle and waved her hand dismissively at Rob.

"Don't worry, time is stopped right now. He can't see, hear or move until all this" Amber gestured to herself and then all around the room, "So, much as I would like to stare at myself, can I tell you what's up? Quicker you get the 4-1-1 quicker we can try fixing all this"

Rob stared at Amber's incorporeal form, the floating wish rock and then down at himself, in that order before nodding slowly. This was SO weird! Like he would have rather taken the weirdness at Shitterman's house than deal with this! Rob made his way to the side of the bed and sat down, trying not to get turned on by the feeling of his newly smooth legs rubbing against each other. The ghost in front of him conjured what looked like a pink cigarette and took a drag of it before facing Rob.

"God, this is fucked up. I'm literally looking at myself even though I know it's you in there Robby"

"I'm not too thrilled about this either, Amber. Why is this happening? Why are you shacked up with Ingerman's dad?" Rob watched as his friend's magically formed face fell for a moment, a look of sadness as the real Amber's face was animated by the shimmering outline of pink on orange. Then finally she spoke.

"Rob, you remember what we talked about a couple of years ago? When you got held back and I graduated? I was scared, didn't know what to do. Wanted to get out of the trailer park but there was no way I'd ever have the money to do anymore than just...exist. And that's when you said 'we do what we have to, to get where we need to go'. And that was the craziest thing you'd ever said but it stuck with me. That's how I got out. This is how I got out. I fucked the biggest fish I could find and I got out of a life of having nothing, of being nothing. But Ragnar isn't like he was. He's getting meaner every time he swings by. My chance to get out safe was a long time ago. But maybe..." Amber lifted her incorporeal body off the dresser and crossed the bedroom, her feet leaving no indentations in the thick carpet until she was standing next to Rob. She lifted a orange and pink finger and touched Rob's forehead, which felt like a gentle vibration.

"Maybe if there's two of us working together, with this Stone, you can save me. And then the Stone will let you go back to your body."

Rob stared into Amber's otherwordly pink eyes for a moment before he brought up his hand to swipe her's away, rolling his eyes and not noticing how his slender, soft hand simply caused hers to break apart in a cloud of wispy pink tendrils before reforming as she pulled the limb away. "Yeah, because I'm some kind of a fucking hero. We both know what I am, chica. I beat up people, hell, I HURT a girl like an hour ago to get what I wanted, and that ended up causing all of this fucking mess!" Rob stood and moved away from his ghostly friend as the light from the Juu'Stas Stone flicked and dimmed.

"Rob, if you don't do this you'll never-"

"Never what? Go back to my old body? Get stuck sucking off Ingercunt's old man for the rest of my life? No, that isn't going to happen. I won't be stuck like this, but I'm not going to play whatever stupid as shit game you or that rock has planned. I'll get us out of this Amber, but I'm going to do it my fucking way"

The light from the Stone dimmed even further as Amber's body began break apart as she looked at Rob with an expression that he couldn't read, the pink shimmering outline of her body twisting and turning in on itself as it was drawn back towards the Juu'Stas Stone.

"I'll be riding shotgun with you Rob. I can talk whenever you hold the Stone. But I really hope you know what you're doing..." Amber's voice trailed off as the last of the outline entered the Stone, and with a small flash the orange tint that had covered the world faded away. The Stone clacked to the surface of the dresser, the Doberman, Taco, finished it's terrified leap backwards, and Rob simply cast a long, hard glare at the orange gemstone that he'd been given. Or possibly cursed with.

'So what's your plan?' Came the little voice in his head that Rob now knew was Amber.

He walked over and grabbed the Stone with a small hand, feeling the burning warmth from all the magic energy it had just expended and fought the urge to simply smash it for what it had done. Instead Rob looked in the mirror at his borrowed face as it twisted into a determined grimace.
11412211211231322311311.title: The Juu'Stas Stone

11412211212.content:
Confused, exhausted, indignant, and cripplingly frightened by what this new reality had brought about, Gloria made the only move that she thought made sense in the moment.

“I wish that we were all younger again, so suck on it Tom!”

“Gloria, you idiot!” screeched Tammy as the stone exploded like a supernova of green luminescence, blowing back Gloria's blackish-gray hair in gust of supernatural wind.

Bill, panicking, noticed that reality itself was melting, shimmering, becoming vague. It reminded him a bit of Inception when the city in Ellen Page's dream started collapsing into an M.C Escher puzzle, but he didn't have a chance to notice any specific impressions he could make out before the Ahn'Ger Stone's magic had finished its course. The light faded away as quickly as it had erupted.

It only took a moment for Bill to realize that he was now standing in a living room far removed from his own, let alone the guest room he had just been in a brief second ago.

The room was rectangular, with a shaggy tan rug covering the entirety of the floor and white walls making up the rest of the area. A comfortable looking black couch sat across from a large screen television, with a rather nice looking rectangular coffee table in between the two. Bill walked up to the coffee table, and he noticed that a board game was sitting on top of it.

Settlers of Catan! That was Bill's favorite board game, and it looked like the game was already in progress.

Turning around, he saw two little girls, wandering around confused. One looked a lot like Gloria might have looked as a toddler, no older than two, three at the most. She was wearing a pink t-shirt for babies, and a diaper could be visibly seen poking out from underneath it. Her hair was in pigtails, and she was holding something in her right hand, but Bill couldn't make it out. Her eyes were darting around the room, frightened.

The other girl had curly blonde hair and was dressed in a shirt with The Flintstones on it and some black pants. She seemed more curious than the other girl was.

“Gworia?” asked Bill in a childish voice no older than two. He slapped his mouth and slowly looked down at himself. It was then when he looked down and noticed that he had transformed into a toddler too! He was wearing a black t-shirt with some cartoon character on it and he apparently was still in diapers as well.

“Oh nooh!” he said in surprised agitation.

Where was he?! What was this place?!

He climbed on top of the couch and looked outside of a partially open window. Outside, Bill noticed that he wasn't in his hometown anymore. The first clue was that the traffic of both the automobile and pedestrian kind was a lot busier than Shermer, Illinois ever was. The second was that the buildings were a lot bigger and differently designed. The third were the palm trees. It was also a lot warmer than Illinois ever got. He crawled further on top of the windowsill and looked outside. In the distance he saw rolling hills.

“Billy, sweetie, get down from there!” said a familiar voice.

Bill turned around and saw Willow, his daughter from the future, frantically running across the strange living area and pick him up by the waist. She carefully placed him back on the floor and bent down to look at him face to face. She gently stroked his hair. She looked worried.

“Billy, how many times do I have to tell you!? No climbing on the windowsill. I'm sorry, Billy. I know how curious you are, but you're still only two years old, and your coordination isn't good enough to go on any adventures yet. Someday though ” she said, winking at him.

It slowly dawned on him. That damn stone had changed reality again, and judging by what was going on, Bill would guess that it had turned Willow into his mother and himself into her son! Bill couldn't believe it. It was mind blowing enough to know that he'd have a daughter in the future, but now he was back in diapers, and Willow was the one pulling them up. He was scared as he thought about the seemingly unlimited power and capriciousness of that stone, now wondering deeply how it came to land on his porch in the first place. More importantly, what had happened to his real mom and dad? The fear showed in Bill's eyes, which Willow took to mean that he was upset.

“Oh, honey, I'm sorry” said Willow in a very maternal voice. “I know! How about we all go out for ice cream later after Mommy is done working?”

Just to keep up appearances, Bill nodded fervently.

Option 1: In this new reality, Willow is the daughter of Kimberly Strasserman. When Willow moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in animation and ended up pregnant with triplets after a one night stand, Kimberly soon followed her to pursue her own interests, trying to restart her life in middle age. She and Willow currently live together in a decent apartment. Grandma Kimmy stops by after one of her classes to watch Bill, Tammy, and Gloria while Willow is working.

Option 2: The story briefly switches to Willow's point of view of a harried, ambitious young single mother as she simultaneously works on a project from home while also keeping an eye on the gang's attempts to figure out a way to activate the stone again.
11412211212.title: Becoming Willow's Kids.

114122112121.content:
At that exact moment, the door to the apartment opened. As Kimberly turned and smiled at the person who was entering, Bill turned his own smaller head to see what who was entering. And he audibly gasped as he saw who it was.

It was Bill's younger sister, Kimberly! It was unmistakably her! Well, Bill's former younger sister Kimberly. Now, Kimberly was apparently much older, right around the age that Bill and Tammy had been seemingly moments ago, but it's already felt like a lifetime since that happened to Bill. Kimberly had a worn but warm face, slight grey hairs in her head, and was wearing a decent looking polka-dot dress. But this older woman, Bill could easily recognize the spunky, energetic, and slightly annoying but still lovable girl he grew up with.

"Hey mom!" Willow said, as she approached Kimberly, Bill still in hand. Behind her, Tammy and Gloria looked on. Gloria held back tears, trying to not draw attention to her childish form, but in her head knowing that she screwed the pooch this time. And Tammy continued to look around curiously, perhaps trying to figure out his she liked this reality as much as the one she just left.

"Hello, sweetheart. How has your day been going?" Kimberly said.

"Well, it was going pretty good, until little Billy here tried to escape out the window again." Willow said, bouncing Bill up and down.

"Oh, you little rascal you! You have so much of your grandfather in you, I just wish you could have got to meet him..." Kimberly said, the sound of loss emanating in her voice.

"I know. I wish the kids could have met him too. But Little Billy here will get to carry on his legacy!" Willow said. "Mom, how were your classes today?" Willow was trying desperately to change the subject, hoping to cheer her mother up. Her mother loved the fact that she was able to go back to school at her age to make up for the lack of a college education, having become a mother early in life and a homemaker for the rest of it. What made it great was that when Willow wasn't at work, Kimberly could simply pop on a VR headset and been in class without acting having to leave the house.

"Oh, they were fine. You think you know everything about the history you grew up in, and suddenly your class goes over all the weird stuff that happened that 2021 and you suddenly realize how much you don't know."

"Well, you'll have to tell me more!" Willow responded.

"Later, sweetheart. Listen, I'm here now to watch the kids. Go do your work!" Kimberly laughed.

"Oh, mom, you don't have to..."

"Nonsense! That's what Grandmothers are for! You have your animation dreams to accomplish! Go! Work!" Kimberly said, taking Bill from Willow's arms.

Bill was so utterly lost here. And he had to figure out something soon, or else he'd be growing up again.


Option 1: Bill attempts to convince Kimberly that he is her brother. Meanwhile, Gloria can't stop thinking about why she keeps screwing up, and Tammy can't stop thinking about why she hated being Tom.

Option 2: Bill's thoughts about the stone are distracted as he messes his diaper. Willow and Kimberly work together to change him as Bill finds out more about the current reality.

Option 3: Bill suddenly realizes that he, Gloria and Tammy are siblings. And that they look eerily similar to a certain bully from Shermer Illinois...
114122112121.title: Kimberly the Grandmother

114122112122.content:
"Alright, Billy, Let's put you and your sisters in your play area, so Mommy can do a little work, OK? Then we'll have some nice ice cream later when Mommy's done." Willow said, First placing Bill into a guarded off room. This was soon followed by Tammy, and then Gloria, but when Willow picked up Gloria, she noticed Gloria was holding onto something.

"Gloria what do you have here?" Willow said, as she took a look at the mysterious green stone. "Where did a silly little girl like you get this? This isn't one of mine... is it? I haven't dated anyone long enough recently to earn something as nice as this...." Willow trailed off, as she got lost in the stone's beautiful shine.

Only to be brought back to reality by the tears of the daughter she held in her arms.

"Oh, I know you don't want this pretty thing taken away, but Mommy doesn't want little Gloria to get into trouble with this thing."

From the other room, Bill heard this. He rolled his little baby eyes. This was trouble enough already. Maybe it was a good thing that Gloria had it taken away... but now it meant that someone who had no clue of its power had it in her hands... but hopefully Willow wasn't the angry type.

Soon, Willow placed Gloria in the play room with the other kids.

"Now, please be good for Mommy. I have to finish up this project for Mr. McGavin so that Mommy can pay the rent! So please! I know you probably don't understand a word I say, but please, let Mommy have work time."

With that, Willow walked off and sighed. Trying to live her dream without Greg there to help out with the kids was rough. Getting her first true assignment, animating for a show called "Pirate Pete's Perilous Plight" and getting to work at home for it was lucky enough. Willow still worked hard during the day to pay the bills and hard at night to keep her kids happy... but soon it would all be worth it.

Willow sat at her desk, and fiddled with the stone in her hand.

"You know... I'm already getting some new ideas from this stone... I may have to have a storyboard session soon..."

Option 1: Mr. McGavin calls Willow and informs her that funding was pulled from the show. Angry and upset, Willow makes a wish.

Option 2: Willow tries her best to work, but discovers that Bill made his way out of the play area. Frustrated, Willow loses her temper and makes a wish.

Option 3: Frustrated at her lack of progress, Willow makes an angry wish towards herself.
114122112122.title: Playpenned

11412211213.content:
In Gloria's state of panic over being old and potentially trapped in the future, she made the wish to be young once more. But instead of transporting the group back to the year of 2018. the AHn'Ger Stone (which no one seemed to fully understand other than it seemed to work only when the individual using it was angry) instead granted Gloria's wish in a different way.

Option 1: Bill, Tammy and Gloria become young again...But still in the year 2058! Bill is now living with his aunt Willow, who is now Tammy's mom! And Gloria is...Oh no!

Option 2: The Stone interprets Gloria's wish differently and makes the three of them young at heart, if not in body. Now considered 'emotionally immature' the three middle-aged teens find themselves in drastically different lives!
11412211213.title: To Be Young Again (Options)

11412212.content:
"I just got my mutant powers!" Willow exclaimed.

Bill blinked a couple of times, shocked at the word mutant being expressed so... casually, as if he were stuck in an X-Men comic. Except, no, this was his reality now. He was an adult man in the future with a mutant daughter, married to his best friend. This was real.

Flashes of the past now briefly entered Bill's mind. Mysteriously, in the past couple of years, many young men and women in their 20s have been discovering that they have certain powers that would have been unbelievable even 10 years ago. Cable News these days was basically full of conspiracy theories about how these mutants came to be. Some speculate it was a failed nuclear experiment, others claim it was an intentional act of the American Government, hoping to create an army in case their treaties with Mars fall through... god, there was life on Mars? Other just exclaim it's the next step in human evolution. And some even claim that they have internal documents that it was a test using magical gemstones that caused these powers to appear. Bill would have normally brushed this off... and yet here he was.

Still, Bill saw how excited Willow... his daughter... was about all of this. And so he felt he should at least act the part of proud papa, at least until her could figure out a way to fix all this.

"That's amazing sweetie! I'm so happy you don't see this as a burden. If you don't mind me asking... what's your power?" Bill asked.

Willow smirked and replied...
11412212.title: Mutant, and Proud

114122121.content:
“I'm a shapeshifter, Dad! Watch!”

Willow closed her eyes and concentrated. Her body blurred for a moment, and before he knew it, standing in her place was Marilyn Monroe.

“Like it!?” asked Willow, sounding identical to Marilyn.

Bill's mouth dropped. He had read countless comics and had seen all of the X-Men movies. He loved Jennifer Lawrence as Mystique...but this...this was something else.

“I'm in shock”

Willow laughed in Marilyn's bubbly blonde voice. Her body morphed again, this time back to her original body.

“I can barely believe it either. It's kind of embarrassing how I found out. I was posing in the mirror yesterday morning, dressed up as Supergirl. Marcia and I like to roleplay. But when I put my hands on my hips, my hair started turning blonde and my body changed. It started getting a lot curvier and my boobs grew out, and suddenly I was Kara Zor-El! And no, before you ask Dad, sadly I didn't have her powers. I guess only being a mutant can only take you so far, but this is so cool!”

Bill looked around. Tammy looked surprised and concerned by all this, while Gloria just looked annoyed.

“So were you the Melissa Benoist Supergirl or the Helen Slater Supegirl?” asked Bill.

“Haha, none of the above. I was the Ellen MacDougal Supergirl” said Willow, referencing an actress from the 2050s who played the character recently.

“Ah” bluffed Bill. “Good choice. So I take it you haven't told anyone yet?”

“Nope! Just Marcia, you, Mom, and Mrs. Vanapoulos. You know I can't really come out about it, not in this political environment, but hey, at least I have a cool party trick now!”


Option 1: Bill, Tammy, and Gloria continue to get to know Willow and ask her to try out her powers a couple of times. In the meantime, Willow notices the Ahn'Ger stone in Gloria's hand and asks to see it.

Option 2: Something else.
114122121.title: "I'm a Shapeshifter, Dad!"

choices: Gloria chooses to give up the stone
Gloria refuses to give up the stone and is Tricked.
1141221211.content:
"That's truly something, sweetheart! Can you change into whatever or what?" Bill said.

"Well, not anything, Dad... there are rules. I have to be something living... It can be fictional. So if I want to be Gregandra the Ogre from the Outrealm series..." Willow started.

She shimmered again, and when she returned, she was now a hulking, drooling, green skinned orge, with two tusks coming out of her mouth, a wide nose, slick black hair, a tiger skinned outfit that barely covered her now wartly breasts.

"I can. Just have to think it." Willow said, now in a deep but still distinctly feminine register.

"Eww... Gross." Gloria said at the sight of this fat ogre that Willow had become.

"Sorry Mrs. Vanapolis." Willow said, as she shimmered back to her base form. "I know you're not a fantasy type of mom. Hey, I can gender swap too? Any childhood crushes I can make real for you?" Willow said with a grin.

Gloria was so taken aback by all of this nonsense... she honestly didn't know what they hell to do. So Gloria just blurted out. "Captain America..."

"You got it!" Willow said, and soon shimmered into the form of Chris Evans, bearded, in his Cap costume from Infinity War.

"I'm with you to the end of the line, Mrs. Vanopolis." Willow said in the sweet voice of Chris Evans.

"Oh my god...." Gloria said, weak at the knees.

"Wllow, darling. I think you might want to change back before Gloria pounces all over you." Tammy laughed.

"Perhaps." Willow said, quickly shimmering back to form. Gloria was still going crazy, still feeling insane from everything that was happening.

"This is a lovely power, Willow dear. And you seem to be having lots of fun with it, so I'm happy for you." Tammy said, still loving the new life she had, her life as Tom feeling like a distant memory every minute.

"Thanks mom. Say, remember how I always wanted a dog as a kid?" Willow said, another shimmer on its way. This time, in Willow's place was a Bloodhound, panting, large ears drooping.

"WOOF!" Willow barked. Tammy couldn't help but to laugh.

"My, such a good girl, Willow!" Tammy laughed, as she scratched Willow's new ear. Bill look on, still in a bit of shock. Willow... his daughter had run quite the gambit of transformations just now. Heck, maybe she could even be Gambit! He wondered if they did ever make that Gambit movie they announced like 20 times in his youth. Anyways, every moment he existed as a father seemed to get more and more insane.

Suddenly, the Willow Bloodhound seemingly caught a scent. Willow sniffed around towards Gloria, and shimmed back to her human form.

"What's that in your hand, Mrs. Vanopolis?" Willow said, curiously.

Gloria snapped out of her trance of insanity to look at Willow. "Oh... just a stone."

"Can I see it?" Willow asked.


Option 1: Gloria, still in shock from everything, simply gives the stone to Willow.

Option 2: Gloria, knowing the power of the stone, refuses to give up the stone. Willow uses her powers of shifting to trick Gloria into giving her more info about it.
1141221211.title: The Rules of Shifting

114122122.content:
“I'm a telepath, Dad! I can read and control people's minds. That's one of the best powers! If anyone tries to harass me over it, I can just shut down their body and make them a drooling vegetable. Not that I would ever do something as terrible as that...yet” she giggled.

Inside, Bill's mind was reeling. As a proud geek, he was all into the idea of magic gemstones and the X-Men and alien life existing. Now that it actually was real...all of it, he was in shock. That was the word. Shock. He didn't know how to take this at all, especially now that he had a daughter who could read his mind. He tried his best to shield his thoughts.

“Well, I guess now you have to start playing the lottery and help us win millions of dollars.”

Willow laughed.

“Or at least become one of those crystal ball psychics if the animation stuff falls through. Just remember that with great power comes great responsibility. Don't embarrass your folks and turn into Kilgrave.”

“Who's Kilgrave?”

“Oh...he's a guy...he's a comic book character. The Purple Man” sighed Bill. “He's a villain. Can control people's thoughts too, but he uses it to rape and terrorize.”

“Oh! From that old TV show Jessica Jones. Yeah, right. No Dad, you and Mom and Mrs. V are all safe with me! I won't abuse it around you three, I promise! I love and trust you all implicitly. That's why you three are the first to know! I haven't told anyone yet. Not even Marcia knows what I am.”

“Who's Marcia?” asked Bill, immediately regretting asking that. He knew that he just slipped up.

To her credit, Willow just laughed it off. “You know who Marcia is! My fiance, silly! Your future daughter-in-law. It's not like you haven't met her a million times!”

It was then when Bill first noticed Willow's engagement ring on her ring finger.

Option 1: Bill continues to bluff at being Willow's father as she explains how she discovered her telepathic powers. Tammy does the same, bluffing at being her mother. However, Willow's powers eventually picks up on Gloria's thoughts and finds out about the Ahn'Ger stone and everything that happened this morning to them. Willow freaks out.

Option 2: The same scenario happens, with Willow discovering that Bill and Tammy are really just teenagers from 2018 named Tom and Bill, as is Gloria. She is hurt and weirded out that her parents aren't really her parents...but is oddly accepting of the situation.
114122122.title: "I'm a Telepath, Dad!"

11412213.content:
“Mom, Dad...I've got great news, and I just HAD to tell both of you in person!” she said excitedly.

Bill's mind melted as this woman who claimed to be (and indeed was, as Bill's brain began to fill with memories of being a dad) his daughter standing before the three accidental time travelers. He wasn't anywhere near emotionally ready to be a parent, and yet, here his daughter was, bursting with energy and gusto. He heard her speak, saw her mouth moving a mile a second, but the entire time Bill was lost in thought at this strange new reality. Suddenly he saw Willow childishly snapping her fingers in his face.

“Dad! Didn't you hear a word I said!?” giggled Willow. “I..."

Option 1: "I'm getting married!" Willow announces, much to the shock of Bill and Tammy. Turns out Willow has found the love of her life while working on her new show! She wants to introduce her mom and dad to her fiancee, who looks oddly familiar...

Option 2: "I'm pregnant!" Willow announces joyfully, much to the surprise of Bill and Tammy. Willow goes on to talk about how excited she is be a mom, but when pressed about the identity of 'the father', Willow...
11412213.title: Willow's Big News (Options)

114122131.content:
“Dad! Didn't you hear a word I said!?” giggled Willow. “I'm getting married!".

The dad part of Bill's mind instantly went on the defensive as the thought of his daughter, his precious little girl, getting seduced by some stranger! He never should have let her go to that school out in California, never given in to her pleas! She was just a kid she didn't know any better! And Tammy had encouraged it! When he found out who it was, he'd-

The more rational part of Bill's mind however, the teenage part, was able to keep himself from doing anything more than uttering a shocked "What?" to the daughter he'd just met. Meanwhile Tammy issued a sharp gasp from next to him and with a quick look to his best friend turned happily married wife, it was clear that Tammy had no real idea of how to react to this sudden, huge bit of news either.

Meanwhile, Gloria simply raised a thin eyebrow in surprise, but she was more annoyed than anything else. This had totally NOT been what she had intended with her wish to make Bill and Tom into an old married couple! They were happily married, with a nice house, a daughter who was clearly successful but apparently prone to dropping surprises on her parents. Gloria had wanted the two of them to be miserable! And SHE was not supposed to be this old hag! Gloria had always planned on becoming a model! Now she was in some hideous business suit and looked like a clone of her own mother! But despite the horror of her new body and the annoyance that her wish to make Bill and Tom miserable had failed, there simply wasn't enough anger to re-activate the magical gemstone that Gloria still had in her hand, or grant any of the numerous wishes to be young again, to go home, to make Bill and Tom miserable that she was making in her hand and under her breath. Maybe if she...

But Gloria's scheming was interrupted as Willow spoke again.

"Okay mom, dad, I know this is a lot to take in but I want you to meet them, okay? They've made my life out west so happy, I never would have made it as a storyboard artist or gotten my new show without them!" Willow quickly walked out of the house and down to stone stairs to the sidewalk, where a wall of tall hedges blocked Bill, Tammy and Gloria's view of the stranger that was coming out from behind them.

Option 1: It was a woman! Bill and Tammy share a look of surprise as Willow led, hand in hand, a gorgeous, curvy red-headed woman up to the house. "Mom, dad, this is Roberta! Roberta Bolstrum!"

Option 2: It was a man! Bill and Tammy share a look of surprise as Willow led, hand in hand a tall, red headed and musclebound man up the stairs to the house. "Mom, dad, this is Robert! Robert Bolstrum!"
114122131.title: Meeting Willow's Fiancee

choices: Tammy takes Willow and Bobbi inside, leaving Bill and Gloria alone on the porch.
The Stone suddenly flares back to life in Gloria's hand!
1141221311.content:
Bill could only stare wide-eyed in shock as he watched Willow, his daughter, bounce down the stairs in a red dress he never remembered her having and stop at the bottom of the concrete steps that led up to the house he and his family apparently lived in. He felt Tammy grab his dangling hand and he cast a sideways glance to his best friend turned wife who seemed to share his feelings of utter shock and surprise.

Gloria, on the other hand, simply stood off to the side of the large porch of the new Strasserman household and watched with mild interest as Willow quietly spoke with someone, her apparent fiancee, who was hiding behind the wall of trimmed hedges that blocked the house from the road. She felt the cold gemstone in her hand and she stared down at it for a moment in her hands, stretching out her wrinkling palm and once again being horrified at the how old she was now. And how much she looked like her mother. And Gloria's own artificial memories didn't help, sitting there, clawing for dominance over her teenage memories. Her TRUE memories, she had to remind herself. It just wasn't fair though, she had put in all that time, business school, spent the best years of her life clawing her way up the ladder only to watch Bill sail past her and become, more or less, her boss! That was why he had the perfect family, the massive, if somewhat old fashioned house in the expensive part of Shermer, and why Gloria never managed to get out of her parent's house (which was now hers as her parents were permanently snowbirding in Florida), much less Shermer!

Gloria felt like she was forgetting something important as well. These new memories, a lifetime lived, seemed to hit all the important things yet leave others out. Was she married in this new reality, or a spinster? The thought of being married to anyone but Tom (even if he was some dumpy fat housewife now) was intolerable. She always believed that she and the former sports superstar of Shermer High were destined to be together, even if he hadn't been rich like Jon Ingerman or impossibly muscled like Rob Bolstrum. Tom was hers...But the cruel wish that had somehow come true had thrown that all off track now. Gloria watched as 'Mr. and Mrs. Strasserman' stared warily at the retreating form of their daughter, and once again memories swelled up from the well of her new adult mind. She was definitely sure she didn't have any kids, though. The closest thing she did have was Willow Strasserman.

Gloria had become Willow's glorified babysitter, watching over the little brat for Tammy and Bill while they took vacations, went on dates...All part of her 'duties' as Bill's executive assistant as he rapidly ascended the rungs of Ingerman's company. At first she had hated it but over time she'd developed some form of attachment to the little girl, turning from 'Ms. Gloria' into 'Aunt Gloria'. Buying her candy or the odd toy, letting her stay up to play video games or watch TV, giving Willow her first (highly supervised) sip of alcohol when she grew into a teenager. And then being a confidant and giving the young woman advice on subjects Willow had clearly not felt comfortable talking to her parents about.

Gloria stifled a gasp as she realized that, while she had no idea who Willow was about to bring up the walk, but she KNEW the younger Strasserman was engaged before her parents even did! The thought of all of it, being someone that their daughter trusted just as much and in some ways more than Bill and Tammy made Gloria want to smile with smug satisfaction. A small, permanent victory for a lifetime of injustices and her career being nothing more than a glorified secretary.

But that was when Gloria's original personality re-asserted itself.

But none of that was true, was it? Just like the young woman who was finishing her conversation by the street and turning, her hand clasped in the mystery fiancee's, it was all just a fake? With every passing second it seemed like the memories of being Gloria Vanapolous, queen of Shermer High seemed to fade the longer she remained here in this new reality. She wanted to make a wish, to escape and be young again, to change her life so that she didn't end up as Bill's glorified secretary, but the anger just seemed so...tempered by disappointment, regret and acceptance that the Ahn'Ger Stone only sparked to life for a brief moment before going dark once more. Instead Gloria's curiosity began to get the better of he as she stared intently at Bill and Tammy's daughter as she pulled her mystery lover out into plain view.

As the stranger was revealed she felt her thinning eyebrows arch in surprise as Bill and Tammy let loose a shared gasp.

There, following closely behind Willow, was a gorgeous red-headed woman with pale skin in a soft, very springy green top and white pants that ended in what looked like designer sandals. Her breasts seemed barely contained by the top and the woman's hips threatened to split the white pants that stretched over her wide hips and generous posterior before stretching down her long legs. Even with the height difference from the stairs giving Willow Strasserman several inches of height it was clear this new woman was tall. A mane of fiery red hair shook and bounced in time with the jiggling of the woman's almost impossible curves as they ascended the concrete stairs. The woman's heart soft, round face seemed happy but extremely nervous to Gloria, a heavily lipsticked smile on large full, pouty lips that revealed perfect teeth, with brilliant green eyes resting behind a small pair of glasses darting back and forth between the middle aged group at the top of the stairs, Willow's backside and her own feet.

And then Willow and her fiancee were on the porch of the Strasserman abode.

'She almost looks like that one chick from Aquaman' Bill thought, a hazy memory surfacing in the back of his 'dad mind' of a movie that had come out during his first semester in college. What was that actresses's name? If it hadn't been for Willow's voice Bill might have been momentarily concerned by this sudden development.

"Mom, dad, this is Roberta! Roberta Bolstrum!" Willow said with what seemed to be all the excitement in the world about to burst out of her. Her face was full of joy that only seemed to falter for a moment as she realized the look of shock, confusion and...anger? on the faces of her parents. But then the love of her life seemed to break the awkward, tense silence that was forming by holding out a slender, feminine hand.

"Actually I, umm, I-I prefer Bobbi" Roberta said, her voice shaking and her outstretched hand matching it as it hung in the early morning spring air. Her voice, nervous as it was, was pleasant and melodious. There was absolutely nothing about her that seemed to justify the warning bells going off in the heads of the three teens turned middle-aged adults, that this was simply a lovely young woman nervously trying to meet her fiancee's parents.

A few moments passed in silence, with only the sounds of Shermer around the group of people. Tammy could see the smile start to falter on her beloved daughter that she had just actually met face and she gave Bill's hand a tight squeeze, which made the boy turned man jerk in surprise.

"Oh! Uh, yes, it's, uh, very nice to meet you Ro...Bobbi" Bill stammered as he enveloped the small, smooth and rose topped fingered hand in front of him a quick shake. "I'm, uh, Bill and this is my wife Tammy" He said releasing Bobbi's hand and motioning towards Tammy.

"Oh it's so nice to meet you!" Tammy said with a sweetness that sent even more alarms going off in Bill's 'dad mind'. That was the 'angry Tammy' voice, and it was more than clear, to him at least, that his best friend turned wife was clearly not happy with the turn of events.

Bill watched as his wife and Willow's fiancee shared a quick handshake before Willow seemed to remember that Gloria was there on the proch with them, and quickly ushered the terrified looking redhead over to the withered Vanapolous. He took this moment to lean over and whisper into Tammy's ear.

"You...You don't really think that's Rob, do you? I mean why would he even be here?"

"The same way we're all old and blessed with a wonderful family, Bill" Tammy whispered in return as the two of them watched Gloria fumble through the introduction. "Listen, if we both can remember two full lives, be this old and have a full grown daughter, who knows what that magic rock can do?"

"you want us to just sit here and watch our daughter get married to the asshole that made you and me miserable? We can't let that happen Tammy!" Bill hissed back, but Tammy released her ironclad grip on Bill's left hand and he felt a throb of pain from it from how hard Tammy had been clenching it.

"I'm not passing judgement until I know this young woman better, honey." Tammy whispered back and planted a small kiss on Bill's cheek before she walked away to rescue Gloria from a very uncomfortable situation. Bill simply just shook his head.
1141221311.title: Meeting Bobbi Bolstrum

11412213111.content:
Bill hid his frustration as best as he could as he watched his best friend inexplicably turned wife of forty years sashay over to where Willow was excitedly introducing Rob...Bobbi Bolstrum to Gloria, whose aged face simply blanched under the unexpected attention, and couldn't help but find his gaze drawn to the large rear that dominated the back of the 'mom jeans' Tammy was wearing.

"Damn" Bill's newly deepened voice muttered as the former Tom Ackerton inserted herself into the conversation and placed a small hand on Willow's arm, giving their daughter a motherly smile as she turned Willow's attention from the terrified looking Gloria back to her. Meanwhile, the redheaded, busty beauty of Bobbi Bolstrum continued to smile nervously and shuffle her feet, one hand intertwined with Willow's while the other hand was rubbing it's thumb and index fingers together; something Bill knew Rob would do whenever the bully had momentarily been outsmarted. Bobbi...If she really was a Bobbi and not just Rob in different packaging, was clearly uncomfortable.

"Willow, honey, let's take it inside. I'll get us all something to drink and your father and Gloria can join us in a few minutes, okay? They were talking about work just before you arrived" Tammy said, casting a quick, knowing look at Bill and Gloria.

'Gloria and I work together?' Bill pondered, he and Gloria sharing a look of their own before suddenly his second set of memories clued him in. He worked for Big Jon's company (or rather the company he inherited from his father), he was a regional director, more or less his own boss and Gloria was...Oh jesus, Gloria was his secretary! Across the porch Gloria seemed to reach to same conclusion and her face paled even further as her eyes widened in horror.

Willow's smile dropped for a moment before it reappeared, bright white teeth gleaming in the morning sunlight, "Oh, okay! C'mon Bobbi, my mom makes the BEST lemonade you've ever tasted! And I can show you my old room! It's still my old room right mom? You and dad didn't turn it into an office or anything did you?" Willow's face suddenly contorted in concern.

"No no, everything is just the way you left it! I didn't let your dad turn it into a man cave!" Tammy chuckled, rubbing her daughter's back and softly guiding her towards the heavy oak door of the Strasserman family residence. She pushed the door open and, with a final look at Bill, headed inside.

"Oh gosh, this is so exciting!" Willow squealed as she pulled Bobbi along behind her as the trio entered the house, Bobbi's eyes going even wider, locking with Bill's for a brief moment before her shorter fiancee pulled her through the opening and the heavy door swung shut behind her.

And then it was quiet once more on the porch, the only sounds were the ambient sounds of Shermer, the wind through the trees, birdsong, cars in the distance, a ringing of a school bell that had, before the strange twist of fate, the three teenagers turned middle-aged adults had been headed for.

And the dull clacking of Gloria's heels on the patio as she staggered backwards to lean on the porch railing. The two teenagers turned adults stood there for a moment as they gathered their bearings; Bill simply processing everything that had happened and his 'dad brain' sounding off all sorts of alarms about his little girl getting married to a complete stranger...Or a complete asshole, and Gloria simply coming to terms with her own rush of adult memories. The silence was finally broken however, when a synthetic chime called out near Gloria, causing them both to be startled.

"Oh god, what the hell is that!?" Gloria cried, spinning her head around as the sound seemed to be right in her ears, "Oh god don't tell me it's some weird future robot or something!" The slightly graying raven haired woman spun in her business suit, free hand pawing at the air in a panic before Bill realized what it was.

"Gloria...I think that's your cellphone" His gruff voice said as he took a step forward. Bill didn't see anything that resembled a phone on Gloria's person, nor did her retro-future business suit seem to have any pockets.

"But I don't have my phone on me!" She whined, patting herself down, "And shouldn't I, like, at least have a purse if I'm an old lady!? God, I just want to go home!"

"Oh just answer the damn thing so you'll both shut up!" Bill hissed, casting a look at the windows of the home he now remembered a lifetime in. Hopefully Tammy was keeping Willow and...Bobbi distracted. Last thing he needed was daughter asking questions he was sure none of them were ready to answer.

"How dare you! You can't talk to me like that!" Gloria hissed back, her panic momentarily giving way and true anger pushing through the feeling of sheer exhaustion she had felt since landing in this messed up future world.

In her hand there was a brief glimmer of green-gold light and Bill tried to hide his alarm. Gloria had been pissed off when she'd wished them all here, clearly the gemstone required you to be angry before it granted wishes, and the last thing Bill needed was to be swept away into another fucked up version of reality. Even if he'd lost most of his life, this one...wasn't so bad.

"Okay okay! I'm sorry, Gloria. We're all just a little stressed out right now. Just answer it and then hang up, I'm sure it isn't important and then we can just sit down and figure out what to do next" Bill hoped the quick apology would work. IF nothing else, maybe he'd get a few seconds to just pry the Stone out of her hand...

Gloria gave Bill a smug look, apparently not noticing the faint glow in her hand fading away. "Good, now how do I make this thing stop?"

"I don't know! Maybe just say 'answer' or something?" Bill shrugged, the actual answer lost on him. Apparently the memories were selective.

"If we're in the future then you should know how this works! You're the geek Bill!" Gloria groaned before looking upwards and letting out a meek "Umm, answer?" The synthetic chiming immediately stopped and Gloria let out a squeak of alarm as pictures appeared in front of her eyes! And not just a picture, but it was live video as some flabby looking man that looked like a frog was smiling at her! Off to the side there was a handful of words next to icons for signal strength and volume, and Gloria spied the name 'Ronny' at the top of the short list.

'Who the hell is Ronny?' She thought as the man, who clearly knew her, began speaking and a voice that sounded like a dying cow filled her ears.

"Hey baby, did you finish talking with Bill? Is he gonna give you that raise?" 'Ronny' said, his beady eyes glistening as much as his skin.

"Uhm..." Was all Gloria could think to say. Who was this ugly ass clown, and why was he calling her 'baby'? She looked over at Bill and pointed to the video in front of her, but Bill simply gave her another shrug.

'Fucking useless nerd!' Gloria mentally hissed. Could Bill not see or hear this guy talking? Was this actual science fiction crap that she was using right now? Her eyes focused on the screen that apparently only she could see and read over the additional information, her eyes nearly popping out of her head when she saw 'Husband' tacked on under the words 'Relation'. 'OMG! OMGOMGOMGOMG!' Gloria screamed as the world started to spin around her. It was too much! It was just too much! She didn't want to be old, she didn't want to be in the future, she didn't want to be Bill's secretary, she didn't want to look like her mother and she definitely did not want to be married to some frog mutant guy!

"Baby, can you hear me?" 'Ronny's' face went from a disturbingly wide grin to a unsure frown.

"I, uh, I'm gonna call you back! Bye!" Gloria said, trying to not black out as the world swam around her. But the video remainined.

"Gloria, honey are you-" 'Ronny' said again, a pudgy, sweaty hand reaching out towards her.

'Ohgodwhatifhecanactuallytouchmethisistooweirdomg!' Gloria internally screamed.

"Uh, bye! So long! Uh, adios! C'mon you stupid phone, hang up!" Gloria screamed.

"Baby, what is-" Ronny began but finally the screen disappeared and the grotesque man's voice went away. Gloria began to sigh in relief but the ringing began again.

"NO! NONONO! I REFUSE! BLOCK CALL!" Gloria screeched as she bashed her palms against her head. Thankfully the chiming immediately stopped and never returned. Gloria looked up, tears filling her eyes.

"Oh god Bill, he was so ugly!" She wailed.

"Who?" Bill asked. The boy turned patriarch had no idea what was happening, to him Gloria had simply been talking to no one. If it really was a phone...Then only Gloria could see it! Actual sci-fi technology! Bill felt the inner geek in him get excited by that, but he tried to remain focused.

"MY HUSBAND!" The raven haired woman bawled as the tears came flooding out. This wasn't fair! She was supposed to marry Tom! She was supposed to be famous and rich by now, not...not stuck as Bill's secretary and married to an ugly dude! She cast a blurry look around the porch and made her way to a nearby patio chair. "Oh god this place is so fucked up Bill! I didn't want any of this! I didn't actually think the wish would come true and ruin my life! It was supposed to ruin YOUR lives!"

"Gee, thanks for the heartfelt confession" Bill snarked back, whatever pity he felt replaced as Gloria's egotistical bitchy nature re-surfaced. "Here, just give me the gemstone and I'll make a wish. God knows I'm angry about all of this as well"

"NO!" Gloria shouted back, "YOU'LL JUST LEAVE ME HERE AND GO BACK HOME! I'm NOT GOING TO BE STUCK AS A OLD HAG, BILL!"

Bill was about to fire back when the front door creaked open and Tammy's blond head poked out.

"Be quiet!" She hissed, "Gloria, just stay here and we'll figure it out later! Now hush!"
11412213111.title: Announcement Aftermath

114122131111.content:
"Oh my god, mom! You don't even know how much I missed your lemonade! Bobbi and I have tried to make it out in our apartment in California but we just never get it to taste like yours!" Willow said as she, her fiancee Bobbi and Tammy stood in the Strasserman's kitchen. The lanky woman took a deep drink of the near-golden liquid in her hand as Bobbi simply took a sip, tucking a stray strand of brilliant red hair behind her right ear as Tammy simply took a seat at the kitchen table, gesturing to the empty chairs positioned around it.

"Take a seat girls. Bobbi, I'd love to get to know more about you! Willow hasn't said ANYTHING to me about you!" Tammy said, smiling. Outwardly the transformed teenager looked pleasant and non-threatening, but her eyes betrayed her inner frustration. The bulk of her new soul wanted to be outraged, that her daughter, her perfect Willow, had gone behind her back and had rushed into a relationship.

An awkward silence followed as the two girls followed Tammy's instructions, Willow giving her mom as wary look as she and her beloved Bobbi took a seat, trying not to stare as Bobbi's bust jiggled from the movement. She was so beautiful! Willow was really lucky to have met her, she just hoped that her parents wouldn't scare off the love of her life by being over-protective. She could already see that Bobbi's nerves were starting to fray, and she reached out an arm under the table and gave Bobbi's leg a soft squeeze for confidence, which the redhead returned with a small smile.

"Well, um, I, uh, don't really know where to start..." Bobbi said sheepishly.

"Where are you from, sweetheart? Are you from California?" Tammy offered, coaxing the attractive girl in front of her out of her shell while Willow looked on with trepidation.

'Oh god mom please don't ruin this!' Willow thought to herself.

"I'm actually from here I just...mom and I moved when I was really little. We didn't have much money so we just went wherever she could find a job"

'Mom?' Tammy wondered, 'Maybe she's Rob's daughter and not him?'. But outwardly she nodded in response, "What about your father? Does he still live around here? Or any other family? Would I know them?" Tammy watched as a shadow briefly passed across Bobbi's face.

"Um...He's not around anymore. He died in a car crash when I was still a baby, so I never got to know him. My mom's name is Julie though, Julie Bolstrum?"

Tammy felt the blood run out of her face. "Oh honey, I'm sorry! I didn't mean" Tammy she said, mortified at her own insensitive question. The Strasserman matriarch reached out to pat the younger girl's hand while she racked her memories, new and old for a 'Julie Bolstrum' and pulling up nothing. Was she someone who actually existed or had Gloria's wish simply conjured more new people into existence? "What was your fath-" Tammy began to ask but Bobbi interrupted her.

"That's okay. Like I said I don't really remember him. But anyway yeah mom didn't have any other family here so she and I moved all over the place, we moved to Fort Petersburg in Florida when I was thirteen and a little after that is when mom met my stepdad Alan. Then when I was sixteen we moved with him to California. After that I finished school out there and did some modelling for a while..." Bobbi said, quickly moving past the rough memory.

"That's actually how we met!" Willow chimed in, "You know during art school they'd bring in those models for life drawing? Well one day I show up for class and Bobbi was the model! Best 'F' ever!" Willow gushed, blushing while she grabbed one of Bobbi's hands.

"Yeah I remember seeing her and thinking 'oh god that nerd is checking me out!'" The redhead said as she visibly relaxed, "But yeah I'd never done anything like that before, and it was freezing in that classroom and I had to be naked so the whole thing was super awkward. I said I'd never do it again but rent is stupid expensive in California so I ended up back on the university campus again flashing my boobs at a bunch of art dorks"

"Didn't expect one of them to ask you out did you?" Willow said as the two girls descended into a self-referential loop of memories.

"Like I wasn't gonna talk to the skinny chick giving me hot cocoa after I froze my tits off! And then later turns out you had messed with the room's thermostat!"

"Curses, my master plan revealed!" Willow snickered back.

Tammy just sat there, listening to what was actually quite the romantic little love story, a mixture of emotions running through her. It was clear the girls loved each other, but Tammy couldn't shake the feeling that something was still off about the busty redhead. She racked her brain, trying to recall a specific car crash but they had been so common before self driving, networked traffic had come along that it was a fool's errand. And she was hurt that her daughter had lived a full life without saying a word of this girl to her on their nightly phone calls.

But the conversation was interrupted when a furious, feminine screech came from the front of the house. It was clearly Gloria, and she clearly wasn't happy about something.

'But what else is new' The Tom part of Tammy snarked, and Tammy could feel her eyes roll in her head.

"Was that Ms. Gloria?" Willow asked, moving to stand up from the table, but Tammy beat her daughter to it, practically leaping out of her chair, trying not to swoon from the light headedness that swooped down upon her.

"No honey, I'll, oooh, I'll go check on your father and Gloria. They've been a little cagey at each other lately, your father's job has been pretty demanding this quarter. Why don't you give Bobbi a tour of the house?" Tammy gave the two girls a smile and took a few wobbly steps out of the kitchen towards the front door. Her immediate concern was another wish unleashing more chaos on this unexpected, but happy life Tammy had found herself in.

"Gloria is chaos enough" Tammy muttered darkly as she reached the front door.Behind it she could hear Gloria whining. Another trademark of the Vanapolous girl.

MY HUSBAND! Oh god this place is so fucked up Bill! I didn't want any of this! I didn't actually think the wish would come true and ruin my life! It was supposed to ruin YOUR lives!"

"Gee, thanks for the heartfelt confession" Bill deeper and slightly muffled voice barked back "Here, just give me the gemstone and I'll make a wish. God knows I'm angry about all of this as well"

Tammy couldn't help but feel a twinge of hurt at her husband's statement. Was he not happy with how their lives had panned out? But Gloria screeched once more, her voice reaching another octave.

"NO! YOU'LL JUST LEAVE ME HERE AND GO BACK HOME! I'M NOT GOING TO BE STUCK AS A OLD HAG, BILL!"

'Oh goddamnit Gloria!' Tammy sighed and pulled the door open a crack. There's was no way the girls in the kitchen (or the neighbors) hadn't heard that. "Be quiet!" Tammy hissed. She noticed that Gloria was still clutching the gemstone in one hand, at some point having collapsed into one of the porch chairs, but it wasn't glowing like it had right before they'd all ended up middle-aged. Maybe it only granted one wish? Or maybe it needed something else to work?

"Mom, is everything okay?" Tammy heard Willow ask from the kitchen. And the last thing they needed was for her daughter and Bobbi to find out about any of the events that led up to now.

"Gloria, just stay here and we'll figure it out later! Now hush!" Tammy hissed again before sliding the door closed once more, turning back to her daughter who was now standing in the entryway to the kitchen, a look of concern on her face. Tammy put on her best smile and hustled over to her daughter.

"Yes honey, it's fine! Just another work argument" Tammy bluffed, but she could see in Willow's eyes that the girl didn't believe it. The shrinking of the pupils, the loss of color in her face, rapid increase in breathing. Willow was about to have one of her panic attacks.

"That sounded like dad was firing Ms. Gloria! Oh mom, don't let him do that! Please not today! Or ever! Oh god it's all my fault isn't it! Dad's mad and this just made it worse I know I should have-" Willow's voice began to waver and Tammy did the only thing she knew to do. She grabbed the lanky girl and pulled her close, stroking the curly hair of her daughter.

"It's okay honey, no one is getting fired. Dad knows how much you like Gloria, he wouldn't do that to you. It's just an argument okay? It''s all gonna be good, nothing is your fault, okay? Just breathe with me honey, in and out, iiiiinnn and ooooout..."

Mother and daughter stood in the entryway to the kitchen as Willow's ragged breath began to slow and normalize, a emotional sniffle coming from her as the panic left her, even if the anxiety was still just beneath the surface. She knew she should have taken her medication before pulling this off! Now Bobbi probably thought she was a loser!

The two women parted and Willow turned back towards the kitchen table...
114122131111.title: Tammy's Motherly Interrogation

1141221311111.content:
The moment Willow had turned her attention from him, the moment she'd gone after Tammy, Rob knew it was his only chance for freedom. He'd pulled himself up from the table as quietly as he could (which given he had a the body of a knockout supermodel with tits the size watermelons and hips to match was no easy feat), pulled off the pair of heels he was wearing, and he'd made a barefoot beeline for the only other exit from the kitchen: The basement.

Rob opened the basement door as quietly as he could and bit his plump lower lip in pain as he squeezed his giant new assets through the aperture, wincing at the sensitivity of his nipples as they pressed against the fabric of the low cut green dress and the hard door. But then he was through, and he slid the door closed behind him, the light from the kitchen fading away to a faint darkness as LED lights lit up each step of a staircase leading down into the NEW Strasserman basement.

The irony wasn't lost on the bully turned bombshell. His morning had started in the basement of the OLD Strasserman house, there on orders from Jonathan Ingerman to wait until Bill's family was out of the house and then burn the entire place down as 'revenge', but Rob knew it was just a trap to get Big Jon's only competition out of the way permanently. And Rob had complied, as Big Jon expected of his 'loyal' lackey, the cowed, tamed beast of Shermer. But Rob was smarter than most people gave him credit for; The big man hadn't just kept control over a gang of bullies simply out of brute force, or had gotten away with the no small amount of petty thievery over the years. Rob was smarter than most people gave him credit for, and he wasn't going to waltz right into the trap.

So Rob had waited until Shitterman's parents had left, creeping upstairs to get Bill alone and propose some kind of alliance to take Big Jon down for good...Only to see the little nerd and that failure Tom Ackteron arguing with the hot but bitchy Gloria Vanapolous across the street! Gloria had been holding some kind of rock and the three of them were fighting over it...

And then there was that flash of light and suddenly he was a woman! A incredibly hot woman! Sitting in a car that looked like it was out of some sci fi flick! He'd had just enough time to look himself over and mutter a obscenity before the girl, Willow, round the corner. Then it was like he'd been thrown in some kind of twisted prison, nothing more than a passenger in his own mind as this 'Bobbi' acted like a little demure doe in the headlights, allowing the shorter girl to pull her up the stairs and submit her to a humiliating meet and greet with her 'parents'.

'Oh, you've got to be fucking kidding me with this bullshit!' Rob had groaned to no one but himself when he'd seen just who those parents were. The old man was clearly Bill Strasserman and the Meryl Streep knockoff in the business suit was Gloria Vanapolous (given she looked almost identical to her mother). The little blonde he had trouble placing until he realized it was Tom Ackerton, the sports star acting like some perfect little housewife. And he was getting engaged to their crotch goblin!

And what was with that sob story at the table?
