'Fucking embarassing' Rob muttered in his new breathy voice as he descended the stairs, praying to whatever deity that was clearly messing with him to not let the wood structure squeak. But the bully turned bombshell reached the concrete floor of the basement without incident and blinked into the darkness with eyelashes that were so long they were slowly driving him crazy. Unlike the original Strasserman basement, this one was fairly generic. Before Bill's new house has a full carpet floor, a bathroom plus the whole area that Bill had claimed as his own, filled with Marvel and Star Wars and other geek shit. This basement just had a handful of shelves filled with what looked like junk and some old furniture...

'Bingo!' Rob thought as he spied another door. Faint light spilled in from a gap in the heavy curtains, obviously leading outside. Above him he heard the sounds of whatever was happening to Willow begin to subside and just to be on the safe side of...whatever, he cupped two tiny hands over his earring bejeweled ears and made his way as fast as he could through the dark confines of the basement, stubbing a painted toe once on some un-seen object and fighting back the instinctive urge to swear at the top of his lungs. But then he was at the door, quickly flipping the two locks open and turning the knob, the door swinging wide to reveal the Strasserman's backyard.

Above him he could hear Willow's voice calling out to him. Or rather, to Bobbi and he quickly covered his ears once more.

"Shitshitshit!" He whispered, his green eyes wide, afraid that this new body he was in would come like a dog and he'd be trapped as Bobbi for who knew how long again. But as he heard the muffled sound of Willow and then Tammy calling out to him...nothing happened. Or well, nothing save for a nagging feeling, more of an itch, for him to march back up those stairs and into the arms of her Willow. Maybe it was visual contact? Willow WAS pretty easy on the eyes...

"Fuck that!" Rob snarled, giving his pretty new head a hard smack, turning his attention back to escaping. The backyard of Bill and Tammy's new house was wide and long, typical of the more wealthy area of Shermer and definitely larger than Bill's old backyard had been. And instead of a fence there was a row of hedges that were as tall as Rob used to be. Now they simply towered over his much smaller, prettier frame. Rob poked his long-haired head out of the doorway and angrily held the waterfall of red locks off to the side as he looked side to side, finally spying a path that led back up to the ground level of the large house, possibly to the front yard or a garage or something. He chanced a glance upwards, noting the that there were more than a few windows. And if Shitterman and Titsapolous were still on the front porch...All in all, there was a high chance that he could be seen.

It wasn't ideal, but if worse came to worse Rob could just go through the bushes.

"Okay Bolstrum, here you go..." Rob said as he readied himself for the escape of his lifetime.

'Then what are you gonna do Robbie? You'll still be a chick! And still stuck...Wherever the hell you are!' A condescending voice in his head said. And it was right. Everything had come from Vanapolous and that weird rock she was holding! Maybe she was still on the front porch...If he could surprise her, maybe grab the gemstone and make a wish to be back to normal...

Rob glanced at his hairless arms.

...But overpowering Gloria, and definitely Bill was out of the question. The girl he'd been transformed into clearly only had enough muscle tone to help with her looks, she was no fighter.

And if Rob got caught, he'd end up trapped in his own body again. And who knew if him getting away was just a fluke of whatever had changed everything or not! Or maybe if he played the part...Maybe he'd have a better opportunity to get away? One with less risk?

Regardless, the sound of the basement door opening forced him to take action.

Option 1: Rob makes a break for it. Deciding on the riskier course of action, Rob bolts out of the basement and attempts to wrestle the Ahn'Ger Stone from Gloria.

Option 2: Rob allows himself to be 'captured' and fall back into the role of 'Bobbi Bolstrum', spending the day trapped in her body. But that night after everyone falls asleep...
1141221311111.title: Runaway 'Fiancee'

11412213111111.content:
The door to the Strasserman's basement opened with a depressed groan, causing lambent early morning sunshine to flow downwards toward the corner where Rob was hiding, the rays tickling his newly delicate skin, a pleasantly warm Spring breeze easing through the strands of his presently long crimson hair.

“Honey, are you down here?” asked a thin, reedy voice from the top of the stairs. “Bobbi?!”

“Bobbi?! Sweetheart, it's OK to come back upstairs now!” said an older but sugary soprano voice.

Crickets. Rob wasn't saying a damn thing. He listened stealthily as the two voices seemed defeated for a moment.

“Wait a minute, Willow. I forgot, your father and I put cameras in the basement since you moved away!” squealed the older voice. “Let me pull up the footage on my iPhone.”

“God Mom, you still have one of those old retro tech things?” giggled the younger voice. “What's next, are you going to do math with a slide rule? If I start up the fireplace, are you and Dad going to start hooting and hollering like a couple of cavepeople?”

“Says the kid who has a vinyl record and VHS collection. God, even I didn't have VHS when I was your age.”

“Hey, I just love the old Disney clam shell cases, OK? And those tape are worth a lot of money nowadays, for your information!”

“One man's trash...”

“Whoa, you've got like a dozen different feeds on that thing. Why do you even have all these cameras, anyway? Are you and Dad filming a reality show down here?”

“No, it's where we have our kinky sex livesteams.”

“Mom!”

“Sorry, honey, but you walked right into that one. It's just security. You know how paranoid your father gets about home invaders.”

Heh, not paranoid enough thought Rob as he eavesdropped on their banal little conversation.

“Le sigh. I get enough of big brother out in California. Just last week, we had some pervy drone that was spying on us just outside our bedroom window. Bobbi shot it down with a sling shot of all things.”

“Heh. And you call us cavemen.”

“Cavepeople, and you are! Why aren't you using the noosphere instead of that old thing?”

“Well, to be honest, the noosphere kind of freaks me out. I don't like the idea of being connected to a giant hive mind that can read my thoughts and always knows what I'm doing. Call me old fashioned if you want, but I prefer a little privacy.”

“Fair enough, and it figures. Wasn't Dad part of Anonymous back in the day? I guess he rubbed off on you.”

“He rubbed off on me all right. It's why you were born.”

“Gross, Mom.”

“At least I won't get turned into a battery someday, if I can help it” chuckled the older voice.

“Pretentious much? All your generation did was share memes about cats and troll people into committing suicide while you let all sorts of horrible things happen around you. My generation fixed the polar ice caps and stopped climate change. So nyah nyah to you old fogies.”

“With help from aliens! A deus ex machina!”

“It still counts!”

“No it doesn't, but I love ya anyway. And, little whippersnapper, it turns out “retro” tech isn't so useless after all. Look at the feed of camera six. There's your Bobbi standing right behind the cellar door...which she opened. Oh no, I think she's trying to ditch us.”

“Are you serious? Lemme see that.”

“My lemonade wasn't that bad, was it?”

“No Mom, your lemonade is like liquid crack. It's definitely not that.”

“Well, what is it then?”

“If I had to guess, she must have been scared by all the yelling on the porch. She's very sensitive. Bobbi!” yelled Willow. “You don't have to hide anymore! Come back upstairs and I'll show you my old room!”

Crickets.

“Please answer me!”

Tammy suddenly let go of Willow's hand.

“You know what? Meeting the in laws is never fun. I think I should go down to talk to her myself. Get to have a little one on one time with your fiancee so she can learn to trust me. Just go upstairs and watch some TV, hun.”

Willow re-clasped her hand into her mother's gentle but firm grip.

“No. Lets go together. After all, we're all going to be one big happy family soon, right?”

The part of Tammy that used to be Tom, the one who went to bed exhausted because she had felt so alone, suddenly found her tank of gas being filled up again. Despite all of the bickering and the backtalk from her daughter, and the weirdness of having an entire lifetime's worth of memories and emotions & opinions associated with those memories dumped into her head, this was the first time she felt happy. Here, she wasn't being treated like a piece of shit, much less being gaslit into believing that she deserved it.

“Did I ever say how much I love you?”

“Like a hundred times every single day. I love you too, Mom. It's wonderful being back home.”

“Shit!” whispered the bully turned beauty as he saw two female shadows hug one another and then amble their way down the stairs.

The need for Rob to answer Willow and let his “fiancee” know where he was had grown more intense than it had been a minute ago. A minute ago it had been a casual itch, like wanting a taco at three in the morning. Now, without the safety of floorboards, insulation, and distance to protect him, it took Rob a moderate amount of stubbornness to resist this strange new compulsion. An invasive part of his brain, the mental virus known as Bobbi, was urging him to run into Willow's arms because she was weak and insecure and needed her strong and confident girlfriend to protect her. To Rob, this was enough proof that the farther away he was from Bill and Tammy's vagina turd, the more freedom he had.

If he ever wanted to escape from this weird gender bending future-drama horseshit, he had to get that kryptonite looking rock and wish things back to normal. There was only one way that he knew how to do that, the only way that a meathead like him knew how to do anything: the direct approach.

“That old hag Titsapoulous is probably stronger than me now, but fuck it, I'll take my chances” muttered the bully turned model as looked toward the open cellar door and ran out into the sunlight.

“Oww oww oww!” he yelped daintily as Bobbi's tender bare feet stepped on a series of pebbles laying around in the grass.

11412213111111.title: Hide And Seek, Part 1

114122131111111.content:
Bill could clearly see that he wasn't getting anywhere with Gloria, who was all curled in the corner of his porch silently freaking out about her husband, whoever that was supposed to be. Honestly, he would prefer it to be a mystery best left unsolved. What was important was that he had to calm Gloria down, and then think of a way to persuade her into handing the magic gemstone over to him.

The teen turned middle aged businessman knew that it wasn't going to be easy. Gloria, while not as academically inclined or clever as himself, was far from stupid. He couldn't trick her into letting go of the magic bauble as easily as he could with Big Jon or Rob Bolstrum, who both had exploitable tempers. She didn't have any psychological weaknesses he could take advantage of. Her personality was intractable and stubborn, so negotiating with her or making attractive sounding rationalizations were out. He had no choice but to sweet talk Tom's ex girlfriend. Get on her good side. Flatter her ego. The problem is that he absolutely hated Gloria's guts, and the real question for Bill wasn't whether Gloria was prepared to swallow her pride for once and do the right thing, the question was: is he?

Another thought, comparing his bizarre situation to Marty McFly in Back To The Future Part II popped came up randomly, which made Bill chuckle. But he was distracting himself.

OK, lets get down to brass tacks...

As Bill was pensively attempting to figure out an angle, a car pulled up in front of the Strasserman home, heralded by the sound of a sputtering engine being turned off. A slamming of a door was heard behind the thick wall of hedgerow surround the entrance, followed by the sound of a wheezing out of shape man struggling to open the front gate. The bearded nerd turned away from Gloria to face the new disturbance.

“Oh boy, what now?” he whispered to himself with no small amount of dread.

“Gloria! Gloria, honey! Are you OK?!” croaked out an enigmatic gray skinned frog like creature as he stumbled gracelessly across Bill and Tammy's front lawn and towards their porch. On any other day but today, he would have been the oddest sight any of the kids had ever seen.

As the strange man got close, Bill commanded him to stop.

“Hey, that's about far enough!” Bill yelled. His older, heavier voice sounded authoritative in a way that it hadn't sounded as an eighteen year old, even more so than his own father sounded, and the strange man instantly stopped dead in his tracks.

“Who the hell are you?”

It took him a second to catch his breath.

“My name's Ronny Vanapoulous, I'm Gloria's husband. We, uh, we've actually met several times before, Mr. Strasserman.”

Bill paused as “old” memories began to form in his mind. In them, he recalled Gloria being married in this future timeline, although from what he could tell her spouse looked normal and even handsome in them. Nothing at all like this weird ambiguously human creature. Then he recalled who Ronny really was and visibly blanched.

“Y-yes, that's right. Gloria's husband. I remember us having dinner together. We also went golfing that one time, and you almost killed a caddy with your terrible swing.”

Ronny gave a small, self deprecating laugh.

“That's right, sir. Tell Karen I'm sorry again, it was my first time out on a professional course and I got nervous.”

“Uh...sure. I'll do that.”

“And tell your lovely wife that I said hi too. Anyway, I'm just looking for Gloria. She told me earlier this morning that she was taking a swing, excuse the pun, she said that she was stopping by your home because...well, it's none of my business why! The point is, she told me that she'd be here. I promised Gloria that I'd call her when she was finished doing what she was doing. When I did, she began acting very strange, like she had never even seen me before and then hung up in a panic. I called her up a second time, and found out that she blocked my number. You wouldn't happen to know anything about as to why, would you, Bill?”

Bill hesitated as he struggled for what he should say.

“Well, actually, Gloria's right here. Gloria, why don't you...”

The teen turned grown man turned his gaze over to where Gloria had been having her little panic attack and discovered that she had vanished!

Nervously, Bill turned back to Ronny and chuckled nervously.

“Well, she WAS here just a second ago...”

114122131111111.title: Hide And Seek, Part 2

1141221311111111.content:
Gloria silently thanked God that Bill had been distracted just long enough for her to sneak past him into the house. She blew an exasperated sigh of relief as she closed and locked the Strasserman's front door behind her.

This was madness! Not only had the cursed gemstone she was holding tightly in her hand forced her to sacrifice her youth, her body, her dream life, and her self respect, but the future Gloria Vanapoulous was apparently married to an alien! A goddamned alien!

In the 2040s, when the Earth's climate had reached a point of irreversible catastrophe, literal fucking Martians had made first contact with humanity, where they revealed themselves to have been watching over us for generations, only deciding to intervene when we were on the razor's edge of killing ourselves. Apparently, Earthlings were on the same track the Venusians had been before perishing eons ago.

Her husband Ronny, real name unpronounceable to humans, was one of these aliens. Gloria wanted to vomit at the thought.

She didn't care how powerful it was, the second that she returned back her normal, beautiful eighteen year old self and her real life(As opposed to the artificial life that she was currently trapped in), she was smashing the damned stone in her hand into little tiny pieces with a fucking jackhammer if she had to. But first, she needed a safe space, a place where she could calm down for just one lousy second! Then she'd make her escape from this future hell.

The cheerleader turned secretary's graying hair whipped back and forth as she searched frantically for a safe space.

“Think! Think, bitch, think!” she muttered to herself as she impatiently tapped at her temples in a vain attempt at inspiration, but no ideas came to her. So instead, she wandered in search of a good hiding spot, hoping to possibly jog her addled brain.

Gloria silently seethed with envy as she stalked through each room of the Strasserman home, realizing just now how well off Bill and Tammy actually were and how much her initial wish had backfired on her.

“This place is lit as fuck!” she moaned.

The Strasserman's living room was spacious, immaculate, and beautiful, like something you might see in a TV show about rich people. So was the kitchen and the dining room. There was a state of the art game room that Gloria vaguely recalled Willow spending a lot of time in when she was made to babysit the girl. A guest bedroom on the first floor was large enough to have an expensive looking piano and a minibar inside of it. There was a locked off room connected to the garage that Gloria couldn't get into, but her memories told her was a workshop where the older Bill tinkered on different projects whenever he had free time. She recalled that the future version of Tammy's husband fancied himself something of an inventor, the nerdiness in him never having faded away. Gloria rolled her eyes at the entrance with its pretentious biometric locks and wandered around some more until she heard someone opening the front door in the foyer, prompting her to sneak upstairs in a hurry.

Ultimately, Gloria settled on doing the deed in Willow's bedroom. Not for any particular strategic reason, but she felt uncomfortable being inside the master bedroom where Bill and Tammy had very likely had sex at some point, shivering at the thought.

Cautiously, she stepped inside the bright and cheery childhood abode of a person who thought of Gloria like an aunt, virtually untouched since she had left for college. Wordlessly, she sat on her bed.

Gloria was simply mad at the irony of it all, the reversal of fortune. In the real world of 2018, she was the one everyone was jealous of. In Shermer High, she was the queen whose ring you had to kiss. She was popular beyond compare, good looking, with the surface level charm, Machiavellian wit to know how to manipulate almost everyone to her benefit, and not to mention doing pretty damn well for herself. With the obvious exception of Jonathan Ingerman who existed on another strata of wealth, not to mention in an entirely different social scene than her, she was probably the richest kid in school. Bill and Tom's families weren't hurting by any means, but it was only Gloria who could afford to have the nicest clothes, the nicest car, the latest smart phone, etc.

Being at the top of the rat race had always been something she had prided herself on. Come to think of it, so did her parents, which is where she must have gotten her behaviors from. She could only imagine what her mother Ariadne would think of this home.

But now, now the haughty Gloria was the glorified servant of someone that she had once thought of as her inferior, and it sucked. It really, really fucking sucked to be humbled.

But it was more than that. She could live with Bill's grass being greener than hers. It was Tom being content for once in his life that really bugged her. Frankly, it pissed her off seeing how well Tom was doing when not trapped underneath her thumb, cowed by her bitchy...domineering...Type A personality. The fact that he was happy here, that he would rather be in a relationship with Bill stuck as a pint sized housewife with an ass you could sit a soda can on as opposed to the chiseled Adonis that he had been this morning and in a relationship with her was just...it was unfathomable to her bloated ego.

She had been holding in a good, long rage against the heavens for about an hour now. The gemstone in her hand was glowing emerald fire and primed for its next wish.

1141221311111111.title: Hide And Seek, Part 3

11412213111111111.content:
Running around with huge heaving tits, lengthy locks of hair, and a pair of hips so wide that it noticeably impeded his movement was not his idea of fun, thought Rob Bolstrum as he watched Old Man Bill argue with the ugly dude who had pulled up to his house.

Sure, the body he was trapped in was a wet dream come true. He'd love to fuck the woman who looked like this, a woman who put Scarlett Johansson to shame, but being her? That was no picnic. Besides the restricted movement caused as a result of Bobbi's exaggerated hourglass figure, his dogs were barking, the double dee boobs were absolutely killing his back, and his clothes were so goddamned tight!

Rob did feel a little bad about his hypocrisy deep down, really deep down. He'd never want to dress in clothing this constricting again, not even if it was a fucking wetsuit or whatever scuba divers wear, but he wouldn't exactly say no to a girl, a real girl, who had a killer body and wanted to show it off.

Surprisingly, the former giant was optimistic about his situation.

All of this inner turmoil meant that good old Rob Bolstrum, white trash thug who was barely graduating high school this semester and definitely not bound for college, was still in the driver's seat of this body, not the unwanted invisible passenger he had along with him.

He wasn't hearing those nagging thoughts in his head anymore. The ones from Bobbi's subconscious that told him that Willow needed her, that Willow was her little sugar bear wifey to be, that she actually gave a shit about Willow's stupid drawings or her faggoty animation career, what kind of wedding dress she was planning to wear a year from now, and all that mushy girly romantic bullshit.

What the hell was that rock the nerds were fighting over, anyway? Was it actually a wishing rock like in Aladdin? A part of Rob was still skeptical. Magic was for babies and fantasy loving pussies. Which admittedly fit Bill Strasserman perfectly, but still. Here he was forty years in the future, staring at the camel toe that poked through Bobbi's white pants. What else could that green hunk of junk be but a magic lamp? He couldn't wait to get his hands on it. Not just to escape this body, but to punish Big Jon for what he did to him. He would, to borrow a famous phrase, get medieval on Jon's ass.

Honestly,the hardest part of all this was playing the waiting game. He had spent all morning waiting, and his bully mindset wasn't built for that. He was built for acting, and reacting when necessary. Again, he had to remind himself that the girl he was stuck as was weak and dainty, and could probably only fight off an eight year old with Down's Syndrome.

So he waited, as silent and patient as a predator on the savanna. All he could do was watch and reflect on his situation.

When Rob made good his escape from the basement, the bully turned knockout had sneaked around the perimeter of Bill's new house as quiet as a ghost until he found a decent blind spot, a place where he could observe Bill and the girls while remaining unnoticed. He was hoping that while Tammy and her brat were distracted in the the backyard, Bill at some point would walk inside his quasi palatial estate for a minute. Maybe to take a piss because old guys peed a lot, right? Or maybe to calm down his curly haired geekette that had once been cum inside his nutsack. Or maybe to have a quickie with the naggy wife that Tom Ackerton had turned into. The wife who likely kept Bill on a leash like the pussywhipped cuck Rob imagined that he had grown up to be. It didn't matter what the excuse was, just that Bill left. While the Addams Family were occupied, then Rob could ambush the aged Gloria when she was alone and vulnerable on the porch. He would bum rush her with the small amount of strength that Bobbi had, and Gloria would almost immediately fold under the pressure like the weak bimbo that Rob always knew that she was.

At least, that was the plan.

Nope. No such luck. Man plans, God laughs. The creature from the black lagoon had decided to stop by out of the blue, and the second Bill was distracted by the ugliness of it, the wily old broad that had once been the hottie of Shermer High stealthily crept past the dweeb's turned back and straight into the house.

What the hell was Rob going to do now?

11412213111111111.title: Hide And Seek, Part 4

114122131111111111.content:
“She ditched me. She really ditched me. My worst nightmare has come true” said Willow tonelessly, defeatedly, none of her trademark ebullience apparent in her voice.

Mother and daughter had searched the entire backyard and discovered no evidence of Willow's fiancee. No footprints, no telltale clumps of dirt or displaced hedges. It was as if the gorgeous redhead had vanished into vapor as quickly as she had arrived.

“Don't worry monkey, I'm sure Bobbi still loves you” consoled Tammy, once again hugging her daughter tightly and stroking her hair, a tried and true tonic that her older memories recalled having done hundreds if not thousands of times over the years.

“But why?” sniffed Willow as she wiped a trail of casual tears from her face. “Why would she run away? Things were going so well! We...w-we were going to get married. We, w-we had a date set and everything, and for the honeymoon I-I was going to take her to that cool underwater hotel they built near Calabasas. It was going to be a surprise. I had enough money stashed away and everything!”

“Monkey, don't beat yourself up. You said it yourself that she's sensitive. It didn't exactly take Sherlock Holmes to see how jittery Bobbi was when meeting your father and I. Maybe she's just exploring the neighborhood until she calms down.”

“...Maybe?” squeaked out sad Willow. “She does like to take lots of long walks, especially when I'm in one of my crabby moods.”

“See!? There you go.”

“But she would have called or texted me by now!”

Tammy hated that she couldn't answer her daughter honestly. The jock turned diminutive blonde worried that her husband's suspicions might be right, that somehow that nervous little girl Willow was over the moon for was really Rob Bolstrum, their high school bully transformed just as they had been.

Two hypotheses ran through her mind.

The more positive scenario was that if Bobbi really was Rob, he had no idea what was going on. He panicked at being altered against his will and ran away in terror/confusion at his first opportunity. Bullies were ultimately cowards, right? It would undoubtedly be deleterious to Willow to lose the love of her life, especially on the verge of getting married, but Tammy knew that her daughter had been in shitty relationships in the past and would learn to deal.

The other, more disconcerting option for Tammy was that Rob had a double set of memories just as she and Bill did, and in his vindictiveness at being transformed was deliberately fucking with their daughter by agitating her into having a panic attack. Only someone like Rob was cruel enough to break the heart of an innocent soul just to spite her parents. Or maybe he had some other plan in mind to ruin her and Bill's new lives.

The thought made the mama bear side of Tammy white hot with anger, a side that she showed almost no one except her Bill. Elaborate thoughts of revenge crisscrossed her bifurcated mind.

If Rob hurts either one of them, I'm going to chop his fingers off and make him eat them.

Tammy didn't play when it came to protecting her family.

Gradually, anger gave way to the absurdity of all of this, over how drastically her life had been turned upside down in a short couple of hours, to be forty years older in the future in wedded bliss to her best friend who was now her soulmate. It was actually a perfect plot line for one of the cartoons that Willow storyboarded. Who else was going to show up into her life next, Vanessa Chandler?

Spontaneously, the teen turned middle aged mom let go of Willow and burst into a fit of giggles.

“Mom, why are you laughing?” asked Willow in a perplexed tone of voice, and after a few more hiccups of mirth, Tammy caught her breath.

“I...”

Before Tammy could answer, the two Strasserman women heard a blood curdling scream coming from Willow's bedroom.

114122131111111111.title: Hide And Seek, Part 5

1141221311111111111.content:
Bill and Ronny had spent the last ten minutes waiting for Gloria to reappear from wherever she went off to, and once it was clear that she wasn't coming back...

“If you don't mind, could I go inside and look for her?”

“Sure, why not? Maybe Tammy can fix you some of her lemonade. You drink lemonade, right?”

“Of course! Lemonade is like drinking the blood of Issus herself.”

“Haha, if you say so. My wife will like hearing that endorsement.”

Bill's plans for returning home were being delayed yet again by outside factors beyond his control, but what could he do? His memories told him that Ronny was a good dude, literally just an Average Joe who happened to look like a frog man, at least when cloaking technology couldn't make him pass for a human.

His good conscious couldn't allow him turn the man away. Still, if just one more thing interrupted Bill's day...

The moment he opened the front door to let Ronny inside, the young man turned middle aged man saw Willow's fiancee Bobbi sprint around the corner of his house with lightning speed.

“What the hell?” he asked himself.

“Hi there! My name's Ron...”

“Piss off freak!” Bobbi yelled cruelly, pushing Ronny to the ground with a loud thud before running up the stairs past Bill and into his living room.

**

“Thank God that Shitterman still sucks” wheezed Rob as he raced through a swanky if somewhat old fashioned living room. He had gambled on the hunch that despite Bill being a fully grown man now that he was still a clumsy, uncoordinated nerd at heart, and that gamble had paid off.

Guess I'm not as dumb as everyone thinks.

Another hunch of Rob's was that when Gloria had gone inside that she ran upstairs, away from Shitterman and the small fry that Ackertard had turned himself into. Titsapoulous was obviously not happy being an old lady now, just like he wasn't happy being a chick, so she probably wanted to be as far away from the sickening sweethearts as possible.

Not that he blamed her one bit.

Once Rob had landed the second flight of stairs, he searched around room by room, his long hair swinging wildly, his large breasts hurting from the lack of a support bra.

That's when the bully turned bombshell got his next lucky break, or so he thought.

When he saw the emerald light emanating from the farthest room on the left hand side, Rob knew that he had finally found his mark.

“Time to end this bullshit” he whispered, desperately trying to sound intimidating with Bobbi's angelic voice.

**

Gloria stared in awe at the magical bauble she had in her withered, wrinkled hand. She was plenty angry already, but wanted to word things just right so she never ended up in a place like this again.

If things went right, she would momentarily be back to her old self, with Tom back in her loving arms, ready for their return as Shermer High's power couple.


“I wish...”

Before the aged queen bee could make her wish, she saw Bobbi Bolstrum rush in through the door and felt the girl grab her throat. Gloria made a blood curdling scream.

Option 1: Gloria and Rob/Bobbi fight viciously over the stone. During the struggle, Gloria makes a desperate wish to return back to 2018. The wish is successful. Problem is, Gloria is still old, Rob is still a gorgeous supermodel, their younger selves are still present, and Bill and Tammy are trapped in the future!

11412213111111111111.content:
The gemstone glittered with the strange, ethereal gold and green light, bouncing off the familiar yet alien confines of Willow's bedroom as Gloria finally pushed through all the shock and the unexpected tiredness that had gripped her since traveling to the future, her new body just being overworked as Bill Strasserman's personal secretary.

Or in Gloria's mind, the personal slave of the entire Strasserman family.

She HATED that fact. Hated that her dreams of being rich and powerful and beautiful all amounted to nothing. Her boyfriend was now some dotting housewife, she looked like her mom, she had no power, and as best as her new memories could surmise she and the...the alien that she'd somehow wound up marrying were simply middle class nobodies, not even as well off as she'd been before making the first wish! But now she could change all of it, she could get her happy ending.

"All I've got to do is go home" Gloria thought as she closed her fist tightly around the gemstone and held it in the air. She closed her eyes, took a deep breath and fought the urge to simply wish something vindictive on the Strasserman family here in the future. She had to get back to 2018. She had to stop herself from making the original wish.

But as soon as the words "I wish" left Gloria's mouth, there was a high pitched, blood curdling scream from behind her that caused Gloria's eyes to snap open as a large blur of green, red and flailing breasts smacked into her. Gloria's knees flared with pain as they buckled beneath her from the sudden assault, her legs no longer fit and toned like they had been in her teenage years and with a cry of pain Gloria collapsed to the carpeted floor of Willow Strasserman's bedroom.

"GIVE IT TO ME YOU FUCKING BITCH!" Rob screeched in his new voice as he scrambled on top of Gloria's body, the older woman groaning in pain from his tackle. He spread his slender new legs and planted his ample rear on the center of Gloria's back, pressing down on the graying hairs of the secretary's head with his massive new tits, using the few advantages of his current body to make up for his new lack of strength. He dug his long fingernails into Gloria's closed fist, leaving long bloody scratches in the wrinkled flesh.

"ROB, STOP!" He heard the booming voice of Bill Strasserman say from somewhere outside the room, and that just made the bully turned bombshell fight even harder. If Bill got there he'd just pick his new body up like it was nothing more than a fucking Barbie doll! And the sound of Bill's voice seemed to have an effect on Gloria as well, as the old woman suddenly surged with newfound energy beneath his voluptous form, actually starting to RISE off the floor even with Rob sitting on her! Rob swung his legs around Gloria's abdomen and squeezed as the former cheerleader used Willow's nearby bed as leverage, hoisting herself upwards despite the full grown woman on her back.

"GOD-FUCKING-DAMNIT!" Rob screeched again, angry that his new body was so weak he couldn't even beat an old woman in a fight. He tucked a slender arm around Gloria's neck and squeezed as he fought against being bucked off, Gloria rasping beneath him her oxygen source was cut off, but the old broad was still fighting...And winning! Rob felt Gloria's free hand dig into the soft skin of his forearm and begin to pull it away, Rob's pretty green eyes going wide with fear as he began to lose the fight, and he did the only thing he could think of.

"HEY, GET OFF MY WIFE!" Came another male voice from somewhere close behind Rob. He was running out of time!

Baring his perfectly white and sparkling teeth, he lunged towards Gloria's exposed right ear, his teeth digging into the cartilage protrusion as Gloria let out one final pain-filled scream.

"I WISH I WAS BACK IN 2018 SO I COULD STOP MYSELF FROM MAKING THAT WISH!" Gloria screeched, and Rob's eyes bulged out of his head as the world was filled with a verdant light...

And then they were gone.

Bill groaned as he smacked into Willow's bed, his momentum carrying him forward as the bright after-image blinded him. He toppled over onto the soft mattress that smelled like his daughter and lay there for a moment. He'd been so close! If he'd had just a couple more seconds he would have been able to reach Rob and pry him off of Gloria! But even with his more powerful body he was still human, and age had simply slowed him down just enough.

"Where...What happened?" Ronny croaked from the doorway as the alien's natural Amphibian form swam back into focus for Bill. The alien was rubbing his own bulging, off-center eyes with a clammy partially webbed hand. Meanwhile Bill could hear the sounds of the rest of his family ascending the stairs.

"BILL! HONEY! ARE YOU ALL RIGHT!?" Tammy said as she pushed her short, slightly tubby body as fast as it could up the stairs, huffing with effort as Willow tromped up behind her. An idle thought crossed Tammy's mind as she cursed her decision to not buy a gravity lift to replace the staircase.

'No no, you WANTED the exercise!' She huffed to herself as the upper landing came into view. For the first time since becoming Tammy, she regretted not having Tom's athleticism.

"Mom, mom what's happening!?" Willow squeaked behind her and as Tammy pulled herself off the stairs and leaned against the upper hallway wall, the boy turned housewife simply didn't have an answer, despite ALWAYS having some kind of an answer for her daughter.

"I-I don't know h-honey" Tammy said as she regained her composure, giving her beautiful daughter a smile she hoped was re-assuring and placing a slightly sweaty palm on Willow's cheek. "I-I'm sure your father's gotten to the bottom of it though". Tammy looked down the hall as Bill staggered out of Willow's bedroom, rudely pushing a still dazed looking Ronny to the side. She expected her knight in shining armor to have that re-assuring look of triumph on his face...But then Bill slowly shook his head, his mustached face wide-eyed and pale. Tammy's blood turned to ice water as she realized what had just happened.

"Oh. Oh god. OH MY GOD!" Tammy cried out in terror before promptly fainting in the trembling arms of her daughter.

114122131111111111111.content:
All Gloria knew was pain. She had been about to make her wish when suddenly she had been attacked! Tackled to the floor with someone that was both heavy yet soft screaming at her. It had taken every last once of strength that Gloria had in her withered body to keep from lashing out with a wish, to keep her fist closed despite the fact it felt like it was being stabbed and sliced with a entire cupboard full of knives. But her outrage at what had happened to her life, the fact that the stranger was trying to take the wishing stone away from her, had given her enough adrenaline to fight back...And to everyone's surprise, actually start winning! But then her attack had started strangling her, and even bit her, and Gloria felt her legs start to buckle again, her decrepit body threatening to collapse back to the floor.

She had wanted to wish her attacker away, to wish something terrible upon them, transform them into something that wouldn't hurt her...But Gloria resisted the urge to waste the wish. Even half-blinded by pain she knew the only way out was to go back in time. Back to when she was young. She could stop all of it if she stopped herself!

"I WISH I WAS BACK IN 2018 SO I COULD STOP MYSELF FROM MAKING THAT WISH!" Gloria had screamed as her legs buckled beneath er, and despite her eyes clenched shut in pain, the green-gold light was still as bright as staring into the sun. She felt a surge of victory, she was going to be young again! She could fix that horrible nightmare of a future from ever happening!

But despite expecting to hit the carpeted floor of Willow's bedroom, instead the ground simply vanished beneath her and the sound of rushing wind caused her eyes to snap open.

"Oh fuck!" Gloria gasped as a large branch and a row of blurry green bushes rose up to meet her. And then there was more pain, the sound of twigs and branches breaking as Gloria felt something heavy roll of her back and her clothing rip in several places. She felt her gemstone hand bash painfully against the hard bark of a tree. And then there was silence and stillness. And pain. There was a lot of pain as Gloria's entire body throbbed and she could taste blood in her mouth pouring in from a split lip. She tried to move, to rise up out of the wet grass she now found herself laying in, but that only caused more pain. So instead she opted to simply lay there for a moment and collect herself, staring upwards at the partly cloudy sky that she definitely recognized.

"I did it!" She croaked, turning her head and spitting out a stream of syrupy blood onto the grass, "I'm back!"

And indeed she was. It happened a bit differently than Gloria had been expecting, but she recognized that sky, and the house that rose up above the bushes she found herself surround by. That was Bill's house! His OLD house! The wishing stone must have dropped her in Bill's backyard! She was back in 2018! And just as soon as her body stopped feeling like she was dying she'd get up and...

A nearby cough disrupted her train of thought, her head snapping painfully towards the sound and her eyes widening as she saw who had made the sound. There, laying next to Gloria in the bushes, was the incredibly attractive form of Bobbi Bolstrum, her breasts attempting to smother the pretty girl as she lay in a crumpled ball of broken branches, leaves and a bright green dress that was now in tatters. Small streaks of blood crisscrossed the woman's legs and arms from her own impact into the foliage.

It was her! That girl that Willow was engaged to!

"Bobbi?" Gloria croaked out as she pushed herself up into a sitting position, wincing in pain but fairly sure that, save for a few cuts and what would certainly be bruises later, she hadn't actually broken anything.

"That's not my fucking name!" The girl in front of her growled. Or at least purred, given how airy and soft it was. The breast-heavy redhead flipped herself over off of her stomach and onto her large rear, nearly flopping over again as her massive tits threw her off balance. "Call me that again and I swear I'll rip your fucking throat out!" The girl hissed as she flailed about, her hands planting themselves firmly on the ground behind her to stabilize the human form of a tectonic shift as her breasts finally stopped moving. The wide green eyes fixed Gloria with a look of hatred that she swore looked familiar.

"Then who are you then!?" Gloria groaned as she pulled herself to her feet, brushing the collected twigs and leaves off her business suit as...

Wait.

"OH GOD I'M STILL OLD!" Gloria gasped as she realized her body hadn't changed back to it's youthful form. She had expected the wish to just rewind time, that's what she had wanted, what she had planned on doing but then...

"You fucking bitch! You made me mess up my wish!" Gloria said, pointing a bony finger towards Bobbi's sitting form.

"I had to get that fucking rock somehow, Titsapolous! Not like you were gonna fucking share it! You were gonna fucking leave me there weren't you!? YOU WERE GONNA LEAVE ME LIKE THIS!" Rob screamed back as he pulled himself to his feet, the tattered remnants of his dress tearing more and slipping off one of his massive boobs.

"Wait...Rob!?" Gloria stumbled backwards at the small but stacked beauty in front of her. Admittingly she may have been a bit slow on the realization that the girl in front of her had shared the same last name as 2018 Shermer's disgraced bully, but then again she'd been having a low key freak out over, well, everything that had happened to her in the future. But there was only ONE person that called her Titsapoloous.

"No no, I'm the fucking Tit Fairy. Give me the rock before I have to kick your ass again!" Rob said as he took a stick forward, wincing at the sharp sticks that were poking the soft skin on the bottom of her tiny feet.

"Fuck you! I wouldn't give this rock to you even if my life depended on it!" Gloria spat as she took another step backwards, nearly tripping over one of the exposed roots of the tree they had found themselves under. Rob shouldn't have even been here! Gloria had specifically wished for HER and HER alone to be back in 2018, so what had happened!? Gloria looked at her closed fist and expected it to be glowing with anger and frustration, but there was no light coming from it.

'Maybe...Maybe when she bit me it changed something?' Gloria, even after experiencing the future, was still entirely unprepared for creative thinking. At least when it came to not trying to creatively tear down a rival or some innocent that she had deemed unworthy. 'Maybe if a part of me was...in her, it made us count as one?'

Gloria felt a headache coming on and she wasn't entirely convinced it was the fierce physical beating she had just taken.

"Well that can be arranged" Rob growled again as he took a deceptively menacing step towards Gloria.

But that was when they both heard it.

"HEY BILL!"

It was Gloria's voice ringing out over the otherwise quiet neighborhood, but not the old, mature voice that Gloria was surprisingly (and worryingly) becoming used to. Instead of was the youthful voice of Gloria as she had been. The Gloria that Gloria should have been returned to being.

"Oh shit!" Gloria hissed, pushing Rob's top-heavy form away as the bully advanced on her. Gloria's hand pushed deep into Rob's exposed, pillow soft breast.

"WooOOAaah!" Rob squealed in alarm as the much stronger older woman simply stopped his advance. He waved his muscle-less arms around in wide circles as he took a couple of un-even steps backwards, struggling to keep his balance. "Fucking Christ I HATE THIS BODY!" Rob pouted as he finally succeeded in not collapsing back on his big booty. But Gloria wasn't listening, instead the gray-haired girl turned woman was staring intently towards the back of the Strasserman house, which Rob was only now recognizing.

"Holy shit!" He whispered to himself as he suddenly realized where they both were. He pushed himself out of the bushes and joined Gloria by the tree, staring at the back of Bill's old house. But where Gloria was fixated on the strip of lawn that led to the front of the vintage Strasserman abode, Rob's eyes were locked on the small windows that lay near the ground, visible between the rose bushes that lined the base of the two story home. Namely, his large, green eyes were focused on the one that was ajar. The one he'd used in what felt like a lifetime ago.

'Am I down there?' Rob wondered. When all the madness had started this morning he had been down in the basement, on orders from Big Jon but devising his own plan. And then he'd ended up in the future, stuck as a pathetic fuck-toy for a nerd girl that had crawled out of his two worst enemies.

But Rob's introspection ended when Gloria spun around and grabbed him, painfully, by one of his bare shoulders, the bony ringers digging into his soft flesh. He fought the urge to squirm under the grip and intense stare that the former queen of Shermer High was giving him.

"Listen. I can't really explain it, but I'm on the other side of the house. If you help me, right now, I'll make a special wish for you with the gemstone. We just have to go make sure that the...other me doesn't make a wish, okay?"

All Rob wanted to do was fight back. He hated being this small, he hated being this weak, he hated the fact that no matter what he seemed to have to fucking take orders from people he hated.

But what choice did he have?

"...Fine" Rob said, nodding in agreement, his mane of redhair bobbing in the morning light.

In the distance, from under the darkening morning clouds, there was a clap of thunder.

“Mom, Dad...I've got great news, and I just HAD to tell both of you in person!” she said excitedly.

Bill's mind melted. The very first attractive woman to ever kiss him was his own daughter. He felt simultaneously disgusted, confused, and embarrassed. He wasn't anywhere near emotionally ready to be a parent, and yet, here she was, bursting with energy and gusto. He heard her speak, saw her mouth moving a mile a second, but the entire time Bill was lost in thought at this strange new reality. Suddenly he saw Willow childishly snapping her fingers in his face.

“Dad! Didn't you hear a word I said!?” giggled Willow. “I'm pregnant!".

Bill felt the fatherly part of his mind start blaring alarms. Some random guy had touched his little girl! Had deflowered her and put his seed into her! She was too young for this, her life was going to change! The moment he found out who the bastard was that did this to Willow he was going to-

Bill's teenage mind, however, pushed those thoughts away as he let loose a mildly shocked "What?" while Tammy simply began squealing in joy and enveloping her daughter in an immense hug and bouncing up and down in the middle of the living of their home.

Gloria, Ahn'Ger Stone still in hand, however, simply stared at the scene in shock and annoyance. This had totally not been what she had had in mind when she had wished for Bill and Tom to be a married couple. They were supposed to be old and decrepit, not middle aged, well off and a happy family with a successful daughter! And Gloria herself was NOT supposed to be some ancient looking clone of her mother. But whatever anger she had possessed had been spent and the Stone wasn't responding to her multitude of silent wishes to be young again, to be back home, or to make Bill and...'Tammy' miserable in some way or form. Maybe if she tried thinking about the last fight she and Tom had it would...

But Gloria was interrupted as Bill's internal conflict between his teenage mind and fatherly mind seemed to reach some kind of truce as Willow gave his body a huge hug.

"So, uh, honey...Who is the father? Do we know him?" Bill asked, and Willow looked up at Bill and said...

Option 1: "It's Jonathan Ingerman! You know, the guy that owns your company? He bought the animation studio and came in for a tour and we just fell in love!"

Option 2: "Um...I may have gone to a party and had a, um, really good time with some guy? Please don't be mad, dad!" Willow says as her face blushes with shame at getting pregnant from a one night stand.

1141221321.content:
For a fraction of a second, Bill had seen a worried look cross Willow's otherwise radiant face, as if she were afraid to answer the question. Maybe she was concerned with what his response would be? That didn't make much sense to Bill. He was a protective father, sure, but his lifetime of new memories implied that he wasn't the smothering, oppressive kind of protective, not the kind to threaten lovers. He just wanted her to be safe.

Whatever it was that had bothered his newly acquired daughter, her demeanor had immediately snapped back to her current state of excited jubilance. She smiled a smile so gleeful that it would make Helen of Troy look uglier than a demonically possessed Regan MacNeil, though that may have just been the proud papa in him speaking.

Almost nobody else had noticed the momentary lapse in cheer from Willow, least of all the teenage version of Bill. The transition had occurred so fast that it could hardly be said to have occurred at all. The middle aged, world-weary version of Bill, however, had noticed, and his fatherly memories had told him that look was something to be concerned about.

For example, it was the same look that Willow had given when she got caught experimenting with drugs for the first time when she was thirteen.

It was also the same look she had given when Bill had walked in on her making out with her then girlfriend Kylie Perkins when she was fourteen. The pretty, dark haired Kylie had actually sneaked in through Willow's bedroom window late at night like in all of those goofy romantic comedies. Kylie's parents had to be called, and a big to do was made about it, utterly embarrassing both girls, which a part of Bill's new set of memories still chuckled over.

To his shame, it was also the same look Willow had given Bill when she was seventeen and he had said no to her dream of moving out west to California so she could attend CalArts, one of the best animation schools in the country. Bill had told Willow that he didn't believe that she old enough to know what she really wanted to do with her life, or to live on her own, and that she had grown up too spoiled and had it too easy to really know how to take care of herself. Secretly, he hadn't wanted to admit that the primary reason he said no was how damned expensive it would be for Bill to pay for. After debating with her father for close to an hour about it, where voices were raised and things were said that were not meant, Willow had finally admitted defeat, giving Bill that same glimpse of concern in her eyes as her dreams turned to dust. She held back the tears in her eyes, and returned quietly to her room.

That night, Bill recalled the absolutely vicious tongue lashing that Tammy had given him, one of their only major arguments in nearly twenty years of marriage, and how she had made him sleep on the couch. The next morning, the middle aged Bill Strasserman had reluctantly changed his mind and agreed to pay for Willow's tuition.

That strange trip down memory lane had made the former teenage boy temporarily forget where he was. His mind zoned back to where he was now, in the foyer of his and Tammy's beautiful, old fashioned home as Willow hugged her dad tightly across his broad shoulders.

"The father" Bill repeated. "Who's the father?"

Willow grinned as she slowly let go of him.

"It's Jonathan Ingerman!" she squealed in her reedy voice.

"Jo-Jonathan Ingerman?" he stuttered.

"Yeah! The guy who owns your company! You said that you and mom used to go to high school with him back in the day? He bought the animation studio I work at last month. He came in for a tour of the facility, and once he realized who I was, we just fell in love!"

Bill immediately went quiet. A chill rippled across his back.

Big Jon.

The bully who had made his and Tom's life absolute hell for years was now the father of their grandchild.

Big Jon.

That. Piece of shit.

His face went red. His body began to tremble.

Tammy looked on in concern, dread crossing her own face.

"Um...honey, isn't Jon a little old for you?" she asked Willow as diplomatically as possible, enveloping her beautiful daughter's hand with her own.

"I thought that at first too, mom, but he's so sweet! He's just like a big, soft huggy teddy bear. Really nice guy, and don't tell Dad, but he looks really hot for his age" she giggled in a stage whisper.

"Baby, he's our age. Doesn't that bother you at least a little bit?"

"No, not really. Age is just a number. Oh, by the way! I guess you want to know how it all happened, right? Well get this: a couple of days after meeting Jon, he took me to Switzerland for the weekend! Just like out of the blue. I woke up with a text message asking me "Hey, want to go to Zurich with me?". Who was I to say no to that!? Naturally, one thing led to another. We had dinner after we got off thr plane, and he promised me that any ideas I had for any shows would immediately get greenlit, and I sure have a few! Then later on after some clubbing, we rented a hotel room, ordered some champagne, and voila! Now I'm going to be a mom. Isn't it exciting!?"

Tammy gulped.

"I think you're just moving a little fast. Your father and I knew each other for years before we decided to get married, let alone decide to have you."

"Mom, I thought you'd be excited! I mean, I thought that YOU of all people would approve. Grandbabies! I mean, you're going to get to spoil him rotten! Or Her. Obviously we don't know the gender yet since I'm only a few weeks along, not that we'll push them into anything! Oh, by the way, we've decided that we're not taking doing any genetic enhancement procedures. We're old fashioned that way."

"I...I am excited and happy for you, honey, I just..."

The middle aged blonde took a deep breath.

Despite having adapted to this reality far more comfortably than her husband Bill, the former Tom Ackerton possessing a second set of memories that were nothing short of blissful, Tammy still recalled the intense fear she had of Big Jon. He was bad news, practically her husband's arch enemy, the Lex Luthor to his Superman, and she certainly would never approve of him as a potential son in law if Willow ever decided to marry him, let alone the father to her grandchild. She could see the anger on Bill's face. He was practically about to burst.

"I'm just worried about how your father is taking it."

Willow swiveled around. She saw her father's eyes about to pop out of his skull. He shut them in an attempt to calm down.

"Oh no, I was so worried about this! Daddy, please don't get angry! Jonathan and I are in love! He's not the guy you remember from high school, he's a nice guy now..."

Willow touched her father's shoulder, which was usually a surefire way to calm him down, but she could still feel him struggling to control his furious tremble.

OK, at least finally there's some drama happening thought Gloria to herself as she watched the family drama occur around her, thrilled that Bill and Tom's perfect little storybook marriage wasn't so perfect after all. A wicked smile flashed across her face as she saw that her former arm candy's geeky friend turned husband was finally about to go apeshit at their daughter for getting knocked up. She stared at the magic stone in her hand, in awe of its power, wondering how she was going to escape from this once things got too heady. For now, she enjoyed being a spectator at this suburban meltdown.

In the middle of all this tension, a cold, disembodied female voice erupted out of nowhere and spoke. It was the same robotic voice that had announced Willow's visit minutes earlier.

"Bill, are you OK?" the voice asked. "My sensors tell me that your blood pressure has spiked, and unusual activity in your amygdala suggests that you are under extreme emotional distress. Should I call an ambulance? Schedule a therapist appointment or perhaps a massage?"

Steadily, Bill's body began to calm down. He stopped quaking in anger, and Willow let go of him.

Slowly, he opened his eyes.

"No, no, no, none of that will be necessary, A.M.Y. I'd just like to be left alone for now. I'm implementing deactivation code 599245792WJKXL3359."

"Deactivation code recognized. I will resume normal functions in: One hour."

The robotic voice slowly faded away.

Bill was so glad that his older memories remembered that code, because he did NOT to be bothered right now, especially not from some futuristic Amazon Alexa. He was too worried about how much his two sets of experiences were slowly beginning to converge, and how much was starting to mix up his actual teenage life with this ephemeral grown up one. He and Tom(And reluctantly, he admitted to himself, Gloria) needed to escape this reality before they forgot who they really were...


Option 1: Before Bill can gather Tom/Tammy and Gloria and try and wish themselves back to normal, the middle aged Jonathan Ingerman arrives at the Strasserman family home, causing tension to escalate.

Option 2: Something else.

1141222.content:
“Wow...2058” said Bill out loud. Bill had always been a fan of science fiction, and besides been forty years older, this was pretty much a dream for him. He walked around the house and noticed the subtle differences between 2018 and 2058 with geeky interest.

Meanwhile, Gloria turned on the television. One of the local TV stations was the first station that appeared. A mild mannered looking news reporter was explaining something, so Gloria turned up the volume.

“Representatives of the Lowell Corporation are still in talks with the native Martian inhabitants to begin constructing a human colony near the planet's southern equator. This will require the use of controversial terraforming technology which might disrupt the planet's native ecosystem...”

“Boring!” said Gloria. She changed the channel to CBS. Somehow, The Price Is Right was STILL airing in 2058.

“Huh, I wonder if Bob Barker is still alive” she mused

“Hey wait, turn that back!” yelled Bill in his deeper, manlier voice, running from the kitchen.

“I heard something about Mars, turn that back”.

“But Plinko!” said Gloria, smiling at giving Bill a hard time. Gloria turned the channel back to the news.

The news program had ended. Now some insipid talk show was airing.

“Damn it” said Bill, pulling out his cell phone to look for answers. The Android that his parents had bought for him last year had been replaced by a newer, sleeker type phone that looked more like a piece of glass than a phone. Bill struggled to understand how 2058 phones worked.

“Hello, I'm Sophie Wagner, and is this is The Pulse. Mutants. They used to be fantasy characters in comic books and film. Now that they exist in reality, and people are frightened of what they can do. On today's show, we're going to explore the question of whether those with superhuman abilities are a threat to civil society, or if we are witnessing the birth of an a brand new social demographic that must be protected and cherished. After the tragic events at O'Hare airport, we...”

Gloria flipped through the channels again, yawning, and found a station airing old episodes of Breaking Bad. She had never watched a single superhero movie and had no idea what the hell mutant was, just that she didn't care.

11413.content:
Bill had just seen the last Avengers movie last week, the one with the Infinity Stones, so when he noticed that the mysterious gemstone he found was suddenly glowing in Gloria's hand, red flags started going off in his head.

“Gloria” he said calmly but firmly, “Could you give me back my gemstone, please?”

Gloria turned from Tom to Bill in exasperated annoyance and gave a disgusted sound.

“Seriously, Bill? Of all times, you pick this one?

“Just give him back his toy, Gloria!” said Tom, trying to defend his good friend.

“Shut up, Tom!” shouted Gloria.

Indeed, Gloria had been trying to avoid a situation like this when she approached Bill's house, and the fact that she wasn't prepared to deal with when things turned bad or at least just not turned out the way she wanted it to was stressing her the hell out. She was used to laying down the law with her friends and her friends spinelessly just going along with what Gloria wanted out of fear or self interest. Subconsciously, Gloria suspected that she probably got this trait from her mother, but right now she wasn't interested in soul searching. She was hurt, and she couldn't understand why Tom and Bill were teaming up against her. So she exploded.

“I just wish you and Bill could just feel the pain I feel!” she screamed with indignant umbrage. As she did, the Ahn'Ger stone exploded into action. It suddenly felt deathly cold, causing Gloria to drop it. The entire block glowed in its brilliant green light.

“I was afraid of this” said Bill quietly to himself before the three of them were immediately transported...

...to Gloria's own home.

“What the hell just happened!?” yelled Tom, but somehow he heard Gloria's voice instead of his own.

Gloria herself now realized that she was sitting in her living room on the large, comfy red couch she passed by every morning. She looked around. Yeah, this was definitely her living room.

“What the hell?” she said, repeating Tom's own refrain. “How did I get back here?”

Sitting next to her on either side were identical copies of herself. Both girls had the same black hair, the same green eyes, the same facial structure as her own. Hell, they were wearing the same exact clothing as she was. They both were wearing same sandals she was wearing, and each had the same silver toe nail polish she did. They were twins...no, triplets. Identical triplets.

“Who the hell are you two!?” yelled Gloria as the two impostors were staring at their hands in disbelief. One had even pulled a mirror out of their purse and stared slack-jawed at herself.

“Oh my god” said Bill. “I've turned into Gloria Vanapoulos”.

Suddenly, the three teenagers were interrupted by an older female voice coming from the top of the stairs.

“Gloria, Natasha, Ursula...what are you all still doing here?”

She was Ariadne Vanapolous. And she did not look happy.

"Girls. Aren't you going to be late for school?" Ariandne asked, a wicked smile on her face.

Natasha and Ursula, the former Bill and Tom, looked over to see Gloria's face go white, and her eyes widen. Both of them shot a glance at each other. Suddenly, a whole lot about Gloria made sense.

"We have plenty of time, Mother. We can still make it on time. We won't get in trouble." Gloria said. Natasha grew wide eyed. Gloria was a totally different person around her mother.

"Good. Then get going! You... what's this?" Ariadne said, looking to the ground. Natasha watched as Ariadne picked a green gemstone off the ground. It was that stone that changed everything! Natasha knew she had to have it if she was going to fix Ursula and Gloria, and herself. Slowly, she got up. Gloria looked on in fear, Ursula in curiousity.

"Mother..." Natasha began. She felt so odd saying that, but she had to play the part. "That stone... belongs to me. May I have it back, please?" Natasha said, in the most careful way possible.

1141322.content:
Ariadne squinted down at her trio of daughters. Her nose was so far upturned, Natasha was worried she’d catch an eyeful of snot. She and her sisters sucked in a silent breath as their mother raised a finely trimmed eyebrow. ‘This is it,’ Natasha thought, too afraid to shut her eyes in fear and preparation. ‘This psycho is about to send us to another reality.’

Then Ariadne huffed, and dropped the stone into Natasha’s open palm. “Alright, dear, there you are. And thank you for using your manners. For once,” she added, along with an overly emphasized eye roll. Before Natasha, Ursula, or Gloria could even thank their mother, they were nearly shoved out onto the sidewalk. “Have fun at school, dears!” Ariadne called before slamming the door shut.

Ursula was the first to recover from the sudden exodus. She gave herself a practiced once-over, as though she’d done it alone or in a mirror many times. Perhaps she has, in this reality. “We don’t even have our backpacks,” she pouted.

Natasha dusted herself off, and checked he stone. Luckily, it hadn’t been harmed by the concrete sidewalk. She didn’t want to think about what would happen if the stone were damaged, or worse, destroyed. “I have the stone,” she announced to her sisters. “We can worry about backpacks when we’re all home.”

“And how do you plan on getting us there, sister?” Even though they shared the same voice, Gloria’s was distinct in its annoyance. Natasha didn’t want to admit it, but she had been hurt by Gloria’s sarcastic use of the word sister. In her mind, they truly had been sisters for eighteen years. “How do you even know that stone can get us home?”

“I’ll make a wish, just like you did to get us here,” Natasha fired back. Ursula tried and failed to stifle a laugh.

“Do you think I wanted to wind up with two clones following me around?” Gloria screeched. “I won’t be able to look in the mirror for at least a month now! God, I think I’ve developed a brand new disorder because of this.”

Ursula put her hands on her hips and coughed. “What’s your point, Natasha?”

“My point is—” Gloria stopped and stared blankly at Ursula. “Natasha? I’m Gloria, you idiot!”

“I’m sorry! We all look the same, I can’t tell us apart! Maybe that’s what we should wish for? ”

“No, we go home first!” Natasha shouted. She could remember having to reign her sisters in when she was little. Appaarently she’d never outgrown the habit. “Gloria, what’s your point?”

Gloria took her fingers off the bridge of her nose and looked between her sisters. “I didn’t know what the stone could do when I made my wish. And if I remember correctly, I wished for you two to feel my pain, and not to turn into human copy machines. That means the stone has its own screwed up interpretations of wishes.”

“So what, we just don’t make any more wishes? We can’t do that Gloria! I can’t be stuck like this for the rest of my life!”

Ursula let out a high pitched scream and stamped her foot. “Alright, who’s speaking now!?”

The gemstone began to glow in Natasha’s hand, and after last time, each of the sisters noticed it. Gloria and Ursula bent their legs and curled their fingers, ready to pounce. Natasha put the stone behind her back, and curled her other hand into a fist. It was a magical Mexican standoff, for the right to reality. The girls shifted their eyes, studying one another’s movements. Then Gloria kicked herself forwards, Ursula leapt onto Natasha, and the stone fell into one of their hands.
