The gemstone began to glow in Natasha’s hand, and after last time, each of the sisters noticed it. Gloria and Ursula bent their legs and curled their fingers, ready to pounce. Natasha put the stone behind her back, and curled her other hand into a fist. It was a magical Mexican standoff, for the right to reality. The girls shifted their eyes, studying one another’s movements. Then Gloria kicked herself forwards, Ursula leapt onto Natasha, and the stone fell into one of their hands.

Option 1: Gloria smashes the stone on the sidewalk resulting in a flash of magical energy!

Option 2: Before one of the girls can use the Stone to make a wish, it is swatted out of their hand and goes skittering down the sidewalk to stop at the feet of someone who had been watching the sisterly feud with some interest..But who was it?
11413223.title: The Quarreling Sisters (Options)

114132231.content:
"AHA!" Gloria screamed as she wrapped her fingers tightly around the green gemstone that had caused her on and off again boyfriend and his best friend to suddenly become her identical sisters that she was currently fighting with. But her triumph didn't last long as Ursula and Natasha stopped slapping at each other and turned to stare at Gloria before they dogpiled the original Vanapolous.

"GIVE IT TO ME GLORIA ITS MINE!" Screeched Natasha, formerly Bill Strasserman, who desperately wanted to be be anyone else but a clone of Gloria in this moment. She had been such a fool to simply hand over the gemstone earlier, in the different reality where she had still been a boy! And why? Why had she, then Bill, let someone who he largely hated look at his treasure? She had to get the Stone back, she had to wish for something, anything other than this reality!

"GLORIA YOU BITCH!" Squealed Ursula, formerly Tom Ackerton, who desperately wanted to use the Stone to end all the problems that had befallen him since he and Gloria had officially begun dating. He could use it to simply wind back the clock, to have never met Gloria,or to make her be a good girlfriend, or just...Well, he'd wish for something to make his life better! But he had to get it from his ex turned sister before she used it to further punish him and Bill for, well, simply existing. Gloria was a bitch like that.

the two former boys piled onto Gloria and began clawing at her identical tanned skin with their new longer nails, leaving bloody gouges in formerly flawless flesh that caused Gloria to shriek in pain as she failed under the combined weight of her new sisters as they fought to wrestle the magical gemstone out of her hand. She wanted to use the anger inside of her to make a wish, but the pain from multiple slashes with long nails, the weight on her thin frame, the concrete sidewalk digging and scraping into her flesh, the pain over-rode her anger. All the Stone could do in this start was flicker weakly as Gloria's anger punched through the pain, but it wasn't enough.

In Gloria's mind the Flight part of her Fight or Flight instinct kicked in, the pain telling her to get as far away from her psycho sisters as she could, and she began flailing wildly, arms and legs kicking randomly as she tried to get Natasha and Ursula off her. She couldn't even truly see what she was doing, the breasts of one of the other girls pressed up against her face as they used their entire body weight to pin Gloria to the ground while they clawed at her hand, all Gloria could do was just swing and kick into the fashionable void.

She felt a shoe connect with something pliable yet firm as the weight on her legs shifted suddenly, the girlish 'oof!' in a voice that sounded like her own as the weight suddenly shifted. Her fist connected with something hard that was followed by a high pitched scream of pain and something warm and hot pouring through the cracks in her fingers. Her other hand pounded against the concrete as it struggled to stay free of the pointed claws that were trying to dig their way to the magical gemstone.

And then she felt something give way within her clenched fist as it slammed hard against the sidewalk, and then green-gold light pushed through the flesh and fabric pressing against her face.

'OH NO!' Was all Gloria had time to think as the shattered Ahn'Ger Stone released a blast of magical energy as it broke beyond all repair.

Option 1: The flash subsides, and the three girls untangle from each other. Gloria, Natasha and Ursula see the world has turned slightly green, and all three of the girls has a golden glow around them. What had happened?

Option 2: The flash subsides and Gloria, Ursula and Natasha find themselves the same, moments before the brutal fight that caused the Stone to break. Ursula and Natasha act as if nothing was wrong, and only Gloria seems to remember the old realities. But with no magical stone to change back, it appears as if she's stuck with her ex and his best friend as her new sisters. For life.
114132231.title: Shattering The Stone

1141322311.content:
There was a brief moment of silence as the Ahn'Ger Stone impacted with the hard concrete sidewalk, as if the entire world had been put on mute. And then with a flash of the verdant light and a gust of wind, sound returned to the world as the gemstone shattered into dozens of green shards, the inner gold teardrop blowing away in the gust of wind and covering the Vanapolous sisters.

"GLORIA, WHAT THE FUCK DID YOU DO!?" Natasha screamed, nailed hands flying up to her eyes as the gold dust flew into them, her long nailed hands carefully trying to dig the irritant out as she rolled off of Gloria. This was just perfect! The Stone was gone, and with it, any chance that she had at turning back into Bill!

'I didn't even get to use it!' She mentally pouted. The power to re-write reality and she'd stupidly handed it over to one of the worst people in the world.

"I COULDN'T SEE! YOU BITCHES WERE KILLING ME!" Gloria screeched in return as she scrambled to her feet as she pointed a long, gold-flecked finger at her momentarily blinded sister, fighting the urge to continue the brawl by taking advantage of that fact. It only briefly occurred to her that she wasn't supposed to have sisters, and that, due to her actions, she was now stuck with her bitter ex and his best friend who hated her for the rest of her life.

"Leave her alone! You just should have let us have the damn thing Gloria!" Ursula said as she herself stood up, brushing the gold dust off of her shirt and trying to shake it out of her previously styled mane of raven black hair. She gave Natasha a shove, having not seen her roll off of Gloria. "Why do you always have to make things more difficult! Now we're stuck like this, Gloria!"

"I'm Natasha you bimbo!" The shoved sister said as she flailed blindly to keep herself from falling over before pointing a finger outward towards a nearby tree, completely opposite of her intended target, "She's Gloria!"

"Well, I'm sure this is your fault also" Ursula said, her face tightening into a fierce pout as she struggled to tell her new, and likely permanent, sisters apart once again. "Why is it so hard for me to tell you both apart? Why couldn't your would have made us look different, Gloria! I wish I could tell us all apart!"

The moment the word 'I wish' came out of Ursula's mouth, something strange happened. A familiar glow surrounded her body, her hair re-styling itself as the black was burned away by a brilliant glowing gold as is floated in the wind (despite there being no wind). Ursula herself squealed in alarm as her vision took on a green-gold tint and her body seemed to feel...lighter? The reluctant triplet looked down to see that she was, indeed, floating almost an inch off the pavement!

"OH MY GOD!" She screamed. Gloria simply gasped, ignoring the pain from a split lip, as her sister apparently developed superpowers.

"What? What's happening!? I can't see!" Natasha cried from the ground, one arm outstretch in front of her while another one still carefully rubbed her eyes. "Gloria? Ursula? I wish I knew what was going on!"

And much like her sister, Natasha's body suddenly exploded with otherwordly light, her eyes snapping wide open to reveal two pools of swirling golden light instead of the green eyes that she had been cursed with as a clone of Gloria. She gasped in surprise (and more than a little relief) as her vision returned, even if it was like watching a poorly developed film. And she, much like the former Tom Ackerton, was now floating half an inch off the sidewalk. It was actually a bit more, but the body she had been given had a substantial rear, and whatever was powering this event seemed to take...proportions into account.

And Gloria, the cause of everything and one that was definitely not about to be left out of something, especially if her former ex turned sister was involved, simply muttered "I wish that was happening to me!". And without fail, her body began to glow as well, her fingernails turning into bright pinpricks of light as she began to float as well, as her flesh was mended in her newfound aura.

The three sisters looked at each other in shock before...

Option 1: The sisters are now living incarnations of the Ahn'Ger Stone, forced to grant one angry, twisted, irreversible wish to any individual that makes one. As if on cue, Ariadne rushes out of the house.

Option 2: The Vanapolous triplets suddenly begin turning into a replacement gemstone.
1141322311.title: The Golden Aura

11413223112.content:
The Vanapolous Triplets stared at each other in stunned silence for a moment as they each took in their new, glowing forms.

"Holy shit! Look at your hair Ursula!" Natasha said, finally breaking the silence as she, somehow, stood up while never touching the sidewalk. "It's glowing! What happened to me? Everything is all gold and green so I can't tell if mine changed color or not!" The girl, formerly Bill Strasserman, grabbed her own mane of previously styled hair and held it in front of her squinted glowing eyes, which suddenly went wide as an answer popped into her brain. "Oh wait, it's my eyes, isn't it?"

"They're really shiny and gold like my hair!" Ursula ran her hands through her hair, sending out a flurry of golden sparks that lazily drifted to the ground. "This is so cool! And now we can tell each other apart!" The former Tom Ackerton was immensely relieved to have that particular problem taken care of. Despite having glowing gold hair and floating under some unknown power, the new girl was simply relieved that for once in her life as a Vanapolous, she'd be able to tell who was Natasha (the sister she liked) and Gloria (the sister she hated because she was, like, a total bitch). The fact that only a few minutes ago she hadn't even BEEN a Vanapolous seemed like a fading memory. It was still there but it just seemed..unimportant, especially right now.

"Like hello? You just look like a bimbo now, Ursula! And Natasha just looks some pretentious wannabe with golden contacts in!" Gloria sneered at the two before placing both her hands out in front of her, "Look at these nails!"

Ursula and Natasha shared a look before rolling their eyes. "Whatever Gloria" They said in a very Twinly way.

"Oh, you bitches are just jealous because whatever happened, I look the best" The original Vanapolous said, sticking her tongue out before realizing her sisters (who she remembered not being her sisters, but still did) seemed to be ignoring her. Like always.

"I wonder..." Natasha looked down at her tiny feet in designer sandals and took a cautious, small step before squealing in girlish delight as she FLOATED forward, almost like one of the superheroes in those Marvel movies that everyone liked! The fact that she used to be a Marvel super-fan seemed to have slipped her mind at the moment as she took another step, and another, larger one as she seemed to be going higher into the air! "CHECK ME OUT! THIS IS SO COOL!" She screamed in excitement.

"How are you doing that!?" Her currently golden haired sister said before trying it out for herself, putting her acrobatic cheerleading skills to use as she launched herself into the air, putting the cheerleading skills that had replaced Tom's athletic abilities to good use. Before long she was almost eye level with Natasha, some ten feet off the ground. She and Natasha giggled as they literally walked on air while below them, Gloria struggled with the concept.

"Ugh! This is SO NOT FAIR" Gloria pouted as she only moved upwards a few centimeters at a time. She was just the captain of the cheerleading team, the one that came up with the cheers and kept all the other girls in line, and she wouldn't be caught dead watching those superhero movies, so the concept of having superpowers or how to propel herself was simply not in her wheelhouse. At least, not with reality changing her ex-boyfriend into a clone of her and deeply burying, if not flat out erasing the handful of dates where she actually saw some of those movies and was more than just 'cheer captain Vanapolous'. "Why is this even happening anyway? She whined as Ursula and Natasha pranced around above her.

"It's the gemstone, or whatever was in it!" Natasha said, finally stopping her upwards climb and somehow...just willing herself to float down until she was only a few inches above Gloria, "When you broke it, all the magic power flew into us! And then when we made the wishes it turned all of it on! And before you ask, I know because that was my wish, to know what was happening!" Natasha stuck her tongue out at Gloria before floating upwards again and throwing a slender arm around her fellow magical girl sister.

"What about my wish, Nat?" Ursula said, her face scrunched in confusion while she continued to float and play with her hair.

"Your wish, sis, was to tell us apart! So wherever the gold dust landed on us, that is where all the magic is channeled! So You have really pretty hair, I've got gold eyes and Gloria just has a bad nail job. She just wished what was happening to us would happen to her, so her wish didn't come with anything more than lightbulb fingers" The girl formerly known as Bill and her favorite sister both started giggling as they stared down at Gloria, who was now only a few more inches higher than she was before.

"At least you'll save mom and dad a few pennies on the electric bill now, Gloria!" Ursula taunted as she freed herself from Natasha's grip and cartwheeled through the air, "Now you won't have to turn all the lights on when you go to the bathroom in the middle of the night!"

"SHUT UP!" Gloria fumed. It just wasn't fair! SHE had been born first, so that made HER the leader of the triplets! She should be the one with all the power and gloating over her sisters, not the other way around!

'You're also the only REAL Vanapolous' The quietest part of her whispered before being swept away by jealousy. 'Maybe...If we all have the gemstone's magic, maybe we can make our own wishes? Then they'll HAVE to respect me and treat me like they should!'

"I...I WISH THAT" Gloria began, finger pointed at Natasha who was wearing a shit eating grin beneath the creepy gold eyes, but stopped as the smug face above her turned to fear with a terrified gasp.

"Oh god, we're-" Was all Natasha could say before she, along with Gloria and Ursula, were surrounded by dark green mist. The mist began to swirl around them, faster and faster before in an instant, faster than Natasha could finish what she was saying, each girl was covered in a dense green cloud. So dense that only the glowing parts of their forms could be seen.

'We're gonna become the new gemstone!' Natasha thought to herself as she felt a great pressure pushing on her from all sides, crushing her pretty female form until she was just a pair of eyes staring out of the emerald fog. She knew the same was happening to Gloria and Ursula. Ursula was simply being consumed by her hair, the former Tom simply disappearing into the golden mane until it was all that remained. And Gloria, she simply melted away until all that was left of her body were the ten golden fingernails.

The green clouds grew smaller around what remained of their victims, shrinking in size until each cloud was no larger than a human hand as they began to drift closer and closer together until they began to merge. As their prisons became one and each remnant of Gloria, Ursula and Natasha Vanapolous began to touch, their could once again hear each other.

"OH GOD WHATS HAPPENING!?" Ursula's mind screeched in fear and confusion.

"MOMMY!" Gloria's mind sobbed.

"WE'RE BECOMING THE NEW GEMSTONE WE'RE GONNA-" Was all Natasha's mind could get out before all three souls collided in a mental cacophony of screams and emotions that swirled around each other in anguish. The ability to form coherent thoughts vanished from their minds as they were consumed by the pain of this new, unknown transformation. If they could have processed what was happening beyond the pain of the transformation, it might have felt as though they were being drawn towards something as their presences within the swirling golden vortex faded away from the mortal plane and traveled...somewhere else. Before long all that remained of them within was a shade, the last fleeting emotions, thoughts and fragments of personality as the Vanapolous sisters vanished from the mortal plane.

Meanwhile, outside of the mental hell, the green clouds had merged into one, taking on a teardrop shape as it's opacity began to clear, revealing the inner golden teardrop and all that remained of the bodies of the former sisters, a shaped golden core comprised of golden particles that seemed to catch the last rays of the morning sun as it slipped behind the dark clouds of a spring thunderstorm. The transformation complete, the newly reformed Ahn'Ger Stone simply blinked from existence as all trace of the previous owners was erased from reality. The Vanapolous sisters never existed and never would exist again.

All that existed of them now were the remnants that served as the core of a new vessel that allowed humans, mortal creatures full of impulsive, cruel and petty emotions, to make their wildest and angriest dreams real.

In time, perhaps only an hour, perhaps a century, the reborn Ahn'Ger Stone would find a new owner, a foolish mortal that would unleash it's power onto an unsuspecting world, but for now it simply floated in the spaces between realities, waiting for just the right person to say those two fateful words in anger;

"I wish..."

THE END
11413223112.title: Becoming That Which They Beheld

114132231121.content:
The last thing Natasha felt before the mortal world vanished was a sharp, painful pinch and then her incorporeal ears filled with the sound of rushing wind. And high pitched screams as Ursula and Gloria tumbled through the off-green tunnel that the trio now found themselves in, falling (for lack of a better term) towards a golden portal at the far end that grew larger with each passing moment.

'Are we dead? Where are we?' Natasha thought to herself, and heard her voice echoing around her as though she'd said the words out loud. And then, as they had before, the answers came to her. They weren't dead, and they were in some sort of transit tunnel to...somewhere else! She mentally breathed a sigh of relief, since she currently lacked a body and the lungs needed for an actual sigh, and somehow 'reached out' towards the sources of the other feminine screams; Ursula and Gloria. Her sisters lacked bodies just as Natasha did, but their minds were still there, and still their own despite what the magic had done to them.

'Girls!' She called out, but her sisters were still too traumatized by their transformation to hear her. So Natasha went for the solution that suddenly popped into her mind and willed a slap across their mental 'faces', stunning both of the girls into a momentary silence.

'Listen to me! We're not dead! We're just...somewhere else now! Just hang on, the moment we hit the gold portal we'll have bodies again, okay!?' She hissed, and she felt confusion, doubt, and more than a little fear fill the tunnel.

'I...I don't wanna go into the light! I want my mommy!' Gloria sniffled before bursting out into mental sobs. Waves of regret washed over Natasha and she felt the urge to cry as well. For all of her deep seated issues, Gloria had still loved their mother...Who now lived a life where the triplets had never existed.

'I don't understand, Nat! And where are you? All I see is green!' Came Ursula's voice, accompanied by just wave of confusion. Natasha would have rolled her eyes if she had possessed any. Ursula had the misfortune of being the 'dumb' Vanapolous, or at least, the Legally Blonde version of clueless.

'Just...We're fine, okay? We're not dead! Just trust me!' Natasha did her best to clam her sisters down but it was hard for her to put into words what was happening to them, even if she knew in her...mind? Soul? Or whatever amounted to it now was about to happen. A tense silence descended upon the three, broken only by Gloria's muted sobbing as they soared closer and closer to the golden light. In mere moments it now dominated Natasha's view and the light blocked out everything else. what could have been called her throat as a sharp ringing filled the air.

She reached out mentally and grabbed the 'hands' of her sisters. Just in case.

And then they hit...something. It was not unlike a wall but it seemed to give way as the three consciousnesses impacted on it's surface and 'sank' into the golden depths. To Natasha it felt like the moment coming out of a water slide and hitting the pool below, a rush of air before the rough impact and then the cloying wetness as you swam to get out of the way of the person behind you. She felt the 'fingers' of her sisters tear away from her own as she began scrambling to grab hold of something, anything in the blinding brightness. Her mind started to go blank as she sank deeper into the golden light and the sudden crushing pressure around made her feel like she was on the verge of drowning. A panicked thought entered her mind; She was wrong! She really was going to die!

And then with an audible POP, Natasha found herself collapsing unceremoniously onto a hard, cold surface, pain shooting through her shoulder as she gasped for air and wincing as the sharp coldness filled her lungs as she rolled to her knees, hacking up globs of gold that pooled on the hard and impossibly deep green floor beneath her, reflecting an off-color but instantly familiar face up at her.

'Wait...Holy shit!' With a final hack Natasha flopped backwards onto her rear and stared down at her re-constituted form. Or at least, a version of it. Instead of flesh and bone, her arms and the rest of her body were made out of shifting, prismatic crystal that reflected the bright, pale green light that sat far, far above her. Natasha clambered to her feet, finding that she was completely naked, and that her entire body was now comprised of the crystals. She wore no clothes, and she felt something expanding from her back. She whipped her head around and sent her equally crystallized hair flailing and gasped in surprised as a pair of butterfly wings expanded outwards from her shoulders and lower back.

And then her attention was drawn to a noise next to her, and she looked to see two other crystal versions of herself suddenly appear in the air and fall the deep green ground. The crystal twins hacked and groaned as they went through the same process as Natasha had just moments ago. She rushed over to what she immediately knew was her sisters, equally reconstituted as she had been, and helped them to their feet.

Natasha was just about to fill her sisters in when a sharp cough interrupted her, and she looked up to see...Another version of her fluttering down from out of the light?

"Well it seems you FINALLY got here. I was wondering what was taking so long. Writer's block, I suppose" The...other her said, with a casual dismissive wave towards the ball of light, which flickered as if it was annoyed. "Anyway, welcome to the Index, and my name is Sandy. Don't bother telling me yours, I already know, thanks. And no, Ms. Exposition, you don't need to explain things. Just let me talk, okay?"

Natasha was taken aback for a moment before simply nodding.

"Now, you three made an oopsie. You broke the Ahn'Ger Stone, that's the gemstone you were using to make the wishes, and ended up giving your magically created forms so that another Stone could be made and go on and further the story in other ways. Since The Author-" Sandy said, pointing a finger upwards at the ball of light, "Felt sorry for you and had an idea, you get to continue existing as individuals...but you'll be Editors now. I guess you could call yourselves Moderators or DMs of the story, I suppose"

"But...the new Stone...When we fell into the tunnel I could tell that it was copying parts of us!" Natasha said as she and her sisters looked at each other in confusion. Sandy let loose an annoyed sigh and tapped her foot.

"Listen, we only get so much time to say, and you already wasted it with your dramatic entrance, okay? Each Stone in the Multiverse is sentient to a degree. Because it is powered by anger and malice, it copies off of the beings that use it so that it can mess with any future wishes. That's why it never gives a user what they want, it's always got to have a downside. And also why it sometimes manages to escape and find new people to torture" Sandy said, explaining it loudly and slowly as if she was speaking to a group of small children.

"Oh yes, make ME be the jerk" Sandy said, turning to the orb of light and giving it the finger before turning back to the three VERY confused sisters.

"Uh, what's a Multiverse?" Ursula asked, timidly raising a hand as if she was trying to ask a stupid question in a classroom.

"Ugh" Sandy groaned before reaching out and grabbing Natasha's wings.

"OW! Hey!" She yelped, swiping at Sandy with a shimmering hand, but stopped when she saw what the strange entity had done. There, on Natasha's new wing...Was a screen that was showing multiple different versions of herself, and even different people! She actually recognized the boy that was showing up a lot more than she was...

"That's because you WERE the boy!" Sandy said, somehow knowing what Natasha was thinking. "The Multiverse is infinite dimensions and planes of existence. Everything that CAN happen DOES happen, though thankfully WE make sure things stay interesting and PG-13, R at best. That's what we do, and that's now your job as well. That's the condensed version since we're running out of time"

"Wha?" Ursula said, scratching her head. She looked at her own wing, which was blank, in confusion.

"there's no time to explain further. You're each going to act as 'life preservers' for the Multiverse. When things get boring, you go in and mix things up a little and give the audience a hint of something bigger at play, okay? Good!" Sandy said, and waved a hand as three portals opened up beneath their feet..

"Natasha, you get to go offer Bill options to bring back 'classic' universes. Don't worry, you'll know what to say. Gloria, you get to go invoke Godzilla-"

"What!?"

"-And Ursula, well, we haven't found a way to work you in yet so you get to sit in the break room until figure out something for you. Bye girls! Have fun, and remember, be creative!"

And with a SCHLOOP and three identical shrieks of terror, the three new arrivals were sucked into the golden portals and whisked away to other adventures.

Sandy looked upwards at the orb.

"Learn to condense next time, would you? We already had to modify and get rid of the whole 'giant pyramid of desks' where all the other Editors work on the story' bit. And then all the dramatic 'oh noes, we're going to die!' sisterly stuff that you wanted. Just like that dumb '666' chapter you wrote and had to delete over and over. Yeesh"

The orb of light flickered and shuddered as if in protest.

"Yeah yeah. We've already talked about chapter length and how it contributes to less views. But I know you won't change so whatever. Hopefully the ones paying attention will get something out of this weirdo chapter anyway."

Sandy floated towards the light and took her place at a rather unimaginative desk with a keyboard and computer. She arranged her minimal things and looked straight ahead, as if at someone.

"Well, hope you enjoyed this. You'll see more of us in the future, maybe. But for now, this storyline is now at"
114132231121.title: The Index

1141322311211.content:
Sandy was about to declare the story at an End...But a rumble from the energy ball above her suddenly made her say "To Be Continued?"

"Bleh. Warn me the next time you're gonna retro-actively change things? Now my head is all woozy from causality. Not that, uh, anyone that hadn't seen this before is going to be able to tell the difference"

The sun-like sphere flickered, and Sandy suddenly found herself far away from it, standing outside of a small square box.

"Oh. Guess we DID find a use for you..." She said, as new information filled her brain. She shrugged and walked forward, an opening appearing as she approached.

_

Ursula tapped her foot while she sat in the rather plain looking 'waiting room' that she had unceremoniously been deposited into. There was no clock to watch, no magazines to look at...There wasn't even a door! The only thing that was in the short green couch that was about as comfortable as something seemingly hewn out of green crystal could be.

And speaking of...

Ursula brought up the long strands of hair that twinkled in the source-less light that filled the room, watching as it glimmered and refracted and shone through her new body. This was so totally weird, one minute she was fighting with her sisters, then enxt minute they had superpowers and the next minute they were being sucked through some kind of inter-dimensional tunnel, coming out the far end looking like one of those expensive little jewel models! And then that bossy little 'Sandy' version of her said they were basically dead! The really confusing conversation about the 'Multiverse' (whatever that was) sounded like 'Sandy' was putting them all to work for a giant glowing ball for the rest of eternity...Until Sandy had rushed through saying there was no way to 'slot her in' and promptly split the trio up, which Natasha and Gloria being whisked away on 'jobs' immediately while Ursula was stuck with nothing to do because 'they hadn't found a way to fit her in yet'.

The next thing the former Vanapolous knew, she was dropped in this dull little room with nothing to do but play with her hair (which despite it's current appearance, Ursula still was absolutely thrilled about having) and the big wings that had sprouted from her back. She'd always liked long hair on girls, though she wasn't really sure why. How long had she been in here? She was really starting to miss her sisters, especially Natasha and even (just a little bit) Gloria! And after she'd quickly mastered the ability to float and fly (which wasn't all that different from cheerleading) she had quickly grown bored, and that boredom had eventually begun to manifest into nervousness, and then full blown anxiety. With no stimulation or distraction, things were starting to get to her. What if she had been forgotten? What if this was just her life now for the rest of time?

But just as her crystal hair began to curl and frizzle from anxiety, there was a chiming sound as a door opened on one of the walls as Sandy floated in, looking as bored as ever.

"Hey, toots" She began, "So it looks like we may have an opening for you I can't promise anything long-term, but if you pull off your audition you could start climbing ladders. And no, don't ask me any questions, the fourth wall is properly secured against meta commentary and humor. The most I can tell you is that this is largely a contract job, and your supervisor is an Editor we've been really impressed by"

Ursula couldn't think of anything to say.

"Oh yes, that's a great way to extend the chapter length" Sandy said, rolling her eyes, "Listen, just come with me. It's better if you don't talk, since we're not really sure if you're just supposed to be a bit dumb or full on bimbo yet, okay?" Sandy slung an arm around Ursula's winged shoulders and guided her through the door which slammed shut behind them. Ursula turned to look back at her prison but there was nothing there, simply more green-black void.

"Uh..." She started, only to be interrupted by a groan.

"This place is basically a realm of pure creation and imagination. Anything is possible here. Once you've done this job it should, more or less, start making a bit more sense. Consider it on the job training"

"Okay..." It reminded Ursula of the very short lived job she'd had after school, working as a cashier for a local car wash. The manager had showed her the basic ropes for the cash register and then left her to deal with a horde of old ladies and ladies her mother's age and then a couple of pretty horny boys that were clearly just there to hit on her. She'd quit the next day when the manager needed her to wash his son's car, despite the fact the car wash was self-serve and automated.

"Yeah, spoiler alert, didn't really happen. But that's neither here or there. I mean what IS reality, or memory, if just the perception of events filtered through a mixture of chemical and electrical signals in your brain? I mean, if I told you now that you were originally a eighteen year old All American athlete who was dating your sister? In a fictional story made up by multiple individuals as a recreation of an older life you never lived that was originally written by a fascimile of me? Or the fact that you've never lived at ALL, would you believe me?" Sandy waved her hand as the two walked through the emptiness.

"Wait, what?" Ursula suddenly felt a rather intense and crushing feeling of existential terror at what the (other) strange green woman was saying and stopped in her tracks. Sandy floated her way out of a stumble and turned to stare at Ursula with a look of what might have been taken as sympathy.

"Exactly. Sorry, don't mean to get all 'Morpheus' on you. Maybe I just should have led with 'You think that's air you're breathing now' and left it at that but the Big Guy likes to make his references" Sandy pointed upwards, where a small light source shimmered. "And yes, that WAS were you were when you arrived. Don't think about it too much, everything here only makes as much sense as how each person interprets it"

"O-oh" Suddenly Ursula just wanted her sisters. And her mom. But now she wasn't sure if any of those were real...What if her mom wasn't her mom? What if...What if...Ursula sniffled a bit as the crushing implications of, well, everything began to settle down upon her.

"Hey don't be so glum! This was supposed to be a FUNNY chapter! But clearly it got away from us. So much for the meta-proofing on the fourth wall. Anyway, we're here!" Sandy patted the distraught teen on the back and pointed off to the side, where a small desk was waiting. There was an older looking computer, possibly from the 90s or early 2000s sitting on it, as well as an older rotary phone. None of the devices had any visible power cords, but somehow Ursula knew they both worked perfectly. Two small file trays that had the word 'OUT' and 'IN' taped to the side sat on the edge of the desk. Ursula blinked away the tears and walked towards it, touching the surface. It felt the same as the couch in the 'waiting room' had.

"Listen, we're either all made out of crystal here or energy given a defined shape. This isn't a Hilton" Sandy rolled her eyes, glaring up at the small, distant green-gold sun above them, which blinked once in what felt like the equivalent of a shrug.

"What...What do I do?" Ursula asked as she tried to keep her composure.

"It's simple. There's a new project starting up and since it's a little vague in origin, we got an offer by one of the Editors there to possibly elaborate on giving the new cast of unfortunates. They heard we were looking for something to do with you so...You get a shot at the Big Time, even more than your sisters are getting"

"But...You're not telling me WHAT I have to do!" Ursula was getting fed up with this Sandy character and her casual cruelness. Though she wasn't sure now if that was just who Sandy was or if it was just being stuck in this...place for who knew how long, of if that was just how...how she was being written. Was being unsure and clueless how Ursula was supposed to be 'written'? Did any of this mean ANYTHING at all?

"Ugh, enough with the existential shit. Here's the job. Right now, all you need to do is sit here at this desk, and when the phone rings you write down whatever it is you're told to write down on this notecard" Sandy waved her hand and a rather generic looking notecard appeared on the desk with a flash of glitter, "When you're done, you place it into the 'Outbox'. Then whenever something shows up in the 'Inbox', you type it into the computer. The Inbox will clean itself out. Don't worry about not knowing anything about programming, the computer will do most of the work for you"

"Wait. So I've gone through all of this...Just to be an Intern?" Ursula said incredulously, feeling suddenly extremely insulted on top of anxious and afraid.

"Looks like it. Good luck with the plug, Toots!" Sandy said with a smirk and suddenly blinked away, leaving Ursula stranded and alone. After a long moment of conflicting feelings, she sighed and reluctantly sat down at the desk, a chair materializing out of the green floor almost on command and she lowered her crystalline rear into it.

As soon as she had gotten comfortable, the phone rang. She looked at it with trepidation and slowly reached out, picking it up with two shimmering fingers and brought it to her ear, afraid of whatever new nightmare may or may not leap out at her.

"Hello, Ursula" the voice on the other end said, "Please write down the following. Feel free to give it some friendly personality but do NOT divulge any details as to what you may or may not currently know, or where you are now. Are you ready?"

"Y-yes?" She squeaked, pushing a strand of her hair behind her free ear.

"Good. 'To whomever this possibly concerns..."

choices: "I wish you knew what is felt like to be broken up with!!"
"I wish you were a Vanapolous, so you could feel what true wrath is."
"I wish you were as easy to control as the girls in my clique!"
1142.content:
Bill sighed. There was one right answer to Gloria's inquiry. And it was the answer that Gloria didn't want to hear. Truth be told, Bill didn't really want the drama right now. Especially Gloria drama. But this was going to continue, and continue to hurt Tom, if he didn't stand up for himself and his friend. So that's what he did. He took a stand.

"No." Bill said.

The comfortable smile Gloria usually had faded in an instant.

"What?" Gloria asked.

"Look Gloria... for the sake of Tom, for the sake of yourself, please just stop this. It's over. It;s done. Tom doesn't want you back, and you don't even need him back. You're Gloria Vanapolous! You can have any guy you want. Look at what you're doing. Playing victim again. You and Tom didn't work! You're gonna be better off without him. You gotta know that by now." Bill said.

He had just rambled on every thought in his head. Maybe it wasn't corherent, but he hoped it worked.

Judging on the anger building on Gloria face, it didn't.

"You miserable asshole. You think you can tell me what I want? You think you can tell me what to do? I ask you a simple favor and you can't even give me that much? Do you know who you are talking to? Do you know who you are messing with?" Gloria demanded.

"Oh boy." Was all Bill could muster. He instantly regretted trying to help.

"You don't know what you've unleashed here, Bill. God...." Gloria said, neither her nor Bill noticing the green glow emanating from her hand. Neither could have known what the next words out of her mouth would truly mean.
1142.title: Bill Takes a Stand

choices: Bill goes back to elementary school
11422.content:
“You know what?” said Gloria as she waved her hands around in a theatrical way. “Maybe you just don't get it, Bill. My mom always taught me to never take no for an answer, and I'm not taking one today.”

“Maybe that's why you're such a spoiled brat.”

“How DARE you!? God, if only you knew how rough I had it. If only you knew what I've had to go through, how hard I've had to work to get where I am. All of this, Bill? The clothes, the money. My mom never gave me any of it! I've been working my ass off ever since I was twelve, saving up every last penny. I don't even have a car! My mom doesn't even know about Tom! She won't allow me to date anyone, so I've had to sneak behind her back to do it! Didn't you ever wonder why it's always me going to Tom's house and not the other way around? Because if she ever saw Tom, I'd be grounded for life! I'd never be allowed to leave my room!”

“I'm...I'm sorry” said Bill. “

Gloria relaxed and relented a little bit.

“It's OK, Bill. You didn't know. You don't have a crazy control freak for a parent. You don't know what it's like.”

Bill had felt bad about this entire situation to the point where he had momentarily forgotten about his gemstone, still glowing in Gloria's hand.

“Sometimes...I just wish I had somebody that I had somebody. A brother, a sister...anybody who knew what it feels like!”

Just as Gloria finished her dramatic soliloquy, the Ahn'Ger stone flared its cold, emerald light. Gloria noticed the stone had grown very cold and dropped it to the ground.

When she picked it up, Bill was gone.

**

In his place stood a six year old girl. The girl bore a strong resemblance to Gloria. Her long black hair was covered by a pink headband and her green eyes were sparkling, suggesting some sort of mischief that she was planning to unleash very soon. She was clearly a fan of Disney, as her long pink skirt was covered in the various Disney princesses, and her backpack carried the icons of Anna and Elsa on it.

“What just happened?” she said in her high pitched, little girl voice. When she heard it, she was immediately mortified. She looked up and saw Gloria, standing there with the Ahn'Ger stone in her hand.

“Come on Natasha” said Gloria with an impatient air in her voice, albeit one that sounded much more benevolent tone that she had spoken to with Bill a moment ago. “Mom couldn't take you to school today, so I'm walking you and I don't want to be late.”
11422.title: Bill Can't Get Away From Gloria Now

choices: Bill/Natasha succeeds in gaining back the stone
Bill/Natasha fails in gaining back the stone.
114221.content:
Bill took the now taller Gloria's hand, and began to walk with Gloria away from the porch, down towards JFK Elementary School, which wasn't too far from Bill's house... well, Bill's old house, it seemed.

The world was such a blur now for Bill, and so were his memories. On the one hand, he remembered being Bill Strasserman, brother of Kimberly, Daughter of Martha, best friend of Tom, and at most casual acquaintance to Gloria by means of her being his best friend's Girlfriend. Fleeting memories of trying out for the baseball team and competitive Mario Kart against Tom filtered through his mind

But also popping up were memories of being Natasha Vanapolous, Younger sister of Gloria, daughter of Ariadne, best friends with someone named Becky. Random memories of him begging his mom... Ariadne to go to Disney World this summer, and getting her hair done with Gloria now popped up alongside his baseball and Mario Kart ones.

Bill/Natasha was all disjointed in the head. Competeing versions of his life wrestled around in his head, and he had to do something to fix this before he went crazy... or possibly forgot the Bill part of him. But what could have done this? How could he possibly have two lives in his head.

Another memory popped up. One that was common in both of his mental realities... The Green Flash... the stone!

Bill/Natasha looked over to Gloria. In one hand, she held her now younger sister's. The other held the stone that Bill had found this morning. It had to be that stone! And that Stone had to be the way to fix all this, to get her mind straight before it was too late.

The green eyes of Natasha flaired with thought as Bill and Gloria approached JFK Elementary.

"Alright, kiddo. Time to go to school." Gloria told her younger sister.
114221.title: Bill goes back to elementary school

1142211.content:
Bill had reached an impasse. Somehow, that stone he found on his porch had warped reality in this bizarre fashion to where he was now Gloria's adorable little sister Natasha...a sister that hadn't even existed until just moments ago! Bill didn't know Gloria very well, but he knew enough to know that she was an only child. He didn't know how the Ahn'Ger stone had done this, he just knew that he needed it back if he ever wanted to return to his own body. He knew that if he didn't get it out of Gloria's hands and like soon, he would be trapped as Natasha, possibly for the rest of his life. He didn't even LIKE Gloria, much less wanting to be related to her!

“Gloria” he said in Natasha's cute lisp, looking up to her big sister. “Can I see that pretty gemstone in your hand?”. She pointed at Gloria's hand.

“Oh this?” said Gloria, half forgetting she had it or even remembering where it had come from. “Sure. Just make sure nobody steals it from you, Nat.”

Gloria bent down and casually gave Bill/Natasha the Ahn'Ger stone. She then grabbed Bill/Natasha by her little shoulders and kissed her gently on the forehead. “Stay safe. I love you, and Mom loves you too. I'll pick you up at 3:00 P.M”.

For the entire time Bill had been acquainted with Gloria, he had never seen her act so selflessly towards another person. He remembered the fights with Tom, the mean girl bullshit with her little clique, the constant playing of the victim card when she couldn't accept responsibility for screwing up. He had to admit that in this reality, for all of her faults, Gloria was at least a good sister.

“Now go run along. See, there's Becky!” said Gloria, pointing towards another little girl that apparently was Natasha's friend.

Bill smiled and said “Bye Gloria, see you later!” and walked off with the stone, putting it in Natasha's backpack.

Option 1: Bill spends the morning in classes, enjoying being a little kid again. During lunchtime, he heads to the bathroom to try and change back into his original body.

Option 2: At some point, Bill loses the Ahn'Ger Stone and it's found by someone else. They make an angry wish and alter reality even further.
1142211.title: Bill/Natasha succeeds in gaining back the stone

11422111.content:
Bill skipped his way into the school, trying to draw as little attention to himself as possible. For all the issues that had just come up in his life, he had to admit that he was in a new reality ,and for now he had to play by the rules of this reality, lest he get himself in more trouble. If he just started wishing for something and then a teacher took the stone away? Or a kid tries to bully it out of him? He couldn't risk losing it, so for now, he was gonna wait, and he was gonna be Natasha for a bit, until he could get some alone time.

And admittedly, that time as Natasha was a blast. Bill found he could put himself on a sort of auto-pilot thing, where he would just naturally be Natasha. So he did so at points, letting Natasha get some spelling questions wrong, since no first grader would be perfect just yet. But he took control to color just a little bit outside the lines, and during a break-time where the kids played that old classic Heads Up, 7-Up. Bill found himself laughing more than a few times, and genuinely, it was nice to be a kid again, even if he was a girl.

But soon, it was lunch, and after a nice meal of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich and some milk. Bill decided it was time to get serious. So, he made his way to the bathroom, took the Frozen backpack he had now, and took out that stone. Starring at it for a moment, in a sort of wonder about its power, he decided to make a wish.

"I wish I were myself again!" Bill said, his little girl voice echoing in the bathroom.

Nothing happened.

Bill looked to the stone again. Maybe he worded it wrong.

"I wish I was Bill Strasserman again!" Bill said.

Still nothing.

A little frustrated now, Bill tried to take things one at a time.

"I wish I were a boy again!" Bill said. The stone glowed for a slight second, then extinquished.

Bill was getting really mad now. He couldn't be stuck like this! As much fun as he had as a kid, Bill didn't want to be Gloria's sister! He wanted to be Bill! As his anger grew, the stone glowed again, This time, Bill didn't notice.


Option 1: Bill blurts out "I Wish I were an Adult!" making him an adult version of Natasha, now a teacher at the school.

Option 2: At the peak of his anger, the Natasha Auto-Pilot takes over, and Natasha wishes her deepest desire: To be a Disney character.
11422111.title: Kid for a Half Day

114221111.content:
Bill still hadn't quite grasped how the Ahn'Ger stone worked. He thought that it worked like the magic lamp from Aladdin. He thought that all he needed to do was make a wish, and said wish would be granted. He didn't yet notice that only anger, blind fury, was the key towards unlocking its power.

He made a couple of more attempts at wishing to be himself again, forcefully stating “I wish to be Bill Strasserman!” like an incantation before eventually realizing the futility of what he was doing.

Now he was getting mad. Mad enough to not entirely understand what he was saying. As he stared in the mirror at his little six year old self, Bill screamed “I WISH WERE AN ADULT!”, and at last the gemstone in his hand started to glow.

“Finally!” he said in Natasha's lispy six year old vocalization as the mysterious artifact held openly in her hand turned deathly cold and scanned its vibrant luster all over her body. When the glow faded back into the gemstone, Bill stared at his new form.

To put it short, it was not what he had expected.

“What?! How!” he said in a voice that was still female but now of a slightly deeper adult tenor. He glared at his new body. It still wasn't his own! If anything, it looked like how Gloria would look if she were a few years older. A purse had materialized from nowhere on top of the counter. Reluctantly, Bill searched it, hoping to find a driver's license. Thankfully he found one:

“NATASHA VANAPOULOS. DOB: 5/8/1995. Sex: F. Hair: Blk. Eyes: Green. Height: 5'8. Weight: 115lbs. Address: 568 Beaumont Avenue

Putting the wallet and the gemstone back in her purse, Bill pondered with trepidation over what had just happened. He had just altered reality even farther away from its origin point. Now, instead of being Bill or being Gloria's little sister...apparently now he was her older sister, a grown adult. This rock...this magic rock...it seemed to work on anger. That was weird. How would Bill be able to control it if he couldn't think straight?

As much as he was worried about how to return to normal, Bill also realized that he was in the little girl's room, and lunchtime was going to be over in a few minutes. What should he do!? Where should he go now? Did he work here? He stared in the mirror again, hopelessly lost.

“Holy shit” he said in his soft new voice as if noticing for the first time. “I'm hot, aren't I?”.

Indeed, she was. The grown up Natasha was a total knockout, both the youngest and easily the most physically attractive teacher at JFK Elementary School, and she was the object of lust for many of the older fifth and sixth grade students(And no doubt some of the other teachers). She had thick, pouty lips, vibrant green eyes, a youthful yet intelligent looking face, and a killer body that appeared like she took good care of herself. Natasha was wearing a pretty white sweater and some black slacks, as well as some sensible ballet flats on her feet, but in Bill's mind, this woman whose body he was now inhabiting could have been wearing a burlap sack while covered in mud and she still would have taken his breath away.

Bill wanted to stare at his new reflection forever, but he realized that it was now one minute until the end of lunchtime. Instinctively, he grabbed the adult Natasha's purse, slung it over her shoulder, and walked outside the bathroom. As Bill passed by the classroom he had been in all morning, Ms Wick's class, he noticed that the panel next to the door which described her job had changed. Instead of saying “Ms. Wick- 1st Grade”, it now said “Ms. Vanapoulos- Kindergarten”.

Bill, wondering what this was all about, stepped inside. The room and its ornaments had changed a little bit from when he was in here an hour ago, seemingly fit for an even younger audience than the first graders Bill had hung out with all morning. “Not good” thought Bill to himself. The students were already in their seats, anxious to finish their lessons so they could go back home. Bill hesitantly walked to the front of the room, not knowing what else to do, and found a lesson plan sitting on Ms. Wick's desk. It was all written in his handwriting. He turned around and saw a squadron of five year olds staring intently at him. Or rather, her.

“Good afternoon Miss Vanapoulos!” shouted the students in a boisterous sing-song chant, mostly in unison, with a couple of them mispronouncing Natasha's last name and the more socially awkward ones singing slightly off key with the rest of the group or simply not joining along.

Despite this morning being the single weirdest day of his young life, with his entire sense of what was possible in this world being thrown out the window, sweet little kids always needed tending to, and Bill wasn't going to deny them an education. He had already spent the morning as a student. Why not spend the rest of the day as a teacher?

“Hey guys!” he said with a smile in Natasha's surprisingly maternal voice. “So today we're going to start learning about Roman numerals and writing in cursive letters...”

Option 1: Bill/Natasha spends the rest of the day as a Kindergarten teacher while dealing with all of the typical problems: Kids picking on each other, kids not paying attention, and one student who has a crush on her. After school ends, Bill receives a text on Natasha's cell phone from her boyfriend, who wants to take her out on a date tonight.

Option 2: Something else
114221111.title: She's All Grown Up

1142211111.content:
Bill had to admit, he had almost as much fun as Teacher Natasha as he did as First Grader Natasha. Like with his little girl form, Bill let the Natasha auto-pilot take over occasionally, mostly for the actual teaching stuff. Bill was able to handle a lot more as the adult Natasha though, so when his former BFF Becky Summers and Caroline Reed were chatting with each other, Bill was the one who got them to pay attention. It seemed as if Natasha had talked to them about this before, so they focused pretty soon.

During a coloring break, Bill had to deal more troubles that Teacher Natasha was probably mored than used to. Xavier Deval was stealing Francis Young's crayons, so Bill had to step in. And of course there was Trevor Windham, who liked to tell Natasha that she was really pretty, and that he wanted to take her on a date like his big brother does with his girlfriend. Natasha's memories popped into Bill's head, telling him that this was a recurring problem. Bill went to Natasha mode, and Natasha reponded with the usual "I'm a little too old for you, plus I'm spoken for." Bit, and Bill wondered if this was something to bring up with Mr. and Mrs. Windham at Parent Teacher conferences.

While the Natasha side collected up the colored drawings to put up around the room, the Bill side paused for a moment. Wait... did the Natasha side of him say that she was "spoken for?" As in... she was actually dating someone? Bill somehow couldn't process this information. Bill had never been on a date in his life. He was the type of guy that girls were friendly towards but never really found attractive. And Bill was cool with that, at least for now. Suddenly, he was a beuatiful woman with a probably beautiful boyfriend? How the heck was he gonna handle this?

Before he knew it, the class was over. The students excitedly ran out of the classroom, ready to meet their waiting parents. Bill grabbed Natasha's purse, and started to head out, when he felt the buzz of a cell phone go off.

Bill took Natasha's perfectly manicured hands and picked up the phone. It was a text from Frank Andrews. "Date tonight?"

It was the boyfriend.

Bill found himself in such a shock that the Natasha personality instantly took over. She smiled, and dialed Frank's number in her phone.

"Hey babe." A male voice answered on the other side.

"Hey sweetie. Got your text." Natasha responded. At this point, Bill was just along for the ride.

"Well, I didn't want to interrupt story time with the kids." Frank said, a jovial kidding in his voice.

"It's Tuesday. You know Tuesday is coloring day." Natasha responded.

"I know. Story Time is just a funnier line." Frank said.

"Well, I'm down. What are you thinking?" Natasha said.

"Dinner and a movie? I know you have all those intense 20 page papers to grade, but..." Frank started.

"Hey, It was coloring day. All I got to do tonight is feed Marcy and I'm free. Dinner and a movie sounds lovely. What are we seeing?" Natasha bit her lip and smirked.

All Bill could think right now was Who Was Marcy? Probably a pet of some kind.

"Well, there's that movie Blockers. With your favorite guy in the world."

Natasha laughed.

"Look, I've already told you, if John Cena comes busting down my door and wants to take me away on an Alaskan Cruise, there's at least some debate! But I'd probabl choose you anyways." Natasha teased.

"Well, that is a very specific circumstance... but he's single now, so I can't take any chances." Frank retorted.

"Well, it's a date then. Pick me up at 7?" Natasha said.

"Sounds like a plan. Bye babe." Frank said.

"See you tonight!" Natasha said, hanging up, and headed to her car.

Well... It seemed like Bill was going on a date tonight. What a strange day this had turned out to be.



Option 1: Natasha/Bill returns to Natasha's home to feed Marcy, get ready for their date, and to discovery more about the life of Natasha.

Option 2: Natasha gets another phone call. It's from her mother.
1142211111.title: Natasha In Love

11422111111.content:
The drive home was surreal for Bill. Over the course of one day, his entire life had changed forever thanks the gemstone he had found. He was now an adult, a woman, Gloria's older sister, and was employed as a Kindergarten teacher. What madness would happen next?

Bill stared at his purse, which held the gemstone which did this to him. When he first found the damn thing, he had wanted it appraised, hoping he could sell it and raise some money, but knowing now how powerful it was, Bill wasn't planning to part ways with it anytime soon. He turned on the radio, and unfortunately Taylor Swift was playing.

His mind on autopilot, Bill allowed Natasha's memories to decide how to drive home. Bill winced a little as his new body passed by his own house on the way, already growing a little homesick. However, said homesickness didn't last long once Natasha turned a corner and drove down Beaumont Avenue. She reached her home, a modest but cute one story affair, and she parked her car into the domicile's driveway. Bill got out, remembering the lock the doors. He reached the house, found Natasha's house key in her purse and walked inside.

The home was cute! It was fairly Spartan in nature, not being decorated very much, but it was functional. Bill turned his head around, looking at everything when he found a wall of framed pictures situated near the home phone. One was of Natasha as a little six year old girl standing next to a woman, presumably her mother, who was holding a baby in her arms. It didn't take Bill long to realize that said baby was probably Gloria as an infant.

Another photo showed Natasha as a teenager acting in a play, and another as a cheerleader. Another showed her graduating from college in cap and gown, and yet another showed her first day on the job teaching school. This one was taken fairly recently, in September of last year. It seems like this was Natasha's introductory year as an educator.

“Wow” said Bill.

Bill walked into the kitchen and saw a cute puppy, a corgi, sleeping on the black and white checked linoleum floor. This was presumably Marcy.

“Hey Marcy!” said Bill sweetly. “Wake up, Mommy's home.”

Marcy opened her eyes and immediately got up from its slumber. She was wagging her tail, and Bill knelt down to pet her and hug her.

“God, I love you” said Natasha as Marcy licked her face, Bill allowing her to resume control once again. He let Natasha play with Marcy for a few minutes, and then after enough play time, she went off to go find the doggy food, which was in a pantry near the basement stairs.

Option 1: Bill wanders around the rest of the house and discovers some secrets about Natasha.

Option 2: Bill gets dressed and made up in preparation for date night and then heads to Frank's house .
11422111111.title: Natasha's Cool Pad

114221111111.content:
Bill took the time to feed Marcy, finding very quickly why she was very precious in Natasha's life. Bill decided that since Frank was taking him out to dinner later, that he didn't need to have anything big right now. Bill just grabbed a granola bar from the cabinet and started to snack.

Then Bill thought about how crazy that was. He had an attractive man taking him out! Bill smirked as he considered what meant. It was really weird and impossible... and yet he sort of liked it? He didn't know if Natasha's love for Frank was seeping into him, or if this was just a nice change of pace from his sad sack life as Bill. As much as he knew he should return reality to its normal... reality, he sort of wanted to explore this life a little more. It certainly was better and more interesting than what was happening to him before this morning.

As Bill finished his snack, he decided to actually explore a bit more. Why not? He was Natasha now, might as well figure out more about this woman's life. He exited the kitchen and back to the main living room. As he observed before, the apartment wasn't too fancy, other than the pictures on the wall. Natasha had a decent sized TV, with plenty of interesting movie choices and a nice little record collection. Again nothing too fancy.

Bill decided to head into Natasha's bedroom, which is where he would find a real surprise...
114221111111.title: Natasha's Secret

1142211111111.content:
Natasha has a super crazy secret for Bill to discover... what is it?

Option 1: Natasha is secretly a spy for the US Government, much like Ethan Hunt or James Bond

Option 2: Natasha is actually a superhero, the teacher gig is her secret identity.
1142211111111.title: Natasha's Crazy Secret

11422111111111.content:
Bill walked into Natasha's bedroom. Like the rest of her home, it was cute and simple. Nothing too fancy, but decidedly girlish. Her walls were a ethereal white, almost glowing, not a single imperfection being noticed by Bill's eye. Her bedspread was pink, with a couple of teddy bears keeping guard on top of her large fluffy pillows, and the bed itself was nice and bouncy as Bill sat down to examine the tactile experience of it. The bedroom television was quite nice. Everything was.

Bill laid Natasha's head on the pillows and stared at the ceiling for a few minutes, pondering what to do. He had been given a once in a lifetime opportunity to live someone else's life. He had just been given definitive proof that the supernatural exists. Somehow, he felt like he didn't truly appreciate the magnitude of these discoveries. Not that he'd be able to prove that he had discovered a magic wishing rock that warped reality when you were angry, that would never hold under scrutiny in a laboratory environment, but still...once he got tired of being Natasha, he should do something with this knowledge, right? Was it his responsibility to share it with the world, or to be a Good Samaritan and perform altruistic deeds with it? When Bill momentarily got lost in his own ruminations, the “autopilot” function took over. Natasha rose from the bed and began to search her closet.

“Huh” thought Bill. “She must be looking for an outfit for her date with Frank tonight.”

To Bill's massive surprise, behind the designer red polka dot dress was something he never would have thought a Kindergarten teacher to have: A Heckler & Koch MP5 submachine gun. Natasha pulled it out. She examined it briefly, as if already familiar with it, and set it aside on the floor. She then pulled out a small metal box with a thumbprint scanner. She also set that aside and began to get dressed for her date.

“What the fuck is going on here?” thought Bill, now on the edge of his mental seat. Once she was fully dressed in that cute polka dot dress and a pair of Jimmy Choo heels, Natasha pressed her thumb to the biometric scanner, and like magic, the metal box clicked open. Inside was a device that looked like something Q would develop for 007. It was a small, circular oddity, no larger than perhaps a poker chip, and Bill had no idea what it could possibly be used for. She took it out and put it in a hidden compartment of her purse. She then took the submachine gun and hid it behind a secret panel in the closet. She shut the closet door and secured it with a small, almost imperceptible hidden lock.

Just like that, a maelstrom of Natasha's memories suddenly poured into Bill's mind, causing him to experience a severe headache.

They were memories of Natasha as a little kid, but they were of a little kid doing things that no little kid should be doing.

Memories of heavy weapons training in some godforsaken desert in 100 degree weather. Memories of stalking various criminals and political targets for days at a time to get a rhythm of their day to day routines. Countless hours of rotely memorizing different languages, accents, postures, and behaviors. Memories of all the injuries she acquired learning dozens of martial arts styles, and not just the kind used for self defense, the kinds that maim and kill. Memories where a dark haired woman- her mother(!)- and countless agents who would abuse and condition her in all manner of ways until she was molded into the perfect little soldier. Fierce when she needs to be. A seductress when she needs to be. Sweet when she needs to be. A walking encyclopedia of the U.S government's every extra-legal action to impose its empire on unwilling participants.

Bill recalled the first time Natasha murdered in cold blood for her country, and the look of shock on the man's face.

He recalled Natasha's memories of the Red Room, which were too painful for even her to consider, and therefore were quite cloudy and hazy.

It was then when Bill came upon a terrifying realization. Natasha Vanapoulos wasn't a Kindergarten teacher. That was just a front. Natasha Vanapoulos was actually a living weapon. A spook. A spy and an assassin. A hired killer for her country. Up until recently, she was essentially Hit-Girl or Natalie Portman in Leon The Professional. Now she was all grown up and earning a reputation as a real life Black Widow.

She was on a mission.

Option 1: Natasha is actually after Frank's father, who unbeknownst to Frank is involved in organized crime like drug and human trafficking. Natasha is using Frank to get to him, and using him to get to a very big deal terrorist that he does business with.

Option 2: Something else.
11422111111111.title: True Lies

114221111111111.content:
The information continued to flow into Bill's side of the brain. Frank was the son of a man named Zachary Andrews, a local big business man, pretty successful and pretty well respected amongst his peers. But Frank didn't know, and what Natasha did, was that Zachary's big business was just a front, a means to make even more money on the other side of the law, the side of the law that ran drugs and trafficked humans.

And Natasha's intel had informed her that Zachary's latest business was selling arms to a notorious terror organization known simply as the Dark Oval. Natasha's agency had been looking for its leader for quite sometime now, and Natasha felt like she had the perfect in now: Through Frank.

Over the years, Natasha learned that men will give up anything and anyone in the name of love. No matter where in the world they were from, or what type of person they were, Natasha could make them melt on a dime, and from there it was all lollypops and pancakes. Frank seemed like a genuinely nice dude, but Natasha had a job to complete, and Frank was her key in. Her hope here was to get Frank to invite her to meet the parents, at which point she hoped to get a closer look at Frank's operation, and maybe find an entry point later to sneak in and grab a few filles.

This was all mindblowing for Bill. He had been a casual James Bond fan, enjoying the classics like Goldfinger and Goldeneye, and of course, he knew of Black Widow and Mission Impossible and all of that ilk. But now, he was in a real life version of that. He was in the body of a badass, coldhearted killing machine. This was insane. And Bill couldn't help to admit that he sort of liked being along for the ride.


Option 1: Suddenly, agents of the Dark Oval storm Natasha's apartment. Bill is amazed as Natasha takes them all out, as the Natasha part of him begins to suspect that Frank may know more than he lets on.

Option 2: Natasha goes on her date, and successfully seduces Frank into letting her meet his parents. Bill gets more and more into the spy life, feeling the same addiction Natasha feels for it.
114221111111111.title: Natasha's True Goal

11422111111112.content:
Bill circuited through Natasha's bedroom like a museum tourist. He was almost afraid to touch anything. Despite reality being changed to where he WAS Natasha now, he wasn't merely inhabiting someone else's body, Bill still didn't feel 100% comfortable being a grown woman. He liked it so far, but he was pretty sure that the novelty would wear off sooner than later. Then again, maybe he would grow into loving being Natasha, and it would just take him a little more time for him get used to this.

Honestly, other than his small fear of losing his real identity, Bill was impressed otherwise by this weird new turn in his life. Natasha had a very cute looking bedroom. It was slightly more furnished than the living room was, with posters for Heathers: The Musical and Welcome To Night Vale adorning the wall, a bookshelf with a lot of interesting books, and a cute Heathcliff alarm clock on her dresser. Bill smiled.

The afternoon daylight imbued the room with a golden glow, making everything seem brighter and friendlier, and Bill imagined that Natasha struggled to get out of bed sometimes because it was just so NICE being in here. It was like all the troubles of the world- war, strife, hate- didn't exist here. It was an oasis of tranquility, Natasha's inner sanctum of peace.

Bill moved on and began to search Natasha's closet. It was filled with a fine array of clothing, a mixture of comfy, practical, work, and flirty. Bill picked out a cute polka dot dress for tonight's date with Frank, which he assumed was partially influenced by Natasha's personality. He laid it on the pink bedspread.

Bill imagined how he would look in the dress when suddenly, his memories...Natasha's memories forced him to recall something else. Allowing her body to go on autopilot, Bill turned around and walked inside the closet again.

“What is she looking for?” Bill wondered to himself, laughing that he essentially had a split personality now.

Natasha bent down and slid a hidden panel in the closet to the right, and turned on a hidden light from within the cavity.

Bill saw what was inside.

A helmet. A mask. A pair of gloves. A pair of boots. A cape. A symbol.

Flashes of memories past appeared before Bill like a movie.

Option 1: Natasha recalls her late father, who unbelievably was an alien from another planet who came to Earth and eventually fell in love with Ariadne, Natasha's mother. When he died, he passed his costume onto Natasha. The costume gives her many powers like superhuman strength, superhuman speed, the ability to fly, and other strange powers. She tries to use it to make the world a better place.

Option 2: Natasha is a street level vigilante superhero like Batman or Daredevil. She dresses in this costume at night and busts corrupt cops, organized crime, etc using her almost superhumanly acute fighting skills, weapons, and homemade gadgets.
