choices: Bill can't help but explore his new relationship with Gloria
Bill can't take this reality anymore and tries to undo it with a wish
1142211111112331.content:
Bill made his way to the bedroom, seeking to find out more information about his new life, be it permanent or temporary. Natasha's bedroom was just as clean as the rest of the apartment was, a queen sized bed dominating the room and decorated in large, poofy purple pillows and comforters. It actually looked pretty comfortable, which Bill confirmed the moment he laid his new body down on the mattress for a moment, sinking down into a soft canyon of fabric. He laid there for a moment, a feeling of exhaustion from the long work day and the stress of having been so utterly changed. His new eyes fluttered for a moment and the embrace of sleep stretched out to welcome him...But the loud scratching at the door caused Bill's eyelids to flash back open as Natasha's personality re-asserted itself.

"Oh, Marcy! You want in to see mommy?" Natasha said, and she quickly pulled herself up off the bed and crossed the short distance to the door, opening it and letting the adorable mass of Corgi waddle itself in and take up residence on the bed where Natasha had been moments ago. Natasha herself followed her dog and gave it a swift kiss on the head before Bill resumed control.

"Well, ok. Now what?" Bill said as he looked around the bedroom. Marcy, the dog, simply grunted and rolled over on the bed. "Suppose I should start with trying to find out some more information if I'm really following through with this date..."

After a few minutes of rifling through Natasha's personal items, phone numbers, doctor's appointments for routine check ups, a schedule, even a lesson plan, Bill finally stumbled upon a locked drawer at the bottom of the bedside table. After a few moments of struggling against the lock, Bill sighed and stood up, taking full notice of how Natasha's large breasts jiggled. It felt...normal?

"Oh god" Bill whispered, "I really hope we're not...assimilating? Is that the right word?" Indeed, Bill was afraid that the longer he stayed as Natasha, the more he'd start becoming her. Already he couldn't remember what he'd actually been in charge of today and what he'd let occur on autopilot. The thought of mentally fusing with this woman, truly becoming a Vanapolous, horrified the teenage boy. And then, unbidden, or perhaps caused by these fears, a memory, clearly Natasha's, floated to the surface of Bill's mind.

It was the image of a key, stuck magnetically to the underside of the bedframe. It was what opened the locked drawer on the bedside table. Bill blinked and then crouched, a slender hand sliding up along the bottom of the queen bed's frame until manicured nails bumped across something long, flat and jagged. A simple clasp and tug of feminine muscle caused the key to slide loose from it's hidden location and Bill wasted no time in sticking it in the drawer's lock and turning it, the drawer sliding open just a tiny bit.

Bill left the key in the lock and the, despite the flair of strange emotions, anger, sadness, shame, suddenly rising in his throat, he pulled open the drawer and blinked at the handful of contents within. The top was a large, faded envelope, wrinkles at the neck where it had been opened many times. Beneath it was a small wooden box, featureless save for the claps and joints. Cautiously, Bill reached in and pulled out the envelope first, rising from his kneeling position and slowly, carefully undoing the seal-tie at the top and sliding the contents out on the bed.

There, now in a jumble, were legal documents, work applications, four birth certificates.

"What?" Bill whispered, despite something at the back of his mind screaming to put it all away. There were several copies of each document, one that looked like the original, and several others that had dates changed around, names removed or omitted. Bill carefully shuffled them back into a neat pile, and set them aside, reaching for the birth certificates. The first one, the older ones, were clearly for Natasha...But the information didn't make sense! One had Natasha's birthdate just a few years before Bill's, Gloria's, Tom's, but another one, an older one that looked far more official, had it thirteen years before any of them had been born.

If this was to be believed, Natasha wasn't twenty-three. She was actually thirty-one

Bill dropped the papers back on the bed as if they had burned his hands, and after a moment, slowly reached for the second set. There, in official ink, was Gloria Vanapolous's name...But underneath them made a cold ball of dread form in Bill's stomach. On one set of papers was Natasha Vanapolous under 'Mother', and on the other, was one with the name "Ariadne Vanapolous".

"Oh my god" Bill whispered and suddenly flashes of memories, vague and indistinct but full of emotion swept over him, causing the trapped teenage boy to let out something that sounded like a gasp of surprise and a sob.

Bill dropped the second set of papers and reached down for the box, flipping the clasp and opening it. Inside was a faded, pink beanie, and a stack of polaroids, images of a much, much, much younger Natasha in a hospital gown, cradling a small newborn. Bill set the box down and, with no small amount of dread, held the beanie between two fingers while he flipped through the images, tears welling unbidden in his eyes. Pictures of a very pregnant, barely a teenager Natasha being wheeled into the hospital by Roman Vanapolous, Natasha's father, pictures of Ariadne sitting beside a frightened Natasha in a hospital bed, pictures of a group of doctors surrounding Natasha, and finally, pictures of a wailing newborn in various stages of post-delivery before settling back on Natasha cradling it, a look of fear, sadness, and joy on her face.

Bill slowly set the photos down in the box before unrolling the small beanie in his hands.

There, in a thin line of white fabric, was the name "Gloria"

"Oh my god" Bill whispered, as memories from Natasha's life came flashing back.

Natasha had been born to Roman and Ariadne Vanapolous, an only child. She had developed early, and three days after turning thirteen, had successfully romanced a classmate one day after school, not really knowing what she was doing. This had been a long time ago, halfway across the country. And then when she had gone to Ariadne, terrified of the changes happening to her body, the anger in her mother's eyes, the shame she felt, the need to pull Natasha out of public school out of embarassment.

"How dare you!" Ariadne had screamed in her face, "Do you know what this will do to us!?" Ever the nurturing mother, Ariadne had been more concerned with image than the feelings of her daughter. Soon after Natasha was pulled from school, Ariadne and Roman had begun the process of looking for new positions, new jobs, new homes elsewhere before finally landing on Illinois. The secret meetings and bribes that Natasha's father, Roman, had to do to change Natasha's information, and the information for the baby, once she came. Ariadne would be the mother, of course, there was no way she would bear the shame of her thirteen year old daughter being a mother. Instead, it was arranged so that Ariadne and Roman had simply been trying for another child, and after years of failures, finally decided for a donor. That would explain any drastic visual differences in appearance. It had to. And Ariadne, of course, would acquire a new job, giving up her downtown NYC manger job to support her husband, as he moved across the country to Illinois to take a high paying corporate job, stepping down from his mid-upper level political office.

"I'll sacrifice for this family" Ariadne had hissed at Natasha, the night she had been told of the plan, "Someone has to"

And then in just a few months, she was here, and Natasha had been rushed to the hospital, enduring hours and hours of labor and a looming C-Section before her little girl, Gloria, had popped out into the world. And no sooner had the Vanapolous family arrived home, they were moving, from New York to Illinois. The legal documents were all in place, the lie was ready to be spun.

And Natasha gave up her baby Gloria, becoming her big sister. It broke her heart every moment, seeing Gloria grow up thinking, calling Ariadne mom, calling her 'sis', and being strictly forbidden by Ariadne and Roman to ever acknowledge that Gloria was hers. Terrified of Ariadne's wrath, of being disowned and left in the wilderness, Natasha had complied. Over the years the pain dulled somewhat, learning how to play the role of the big sister, of graduating from home school and being funneled into this apartment as soon as possible, distance helping to maintain the lie, to hide the hurt. And thankfully, Natasha had aged exceedingly gracefully, whatever signs of aging she had, she had learned to hide with careful, skillful application of make-up.

As the flood of memories slowed to a trickle, Bill tried his best not to collapse on the bed as he wiped the free flowing tears from his eyes.

"This is insane!" He said with a sniffle, "I'm Gloria's mom!"
1142211111112331.title: Natasha...is actually Gloria's mom!?

choices: Natasha wishes to be another Disney character
114221112.content:
Bill still hadn't quite grasped how the Ahn'Ger stone worked. He thought that it worked like the magic lamp from Aladdin. He thought that all he needed to do was make a wish, and said wish would be granted. He didn't yet notice that only anger, blind fury, was the key towards unlocking its power.

He made a couple of more attempts at wishing to be himself again, forcefully stating “I wish to be Bill Strasserman!” like an incantation before eventually realizing the futility of what he was doing.

It was at that juncture when Bill was beside himself. He wasn't even angry. He was stressed out more than anything, confused by the seemingly capricious rules. He imagined the “Time Is Collapsing” music from Inception playing in his head, and Bill zoned out...

...So Natasha zoned in. The six year old girl part of Bill's duel personality was now in control, and because he was growing more distraught, so was she.

Natasha was overall a happy, well adjusted little girl, but the Vanapoulos household was inherently dysfunctional, and try as they might, Gloria and Ariadne could not hide that fact from Natasha's piercing observations. Natasha knew that her big sister Gloria and her mom weren't getting along. They were always fighting in the next room or downstairs, away from where they thought Natasha couldn't hear them. One night, after Gloria called her mom some bad words...well, Natasha had never heard anyone so angry as her mother. There was no physical abuse, but the sheer ugliness of the emotional manipulation that resulted from Gloria's one slip up was beginning to wear on the souls of both of Ariadne's daughters.

She stared at her backpack. Natasha loved Disney. She was a little girl, so of course she did, but Natasha truly identified with those movies. The magic and the gorgeous animation and the wonderful songs were what drew her in, but the stuff that spoke to her young soul was the emotional resonance. Natasha wished that she and Gloria could be as close of sisters as Elsa and Anna were. She wished that her mother was less like Maleficent from Sleeping Beauty and more like Eudora from The Princess & The Frog. She wished that life could be more like a Disney movie. She was mad, wanting to be free instead of trapped in the Vanapoulos family home, which may as well have been the Evil Queen's castle from Snow White.
114221112.title: Natasha the Disney Character

1142211121.content:
“I wish that I was Elsa!” shouted Natasha in her little girl voice, sounding legitimately excited at the prospect of turning into someone else, and the Ahn'Ger Stone answered her wish as it began to glow, irradiating the bathroom in its unearthly magic. Natasha's beautiful green eyes at once became in perfect unison with the glow of the Ahn'Ger Stone, merging and disappearing from her reflection. Natasha noticed this beautiful and bizarre visual effect in the mirror as the magic changed her...changed Bill...changed both of them into something more, something greater.

The gemstone's magic slowly faded, and as both Bill and Natasha stood there, amazed at the light show...they were finally introduced to their new identity.

She was unmistakable. The glittering blue dress. The blonde hair styled in an elaborate french braid. The soulful eyes betraying years of insecurity and crushing loneliness. Bill gasped at his reflection. Bill was now Elsa from Frozen.

“Oh my god, what did this damn thing do now?” said Bill in Elsa's voice, sounding identical to Idina Menzel, as he put the gemstone on the bathroom counter.

As freaky as turning into Natasha had been, at least she was human. Elsa was a fictional character. Did...did Bill now have magical powers over ice and snow too? Could he create sentient snowman and snow monsters from nothing?

Bill stared at Elsa's pale hand and briefly concentrated. A burst of cool wind and snowflakes erupted from it.

Option 1: Elsa is still a fictional character in this world, and when students and teachers see her roaming the hallways, they respond with a mixture of fan enthusiasm from the kids and adults that liked Frozen and confusion from everyone else over what she is doing here. Overwhelmed by all of this attention, Bill gets stressed out and accidentally causes a city-wide blizzard with Elsa's powers.

Option 2: Elsa, Arendelle, and everything we saw in Frozen all exist as real things in this new reality. Queen Elsa is currently on a whirlwind tour of the United States, briefly stopping by JFK elementary school to speak to and entertain the children there.
1142211121.title: The Cold Never Bothered Me Anyway...

11422111212.content:
Bill breathed a heavy breath as he watched the snowflakes he had just created fall to the ground. He couldn't believe it. Somehow, this day had started with him finding a stone that led him to briefly become the sister of his friend's jerk ex-girlfriend, and now he was a fictional character from one of the most popular films ever made. How much crazier could this get?

"Elsa? Are you ready?" A voice that sounded earily similar to Kristen Bell called to him.

Bill turned around, and starring straight at him was Anna, Elsa's sister! In his old reality, Bill's younger sister Kimberly had seen the film numerous times, so obviously Bill was familiar. So when he say the smile and bright eyes of Anna staring at him, he knew what this meant. It seemed now that the world of Arendelle, the world of Frozen, was part of this reality.

"The kids are almost done with lunch, and they are so excited to see you!" Anna said.

Bill legitimately didn't know how to respond. This was all so much.

Anna took notice of this, and walked towards her sister.

"Hey, everything OK? You're not gonna create an eternal winter on us again, are ya?" Anna laughed.

Bill just looked back in the mirror, looking at his golden hair and his stoic demeanor.

"Sorry. Too soon?" Anna said, putting her hand on Elsa's shoulders.

Bill didn't want to worry Anna any longer. Obviously this took place after the events of the movie, so he had a little insight into what his mindset should be. But part of him reached into the new Elsa side of him, and sighed.

"Anna... This is all so crazy, you know? All these kids look up to me... and I don't want to.. let them down." Elsa said.

"Elsa... you're an amazing person, an amazing leader, and an amazing sister. Just go out there and be yourself! These kids love you, Elsa, they're not gonna be disappointed in you."

Anna paused and smiled.

"Besides, if they are disappointed, you can always make a bunch of cool snowmen come alive to dance and also tackle them."

Bill as Elsa couldn't help but to laugh.

"Anna...." He said, giving a light punch to her. Like with Natasha, it seemed easy to fall into the Elsa roll.

Suddenly, the bell rang.

"Oh, sis, that means we're up! Let's go!" Anna said, nearly dragging her sister out.

Bill made sure that Elsa grabbed the stone and held onto it. He didn't want someone else finding it and accidentally changing reality even further.


Option 1: Elsa gives a presentation to the class about her life and her story, the kids want to see a demonstration of the snow powers, and Elsa grants their wish, as Bill more easily slips into Elsa's personality.

Option 2: During the presentation, one kid asks if Elsa has been Rapunzel or Ariel yet, making Bill realize that more Disney kingdoms exist in this universe.
11422111212.title: Frozen is Real!

114221112122.content:
Bill kept up with Anna's merry jaunt as they both raced along the school hallways, Bill occasionally struggling not to trip over the Elsa's gown as they ran upstairs to the second floor. Once they reached the gymnasium, the two suddenly both saw a lot of people...staff workers, parents, and even Arendelle's Royal Guard, all waiting for them outside, a couple of them gasping at their mere presence. One of the guardsman saw Queen Elsa and Princess Anna and smiled. He and another guard opened the double doors for them.

Bill looked inside the gymnasium and saw hundreds of kids, most of them very noisy. At the top of the platform was the principal of JFK Elementary, Jenna Negrotti, standing near a podium.

“She's finally here!” announced Negrotti, herself sounding just as excited as the kids were. “Here for the first time, I am proud to present to you all, Queen Elsa of Arendelle.”

Bill looked to Anna, who let go of her hand.

“Showtime!” she said excitedly.

Bill nodded and nervously walked through the doorway into the gym. His mind raced back to went he graduated from this school in the sixth grade. His parents, Martha and Greg, were so proud of Bill as he was adorned in his finest cloths and his cap as he went on stage to receive his diploma. Now he saw hundreds of people, mostly children, none of whom he knew at all. Virtually all of them were transfixed as they watched Elsa, a living Disney princess, regally climb the stage to give her speech.

“Hey everyone” said Bill tapping the podium, still not used to sounding like Idina Menzel.

“We love you Elsa!” screamed a little girl.

“Thank you! So, I'm here. Finally!”

Bill's mind went on autopilot as Elsa's personality started to take over.

“I have to say that as long as I have been Queen, I have dined with Presidents, danced with generals, been kissed by celebrities, and hobnobbed fellow royalty. I've spoken in front of hundreds of crowds just like this one, and not one of them was as wonderful to be with as you kids are!”

A small smattering of applause was made at that statement, although others found it to be pandering.

“In the four and half years since Disney decided to adapt my autobiography to the big screen, I have had plenty of time to reflect on what happened to me that one horrible day when I broke down and ran away from home. That one bad day when my anxiety and fear overwhelmed me, where I nearly lost my sister and my seat on the throne to Hans of the Southern Isles. That one bad day of Arendelle's unnatural winter that seemed eternal and everlasting. That one bad day,when I was in the darkest place I've ever been in. On that one bad day, my worst day, I discovered just how special I really, and how much I was loved. I almost gave up on everything that day, and if I had, I wouldn't be here speaking to any of you now. Lest you think I'm bragging, this applies just as much to all of you as it did to me. You are all special, you are all loved, and you are all capable of creating magic in this world.”

Bill sat back and listened to Elsa speak, bearing her heart and soul to the audience as she gave her inspirational speech. He could have interrupted Elsa at any time, but he didn't. Truth be told, as much as Kimberly teased him about making him watch Frozen for the thousandth time, he actually really liked the movie, and he got emotional at most of the songs, particularly “Do You Want To Build A Snowman?”. He was getting just as emotional now, listening to her. When she was done, the entire audience clapped this time.

“Now it's time for the Q&A session” said Principal Negrotti, speaking from a microphone off to the side.

An entire forest of hands suddenly erupted from the seats.

Principal Negrotti laughed a little. “Unfortunately we won't be able to get to everyone, which is why during her majesty's speech, we periodically selected certain students from the audience to field their own questions”.

Indeed, Bill saw a line forming in one of the rows in the middle of her presentation.

A little boy went up to the standing microphone.

“Hi” he said shyly.

“Hi there young man. What's your name?” asked Bill in Elsa's kind voice.

“I'm Rod Walker. I-I love Frozen. It's my favorite movie.”

“Thank you! You have good taste, Rod!”

“Um...I wanted to know if you know Ariel and Queen Rapunzel?”

Bill hid his laughter at the question. The Little Mermaid and Tangled couldn't possibly be real too, could they? It was then when Bill noticed a map of the world hand on the wall in the front of the gym. The map showed various countries that Bill didn't recognize, and the geography seemed little off. The map was too far away to really see, but he was pretty sure he saw the name “Arendelle” located near Norway, and the name “Corona” near Denmark. The named “Atlantica” could clearly be seen near Denmark, but the country wasn't shaded in. It appeared to be submerged in water. He even noticed the name “Agrabah” located where Iraq was supposed to be.

“No...” he whispered slowly. In the back, Bill saw Anna start to get a little nervous.

“S-sorry?” asked Rod. “I didn't hear you.”

The world couldn't be THIS different now, could it? Did Natasha's wish just transform the Earth into a planetary wide Disneyland?

Option 1: Bill bluffs his way through the question and says that he knows Ariel and Rapunzel well. They were even at her coronation! Different kids start asking other questions about Disney characters like Aladdin and others, leading Bill to realize just how different the Earth was now.

Option 2: Something else.
114221112122.title: It's Good To Be The Queen

choices: Natasha wishes to be Judy Hopps from Zootopia
Natasha wishes to be Mary Poppins from... Mary Poppins.
1142211122.content: I'm just gonna give you three more choices here that I think would be interesting. Cool? Cool.
1142211122.title: More Disney Options!

11422111221.content:
Natasha thought back to the last Disney movie she had seen. In the theater it had been Coco, but Zootopia had been playing on the Disney Channel last week, so that movie was fresher in her young memory. She and Mommy had sat down to watch it together, and Natasha was overjoyed. She loved this movie. She loved the sheer immersiveness and breadth of the titular city, and truth be told, she related to Judy Hopps more than she wanted to admit to her mother. You see, Judy's own parents in the movie had no faith in her dreams of becoming a police officer in the big city. She was a bunny, and bunnies simply didn't last long in a cutthroat metropolis populated by lions and tigers and bears...and scheming sheep. Sometimes, the precocious Natasha felt that she was underestimated by Ariadne too, and by her big sister Gloria...and by practically every adult she knew. Only Ms. Wick, her first grade teacher, seemed to see the potential in Natasha. Or at least that's how Natasha felt. Sometimes she wished that she could just escape into Zootopia for a while. Gee...she has a magic wishing rock, that doesn't sound like too bad of an idea.

“I WISH I WAS JUDY!” screamed Natasha into the mirror, all of her repressed anger and insecurity bursting to the surface. The Ahn'Ger stone heard her wish, and immediately granted it. The gemstone exploded into being and washed over Natasha's body, covering her in magical energy.

When the light subsided, Bill woke up from his trance.

“Huh?” he squeaked out, his voice sounding funny. His voice still sounded feminine, but feminine in a different way than Natasha's high pitched little girl voice. This voice sounded like someone closer to an adult, and yet not quite that either. He also felt much smaller than he had a moment ago. He looked around him.

“Am I...standing ON TOP of the BATHROOM COUNTER!!?” he wailed histrionically. Quickly looking around him, he noticed that the paper towel dispenser and the automatic hand dryer were much bigger than they had been a moment ago. To this right, the tiles on the wall that connected the communal sinks to the toilets seemed far more imposing than they had a moment ago, reminding Bill of the nearly impenetrable medieval walls of Constantinople that he had been learning about in history class.

Finally, after realizing that something was now very, very wrong, he turned to face his new identity in the mirror.

Bill saw a bunny. HE was the bunny. He was an adult female bunny dressed in a police officer's uniform fit for her little bunny body. She had large floppy ears and wide, expressive purple eyes. Bill recalled her from somewhere. Some Disney movie that he had been forced to watch when it was Kimberly's turn to choose the movie for family night. Damn it...somehow he just remembered. Judy! This cute bunny's name was Judy Hopps! And now Bill was now her. Bill was Judy Hopps!

“You're sorta stuck where you are, but in your dreams you can buy expensive cars. Or live on Mars, and have it yooooooooooour way! You hate your boss at your job, but in your dreams you can blow his head off. In your dreams, show no meeeeeeeeeercy!”

The prophetic song played over the intercom of Sandy's, a local retail store in the Twin Pines Mall as Rebecca Armitage and Jake Anselm manned the two front registers. Not a lot of people were in the store today, as it as a Wednesday morning. A middle aged woman and a girl of about nine, probably mother and daughter, were checking out shoes while a nondescript man wearing a brown jacket browsed Blu-Rays. Outside the store, an elderly looking man in a fedora was reading the newspaper on a wooden bench as he usually did every day.

Rebecca yawned loudly as she made inventory of her life. She was 21, going to graduate from college next semester. Her father, for there was no Mrs. Armitage in the picture, had insisted that she take something STEM related, particularly since he was a mechanical engineer himself. Rebecca eventually acquiesced to Mr. Armitage's terms, and was aiming to get a degree in Statistics, though she honestly had very little interest in the subject. The course was intense and work load heavy, which left very little time for her to make any new friends. She half-heartedly tried to pledge for a sorority in her first year, but she dropped out when she realized that she just didn't have the room in her schedule(She didn't want to admit that it was the bitch who made fun of her for gaining the freshman fifteen). Rebecca thought wistfully back to high school. She had plenty of friends there. She was popular. She didn't even have time to go swimming anymore.

“Wasn't that song in Batman Forever?” heard Rebecca all of a sudden, breaking her out of her daydream.

“What?” she asked tiredly.

“That song that's playing. Wasn't that in Batman Forever, you know, the one with Jim Carrey?” asked Jake.

“I don't know” answered Rebecca, resting her face on her elbow, her elbow itself resting on the counter like a freestanding column. “I never saw that movie.”

“Before your time, maybe” said Jake.

“Maybe. I'm not big on the superheroes.”

Jake Anselm was Rebecca's co-worker. He had just turned thirty years old and was going through what psychologists called a quarter-life crisis. Jake was beginning to realize that he wasn't a kid anymore, having wasted his twenties in a state of arrested adolescence and immaturity, working minimum wage jobs just to scrap by, and his relationship with Rebecca was friendly but strained as a result of his insecurities. He wanted to start fresh and go back to college himself, but his low self confidence told him that he was perhaps just a bit too old for it.

“Do you ever wish that you could just start over, Jake?” asked Rebecca in a pensive voice as she was watching one of the customers walk up to her register to purchase something. She suddenly composed herself, forming a perfectly happy smile that hid her soul crushing ennui.

Natasha herself felt the alien feeling of being handled like the object she now was and with a barely audible clink, was suddenly pressed directly against the gemstone that had caused this entire mess, her 'face' pressed directly against it's smooth, warm surface. From this distance Natasha could see the golden core of the gemstone almost fluctuating, almost as if it was wet and flowing as an untold number of gold particles seemed to flow downward and curve back onto themselves like a slow, micro-sized waterfall.

"What the hell are you?" She thought to no one but herself, but had no further time to inspect the artifact before resuming her place as a cleavage ornament hanging from around Rebecca's neck.

Waas it because she was now just an object, too small and unimportant to rate altering along with rest of reality? Rebecca fell to her knees and felt white hot tears filling her eyes. She had been bored with her life, yes, but when she wanted some excitement, something to make her life exciting and wonderful again, she never wanted this! Without the stone, and the clear signs that absolutely no one, not even the men that had become women, remembered that there had been two sexes just moments ago, there was no way to fix her mistake.

Not caring that the mono-gendered crowd of shoppers around her and the approaching forms of uniformed police-women was giving her odd, concerned looks, Rebecca Armitage, destroyer of man, sobbed loudly and openly at the fate of womankind.

And Natasha the necklace could only resign herself to being nothing more than cheap jewelry for the rest of existence.

-

Meanwhile, in a car not too far away...

"Holy shit girl, I can't believe you got all this!" An electric pink haired woman with an abundance of piercings on her face squealed as the the blue-haired thief peeled away, as best she could in the backseat of a car, the layers of clothing she had successfully shoplifted. Similar praise came from two women that sat in the driver and front passenger seats.

"Yeah, I'm just awesome like that." The blue haired girl replied with a grin before giving the pink haired girl a light kiss on her pierced lips. "I also got something else right at the end. And I'm claiming it before any of you get to!" The blue-haired girl held out her hand and peeled back her blue-tipped fingers, revealing the Ahn'Ger Stone.

The pink haired girl's eyes became huge as she picked the stone up with two slender fingers. "Woah...Cameron, how'd you get this? No way you could have swiped it from the jewelry store..."

The blue-haired punk, Cameron Knowles, plucked the stone back from the hands of her friend. "It was easy! The alarm went off at Posenby's, I ran and saw this stupid looking fat chick outside of Sandy's and this thing was just laying there in her hand so I grabbed it as I ran past! Brandi, you should have seen the look on her face, it was if she was seeing the world for the first time! I bet she's autistic or some shit"

"Putting those pickpocket lessons to good use, right on girlfriend!" The driver said as she carefully, yet speedily weaved through the late afternoon downtown traffic.

"Like, what lessons? She just watches all those tricky bitches on Youtube" The platinum blonde from the front passenger seat said, her voice slightly tinted with jealousy.

"Thanks Jules. And whatever Danni, at least I know HOW to even get on the Internet!" Cameron said, giving the back of the seat in front of her a light punch as she, Brandi and Jules laughed while the blonde, Danielle 'Danni' stared out the window and pouted..

"That's like, not funny at all!"

One that didn't matter for the books and folders and pencil cases he had in his bag. But for a tiny, precious stone? It was a perfect fit. So after rattling about the backpack for a bit, the stone dropped out, shining on the ground in the sunlight.

114221121.content:
Bill was amused and delighted and more than a little bit nostalgic as he waved goodbye to Gloria and entered the horde of schoolchildren as they waited for the front entrance to open for the day. He chatted it up with the girl who apparently was his BFF, who indeed was named Becky. “Natasha” and Becky hit it off immediately. Truth by told, all of Becky's points of references were lost on Bill. The blonde girl talked in a mile a minute, high-energy cadence, covering all sorts of various ground in less time than Bill had to understand them, although Bill made out something about Natasha having won a dodgeball game in gym class the other day against the boys of their homeroom, and Becky he supposed was in her girl power phase. Regardless, Bill could tell that Becky really liked her, and that's all he really needed to know for now. Bill just needed to play the patience game. He would wait until lunchtime, go into the bathroom, and wish himself back to normal.

Bill also was introduced to several other students, boys and girls alike, who acted like they knew Natasha well. For the most part, everyone was friendly and kind to Natasha, which relieved Bill, who from middle school on had only had negative school experiences. Sooner than he Bill had liked, the doors finally opened, with teachers and other school staff shepherding their charges inside. Bill was one of these charges, as he couldn't wait to look inside a building that he hadn't been inside in at least six years. He found himself in awe at the old fashioned design and architecture.

In the short amount of time where Bill and Becky were separated from each other, Becky noticed out of the corner of her eye the gemstone that had fallen through Natasha's worn backpack. She slowly walked up to the glittering rock and picked it up.

“This is so pretty” she said to herself, in awe of the stone's crystalline beauty. Subconsciously, she could also feel the magical energy coursing through the ancient artifact despite the gemstone itself being cold to the touch.

With the chime of an old fashioned electric interrupter bell, the first summons of the day that warned that class was beginning in less than one minute, Becky pocketed the stone and ran inside the storied school building.

**

The First Grade classes had naturally gone easily for Bill, who still possessed an eighteen year old mind, although he consciously made the effort to not be TOO good at his work. He deliberately colored outside the lines during a coloring break, misspelled a couple of words on Natasha's spelling test, and occasionally answered Ms. Wick's questions incorrectly as to not draw attention to himself.

This seemed to work, as he got along swimmingly in class. Since the classwork was easy for him, he had time to gossip with Becky, who he learned whose last name was Summers during Ms. Wick's attendance taking. Despite himself, Bill had to hold back childish giggles at Becky's silly jokes and teasing. She was a charming and funny girl, and Bill was going to miss her when he inevitably had to return to his real life.

When lunchtime arrived, Bill and Becky stood in line for what turned out to be spaghetti and meatballs. They sat together with the other first, second, and third graders of JFK Elementary, but the two girls mostly conversed with themselves, their bond rock solid. Bill took two bites of the food and decided that he didn't like the taste of it and pushed it aside.

“Hey Becky, I've got to go use the bathroom. Watch my food and get me a Drumstick when the lunch lady starts giving out ice cream” he said in Natasha's little girl voice. He handed her two quarters from Natasha's backpack.

Becky nodded and watched her best friend walk through one of the two exits.

As Becky waited, she grew bored and pulled out the glittering rock that she found this morning. She stared at it, at the smaller gem embedded inside, the gold oddity almost daring her to make a wish. She turned the stone around in her palm several times.

Option 1: While she waits for Natasha to come back, Becky pulls out a storybook and begins to read it. She begins to wish that she and Natasha could live in the fantasy world of the story for a while instead of being at school, and when Natasha doesn't return after ten minutes, she starts becoming angry.

Option 2: Something else

114221122.content:
Bill waved goodbye to his temporary sister Gloria and joined the small army of schoolchildren congregating around the front door of JFK Elementary, all waiting to be let inside so they could get this day over with. The murmurs among the children was largely talk about summer vacation and how eager they all were to begin it, which Bill couldn't blame them for. He found Natasha's best friend, a girl named Becky Summers, and another girl she was friends with, a brunette named Caroline Reed, and the three of them began to gossip about this topic and that topic, everything from cartoons to cute boys, all of it being interspersed with an abundance of mirthful laughter. Bill was enjoying the conversation so much, lost in the sheer novelty of what he was experiencing, being trapped in the body of a little girl who up until ten minutes ago didn't exist, that he didn't notice that the reason behind his curious fate was sitting very abruptly less than five feet away, soaking in the morning sun's rays.

Regardless, Bill didn't have a chance to notice the stone as the front doors opened, teachers and school staff beckoning the kids to enter the school and find their classrooms before the bell rang, which they all did, with some stragglers, but there's always stragglers.

Bill followed Becky and Caroline to a room marked by a bordered blue sign containing stenciled in white letters indicating whose teaching domain this was:

MS. WICK- FIRST GRADE

Bill didn't remember having a Ms. Wick. His first grade teacher had been a woman named Mrs. Kimmel. He considered the possibility that Ms. Wick must be a new teacher, but he nixed that idea. He easily could have just never had a chance to meet her before today. Bill found that the class had a seating arrangement, with himself, Becky, and Caroline situated off the left hand side of the room. They all sat down next to each other, still laughing over a silly preadolescent meme they had been giggling over outside. The other pupils were having their own side conversations.

Less than a minute later, an adult woman entered the room, her presence preceded by the click-clacking of her blue heels, and most of the students instinctively sat up straight from their slouches.

“Good morning Ms. Wick!” they all shouted, some out of tune despite themselves.

“Good morning class” smiled the brown haired woman of about forty years of age. Bill noticed that she was putting up a very pleasant looking demeanor, but she was likely hiding something painful, as she looked like she had recently been crying.

“If you would, please pull out your textbook to page 520. Today we're going to learn about units of measurement , and after that, we're going to finish off the basics of geometry.”

Bill reached under Natasha's desk and found a large blue textbook and turned to the appropriate page.

The class went by pretty easily for Bill, and he found himself enjoying the class. He had acquired two new friends, even if he'd never see them again, and Ms. Wick was a pleasant teacher who was good at her job.

When the kids went off to lunch, Kathleen sighed.

She had put up a good front. She had to, and more pertinently, she wanted to. Kathleen Wick wasn't even close to that sad point in her education career where she had given up on her students, or became wantonly cynical about her job. She loved these kids. It's just...where to begin?

Her dating life was the pits. She was self-conscious about getting older, and though she arguably had become ever cuter as the years wore on, aging like a fine wine, more and more doors were closing off to her every day.

Hell, it wasn't even just the crippling loneliness. Kathy had a severe wanderlust and a thirst for adventure inside of her, but despite her four decades, she had hardly traveled the world at all. She had never jumped out of an airplane. Never ran with the bulls in Spain. Never went scuba diving. Never even been to Vegas.

Kathy looked at the gemstone she had found laying outside the front double doors earlier this morning, taking it out of her burlap purse. She wondered where it had come from, surmising that it belonged to perhaps some student's parent. Maybe Natasha Vanapoulos or Trevor Windham had taken it out of their mother's jewelry box and brought it in for Show and Tell, dropping it by mistake. At least, that was the closest reasonable explanation that the teacher could think of.

She gripped it tightly and made a silent prayer.

“I wish I were somewhere relaxing and exotic right now” she whispered to herself, gripping the stone in her hand.

The stone began to glow below Kathy's desk, and in an instant, she found herself elsewhere...


Option 1: The Stone transports Kathleen to an exotic location somewhere in the world.

Option 2: The stone transports Kathleen to a faraway beach in the South of France. The stone still in Ms. Wick's hand, Bill remains trapped as Natasha for the foreseeable future.

Option 3: The Stone transports Kathleen somewhere...else.

Bill stared intently at the stone in Gloria's hand. Instinctively, he somehow grasped that this insane new reality had been generated from it. That somehow it was magical and all powerful. Bill didn't know why he thought this, he just knew. He also felt like he DESERVED to own it. Somehow, Bill felt intimately connected to the Ahn'Ger stone, as if all his of his short life had been destined to lead up to him finding it this morning. Something deep inside Bill told him that that Ahn'Ger stone was his Excalibur, his Mjolnir...his Golden Spatula from that Spongebob Squarepants episode he saw as a kid. Why else would it just randomly appear on the porch? He was coming up with plans to get it out of Gloria's hands without attracting her attention or resistance. After all, in this little girl body, even Gloria could overpower him now.

The Natasha side of her personality, however, had other plans. She really looked up to and admired her big sister, and wanted to do everything to please her. She also had zero interest in the stone aside from it looking really pretty.

Bill attempted to talk Gloria into giving him the stone, but instead Natasha's own wishes came out of his mouth:

“Gloria, can we go to the beach after school? You know, before Mom gets home?” added Natasha in her adorable lisp. She had recently lost one of her baby teeth, and her tongue couldn't stop stroking the empty gap in mouth which was still a little sensitive to the touch.

“No!” yelled a psychic Bill to his other personality, trying to assume dominance over his six year old alter ego to no avail. She was ignoring him, if she had noticed Bill's pleas at all.

Gloria's annoyed demeanor softened a little into a warm smile.

“Of course we can. Anything for my little sis! Now come on, I can't be late. See, there's Becky! She probably wants to talk to you” pointed Gloria to another little girl with a ponytail.

Natasha's little body squealed as she ran over to greet her friend.

1151.content:
"BILL ELIAS STRASSERMAN!" A mature female voice cried out.

Bill sighed. Great. Just what he needed. His mother, Martha Candor-Strasserman.

Martha had been getting on Bill's case quite a lot recently. Maybe she was stressed about Bill going to college soon. Maybe she was stressed about his sister's grades. Maybe something was going on at work. Or maybe Martha was just being Martha. But whatever the case was, Bill and his mother had seemingly been finding themselves in arguments more often than not. And this time, it was no exception.

"What is it now, mom?" Bill said, exasperatedly.

"How many times am I going to have to tell you to clean up after yourself? When your done with your dishes, put them in the sink! You can't just leave them on the table like that!" Martha scolded.

"Well, I was running late. Tom's gonna be here any minute..." Bill started.

"Well, if you got up on time, you wouldn't have to be rushing, would you? Or if you actually cleaned your room, you wouldn't have to scrounge through piles of dirty clothes just to find something acceptable to wear?" Martha continued.

"Mom, can we not..." Bill tried to begin.

"Do you think you're going to get away with this in college? Do you think this is an appropriate way to get through life! You can't just... what's that in your hand?" Martha suddenly said.

"No...nothing." Bill said.

"That's not nothing Show me." Martha said. Bill sighed again, and showed her the gem. Martha snatched it from his hand.

"Where. did. you. get. that? Bill are you..stealing?" Martha said incredulously.

"NO! I just found this. I..." Bill started.

"And you weren't going to tell anyone? You weren't going to tell me?" Martha asked.

"I JUST FOUND IT! I didn't even think about what to do!" Bill tried to explain.

"Don't you lie to me, young man." Martha said, inspecting the stone.

"I'm not! I wasn't! Will you just listen to me?" Bill asked.

"Listen, Bill, you need to mature! You need to figure things out or college is going to eat you alive! I can't believe you found this and didn't come to me! What if this was mine? What if you had taken it to school and it got stolen! Seriously Bill..."
1151.title: His mother, Martha

choices: Bill is mom...and Mom is Bill!

115111.content:
“Seriously Bill, sometimes I wish you were more like me, then you would have your head on straight!”.

Martha had meant that last part more as a jest than anything, but her anger came from a real place of frustration with her son. She was genuinely worried about Bill sometimes. He was good kid, and a smart kid, but he had no sense of responsibility at all!

No matter what Martha's intention was, however, the magic gemstone that she was holding in her hand only took it one way. She made a wish, and she was angry, ergo the Ahn'Ger stone is obligated to do its magic thing. It started to glow brightly.

Before Bill's mother could complete her frustrated plea, the Ahn'Ger stone had warped reality, and that incarnation of Martha and Bill ceased to exist. History had just been rewritten, and now things would never be the same.

**

Bill himself had hardly been paying attention to his mother's histrionic rants. He was used to them by now, and so whenever she yelled at him, it went inside one ear and out the other like so much empty noise. This was a day he should have been paying attention.

One moment he had seen Tom finally approaching the house to go to school with him, but now? Now, after seeing how the Ahn'Ger stone had irrevocably changed him, Bill was stuttering nonsensically.

“W-w-w-w-w”

Martha stared happily at the gorgeous spring morning going on all around her while she sipped her chai tea casually. A neighbor boy, Tom Ackerman, waved at Martha and approached the front steps in a casual jogging stroll.

“Is Bill ready yet?” asked Tom.

Martha rolled her eyes sarcastically.

“If he's not, he will be. I'll go fetch him” she said. “Would you like any breakfast while you're here?”

Tom grinned. “Actually, I wouldn't mind that at all.”

Martha nodded, and then turned to her stuttering former son.

“Willow, could you go fetch Tom some eggs and bacon for me?”

“S-s-sure” said Bill, shocked at his current predicament. He shuffled inside the front door, walking past the foyer, briefly passing by a mirror where he saw his new self. He looked exactly like Mom. An exact double. A twin. He was even wearing her exact clothing choices. He couldn't look at himself anymore.

“Why can't anyone recognize how crazy this all is?” thought Bill as he robotically gathered eggs and bacon from the stove top skillet onto a plate. “Why did Mom call me Willow? That's not my name!”. Across from him, Bill's father Greg and his little sister Kimmy were busy drinking orange juice, Kimmy slurping it down nosily, while eating their own breakfast. Neither had asked even once who this stranger was and what had happened to Bill.

The food all ready, Bill began to walk out of the kitchen when he saw his mother in the foyer and approached her. Even walking felt different with these wider hips and different center of gravity. Martha took the plate of eggs and bacon and began to walk outside to give it to Tom when they were both interrupted.

“Hey Mom. Hey Aunt Willow” said the doppelganger Bill casually as he rapidly descended the stairs, leaving in a hurry to head to school. “Mmm eggs, can I have some?”

“Sorry Bill, eggs are for closers and sons who wake up on time.”

“Aww man” said Other Bill as he put on his backpack...

“But Tom can share his own eggs with you. You two have got five minutes” said Martha as she smiled.

“Thanks Mom” smiled back. They hugged each other, and the real Bill blanched. He hadn't been that affectionate towards his mother in months. All three joined Tom on the front porch.

Option 1: Bill is now Martha's twin sister. Martha still has the stone on her because she made the last wish with it.

Option 2: Bill is now Martha's twin sister. Bill is still the owner of the stone because he's the one who found it first.

Option 3: As the Bill that found the Stone no longer exists, the Ahn'Ger Stone is nowhere to be found!

After the group of them had made it outside, Bill had once again tuned out the conversation, except for the occasional nod and the occasional laugh when he felt something was directed at him. Or her now, rather. Bill tried to calm down by breathing slowly, but every time he took a breath, he felt his new breasts jiggle up and down.

Bill looked over himself, noticing his perfectly manicured hands, a purple coat of nail polish on them, and the wide hips he noted earlier. He had to admit that he looked rahter fashionable, all things considered, as he wore a nice blouse and pants combo, with a white jacket to put it all together. He brushed his now longer hair behind his ears, and put a hand to his face. His skin felt rougher, older, with wrinkles and make-up surrounding it.

Bill just couldn't believe it. Just moments ago, he was just Bill, living what he thought was a perfectly normal reality. Now, he apparently was a woman named Willow, the twin sister to his mother Martha, if the information he had just pieced together was right. But how? Why? What could have...

That's when Bill's eyes glanced down to Martha's hand. More specifically, the green glow coming from Martha's hand. That stone! It had to be that stone! As crazy as it sounded, as crazy as it WAS, that stone wasn't there yesterday, and now that it was, things had somehow gone berserk. Whatever was happening, that stone was the key, and now Bill's goal was to get it back in his hands and figured out how it worked, to figure out how to make things normal again.

"Bye, Aunt Willow!" Other Bill suddenly shouted.

Bill had been so lost in thought that he hadn't noticed that Bill, Tom, and Kimberly were now on their way to school.

"Bye Bill. Bye Kimberly. Nice to see you, Tom." Bill/Willow said. As weird as that sounded to him. He had to play along for now. He hand to make Martha comfortable enough so that that stone could end up in his hands.

As the kids left. Martha turned to her new sister, and smiled. Then she said...

115121.content:
Bill had seen his mother stressed out like this many times before. He didn't know exactly what was bothering her right now, but it had to be something big. His mom had always had a lot on her plate, what with her high pressure job, with bills piling up, with her husband having a drinking problem, with her own parents being both elderly and quite ill, and with the uncertain fate of the futures of her two children, among other things. She tried to hide it, but Martha was two steps away from a nervous breakdown.

“Mom” said Bill calmly, trying to reassure her. Bill wanted to let her know that everything was going to be alright. He approached her slowly, laying a loving hand on her shoulder. Despite his good intentions, Martha ignored her son's affectionate gesture in a fit of self destructive anger.

“DAMN IT!” she yelled with a hint of oncoming tears, her face contorting into a caricature of frustration. “SOMETIMES I WISH THAT I WERE A KID AGAIN!”

As if on cue, the gemstone that Martha was holding in her hand suddenly erupted in an explosion of emerald light. Bill noticed the light trying to escape her grip.

“Mom! Look at your hand!”

“Oh my g...” was all that Martha could say before being cut off, as the mysterious light rapidly washed over the both of them.

A moment later, the front porch was empty. Martha and Bill were gone.

**

When Bill and Martha re-materialized, it was Bill who was the first to notice that something was wrong. His hand had been affectionately grasping his mother's shoulder, but now he was embracing some girl he didn't recognize. This girl looked about sixteen years old, just a year younger than Bill himself, but everything about her screamed that she was from the past. Her hairstyle, her clothing, her shoes. It's like she stepped right out a 1980s John Hughes movie.

“Who are you?” he asked inquisitively, and suddenly covered his mouth.

The girl whom he didn't recognize briefly glared at Bill. Then her jaw silently dropped.

As Bill looked around, he realized that he was no longer outside. He was in a bedroom meant for a teenage girl. However, everything about it was retro as well, from the bedspread, to the posters adorning the wall, to the carpeting, just like the girl herself. Bill assumed that it was this girl's room, but who was she, and how did they get here? Where was mom?

More importantly, why did Bill's voice sound so feminine all of a sudden?

Bill looked down and received his answer. He was now a woman, a much older woman, perhaps in her forties judging by the conservative nature of her clothing. His nails were long and coated in red polish.

A handsome looking middle aged man suddenly walked into the open bedroom door.

“Willow? Martha? Are you ladies ready to go out to dinner?”

Bill blinked in the early morning light, bringing up the hand that held the strange gemstone to block out the rising sun as the owner of the voice came into view. The teenage geek blinked in surprise at who it was, as he had been expecting his best friend Tom. Hell, he almost expected it to be Gloria, the disgraced bully Rob Bolstrum or even the new leader of Shermer High's bullies Jon Ingerman!

Bill lowered his hand and cautiously stepped off the porch, his fingers curling protectively around the gemstone as he stepped down off his porch and onto the dew soaked grass, plodding towards the voice's owner.

"What the hell are they doing here?" Bill muttered to himself as he reached the sidewalk. He looked both ways down his quiet suburban road before crossing the damp asphalt quickly, hopping up on the opposing sidewalk and coming face to face with...

1: Matt Harris, a sophmore two years behind Bill and one of the biggest, if not THE biggest loser at Shermer High, known for perving after girls and being...odd and always angry about something, and oddly obsessed with being Bill's friend. His odd mumbling, creepy stares and loud, violent tantrums and outbursts had largely cemented Matt in the minds of the student body as a 'little psychopath'. Why was this greasy haired creeper here at his house and what did he want?

2: Paige Walters, a very overweight and unattractive sophmore that was near the bottom of Shermer High's social hierarchy, and a frequent bullying target for Gloria and her Mean Girl squad whenever she wasn't torturing Tom. Bill wasn't familiar with her other than the rumors that often spread about the less fortunate students and that she often hung out with that little psychopath Matt Harris. Why was she here and what did she want?

12.content:
It was a normal day for Mark Jones. His classes had ended for the day and he was left with a few hours to kill before the love of his life Sharon was done with hers. The small apartment was quiet, with only the noise of normal campus traffic filtering through the walls. It had been a challenging semester, his advanced classes in engineering had demanded a lot of work from him and it was rare for him to have more than an hour or two free, most of which were spent driving around the city and the nearby towns looking for jobs.

And not just engineering jobs, but any jobs at all. Mark's resume was severely lacking in actual work experience, he had spent most of his high school experience playing basketball and baseball. His grand total of work experience could be summed up with "Worked a summer at Wal Mart". And even though he was now highly educated, in this economy not many companies were looking to hire engineers that had no work experience.

It had stressed Mark out and he hadn't even been able to find much comfort from his parents, who used every time they spoke to bad mouth Sharon or talk him out of marrying her.

"You're both too young" or "She's an atheist, you can't marry an athiest" or "I know this sweet girl that already has a fast track job to a corporate executive position, you should get to know her, I'm sure you two will have so much in common!"

Nor could Mark bring himself to talk about his problems in front of his friends or even Sharon. He felt that it just wasn't their problem or business to deal with, and even though he did love Sharon, he didn't want to give her cause to leave him if he appeared weak or that he wouldn't be able to provide.

So with all these worries weighing down on him, Mark did the only thing a stressed out guy could do: Play some video games.

He was sitting down on the couch in front of their modestly sized TV, the Xbox powering on when suddenly a flash of light and a loud pop killed the power. Mark looked around for the source of disruption and was startled to see and hunched form of what appeared to be a naked woman on the floor in behind him, a small circle of singed carpet surrounding her.

"What the...who the fuck are you!?" Mark yelled, jumping up from the couch, the Xbox controller raised threateningly. "Tell me who you are right now or I'll call the cops!"

With a gasp the woman shot up, her long dark hair swinging wildly and her exposed breasts bouncing. As she rose, Mark caught the sight of what looked to be a purse, or a holster of some sort. Something metallic gleamed in the late afternoon light. She turned to face Mark, her eyes wide and full of adrenaline, and she tore around the side of the couch faster than Mark expected grabbing him by the shoulders.

"I don't have much time, you have to listen to me! I'm from the future and the world is ending! I've come back in time to give you this!" She almost screamed in his face, Mark so taken aback that he could only blink before shoving her backwards.

"Get the fuck off me and get the fuck out of my house!" Mark yelled as the woman stumbled backwards, giving a slight grunt but recovering quickly.

"There's no time!" The woman said, quickly pulling the metallic object. Mark tensed up, waiting for it to be a gun or a knife or some other weapon. Instead, she held it out to him and he could see it in it's entirety.

It was a remote. It wasn't any brand or design that he recognized, but it was clearly a remote. It had a screen at the top, which set it apart, but other than a few strange dials and knobs the rest of the buttons looked pretty similar to the remote to the TV next to him.

"Go on, take it! Take it!" The woman hissed with urgency, taking a few steps forward and shoving it upwards into Mark's face. Mark, however was hesitant to touch anything. Clearly this woman was on drug and that remote could be stolen property! It just wasn't worth it.

"No way. I don't know you, and I don't know how the hell you got in here but you need to leave. Now." Mark said, backing away towards the phone behind him.

"What? Oh. Right." The woman looked puzzled for a moment, "This is all new to you. I don't have much time though. I'm from the future, I'm here because the time machine can only send two inanimate articles back with someone. You my ancestor, and the world is literally coming to an end in my time as we speak. It may have already ended. I don't know. You have to take this device, you are the only person in the world that can prevent my timeline from happening. You can't marry Sharon. That's the key! But you can't just break up with her! You've got to-ARGH!"

"Miss, I...Are you high? Am I? I just...what are you talking about?"

Mark never got his answer as the woman began to scream, the remote tumbling from her hands and dropping harmlessly on the couch cushions. Her entire body turned...fuzzy. That was the only word Mark could find for it. She seemed to suddenly look like she was part of an old VHS tape, and pieces of her began to break apart and vanish into nothingness.

"Oh god it hurts!" She screamed, falling backwards as her legs began to fragment away into nothing. "Please, Mark, you have to listen to me! I've changed things just by coming back, I'm being erased! But so long as the remote exists, the end of the world is still going to happen! You have to stop it!"

"I..." Mark was speechless, and with a blood curdling scream that faded into distortion, the woman was gone and only sign that she had ever been there was the remote, sitting on the couch. Even the burn marks behind the couch were gone, and the power to the TV and the Xbox were restored.

"Holy shit..." Mark whispered to himself, "Did that just happen?"

Despite his caution Mark found himself reaching towards the remote, picking it up and moving his hands across it. It was cool and metallic to the touch, the button and knobs easily pliable. He pressed the large red button at the top of the remote, assuming it was the power button and his guess was proven correct; the screen came to life though only with a slight blue glow

WELCOME it said, PLEASE SELECT MODE.

And Mark, in his curiosity, pressed a button.

121.content:
The remote felt real, in his hands, the touch of cool metal in against his fingers too familiar to be ignored. Holding it up close, he was able to see the pixels of the display. It all felt too solid to be his imagination. But, with what had just happened... or rather what he'd just dreamed? imagined? he wasn't sure.

He turned it over and over in his hands. The buttons feeling real too, he looked at the back of the remote. He wanted to see a company logo, or something that meant he could identify who was behind this prank, even if he couldn't work out how he'd been pranked.

The back of the controller, seemed to split the light, a vague rainbow shimmer running across the metal, but it didn't look cheap, or fake. An expensive joke, he hoped.

His fingers shook with anger, as a thought occurred. Had he been dosed with something, was this a hallucination. But, even as that thought struck him, he glared around the empty room. Nothing looked or felt wrong. Everything was sharp, in focus, he didn't have any sense of disorientation, or distance.

Feeling one button shift beneath his touch, Mark tightened his grip to avoid dropping the thing.

As he did, that was when he was hit by a dizzying sensation, as if his knees were weakening. His eyeline dropped by a foot, and he tried to steady himself to stop crashing to the floor. However, another factor was leaping to the top of Mark's priorities.

He looked down, seeing a canyon of cleavage instead of his feet, his legs spreading wide bracing against his disturbed centre of balance.

A gasp spilled from her lips, as another thought occurred. His hands dropping to his crotch, there to find, matching underwear.... panties!

Worse still, they fitted, and Mark confirmed he was fully female. A last desperate hope that he was tucked away, instead finding a full, round rear that also made her quail in fear. The whole room felt bigger, more intimidating, and his?... her! grip tightened. Afraid both of the remote, and of losing it, and any hope of returning to normal.

The remote issued two sharp beeps, and Mark, felt odd. She looked for other changes, for her... his restoration. But her eyeline remained at the same low level, perhaps a foot or more lower than she liked. The bra remaining steadfastly real.

Again the girls grew. Mark wasn't familiar with this view of cleavage, but was damned sure that she was now amongst the most 'blessed' girls, especially with her shorter height.

The ache in her shoulders being accompanied by a twinge from the base of her spine. Rolling her shoulders, and flexing, Mark eased her straining muscles. Darting to the bathroom, Mark needed to examine things. Well, his darting was only a pace or two, as she felt her bust shift, the girls' inertia threatening to throw her off balance. But she made it to the mirror in the bathroom. Her shaving mirror!

Only to find the humiliations mounting. It was too high, she was able to see her eyes and hairline. Her bust not visible in the reflection. Mark had to take a step backwards. The chill porcelain pressing against her bust was making her nipples stiffen. It was more than Mark could deal with...

1213.content:
Forcing herself to put the remote down beside the sink, her fingers trembled but she managed it. She had to breathe deeply to stay calm, resist the urge to snatch it back up, and stab at the buttons until she... until Mark was restored.

Inventing a task for herself Mark went to fetch a footstool. The need to examine her new body building. She felt a deeper understanding of 'Lord of the Rings', the seductive call of power, and it's dangerous addiction. The scene of Bilbo surrendering the ring was now much sharper, the difficulty now acutely clear.

Dismissing her wandering thoughts, she took the living room footstool to the bathroom. Giving herself a simple task, helped Mark get her racing thoughts back under control. Her eyes darting to the remote, as soon as she returned. The whole situation felt unreal, as if the controller could vanish at any point, or her... his... -damn it- his friends would jump out and yell 'Surprise!'.

However, it laid there, exactly as she'd left it.

"It's an engineering problem." she told herself, "Just go slowly and carefully, and take note."

The unfamiliar voice she spoke in, undercut her confidence. But looking in the mirror she recognised the determination on her face, the resolution in her eyes. For the first time, she recognised herself behind/beyond the body.

Picking the remote up, she handled it carefully. This time making sure not to accidentally press any buttons.

Brushing her slender finger over it, the screen whirled, various options flashing past on the screen.

Restore Gender.
Restore Ethnicity.
Restore Previous Form.

Enhance bust.
Enhance rump.
Extend legs.

New Changes.
Display.
Undo.

Resisting the urge to stab the screen, and study the options. Mark wasn't about to accidentally trigger another change. He allowed the scrolling screen to slow and stop on it's own. Safety was her first instinct with any new piece of equipment. Being careful to swipe rather than tap, she selected, 'Restore Previous Form'.

Having a last look at her curvy, Asian body, the pensive beauty in the mirror looked gorgeously insecure and in need of a warm, comforting hug. But with a nod, she tapped the screen. She took in her body with a professional eye, a focus on the details.

Welcome to the world of Magical Transformations.

Due to reasons unknown, powerful, reality warping magic has begun to appear to certain individuals across the world. These individuals are seemingly chosen at random from the everyday populaces on the face of the Earth. While there appears to be no limit to the strange and fantastic powers granted to these individuals, the single 'rule' appears to be that a chosen individual must say "I wish" in order for the magic to take effect. The duration of the power given to the chosen individuals appears to vary wildly, some for only a few hours, while some may possess it for years.

At this moment, the power has chosen several individuals:

131.content:
It was an early June morning in the suburban outskirts of Boise, Idaho.

Randy Veltman didn't try to hide his annoyance as he loaded the suitcases into the back of his black SUV, grunting in annoyance rather than exertion as he listened to his wife, Norma, fritter about behind him. He must have been either bored or particularly weak to have agreed to her idiotic and expensive plan for a 'second honeymoon'. Randy was content with his life, work hard during the week and come home to a full meal and later a beer to nurse until sleep, with the weekends reserved for ballgames, fishing trips and more beer. It was just a waste of time doing all this packing and money going somewhere he didn't even like! The only saving grace was that his friend Carl and his wife were coming along, and Randy hoped the women would entertain themselves while he and Carl slipped off to a strip club or three.

"Oh Randy, it's just going to be wonderful! I know we'll have a great time on this trip! Don't you think so?" Norma's voice was shrill and echoed off the walls of the two car garage as she brought out the last of the travel cases, setting them beside Randy's trunk-like legs before stepping back and staring at the broad, flannel wearing giant that quickly loaded them on top of the other three suitcases.

"Norma, right now the only thing I can think about is the giant gaping hole in our bank account where money used to be. I don't see why you chose Las Vegas. We could have saved a ton of money if you'd just let me pick the place" Randy turned to face Norma, staring down at her much smaller form as he closed the SUV's back hatch.

"Well, I don't want to smell like fish or get bitten by bugs. Las Vegas is fun! I promise, we'll have a great time!" Norma's voice was almost too happy, as if she was trying to convince herself of what she had said, but Randy paid this no mind. He simply rolled his eyes and walked past her, out of the garage and into the kitchen, the door slamming shut behind him.

"I just want you to give it a chance..." Norma whispered to herself, hearing the telltale sounds of Randy pulling a beer out of the fridge, his heavy footfalls fading away deeper into the modest two story house that her family had lived in for fourteen years. She just wanted to keep it that way, Norma was grasping at any straws she could find to keep her from leaving Randy, and this was the very last thing she could think of.

'Maybe' she thought 'He'll have so much fun he'll forget himself' The long suffering housewife though to herself as she followed through the door shrotly after. One downside, outside of Randy's negative attitude that it, was inviting Carl and Jennifer along for the ride. While Norma like Jennifer somewhat, the younger woman's mannerisms and abrasive attitude towards his wife long a foul taste in her mode.

Speaking of which, with a slam of a door acrss the street, Norma heard the distinct sound of a door slamming. Walking over to one of the window slats in the garage door, she was greeting by the greatly mismatched pair of the Fischels leaving their house across the street and headed for hers. Carl, as usual, was lugging more than his fair share of the baggage on his small frame while Jennifer clipped across the pavement in the latest fashions that upper middle class fashion allowed her to buy. And both of them looked unhappy, though Norma wasn't quite sure if that was just the almost comical amount of bags Carl was carrying or just a general look of unhappiness. As their husbands were best friends (or, Norma sometimes wondered, boss and minion) Norma knew about the stresses that Jennifer found herself under. During couples night or seemingly endless fishing vacations or cleaning up dinner while their husbands drank beer in front of a football game, both wives had confided in each other. Jennifer feeling trapped in a marriage of convenience more than a marriage of love, and Norma desperately trying to keep hers from fading away.

The two women were friends, more or less, though Norma did resent Jennifer being so self-centered and general unwillingness to talk about Norma's problems. But Norma didn't have anyone else that understood what she was going through. Just the PTA momsquad and her old, now distant friends through Facebook.

"At least we'll be able to distract each other if this goes wrong..." Norma said as she hit the hit, causing the garage door to start it's slow, noisy crawl open and giving a forcibly cheerful wave hello.
_

Meanwhile, on the otherwise empty second story of the Veltman home, Laura Veltman was busy checking all of the window locks, lightbulbs and everything else the sixteen year old girl was being expected to take care of while her mom and dad were in Las Vegas. It was summer, so at least she didn't have to worry about having to get both of them ready for school in the mornings, but still, Laura had a lot on her mind, as did her brother.

Her eight year old brother Jonah sat on the top step of the stairs and tapped listlessly away on his tablet, waiting for the inevitable parade of goodbyes before he was left alone with his sister for a week. Jonah loved his sister and wasn't afraid or angry he had to spend a week following her rules, but it was the reason why his parents were going on the trip that made him feel uneasy. And the fact that Laura clearly knew but wasn't telling him made him frustrated.

"So, Squirt" Laura said, finally finished with her preparatory chores and taking a seat on the stairs beside him, "I was thinking pizza and Iron Man tonight? I bet if we start at the beginning we can watch ALL of the superhero movies by the time mom and dad get home!"

"I don't care" Jonah pouted, sticking his head further into his tablet, tapping away at some mindless game.

"Oh come on, it'll be fun! Maybe, if you keep it a secret, we'll invite Lindsey and Brandon over and we can play video games on dad's big TV~" Laura said, her voice playful and singsongy as she tried to lift her little brother's spirits, even if she was hiding the same general feeling of helplessness and fear on the inside. She was rewarded with Jonah's face lighting up with a hushed "Really!?" as she lifted him out of his mood.

"Yeah little bro, mom and dad arent't the only ones who get to have fun this week! But you gotta keep it all a secret!" Laura said as she brought him in for a big sisterly hug.

She wasn't blind to her parent's dissolving marriage and the way her dad more or less ignored the three of them. Sure she knew that on some level her dad loved her and Jonah, but it had been a very long time since Laura had last heard him say "I love you" to any extent to any of them. And she'd seen mom trying not to cry when Laura had asked about the possibility of a divorce last month. Unless Jonah directly asked, she wasn't going to say anything about the looming divorce, and she was determined to make this week a fun one for him. If things didn't go the way mom wanted them to go in Vegas, it could be the last enjoyable one that Jonah would have for a long time.

Laura tussled Jonah's hair and gave him a quick big sister tickle as he ran off to his room, a huge smile on his face. As soon as he was out of earshot Laura's own smile faded and she rested her head in her hands.

"I just wish that something would happen this week to fix this mess!" She whispered, and wiped back a stray tear as she heard the garage door opening and Mrs. Fischel call out to her mother.

Little did Laura know that her words would set loose a chain of events that would change everyone's lives, for better or for worse. Something flickered on the back porch of reality and the screen door that divided the realm of the impossible from the possible was flung open as a nameless force that some would call 'magic' filled the Veltman house and everyone in it. Laura had extended an invitation of sorts, the right combination of words and emotion that made the veil thin enough for 'magic' to make it's way into our world. And although it wasn't 'intelligent' like Laura or any human, it was not mindless. It was brought into this reality to serve a purpose.

It spread itself through every inch of the Veltman house, feeling the emotion and the history within it's walls, experiencing decades within the span of a few seconds and feeling completely sympathetic to the families within. With a flash of light visible only to those able to see 'magic', it decided to grant the young human's wish by bonding itself to her, the younger human, and all four of the older humans.

And although the intentions of 'Magic' were very well meaning, it's actions had an adverse affect on reality that would change all of their lives forever.
131.title: The Veltmans
