1311.content:
Randy was bringing one last bag out to the garage when the force closest identified as 'Magic' decided to make it's changes. It's purpose, as defined by Laura Veltman's wish, was to "Make something happen to fix this mess". It had scanned the Veltman house and everyone in it, including the newly arrived Fischels, all the way down to their emotional cores, and the empathic history of the house. And what it saw in it's all knowing yet rather clueless interpretation of events was that clearly the male and female humans had very little appreciation for each other and their struggles.

And so Magic decided that clearly the only real resolution was to switch the genders and roles of everyone in the house at the time of the change for one week. If no resolution was reached that would make the original reality better, then clearly this reality was superior. So in the time that it took a hummingbird's heart to beat once, Magic altered the very fabric of reality.

Randall 'Randy' Veltman was now Miranda 'Randi' Johnson, short and very feminine in clothing and make-up that accented her mature female body and made her look several years younger and more attractive. Her auburn hair was shoulder length and styled.

Norma Veltman was now Norman Johnson. Gone was the sundress and sandals and housewife body, replaced with a dark red polo shirt that seemed strained by the muscles of his new physique. A pair of worn but respectable jeans stretched down to a pair of sneakers. Her former blonde curls was now little more than a buzzcut hidden by a ballcap.

Laura Veltman was now Lucas Johnson. Gone was her female form, her long straight hair and girl next door looks, instead replaced by a curly haired teenage boy in a pair of beat up jeans and a dark blue t-shirt. Splotches of acne dotted his face.

Jonah Veltman was now Joanna Johnson. Where there had been an normal eight year old boy was now an eight year old girl in sweat pants and a Miraculous Ladybug t-shirt, her formerly short hair now hanging in a ponytail down the length of her back.

As for the Fischels, Magic included them even if they had not been the intended targets of the wish.

Carl Fischel became Carly Morrison. Her formerly early balding, slightly hunched pale body was straightened and smoothed, rejuvenated blonde hair hanging down past her shoulders and impressive breasts almost bursting out of a blue sundress. Her glasses shifted from being a requirement for driving to stylish black shades and her full lips were painted red with lipstick.

Jennifer Fischel became Jeffery Morrison, and her former elegant female body seemed to shrivel as it lost it's glory. Breasts shrank to barely muscled pecs, her glorious black hair whisped away to a barely managable combover, and her clothes went from stylish to bland, her dress segmenting into a pair of black slacks and a featureless maroon button down.

And as the people within the house changed, so did the house. All photos changed to represent the new identities, rooms changed to reflect new style preferences, even the vehicles changed, the large SUV becoming a large cab truck with a covered, lockable bed cover, Norma's former white economy car shifting to a small Volkswagon. Across the road, the former Fischel house endured similar changes to fit the new reality.

Satisfied that it's work was done, the force of 'Magic', had it been a visible, tangible object, did the equivalent of curling up and going to sleep, waiting for this exact moment next week to awaken and assess if the wish criteria had been met or not. If it was, then Magic would simply revert the changes. If it hadn't, then Magic would not force that obviously inferior, sad reality back into existence.

With the time it took for a hummingbird's heart to beat twice, the new reality solidified into place.
1311.title: A Grand Role Reversal

choices: Norma, Jennifer and Laura receive wishing powers.
Randy, Carl and Jonah receive wishing powers.
1312.content:
Randy was bringing one last bag out to the garage when the force closest identified to 'Magic' decided to make it's changes. It had entered this new reality on the basis of a heartfelt wish that had created a doorway through which 'Magic' could enter the human world. Magic, had it the capacity to realize itself and assign to it such corporeal and crude labels and identifiers, would have called itself a 'emotional' being. It had been called by the sheer heartbreak and sadness behind the younger female human's wish.

That was why when Magic entered this reality it had immediately expanded across the entire Veltman property, analyzing the humans and the home itself down to their emotional and empathic cores. It knew the Veltmans and Fischels even better than they knew themselves and it sympathized and loved all of them, even to the point where it outright ignored emotional concepts such as hate, rage, bitterness, jealousy and so many others. All Magic saw was six umans in deep emotional turmoil, and all of which just wanted to be happy.

That was why Magic was determined to give them a great and wonderful gift that they would certainly use to fix their lives for the better. Though it both knew and had no idea what a 'wish' was, Magic knew that it was the key to solving the unhappiness of these two families. After all, what better way to make them happy again by allowing their greatest wishes to come true?

In the time it took a hummingbird's heart to beat once, Magic selfless bonded itself to the individuals. It would be a part of them until they died, if they died, and although it did seem a bit unwise, Magic decided that it would fully give itself to them. No interference on part of it's own reasoning, it would be completely bound to the will and whims of the individuals from this moment until the end of their moments. It was brought into this reality to make a difference in their lives, and it would make a difference in their lives no matter what.
1312.title: Magic decides to grant some wishes

13121.content:
With it's final act as a independent force, Magic decided that bond itself to the three females present within the house. It's logic, alien as it was, was influenced by the emotional wellspring of the Veltman house, and it had determined that the female humans were far more in touch with their own emotions, less guarded like the human males were. And Magic was an emotional being, and it was the emotion that had called it into this reality to begin with. There were no doubt that some out there would, if they could see or even comprehend what Magic was that they'd call it's logic sexist, but Magic didn't care. With a flash of light not visible on this plane of existence, it sacrificed it's freedom to give Norma, Jennifer and Laura the ability to grant their own wishes. This change was not noticed by the Veltmans or Fischels, nor did they feel any different. The three women had no idea of the sheer power they now possessed.

"Here's the last of your crap, Norma." Randy said, shoving the small nylon bag into his wife's hands as he headed to help Carl. The smaller man was trying his best not to look overloaded, but one of the suitcases was already close to slipping out of the SUV and clattering to the garage's concrete floor. Eager to avoid another incident like the last time the two couples had gone on vacation ,Randy quickly grabbed the suitcase and almost effortless slid in back into the Tetris-like stack of luggage.

"Thanks Randy" carl said, wiping his expansive forehead the comb-over did little to hide.

"Yep" The larger man said, doing nothing while Norma slid between the two men and placed the small nylon bag on top of the stack.

"There, nice and tidy like a bow!" She exclaimed with a smile, glancing upwards at her husband. All she wanted was some kind of response just to show he was going to try...but her hopes were once against dashed as he simply removed her bag and shoved it in a smaller gap between the suitcases.

"You have to actually stack luggage so it doesn't roll around" Was all Randy said before closing the SUV's hatch. The four adults stood in an awkward silence for a moment before Norma spoke up again.

"Well, if we're all packed, let's go say bye to the kids and get this show on the road!" She reached for Randy's hand but he was already moving towards the driver side door.

He opened the car door and pulled himself in, "I already said mine while I was getting your crap." He said as he slammed the door shut and started the ignition, the SUV's motor loud within the small space of the garage. "Make it quick, will you? We're already running late"

"Oh...okay then..." Norma responded weakly, "Jen, Carl, you go ahead and get in, I won't be a minute". The already emotionally exhausted woman quickly left the garage and made her way through the interior of the house, looking over everything to make sure the house was in a safe, secure state. After her quick check of all the doors and the windows, she crossed into the living room, where here two children sat on the bottom step of the stairs; Laura giving her a worried look while Jonah's head was buried in his tablet.

"Well guys, guess I'm out!" Norma said, opening her arms wide and giving her children a large smile. Laura was, predictably, the first one to act. Norma's only daughter embraced her mother with a large hug.

"Mom, I hope...I just want you guys to have a great time, okay? I wish dad was more open to your ideas and so you two could..." Laura's voice was a choked whisper, raw emotion through. "Oh mom..."

"Shh, honey. It's okay. I'll make it work! I bet you won't even recognize your father when we get back!" Norma reassured her daughter, wiping a stray tear from the teenager's face before turning to face her son "Jonah, can you come say bye to mom?"

"Okay" Jonah said and he paused his game and scampered over to his mother, giving her a huge hug around her waist. The boy was a little sad, but all the promises his sister had made him had him more excited and almost eager for his mom to leave. Norma bent down and returned the hug, giving him a large kiss the cheek. "I call you later before bed, okay?"

"Okay mom" The boy said, wiggling out of the hug and pulling the tablet back up to his face. Norma turned to face Laura once more.

"Well, I guess I'm off, then. Remember, emergency numbers are-" She started, but was silenced as Laura finished her sentence.

"On the fridge, leftovers in the fridge, pizza money on your dresser, no boys and bed by 8 and eleven. I got his, mom" Laura said with smirk, "Now go...just have fun okay? Even if he doesn't want you to"

The fact that her daughter knew so much about the failures of the marriage made Norma's heartbreak, but she put on a brave face, gave one final hug, and left the house. A few moments later there was just the slow, loud roar of the garage door closing and the rev of an engine.

The vacation had finally begun.
13121.title: Norma, Jennifer and Laura receive wishing powers.

choices: Carl suddenly has breasts...and a husband!?
132.content:
It was another early June morning in the suburban outskirts of Boise Idaho.

Carl Fischel was trying his best not to grunt as the suitcases full of his wife's clothing threatened to slip from his grip. Jen was beside him, chittering off a list of all the things she expected to do, and for Carl to pay for, while they were in Vegas. She carried only a small purse and her smartphone, flicking through her DVR app and making sure her almost countless reality TV shows were set to record over the next week.

"And you made sure to check our reservations this morning at the Belagio, right? If we get there and there's no reservation I absolutely REFUSE to stay in a Motel 8! And there's several shows I want to see so I hope you were listening when I told you to order those tickets! And would it kill you to have as much fun as me on this trip, sweetie? I don't want to spend the whole thing dealing with Norma while you and Carl sneak off to the casinos!"

"I did, dear. That won't happen, dear. I will, dear." Came his canned and memorized responses. Carl loved Jennifer, or at least he was pretty sure he did. She was demanding, controlling, but when was the last time that a math nerd like him ended up with a girl that had been prom queen, cheerleading captain and a sorority babe? Not outside of Hollywood, he guessed. And he did enjoy making Jennifer happy, but there were times when she just drove him up a wall. Not that he'd ever say that, of course. That's where all the fishing trips with Randy came in, when Carl could just hang out, drink beer and just enjoy the company of his friend that honestly did not care about domestic problems at all.

"You always say that! Why can't you-" Jennifer started as they cleared the pavement and stepped up onto the sidewalk in front of the Veltman residence. Carl was such a twerp sometimes. Sure, he was good at what he did and kept her very well pampered, but sometimes she just could not stand the amount of useless he was. She had to remind him to do everything, including to have fun! She was fond of him though, much in the way a animal is fond of the hand that feeds it, and stopped herself short of saying something truly hurtful. She was trying to get better about lashing out after she had made a bit of a scene the last time that they and the Veltmans had gone out on a double date and EVERYONE discovered just how poorly she handled her drinks. But sometimes...she just wished she could get a do-over and marry someone with money AND a spine.

"You know, I'm sor-" Jennifer's apology cut short as the garage door began groaning open, revealing a waving Norma and a overly cheerful smile on her face. Jennifer fought the urge to roll her eyes, she could already tell the day was off to a great start with her neighbor. She took a quick breath and pushed the annoyance she felt towards her useless husband away.

"Hey girl!" Jennifer called out, opening her arms and giving her neighbor a quick hug. "Thanks again for letting me and Carl tag along, we're just so excited to finally be going back to Vegas! Right babe?"

"Yes dear" Came Carl's response as began the slow process of setting the four suitcases down, wiping the sweat that was beading on his forehead away before once more lifting a suitcase and moving towards the back of the Veltman's SUV.

"Oh Carl, do you want me to get Randy to load those for you?" Norma's voice called out, full of concern.

"Oh no, I can manage" Carl replied as he pulled the SUV's back hatch open, peering through his glasses at the best place to stack his wife's three suitcases and his own small one.

"Make sure you're gentle, Carl. I don't want to end up with another bunch of broken cosmetics because you didn't stack them right! Otherwise we'll have to restock when we get to Vegas!" Jennifer called out before turning back to Norma "Now tell me ALL about the room you guys picked out! We're staying in one of the Belagio suites, you know, close to where all the high rollers in the casino stay..."

Carl let loose a low grunt as he loaded the luggage, just trying to keep his mind off how much money he had shelled out for this trip, that maybe he could have married someone a little less high maintenance, or that maybe it'd be nice to be the one in the driver seat of the relationship, giving out orders for once. And then it happened, the entire world changed around him as a unheard wish made by his best friend's daughter invited in a powerful force that would change his life forever.

'Magic', insomuch as the force could be called, filled the entirety of the Veltman property, leeching into the very essence of the home as it absorbed every moment that had taken place within it's walls. During it's relentless exploration of the Veltman home it surged into the garage and across every individual within it, including Jennifer and Carl Fischel. The wish that had brought it into this reality had been intended for everyone with the last name of 'Veltman' but it had not been specifically stated that 'Magic' couldn't help out another struggling couple whose emotional turmoil it sampled as well.

In an instant, 'Magic' knew what to do.
132.title: The Fischels

choices: Only Carly and Norman realize the change
Only Randy and Jennifer Realize the change
1321.content:
Carl's grip on Jennifer's make-up bag slipped the moment the entity most closely identified as 'Magic' made it's decision. 'Magic', you see, had been called into this reality by a wish to "that something would happen this week to fix this mess!". Who made it, Magic wasn't sure, it all happened in a bit of a rush to be honest. All it knew was that it was in this reality now and it was being drawn towards some sort of emotional circus somewhere nearby.

So Magic took a pretty quick look around the place. While it had no real sense of aesthetics, Magic thought the house looked pretty nice, cozy, it supposed. But then it felt the emotional trauma happening pretty much...everywhere within the structure. It wasn't a pleasant feeling and magic simply did not have time to deal with it, even though the concept of time didn't really apply to Magic, even in it's original reality. The whirlwind of emotions, at the strained glance Magic was willing to give it was that the two human females liked each other, but harbored far more resentment towards the human males. The human males were fond of each other's company, and found the females to tiresome. There was also a younger human female and a younger human male also on the property but Magic, frankly, was harboring a bit of a grudge since the younger female was the one that dragged it into this mess.

So, two human males that preferred each other to the females, two females that preferred each other to the males and forget the younger two humans. Clearly this was what it was supposed to solve before it would be allowed to be released back to it's own reality.

Because this is what I am, apparently. I'm a marriage councilor Is what Magic would have said to itself, had it any real grasp of the concept of snark, or knew what a marriage councilor was. It very quickly decided what to do, feeling a tremor ripple through it's untangible mass as it's equivalent of a headache began. With a pulse of energy that altered the entirety of the human reality, it curled up and began to go to sleep, hoping to head off the metaphysical migraine before it hit.

Carl Fischel was now Carly Veltman, young and attractive. Her formerly early balding, slightly hunched pale body was straightened and smoothed, rejuvenated blonde hair hanging down past her shoulders and impressive breasts almost bursting out of a blue sundress. Her glasses shifted from being a requirement for driving to stylish black shades and her full lips were painted red with lipstick. And she had gone from loading luggage into an SUV to having her slender, tanned arms wrapped around the bulky trunk of Randy Veltman, her husband.

Meanwhile, Norma Veltman instantly became Norman Johnson, her slender, aging female form immediately bulking to an appearance not unlike Hugh Jackman. Her hair vanished to a buzzcut hidden under a ballcap, her muscles strained against a polo shirt instead of breasts against a sundress, and instead of women's sandals there were instead two slightly worn sneakers. Suddenly luggage appeared in his hands as Jennifer's arms slipped around one of his muscled limbs.

There. You all get to be with the people you like.Try it for one week. If it gets fixed, everything goes back to normal. If it doesn't, then I can't fix it and I'll send you a bill.

And with that, Magic was 'gone', at least for a week.
1321.title: Pairing Off

choices: The children remember who they were.
The children don't remember who they were.
13213.content:
While the adults of both families were undergoing their own major changes in the garage, Laura and Jonah Veltman were undergoing changes of their own. 'Magic', however much of an impatient, inconsiderate entity it had been, did not leave the younger humans out of it's changes. It was, after all, against the 'rules', or whatever passed as limitations for impossibly powerful entities not native to this reality, to simply erase beings from existence in totality. It could only alter the fabric of the human reality, not outright remove parts of it.

So as the older, questionably mature humans had their lives and identities altered, so did the younger humans, though Magic left these changes entirely up to it's own subconscious logic rather than controlling the changes, as it had with the older humans.

Laura was the oldest at sixteen, but in the new reality, both of the women were far too young to have a child that old without drastically altering their pasts and thus, altering their relationships to be wholly unsuitable for their current mates. In an instant the years melted off of her, changing her from a teenage girl next door to a young four year old boy as her her name changed from Laura Veltman to Elijah Johnson. She had, in the original reality largely taken after her mother in the looks department and now that her mother was now a man, it was logical that such a strong genetic resemblance would simply be carried over. Though now there were traces of Jennifer within his appearance as the former hoodie and jeans of Laura became a pair of boy's overalls and an Avengers t-shirt with Star Wars light up shows covering his small feet.

Jonah underwent a similar change, his age cutting in half from eight to four as well, as his gender shifted from male to female. Carly was a younger woman, and her genes were, in a way, slightly more robust than Randy's, his age playing just the slightest factor. Jonah's name became Haley newly blond hair ran down the length of her back as his previous shorts and Transformers shirt morphed into a frilly pink dress with a heart studded My Little Pony top with white sandals studded with plastic pink flowers slid between her toes.

In the same amount of time that it took to change the adults, the children were changed as well. Though in order to keep the events of the new timeline in logical order, both children were now sitting on the couch in the Veltman living room, an episode of Teen Titans Go playing mindlessly on the television while a babysitter materialized on the recliner nearby. She was twenty, dirty blonde hair and big green eyes that framed a pretty face, while the rest of her body was clearly that of a cheerleader, a smartphone appearing in her slender hands witth several textbooks, a purse and a backpack appearing next to the recliner. After all, two four years olds would never be expected to take care of themselves.

The changes shimmered away as 'Magic' finished with the adults and curled up into hibernation.
13213.title: Wait, what about the kids?

choices: 'Vanessa' is actually Magic given human form.
'Vanessa' is supposed to be a guy.
'Vanessa' is supposed to be something else?
132133.content:
"Wait. This...this isn't right." The babysitter said, and then immediately shot a hand to her mouth while the noise of the Teen Titans Go theme song blared over the television's speakers. "Did I just...say that? And this? And this?"

The two four year olds turned to look at her strangely, Elijah's eyes squinting in suspicion. "Are you okay, Ms. Vanessa?" His voice was unsure, as if he seemed to be speaking to someone he knew and trusted very well, but at the same time someone he had never seen before in his life.

'Vanessa', on the other hand, was suddenly realizing that something had gone wrong. Very wrong. She wasn't supposed to be here! But before anyone could fully panic, there was a influx of people into the Veltman living room as the changed adults entered to say goodbye to their new children. Or at least half of them.

"Oh my precious little angel, mommy is gonna miss you so much!" Jennifer cooed as she scooped a rather bewildered Elijah off the sofa and gave him a large hug and several kisses on the cheek, "You bee good for Ms. Vanessa okay? Mommy will call you tonight when we get to the hotel! I'll bring you presents!"

"O...okay mommy! I'll be good. I...love you!" Elijah's voice was slightly wavering though he seemed more sure of himself now, and his face lit up at the idea of getting presents. As his mother set him down and gave a few sniffles as she fixed his hair, Elijah squirmed and turned to look at his father.

"Bye, daddy?" Elijah said as Jennifer finished her primping and and returned to the side of her husband, Norman.

"Uh...yeah. Bye, uh, sport" Norman's voice was a deep manly rumble where only moments before it had been a willowly soprano. Both father and son, newly minted, seemed to share a look before their attention was pulled away by the second set of goodbyes as Randy scooped Hayley up in his arms.

"Be a good girl, okay rugrat?" Randy's voice was full of a half-hearted fatherly concern as he gave the newly minted girl a deep bear hug, to which she only giggled and returned with a big kiss on the cheek.

"Okay daddy! I will! Can I have a present too?" Her voice was strong and happy, there was no doubt that this was Randy's daughter as the large man turned his head to look at his freshly made wife, who was standing uncertainly in the doorway of the living room.

"Mommy and I will make sure to get you something. Mommy's gonna come say goodbye now and then we and Elijah's mommy and daddy have to go, okay?" Randy signalled that it was time to leave with a subtle jerk of his head, and Carly took several unsteady steps forward until she was at the couch.

"Um..." She started, apparently unsure of what to say, "Be a good girl for mommy and listen to the babysitter? I...love you?"

Hayley through her tiny arms around Carly's long blonde locks and gave her a kiss on the cheek, "Love you too mommy!" As soon as the tiny arms released her neck Carly stood and began to move away, only to be grabbed by Jennifer as the other mother headed towards 'Vanessa'.

"Now remember the numbers are on the fridge, Elijah is to be in bed NO LATER than 8pm, and he is to brush his teeth after every meal, is that understood? And the meals MUST be healthy! Fruits and vegetables for snacks only! And I want him to have milk, apple juice or water only, no soda or fruit punch! I want a text and picture of the meal before you give it to him so I can make sure you're not giving him any cheats! And always remember that he is to have a bath every night before bed! And make sure that ANY book that you read to him is not scary. If I come home and find him having nightmares, there will be consequences! You come VERY highly recommended so I better not see you ruining my precious little man with cheats! Is that understood?" Jennifer's voice was stern and uncompromising, her eyes drilling into 'Vanessa'.

"Of...of course. Whatever you say!" 'Vanessa' replied, the fear that was filling her body very apparent on her face.

"Carly, do you have anything to add?" Jennifer turned, facing the new woman, her eyes narrowing.

Carly gulped and cast a look between Jennifer and 'Vanessa', "Yeah, uh, what she said!" was all she could manage.

After a few more drawn out goodbyes from Jennifer to Elijah, the Veltmans and the Johnsons were gone, the sound of the SUV starting up and the grind of the garage door closing as the two couples sped off towards Las Vegas. The living room returned to normal as the ambient noise of Teen Titans Go returned to the forefront, quickly recapturing the attention of the children, though Elijah continued to cast glances at 'Vanessa'.

And 'Vanessa' continued to stare down at herself in a mixture of shock and horror. This was not good, not good at all.
132133.title: Wait, what about the babysitter?

choices: Vanessa tries to focus on accessing her power
Vanessa finds herself falling into the role of a college coed babysitter
1321331.content:
"Oh. This isn't happening. This is NOT happening." 'Vanessa' repeated to her self several times as she ran alien hands across an equally alien body as fear and adrenaline pumped through her newly created heart and circulatory system. Everything was so overwhelming, so new! And so slow! Before this...whatever this was happened she was able to do millions of things in the span of seconds! But now every though was processed only by the rate of her organic, squishy brain! And to make matter worse, she could feel the power of what she had been, but there was no way for her to access it!

'Vanessa' was so caught up in experiencing her new form that she didn't see, didn't even register as Elijah got up from his seat on the couch and the sea of carpet to her, appearing by her barely covered legs.

"Ms. Vanessa, are you okay?" The boy asked again, and 'Vanessa's' head shot up, her eyes wide with fear before something strange overcame her. Instead of sheer panic, the entity that had once been called 'Magic' was filled with a need to re-assure the child in front of her, despite the fact that she had no real clue about human interaction.

"Uh, yeah Eli, I'm good!" She said, despite knowing that she really wasn't, "I just, uh, didn't want to make your mom worry about leaving you here all week!" Again the answer seemed to placate the boy as he returned to his seat, but the sidelong glances kept coming.

'All week? Oh holy crap I have to be like this all week?' She thought to herself, and this time she kept herself from saying what she was thinking, thanks to these new found 'human' traits that had somehow been bestowed upon her. Magic, or rather, Vanessa, slowly came to the realization that just like the changes it-she had done moments ago had imparted some sort of normalization effect onto the adults that the same normalization process now applied to her. In fact, while not connected to the memories as a whole, Vanessa realized that she now did indeed have memories. Memories of a childhood never lived, the now seemingly vast history of a world she did not belong in, the popular sayings of her age group, mannerisms befitting a woman and a babysitter, and a need to care for the young children before her.

It terrified her to the very core, but with normalization all it made her do was turn to stare at the animated cartoon show that she was somehow very familiar with. After all, it was what she had the kids watch at all of her jobs.As the somewhat clever, though mostly bad jokes came rolling in her limited, electrochemical brain began to think of formerly alien things such as college, fashion, boys...

'No. NO. I will not let this personality consume me! I just need to focus on trying to access the power again so I can get back to being me, and I'll make sure to pick something to take my place instead of just winging it. Damnit! This is all so wrong!'
1321331.title: 'Vanessa' is actually Magic given human...

choices: Vanessa admits that she's...not from around here.
Vanessa tries to lie her way out.
Vanessa panics and triggers her magic powers.
13213313.content:
The couch seemed so alien, yet familiar to Elijah. It wasn't his couch, that was for sure. It was the wrong color and it was too poofy and it didn't smell like his house...either forms of them. And he was pretty sure that he'd never seen Ms. Vanessa before this very moment. Half formed memories said that he had, but older, deeper memories argued otherwise.

When Magic left Laura and Jonah's changes up to the internal, self-driven logic of the 'spell', the spell had simply reduced Laura and implanted the new memories in her head that would make her fit in this new reality where she was the only child of Norman, her former mother turned male, and Mrs. Fischel, now his biological (and quite fussy) mother Jennifer. But somewhere, beneath the layers of half-formed thoughts and excruciating amount of little kid instincts, Laura Veltman still existed. Her memories were far sharper, clearer, and there were simply more of them, which was the primary reason why she had not simply been winked out of existence and replaced entirely with the personality of Elijah.

The two personalities were simply merged into one new personality that made Elijah Johnson seem far more intelligent and older than he physically was. That was why, despite the fact that he was clearly entertained by the antics of the Teen Titans, he was also annoyed by them. They were childish, comparable to just being brightly colored noise designed to keep kids glued to the TV (and his deeper memories suggested they were an insult to the original show and it's fans), so he pulled himself out of the soft cushion canyon of the the new Veltman couch and began to wander around the living room.

In this new reality, Elijah was a guest here. He knew that this was Hayley's house, and that the reason they were not staying at his house was because Hayley got homesick easily and literally. But that was fine with him, he had his video games to keep him company, plus he really liked Hayley. She was fun. But a deeper part of him was disgusted by the thought. He couldn't remember why, he just knew that it was...wrong. So he busied himself exploring all the new things that hadn't been there when this had been his house.

It was certainly geared towards a younger, more energetic couple. Pictures of Hayley's mom and dad doing exciting things like riding a motorcycle, dancing, boat trips and other activities dotted the walls. A LOT of pictures of Hayley dressed up in extravagant dresses, apparently from the moment she was old enough to wear them. A large family portrait of her dad Randy, her mom Carly and Hayley hung above the fireplace. Elijah felt angry looking at it, Randy looked so happy, he was actually smiling! And Carly, whoever this Carly was, clearly wasn't the same woman that had just left. This Carly was clearly confident of her body and loved to show it off with a smile. The blue dress was eye popping, and it hugged her form just right; her breasts dominating the photo. Hayley simply sat in the middle with a happy, girlish smile on her face in an impossibly frilly white dress.

That didn't seem fair to Elijah. In fact it made him angry enough that he felt the impulse to yell about and go on a destructive rampage through the house. But his older 'self' stopped him, and instead pushed him to continue exploring.

Eventually he made his way through the living room and stood at the threshold to the front door, the hallway to the rest of the house and the stairs (which had a larger baby gate on them, clearly to keep Hayley from playing on them). He cast a backwards glance at Ms. Vanessa and Hayley. His best friend was still enraptured by Teen Titans Go, and their babysitter was busy probing her body in a way that no babysitter should, at least in front of children. A slender, manicured finger was poking her large breasts and staring aghast at the movement it caused, pulling at long golden hair in disbelief, slowly moving her hands around in front of her eyes before they began to creep downward across her stomach and examining the button of her jeans, a stray finger sliding behind the fabric...

'NOPE. Nope.' Elijah thought and he called out to Vanessa, "Ms. Vanessa, can you come get me a drink, please?"

His boyish voice seemed to jerk 'Vanessa' from her exploratory revelry and she spun around in the recliner, clearly lost before her blue eyes locked on him standing in the doorway. "Uh...Yeah. A drink. Right." She said and after a moment of confusion, pulled herself out of the chair and took several unsteady steps over to him, pausing in the doorway and looking down the hall, her brow furrowing with thought.

"This way, Ms. Vanessa!" Elijah said, and he took off down the short hall, pausing at the end and pointing towards the kitchen doorway, and he watched, curious, as this buxom pneumatic blonde stumbled her way to him, almost tripping over her feet at the last moment and catching herself in the doorway with a cute willowy "oomph!".The kitchen while structurally the same as his older self remembered, was aesthetically different like the rest of the house., gone was the old fashioned style, the dated wallpaper, the rustic wooden cabinets and old kitchen table. Instead everything was so...monochromatic. White cabinets, dark black marble counters, stainless steel appliances...It was a very modern kitchen for what was an apparently very modern family. Elijah took a breathe and walked over to the angular table and carefully climbed up the tall wooden mountain of a chair, his head barely clearing the the top of the table as he stared at Vanessa, still propping herself up in the doorway, her eyes still wide and confused as she processed where she was.

'There's no way this is our real babysitter', Elijah surmised. 'Even a real bimbo would know what to do!'. He coughed and her head whipped towards him, her long locks washing across her face in a wave. The boy pointed towards the sink, "Can I have a glass of water, please?"

"Water. Right. you need that." Vanessa said, and with a little more confidence and stability, she made her way slowly through the kitchen, looking only once at Elijah's outstretched finger to make sure she was headed in the right direction. When she finally arrived at the sink, she glanced back at the little boy.

"You have to get a glass from the cabinet and fill it with water."

Her hands reached upwards and to Elijah's surprise, quickly opened and shut several of the cabinets before coming across the one that held the drinking glasses. But then she pulled out a wine glass and held it towards him, a nervous smile on her face.

"No, that's too big. I need a small one"

"Right. Because you're small. Have to scale." The blonde whispered to herself as she set the wine glass back and in a few moments pulled out a much smaller, orange plastic cup that had a dinosaur on it. It was actually too small, but Elijah said nothing, simply nodding when she held it, almost playfully towards him. Her face lit up with achievement and she held the cup in the sink, fumlbing only once before figuring out how to turn the water on. The cup filled up in an instant and Vanessa slowly, with one hand on top of the cup, made her way to the table, setting it down in front of Elijah with the utmost care as to not spill a drop. Elijah's smaller finger curled around the cup and he took a quick sip. The water was warm, almost hot, clearly she didn't know which handle controlled water temperature.

That, when it came to bath time later, was a red flag in Elijah's mind. This woman, whoever she was, could easily hurt him or Hayley just out of ignorance! It was time to get to the bottom of this insanity.

"You're not our real babysitter, are you?"
13213313.title: Inquisitor Elijah

choices: The customer does something which causes Rebecca to make an annoyed wish
Rebecca and Jake's conversation leads Rebecca to saying “I wish...”
133.content:
“You're sorta stuck where you are, but in your dreams you can buy expensive cars. Or live on Mars, and have it yooooooooooour way! You hate your boss at your job, but in your dreams you can blow his head off. In your dreams, show no meeeeeeeeeercy!”

The prophetic song played over the intercom of Sandy's, a local retail store in the Twin Pines Mall as Rebecca Armitage and Jake Anselm manned the two front registers. Not a lot of people were in the store today, as it as a Wednesday morning. A middle aged woman and a girl of about nine, probably mother and daughter, were checking out shoes while a nondescript man wearing a brown jacket browsed Blu-Rays. Outside the store, an elderly looking man in a fedora was reading the newspaper on a wooden bench as he usually did every day.

Rebecca yawned loudly as she made inventory of her life. She was 21, going to graduate from college next semester. Her father, for there was no Mrs. Armitage in the picture, had insisted that she take something STEM related, particularly since he was a mechanical engineer himself. Rebecca eventually acquiesced to Mr. Armitage's terms, and was aiming to get a degree in Statistics, though she honestly had very little interest in the subject. The course was intense and work load heavy, which left very little time for her to make any new friends. She half-heartedly tried to pledge for a sorority in her first year, but she dropped out when she realized that she just didn't have the room in her schedule(She didn't want to admit that it was the bitch who made fun of her for gaining the freshman fifteen). Rebecca thought wistfully back to high school. She had plenty of friends there. She was popular. She didn't even have time to go swimming anymore.

“Wasn't that song in Batman Forever?” heard Rebecca all of a sudden, breaking her out of her daydream.

“What?” she asked tiredly.

“That song that's playing. Wasn't that in Batman Forever, you know, the one with Jim Carrey?” asked Jake.

“I don't know” answered Rebecca, resting her face on her elbow, her elbow itself resting on the counter like a freestanding column. “I never saw that movie.”

“Before your time, maybe” said Jake.

“Maybe. I'm not big on the superheroes.”

Jake Anselm was Rebecca's co-worker. He had just turned thirty years old and was going through what psychologists called a quarter-life crisis. Jake was beginning to realize that he wasn't a kid anymore, having wasted his twenties in a state of arrested adolescence and immaturity, working minimum wage jobs just to scrap by, and his relationship with Rebecca was friendly but strained as a result of his insecurities. He wanted to start fresh and go back to college himself, but his low self confidence told him that he was perhaps just a bit too old for it.

“Do you ever wish that you could just start over, Jake?” asked Rebecca in a pensive voice as she was watching one of the customers walk up to her register to purchase something. She suddenly composed herself, forming a perfectly happy smile that hid her soul crushing ennui.
133.title: Bad Days

14.content:
Here is a selection of four more story options for you to choose from! These story prompts are not related to the SandySeeker re-imaginings and instead are entirely reliant on your imagination to tell! Pick one below or create your own!

The Toolbox: One average day at home is ruined by a moderate earthquake. There's no real serious damage and no one is hurt, but one of your shelves was dislodged from it's sport on the wall. Not wanting to foot the bill from opportunistic repairmen, you decide to fix it yourself. You retrieve your toolbox from the basement, but it soon becomes very clear that these are no longer ordinary tools, and find yourself caught up in a whirlwind of strange adventures. Who knew it would be this exciting fixing a shelf?

There had just been an earthquake and several aftershocks here in the sunny bay area of Redford Hills California, and while you'd been used to them since you were very young, this one had decided to be a jerk and cause some actual property damage to the home you shared with your best friend Kyle Eubanks. A shelf in the kitchen has been rattled off of it's mooring, sending food and tupperware everywhere, and after the quakes had ceased and the mess cleaned up, the two of you had stood and stared at the completely dislodged box of wood.

"Is anything broken down there, Sidney?" Your roommate Kyle calls from the top of the stairs.

"No, just a couple of boxes are on the floor!" You say back from the bottom of the aged staircase as you survey the basement of your shared home. After a few moments you turn to head back upstairs and deal with the true mess that the earthquake had caused when you see it, sitting on the shelf near the small rectangular window that let natural light into the dark confines of the basement.

A small, red toolbox, covered in a light layer of dust, the light bouncing dully off of it. That's when you got the idea that would go on to change your entire life.

"Hey Kyle! There's a toolbox down here! I bet we could fix the cabinet ourselves and not have to call your dad!" You say excitedly as you quickly cross the basement floor and grab the box off the shelf, surprised by the weight of such a small container as you lug it back over to the stairs and show it to Kyle, who had decided to come down.Sitting inside and playing video games during your free time from school didn't exactly help your already less than stellar athleticism. You shift your grip to hold the toolbox by the silver metal handle and motion to it with your other hand dramatically as if you were on a game show.

"Dude, the last time we actually tried building something was Shop class two years ago" Kyle said, referencing the small disaster that had been the exposure to power tools for the both of you. But hey, at least they'd been able to re-attach that one boy's finger and as far as you knew he was living a normal life.

"I know, that's why I want to fixing this thing! To prove that we can!" You said, ignoring the fact that the both of you had otherwise been banned from using the tools in Shop class after The Incident. But luckily you had both been able to take the class Senior year, not that it expanded your knowledge base any.

"We didn't learn shit in that class." Kyle said, crossing his arms and fixing you with a look that said he was never going to buy any of the bullshit that you had planned to say. It was true, though, everyone spent that particular class goofing off because it had been the teacher's last semester before retirement and all he did was give everyone As for showing up to class.

"At least let me try first! If it's still broke we can just call your dad or something" You plead with your best friend.

"Because that's a good idea...Fine, whatever." He responded, rolling his eyes. Kyle's dad was a bit of a hard-ass. The man owned a contractor company and did not deal with having to pay for things. He was sort of like a modern day Scrooge in that respect. But it was either fix it yourself or call him. With a shrug you stepped past your friend and made your way up the stairs that led back into the kitchen.

You quickly reached the top of the short flight of stairs and crossed the small space to put the dust covered toolbox that you'd discovered. You figured one of your parents must have put it down there as a housewarming gift or it had been left by a former owner, but either way it was time to make use of it. Before you flip the lid open you blow on the toolbox and immediately regret your decision as a cloud of dusts flies into your face. Not expecting it, you inhale more than a little and begin coughing as you wave the dust out of your face.

"Wow when was the last time you touched that thing, bro?" Kyle chuckled as he leaned in behind you as you open the toolbox's lid. Inside were dozens of tools; a tape measure, a woodworking compass, a hammer, screwdrivers, socket wrenches, the works.

"I think maybe when we moved in? It was already here when we got here so..." You reply, gently pushing him aside as you reach in to grab the hammer and a box of nails. Kyle's hands snatched in towards the tape measure and pulled it out with a loud "AHA!" as you started pooling the tools you believed you needed for the job on the table beside the toolbox.

"Dude." Kyle's voice was full of excitement as you saw him grab a circular object with a tiny metallic lip on one end and you try not to groan too much. Kyle being excited about something meant that there was very little chance he'd actually help you get this done. He was pretty notorious for being a flake. His older sister Haylee was the same, and more than once you'd quietly wondered if they were just that clueless or if it was something they'd gotten from their mom.

"What." You say in a practiced, neutral voice, not acknowledging him beyond that singular word. Maybe if you played dis-interested enough he'd lose interest and actually help you. It had worked before, after all.

"Measure me!"

You sighed and turned to face him, despite having just tried to ignore him. There he was, with his 'Jonah Hill meets Freddie Prinze Jr.' face lit up with child like excitement.

"Measure me! It's been forever since the last time they told me how tall I was! What if I've grown?"

"Kyle" You sighed, "Can you just help me fix the damn shelf?"

"C;mon, just do this for me, ok? I promise I'll help you" He begged.

"Ugh, fine. Give it here" You said, reaching out for the tape measure which he promptly slammed into your hand. You lift the tape measure up and look it over, it had been a REALLY long time since you'd messed with any kind of tool and you wanted to make sure you didn't break the thing by not pulling it out right. Finding the lip of the tape roll, you grasp hold and give a short tuck, the yellow metallic ribbon of numbers sliding out easily. You fix Kyle with a half bored, half annoyed stare, "I can't believe I'm doing this"

"It'll be fun!" He says, standing up against the kitchen wall. You rolled your and took a couple of steps towards him, holding the lip of the tape measure's tongue by the top of his head and dragging the main body down to his feet. This WAS the right way, wasn't it?

"Dude, what the hell are you doing? You're supposed to put the little metal hook thing under my show!" Kyle cried out.

Apparently not.

With another roll of your eyes, you let go of the metallic lip and prepare for the measure to snap back into it's casing.

It does, but something strange happens as the tape measure curls into itself. Kyle begins to rapidly shrink! His entire body, clothing and all rapidly decrease in size in the split second it takes the tape measure to close back into ti's housing, leaving him stranded at six inches tall!

There's a moment of silence before the panic sets if for both of you.

"Yes I'm going right now, and the beer can wait! Maybe if I show up they'll let me in without asking too many questions!" You say, placing your hand on your car and bracing yourself for the change. You line up the hammer and let it fly downwards, the pain sharp but brief as green light fills your vision. "Dude, I still can't believe this is happening, it's so cool!" He says, taking a swig from the bottle at the most inopportune time possibly as a police cruiser pulls onto the street.

You and Kyle stand there like fools waiting for it to reach the end the street and turn onto another one before you turn, as fast as your current body will allow, back to Kyle, a crooked finger pointed in his face.

Soon you find yourself...

Still a dude? Check.
Still human sized? Check.
Still human? Check.

"I'm not an evil witch I'm your best friend! Now figure out a way to fix me!" You said frantically as you tried to catch the skin and muscle dripping off of your arm and tried to stick it back on, but you might as well have been trying to attach water to yourself.

"Dude, I'm gonna miss you man. You were the best bro I ever had." Kyle said solemnly as he waved goodbye to you.

"I'm not dead yet! I think! I hope." You said as the melting effect on your body continued to spread. Both of your arms were now just bones that you still somehow were able to move like normal. Looking down you could see through the neck hole of your shirt that your ribs were now visible and there was nothing inside of them. It looked like your organs were liquifying too thanks to the Paint Removal stuff Kyle had splashed you with. By the time you took this in it seemed you had stopped dripping flesh. Mainly because you had no more left. You put your boney hands to your face and felt nothing but a hard and smooth surface. You close your fist and give your head a knock. It hurt like normal but there was definitely a sound of hollowness meaning you no longer had a brain either.

"Dude you're still moving? You're still alive! Oh man that's freaking sweet! And even better you have the greatest Halloween costume ever." Kyle said. "It's not a costume it's my body! And that's my body too." You said pointing down at the frankly nasty looking mess on the ground. You tried to cup your liquified body in your hands but it just siphoned through the cracks of your bone hands. "Dude, a little help."

"I got your back Sid." Kyle said as her ran off to the hallway closet where he returned with a never before used mop still in it's original plastic. "Are you really going to mop up my body?"

"It's either that or use a sponge, or do vacuum cleaners work on liquids?"

"No, I don't think so." You said as you sadly watched Kyle mop up the liquid and put it into an empty trash can. As Kyle did this you again felt your face. It was definitely just a skull with nothing over it including lips, tongue, or eyeballs. You had no idea how you were able to talk and see but figured 'Magic' was going to have to be the answer you'd settle on. Once he was done Kyle put the trash can full of you in the freezer. "So...are you sure you're not dead."

You shrug awkwardly and felt your shirt get caught in between your bones as you moved them. "Dang it, give me a minute." And you removed your shirt and kicked off your pants. "DUDE!" Kyle said covering his eyes. "Might as well look Kyle, after all you already mopped up my penis."

"Now I'm really glad I didn't use the sponge." Kyle said as he got up to wash his hands. "So, what do you want to do now? You want to try and fix this?"

"I gotta try, it's either try or go move into a haunted house."

Author's Note: As this story contains a specific, chapter based story-line, the first option choice is considered the 'canon' choice for the story. Please refrain from using the first option choice, as that is reserved for the primary storyteller (Mr. Domino) at this time. Hollison County. It sits somewhere in the Pacific Northwest, just close enough to civilization that it does not lack for modern comforts, yet far enough away to be considered isolated from the rest of the state of Cascadia. Getting lost in the vast wilderness of the Northern Range state park is a very real danger for the unprepared. Especially so in the forests surrounding Owl Creek, your home town.

You are Logan Reed, a local 19 year old enjoying your complete and absolute freedom of summer vacation after graduation. You're of average height at 5'9, you're physically fit with blonde hair and blue eyes, and you're part of the 'popular' group at your high school. OR were, at least, given that you're no longer IN high school.

You've got a full ride scholarship to Cascadia State University starting in the fall, so you're not overly concerned with getting a job just yet. Instead you've chosen to enjoy the moment and spend time with your friends from school, most of which you'll never see again once you all go your separate ways in the fall. This goes doubly so for your best friend Keanu Palmer, who you've known since both of you could walk. And despite trying to coordinate getting into CSU together, Keanu was eventually woo'd by a very lucrative football scholarship to Ohio State.

So before you end up separated forever, you and Keanu have been living the high life, partying whenever possible, hanging out around your small town and goofing off in general. That's how you both ended up in your current situation.

Both of you had been invited to hang out at a bonfire at Stacy Jensen's house, which sat right on the edge of the state park. There was nothing really unusual about it, you'd been there plenty of times before, but it was no big secret within the group that you had a thing for Stacy, though you never acted on it. You caught a ride in Keanu's vintage Camaro, a largely rusted piece of junk that he kept saying was going to restore, and when you both arrived it was just chilling out and getting your low key drink on with beers that Peter Lincoln had...'liberated' from his dad's stockpile. Erika Hinkle, Jordan Jones and Chris Penworth, your other friends slowly turned up at the evening dragged on. Jokes were had and all around it was another great night to be alive as the full moon illuminated the night. When the alcohol took hold and you all began daring each other to do things is when it all went wrong. Keanu had just taken your own dare and did a perfect back-flip off a nearby log while holding his beer. While you were all cheering, Keanu returned to the fire circle and handed you tally marked scuffed rock that the group was using to keep score in this ridiculous and meaningless game.

"That's right! Showed up your ass!" He laughed.

"Yeah yeah" You joked back/ You drained the last of your beer and tossed back by the cooler that Peter had smuggled them here in, listening to it clink against the other bottles that had steadily accumulated during the evening. "So, what do you guys want me do?"

Silence and the crackling fire was all that responded for a few moments. You'd all been doing pretty juvenile things and the game was starting to get boring.

"Well..." Stacy started, before furrowing her brow, "Let's make this one count for all the marbles! Last one gets the rest of the beer in the cooler!"

"Hey!" Peter started to protest but he was quickly shouted down by the rest of the group.

"Logan, I dare you to take that rock and put in on Barnabas Point tonight!" Stacy said, and another hush fell over the group.

Barnabas Point was near the head water of Owl Creek, a craggy outcropping of rock that stuck out over the gorge where the large, ice melt and spring fed lake became the actual creek. It was deep in the woods, and while not dangerously isolated, going there at night would be rough. Not to mention dangerous. It wasn't too far from Stacy's house but it still made for a decent hike. On foot, on the designated trails, it was at least two hours round trip. At night, at least an hour more both ways.

"Uh, Stace?" Erika said, looking from you to her more than a little drunk friend, "I don't think that's a good idea..."

Stacy huffed and stood up, her small frame wobbling a bit, "Well I think it's a good idea! WE get to leave something that will be there forever! Something from all of us! And then Logan can camp out there and then when the sun comes up we'll all go out together, take and We'll take a big picture and put it in something and mount it out there with the rocks!"

Silence again fell across your group. Erika and Keanu eyed you worriedly while Stacy looked as though she was on the verge of either crying or getting really, really angry. Peter. Jordan and Chris were all silent as they watched the exchange. And you had to admit, she did have a point. There was something...powerful about leaving part of your group behind at a place where it was very unlikely to ever get disturbed again. Not to mention there was still at least twelve beers left in the cooler.... But at the same time, you didn't really want to go out. One of the trails ran very close nearby and it and the other trails leading to the Point were often safe from bears and moose, but you could never predict wildlife.

"You guys are jerks..." Stacy sniffled and she started walking towards her house, leaving the bonfire behind, the mood of the night having gone from enjoyable to buzz kill in a mattter of seconds. And you hated buzzkills, especially if you were involved.

"Stace, wait up!" You said, rushing across the short distance to grab the girl by the shoulder, "I'll do it. You're right, I think it'd be really cool to leave a piece of us out there! But I'm not going on the trail at night without any hiking gear, ok?"

Stacy sniffled again but the tears held back. You removed your hand from her shoulder and she gave you a big hug.

"Thanks, Logan" She said, giving you a squeeze, "It just gets to me that this is the last summer we'll all be together, I just want to make it special"

"Yeah, I know the feeling" You replied

"OH GET A ROOM!" Keanu mockingly yelled from the fire, breaking the tension and sending the group into a fit of laughter and catcalls. He was a good guy, a good friend, and he gave you a mock punch on the shoulder when you and Stacy returned to the fire. He grinned as you made a dramatic deal out of it, but then fixed you with a serious stare. "I'm down with this, but we both know it's a bad idea to go out there ALONE. So if you go, I go.. That way when you wind up IN the creek I'm there to pull your drunk ass out!"

Another round of chuckles as everyone looked over at Stacy.

"Yeah, okay!" She said, her face beaming and red, though from the beer or the fire you couldn't tell. Okay, so you can use mine and Peter's backpacks,"

"HEY!"

"Which Peter is HAPPY to donate. We'll give you guys some walkies, and some water and food just in case! KEanu, do you need to use my backpack?"

"No, I still have mine in my car, I'll just go get it" Keanu said.

"That sounds like a plan, Stace!" You say. Knowing you'll have supplies makes this dare much less challenging. Preparation was always important.

"Yeah, then all you have to do is watch out for the Wackerknobs" Peter said, he face dark,

"What are Wackerknobs?" Jordan asked. The 'new girl' of the group, she'd moved into town a couple of years ago and had yet to hear the local legend.

Keanu rolled his eyes, "They're boogeymen that are supposed to live in the forest, based off some old Native American legends. Some bat-monkey things made out of leather and wire and the only people who have ever seen them are the local druggies. It's a tall tale. They jump on you and, depending on which junkie is telling the story, they either bite you, fuck you, and they feed off of it like a vampire or something. The druggies are the only ones who have ever claimed to see them so it's probably just someone's bad trip."

"Then you've got nothing to worry about" Peter said, folding his arms and glaring at you and Keanu for a moment before getting up and retrieving his backpack from his truck.

It takes about half an hour but soon you and Keanu are loaded out with supplies to make the trip and are standing in front of the dark wall that is the tree line, your flashlights beaming into the vegetation.

"And if either of you comes out before sun-up, I get all the beer!" Peter hissed. You were pretty sure the it was the inebriation talking, but there was a sinister tone to his voice that you hadn't heard before Stacy had hugged you. Was he jealous? You didn't bother asking and simply nodded. With a wave, you both stepped onto into the woods.

Neither you or Keanu had any idea what the two of you were walking into.

1431.content:
Even with flashlights and the full moon overhead, it was slightly freaky being in the forest at night. It wasn't the first time, of course, you don't grow up in a small town with not a whole lot to do without ever setting foot in the woods, but there was definitely something different about tonight. During the day this was a pretty nice trail, it was a soft incline and in the winter you could see out across the valley where town was, as well as the creek's rather dramatic path down through the woods. But in the dark, though, all you could see was what was illuminated by your flashlight, and whatever moonlight made it down through the canopy. After a few minutes of tense silence as you left the glow of the campfire behind though, Keanu nudged you and slid his backpack off his shoulder.

"Dude, don't worry. Bears don't come down off the mountains this late! And if we get into trouble, well..." Keanu said enthusiastically as he unzipped his backpack and slipped his hand in. You recoiled when you saw, in the pale light of your flashlight, what he pulled out; a loaded magnum.

"Holy shit!" You half-yelled, back-pedaling away from your best friend, "What the hell Kee?"

"Don't worry, it's legal!" He joked before sliding it back into his bag, "Remember when that moose fucked over those tourists last year? Totaled their car and put them both in the hospital in Big Tree? Well dad decided that me, mom and him should all get protection in case it ever happened to us. That's why we were all out of town right afterwards, we were taking gun safety courses"

"And why am I just learning about this now?" You frowned as you walked back over to your friend, still surprised and feeling a little bit betrayed that he kept this a secret from you.

"I don't know. Just sort of slipped my mind with all the college shit we were both doing. Anyway, it's not like I've actually had it on me a lot. Can't exactly carry a firearm onto school premises, even if it is locked in your trunk. Sorry, I guess."

You could totally tell he didn't mean it, but you just gave him a look before turning and heading up the path, "Well come on then, Rambo. I think we're almost there"

The two of you resumed walking in silence for a few minutes, the sounds of forest life all around you. Not that you were going to show it, but you did feel a little safer knowing about the gun. They weren't common but there were wolves and moose around, not that anything short of a cannon would stop a moose, but the added level of security did help. It would also deter any Druggies, should you stumble across a violent one. Most of Owl Creek's drug users typically kept to themselves, an eclectic group of men and women of all ages that seemed, on the surface at least, pretty counter culture. Though there were some in their small population that had a history of being violent.

"So" You said, breaking the silence, "What was up with Pete back there?"

"You got hugged by his girl and he got his panties in a twist about it" The future football star beside you said, "Man, you didn't know that Pete's been crushing on Stacy since Freshman year? I know you were hitting those books hard but dude, did not know you were that out of the loop!"

"I knew he was crushing on her! Are they actually an item now?" Stacy had been dating a guy in Big Tree, one of the larger towns in the next county over. It had been a bit of a scandal for a while, given that Big Tree and Owl Creek were sports rivals. But the guy had moved down to Seattle and that had been the end of it.

"Maybe in Pete's mind! He's been trying to impress her since the break up. Why else do you think he would risk bringing all that beer to a casual bonfire?"

"Well, shit" You said. Last thing you wanted to do was cause a rift between your group of friends over a petty love triangle. But your further thoughts were interrupted by a soft glow up ahead. The Point wasn't fully lit, but there was a small United States Forest Service monument with a plaque on with a bunch of boring information about the explorers who found it and it's significance to the biosphere or something. There was a concrete landing next to the actual point where you could look out over the gorge and the lake, complete with railings, benches and a single solar powered light post.

"Sweet!" Keanu said, "I was tired of walking anyway." The two of you picked up the pace, but as soon as the landing came into full view you both stopped.

There, sitting on the bench across from the dim light, was the vague silouette of another person.

"Hold up, Keanu said, sliding his backpack off and retrieving the magnum, "Just in case".

You nodded silently as your friend shoved the firearm into his back of his pants, flipping his shirt over it. With a nod of readiness from him, you both slowly proceeded forward.

"You guys can stop being sneaky. I've heard you both coming for like fifteen minutes" The stranger called out. The voice was airy with a very slight nasal twinge to it. There was a flick of light that lit up an obviously feminine face as the stranger lit a cigarette and took a drag, the embery tip blazing somewhat ominously in the shadow.

"Hey, we don't want any trouble!" You called out, holding a hand in front of Keanu's chest while you ascertained the situation.

"And there won't be any. I don't bite, kid" The woman's voiced sounded bored, maybe annoyed, and with a nod from Keanu you both moved forward slowly, exiting the woods and stepping onto the overlook. Your flashlights danced over the woman's figure; limp brownish red hair, a oval face with dark, brooding green eyes, pouty lips, a slight dash of of freckles, what was clearly a joint and not a cigarette hanging limply from her lips. She was wearing a leather coat that concealed her arms but did little to hid her not inconsiderable bust that seemed poorly restrained by a gray top, and her jeans were ripped and torn in several places all the way down to her seen-better-days sneakers.

https://img00.deviantart.net/b9f7/i/2017...

"Christ! Get the light out of my eyes!" She hissed, and you and Keanu quickly clicked off your flashlights, both muttering an apology. The three of you stared at each for a moment before she made a sarcastic motion for you both to sit down, which you did, cautiously. The wind and rustle of leaves filled the night, the woman pulling out her phone and staring at it for a few minutes before clicking it off and sticking it in her pocket, taking another drag on her blunt before staring up at the sky, letting her drugs hand idly from her narrow fingers. In the dim light you could see the smoke curling off into oblivion.

"Hey" Keanu suddenly blurted out, "I know you"

"Oh?" The woman replied, never moving.

"Yeah, you're that chick that works at the gas station out by the highway! It's Allison Pricefield, isn't it? Graduated a couple of years ago?"

"That's my name. Apparently." It was hard to tell through the sarcasm but you detected a bit of bitterness in her voice. "And yeah. I've seen you both around. Also seen you both staring at my ass from your cars. And down my shirt. So hi."

"I think my mom goes to church with your mom. It's,,,Amber, right? And you've got a little brother? Dad works at the mill in Big Tree?" Keanu continued to press her, despite her obvious attempt at baiting both of you. This was his thing when confronted with strangers, he always tried to press for some form of familiarity so that he didn't feel so awkward. And if this was Allison Pricefield, you were in the presence of one of Owl Creek's Druggies. And outside of the marijuana, there was no telling what she could be on.

"Five for five. Way to be. You think if you get six maybe I'll suck you off for a dime bag or something?"

That shut Keanu up.

"So", Allison said matter of factly, sitting up straight again and fixing you both with a curious stare before taking another hit, "Why are you two all the way up here? Looking to get some quality fucky fucky time in where you thought no one would be? Romantic date?" Her eyes twinkled mischeviously in the dim light of the light post.

"What! No! No. We're out here because of some friends!" You blurted out, "We're here on a dare, that's all!" Your answer didn't seem to satsify her.

"Boring. But I guess so was I back then. Now it's just come here, sit for a couple of hours, get high and go home. Hell, I probably still am boring, I just wear it better!" She said with a harsh, almost hateful laugh, flaring out her jack and and shaking her breasts at both of you in a very un-ladylike manner. You were weirded out but kind of turned on. It was true you and Keanu had scoped Allison out more than a few times at her workplace. This though, this was pretty amazing.

Allison smirked at both of you before leaning back, taking another long drag off the dwindling roll of paper that sent her mountains rising and falling. You figure Keanu must have been choked on his own drool as he was suddenly struck by a coughing fit. You shot him a glance to make sure he was fine before shifting in your own seat to hide your growing erection.

"So, uh, Allison. Is this what you do every night? Come out here all alone just to get high?" You asked. Honestly, weird as it was, you were glad for this very strange turn the night had taken. Maybe talking with her would make the night go by faster. Plus the more you stared at her, the more you stared at the marijuana she kept smoking so damn sexily. It was kind of making you want to give it a try...But your thoughts were interrupted by her reply.

"Only when the moon is full. Wasn't really my choice, but I guess this is what I was destined to be" You could almost feel the hate and bitterness in her words.

"What do you mean by that?" You asked.

Allison stared at you for a moment before taking another deep, sexy breathe. And then she...

Allison stared at you for a moment, taking another deep, sexy breath before leaning forward, holding her hand out to you, the diminishing joint held skillfully between her middle and index fingers. Her dark nail polish weakly reflected the dim light, and her face was dead serious, those deep green eyes staring directly into yours.

"Take a hit, and I'll tell you exactly what I'm doing here" The woman's voice was quiet, yet full of determination. In the dim light you could see the dead seriousness in her eyes, you could smell the smoke coming off the paper, the burning plant within. You could feel the temptation, not just for Allison's explanation but because a part of you really just wanted to cut loose. You only got one of these kinds of summers, after all. Keanu must have seen the look in your eye because he shot off the bench and tried to smack Allison's hand away.

"Fuck that! Get that shit out of our faces! Logan, don't do it man!" You could see Keanu's face taut with anxiety, though you found it a little hypocritical that he'd so violently reject marijuana, yet have no problem taking part in under-age drinking. And you knew why.

"Ke, I don't have to worry about random spot checks from my university. I can do whatever I want!" You said calmly, reaching out and plucking the stub of a roll from Allison's fingers. She leans back as you inspect it, her pretty face never losing that look of dead seriousness. Every now and then her eyes flickered towards the tree line, but the largely remained locked on you. You stared at the rolled piece of paper for a momet, casting one last look at Keanu who simply shook his head, before you took a long drag.

Your body recoiled immediately, not prepared for the heat and smoke. You began coughing.

As soon as your body stopped shuddering, you felt the effects. Lightheadedness, a slight tingling sensation, but nothing else. You were actually a little disappointed as you flashed Allison a grin and handed it back to her, your fingers brushing against hers and the touch seemed electic. "It was about a year ago, I came here with my best friend and our girlfriends. We were touring the state, a fun little summer break after the hell of college finals. I was studying engineering at Cascadia State University and just needed a break. I'd never been here until that moment"

"Bullshit!" Keanu hissed, "Your family has been around here all my life!"

"That's just what you remember, kid" Allison tossed back, before continuing on, "Back then, my name was Bruce Cunnigham. My best friend Jason Knowles, and our girlfriends were Kathy McClane and Jessica Young"
