"Listen, if you keep interrupting, you're never going to hear it. And you need to hear it, okay?" Annoyance was creeping back into her voice. You apologized and told Keanu to keep his own mouth shut.

"Anyway. We made a unplanned stop here, the girls had to pee and we needed to stretch our legs, so we parked down at the trail head, it was close to getting dark but we wanted to try the trail. We took too long, the sun was going down by the time we got here, so we didn't waste anytime taking a few pictures and being disappointed by the dumbass plaque. I decided to break out the Mary on the walk back, it had been awhile and I felt the need for a hit. I was taking a drag when it happened, when we were attacked. You guys have heard of the Wackerknobs, right?"

"For fucks sake!" Keanu cried out, "Logan, let's get out of here man, she's just pissing around! We'll do the stupid dare another time, ok?" Keanu stood up from his bench and walked over to the edge of the woods, "C'mon, let's go!"

"No dude, I want to hear this" You said. You knew it had to be total bullshit, but there was just something about her voice, her looks, you were more than a little seduced and interested.

"Fuck me, seriously" Was all your friend said before he marched back to his bench.

"Again. Every word is true. We were a little ways back down the trail when they just fell on us, one for each of us. They were about the size of dog, but they looked like...I don't know it was dark. They had devil like tails and webbed arms, like a flying squirrel, and they were gray with these red markings all over them with faces like a those grinning faces on a Indian totem pole. They were just all over us, hissing like a cat, and then the one of me bit me! It bit me right on the goddamn neck!" Allison pulled her hair out of the way and revealed her neck, a finger pointing to a patch of flawless skin, "And I passed out"

"Unbelievable..." Keanu scoffed, crossing his arms and making the 'let's get out of here' eyes towards you, but you ignored him.

"When I woke up" Allison continued, her voice trembling a little bit, "I was like this" She gestured to her body. "I went from six foot one to five foot four, breasts, pussy, everything. And I was surrounded by strangers. Where Jessica had been, there was a little boy, looked about four. Where Kathy had been there was a older man that looked like a lumberjack, and where Jason had been was a woman that I'd soon come to find out looked a lot like me. And they all woke up the moment I did. So on top of instant gender changes, the real scary thing was that they acted like it was completely normal!"

"People just don't change gender. Or age backwards" Keanu said, rolling his eyes.

"I tried explaining what happened but none of them remembered. I tried the whole rest of the walk back to our car, which had changed from a Nissan Sentry to a big Chevy SUV. I tried forever to try to see if any of them remembered, I even tried running back up here, but dear old 'dad' stopped me. And then we drove home. To a house I had never been in, in this podunk little armpit of a town I'd never heard of. And it was like we'd been here all of our lives!" A tear rolled down Allison's cheek and she brushed it away with a sniffle. "Instead of studying for engineering, I wasn't even enrolled! And when I tried calling all the numbers of our previous families, all I got was "I don't know anybody by that name" and a dialtone. My own mom hung up on me after telling me I didn't exist!"

You were still not buying it, but this was one hell of a story.

"Over time and constantly trying to convince this new family, my new parents, they screamed in my face that I had to stop because I was putting 'dangerous thoughts' into the mind of the little boy that used to be Jessica. I said I wasn't, that this was wrong and we were not supposed to be a family. So they kicked me out and told me to not come back until I stopped acting like a lunatic. Talk about judgemental, right?" She sniffed again, "So that's when I got the job at the gas station, I had a credit card that managed to get me a piece of shit trailer in the trailer court outside of town. So now my life is nothing but ass grabs and turning over my paycheck to the asshole landlord. Whatever I have left is for food."

"So...If you used to be a man, now you're a woman...And your friends became your mom and dad with no memory of who they were...so why do you come out here?" You asked, still curious despite the incredibly crazy story.

"The only thing I can think of why I remember is maybe because of the marijuana. Maybe that one hit I got in saved me from completely turning into Allison Pricefield. That's the only thing I can think of. As for coming out here? It happened on a full moon, so every full moon I come out here and wait, hoping they'll grab me again. I hate being a woman. I hate this life! The only goddamn thing that helps anymore is the weed!" Allison's voice broke and the tears started flowing freely, she wiped at her eyes and choked back a sob, "Goddamn weepy ass emotions..."

"This is such bullshit, Logan. You can stay if you want but I'm getting out of here!" Keanu said.

"You shouldn't go back down the trail. They're already out there, probably tracking you since you entered the woods" Allison said, her composure returning.

"Oh, so suddenly you're the expert?" KEanu shot back. You were caught in the middle. The reasonable part of you told you to leave, get up and just go. But that reasonable part was outnumbered by the more intoxicated part of your brain. This was making for one hell of a little adventure.

Clearly they prefer the modern variety of profitable career futures, since I went from engineering student to working at a goddamn gas station and living in a fucking trailer park" The bitterness in Allison's voice was so strong you could almost taste it, though that could have just been the drugs. You both shared another puff before she continued.

"That's literally all I could find out. The tribe that lived around here got wiped out, so there's like a paragraph's worth of information about them. Everything else is just urban legends that we 'Druggies' have created, because we're the only ones that remember getting changed."

"How convenient" Came the heckle from your best friend. "Only Druggies remember any of this while the rest of us poor normal people go on oblivious to the fact that these powerful, mythical animals are just running around in the woods every full moon. Seems legit"

"If you don't have anything good to say, Ke, do you mind shutting up?" You snapped, his negative attitude finally getting on your nerves.

"Hey man, you're too busy 'living the dream' and can't see she's just gonna try to get you to buy drugs when she's done. To keep you safe, of course." He gave Allison a smug look, "After all, the drugs will keep us safe. Not to mention for someone that wants to 'turn back' so badly, why is she getting high? Bit of a hole in your story there, babe"

Allison bent down and picked up a small rock and threw it at Keanu, "Hey shitfucker, you ever think about the fact that it's 3:30AM and I have no idea if they only come out on full moons? I'm fucking grasping at any straw I have here and your shit doesn't help!"

That was when you heard it. A branch snapping overhead.

"Oh fuck me!" Allison screamed, her eyes going wide at the sound.
143111.title: Origins?

1431111.content:
Allison screamed as something large charged out of the black wall of darkness that was the treeline. You and Keanu leap to your feet and out of the corner of your eye you can see your friend's hand slide back towards the magnum he hid in his waist. Your adrenaline spiked, was it a wolf, a bear, a moose or...was what Allison saying true? Either way you were terrified, and the pot you had had been smoking for the past few minutes didn't exactly help.

You were surprised and immensely relieved when the familiar form of Jason tumbled out of the treeline and falling hard on the concrete of the observation deck.

"Jason!? What the hell are you doing out here?" You exclaim, rushing forward to help your friend up. You reached down for him, not expecting him to violently bat your hand out of the way before clumsily pulling himself to his feet. That's when the intense smell of too much alcohol washed over you, and you saw his eyes, enraged but slightly glazed.

Jason was very, very drunk. "Finly" He slurred, "Found you two asholes!"

"Jason, what are you doing out here?" You repeated, and you were very uncomfortable in the zombie like stare he gave you.

"Fuck you Logun! Came out here t'beat your ash fer touchin' my girl!" His hands balled into fists and he stalked towards you, only for Keanu to leap in his path, hands splayed apart in a plantive gesture.

"Jason, dude, he didn't mean anything by it, it was just-" Keanu was cut off as JAson shoved against him, his attention focusing on the new target in front of him.

"Fuck you! You sthole my g'damn tickets! S'pposed t'be me goin' to Ohio! Now I gotta stay her and rot!" Jason roared, taking a swing at Keanu, he leapt backwards directly into you. The two of you crashed to the ground and you felt the immediate pain of a foot flying into your abdomen.

"Get up! Both o'you get up! Gonna pay fer evrything!" He reeled back for another kick but from the tangle of your bodies Keanu's leg shot out, nailing Jason in the shin and sending him toppling backwards, howling in pain. The two of you untangle yourselves and you painfully scamper over towards Allison, who just rolled her eyes at the spectacle.

Neither you or Keanu had noticed that in the fall, your friend's firearm had become dislodged, sliding across the pavement and vanishing as Allison grabbed it in lightning quick flash of movement while the three of you were distracted.

"Didn't know there was going to be a Fight Club convention here tonight. I would have worn my cheerleader costume" The Druggie replied, her voice full of snark as she took a disinterested drag on her joint. You glanced up from heaving in pain to see her roll her eyes.

Meanwhile, you were too busy watching your best friend and someone who you had clearly misjudged as a friend beat the living shit out of each other. It wasn't much of a contest, Jason was just too drunk to do much more than swing wildly at Keanu, who had the immediate benefit of being mostly sober. But that didn't keep his opponent from landing a few heavy blows. Both boys had already split open each other's lips and blood was pouring freely from Jason's nose, but the larger boy simply didn't seem to notice. You were just glad that for now, his attention was focused on someone that stood of a chance of winning; you were fairly certain that Jason would have mopped the floor with you.

That was when it all changed. When the barely lit trees seemed to come alive as three child sized creatures leapt out of the darkness and into the dull light of the blood splattered concrete. They were gray, covered in what looked to be red tattoos and had long twitching tales and terrifyingly large mouths with blunt teeth. Their white on black eyes started unblinkingly at each of you for a moment before they charged with a screech that made your ears feel like they'd start gushing blood. Two of them tackled Keanu and Jason, the two boys yelling in pain as the otherworldly beasts bit them. The third one raced past it's compatriots in a beeline for you.

"Holy shit!" Allison screamed from beside you, and to your surprise she jumped in front of the creature right as it sprung forward on it's powerful hind legs towards you. You wasted no time and diving behind the bench Allison had been sitting on, watching as she was attempting to...hug the creature? Her arms were wrapped tight around it's smaller form as she fell to her knees, pinning it momentarily with her weight. She was screaming something, but your brain just couldn't process it with everything else. It lookedl ike she was crying? But then with a screech the creature tossed her to the side like she weighed nothing and fixed it's eyes upon you once more.

With another screech it charged you again and you ducked behind the bench, praying that it would somehow protect you from whatever the hell this nightmare was. You clenched your eyes closed as you felt something hard and wiry slid around your ankle and a powerful, clawed hand slid around the back of your neck...

You whimper out a pleas for God to save you when the deafening report of a gunshot pounds your eardrums and you feel the alien limbs gripping you go limb and vanish. You open your eyes and look down at where you felt the creature's tail sliding around your ankle only to see a cloud of ash-like smoke fading into nothing. Then you feel a much smaller, softer but still strong hand grab you by the scruff of your neck and haul you to your feet.

"C'mon kid we gotta get out of here!" Allison screams in your face as she pulls you around the side of the bench. In her other hand you see the dull glint of Keanu's revolver in her hand, smoking wisping from the long barrel. You catch a glimpse of Keanu and Jason laying motionless on the concrete, the two other creatures hunched over them. The bodies of your two freinds appear to be...changing? YOu don't have time to get a closer look before a fresh screech draws your eyes to the treeline, where another nightmarish creature is bounding out of the darkness towards you. There's no way of knowing if it's a different creature or the one Allison just dispatched.

"FUCK!" Allison screams and fires the gun once more, but the shot goes wide and she screams in pain as the recoil knocks her backwards. The creature pauses only for a brief moment before continuing it's pursuit, but Allison recovers and pushes you forward towards a small flight of stairs you hadn't noticed before, just off to the side of the observation deck.

You don't pause to look though, all you can tell is ahead of you is deep inky blackness that divides the rocky, less dark strip of beach where you stand. 143111111.content:
Right as you feel the unnatural claws on your shoulders, your feet hit the cold water of the lake. You don't stop, slogging forward and kicking up a massive spray of water until you finally dive under, submerging yourself in the frigid water. YOu stay under for as long as you can, your clothes weighing you down dangerously, but eventually you are forced to come up for air.

Your sharp inhale as you break the surface cuts through the night and you flail in the darkness, your soaked hair in your eyes and your body stinging from the cold. You fling your hair out of your eyes and take a panicked look around, though there's not much you can see in the darkness, just the dim light from the observation deck above you and the bright light making it's way down the steps, shining out at you but too far away to truly illuminate you.

"Logan! Kid! Are you okay? Are you, you?" Allison's voice calls out from the direction of the smaller light.

"Yeah! Yeah I'm here!" You shout back, your voice echoing off the tall walls of the canyon as ou start the laborous process of swimming back to shore while fully clothed.

"NO STAY THERE!" Your rescuer screamed back, shining the light of her phone forward onto the rocky shore of the lake. You immediately freeze. There there in the harsh light, is the creature. It's white on black eyes staring at you, never blinking as it paces across the rocks, moving not unlike a gorilla, it's long tipped tail curling freakishly. "Just...just stay there! I don't think it can touch the water!"

So there you stay, eventually having to closer to shore as your body begins to give out from fatigue as the cold seeps into you. YOu come in, despite Allison's cries, close enough so that you're able to fully stand, the black water lapping around your knees as you pull your shirt off and tie it around your waist as you begin rubbing your chest furiously attempting to warm your body back up. Allison stands guard on the beach, the light of her phone locked on the creature, who in turn stays locked on you. Eventually you hear a dual screech from above as the two creatures apparently finish feeding on Keanu and Jason, mounting the railing of the observation deck and staring down at you.

An hour and half pass in silence as you try to keep your body warm. Allison's phone eventually goes dark as the battery runs out, the flashlight having drained it, ensconcing the creature in darkness once more. You can still feel it out there, stalking you, waiting for you to make the mistake of coming to shore.

It is the longest night of your life.

But all nights end, and eventually the dark sky begins to brighten, the earliest birds chirping as they awaken. You hear a low growl from the direction of the shore and the intense scrabbling of something disappearing up the cliff face. You look up at the observation deck and the two creatures that were there have vanished. You may be in the clear, but you're not taking that chance, not until you can see for sure. Eventually the sky lightens enough to illuminate the shadowed wall. The sun won't be directly on it for hours more, but it's enough light to show that the creature is gone. Allison even patrols the thing strip of rocks herself to make sure before eventually giving you the all clear to come in.

When you finally reach dry land, you nearly collapse. It's only Allison that keeps you upright, your eyes meeting hers with an exhausted stare, which she just returns with a knowing look.

You know the questions that you want to ask, but you're too tired, and too scared, to ask.

Instead, the two of you make the long climb back up the stairs to the observation deck. Step after step until finally you're there on the landing, staring at two adult women cuddled asleep on a large quilt that covers most of the concrete.

One, in a yellow sweater, in stunningly beautiful, with long, black, silky hair framing a soft round face with plump, perfectly kissable lips. Her sweater hardly hides the two large breasts that strain against the fabric, and her tight jeans are equally strained holding in two womanly hips and plump rear. Two long legs that end in tiny sneakers finish her off.

The other woman is a blonde. Platinum. Her face is angular and Nordic and framed by the illusion of endless golden curls that run to the small of her back. Her top is constrained by two breasts that are even larger than the first woman's, held in check by a red tank top. Her arms are fit and toned, and the tank top is short enough to show her firm and toned midrift. Her rear is not as prminent as the first woman's but her legs seems to just go on forever in a pair of black tights terminating in pink jogging shoes.

The two women are cuddled together in what is clearly a lover's embrace. A single white and pink backpack lays nearby, mostly deflated. Your back still lays where you had put it, but there's no blood, no sign of anyone else having ever been there.

"I'm sorry, kid" Allison begins, "What happened to me happened to them"

You're not sure if it's your soaking wet pans making you numb, or just utter shock.

1451.content:
War. War never changes.

In the year 2077, the great trial of Humanity was concluded when the verdict was delivered with the gavel of nuclear armageddon. Humanity had become it's own judge, jury and executioner as the need for resources on a suffering world led to each major power on Earth launching their entire stockpiles of nuclear weapons at each other, nearly wiping the face of the planet clean of life. Those on the surface that survived were changed, left in a world charred by irradiated hellfires, forced to survive by any means necessary. And the animal life, once abundant and relatively benign, mutated into monstrous creatures from the stuff of nightmares.

However not all of humanity was doomed to annihilation by nuclear fire or the long, slow struggle of trying to survive the impossible. Buried, deep beneath ground, were a vast serious of Vaults: Massive bunkers where humanity could survive pure and unchanged, waiting for the day when the surface would finally prove habitable again. But these Vaults were not free for everyone, only those chosen by Vault-Tec Corporation were allowed to join. Many did, but many more perished, banging on the heavy Vault doors for a rescue that in many cases, never came. For this initiative, the Vault-Tec Corporation were seen as heroes.

Unbeknownst to nearly everyone, nearly all of the Vaults were built for much more sinister purposes. Vaults are designed to keep you safe from the ravages of the Great War that kill the world. But in truth, they are all part of a vast social experiment carried out by Vault-Tec Corporation and the United States government in secret.

In this Vault, Vault 63, hidden away in the forested expanse of northern New York state, carried a very special brand of Forced Evolutionary Virus, or FEV. Where in the future, FEV gives rise to the horrible scourge upon humanity known as the Super Mutants, but here, in this Vault, things are tuned just a little bit differently. Instead of changing you into a Super Mutant, instead the purpose of this experiment is to deal with seemingly spontaneous gender reassignment. Using the specially modified FEV and the air filtration system, all residents of the Vault will change into the opposite sex, sex organs, voice and all. The Vault's secrete research team have also made several items that could even speed the process up, becoming instantaneous.

To monitor the effects of the FEV strain on relationships between family members and peers without disruption, Vault 63 is set up with two sectors divided into specific gender: all males inhabit the western dorms and work on the power and industrial facilities, while the females inhabit the eastern dorm and are in charge of logistic, such as farming, cooking, teaching the children of the Vault. The two genders are only allowed to meet during the final meal of the day for three hours.

And the Overseer, the unquestionable tyrant ruling the Vault, knows more than what he is saying.
____________________

Does it take place immediately after the bombs drop and sentence the entire planet to death by intense nuclear bombardment, or does this take place in the far off future or 2188? Or are you one of the very few who have been in the Vault since before the bombs dropped?

145332.content:
Holidays. Once they were few and far between, simply cultural events to mark the passing of time, for religions to celebrate or for nations or individuals to give thanks for what they may have as a whole or as individuals. Holidays that actually meant something. But now, it seems, they'nothing more than an excuse to fuel economies and propel forward capitalist over-consumption of resources and material goods.

And let's not forget the endless parade of recently created minor holidays, and especially the ones that seem to have been made up for no reason than a handful of influential individuals wanting to celebrate math or even the creation of the doughnut.

Regardless of their origin or importance, holidays were occurring so often that there seemed to be one almost every other week, and you always, somehow, found yourself caught up in the. in some shape or form.

But little did anyone on Earth know that the barrier between the reality that the human race knew and understood, and the reality of pure magic had grown thin over the last two decades, and now, on the eve of one of these holidays, one was about to fall.

You see, the realm of magic is chaotic, ever-changing, and ultimately directionless, as the reality in which magic resides contains nothing but magic itself. There are no individuals there to shape it, give it purpose or meaning, no life other than the instinctual intelligence of magic itself. That is why, one evening as a barrier fell soundlessly and magic slipped invisibly into the human realm, it was curious as to it's new surroundings. And perhaps it was telepathic, perhaps it was empathic, but the first thing that Magic stumbled onto was a overly enthusiastic individual walking down the street, talking loudly and passionately into her phone about her favorite day of the year.

A holiday. But which?

1453331.content:
You were walking down the boardwalk, one late summer Sunday. You were living the good life at the ripe age of twenty-three, fresh out of college with a degree that against all odds actually landed a job in the field you had studied for (accounting), a nice apartment in the cozy suburbs of San Mateo City, a decent car. a caring family and good, supportive friends...Yeah, life was good. Save for the looming specter of your student loan debt, but the job would eventually take care of that, so you were not too overly worried. Really the only thing you were lacking in your life was, well, romance. Despite your only slightly above average looks, you sadly never had much luck with members of the opposite sex all through high school and college. There had been flings, of course, plenty of one night stands, but you'd never truly experienced anything more than what amounted to lust. Any attempt to pursue a relationship simply fell flat on it's face, and it was, so far, the one thing you really regretted about your young life so far.

But at least you were well off in almost all areas otherwise, so that had to count for something. Right?

You had been particularly bored this morning, waking up a little too early on the last day of the weekend, and after sitting on your butt in front of the computer monitor for a couple of hours you decided to get out and enjoy the fresh air of the beach. It was a little hot, but it beat sitting around waiting for your friends to wake up or get off work

"Maybe if I had someone..." You muttered to yourself in your otherwise empty apartment. The darker thoughts of why you seemed to be so unlucky in love started to creep into your mind, but you pushed them away as best as you could.

And so you showered, jumped into some casual beachwear and made your way to Pacific Beach, the long strip of golden sand that stretched for several miles across the California coast. After your fill of surf, sun and fun, you had made your way up to the boardwalk and pier as the sun began to creep closer to the horizon. Had your friends been with you, you might have partaken in the small amusement park on the pier, but riding the rides alone seemed a little embarassing, so you stuck to poking around the various shops on the boardwalk, a dizzying array of goods and services available at prices designed to steal as much cash from tourists as possible. As the lights of the boardwalk flickered to life as the sun vanished beyond the edge of the world, you were about to call it quits, go home and prepare for work the next day. Outside of the boardwalk's prices, though, you had actually really enjoyed yourself today, and were proud you pried yourself out of the chair to enjoy a little Californian summer.

But that's when you saw it, hidden at the farthest end of the boardwalk where the wooden planks gave way to hotel barrier walls and parking lots. It was a...some kind of barber shop? Or some sort of novelty store? The inside was several walls filled with all sorts of items, herbal jars to normal jars to antique toys to modern comic paraphanelia, all surrounding the single barber chair that sat in the middle of the shop. For a moment, you thought it was closed, but then you spied the old, bespectacled Indian man sitting behind an almost invisible counter, itself buried until a rack of exotic looking candies and...was that butter? Weird. You stepped back, edging towards the beach and craned your neck, looking for the name of the shop, but there was only the slightly Japanese themed exterior on the store as it seemed to cling to the very edge of the boardwalk. You frowned at the lack of identification and turned to walk away when the old man seemed to spot you, slowly rising to his feet and inviting you in with a friendly wave.

"Well, why not?" You mutter to yourself, and you walk inside, the door jingling loudly in the cramped confines of the shop.

"Ah, welcome, welcome!" The old man said with only a hint of an accent in his voice, " I see you have found what you are looking for!" The old man said as he rounded the counter and stuck his hand out. You shake it sheepishly as you look around at the enormous array of knick knacks and other items. It seemed like there was even more, now that you were inside, some of the shelves looked like they could collapse from the walls from the amount of weight on them! Yet the shelves never seemed cluttered, just full. Every item was arranged just so, a maximum use of space and efficiency.

"I have? What am I looking for?" You say as you stare in near sensory overload.

"Relaxation, of course!" The old man chuckled as if he told some obvious joke, "You come to the beach to relax, to get away from that which troubles you. But you don't come here searching for the short lasting effects of impulse shopping, no, you came to my shop in search of something that will change your life forever!"

"And what is that?" You hope your tone of voice would make it clear your were determined not to be swindled out of you hard earned cash, but the old man simply gives you another smile and points to the chair that dominates the middle of the shop.

"Please, sit! A massage is what you need, something to complete your day and make that cloud of negative energy go back to where it belongs!" His voice was warm, soothing, the strange 'just enough' exoticness in the accent that you couldn't help but be pulled in. The old man seemed to sense your hesitance, or maybe saw the look of disbelief on your face, and he quickly changed tactics. "And, for the price of a massage, you may choose one item from the store to take with you!"

It was a pretty good deal, and after scanning the shop for a moment you nodded, sliding into the chair as the old man smiled. Almost immediately he went to work, his old, leathery hands pulling a spray bottle out of seemingly nowhere and moisturizing your hair with a mist of H2O. When your hair was suitably wet, his hands slid beneath the strands and began working the tight skin of your scalp, back and forth, raising it, lowering it, and you had to admit that it felt absolutely incredible. It wasn't often that you even bothered rubbing your own head, so the movement was almost a cascade of relief you didn't know you needed flowing down your body. You felt yourself sink into the chair as you closed your eyes.

"Tell me, what causes the negative energy in your body?" The old man asked, and for some reason he sounded far away. Or maybe you were just REALLY relaxed.

"Nothing" You say, but then you speak again, "Well, something. Too many couples out on the beach today and I just felt left out" You don't really know where it came from, but you don't question it.

"Aha" Your masseuse says as he crumples your scalp together, thumbs resting on pressure points you didn't even know you had, "Unlucky in love! Is this new?

"N...no" You mutter, drifting off, "No it started...started back in igh school. Never could hook...up with anyone. Or college. Just gets old...being single"

"I think I can help with that" The old man says, a chuckle in his voice and for a moment his hands stop moving the tight skin of your scalp, only to return with a new liquid that you don't see, but it smells absolutely amazing. You feel his hands return, this time to your face, a softer affair as the smell of whatever it is flooding your nose. "This is a special oil from my homeland. Once it soaks into your skin, you will no longer be unlucky..."

The old man says more, but between the massage and the smell, you simply drift into some sort of strange in-between state, like you were floating in a warm, soft, and gentle darkness. Your body tingles as the nerve endings seem to be firing off, and you simply allow yourself to enjoy this strange, unexpected but not unwelcome experience for as long as it lasts.

And finally, it does end. And you sit there for a few moments, relishing the final wave of relaxation as it fades from your nervous system. But when you finally open your eyes, you immediately realize something was wrong.

You were no longer in the shop. Instead, you were sitting on a small wooden bench in the middle of a large, locker lined hallway. It was almost immaculately clean, featureless walls and glistening tile that seemed to catch the light of newly risen sun as a small crowd of various younger people in uniform hurried past. It was almost like they were...late to class? And what the hell were you doing here!?

You pull yourself upwards and feel something wrong with your body immediately. You look down and see that you're also in a uniform! And there's a backpack next to your feet!

This isn't possible. Somehow, in that strange shop, you had either slipped into a meditative coma vision, or somehow had been transported and changed into a high school student! But that..that couldn't be possible, right? You look down at your uniform once again and realize that you're...
1453331.title: Harem High: Back to School

choices: You go to your dorm, maybe make a friend?
You go to the office — maybe get some questions answered.
You accidentally fall asleep in the hallway.
14533311.content:
You blink twice, trying to get your bearings. What the hell was going on?! The somewhat familiar dry boardwalk beneath your feet had been replaced with lacquered wood, slightly scuffed by countless shoes. Your casual clothes replaced with black slacks and a starched
polo shirt, complete with striped tie. And for some reason, your face was as smooth as the day you were born. You never had a particular fondness for your facial hair — you could never grow anything past 'scruffy — but the sudden absence of it was more perturbing than you would have ever expected. It was all of these small things adding up that were tipping you over, sending your breath into near hyperventilation. Nearby hallway pedestrians look askance at you, some weird boy having a panic attack on the hallway bench.

And then your panic is interrupted by a; "You alright there, sport?" and a heavy hand clapping down on your shoulder. You look up into a man's bearded face that seems to ooze geniality.

"You look a bit lost there, kiddo," he says, his eyes twinkling with mirth. You're about to rebuff him, but you realize that he honestly could be right about that right now. Were you? God, everything's so weird. You swallow down the roiling sea of emotions in your head and answer him with a simple nod.

"I'm the guidance counselor around here. Name's Dan Sandworth, but you can call me Sandy, Dan, or any variations thereof." He extends his hand that you take, expecting a handshake, but to your mild surprise, he hoists you up from your bench shaped sanctuary. he starts to amble away, but stops after a few steps and turns back to you.

"You're the new transfer student, right? C'mon, follow me. We gotta get you oriented, or Ms. Mulberry'll have my ass.” He jerks a thumb behind him.

He talks the entire time you walk, winding your way through strange hallways and past unfamiliar rooms. You half listen, mostly catching half-phrases like, ‘glad you transferred here’
and the name ‘Amai Academy’. You’re mostly distracted b the people you pass by. All kinds of shapes and sizes: A group of kids with pale skin and weird highlights, some hastily stubbing out their cigarettes when they see Sandworth pass; not that he seems to notice, a group of girls dressed in bubblegum-pink and skirts that were clearly below regulation length, a group of boys and girls in too-expensive clothing — and far more. You give your clothes a self-conscious tug — why were you the only one wearing the uniform?

You make it to your apparent destination after a bit, Sandworth either ignoring or not catching a few student couples snogging in the stairwell. A black lacquered door with the code A14 stands in front of you. Dan opens the door for you, gesturing you in with a mock bow. Your entrance into the room is greeted by a woman. An astonishingly beautiful woman. Brown hair, bright brown eyes behind wire-rim glasses, smooth skin, and — well, you avoided looking at the obvious areas, but they were ample enough to draw your attention, given the tight clothing, but yet her classic blouse slash pencil skirt... The most impressive part about her, however, was the effort she put in. That is to say, practically none at all. Her hair was in a messy bun, tied around chewed pencils, her graded papers had smiley faces and frowny storm clouds in place of grades — but still, she looked like something out of a storybook.

You stare at her a bit before you’re interrupted by Sandworth. “She’s a looker, ain’t she, squirt?” he mutters to you. As per his norm, he doesn’t wait for an answer, leaning in to whisper to you.

“Sorry, she’s spoken for.”

He strides across the room and cups his hand onto her face, tilting her head up. She lets out a surprised squeak before he presses their mouths into a kiss. She reciprocates it for six seconds before breaking away hurriedly, face red as a tomato.

“D-Dan, we can’t — I-I mean…”

She gesticulates wildly, sending papers flying everywhere, causing more panic, all the while Dan just laughs. Grabbing a sheaf of papers, she swats him with it mercilessly. He laughs all the while, however.

After calming down, she turns to you and greets you with an outstretched hand.

“Hello there, you must be the new transfer student I’ve heard all about!” You take her proffered hand and she shakes your hand vigorously. “I’m Ms. Mulberry - it’s lovely to meet you!”

She scrabbles through the mess of papers in the room for a good twenty seconds before you cut in.

“I’m Bryan. Bryan Shaw.”

Amidst her cleaning of the scattered forms, she shoots you a bright smile. “Ah, well I’ll be your homeroom teacher this year! Let me just…” She rustles around in her desk before emerging with a card.

“Your student ID!”

Somehow, there’s a brightly smiling picture of you on it, if not a bit younger than you’re used to. Your birthdate matches your newly changed appearance, having shifted by five years to render you eighteen. In the slightly shiny plastic, you catch a glimpse of your reflection — the picture does seem to ring true. A chill runs down your back — was this some sort of weird coma dream?!

Your small existential crisis is interrupted by your new teacher. “Be sure to hold on to that! We scan it to check your meal plan at the cafeteria, let you into clubs and let you into your dorm! The club fair is Wednesday evening in the gym, so be sure to be there to make some friends!”
She ruffles around for another paper on her desk, eventually picking up four with one manicured hand.


“Oh, also you’re rooming with…” She scours over one of them. “Oh. Nicholas Dower.”

Off in the corner, you can see Sandworth’s regular smile fall by a few notches. “Oh boy, you really put the new kid in the same room as him, Lexi?”

Ms. Mulberry’s smile turns to an angry pout.

“He’s a good kid, Dan, just a bit… misguided. And don’t call me that when we’re working!.”

Dan’s face returns to its usual foxlike smirk as snakes an arm around her waist. “But school is out right now.”

He pulls her in a little closer, before turning to you on a second thought.

“Ah, kid, take a right out of the gate and keep walking ‘till you see a gloomy house on your left. That’s your new digs.”

You turn to the door to leave them to their privacy, as one last comment follows you out the door.

“Hey, Chester? Try to have yourself some fun out there.”

~~~


Your attempt to find the exit in the school before finding a convenient map, but you do catch a weird sight before you finally make your way to it.

You spy a cavalcade of girls led by a boy amble through the hall, looking from side to side. The girls were all similar: pendulous breasts suspended by front-tie tops, their lacy bras exposed by the miniscule garment. Their long legs extend from scandalously short skirts, which are covered by stockings that only belong in Halloween costumes.

The guy who leads them looks like a parody himself. He stands a couple inches taller than you, and his height is further helped by the blonde mohawk. He has two of the girls on either side of him, almost prostrating themselves for attention. There’s a redhead, a blonde, a black haired girl, and some alt chick with a mohawk just like him.

‘I knew that this place was bullshit, but this is some bullshit,’ you think to yourself. Was this some sort of hell reserved for people slightly unhappy with their love life. You try to ignore the sight, but you notice something peculiar as the five turn into a classroom.

They’re hauling a small boy wearing glasses behind them, with frizzy brown hair and a panicked look on his face. The mohawk kid slings him in first, and his harem of girls follow behind.

You’re no hero, but you’d be damned if you were gonna let someone get the shit kicked outta them, even if it was in this bizarro world. You run over to the door and try the doorknob. It’s locked tight.

You start kicking at the door. It’s pretty solid, though, so you don’t accomplish much other than making a ruckus. You’re about to shout to someone, anyone, but the door bursts open before you can say anything.

The mohawked guy looks down at you, a slightly annoyed smile on his face. “Can I help you there, bud?”

Slightly winded, you point a finger inside. “You…. Another guy… In there…”

He sneers at you, opening the door further. Revealed inside are the four… no, five girls that followed him. You didn’t catch the short brunette girl following them in. You stare into the mirror-like surface of the storefront window.

Chaz Harwick, 24 years old, only two years out of college and already in a dead-end job. Your boss was an asshole, your girlfriend broke up with you — and the shacked up with one of your close friends — and you had to walk two miles from work every day after your car died last month. Tired of the same old look?

145333333332.content:
(Author's Note: This starting chapter has significantly edited and was originally written while under the influence of a intense fever. It should now be more easy to engage with this story, and makes the reader character easier to connect with)


They call it Hypercusis, or just "Auditory Sensitivity Disorder", the inability of the brain to process and distinguish sounds. A 'form of autism', or so the doctors your parents took you as a child tried to diagnose your problem as. And your problem? Well, you hate music. You hate guitars, flutes, drums, pianos, synthesizers and even when people (and birds) sing. Doesn't matter what genre a song might be, doesn't matter the instrument, you just cannot stand the sound of music. It doesn't cause you any sort of physical or mental 'pain', you just do no like how any of it sounds.

Your name is Mike, and this is your life.

You know there's nothing ACTUALLY wrong with you. The normal sounds of life don't bother you. Car horns don't set you off, the hustle and bustle of people as they go about their daily lives, non-ringtone based telephones, normal TV. You're a perfectly normal, functioning human being outside of the fact that you hate all forms of music (which eventually bled over into a hate for music videos). It had even affected your ability to get a job, as few employers were actually willing to accommodate to your rather specific needs, but you'd managed to find one. It was a cubicle drone job but so long as you could tolerate rushing through the lobby and limit your bathroom breaks as much as possible you were actually pretty happy. You'd even finally made a friend, Maxine, who you'd hit it off with and had yet to bombard you with questions about music, unlike everyone else in the office had apparently decided to do.

And it had been especially hard today. Some young pop star girl had released a new hot single and it was ALL anyone could talk about, playing it on their phones or computers to their friends, the company radio playing it on what seemed like repeat every time you had to go into the staff break room or bathroom. It was so much that you felt your patience begin to frazzle as a stress migraine began to form. After suffering through your supervisor playing the song in his office, you managed to take a couple hours of sick time and leave work early. You just needed to get home to the small house you were renting and enjoy the rest of the night in silence. You marched down the sidewalk towards the entrance to the parking garage the company owned, but you make it about all of three steps away from the lobby door when you see the next problem in your very bad day.

There, sitting in the shade of the office building, was a young man with shaggy hair, a dirty red shirt and khaki shorts standing at what looked to be an old turntable with a tiny children's keyboard and a pair of small speakers attached to it. The squelching sounds clawed at your ear drums as the small speakers were easily pushed into distortion by the street musician's frantic pounding of the keyboard as he clearly trawled for charity. But despite his clear technical limitations and your distaste for music, you could tell that the man was good. There was a small crowd blocking the sidewalk and the tip jar was already full of dollars and coins. You saw the looks of amazement on the crowd of people, cellphones out and a look of pure enjoyment on their faces, it was clear they were enjoying the man's performance.

But you were not. All you wanted to do was get to the garage and the crowd was currently blocking you, forcing you to suffer the assault on your ears as you tried to push your way through. That's when you realized the man was playing a very improvisational cover of the pop song that forced you to leave work in the first place. You spin around and charge the street musician, knocking over his set-up in one fluid motion of your arms. The old equipment was clearly in worse shape than it had all appeared, the turn-table shattering as it hit the concrete, the keyboard flying into the street and disappearing under the wheels of a large truck and the speakers falling to pieces. The street musician simply backed up against the wall of your former office building though he looked remarkably unperturbed by the sequence of events.

"NO!" You scream in rage, "I'M TIRED OF HAVING TO DEAL WITH THIS! MUSIC IS TERRIBLE, DON'T YOU IDIOTS SEE THAT!? JUST GET OUT OF MY WAY SO I CAN GO HOME!" You were met with the outraged boos and profanities from the crowd, and you try to shove your way through the collected bodies once more before you feel a hand on your shoulder. You spin around, fists raised, expecting a fight from a particularly outraged member of the crowd, but you blinked in surprise when you see that it's the street musician, his eyes full of...sorrow?

"I'm sorry about that" He said, his voice low and calm, before he pulls you into a tight embrace. Your nose wrinkles at the smell of several days unwashed clothing and hair, and you push him away. Anger and the massive invisible chip on your shoulder prevents you from just running away to your car, forcing your body through the crowd. Instead you shove him away. Instead you feel the old hate burning up inside you, but as you open your mouth to spit out an insult, the anger flips over on itself.

"No, no you don't get to be sorry! You don't know what it's like! I can't do anything without having a fucking song blasted into my ear. I can't even go to my goddamn car! I hate music and yet day after fucking day I have to be BOMBARDED BY IT!" You say, throwing a wild hand around and pointing at the entrance to the parking garage whose entrance sits waiting behind the collected crowd. Part of you looks for sympathy, someone who just understands what you're going through, but they're all more interested in capturing a grown man having a tantrum on their phones.

"I'm sorry to hear that" The musician says again, and it's almost as if you can feel that he means it. There's something very off about this entire situation. It was way too quiet for the heart of the city, even the traffic sounded more muted than normal.

"I want to give you something. A gift. THE gift. I hope that it can change your life for the better. Like it did mine" The man says again as he reaches down and grabs something out of his grubby jacket that had been laying on the sidewalk next to the rest of his few possessions. You take a step back as does the rest of the small crowd as you fear he's going for a gun, but your fears are assuaged somewhat as he pulls out an old iPod and hands it to you.

You don't want to take it. It's white surface is covered in scuffs and dirt marks, but the strange musician shoves it into your hands anyway. As soon as the plastic touches your hands a strange haze enters your mind that keeps you from just throwing the music player into the nearby wall. Instead you just stand there and stare down into your hands.

"Go on, my friend. It'll help you with your problem, I promise. You'll see music differently after the battery runs out" He says and releases his grip, turning back to the mess you had made of his display. The crowd around the two of you waits for a moment to see if the confrontation will continue, but soon dissipates as the street musician goes about his business and you just stare at the grungy old device in your hands. Eventually you turn and wander to your car to begin your commute home, iPod still in your hand.

You feel the overpowering urge listen to power it up and start listening to it, crusty earpods and all as you start your car, but some part of you manages to tell you to wait until you get home.

But still, you really REALLY feel the need to listen to it now...
145333333332.title: Turntable Turnabout: Playlist Start

145333333333333333331.content:
Alex Carlson held his cowboy hat in one hand and his six pack of beer in the other as he waited to be served on by the two idiot teenage clerks behind the counter, neither of whom had seen him walk inside.

The female clerk was too busy playing with her smart phone to notice that a paying customer was standing right in front of her. Because of course she was, she's a teenage girl in 2019. If a her face wasn't glued to a screen, then there would be something wrong with her, so he mostly let the indignity go.

Since she wasn't wearing headphones, Alex could hear that the clerk was listening to some faggoty New York comedian on JewTube tell jokes about cannibalistic apartment neighbors and the horrors of avocado toast. Yeesh. He'd never step foot in that city if they paid him to.

Meanwhile, the male clerk who was standing next to her seemed more concerned by his right hand, as the boy had been staring at it ever since Alex had entered this little podunk convenience store.

The boy eye's belied intense fascination with the ring encased on his fourth digit. In Alex's own parlance, he was in freaking awe of the thing, as if it were a caterpillar that had decided to crawl up on his finger and take a nap.

It was fancy looking to be sure, even ostentatious. A silver band(To Alex's eagle eye, pure silver) carved with weird looking occult symbols capped by a giant black onyx gemstone? Hoo boy.

Where did someone this far out of the way come into possession of a piece of jewelry like that? Alex could only speculate.

Maybe the kid had stolen it. Teenagers still like to steal things, right? As part of their little "rebellious phase"?

Or maybe the kid was just high? He seemed the type to get high. His sandy brown hair did look a bit shaggy.

Kids still got high, right? It had been so long since Alex had been a teenager himself that he honestly didn't know anymore.

Not to mention that whatever brain cells he had were slowly getting fried from working out in the sweltering heat every day out on his ranch. He swore that the weather in Texas was getting worse and worse every year.

Or better yet, maybe the kid was nervous because he was having some late night jitters. It was almost 11:00 P.M, and Alex knew enough to know that convenience store robberies tended to peak around this hour. Yeah, that was probably it. Poor kid.

Well, at least he's got a pretty dark haired girl to keep him company. If she'd get off her damn phone that is.

He was getting sick of waiting, so Alex coughed "Ahem" in his deepest Texan accent. Both heads immediately shot up like stars.

Through a rush of apologies, the Afro-Latina girl turned off her phone and hip pocketed the device inside the pair of capri pants she was wearing.

"Sorry, sir!" the female clerk croaked out. "I didn't realize you were standing there."

Alex gave a polite laugh.

"It's OK, Miss. I know that your generation is obsessed with that stuff" he said as he laid his six pack of Yellow Rose on top of the counter, impulsively grabbing a pack of cherry Twizzlers near the register to add to his purchase.

He chuckled slightly, because she seemed genuinely surprised to see him there, judging by the spooked look in her eyes. Offhand, he wondered if anyone shoplifters had come in here earlier and took advantage of the two clerk's lack of attentiveness.

"Not so much" replied the attractive girl as she spoke through a yawn. "I'm just bored. It's the night shift, and you're the only customer we've had for hours.

"I'm not surprised. The only reason that I stopped here in Sawyer was to visit my elderly mother. I live out in Wimberley. You ever been to Wimberley?"

"Sure have. Nice town. Really pretty this time of year" replied the clerk, already an expert at the art of small talk as she got through ringing this rando up.

"It sure is. Nice than here, to be perfectly honest. Right about now is probably the busiest this place has been all night, I reckon."

"You reckon correct, sir, and no offense taken. I don't like it much myself. That'll be $8.25, hun."

The man took out his buckskin wallet and pulled out a crisp twenty dollar bill from it, handing it casually to the clerk.

He glanced at the name tag affixed to her shirt.

"Ruby. That's my mother's name! Ruby Carlson. Do you know her? About yay high, white hair, lives off of LBJ Boulevard?"

"Sorry. I can't say that I do. Here's your change."

"Thank you" Alex muttered in his thick drawl, slowly arranging the slower bills back into his wallet.

"You can keep the quarters and dimes."

"Appreciate it" Ruby Keeley muttered, dropping them in the charity jar, secretly enjoying the cacophonous noise they made.

Out of plain curiosity, Alex swiveled his head towards the second clerk.

"Son, you look a little young to be up this late at night. Aren't your parents worried about you having enough sleep for school tomorrow?"

The brown haired boy, whose name tag said Justin, looked up timidly at the older man, distressed and glassy eyed, seemingly lost in his own world.

"Oh, I'm emancipated, sir. I don't have any parents to worry about me. I take care of myself. As for sleep, we're closing in a few minutes anyway. I can manage."

"You can hold down a job and go to school on only a few hours of sleep?"

"Only been doing it for a year and a half."

The late middle aged cowboy nodded in approval.

"Good for you."

Justin Carmichael nodded back. He let the silence linger uncomfortably, and his eyes once again reverted back to the mysterious ring propped up comfortably on his finger.

"Get that in a Cracker Jack box?" chuckled Alex as he pointed towards it.

"Nope. I found it laying out in the middle of the parking lot earlier today. Have no idea where it came from or who it belongs to, so I decided to keep it."

"Finders keepers. Can't argue with those rules."

"Yep."

Another long, lingering, uncomfortable silence. Once again, Alex was the one to break the ice.

"Well, long days and pleasant nights to the both of you youngsters" he said jovially as he affixed his cowboy hat to his head and grabbed his purchases with one of his thick, meaty hands.

"G'night!" replied Justin and Ruby in unison, with disingenuous sugar in their voices.

Alex chuckled once again
He turned around and walked out the front door of the balmy Southern night.

Once Ruby and Justin saw Alex Carlson's headlights pull out of the dark, tiny parking lot, which only had five spaces which Rigby's shared with the local tackle shop next door, the two eighteen year olds turned to look at one another with baited breath. The clock had just struck 11:00 P.M thirty seconds ago, meaning the indoor closed circuit cameras would be shutting off soon. Slowly, a grin formed across Ruby's splendid face.

"I thought he'd never leave. So tell me again what that ring does" she asked excitedly, pointing towards the fourth digit on Justin's right hand. Her body language suddenly became much more relaxed. She practically had to stop herself from dancing right in the store.

"I can shapeshift" answered Justin proudly.

"And how did you find this out?"

Justin sighed.

"This is like the fifth time I've told you."

"And it gets funnier every time! Tell me again."

"OK, after I found this ring" he explained, holding up his hand, "I had to go take a piss. When I was doing my business was...I was..."

"Say it!"

"I was thinking of Zoey Deutch. I was...I started jerking off to her, just a little bit. Not enough to cum, but enough to get me hard. When I was washing my hands, I looked in the mirror, and I saw her reflection staring back at me."

Ruby gave the biggest, heartiest laugh Justin had ever heard.

"Holy shit! You literally became her, right?"

"Yep. I looked down, and I was wearing her clothes, I had her pair of tits, her blonde hair, that little homemade bracelet she always has on. I WAS her. Nearly gave me a heart attack. Then I wished to everyone I don't believe in that I was me again. The ring started tingling, and my body began shimmering. Then I was me."

"Justin. Do you know what this means!? We can use this ring for so much. We can rob banks and impersonate people and, and...we could become animals! I mean, I'm not a furry or anything, but haven't you ever wanted to see what it's like? Because I have!"

Justin grinned as he heard the telltale clicking sound letting him know the cameras were now off.

"I think I've got a better idea."

Option 1: Justin shifts into Ruby's ideal partner. They head to his house, and after a wild night of passion, he awakens to find that he can't turn back.

Option 2: Justin shows off by shifting into multiple people and characters while they finish closing up the gas station. The two of them clock out, and Justin suddenly finds himself unable to shift back to his original form!

Option 3: Something Else Happens

"You two act like such a couple sometimes" laughed Peter Tzimeros in his distinctively deep and jubilant voice, taking one giant step for every two his two college dorm mates Bill Strasserman and Tom Ackerton took, his meaty hand wrapped around the shoulder of his beautiful girlfriend Judy Ross.

All four of the young adults were busy tearing a path through the mall, killing time until later in the afternoon when the local multiplex was airing Brightburn, a weird new horror movie asking the question "What if Superman was evil?". Tom had really wanted to check out John Wick Chapter 3 instead, and Bill had wanted to go see Avengers: Endgame even though he had already seen it four times, but Judy had insisted on Brightburn, and since whatever Judy wanted Peter went along with like Toto follows Dorothy, the two childhood friends were outvoted.

"Hahahaha, very funny" said Bill sarcastically.

"No, seriously" said Peter, still smirking. "You two have great chemistry together."

"Stop" Bill insisted.

"When's the wedding?" snarked Judy.

"You know, it's really no big deal even if you two are really gay for one another. My family has an old saying..." said Peter before he was rudely cut off.

"Bill here is just my good buddy" said Tom with an easy smile, slapping Bill on the shoulder platonically. "No, I think I'm taking a break from the dating scene for a while. I've already told you all what happened with my last girlfriend."

"Who, the bitch?" asked Judy.

"She preferred being called Gloria."

"Yeah, I remember what you told me" said Peter. "She dumped you in front of the whole school two weeks before graduation. Geez, what the hell was her problem? Did she have a condition where she was never not on her period?"

"I wonder that sometimes myself."

"You're a sweetheart, Tom! What could you have possibly done to have deserved being tortured for two years like that?"

"You want my best guess? Shermer's a small town, and small towns make people crazy. You know, cabin fever. Like what happened to the Donner Party. People in small towns got nothing to do but play football and get drunk, so when that gets boring, they turn on each other. Almost all of the cheerleaders at our high school were bitches. Gloria was just the head bitch."

"This Gloria was like the Medusa. The second she opens her eyes, everyone around her turns to stone" said Peter jokingly.

"I wish that that I had been turned to stone during some of her rages" replied the blonde haired Tom wistfully.

"Hey! Hey!" cut in Judy, the normally chill goth girl becoming seriously indignant. "My minor is in mythology, and Medusa was not a bitch. She was the farthest thing *from* a bitch. I take offense to that!"

Peter sighed and touched his temple casually.

"Sorry, honey. You know how I am. I didn't get into Stanford for my brains."

"Just realize that poor Medusa was raped by Poseidon while she was praying in the temple of Athena, and the very goddess she was praying to turned her into a monster for having the *gasp* audacity to be beautiful. The very definition of victim blaming. Then, later on she gets decapitated for her troubles, for just existing, and the man who did it is worshipped through the ages as a hero. Sorry, but my feminine pride gets in such a rage by that goddamn legend."

Peter turned to Bill.

"Is all that true, Big Brain? Is Medusa really misunderstood?"

Bill nodded his head.

"Yeah, at least according to one version of the myth."

Peter's eyes widened theatrically.

"Motherfucker. I never knew that! I thought Medusa was an evil old hag who got what was coming to her and that Perseus was a good guy!"

"Dude, you're Greek! You should know this shit!" chuckled Bill.

"Actually, I am from Modesto. My parents are Greek. They came from Istanbul to here thirty years ago. Almost the only Greeks there, so they know very little about those legends. Hence, neither do I."

"Still, it's a common myth. You should have known at the least through pop culture osmosis. Didn't you ever play Age of Gods?"

"Not everyone is a nerd like you, Bill. Some people like to read and play games all day, and some people..."..

Peter casually lifted the 5'8 Judy into his arms and kissed her passionately. He then let her down, Judy giggling all the way.

"...some people like to go out and pick up girls."

Bill smiled.

**

On the first day that Bill Strasserman had moved into his dorm at Stanford, having commuted halfway across the country from Shermer, Illinois along with Tom, he had been seriously worried that the giant down the hallway was going to be another Big Jon Ingerman.

Back at home, the similarly sized Big Jon had made Bill's life a living hell for four years, the sadistic bully taking every opportunity to punish Bill for...for nothing really, just because Jon didn't like the look of his face. And Bill couldn't do a damn thing about it.

Which, come to think about it, is probably a good reason why he was out here in California right now, to give himself a wide berth between himself and the probable future serial killer.

Thankfully, despite Peter Tzimeros being close to 7'0 feet tall and muscled like Hercules, he was nothing like Ingerman or Bill's other bully, Rob Bolstrum. Peter was friendly and boisterous, humble about the fact that he was only here on a sports scholarship, and had taken an immediate liking to Bill, finding the nerdy freshman amusing and offering to take him to his first kegger party the same night they had met(Despite Bill being underage). Since Tom was on the same college basketball team as Peter, the three had almost immediately become fabulous friends.

Bill liked Peter's girlfriend too. Unlike the high school nightmare that was Gloria Vanapoulous, Judy Ross was perhaps the coolest chick that Bill had ever met, almost a mirror image of Gloria in every way. He wasn't sure if he was attracted to goths, but he couldn't deny that the dramatic looking black girl was very beautiful and had a sparkling personality. Maybe she could introduce him to one of her friends...

**

"Whoa whoa, what's this place?" yelled out Judy, causing the quartet to immediately stop in their tracks.

In between a Hot Topic and an Auntie Anne's was a strange store none of the four teens had ever seen in this mall before, as if it had just appeared the moment they had approached.

"The Third Wish?" asked Tom. "Never heard of it".

"Sounds like a magic shop or something" said Bill.

"Look at those boots!" squealed Judy, pointing towards a pair of knee high stacked Sabrina's displayed in the window. She walked up to look at them, her skirt swishing along with her.

"Hey guys, want to come in and take a look around?" she asked with excited eyes, turning to look at her trio of guy friends, none of whom seemed overly enthused.

Judy began to develop sad puppy dog eyes at Peter.

"Puh-leez?! We got over a half over until the movie start!"

The large man chuckled and looked at Bill and Tom with a sheepish grin.

"I guess we're going in here for a while, guys."

**

While Judy paid for the boots, holding onto Peter's arm the entire time as she gabbed away with the fellow goth girl at the register, Bill and Tom looked around this strange store.

"What kind of theme are they trying to set up here?" asked Bill, noticing that there wasn't a consistent tone to the store.

"Yeah, pick something and go with it" agreed Tom.

One section seemed set up just for fanboy nerds just like Bill. A whole wall of Funko Pops sat next to a rack containing a vast collection of classic console games and various classic "geek" movies. Next to that was a table filled with more unique items, mostly artwork, all of which were obviously handmade, but still well done(And very expensive). Next to that, and even more expensive, was a table filled with various movie and TV props, some claiming to be the original such and such from the The Empire Strikes Back or scripts from classic Doctor Who and Star Trek episodes. Bill was seriously tempted at purchasing one of the model ships of the Nostromo used in the original Alien but passed how much money it would set him back.

The front of the store was filled with Gothic apparel and things that Judy was into, and wadp obviously targeted at a female demographic, so Bill nor Tom had taken a close look at it.

The back of the store, meanwhile, seemed more like a flea market. All different kinds of antique items littered this section.

"My mom would go crazy in this place" muttered Bill as he examined some very fine looking china filling a handsome looking cabinet.

"Mine too" said Tom as he played around with a very old cuckoo clock. He picked up a bag of golf clubs.

On a shelf filled with jewelry, watches, bracelets and so on, Bill briefly picked up a fine looking teardrop shaped emerald with a small golden core. It seemed to refract the light of the overhead fixtures against Bill's chest, which seemed incredibly odd yet somehow familiar to the young man. Creeped out, he put it back down where he found it.

"Hey Bill!" he heard Tom yell from a few rows down. Bill followed the source Tom's voice until he found his best friend holding up a well used old board game in front of his chest.
1453333333333333333331.title: Morphmanji

14533333333333333333311.content:
"Morphmanji? What, was that made by Plagiarist Brothers or something?"

"You know that Jumanji is one of my favorite movies! When I saw this, I decided that I just have to have it. It's cheap too. And in good condition!"

"Seriously? Dude, I'm supposed to be the undatable loser here, not you. Handsome jocks like you don't play ancient looking board games that rip off twenty year old movies. People with nothing better to do play those things."

"C'mon man, I've got geek credentials. I played that weird Hong Kong '97 thing you wouldn't stop talking about with you, the one with the photo of that dead boxer that appears when you die in game!"

"Well I'm buying it, spoilsport, and I insist that we play it once we get back to the dorm. Judy and Peter can join in too if they want. The more the merrier, right?"

Bill chuckled.

"I haven't played table top games in years, but sure, why not? What's the worst that could happen?"

"That's the spirit!" grinned Tom, proudly holding the game as he brought it up to the register in the front of the store.

"Found something?" asked the pretty looking goth cashier.

"Yes" Tom said, laying it down on the counter.

"Ooo, nice choice. I love this game."

"Have you ever played it before?"

"I have! It's very fun. Just make sure to finish each game, or the transformations are permanent."

"Haha, what do you mean?"

The girl, who had a name tag that said RAIN, gave a tiny impish grin.

"You'll see."

Judy and Peter, who were each holding shopping bags full of Judy's purchases and were standing next to the entrance, both raised their eyebrows at the ominous sounding statement.

Tom paid the strange girl, who put the awkwardly shaped game into a large plastic shopping bag. He thanked her, and along with Bill, Peter, and Judy, travelled in the direction of the multiplex.

Then you remembered, the cook book. Your great great grandmother Martha had died about a month ago at the ripe old age of 113 and she had been a bit...eccentric in how she did her will. Her living kids and grandkids got the house and money and such, but you hadn't been forgotten. You had gotten something the guy reading the will called one of her 'prized possessions'. A cook book. Although you weren't sure how 'prized' this thing was. A bunch of people got random 'prized possessions'. One distant relative apparently even got a toolbox of all things.

Pushing that out of your mind you opened up the old musty book. Even thought the book looked to be a century old, it seemed Martha had kept it in really good shape. The pages were browned but felt and turned as good as new. You skimmed the pages and saw that each thing had a weird name like 'Switching Spaghetti' and 'Buxom Bon Bons' but you didn't find what you needed until you found something called 'Childhood Chicken'. The ingredient list seemed super simple, just chicken, lemon, salt, and pepper.

Breathing a sigh of relief you said, "Thank goodness, I can actually cook this. And it's so simple, what could possibly go wrong?"


One Hour Later


"Oh come on! How is there so much smoke!" You screamed opening the over which had smoke and a bit of fire pouring out of it. You pulled the burned chicken out of the oven and put it under the vent to let out all the smoke. Taking a moment you went to the bathroom to make sure you didn't burn your eyebrows or something. Thankfully your face was still in tact including your pride and joy, your red handlebar mustache which you made sure to give a twirl of pride.

You made your way back to the kitchen and felt your phone buzz. It was a message from Trish, Be there in 15. See you soon.

"Crap, I don't even have time to grab some burgers and pass it off as something I cooked." You groaned, well, maybe you could save the chicken. Back in the kitchen the chicken still looked black as ever, desperately you went to the Cookbook. At the bottom you saw some notes written by your great-great-grandma. After you inevitably burn the chicken, make sure to say the magic words and add some love as you put some salt over it.

You laughed as you read this, you suddenly had a flashback to when you were a kid and would visit your Grams she'd always sing and stuff as she cooked, she'd even written a little rhyme for the Childhood Chicken. "Why the hell not." You said as you pulled out the salt and read from the Cookbook.

"Chicken chicken Day or Night,
Give youth to those who eat the white.
If age and wisdom is your lark,
Go ahead and try the dark."

You gave the weird poem thing a look, "Well, Grams wasn't exactly a poet, but whatever." You looked down at your pathetic excuse of a chawed chicken but almost fainted from shock. Instead of the mass of blacken meat now laid a perfectly golden brown chicken that looked like it could be from a tv show. You rubbed your eyes to make sure you weren't dreaming, but sure enough, the chicken was still there and perfect looking.

"I'll never say anything bad about salt again." You said to yourself as you cut off some white meat and took a bite. It was perfect and juicy and you'd never had anything like it. Happy with what you'd done, you set the chicken on the dinner table with some wine. Just in time too because the doorbell rang at that moment. You ran to the door to let in your beautiful brunette girlfriend Trish in. "Hey babe." You said giving her a kiss which felt...a little different somehow on your upper lip.

"Oh baby, you actually did it, you shaved that silly mustache for me, this is the best anniversary gift I could have asked for."

"What? I didn't sha....wait. You don't like my mustache!?" You said trying to process what Trish just said.

"Aiden, I love you, but that thing made you look like a 1920's bad guy. Not your best look. I mean without that mustache you look like 5 years younger."

"But I have my..." You touched your upper lip to twirl your mustache, but sure enough, there was nothing there. "Be right back." You said as you rushed to the bathroom. It couldn't be gone! It had just been there a minute ago! But as you looked in the mirror, sure enough your mustache was no longer there. In fact...it was weird. You did look a few years younger. You looked like you'd definitely get carded at a bar, and your id might not work because you look younger than your id does. "But why...?" You said when you were hit by inspiration. "This chicken, that poem." As crazy as it was, it was the only thing that explained your mustache. The Cookbook had magic to it and you had just made some sort of...age changing chicken or something. Quickly you leave the bathroom to head to the dining room and the magic chicken you'd made.

Here is a selection of two more story options for you to choose from! These story prompts are not related to the SandySeeker re-imaginings and instead are entirely reliant on your imagination to tell! Choose below, or make your own!

Quarantine Madness: A Pandemic is sweeping the world. The disease is so contagious and deadly that people now can't even leave their homes even for groceries! There are no more television shows, only constant information about relief efforts underway, such as government supplied food deliveries and mandated medical checks. The Internet is largely the same, being taken over for government use, and overall what little entertainment there is to be found is only what people have on hand. You and your neighbors have been trapped in your apartments for almost a year without any real human contact and things are starting to get...weird.

Welcome to the Jungle: You're a trust fund kid. You've never worked a day in your life, nor have you ever known misery. But money doesn't buy everything, and sometimes it can't buy people off. After you and your other rich friends are busted for a badly planned and offensive prank, you're given one chance to not get expelled: Leave the country and assist a university funded expedition in South America. Facing expulsion (and worse, losing your money due to your parents being collectively outraged), you and your friends agree. But you're hilariously unprepared for the heat, the physical labor, and none of you packed anything for hiking through dense jungle. It only gets worse when you and your friends get lost, stumble onto some ruins, and trigger an ancient curse.

Here is a selection of four more story options for you to choose from! These story prompts are not related to the SandySeeker re-imaginings and instead are entirely reliant on your imagination to tell! Choose below, or make your own!

Creative Writing: You were studying at the local library, taking notes for tomorrow's big test like any good student, when disaster struck. Your pen ran out of ink. Desperate to finish your notes you search the library and find a strange, antique looking pen sitting on a nearby table. You grab it and quickly discover that whatever you write with it becomes reality! Do you use this power responsibly or do you decide to do some creative 'editing' to the word around you?

Time Travel Insanity: You're working on a secret project you hope to present during your final university presentation. You're hoping that it'll impress and convince a wealthy benefactor to hire you, and pay off your crippling debt. On the day before the presentation you're doing some last minute modifications in your family's basement/your laboratory when an accident that you don't fully understand has turned your secret project into a actual time machine! With just a few inputs you, or anyone can travel to any moment in history! But getting back, on the other hand...

The Ultimate Vacation: Everyone knows that Paradise Island is the place to go for a memorable vacation. It has crystal clear water, golden beaches, lush tropical jungles filled with life, and the best resorts and nightlife on the planet! It's a well known fact that trips to Paradise will change your life forever. The only downside? It's once in a lifetime trips are ludicrously expensive. You and your college friends have pooled enough cash (and called in a few favors) to get a full week in one of the resorts there, and it'll be a week that you'll never forget.

The Killer App: Well, you've done it this time. You picked a fight with the weirdo neighbor across the hall, absolutely tired of his blaring anime and other obnoxious science fiction music and shows at 3AM. Things got heated when he pulled out his smartphone and started trying to take your picture while threatening to 'fix' you. You threw a punch, he threw a punch and in the ensuing struggle his phone took a picture of one of you by accident! Just when you thought your late night couldn't get any weirder, it does. It really, really does.
