152.content:
The Flex Combobulator was pulsing again, and Rick was afraid it would start smoking again. If it did, his mother would kick him out of the house for sure. She’d had a go at him while his father, Tim, opened as many windows as he could find. Rick was amazed at how much she’d been able to complain about, and so loudly too. He was afraid the fumes would knock her out, with the amount of enraged huffs and sharp breaths she’d took, but they never did.

Anne Church was built sturdier than that, as was the rest of her family. It was just Rick’s luck that he’d picked up the strength of character and intelligence while his brother Charlie got physical strength, charisma, and enough good looks to make a movie star jealous. All the things his parents and everyone else on Earth respected. Rick rolled his eyes, and reached for his blowtorch. Hopefully the flames would discharge the combobulator and cool it down.

“Hey dude, I think your robot’s getting high.”

Rick shot the voice, owned by Bruce Dilman, an angry glare. He hoped his pitch black welding goggles emphasized it.

“What did I tell you about weed jokes at my house, man? My mom’ll make sure you never step foot in here again if she hears you.”

Bruce was Rick’s roommate in freshman year. The two young men were almost twins, with the same pale skin, green eyes, and brown hair. The only thing separating the two was their hair. Rick’s was blond, thin, and neatly cut; Bruce’s was black, thick, and nearly touched his hips.

“I’m just saying man, I don’t think the first robo-historian needs to bring weed to Rome, or Egypt, or wherever.”

“For the last time, the Historotron doesn’t travel through time. It creates a simulation of time periods and explores them thoroughly in the time it takes to ask a question. It can’t open a smoke shop in Mesopotamia.”

Rick fired up his blowtorch to cut off Bruce’s response. He stuck the tool into the Historotron’s chest, and the Flex Combobulator. The Historotron was built like the kind of Hollywood robot seen in cheesy B-movies. Every part of it was blocky, and moved on a single axis. It had two red Christmas lights for eyes, and a decades old walkie-talkie in place of a mouth. It was entirely obvious that Rick was working on a budget, but purpose mattered more than presentation. It was true for him, with his matted clothes and patchy peach fuzz, and it was true for the Historotron. He hoped it was, at least.

“Hey man,” Bruce said, with the same inquisitive tone he used for every sentence. Rick ignored him, and continued to focus on the Combobulator. He couldn’t tell from behind his goggles, but it seemed like it was getting brighter, as were the wires surrounding it.

“Dude!” That got Rick’s attention. Bruce almost never raised his voice. He shut off the blowtorch, and spun around to face him.his eyebrows raised over his goggles when he saw Bruce’s face frozen in terror.

“What is it?” Bruce raised his hand, and pointed at the Historotron. Rick looked up, into a pair of bright red lights. He shut his eyes, half from the light, and half out of annoyance. “Dude, did you just interrupt me because the lights were on? Christ, dude, i know you’re like a perpetual stoner, but this is a new low. Or would it be a new high?” Bruce moved his hand down, and Rick followed it to a plug sitting next to an empty socket. The plug powering the Historotron. Then, there was a horrible cracking noise, and a voice.

“Hello. Where would you like to go?”

Both men screamed, and ran out of the basement. They came to a crashing halt halfway up the stairs, when they ran into Rick’s brother, Charlie.

“Can you two dickweeds stop making so much noise? Mom’s getting annoyed and I don’t want to deal with that.”

“Charlie, you need to come downstairs,” Rick said through pained breaths. Just running up the stairs was more exersice than he’d gotten in the past year.

“Come to your freaky lab? I thought I was banned when I squeezed your Franken-gerbil to death.”

Bruce pushed Rick to the side and came to the forefront. “You gotta beat up our robot, man! You’re the only one who can stop it!”

Rick shot Bruce a look for using the word ‘our’, but held his tongue. Instead, he talked to a skeptical Charlie. “He’s telling the truth. I think my robot is sentient, and you need to stop it.”

Charlie looked between the two, confusion lining his every feature. Then he shrugged and barreled last them. Nick and Bruce followed behind him, though they were in no hurry to return to the basement. The trio entered the laboratory, and came face to face with the Historotron. Charlie’s eyebrows shot up, and the younger men cowered behind him. Charlie barely managed to hide his own fear by raising his fists.

“Hello,” the Historotron greeted. “Where would you like to go?”

“Bro, once I beat this thing up, we’re gonna have a real long talk, cool?” Nick just nodded, and pushed his brother forwards.

“Command not recognized. Sending you to -time period not designated-. Prepare to experience history!”

Bruce barely had time to get out a “What the hell does that mean?”, before he, Nick, and Charlie were swallowed whole by a flash of white light.

Where did the Historotron send the trio?

Rick was expecting a thud, or a bang, or some indicator that he’d landed when and wherever the Historotron had sent him, Bruce, and Charlie. He was not expecting an ear-splitting scream to cue the arrival.

“What the fuck!?” a girl screamed, and Rick assumed it came from someone who’d just seen three young men appear from nowhere. Then he heard the girl scream again, louder this time. “I have tits! Why do I have tits!? Where the fuck is my dick!?”

Rick turned around, and saw a woman around his age furiously pawing at her red polka-dot dress. Next to her was Bruce, dressed in jeans, a stained shirt, and a leather jacket. He too was pawing, but at his hair. It was cut short and slicked back with enough grease to make a fry cook faint. Behind them both was a diner, with a few similarly dressed occupants.

“Bruce?” Rick asked, and he nodded before returning to his hair. Rick looked over to the woman, who was now groping herself, and quickly realized what was happening. He mentally prepared himself for the beating to come, and forced himself to say, “Charlie?”

The woman, Charlie, came to a dead stop, and slowly turned her head to look at her brother. An excess of lipstick made her sneer blood-red, which did little to ease Rick’s mind. His only defense was to put on a nervous smile and apologize.

Charlie lunged before Rick could get a word out. She slammed her fist into Rick’s nose, and screamed almost as loud as he did. Apparently her female form didn’t get into nearly as many fights as modern day Charlie. She shook her hand in the air, and fought back tears as Rick recovered from the punch.

“I’m sorry!” he shouted, waving to keep Charlie from getting too close.

“What the hell happened!? Why’d I turn into a girl?”

“And why’d I lose my hair?” Bruce complained. “How come you get a suit and we get screwed over?”

Rick glanced down, and saw that he was in fact wearing a nice charcoal suit. He quickly shook off the revelation, and returned to his companions. “I don’t know what happened.” Bruce and Charlie looked unimpressed at best. “I don’t! The Historotron did this to us! It’s not like I chose to go to... the 1950s?”

Rick looked around to confirm what he’d just said. The diner and greaser fashion added to his theory. The hot rod cars parked around them and passing by on freshly tarred streets did too. He stuffed his hands in his pockets and nodded. “Okay, Yeah, we’re in the 50s. Or a simulation of them, at least.”

Charlie charged towards her brother and pushed her breasts up. “Feel these man! Do these feel like a simulation to you!?”

Rick pushed her away, trying his absolute best not to touch a breast in the process. “Stop that! It’s a simulation, no matter what it feels like. The Historotron must have put us into a complex virtual reality program with its zaps. God, I wish there was a more scientific term for ‘zaps’.”

“The point, Rick, please!” Bruce groaned. He ran a hand through his short hair, then scrunched up his face and rubbed grease on his jeans. “When do we get back to the present?”

Rick racked his brain for a moment, his expression becoming more and more annoyed by the second. Eventually he threw his hands up, and sighed. “I genuinely don’t know. My best guess is that we have to wait out the simulation. We either get to the end of the 50s, back to the moment we entered the simulation, or to the moment we die.”

“That’ll take forever!”

Charlie tugged on his eyebrows, making his eyes seem even more manic than they were. “I like this ‘until we die’ idea. Wasn’t gun control was a lot more lax back then? Or right now, I guess. Either way, I say we go down to a gun shop and shoot ourselves. Bang! We’re back in the present!”

Rick shook his head so fast it could have unscrewed itself. “Don’t do that! That’s the exact opposite of what we want to do! I don’t know what will happen if we’re killed in the simulation! Dying naturally might get us out, but blowing our heads off could screw with our real brains in a really, really bad way.

Charlie tried folding her arms, but found her breasts got in the way. She huffed and put her hands an her hips, in a way far cuter than she intended. “Fine. So if we don’t go to the gun store, where do we go?”

Rick tapped his foot and thought for a moment. “We could go into the diner,” he said. “The Historotron dropped us here, so it may want us to go inside. Maybe it’s simulated a story for us to fully experience the 50s.”

Bruce furrowed his brow. “What does that even mean?”

“The Historotron is meant to accurately simulate a time period to derive information about it. Think of Westworld, but it’s greasers instead of cowboys. Not that I didn’t program an 1870s simulation...” Rick proudly thought of his programming skills for a moment before catching himself. “Anyways,” He hurriedly continued, “maybe it wants us to do certain things to learn more about the 50s. Maybe doing them could get us out!”

Bruce wrestled with the idea for a few moments before giving up on it entirely. “I don’t like it. The Histo-thing gave us these new identities, I say we figure out who they are. Maybe playing the part will get us out. Like that movie Pleasantville! Like I have to fix cars, and you have to go to some school, and Charlie has to become a housewife!”

Charlie slapped Bruce’s arm, and hated how much easier it felt compared to punching. “I still say gun shop. It’s quick, and it’s easy, and even if I die for real, at least I won’t have to be a chick.”

Rick shook his head. “Okay, first off, Bruce, that’s the exact opposite of what Pleasantville is about. Second, no. Just no. No gun shops, ever.”

Charlie stuck out a fist. Rick reflexively jumped back and cowered. He peeked an eye open, and saw Charlie shaking her head and Bruce barely containing his laughter. “It’s rock-paper-scissors, you numbskull. We do what whoever wins wants.”

“That isn’t the most scientifically sound method—”

“Just throw your fist in.”

Rick raised his fist, putting it across from Bruce and Charlie’s. They bounced them in the air and chanted, “Rock, paper, scissors, shoot!”
15212.title: The trio land in the 1950s

152123.content:
"Ha-ha! Gotcha, fuckers! Scissors always wins!”

Rick and Bruce sagged in disappointment as Charlie let out a particularly vulgar victory cry, heed. On a nearby sidewalk, a simulated mother hurried her simulated son away, shooting quite the simulated reproachful glare over her shoulder.

“Dammit,” muttered Bruce, sullenly shoving his hands into his jacket pockets. “Whydja have to throw paper too, Rick?”

“Statistically, it has the best winrate,” huffed the geek. “Charlie’s just… an anomaly.”

“Damn right I am!” crowed Charlie. “Hottest Church, and the goddamn best at rock-paper-scissors.”

“And the biggest bitch…” mumbled Bruce.

Lightly curled blonde hair flashed in the air as Charlie whirled around and strode to the former stoner, sunny smile on her pretty face.

“Just ‘cuz I’m in a good mood, I’ll only beat you half to death when we’re outta here,” cooed the blonde bobbysoxer. The red-painted smile remained fixed on her lips as she took off down the street. “C’mon, dickweeds, let’s get a’ shooting!”

Rick strode over to his friend, who was standing stock-still, a bemused expression frozen on his face. “You alright there, Bruce?” There was no response. “Look, if this doesn’t turn us into drooling vegetables, I’ll hold him off for as long as I can. So that’s like, three seconds.”

Bruce finally moved, turning his slack-jawed face slowly to meet Rick’s gaze. “Is it me… or was that actually kinda hot?”

“Dude!”

Bruce raised his hands defensively. “Hey, ‘s not my fault Charlie makes a good chick.”

Rick grimaced. “Christ, now I want to shoot myself.”

“I calls ‘em like I sees ‘em.”

~~~


To Rick’s dismay, a gun store was only a few blocks away — Charlie’s eagle eye spotted it, and upon its sighting, she kicked off her mary janes and set off sprinting, mumbling something about ‘fuckin’ Barbie shoes’ in a bitter soprano.

Rick marveled at the reaction of the nearby pedestrians. Sure, everything was procedurally generated — with generous reference to period pieces and Wikipedia entries — but he never expected this kind of, well, reactivity. People - or, uh, programs - eyed Charlie with varying expressions of contempt, disgust, and plain ol’ bile curiosity!

If the Historotron could simulate preconceptions towards certain types of folks, the applications were even more limitless than before — contradictory as that was. It could be used to eliminate prejudices, foster empathy, bring in a new era of world peace — alright, maybe that was stretching it.

But, well, to do that, he needed to make sure that Charlie didn’t beat the everloving shit out of the contraption, a possibility that was becoming harder and harder to prevent with every muttered ‘crazy broad’ from passerbys. Bruce took it upon himself to go into the gun store, on the (very well-founded) assumption that the owner would deny Charlie service, which would probably result in quite a lot of hell being raised.

Rick, meanwhile, stood near the shaded corner of the brick-and-mortar store with his brother-turned-sister, trying very hard to not question her about what this experience had taught her, lest his simulated teeth take a one-way-trip to his stomach when Bruce exited the store.

“Hey guy- er, both of you, check it out!” he crowed, twirling a rather large nickel-plated revolver on his ring finger. “I’m Revolver Ocelot!”

“That sounds like nerd shit. I bet it’s nerd shit,” grumbled Charlie.

“How’d you — jesus don’t point that thing at me — pay for it?” asked Rick, ducking his head as the gun turned to face him.

“I dunno dude, I just pointed at it, asked the store guy if I could get it, then a real slick wallet just poofed itself into my pocket.” Bruce shrugged. “Kinda neat. Wonder if I could buy something bigger with it…”

“I don’t give a shit!” announced Charlie as she wrenched the gun off of the greaser’s finger, drawing a small yelp out of him. With a bit of difficulty, she pulled back the hammer, put the muzzle in her mouth, and CLICK.

“Whaa th’ faah,” slurred Charlie, brains still very much snugly nestled in her skull. With her nth grimace that day, she extracted the metal barrel from her mouth, glaring at Bruce. “What kinda pussy doesn’t load a gun?!”

A sizeable amount of people had begun to gather around the gun shop, a few pointing at the obviously suicidal housewife, the poor thing, and how her milksop husband couldn't even protect her from that wicked greaser! Rick quickly put a hand on either shoulder of his nearly-bickering compatriots and directed-slash-shoved them into the recesses of a nearby, hissing “Shut the fuck up,” on loop.

The three of them stood awkwardly in the grassy backroad, Rick having sequestered himself in a corner, knock-kneed in from anxiety, and Charlie’s red-tipped finger still around the trigger.

Charlie broke the silence with a “Well, are we fuckin’ doing this or not?”, and a petulant plant of her gun-free hand on her hip.

“Dude, there is no goddamn way that I’m shooting myself,” said Bruce. Before Rick could interject with a reiteration of his very serious health concern, Bruce fished a small red box out of his pockets and tossed it Charlie’s direction. “Here, shoot.”

The events that ensued did so extraordiarily quickly.

Bruce’s face broke into a large smile at his unintentional pun.

Charlie caught the box, opened it, and with instincts honed from manifold Call of Duty matches, slotted a bullet into the first chamber.

Rick struggled to a proper standing position and started to dash to the blonde.

And Charlie, with a victorious smirk upon her face, pressed the gun against her temple, cocked the hammer, and pulled the trigger.

No one really heard the bang as the entire world seemed to dissolve into quadrilateral green, red, and blue particulate matter, a klaxonesque ‘ERROR DETECTED: PASSENGER AT RISK’ boring through their ears and into their brains.

When light once again graced the time-travellers' eyes....

Option 1: Charlie seemed very much alive with no ragged hole in the side of her skull. But, even though she’s definitely pissed, she seems less sweary and more, uh, Stepfordy?

Option 2: The trio are still in the 1950s, merely another scenario. And, adding to Charlie’s immeasurable rage, she’s still a girl!
152123.title: Charlie wins!

153.content:
Welcome to Paradise Island!

That’s what the sign said as you and your friends got off the shuttle from the airport and made your way to this amazing luxury resort.

You are Sam Gibson, 25 and very recently single. Your long time girlfriend Alicia who you planned to propose to and even planned on taking here for your honeymoon had broken up with after confessing that she had been cheating on you for months. This trip was supposed to help you forget about her and help you rediscover yourself.

Traveling with you was your best friend Derek and his girlfriend Sarah. You had been friends with Derek since high school and while he has been know to be wild party type of guy, he always has your back.

His girlfriend Sarah you have know for the last three years since she has been dating Derek. At first you didn’t really really like her. While she was hot, she seemed shallow and uninteresting to you. However over the years you have found she isn’t so bad. She has a great sense of humor and actually helped plan some of the best birthdays you have ever had.

Traveling with them is Sarah’s younger sister Lisa. Derek used to joke about her saying Sarah got all the hot genes and there wasn’t much left for Lisa. While that was somewhat true, it didn’t mean Lisa was any less a nice person. She was kind, gentle, but definitely shy. Sarah was a sexy blonde with the body of a cheerleader, meanwhile Lisa was a short and skinny brunette, with large glasses.

You didn’t know Lisa very well, only meeting her at birthday parties a couple times. She seemed really nice but her shyness made it hard to get to know her.

This trip was planned mostly by Derek and Sarah. Derek told you he plans to propose to Sarah here. Meanwhile you need to focus on getting over your Ex and meeting someone new. Lisa needs to finally grow and get out of her shell and experiment with life.

The four of you soon pulled up to the luxury resort ready to enjoy what was supposed to be an amazing week of fun and excitement.
153.title: The Ultimate Vacation

1531.content:
As the four of you got off the shuttle standing at the entrance to the resort was a man waiting for you.

You were a bit stunned at the man. He had to be almost seven feet tall. He had tanned skin, dark hair, and a well kept beard. He was wearing an all white suit as raised his arms smiling to you all.

“Welcome guests! My name is Maximilian Valdez! However you can just call me Max. This is my island and I am pleased to have you all here!” He said in a loud and booming voice.

“Uhh...thanks? Is it normal for the owner to greet all his guests?” Sarah asked a bit skeptical.

“At your typical resorts no. However here at Paradise island we pride ourselves on creating a transformative experience for all our guests! One that will change their lives forever! I am here to simply introduce myself and get to know you a little better. So tell me friends, in a simple sentence, what brings you here?” Max asked us.

We all thought about it awhile looking to each other a bit.

“I’m here to rediscover myself.” You said trying to keep it simple and vague.

“I’m...here to get out of shell.” Lisa said shyly.

“We are here to have fun!” Lisa said for herself and Derek

“Wonderful please enjoy your stays. I hope this wonderful and changing experience for you all.” Max said as he let us through into the resort.

Well all smiled and passed through the gates to the resorts. However the second we did something happened. We all paused...A strange sensation had come over all of us as we looked to each other seeing our bodies were actually giving off a soft glow...

“What’s happening?” I shouted looking back to Max.

“Exactly what I said. You all are experiencing the change that will most help you to have the best possible time here.” Max said with a smile.

Looking down to myself I was changing first as....

155.content:
Hello everyone.

I'd like to take a moment of your time to announce that this is the 500th chapter of The Ahn'Ger Stone & Other Stories! It is a huge milestone for me and this Interactive, and I'd like to just talk a little about it and acknowledge the other hard working authors that helped this project come to life and take on a life of it's own.

A year ago, on April 19th, 2018 I embarked upon a project to restore several of the stories originally created by Sandyseeker, and had been unfortunately lost when Sandyseeker deleted their account. Those stories were:

The Grellstone: Angry Transformations.

Mark's Morphin' Machine.

Five Characters in Search of Change.

It was a daunting task as I had no way of re-posting the original chapters of the story, and to bring the stories into a more modern era of Interactive TG/TF. I knew that a complete restoration was going to be impossible and instead opted for making these stories and Interactive into more of a spiritual successor, similar but different, one that could take on a life of it's own and be an overall hub for original stories to start from. It started with the introductory overview which was (and still is) a bit wordy, but I also wanted to lay down some more rules to ensure a higher overall quality and keep out the content which can be viewed as distasteful to outright illegal. I wanted to treat this project and the stories within with the respect that they deserved and give fans of the original longer length chapters and higher quality stories to enjoy.

In the year since, this project has grown beyond my wildest expectations at the time, and that is entirely due to the hard work and dedication of my fellow writers helping to drive the story forward, to recreate what was lost when Sandyseeker deleted their account here. While Mark's Morphin' Machine and Five Characters in Search of Change (now known as Magical Transformations) have sort of fell by the wayside, the Ahn'Ger Stone and several side stories have been going strong, thanks to the help of these talented authors. Their dedication to this project helped keep my own interest, and I can easily say this is the largest online project that I have ever been part of. And I'm honored to be a part of it, as it is one of the high points of my day to log in and see new chapters posted, or an email talking about new ideas for this Interactive, and even just reading these chapters as a fan.

As such I'd like to take this moment to thank the following authors for their invaluable contributions to this story.

Fitzroy Clement: Someone whose knowledge of the old Grellstone chapters and understanding of it's characters helped propel this spiritual successor forward by such leaps and bounds. From recreating the old chapters, bringing back characters I had forgotten about entirely, to helping push into new arcs and filling out the world in a way that the original story never did, the Ahn'Ger Stone is now so much more than just a simple TF/TG story with a relatively small cast. Their contributions have been utterly invaluable in the success of this Interactive and it simply would not have survived without you.

Cardio: Someone who has helped me build an absolutely wonderful side-story with The Toolbox. With little more than two opening chapters, Cardio leaped in and grabbed hold of the concept, helping to flesh it and the characters into such a great grab-bag of transformations from both the expected to the wildly unexpected, from shrinking to TF/TG and just overall delightfully goofy characters. Thank you for exploring that world with me, and I look forward to many more chapters to come.

Somethingnew: Somethingnew was someone who stepped in at the start of the project, working alongside Fitzroy Clements to bring back the old chapters from the Grellstone and helped give this project the early push in interest it needed to get going. Your contributions were great and I look forward to see your return to this Interactive one day.

Comiccow6: Comiccow6's contributions to the Interactive have always been of excellent quality, often opening up routes that I had never considered, and seizing the initiative with one of the secondary story prompts to create something that I would have never expected. And their support for this project has been something that has always brought a smile to my face.

Morphology: While Morphology has not been an active contributor to this project, they did, however, post a large chunk of chapters from The Grellstone, helping give the Ahn'Ger Stone some of it's original history back. Thank you for providing these chapters, and if you're still out there reading, please feel free to add more, or post your own.

Mr. George: Thank you for your contributions, specifically the opening chapters of Mark's Morphin' Machine! It was great to see your take on the opening chapters of what was honestly my first exposure to Sandyseeker's Interactives!

Captain Awesome and Guyman: Thank you both for launching two of the side-stories! It is always a thrill to see other writers take on the story prompts and their interpretation of them! I have greatly enjoyed your chapters and hope to see more from you guys in the future!

To anyone that I might have missed, thank you for your own contributions to this project!

And last but certainly not least, I'd like to thank everyone that has been a fan of this Interactive and has come here to read the chapters we've ALL worked so hard on. As much as we may do this for ourselves, we also do this to entertain you!

Here's to many more stories, chapters and characters, and I'll see you all again at the 1000th chapter milestone!

-Mr.Domino

info.brief_description: A Stone that only grants angry wishes and more stories of transformation found here!
info.description:
This is a re-telling of the long lost Grellstone, Mark's Morphin' Machine and Five Characters in Search of Change Interactives by SandySeeker. It is with greatest respect to those stories and SandySeeker that I am reviving-rebooting this in the hopes that those stories will find new life here within this Interactive.

It is my hope that older members of the Interactive Community will restore many of the old story-lines to the best of their ability, though I am excited to see what new stories will emerge from the fresh slate and by new authors! Have fun!


Important: For the posting rules of this Interactive, please check the bottom of this page. Failure to abide by these rules may potentially result in your chapters and content being deleted from this Interactive. Re-posting the content and chapters of this Interactive elsewhere without permission is not allowed. Thank you.


The Ahn'Ger Stone


The Ahn'Ger Stone is an ancient, mystical artifact that is capable of granting wishes...But only when the person holding it is angry. It has found it's way to Earth and has found it's way onto the doorstep of Bill Strasserman, a high school Senior in the American town of Shermer, Illinois. Bill is enamored by it's unique shape and strange beauty; a teardrop emerald with a golden core that seems to pull the light of the morning sun into it Through a series of strange events, Bill discovers that the stone is magical and grants wishes! ...But only when whoever is holding it is angry! And to make matters worse, Bill is surrounded by a cast of friends and enemies and all of them seem compelled to use the Ahn'Ger Stone! With the wishes capable of permanently altering not just bodies, but the entire fabric of reality and the minds of everyone within it, can Bill discover the truth behind the Stone without getting transformed by an angry wish?

-Cast of Characters-

Bill Strasserman is your average 18 year old High School senior. He has a small group of friends and has average grades, and is a bit of a geek, though he has a interest in baseball and doesn't mind physical activity. His life is comfortably middle of the road, with one younger sister, a mom and dad and a dog and lives in a nice house in a quiet section of small town America. He's enjoying his final year of school and looking forward to college, and maybe finally getting a girlfriend. His only problem? A bully with a bone to pick.

Kimberly Strasserman is Bill's younger, twelve year old sister. The baby of the Strasserman family, Kimberly can be a bit of a brat and is not above using her spoiled status as a means to get what she wants. She is jealous that Bill is older than her, and thinks that he is still a smelly boy. She does not enjoy school and would rather spend her time goofing off with friends.

Tom Ackerton Is Bill's best friend. The two have known each other since Kindergarten, and over the years Tom and Bill have gotten into all sorts of hijinks and adventures. In middle school ,Tom joined the school basketball team and quickly became one of the stars of the team, landing him a girlfriend named Gloria Vanapolous. They've recently gone through a nasty break-up, and Tom has been taking his frustration out on Bill.

Gloria Vanapolous is Tom's recently ex-girlfriend, and one of the school's prettiest girls. One of the most popular girls in school and a cheerleader, Gloria's break-up with Tom has been the talk of the gossip circles recently and Gloria is not above exaggerating the truth in order to punish Tom further for breaking her heart. Gloria is an only child, and due to her mother Ariadne being a massive control freak, Gloria has taken her frustrations out on those that cross her, though underneath she still considers herself to be a good person at heart.

Jonathan Ingerman, or 'Big Jon' is the bully of Bill's high school. A massive, constantly angry muscle headed jerk that is known to hold grudges and is not afraid to get physical in order to get what he wants, Jonathan makes life a special brand of Hell for those unfortunate to cross him and his gang of lackeys. Several years ago, Bill caused Big Jon to get suspended by tricking him into a fight with a teacher nearby. Jonathan has not forgotten, nor has he forgiven Bill for this.

Rob Bolstrum is the former leader of the high school bullies, now disgraced after losing a fight for dominance to Big Jon. Rob is now nothing more than Ingerman's lackey, and harbors a deep, burning hate for him. Rob does what he's told, but the big man is smarter than anyone gives him credit for, and is looking for a way to take his revenge on Big Jon and get his old title of King of the Bullies back.

And many more characters!

Other Stories you might enjoy!


The Toolbox
 Two roommates living in the city of Redford Hills California, the summer before their freshman year in college, experience a minor earthquake that knocks a cabinet off the wall! Taking it upon themselves to repair it despite knowing nothing about tools, Sidney and Kyle discover a otherwise normal looking toolbox in their basement, filled with otherwise normal looking tools. But when a simple moment of goofing off reveals the magical, transformative powers unique to each tool, the two boys find themselves on whirlwind body altering adventure, giving a whole new meaning to the term 'home improvement'.

These and many other stories of transformation can be found within. To navigate to them, simply click on the Create your Own chapter paths!

Create Your Own!


Want to tell your own story of magic and transformation? Feel free to create new and interesting stories with interesting characters! Have an idea for an interesting character but don't want to create a new story? Feel free to introduce new characters not listed above into the existing stories!

The Rules

Read before posting

Failure to adhere to these rules will result in content being deleted.
As owner of this Interactive, I reserve the right to make edits to content or remove any content deemed unsuitable for this Interactive without any prior notice.


1. No underage sexual activities. Any character engaging in sexual activity must be written as the age of 18 or older both mentally and physically. Failure to adhere to this rule will have your chapters deleted.
2. No toilet stuff: This includes playing in feces, urine, vomit, fart, drool, diapering, adult diapering or excessive use and description of sexual fluids.
3. No excessive weight gain. Making characters obese is fine, but please try to limit the weight gain to 500 pounds.
4. No Excessive Giantess or Giants: While shrinking to very small sizes is allowed, any character that is made larger should not become taller than 100 feet.
5. Age Regression must be both physically and mentally. The above rules on sexual content and toilet content apply here as well.
6. No Hermaphrodite or Futanari transformations. Transformations between genders should be complete male/female and female/male.
7. No incest content between parents, siblings or blood relations allowed under any circumstances.
8. No excessive gore or killing off characters for no reason.
9. No male on male sex scenes or graphic, detailed sex scenes. A preferable rating would be PG-13 or use of 'fade to black' scene transition.
10. No MPreg or Unbirthing.
11. Overly slow transformations. All transformations should occur instantly or within minutes and should not be drawn out over multiple hours.
12. No short chapters: In order to keep content interesting, all chapters must be a minimum of three paragraphs. Poorly done endings will be removed.
13. Option Chapters should be labeled as such and make an effort to provide some form of content (new or re-used sample) with the options.
14. Please refrain from 'Ending' the story unless the the story-line reaches a natural conclusion. Something Else or obvious 'Option' chapters are meant to provide users with the ability to provide new options when possible. Low effort or inappropriate 'End' chapters WILL be deleted.
15. Any linked images should be to safe online image hosting services such as Imgur, Blogspot or DeviantArt.
16. Please make sure that you review and spellcheck your work before posting. Small mistakes are acceptable but chapters with glaring grammatical errors will be deleted to uphold quality.

Have fun, and thanks for reading!
